x7PnL9U-hyPGQviZilxsWA.text: This is the only restaurant still charging you for food that make you sick. That's right. You aren't hearing it wrong. I would rather starve myself than eating here and getting food poisoning and must-be-paying for it. Avoid this place at all cost!!!! For detail, please read the following.   I came here with a few friends and ordered a bowl of pho. My pho came out with the smell of drugs or some sort of medicines. But I just convinced myself that maybe the smell came from a different place. I proceeded for a little bit and that smell was so strong that I couldn't continue. And the smell actually came from my bowl of pho. I told the waiters that my food smells funny and tastes a bit bitter. He asked if I want a new bowl but I said no because my stomach felt weird at the time. A few minutes later, I had to run to the restroom inside the restaurant and threw up. When I came out, they gave my friends the check that included the price of that bowl of pho. They didn't want to take that $10 off the check regardless my reasonings. I would have tipped them $10 anyway if the service was good. So at the end, I asked him to remake the pho for me and put in togo boxes. Apparently I wasn't gonna eat it. Who would eat something at the same restaurant that gave you food poisoning a few minutes earlier?   I personally think it was ridiculous and unethical. Indeed, it was absurd to charge the customers the food that poisoned them. They should be grateful that I didn't sue their ass for making dirty and poisoned food. This restaurant is crowded because it's one of the places opening 24/7. But I would rather starve myself than eating here and paying to get poisoned food.

yCelZyIGcDlEoAKTHetfJw.text: Worst customer service ever! Specially from the owner! I love the food but the service sucked! Rude! And don't even come to check on you! Asked 3 different people for a soda till I finally got someone to bring it to me! Don't waste you money here go somewhere else please. Forget this place

B9sN7sT7_qTO4_pPXiC0AQ.text: I had never had Pho before and I had parked in this lot to go get a mani/pedi. But I also needed to get some protein in my system. This place was right in front. I saw that it had a "Best of Vegas" banner and after I walked in I realized that my friend suggested this spot to me before.   I went for a rare steak and brisket Pho. My honey went for a three meat Pho. We also ordered Sweet & Sour Chicken, which was my favorite item of the night and by far the best sweet & sour I've ever had.  Back to Pho. I like soup. I like noodle in my soup. I didn't like one of the greens they used. It had a light minty taste, but wasn't mint. Whatever it was (I think they also brought it out on the side for us to add into our soups), it distracted me in a bad way. The leaves look like basil, but definitely aren't basil. Anyway, if it wasn't for that, I think I would have become a bigger fan of Pho than I currently am. The meat was alright. Tasted too bland. But again, this was my first Pho experience. I guess this is how Pho works and I may not be a fan. I don't have to love everything I eat and everything that others love, right?  Their service was extremely fast. Five minutes after we placed our order, the Pho was out. Wow.

t_RIGahdGXi31Un3qN2cOg.text: I love love love this place. My order every time: fresh spring rolls with tofu and their vegan pho. So good. You can veganize a lot of their noodle dishes too which is awesome. it's open 24 hours.

lmiaJjoAX_Mt2IRmFfoLlQ.text: The host was a dick. But it was all uphill once we were seated. Crab rangoons. Seafood over rice. Veggie phone beef broth. All delicious. Fast service and for being open 24 hours they were super busy at 330 am. Great low key low cost spot to get some good food in you after blowing all your cash on the strip.

O68cDMMgTnJS3gHskh9SKA.text: I have been here once early this year, went there around 9pm and everything was ok...I am not a Pho expert but I liked it at the time. This time I figure I invite out of town guests at around 0230 in the morning Monday December 22nd 2014.....The initial waitress did not say a single word to us in the 4 times she went to our table and took a little over 10 minutes to make first contact. The Male waiter was short and unfriendly too, got our order and disappeared , forgot the spoons.   The food was ok but ruined by RUDE service and the following: My guest (which happens to run a million dollar restaurant)  requested carbonated water from the soda tap (gas bubbles and water).... when we got the bill they charged it as a full flavored soda   3 dollars for carbonated water!  we questioned it since nowhere else in AMERICA they charge for Co2 and water, they went to get the manager (which claimed to be the owner). That younger male with an attitude of a major jerk, leaned on the table with both "fists" on the table, leaned over into our personal space and asked: whats your problem!   The question of why in the name of everything that is 100% free anywhere in America he was charging 3 dollars for carbonated water and with a major attitude and tone of voice he said:   "I don't care if I lose a customer that doesn't want to pay for carbonated water, Its 2.99 and I will not remove it from the bill" .  Needless to say the rude waiters did not get tip and I will never go back and I will never suggest this hole again.  I am sure that punk is the SON of the hard working parents who most likely slave all morning and afternoon to get this restaurant running..... If you look at the reviews, most of the lesser stars are because the graveyard staff attitude.

Vjtif7L8MsH7AyUhk2TJ3A.text: WHAT TIME IS IT???  Pho Kim Long Time!!! _______  So two ladies be like...   L1: "What you like do?"  L2: "We Go Pho Kim Long"  L1: "Then where do you want to eat?"  L2: "Heyoooo" _______  The name of the business could be a joke... or there really could be someone named Kim Long out there that makes pho... either way, the food is pho reals. I wish there was Chili Oil in addition to the sriracha sauce. The iced coffee is super strong.  Whether it is great or just okay in your opinion, It will definitely help a hangover from a crazy night on the strip... and isn't that was really matters?

C_XYgPYlRZhaHJqZeuzCUw.text: I'm on the fence for 3 stars or 4 stars.  The only reason I would want to give it 4 stars is due to the 24 hours of operation.  3 stars because the food is just okay.  If it's 3am and you want vietnamese food, I don't think there's any other choice. That should automatically be a 5 star rating to you at that late hour.  Don't go here expecting amazing food.

ezSZgf08zz3Kz1xIsF37eg.text: If I could give 0 stars I would  Some of the worst service I have ever gotten is from here server seems like she had something up her hoo haa... and the food wasn't even good ordered calamari app and got a big plate of fried breading really ? Had some rice with cube steak rice was hard and I guess the steak was on strike because there was barely any ?? And server was not attentive at all !!  Except one guy that refilled my Pepsi man this place is bad and also I was done wanting to leave but no one absolutely no one can to my table at all but they were going to every other table except mine really ?? After about 25 minutes I just got up I was going to just walk out until suddenly one guy got right in front of me with my check haha seriously this place man ... then some guy with a gray shirt and black hat was swiping my card and said if I wanted to leave 15% , 18%, or 20% tip I could not believe what I heard I even said sorry so he could repeat himself I just said NO .... You can tell the guy got an attitude because he just had his head down and was just throwing everything around until he gave me my card and receipt back ... seriously this place is trash never coming here again I literally never make comments like this at all but man this place is something else

dq1HfYM9dzkYwjtvXRRLqg.text: this is prob the best looking pho place ive ever been to. so driving up to the asian side of vegas you notice the HUGE banner for being rated the best pho ever, or whatever it said. TO BE HONEST. that hyped me way too much and it just didnt live up to the behemoth banner.  when i walk into a place and notice, you have a waiting list, that right there tells me youre good enough but it doesnt hype me like a giant banner. lol  the pho was okay, the broth didnt taste bad, it just wasnt the best ive had. there wasnt that much noodle, like it was proportioned wrong. meat to broth to noodle ratio was off and i was left dissatisfied. the bill was cheap for 7 people so i guess thats okay   this place is really clean and the staff are like any other place, no service at all so expect that.

wsaO0t42iiB_j3XELmy6YA.text: This place is awesome! The food is always fresh and fast whether you're coming at 2pm or 2am! My favorite things to get so far are the chicken wings, the lumpia, and boba. Their special sauce with the chicken wings is amazing. Overall, everything here is delicious and packed with flavor and you'll probably just want more.

z5jJPHQTIXiDjStuSsUksg.text: Decent pho, open 24/7 which is nice when your craving something Asian at 4am. Decent priced and good portion size. Recommend the Thai ice tea !

FSsCTCaigdRFGS9oJzfB3Q.text: Love this place.. best place to go whenever you have a hang over on top of that it's not a pain for your wallet..

3tz4FU-fF13Vr3S1PYQOkA.text: the door man.. or whatever he thinks he is... (you're not working at the club either) super power trips.... we waited like everyone else, then we got seated and he had to ask us for fkin ID! are you serious? stop power tripping and do your job... stupid mofo...

hGgpTuFd6QmmyMq-QR90JA.text: Pros: - Open 24 hours- this is a great selling point. Sometimes at 11:00 pm, after a really really long day, or 3:00 am, perhaps at the end of a night out, a bowl of pho just hits the spot.  - Rotating specials (e.g. this week included salt and pepper eggplant, szechuan eggplant, and pork buns.) - Drinks include thai tea with boba and soda with preserved lemon  Cons:  - The service was really pretty terrible. Water came quickly, but after that it took a while to get other drinks and about 20 minutes to get our check (after asking three different people). It would have taken longer, but we got up to go pay. They were pretty rude about it too, telling us it had only been 5 minutes.   In-betweens: - The pho was okay, although the broth was on the bland side, and my rare steak was faaaarrr beyond well done by the time I saw it. I would recommend ordering the rare steak and brisket, with the steak on the side. This will keep it rare when you add it to your pho =)

y3fEuNsYJjHeSSwTeruDMQ.text: If I can give 0 stars I would, they gave us our food so rudely. The food was alright. Slamming it against the table and didn't even bother to ask which is which. We're a group of five and we were just hanging out having a good time. When it was time to pay they gave us the receipt on the table. We all went up to the cashier to pay individually. I was the first one to come up and since I have cash in hand I was going to tip that, so I didn't write any tip and this guy looked at me dead in the eye and said no tip, why not? I told him I'm paying in cash and threw my card across the counter. So rude. Will never go back to this place.

ytUXEKz2CH4far_COLzUYQ.text: Wow! Impressive Pho'! Busy but they were efficient on the turnover and tables were ready quick...food is amazing!

uuT6nMwJUAW-BQFvW-qqMQ.text: Great place with bomb food! Try their spring rolls with the peanut sauce, yummy! Cooks in late evening make food a bit better than the daytime... Perfect place to eat after clubbing to sober you up! =$

C8Pt_N8laGvwW1uZBYdTuA.text: if I could give this place 100 stars I would. I've been going here for the past four years. I'm not even from Las Vegas, so for me this place is a must stop in Sin City. Yeah yeah this place is full of Michelin 5-Star places, but oh lordy lord is this place good. I think it's one of the best vietnamese spots in the U.S and I'm comparing it to hubs in LA/Little Saigon/Dallas/Boston and other major vietnamese hubs. I tell everyone I know in the Boston area to come here and they agree that this place rocks.  I will say the one thing I don't enjoy is the service for it is a typical asian restaurant experience - sub par. Also, the spring rolls aren't so great, but everything else from pho, com tam, mi xao don, cha gio and the drinks are worth it!  PS - though this place is open 24/7, they will deny service if they can't handle it. Happened to me during EDC last year. I just left to change some clothes and came back in like 20 mins.

6Pxp0NQvmDaa-4K7xIun8A.text: This place is the best 24 hour pho in town. And they don't just have amazing pho, literally everything I get from this place is delicious

5rCMeleh-GyqiuFPRZdtvQ.text: This was my first time to ever try Pho and it was delicious... I had the wonton pho with egg noodles and egg rolls.. The only thing that threw me off was the taste of cloves in the broth but other than my strange taste buds it was amazing and I will definitely be go back for more...

0c--kot5kPLzbKp0LH-t6Q.text: If I can give a 0, I would. Horrible service and mediocre food. I have been here before, but this time we had to come here because our go-to place is closed.  The service this time was horrible!! We placed our order for pho and waited at least 20 minutes, while others came after us and got their soup first. We were so upset and asked the server and she said there was a mix-up in the kitchen. Granted there was an error but as a good business, you should see that we sat there and waited a long time and didn't get our food.  On top of that, there's no recognition of the fact that your customers are sitting there waiting and not a word from staff. Never coming here again!!

X6yExFV9vqLktVaNRZBX6g.text: When you live in Vegas this is the perfect spot to eat after staying out till 4am! They are open 24 hours and located not too far from the strip in China Town.   We came around 4am and were seated immediately. I ordered the rare steak and brisket pho (#15). The broth is not bad and the serving size is pretty large.   I didn't expect great service especially around the time we came to eat. They were quick to take our order and we didn't have to wait too long till it was brought out to us!   Seriously the perfect meal to eat after a night out.

5SKZqFj872CPIhbfKoOC2A.text: Came straight here from the airport. Their pho was amazing. It was definitely satisfying. Their salty chicken was good as well.

akaotpwRw3r2o01qd8iZIA.text: This is the worst Pho I have ever tried. Nevertheless, the customer service is so bad and they required to be tipped according to their tip suggestion. Its quite rude to ask to choose the tips option that was suggested. Tip is personal. It depends on the guests how much they want to tip and how much they think the server deserve. I was very dissapointed. If you are authenic Vietnamese, dont try this place. I dont know why there are many good reviews on yelp.

cHcfkbDMHUMn-PeEhxRBCA.text: I usually go here very late night. Usually you will find yourself in a wait to get in as everyone in the town seems to go here at that time. Pho is very good and fresh. Meat isn't dry.  All in all, best pho in town.

O0cQJ_CBLLrSAB4TAACtMA.text: All the food we ordered was actually very good. Had the pho beef noodle soup and other dishes. All looked and tasted good. I would definitely go back again. Busy restaurant but not a long wait.

jtRZOmd3LT-CSTRvxChZtg.text: In Las Vegas, you want to eat at places that are busy. Especially in asian spots. Why? Because it means food MOVES and you don't get leftovers or stuff that's been sitting waaay too long under a heat lamp. And eat off the strip. Waaay cheaper...  This place is open 24/7 (plus) and was busy from the moment we stepped in with people still waiting to be seated when we left about an hour or so later (plus). We're talking about midnight on a weekend in Las Vegas too. Service was quick (+), the place was clean (+), food was hot and very good (+). I wish I had taken pics, but we were all just too hungry to care after not having eaten since about 3 pm that afternoon. Definitely come here for a change of scenery from the pricey food places on The Strip (+). Prices were reasonable and food choices are endless here (+). You don't want to visit here if you're the undecided sort. I didn't seen any sandwiches here, but plenty of options for drinks as well. My one questionable food choice was the salted boiled chicken. We ordered a  1/2 a chicken expecting to be an American sized 1/2 chicken portion. Wrong!! We got a chicken that could pass for a cornish game hen size. Yeah, I thought we were back in China again with the size of this bird. Kind of felt gyped in a way( - ). Hence the reason for the not quite 5 star rating. Portion sizes for the Pho we all ordered were  a good size. Honestly, I couldn't tell the difference between the size of my small bowl and the large bowl my other dining companions ordered. I was still full after finishing my Pho and I didn't even drink any of the soup.  Eat here because it's close to The Strip, cheaper than any place on The Strip that serves the same thing but will probably charge you more (maybe $5 more. Yikes!!). Parking could be an issue at peak times, so I suggest if you're from out of town to get an Uber/Lyft here.

daZLlv0oLWVFloC_LcNgpA.text: The food is good. Services is good. We ordered the drunken noodles with shrimp and two Phas. Delish.   Our waitress is helpful and attentive. She knows the menu and helps if you're indecisive.   It's causal, fairly fast in delivering your food.

CxWZO2o2Kj93jOgQgH0EXw.text: nastiest place i have ever eaten at. the employees are rude and in a bad mood. the food tastes like dirty bath water. do not come here.  oh, you also have to wait 10-15 mins to even be seen by your server.

s4C9RZl39FE_YloAJsTmxg.text: It's decent pho. Not the best that I had but very comforting still. Quite some wait for the table.

zppiPAN3LuPRMOA8VuXSpw.text: I decided to bring my family here this past Sunday (4/30/17) because we've been wanting to try other pho joints and I came here before on two separate occasions in the past and from what I remembered, it was really good. We had 7 people in our party, plus a baby, and it took for-freaking-ever to get a table. We also came during the dinner rush on a Sunday, so it was understandable. We waited at the cramped and overwhelming seating area at the entrance and were finally called for a table after about 45 minutes.  We were seated at our table by the hostess and given menus. Everyone quickly decided what they wanted to eat and we placed our order with our waiter before we even got our waters! My family ordered a couple plates of gi cun (fresh spring rolls), roasted chicken with garlic, shrimp fried rice, and five bowls of pho. The food came out really fast, which seemed a little suspicious to me, considering how crowded the place was! First of all, the spring rolls were extremely small compared to other Vietnamese restaurants I have been to and the rice paper was hard and difficult to chew, as if it had been sitting out for a long time waiting to be served. The spring rolls definitely weren't fresh. Second of all, the broth in my pho wasn't very hot. It was just warm. Third of all, the shrimp fried rice was extremely bland. There wasn't much flavor at all. Somebody pass the soy sauce!  As I was eating my pho, I started to remember why I enjoyed my previous visit here. I came here with my cousins at 3 in the morning after a long day of getting crazy at Life Is Beautiful. Of course anything tastes good when you've been on your feet all day, you're intoxicated, and half asleep, right? Needless to say, the food is just okay, not really satisfactory. The quality isn't there.  Straight up, the customer service is terrible... That's me being nice. The servers aren't attentive and it took a few tries to get our waiter's attention. I asked one of them for some extra lime and as he was walking away, I caught him rolling his eyes. Of course, he never came back, so I had to ask someone else. They were definitely understaffed for the amount of customers they had!  It's unlikely that I'll be returning any time soon and if I do decide to give this place another try in the future, I'm definitely just going to stick with the pho and stay away from the spring rolls and fried rice.

What I overheard from the cashier is not good so That could affect a food service as well. After I heard them then we didn't eat and we left for other restaurants.

i0fRh6atkSDFadCQFS7BzQ.text: Was there on Christmas place was busy. I decided that I was going to treat myself with my regular order beef stew soup with rice noodles but also Terriyaki chicken with stream rice. My order came within 5 minutes. I first tasted the beef noodle excellent as usual no problem. Then the Terriyaki chicken looked good. But, when I sliced it was hard looked it was not fresh. took a bite tough not easy to chew. Try adding Terriyaki sauce still not much better. $13.00 wasted I won't order it again. When paying the check the restaurant manager knows that I am a regular visitor asked how was my dinner the beef stew excellent no problems but, when I told him that Terriyaki chicken was bad he said he was sorry and will speak to the chef. I made it real clear that I was not going to order it again. Pho Kim Long has great Pho soup. There entrees they need to improve.

6JfohmPrR-JdEkKQ8jf-4Q.text: Pho has a lot of MSG that I have to go back to the hotel to take a nap right after. I alway feel tired right after the meal if food contain MSG, but it takes a moderate amount for me to fall asleep. The sevice is okay, my sever is nice, but asking me sign the reciept while I was still eating so he can go home, which is understandable. However, other servers keep looking at us and ask to take our bowls right after which make us feel like we need to leave immerdiately, even though it was only 5pm. Vermicelli bowl is okay, but most of the food are salty for me, espicially anything with broth.

JhHQV6Eo3gT0cvL-scWZIg.text: Yikes.  I thought since this place had the MOST reviews, that it would be fairly good.  I was very wrong.  Probably one of the worst Pho we ever tried.  Not only that, they served it cold, luke warm.  It's like they have all of these phos sitting prepared in advance and then serve it when it's ordered.  It definitely was not made to order.  We also ordered spring rolls, sweet sour pork, and beijing beef.  The sweet sour pork was pretty good. That's where it stops.  Definitely do not recommend this place at all.

3zEWJ4GIdisGWkS_FOtC3g.text: If there is 0 star on yelp, this is one place I would give 0 star.  Pho is below mediocre and the manager is rude and crooked. I asked to change the meat because the chicken plate I ordered came out SUPER dry with little meat.  The chicken looks like a small frog, very different from the picture on the menu.  They took back the plate and gave me a different dish that I didn't order.  When the bill came, they charged me for two dishes.  When I asked if they had made a mistake, the manager/ owner told me he purposely did that because I tasted the food and I should not throw away food because there are lots of hungry people.  I told him I did not taste the food.  I cut open the chicken and realized there are no meat.  If he felt strongly about the hunger people, he should have returned the plate and tell me no I cannot change or tell me I need to pay for different meat.  I would have gladly pay extra.  The manager's behavior was demeaning and RUDE even for a Vietnamese restaurant standArd.  I can not believe this place is still open when there are so many other pho places in Las Vegas with better yelp rating.  Now I know why they have low ratings compare to other pho places.

Rnt4Its5wzat2uEDE8xj5w.text: I ordered a combination pho and it literally came with only 2 different types of meat (Probably 6 thin slices total) and NOTHING else. Why am I paying extra for something that isn't COMBINATION? There was no meatballs, no tripe, no tendon. The soup was also salty AF and I found a piece of plastic wrap in my pho. So please don't waste your time and go to a different pho place. I'm so disappointed!

d9gtVRHsEP_GEy9WPRs9Hg.text: My friends and I recently hit up Pho Kim Long while we were in Las Vegas. We ended up at the restaurant toward 10PM. The restaurant was definitely busy, but the wait wasn't too bad. Overall, the experience was good. Staff was friendly, though a little busy. The food was good, but not amazing. All and all, if you had an urge for Pho outside of traditional business hours, Pho Kim Long doesn't disappointment.  The pho was solid quality. Not amazing, but definitely good. No real complaints here other than it gets crowded. Definitely would recommend.  Four stars out of five for good food and good service.

xpUekVV_hoA40AFlv95dPQ.text: It's been over three years since I first reviewed Pho Kim Long.  They have gotten a little too popular for their own good. They're open 24/7 now and the consistency isn't what it once was unfortunately.   The one thing I think they still do here better than most is their Chicken Pho. Since chicken pho isn't all that popular most places simply have it as an after-thought. At PKL it is done well with a very good broth.  They must be doing something right to always be as busy as they are, but unless it 3am and you just got out of the club, I still think there are better options in the vicinity.

BLVpLSuGnTNwtXKhqEteRw.text: Good place for pho and cha goi. Goi cuon is good as well but size of everything has diminished while prices have gone up.   Salt and pepper and lettuce wraps are also great appetizer choices. The flavor of the food is great here, service is spotty depending on when you come, but there are a lot of tables. But for late night pho, this place is the best choice and not only because it's one of few open late.

D-_ahChP6A3l8hSmKpslhA.text: It's really ridiculous, the host has some stupid rules about table arrangements. We came at 2:00am.....they only have 2 tables in the whole restaurant server 6 people, they will not put 6 people in a 7 ppl table no matter what. Unfortunate enough, we had 6 people.  Wait for an hour there and we Left. Will not come again and will tell anyone I know don't come here.

I3y1skjM19jGpR6f7X58-A.text: Ordered the Noodle with tenders, briskets, and meat balls. Everything was great except for the meat balls, they were very plain with no flavor at all and the texture was not chewy like all the meat balls I had in my life before.  Other than that, the portion is really worth the money with plenty of meat. The service is fast and both bus boy and waitress were very attentive.

bJu9bJcV_r-miJakblwZmg.text: Hmmm...The first time I came here (2016), my sister took me here for a late night/early morning meal. She & her friend are vegan, so they opted for pho and I got a noodle dish with meat. When the food came out, my meat was blue (YIKES) and their pho's veggies weren't fresh. All 3 of us ended up with food poisoning even though I avoided the meat!  I tried giving it another chance on Sunday AM with a friend which was alright. Food was fine and came out quickly.  15 mins ago -- Came alone to get a bite to eat and while I sat down waiting for my waiter/waitress, I was promptly greeted by a COCKROACH who went under my seat!! I freaked and told the host then went to my car. Fumbling for my keys, the host met me at my car and said "let me get your door for you". I responded saying "Oh, I must've left my keys because of the cockroach" and he said "Don't worry, we will kill the cockroach". Opened my door and handed me the keys.  Disgusting. I will NEVER go back!!! Go up the street to H.K Seafood instead. Clean, friendly staff, and super tasty food.

EQq7umgCbikmMyn_ljasxg.text: Food not the same as it used to be. The cooks changed and so did many of the staff. Waiting line is still long. I was disappointed this time around. If you have a hang over or had a long night of drinking this would be the place to get over it, if you can wait that long.

mTgMi3ZyswD8Fpih9mATiQ.text: Cons outweigh the pros of this place.   Went here today due to the higher than 3 star ratings and its location. Had a desire to eat some Vietnamese food even though I had some back in the OC last week where I live. This place is large with plenty of seating which is good. We were promptly seated, again another positive. They brought us our waters pretty quick too. So far so good.  The waitress comes around and I order in Vietnamese and ask her for Pho Tai Sach(tripe). The waitress tells me they don't have that. Um ok, sure its not everyone's cup of tea, but even a basic pho restaurant should carry that. Strike one. Someone in my group orders Bun Bo Hue. At least that went off without a hitch... so we thought. About 10 mins later the Bun Bo Hue comes out. No cabbage or veggies are included with it. This is what the waitress tells us after the fact. Strike two. Again, any normal viet place would serve a plate of veggies with that.   So here is where things go wrong from that point forward. We sat there for another 15 mins waiting for our other 2 bowls of pho. Talk about ridiculous. Either time it right so all the food comes out together but don't bring just one bowl. Whatever, we were finally realizing this place had some issues.  Finally, we get our pho and we eat it. To thier credit they included alot of meat. Not much else unfortunately. The pho broth was truly bland. No aroma at all. The noodle portion was small too.   The final insult was when the bill came. I paid for it by card. I always leave the tip in cash so I zeroed out the tip field. The watress comes over and picks up the bills and says "zero on tip?". I said yes. Thought she just wanted clarification before she processed the transaction. She then puts the bill back down on the table and walks off. WTF, She literally comes back 2 mins later, and again ask me, "no tip?" I then tell her we are leaving cash for the tip. She then picks up the bill and walks off. I have never had any waitress anywhere harrass me about the tip like this. She literally did not deserve one after that, but we left one anyway just because we aren't savages.  Conclusion: there are pros to this place like the large amount of meat they give you amd prompt seating. But why bother the deficiencies in the flavor and the staff out weigh my desire to come back. You decide for you, but I won't be coming back after this experience. Plenty of other Viet places near by with better ratings.

Bl1-YG7LMlDcmQDuFSRwhQ.text: This place is terrible. Took almost 20 mins for them to take our order. When we got our food, not once did they check on us. Staff is rude. I complained to the supervisor name GWEN and all he said was "we are very busy that's why" . DONT COME HERE.

GcgblIJDse3SkRmsePoJCA.text: We had rare beef pho and pork seasoned rice. They were excellent. Hope they add sam bo liong to the drink menu

ZEg2Prwcc1hMRNpfZrm-Ag.text: First time customer.  At first was concerned that wait was long due to list.  Not the case. They pump out fresh food and the service is speedy.  I will gladly return again and again. #localspot

jQ_KumVkWywxeCUETPEzKA.text: We love coming here every time we visit Las Vegas. We always have the combination Pho which is thee best Pho soups I've ever tasted. The bowl of Pho is served with a side of basil, lime, sprouts and jalapenos so you can add what you like. We also love to order their orange chicken which has a nice little kick to it and the fried rice. Which is also delishhh! This place is always packed so be prepared to wait. I've been there in different times of the year and we always wait for a table before seated.

MUMOiwrR_4C_BV-gAgQSpQ.text: The food is always consistent and good. Service is always consistently terrible.  But i always go back :)

4-2vJUp-nD2gwq2nZyHlxQ.text: The pho was delicious!!!! The only thing I didn't like AS much but was still frekin good was the eggroll. It just didn't have that taste I would get with one. But other ham that, the staff was friendly, the food was amazing, I'm really happy they were open late and they saved my HUNGRY butt at 12 am haha so I definitely recommend !

aZiGWu291deob6esYJEZHA.text: Terrible service. The waiter came to take our order and he never came back to our table. We did however,  watch him get a massage while we were trying to attract his attention. We ordered one crab ragoon and we ended up with two. We also ordered a Pepsi which arrived after we asked for the check. When I went to pay the check the person at the counter was very rude regarding our tip. I was there last Saturday and received the same treatment. I will never come to this restaurant again.

Co4fq3N5gxhm0tIMTKHeEA.text: Food is ok, not great.  We ordered pho and hu thieu.  The pho was ok, a little bland.  They used the same broth for hu thieu.  That was a first for me.  Must have ran out or too lazy to make the correct broth!  If you're looking for customer service, go elsewhere.  I went to pay and the guy was ignoring me while taking care of other receipts!  Finally, he acknowledges me with a grunt and runs my card without saying a damn word!  I wouldn't be surprised if he was the owner's son/family.  Only place open 24/,7 so if you're looking for so-so Vietnamese food and service with a grunt and no smile, this place is for you!

gUGGO87nWvqj61bg3u9BaQ.text: Best Pho place in town! Rice plates are yummy & great customer service. Been coming here since my family & I moved out here in 2004.

BGMkCtB76EA2x6wu4oD39A.text: This place was voted the best Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas.  I do not agree.  Food is decent, but not nearly the best.  Best thing about this place is that they are open 24 hours!  That's awesome!  We made it here at about 10pm on a weekday.  It is not a little place, but we still had to wait about 20 minutes before we could be seated.  Only 1 person in our party of 8 was happy with their order.  Those are not good odds.  Maybe we expected too much because they were voted best in Las Vegas.  Maybe the rest of us ordered the worst things on the menu?  It is a very large menu with so many choices.  My wife ordered Pho and was disappointed.  I ordered a Roasted Chicken with rice dish, and the chicken tasted bland.  Well, 7 out of 8 of us will not return here anytime soon.  There are much better options in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #38 Roasted Chicken with seasoned rice
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KZ86UocWIlBWa3zJ_jhYDg.text: Actually I am not a big fan of Vietnamese Pho cuisine but this place is dope. My favorite dish is meal No. 13 Beef Pho Soup and the Coconut Smoothie with Boba - liquid crack!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very delicious: Beef Pho Soup (Meal No. 13)

zoYbrYNrey_An8ZWVz_K6w.text: With some many other (better) Pho places in the area there is no reason to eat at Pho Kim Long.  The tour buses regularly bring unknowing tourists to this particular mall strip in Chinatown. They get a lot of good business that way. Poor tourists. 5 minutes down the road are at least 2 better Pho joints with much less inflated prices.

brtU0B6bwuOXRtNHW0YsLg.text: A good bowl of pho for a reasonable price. Got a large bowl of the combination pho for $9.   The soup is as close to homemade as you can get at a restaurant (especially in Las Vegas, NV). Small selection of meats, but the meats that they do offer are good. They pile on the meats but don't give you enough noodles. They are generous with the vegetables - I asked for extra basil and limes, and they gladly gave me a small plateful.   We came late night at around 11pm, and there was a waiting list and full lobby. It took about 20 minutes for my table of 10 to get seated; our order was taken within 5 minutes and came out in the next 10 minutes. The service is fast but not attentive. The environment is loud and somewhat chaotic, well decorated.   Definitely will come here again for a late night eat.   Pros: food comes out hot and fast Cons: none

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large combination pho with an extra side of meatballs.

Nds3rhs7ZWyBCSx1OouN0A.text: What's better than pho after staying out until 4 am partying your brains out? Not only that but you're partying in VEGAS! Pho Kim Long is literally the biggest pho restaurant I've ever seen. The line can build up, so be prepared for that.  Pho Tai ($7.75) Awesome broth!! Noodles and rare steak are great, but I HIGHLY recommend adding meatballs to any pho you get. Probably the best meatball in pho I've had.  Egg Rolls ($6.50) How can you order pho without egg rolls. I recommend the egg rolls as well. Nice little appetizer before your hangover meal.  Next time after partying at Marquee or Hakkasan, I'm coming here the morning after.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Rolls
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Tai

zsPOn6L6G6H-pKPiA55EqA.text: What's more appealing than 24 hours Asian cuisine? That's exactly what they offer and that's what brought us to this gem. We brought our visiting friends from China and they love the place as well. Their fried eggplant is to die for. Something simple turned extra ordinary. Their wanton noodles is simple and comparable with others. Their seafood clay pot is very tasty as we'll. Don't let their tea or coffee (tea bags and served in styro cup) deceive you. They serve pretty hope you're doing good food and their service is fast and friendly. Check them out guys.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their fried eggplant. Simple ingredient turned into something great.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood clay pot. Try it and I&#39;m pretty sure you&#39;ll love it.

r_fWMON1muvItWHm7KzpUA.text: This place is open 24hrs!? I came for lunch. Superrr hungover. And my usual pho place was randomly closed! Came here because of the time heh heh. And stayed because there was a wait, and when there's a wait the food must be good, right?   I got pho tai and it was really good. I don't usually drink all the broth but this time I couldn't help myself. We also got the vermicelli pork dish which was also good!   Our bill was less than 20$ and there was so much food!

-2pSoWDdeqjw29sgANdlaA.text: I stop by Vegas about once a year, and I always end up in Chinatown somehow! But when in Chinatown a go-to spot is Pho Kim Long! If you're looking for good Pho this is definitely the place to go. The wait was roughly 15 minutes. The server my table had was a bit rude and slow, but I was able to look past this once the food had come out. The soup base of the pho was what especially made me come back here time and time again. The pho isn't lacking in meat and always has a good amount. I don't know a great deal about the rest of the menu, but if you want pho in Vegas, stop by Pho Kim Long!

6hlo5AcM8qd1DR-d19YNPQ.text: Never will come back to it again!  Horrible service- the staff saw us came in and did not seat us after awhile. No greeting, smile, thank-you what so ever. Seem like they were glaring at us ever time we ask them for something.  Food- the quantity is ridiculously little! Food that we ate there looked nothing like the picture. We also ordered half a duck to go and half chicken to go. Once we came home and open it, I almost laugh. Half? More like 1/4. It was a small box and a thin layer of meat. Seems like left over. Two dried up duck legs? Half? Seems like they were just trying to put anything in to let it pass.  Price- it's pricier than most places.  Regret it entirely... the only reason we went cause it was opened 24/7.

xI_SmaLSh-C53IAXgoecgg.text: The food was good but it would be the first and last time I would eat here. Why? The worst customer services ever, giving food out 30 minutes later after order, asking for water 4 times, no one served. The rice has to have go with some sauce, nobody gave to me. Asked where is my food, answered "I'll check it", go somewhere far away. More and more happened.  But seriously the food is so so good. If you have a good temper, you should go have it.

Z2eLqbs-7kEgLbqIMv3ZkQ.text: Man ... so for those who don't know about this spot . The food is GREAT. When it comes to service , they need a lot of work. Thus me giving this joint a trae star mark. Lately I've avoided dining in due to the service given and ordering pick up instead . Very convenient but the food at the table just taste sooo good freshly given, opposed to the lightly watered down version due to the heat .

fueFfdm3U5g9n_7-eZkf7g.text: Sadly, this is the only place I could think of for a quick bite after seeing MJ's One; with a name like Kim Long you're not gonna forget it. I think this place is actually pretty dirty, even by HITW Asian standards. I've been to a lot of better pho places back in LA, I just need to do some homework and find a decent one in LV for times like this... The Cha Gio were pretty underwhelming this time yelp.com/biz_photos/pho-..., maybe I just had better since, I prefer the skin more blistery and I thought the lettuce that they provide was skinny and lousy as a wrap. We had come for pho; she had the Tai Chin yelp.com/biz_photos/pho-... and I most likely had the Tai Nam yelp.com/biz_photos/pho-.... Both were unremarkable and I forgot to ask for the rare beef on the side so naturally they were overcooked... I'm pretty much over this place, I just need to find another place; even the name that used to made me chuckle, now it just sounds stupid...

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 090813:  Pho Tai Nam...
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 090813:  Pho Tai Chin...
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 090813:  Cha Gio...

h1C3yYPUsEDrLO9RjMC1kA.text: Great service love the pho and other food too You can't miss this place in Vegas have to love this place is will definitely visit this place again. After drink perfect place to go

m_JkNHd4CC5RWGQJ-VDp7Q.text: 24 Hours?! +1 star for you, Pho Kim Long. A place for drunchies.  Bun Bo Hue ($8.50ish): This noodle soup used to be REALLY good here. My parents wanted to come here specifically for it, so we ordered 3 bowls. The sauce they gave with it is SO yummy, better than the broth itself, unfortunately. This time, the bun bo hue lacked flavor. I was hoping for pork blood inside because that's usually how I see it served but nada. Disappointment this time around.  Pho Tai Sac ($7.75): Not bad! I ordered the small bowl and after 10-15 minutes of eating, my bowl looked like it had not been touched. It was like a magical bowl of never ending noodles! I didn't know how to stop it. I ate a little less than half and had to pass it onto my sister & dad to help me finish. Good amount of meat slices.  *BE AWARE OF EXTRA TIPPING!! I had a party of 5 and we automatically got a 18% gratuity charge!

IzyuMll_AaxmlzUptu9Bvw.text: all i have to say is i love basil.  these guys rock it 24/7.  tai chin is my goto

CkhdE-ZIJbwOgmE8YwZ8pw.text: Came in at 1:30 am and the place was pumping! Guess I'm not the only one who gets pho cravings at odd hours.   Service was fast and friendly. The establishment is pretty clean and spacious, although the tables are arranged in close proximity to each other so it's definitely not a quiet place.   I had the rare steak pho with spring rolls on the side. Even with a small, I felt full. Their noodle portions are generous. I'll ask for the rare steak on the side next time though, because it was a little dry when it reached my table. Other than that, everything was cheap and delicious.   Totally coming back here when I'm near the strip. I think it's also worth noting that their menu is extensive, so if you don't like pho I'm sure there will be something else to enjoy.

wOl-1Y9rJe69mQZ55na4DA.text: Lines are very long, but the wait is well worth it, and they turn the tables over very quick. Wait Staff hustle but take time to make sure you understand the menus. The Food  "Vietnamese "is about as authentic as you will get anywhere. A great selection of Pho and soups along with a great selection of rice dishes.

fjkgjo5pyEnoDP-AUnIQDg.text: Absolutely horrible experience. I am so disgusted by the way they serve their water, I refused drinking it. They have a big black bucket and they just scoop the water from that bucket into the cups! The water does not come from the soda fountain! I am sure that is health code violation. There are more to this horrible experience. This visit reminded me of why I never come here. My boyfriend ordered pho and I just had salt and pepper chicken wings with rice. My chicken wings came up first and I had to wait 20 min for my rice so I could not eat my chicken, by the time it arrived my chicken was already cold. While my boyfriend waited for his pho for 30 minutes, while we watched everyone who ordered after us get their pho right away! The server had an attitude too! I will NEVER come back here ever again no matter how much I'm starving. Overall HORRIBLE SERVICE and DISGUSTING restaurant. Negative stars if I could rate this place.

UZQw2-ybRWRc-c7ubnVdpg.text: Tend to always stop here at least once a year. Pho Kim Long is 24 hours! Yes!  But two stars because their pho is different than where and what I taste in sunny california. Understandable that it's nevada, heck it's Vegas but I mean... less watery broth would be nice.  The service is good though... depending on the time because there are only so any people that work and can help out their customers directly. But yeah.  Brush up on flavor??

re5x9QH2oB0JNSmc67LuUA.text: I use to love coming here drunk/sober so I remember it use to be good. Service was always whatever but we would come late night. Tonight we had the calamari and I swear they served more before? I may be wrong but it came out looking pretty lame. No flavor and it wasn't even hot. We waited for the server to come around and finally after calling him over, we told him we didn't like it. To which he replies with why didn't you tell me sooner so i could make you a new one? It's almost finished. What do you want to do with it?  Hm okay. As a server the first thing I say to my guests is "I apologize it's not up to par. Could I get you another one? Or is there anything else I can get for you?" And we had to ask the bussers to call him over!  Maybe it's asking for too much from this place. Then the manager? comes around later with the same plate saying it's almost gone and asks us if we still want it??? Wtf?? WE DON'T LIKE IT NOR WANT IT.  Super disappointed. Don't expect service. If anything, go when you're drunk so you don't notice how bad everything is.

lpguuPO1RcoKPa8gfQzsYQ.text: Loved the "Special Combination " Pho and I asked for it SPICY!!  Unfortunately I've had Taco Bell Sauce with more kick. BUT the flavor of the Broth still reigned.  I also got the Bun Thit Ng...I forget how to spell it... MAAAAN. The rolls and the marinated beef were so tender and flavorful!! Wasn't a fan of the cold noodles.   So food experience overall was good.  As popular as it is I feel like there's NO excuse for the Bathrooms to be in the shape they are in. YUCK!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love... in a bowl!

JZ5SI6__C_j8GUEogAxiOQ.text: I have been fortunate enough to always run into great pho restaurants when i crave it. But of all the pho restaurants I've been to, this is thee greatest of them all. The complaints I've seen about this place has consistently been the service but i was yet again lucky enough to get super fast and great service! Theres not a single bad thing i can say about this restaurant and its amazing that it is also 24/7.

F-flPDyFKlDJFR_Lx_eMNg.text: one of my boyfriends long time favorite spots; and it stays consistent. For a Wednesday night, it was still pretty busy - but we were in and seated within 15 minutes.   Service was ok - but it seemed they had too many tables and not enough waiters, so I understand. They still made sure to check on us and refill our water as needed.   The food came out so fast! Within 5 minutes of ordering the food was at our table! It was crazy - but everything was amazing. We will def be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qdgDdjVdPtSt50hFlN5Fxg.text: Mediocre food. There was still a line at 10ish for  dinner, idk why... you can come here when other places is closed to fill up your empty stomach I guess

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sdB56TuCKOWmBGSHmiD1tQ.text: Always a great stop when i'm in town!! When I lived here, this was my weekend go to joint for great vietnamese food!!

JL7kErlq9eO1x1lRO3fFbA.text: Sooooooo yummy! It was really busy when we got there around 10pm but they sat us down within ten minutes! The customer service is great! They bring out everything super fast.... I don't think I waited more then 5 minutes for all of my food to come out. The pho was delicious! I recommend trying the tofu nuggets! All in all was a fantastic place and can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kim Long Fried Egg Rolls Tofu Nuggets Rare Steak Noodle Soup

eaguTV2WztJ68qSBvoQU_g.text: We went here after late night clubbing and we were craving for pho. I been here a few times whenever I go to Vegas. I still prefer this place over the other pho in the area since there is Variety of options for food. This is place is open 24 hours so it a good whenever you are craving for pho or Asian foods. We got a table within a few minutes of waiting. We ordered the special pho and honey walnuts shrimps. The pho was good and the honey walnuts shrimps was good. They have over 130 food items for you to choose if you prefer not getting pho. The services was decent and friendly. The parking here can be hassle since it limited parking. This place is good for late night and options for you don't want to eat on the strip. I will be back again when I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yadi3o0i5xmVEGyfyZ_GoQ.text: Lots of servers in circulation so service was efficient. Busy w a small wait list on Wednesday after midnight.  My friend's pho tai bo vien came out lukewarm so she couldn't enjoy it thereby didn't finish. He forgot to write down my spring rolls order so those never came. The oysters in black bean sauce were perfectly savory n sooo good w rice. I might just order all oyster dishes next time, make it an oyster fest. If w a date, then lucky man, right!  We ordered two yummy coconuts n didn't finish drinking so they removed the juice w coconut meats n put in to go cups for us.

ECJCgcBZgICy8IvLR4kbGw.text: This place is large, clean and reasonably priced.  The portions are big and the food is delicious.  I tried the pho (#13) and fried spring rolls.  Loved the lemonade soda which was very citrusy and refreshing!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried springroll
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemonade soda.  So good!

FMKqqXSrkxLp3ORcgyD_iA.text: Of the strip this locals restaurant is where many of the asian hotel employees eat. Amazing pho but much more. Great seafood such as clay pot catfish and fried oysters, great orange chicken, many vegetarian dishes and the best orange chicken I have ever eaten. There are many Asian restaurants in Las Vegas is Chinatown with great reputations but I can't bear to go any place else but here when I am in town

PHVHgXKJp2dkl9oHcN36EA.text: I ordered through post mates... I took the contents directly out from the container into a clean, empty bowl and I find this extra ingredient in my soup. Needless to say, I dumped out my entire meal and I'll be avoiding pho Kim long as much as I can. This place doesn't even taste good, it's just open 24/7 that's why I order my food here. No bugs in my food! Is that too much to ask for...

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ew
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bjU7OXE_lIMpP8Il6ejYFw.text: Excellent pho and wonderful service. I highly recommend the eggplant that is cooked in a clay pot. So good.

FHPjAfDgD41L1SJP6OFv8w.text: No question about it.....THE BEST pho in town! My friend and I stopped in this place last night after craving some pho. So glad we did. This place was jammed packed and you know as well as I know, that's always a great sign. The hostess was incredibly sweet and very talkative, which I loved.  I really surprised we were sat at our tables as fast as we were. I thought for sure it was going to be a long wait. I had the special combination tender beef pho.... OMG .... just simply delicious, no other way to say it. The broth was so tasty and delicious. The different varieties of beef and the noodles was just out of this world. I can't wait to go back!

A0r1sBd_2RqNnWijPccs5g.text: This is my go to Pho place whenever I am craving a late night meal in Vegas. It tends of get packed throughout the night, so expect around a 15 minutes wait during most weekends. The Pho broth and noodles are both delicous. The egg rolls were crispy and tasted perfect when dipped in fish sauce.  I have came here at least 5-6 times, and the food has always been good. The only complaint is the service here, which tends to be slow or non-existence. The service becomes great when they are trying to get you to leave. They will bring you the bill before you ask for it. Start taking bowls and plates away within the minute you finish.   There are plenty of parking in the plaza. Last time I went Aug-2018, prices were 8.95 a Pho bowl  TL:DR, Great food, Plenty of Parking, Bad Service.

WsH0UIhBWPlJyDUFmc3rVQ.text: Pho Kim Long is literally the best Pho I have ever eaten my entire life and I have tried over 30 Pho restaurants. The quality of their food is excellent. They are open 24 hours a day which is great! Not only do they have delicious pho, but the other foods on the menu are just as delicious such as the Mongolian Beef. This place definitely speaks for itself with the crowd that passes through. Do not get discouraged by the waiting list and amount of people you see waiting, it goes by really fast. The prices are very affordable. I highly recommend Pho Kim Long for all of your Vietnamese food cravings!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Ga
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vPShZQ6Oy0DLGsh-kIOj4w.text: Our parents always crave canh chua ca kho to (spicy sour fish soup & caramelized fish pot) when they're on vacation, and this is the perfect go to spot in Vegas for it! There are so many options for everyone in your party, and each dish tastes really homecooked. Don't be so intimidated by the waiting line- it moves fairly quickly since the restaurant is huge and service is quick here.

w2GycSVDFJSl6Hr6_VXswg.text: In May we went to Las Vegas for sightseeing. On the third day, we choose this restaurant for our breakfast. Ten people set ten bowls of rice noodles, two spring rolls and three summer rolls. It tasted good and the service was kind, but the highlight came when I eating the last bite, I found a dead fly in the soup. I felt very vomiting, but my husband had already paid 20% of the tip. I was so helpless that I told the waiter that there was a dead fly in the soup. The waiter only said sorry.I would never go here again.

fB9qb-jkhJ0DlVxdBpNyYQ.text: There are some places that surprise you, and this place doesn't! A seeming fusion of southern Chinese cuisine and Vietnamese comfort food can launch the restaurant only so far in the road of intrigue without diminishing the quality of either influences.   My minute samplings of the Chinese dishes were satisfying enough, but I'll limit my review to my portions only. I'd admit the Chinese orders are infinitely more alluring and aromatically than the Vietnamese counterparts, but it's safe to assume the defining element of this establishment is the rare availability of pho and vermicelli in wee late hours. Arriving on a busy Sunday noon time, the wait was still minimal, yet the service was quick and buzzing. There are parking available in the plaza lot, and also plentiful restroom stalls inside in the back.  -Pho Tai Gan: Although this specific dish is not on the menu, you can order pho with the sliced rare steak and tendon. There are only a few pieces of tendon, and the soup base was too light and hinges on the flavorless side, instead of the rich, umami taste I expected for pho.  -Bun Bo Hue: The broth was a translucent and lack a  clear distinctly sour and salty flavour that distinguishes what is supposed to be a thick red colour soup base. There are three pork knuckles or leg pieces in there, but what I do enjoy is the yummy shrimp chili paste condiment with an in-house-made taste.   Food: 2.5/5 Service: 4/5 Ambiance: 3/5 Environment: 3.5/5

0bZ3u3_sPel2Pd-4ipRecw.text: This was my first time going to Vegas and needing some pho this was the place to stop too ! I cannot tell you how many times I went here over my 5 day vacation . The service was great , quick and everything was amazing . Definitely worth coming here over and over , my fiance and I just couldn't get over how good the food was . Next time we come this is a spot we will most definitely stop at . Their pho was amazing , fried spring rolls and their crab Rangoon was delicious . Must go here !

zoH-e-G9sA8-2byppna7lw.text: I have to say, my friend and I had a good laugh when we pulled up to this place.  This is probably the second Pho restaurant that I've been to that seems to like to push it's limit in estranged humor.  The food was delicious, and though I must say that it is hard to mess up Pho like it's hard to mess up a burger, you definitely can taste the difference.  However; PKL does not meet that standard.  There are a lot of Pho chains out there, and PKL is decent in that regards.  They are open late at night and good for some midnight cravings after a night of gambling if you're a tourist.  Or whatever you happen to be in Vegas for.  There is a bathroom, service is decent, and I have and probably will visit this place quite often.  knocked a star mostly on my preference, when I go to these places, there has to be some cheap gimmick that pulls me either with something free or some kick butt pho.  the name in it of itself just doesn't cut it for me ;)

GRJ1qrZvEEm4dVj4mhDlAA.text: The food was okay, no cilantro or mint in our fresh rolls or noodle bowls (disappointing)  Ceramic plates and bowls weren't very clean (that bothered me)  Extra points for the waiter telling the truth when asked about MSG in their broth!

mB3VXYi_gEE6yp2bO74ZSA.text: I love the pho , and coconut water is delish . Service, needs to get worked on abit ,other than that great =)

dhW4dywPvwaI0kfQdbPGAA.text: Great food , great service from our waiter Brian. Kids loved it and said it was way tastier than the other place their mom and aunties took them to. Lol they eat everything ordered with no take home. Will definetly take them here again

31foMX7v-910cdHuawyqJA.text: the best after hours PHO place in VEGAS!!!!  I had the Pho Thai and it was amazing!!! ha ha the Kalbi was awesome too. I've never eaten at a place that cuts the Kalbi off of the bone.  That definitely made me want to go back! Of course don't forget the spring rolls! They were awesome..  I really only eat a few things when I go to a Vietnamese restaurant. So from what I had I loved!

SnvQb3d4Pu-9DY0a8YaDmg.text: The wait is long and the wait staff (not all) were rude.  Food was not very flavorful and the vermicelli with pork was horrendous.  The pork was chewy and bland.  My wife ordered pho which the broth was not that good.  Spring rolls were nothing but noodles and the dipping sauce was sour.  Better places to eat elsewhere!  Don't waste your $$$$!

KJTAQiET5uN_oQjuXB0_nA.text: The environment gives this place an Orange County feel, it almost made me forget that I was in Vegas!  They have a wide variety of options for you to choose from on their food menu. Aside from pho, they offered bun bo hue, chao, banh xeo and even some rice plates and many more!   I went with a small pho ga with white meat and sadly give it a 3 stars due to lack of taste in the broth and stinginess on the chicken!   Service is a-okay, prompt with getting our amenities and refilling our ice waters.   I will surely return to this restaurant to try other dishes, like the banh xeo and chao. happy to have found this side of Vegas :))

sN-ljlYKoUWjYjRdYN_fWw.text: I went here with my brothers that love Pho.  I have never had it so why not try it.  We were a party of 10 and we were sat right away and service was great.  However I didn't care for the Pho.  I really am not a soup person. My brothers who LOVE Pho and eat it on all their travels liked it, not loved it.  However the place was packed so I am sure it is good.   I would have given it more stars but I tried the Pho and wished I would have ordered something else.  Pho is not for me...

jTWYqzLInMKsCJmxeipfSg.text: Ok, I have eaten here all times of day. Lunch, dinner and late night. I have had a consistent experience everytime. Which is half the battle with restaurants these days.  The atmosphere is well lighted. Nice but not exactly romantic. Menu is large. For someone new to this type of food the menu can be overwelming and confusing.  But, once you find your dish of choice they will have you hooked. Personally I love 12 and 16. They are noodle bowls with beef. I like to add the fresh mint they give on the side.  For a drink i highly recommend their Thai ice tea. Also, if I had to recommend a time of day i would say late night. 2am? No problem!

WKFJix9qEdZQhAwYezp5PA.text: The name alone makes you wanna come into this place. The name is hilarious! I've been coming here every time I go to Las Vegas. The best thing is that it's 24 hours and it's cheap. But it's not the best pho in town. If you want a decent place to eat cheap and late night with a group of friends, eat here. It's only 5 mins away from the strip.

uv0Uz7tu65qssECdBEQq2g.text: We just get sick of spending $150+ on every meal in Vegas so we go here to help ease the pain in our wallets a little bit.  Even though there are a lot of pho places around, the competition didn't improve the taste of the pho. I barely touched my bowl because it just tasted bad. I like the egg rolls and dumplings. I have had dinner here several times and most of their items are tasty so its depressing that their pho is crap.   As far as authenticity goes, if you go back to Vietnam you have to eat on a little table with flies every where if you want real pho. So just be happy the place is clean and there is some sort of service. Its good for your average filler meal before you go out and spend a bunch of money on some celebrity chef restaurant.

nkUAgEDTJX9DUsZsXzCkXw.text: Yay! Another decent Vietnamese restaurant.  Best part of this one is it's super affordable and open 24 hours!  I will say they are SO busy that sometimes the service can be slow but the prices are great and the food is really decent.  There are some small inconsistencies like - the first time I had the duck it was yummy.  The second time it was "ok" so you kinda gotta be careful of that.  But I always have the crab rangoon and it's delish.  As well as the Singapore noodles, seafood plate and beef pho soup.  I definitely recommend this place especially late at night :)

_ApHbFg4wgCk-PcL5K7g9g.text: Me and my friends from LA went there to have Pho on lunch time. It was really busy and the waiting list was almost full so I had to wait about 45 min. becuse it was so busy, our server did not really pay attention to us so I had to run to our server and order. that was ok, However, our server kept on missing the items that we order and eventually our server took out from our checks. it was ok. I will give them try again when it is not that crazy busy.

N1kmMvZ11Z1xs9X7pqC-VQ.text: Gonna say it, best Pho I've ever had...  I don't know if its cause this place is in Vegas and its nice to eat some good (relatively) cheap asian food after cramming your trap with casino buffets, or it also could be cause most of the people here are either drunk or hung over.  But I stand by my statement that this is probably the best Pho I've had.  I try to come here at least once every other vegas trip, once me and my buddies came here twice in 1 day, before and after clubbing, its just good.  One word of advice, the XL bowl is really that, EXTRA large, I normally finish my bowl or my rice dish and the rest of my gf's bowl, but man, I couldn't finish the XL bowl.  The broken rice dish here is ok, nothing crazy special, same with the egg rolls, the wait is pretty long on Sundays in the 11-12 time, I guess its a good hang over food before you head back home.  This place is also open 24 hours so you can come here at 4am and get the goods, its also a nice pick me up after losing a bunch of money on the tables.

KaeQWYQep-3NdF3egL-oXQ.text: Went there with family for dinner. The food was mediocre. Price is high for the value. Server barely speak English.

UHW2oYxFlbFvJS3DbSb0zw.text: Fried rice? Delicious !!!!! Try the Shrimp noodle phong too!! The food was great plus it's open 24 hours.. great for a late night grub :)

7nyhasBtIEbhF0gYnGMX2w.text: Yummy place to satisfy any Pho craving!  Got the pork vermicelli bowl with egg rolls, super yummy combination! Also try the lettuce wraps, super light and delish!

DH-71OF9EB48ir2UH7q_7Q.text: So I drove a long way and all I got was greasy old tofu! And it is usually good there but also they forgot my scallions! If that happens again bye bye!

h1GhZjYQYTl3JJTC_z-TKg.text: Came here on 12-22-13 right after arriving Las Vegas for late night arrival (11:30pm)  The store opens 24/7 and was packed in mid night and service is not as great as I expect.  Highly recommend late night dinner folks to try other late night asian restaurants in this area

ta_ZE9oH9nPnNUfrxQoe8Q.text: This place is cool, not only cause the name, but the hours. The food's pretty good, ordered pho and you can get extra broth for just $1. The service is alright, like any other mom and pop asian place. We had a problem with our check and the man was being very rude about it. I'm sure there are numerous large parties that come through the restaurant and want to split checks or pay partial cash, partial card. The man was just being very impatient and fussy and the funny part is they weren't even busy at the time, he was probably just having a bad day. The prices are reasonable too and the food is good. But this is the place to be after a long night of partying or to cure your hangover in the morning!

gC-nU9qgNChJZ57iaC-cBQ.text: Though There are plenty of Pho restaurants in Las Vegas, my friends and I are still coming to his place often as it is right in the middle of everything. He parking and the waiting could be a pain. If you choose to come during peak hours, expect to wait a long line. The portion of the food is huge. You can even share like a family style.  To improve- cleanliness, customer service (understandable that Pho restaurant don't emphasize on the service as much as American ones).

Xcbq3guGi4HQZ4TllIr2ew.text: Great broth and open 24hrs, this place is a safe haven after a long night. Delicious and great service.

WdzXA3SCc_3BfrC-_dXJdw.text: I wish there was a better pho place on spring mountain so close to the strip for our tourists. The Bun Bo Hue is a disgrace. There's no lemongrass flavor or even color to the broth. The pork feet is almost nonexistent and there wasn't much meat after that. It's called BUN Bo Hue because there's supposed to be vermicelli noodles which is a thicker rice noodle than the typical pho noodle. Just very bland and disappointing. I feel like the service is lacking terribly too. No one came to check on us within the 20 minutes after us getting our food because I really wanted some extra chili garlic sauce to add to my mess of a bowl. They can do better.

xvcNiejpvzCEOIeWRWWkHg.text: This Vietnamese restaurant is probably my most favorite place to dine in Las Vegas. Even my husband loved their food. We ordered pad Thai & Mongolian beef...

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ooZWLHPF6JpxWyyNKa0BSQ.text: Fantastic food and service. I had the roast duck and it was absolutely delicious. My family had noodles soup, pork and rice dishes. Parking was a bit tough but I found a good place to park, real busy but got a good table and fast service. Love to go back soon.

rm-ovDVJ9ZK61jZXZCErIw.text: My family and I came to this restaurant for the first time. Our waitress had a CBF and was unfriendly. We asked the owner for a different waitress, but it didn't happen.  All of the employees and the owner were unpleasant as they do not like to smile or even try. NONE of the employees were Vietnamese, except for the owner. It definitely wasn't authentic Vietnamese food, especially when they had Chinese fusion dishes.   I am Vietnamese and I can tell you that this is probably the worst Vietnamese restaurant I've gone to. The food was not fresh or appetizing. It was bland and overpriced. I actually lost my appetite before I was full. The busser asked if we needed boxes while we were still eating. It was rude and they weren't even busy.  At the very least, I can tell you that their facility appeared to be clean and their iced coffee was decent, but not strong. Overall, I would never come to eat here again. I'd rather eat Top Ramen. At least it has flavor.

TeMCSU5HIOZU4jD2I35HFA.text: How do you eat family style and get charge $6 when ask for rice? Unbelievable!! I can see if I asked for more rice but this wasn't the case. Will not return

n0Iqx5G4vynfc-dcsbOL1w.text: Food is always good here, service isn't bad. It's always busy so it takes a while to get seated on a busy day. Come here often and I also order to go and the food is always ready on time.

qkShJGQzlwtaMVJXkTuw5A.text: Place is spacious.  Needs to be though since there are so many grubbers.  No wonder they're open 24 hours.  Probably the fanciest looking Pho Noodle house I've been to.  There's an aquarium plus this section against the wall that almost looks like a greenhouse without the plastic coverings.  Then the wall works...  it's a WOW!  The interior decorating is attractive Asian art.  I couldn't help staring at their money tree while waiting to be seated.  So there is a plant called a money tree.  But this restaurant had like folded money art hanging from plant trees.  I believe that is some symbol for prosperity of their business.  That is actually True; evident in the numerous people waiting, the well kept well designed interior.  We had about a 15 minute wait, but when we were seated I saw several open tables toward the back.  Not sure what was going on with their table seating management cuz there were plenty people standing to wait.  Perhaps they lack servers as well and didn't have the manpower.    Except that our food came out pretty quick.  After being seated and already eating, I can see the activity going on was fast paced.  The kitchen was full staffed it seems.  Our food was great nothing wrong with presentation, or overcooked or blandness.  I just didn't like all the tendons in my soup.  I swear too our server would drop off food, very short or no interaction.  Only announced what the order was, set it down, and disappeared.  I get it they're extremely high volume.  But I'd like to be able to comment oh kind, friendly, or patient whatever... not enough interaction to mention.  The menu had great selections too for pho, rice plates, appetizers... A fast meal, good food, nice set up.  Just enjoy it for what you're there for - to eat.

7JQHdMu5-1eamiG30sxHjw.text: Whenever I'm in Vegas, I must make a stop (or multiple) stops here! It's 24 hrs and not far at all from the strip with an Uber ride away. The chicken is their claim to fame along with the yellow rice. The pho is decent and you will definitely find something amongst the diversity in the menu. The waiters are all very friendly and it feels like home. A pho real gem in Vegas! A pho sure to return spot!

Mkd0S2nMHaxz5gM-gxUiSg.text: It is so awesome to know this place is 24 hours.  If we had a Pho place that opens 24 hours in St. Louis, I probably would never get a hangover.    For our appetizers, we got the fresh springs rolls, Kim Long fried egg rolls, Vietnamese crepe.  All appetizers were perfect! This is the first Vietnamese place I've been to that doesn't have Com Dac Biet, but it was okay because instead I got their Charbroiled Shrimp & Pork which was even better than any Com Dac Biet I've ever had.  YUMMY!  Definitely recommended.  Sadly, the food was better than any other Vegas strip hotel foods we had.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YGNn6dmoZ4MqvumTmLkazw.text: This place is pretty much the staple every time we come to Vegas. It's usually the last place we eat before heading home. I think, for us, it's a chance to get some comfort food at a pretty affordable price before the long drive.   You can never go wrong with any of the food here. In particular their noodle dishes are solid choices. I usually order their beef chow fun and fills the stomach with genuine Asian goodness.

So7pRHdMPk7Dhq2cFeru3w.text: 1 star due to several reasons First - Bad services ever.  Tip - They asked for Tip???? Food - C+ / B range Attitute: negative First time and also my last time

49tEQeGmMjGmsW5i40iAAA.text: first thing first is all the negative comments about this restaurant is completely True.   It's only getting a one star rating because of being seated was quick and I didn't have to wait long especially coming in with a party of 6. I had dined here with my son , hubs , & the in laws three of us order their pho I forgot which one but I got the pho ga (chicken pho) since I was craving for it . My son got com tam which is pork chop with rice and veggies and an egg cake that came along with it while the SIL order their house special fried rice and the hub got the 'bird nest'. As we were waiting for the food all I could think about is being able to enjoy my broth and dipping my chicken into the fish sauce but as soon as I got my food I was very shocked . What the hell is this ?! My pho looked so weird .. the broth was okay .. the noodle tasted like some cheap noodle brand and the chicken was chicken breast ... what the hell ??? seriously ?!! Pho kim long you guys couldn't even throw in the other pieces of meat ?? Chicken is so cheap yet you guys charge so much for freaking chicken breast that was so damn dried ?!?! also they threw in red onion for my pho which was really weird .. I've been to many different pho restaurant and seeing that just caught me off guard. My sons food came out to be beef instead of pork chops but he didn't care because he thought it tasted good besides his egg cake which had no flavor to it even though he had extra fish sauce to dip it in. The FIL didn't care much cause he was too hungry so he ended up finishing his meal while the MIL barely touched her bowl . The hubs order looked like a bird took a crap on it while everything was just thrown on and it was super soggy when it's suppose to be crunchy and had one piece of beef along with some chicken breast meat lolol . The SIL fried rice was so plain when it was suppose to be their house special to the point she had to add so much soy sauce for flavor lol . The food was just so bad in general and so expensive.. I don't mind paying for quality food but in this case it was not worth it at all!   Lastly , when it was time to pay the bill the waiter had the nerves to come and ask which part of the meal did we want to pay gratuity for like serious ?! Who does that ?!?!   Never again will I ever dine here , I highly suggested everyone not to either I don't know how this place is surviving maybe it's because they're open late and everyone whose drunk comes here thinking it's good ? who knows . NEVER AGAIN

ClccYp29GT2wMNUTgTWmbQ.text: We're always stopping here for dinner on the way to Colorado. Fast and good service delicious food always open We love it here.

joHK_YQOjHSj2mIrXNYO0g.text: One of favorite restaurants to visit in Vegas. I love their vermicelli dishes I think it's #28 on the menu. The flavor is so good and I'll be back again every time I'm in Vegas for lunch or dinner.

oAePNbpbqXOe8K_ABaIYgA.text: Worst service ever.  There was no customers and two servers seems like they don't want to working at all.

rpTg88qKw2znCGaYoEO3lg.text: If I can give this place a negative star I would! Bad service, the staff are very unfriendly. Food isn't good. Parents wanted some Asian food so we stop by here. Wrong choice and will NEVER return again! Taking my business elsewhere!

YYSX0wjVfNdyXfwYoLFmBw.text: Garbage service during late night. Demand tip. Came in on a Sunday night and never gave me my change. 40 dollars on a 23 dollar tab. No change? Cmon buddy. Terrible service. Nobody came to check up on us. Had to wave down a busser to get some. Pho is great tho

Ol_L8KkA9qpc2WG9k1gZlQ.text: If I could give them 3.5 then I would, but Yelp just doesn't let me. This is an update: For a while, we always suffered from a terrible headache after we had pho. One time we asked if they put MSG in their food, they confirmed they do. So, be careful if you are sensitive to MSG like us. The service isn't as good, but I expect that. They never really come back to fill up our waters, sometimes they just drop the check on the table when we haven't even gone through half of the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No. 16. Pho tai nam, rare steak and well done. Too bad they don&#39;t have tripe :(

s5uJ_E9ztUFtW5V_0odalQ.text: This place is potent as fuck!   You could smell the place from your car a mile away. Ok, yeah, that's just a mild exaggeration on my part, but whatever. You leave the place leaving with the smell of Pho on you, but then again, I love pho so that's really not a problem.  The food was great and came out quickly, which is the best thing after drinking and clubbing at 5am and walking around in the cold.   If I have to be honest, the main reason why I even wanted to try the place was because of the name. I'd go anywhere where the name is a sexual pun...or if this was just a Vietnamese name and it was done without any bit of irony, then my apologies... Other wise, pho kim long? Yes please!

kE8zFYkwDNVPOfP4OGjC-Q.text: Time for an update. It's been over a year since my last PKL review.  Popped in here last night with some friends after a big night out on the strip.   Last time, I made mention of the broth because I didn't think it was as flavorful as Pho joints in LA.
