The inside of the restaurant is pretty spacious and better looking than the outside... which isn't impressive and the parking is frustrating because of the extremely narrow parking lot (more like a parking strip).  I usually order #13 steak & brisket noodle soup.  Their meals are decent.  Not great, but still pretty good.

NzhZJR9zrur4IEwo6X-_xQ.text: So in the Philippines --- it's called Bulalo --- late night soup for drunken debaucherous nights-no noodles --- eat with rice.  In Japan it's Ramen that  makes Cup O noodles tremble in fear. Vietnam... Pho. Yea not FO....FA A long long way to RUN!  But Pho Kim Long I'll run here any day. It's just fun to hang out and eat. It's kinda loud with the bustle of all the asian community hanging out and enjoying or celebrating the food. I just wanna eat it....They have Beef or Chicken pho. I love variety. I always get the beef pho with the thin sliced brisket and the part that's been boiled down for hours. I also like the fried eggplant. Mmmm with big ole garlic chunks. OH and if you haven't had it --- the bbq pork chops. Mmmm with rice. Ohhhh yea and the fried rice there rocks....Crap...I'm hungry....I feel like pho kim....pho kim long time....mwahahaha

Tlv3xMAhzR3woJsAVLqGTA.text: Pho Kim Long is good.  If you are going to Pho Kim Long you need to drive off the strip.  It takes about 20 minutes to Pho Kim Long.  There is no pho king here.  Its just ok.  I've had better phos.  The pho kim long broth was warm and not sticky.  I prefer mine a little more salty and less bitter.  There is a pho shizzle down the street but i wanted pho kim long.    I don't think I will be back to pho kim long any time soon.

3lHqD0uxqZXeZB7MNa3hFA.text: I decided to get out of my normal routine of going to Pho Saigon 8 and decided to try a new place. Boy, was I PISSED! At first, i saw that it was packed with Asians (good sign, right?). Whatever they were eating must not have been pho, because the broth sucked. It was this cloudy brown water with very little meat. I felt like I was being ripped off. I actually left angry because I could have gone to Saigon 8 like I originally wanted to.

i2RYr2-rxhSUWkARiaWcWw.text: Decent food, nothing spectacular. Service is so-so, like any other chinese restaurant. We had about 10 different dishes, everything was ok and no after-the-fact rections so I guess that's a plus :) Definitely decent asian food in Vegas.

r-0sVkVsBK15eub7g_n4vQ.text: Popular place and pretty much anything on the menu for the picky person...

J_7KhJ6LUS63KQbmvnwiqw.text: For a place that is open 24-hours, this place actually serves up some pretty delicious chinese/vietnamese grub (even when you are sober and eating it for lunch). Pretty good pho tai, can't complain. My lunch buddies enjoyed their grilled chicken over rice and chicken porridge dishes as well. Decent food, good prices, open all night. And come on.. the name of this place is just... fun to say. Pho-kim-long time, baby!!

35UFCa-qlUz2H3oJV0BMpg.text: best pho spot off the strip in vegas. kinda ghetto but hey if you eat pho at a spot thats not ghetto you're not eating legit pho my friend. pho tai is the go to meal along with egg rolls and spring rolls. great for a pick me up after a long night of drinking and debauchery in vegas.

nXJjD8yxb4e9TkoMT4owPw.text: Me and la familia ate here 3 times over my 3 nights stay over christmas ( i think i wont be missing pho for a good couple of months). I lovee the pho soup. And i heard the entrees are pretty damn good too, especially the clams and oysters. The only reasons for the 4 stars are the service and the ventilation. I always come out smelling like pho, which i dont like. I like my hair to smell flowery, u know?

Tz85t7CYpn5EtdIveuaxHw.text: Well, where do I begin. Pains me to even ponder it, but the tale needs to be told.  Over the ages during my travels, Pho Kim Long has always been at the pinnacle of my destination. I will admit, it always satisfied the cravings of hunger and thirst in any direction I saw fit. From the delicious boba filled smoothies all the way down to the crab rangoons. Pho had it all. Seasoned rice young men and women dear for? Check. Charbroiled meats of the finest qualities? Check. Tap water with the temperature colder than the iceberg that sunk the titanic? CHECK. CHECK. CHECK. And boy, I would stand by this statement for years. My travels have never betrayed me. Until now.  Over the years, I would assume, one would come accustomed to the fine delicacies Pho Kim Long had to offer. However, one could also come to recognize an anomaly, a pattern if you will... if ONE were so inclined to look... that is. I come before you now because I believe I have cracked the code with Pho Kim Long after all these years. I'd be much more frustrated myself if I wasn't so god damn impressed by it. Over years of observation, my research can be concluded as their technique betrays us long before the quality of their food.  At Pho they will serve you, get you your food as quick as possible, and once your sustenance arrives (hopefully all of it, at once), you're forgotten. Betrayed. Left behind, with no one to tell your tale. The tale of a  man or women served the finest beverages and cuisines, only to never be heard from again. This is Pho Kim Longs practice. Their establishment runs off the assumptions of those dining in, and this is such a practice that may satisfy only the hungry, but not the ones weary from long travels such as myself. We seek more than just satiation. We look for the service of refilled iceberg sinking cold water every chance we get, but instead it never comes. The story is even more disheartening when you can see a tray absolutely stacked with those waters you lusted so long for to begin with. I couldn't understand Pho's reasoning for this, as water, is "essential to life" and the prime of a servants responsibilities.   But if you want this story to stop at the water, I'm afraid it just doesn't. My time before this had their famous wings containing the pinkest of meats I've ever sawed. And as I've said from the beginning, it pains me a great deal as I have looked upon my travels for years and with ease and optimism as Pho had always been the tip of the iceberg that would quench my thirst and satisfy all hopes and my every demands. But it just isn't there anymore. You're served and then forgotten. I will spare you the finer details, as I believe you just aren't ready to digest them. When your last few visits aren't as pleasant as you remember, you will reflect back on this review and analyze what you thought Pho was all these years, and how soon will be a distant memory.  In loving memory of Pho Kim Long. "Satisfied, but forgotten"

rtyeRLHVSFDJetpXc1swug.text: Pretty darn good Pho. We come here when we want to eat late. They are usually pretty busy but super accommodating. Always friendly! I always get the vegan Pho Chay with fried tofu. It's always super fresh and tasty. I think the only food item I wasn't very impressed with was the spring rolls. They are stuffed with a bunch of flavorless iceberg lettuce. If you are looking for a good veggie pho, I definitely recommend this place.

LtGUUajf9aTYFgm8_lqIhw.text: Pho was okay not that great... soup was warm not hot enough and noodles seem to be cooked long before so it's dried. This restaurant pho  doesn't taste like authentic Vietnamese pho really bl. Beware cashier force you to tip 15,20,25% he will write it in for you.

QA57xZXZBvtHXXt2cbyyRw.text: Food was so bad and I had the worst services. I had one to go dish and had too wait for almost one hour. Restaurant manager was rude. I will never go back

JCaQA13qn04WbSMnN0lraQ.text: I went really late and it was a pretty good place not too busy food quality was pretty damn good I can say that this is one of the best places to go after long night of drinking if you got the beer munchies. I work as a driver and have taken a lot of people here at night. A really cool place to go if you want to just hang out with a friend. Wasn't much of a fan of the Boba tea but the Mongolian beef was pretty damn good not too crazy and prices and the Pho  pretty freaking delicious I literally watch the meat cook in front of me when it was served. They have a lot of menu options and it's kind a hard to choose from what you want but they keep the menu pretty simple enough to order what you might be craving. I would give it a five stars but I'm only going to give it for due to the server is not checking up on me to see if I want to refill I would give it a five stars but I'm only going to give it for due to the servers not checking up on me to see if I wanted arefill.

oU8k03Yhb7FyKSgAJA7Tng.text: My stomach hurts so bad as I write this review, I am definitely torching this place.   This place is terrible! My whole family got sick after eating here. As I lay here feeling full of regret and in disbelief of how disgusting our dinner was here, my stomach is extra tender and sore and my mouth is numb and dehydrated.   I'm full Vietnamese and this place is such a huge embarrassment and a disgrace to real authentic Vietnamese food.   First offense - the goi cuon (shrimp and pork spring rolls/ summer rolls) were tiny and barely had any filling inside. A piece of lettuce, a tiny bit of noodles, a sliver of meat and 3 slivers of shrimp. Oh, and that so called dipping sauce was so gross! Super watered down. What a ripoff.   Second offense - Msg was never really an issue for me and it never really caused me any problems, until I ate here. Also, my uncle is really sensitive to it and he had a lot of issues with his pho. He didn't drink any of his pho broth because it had too much MSG and by the end of dinner he started to feel sick.   Third offense - the nuoc cham (fish sauce/dipping sauce) was so watered down, that I ended up asking them for 3 bowls for my meal - but even 3 bowls was not enough and I finally gave up. It was disgustingly bland. I was pretty much pouring sugar water onto my rice.   Fourth offense - my pork chop was dry and the marinade was bland. The charring on the pork chop tasted artificial.   Fifth offense - our tongue is all sorts of numb and shriveled up after eating here. I guess MSG does that to you. We're extremely weak, thirsty and dehydrated now.   Sixth offense - the chow fun beef noodles in gravy (hu tieu xao bo) was so unappetizing and unappealing, I was in disbelief they served it to us. They overcooked the chow fun noodles so they broke up into a billion of small pieces when you tried to pick them up with chopsticks, the gravy was all watery and goopy. It was not tasty at all.   With so many options in Vegas to get Vietnamese food late, this place is not one of them.

LSfwogh6uDGXcNi9dDzjhQ.text: I recently went here with my gf.  Now, i DO NOT like veitnamese food cause they put fish sauce on everything! ON EVERYTHING!!  Anywho, I was enjoying my pho for the first time but couldnt enjoy it for long cause my gf who is KOREAN starts telling the vietnamese waitress that the VIETNAMESE iced coffee does not taste like it should and tasted mediciney...her explanation for her expertise over the veitnamese waitress and chefs were that she has had many before and it was not like it.   now Mind you the key word in Vietnamese iced coffee is VIETNAMESE! The food is actually authentic.  Anyways to combat my girlfriend's 3 star review i give this place 5 stars!!

EbHVa5ShbUcARcDN4wL94A.text: The place is an eat and run kind of place. It is very busy and loud. The tables and chairs are basic. It's not really conducive to enjoying your food and catching up with your friends lives or what not. We ordered pho #13 and #14, calamari salt and pepper (not the Italian style), and spring rolls. Good inexpensive food that can fill you up, no problem. Wait time is a bit long (thus the 4 stars) considering we were there late. Overall, good experience.

9_yHP0DkaEnDdznGUo8IMw.text: Slow service and they charged us special iced cafe for getting the wrong hot coffee wrong. Rude server, too.   I dont even want to say more.

9b_9yN2zLjRbg48SyvCUKw.text: The food is good but the service is subpar. We waited quite awhile before someone checked in with our table to take our order. Our waiter seemed like he didn't want to be at work serving anyone. He didn't bring my Thai tea until I asked for it when he was walking by and he never checked on the table to see if we needed anything such as water (which 2 of our glasses were empty). I'm a pretty patient person, I understand places in Vegas can get busy, but it's not hard to quickly check-in with your table and see how they're doing. While the service wasn't great, the food was still good enough that I'll return again only if a group of friends want to go here, but it wouldn't be my top pick.

_mRifX2VRl2Bo-zMb1of8A.text: Food and waiters are excellent however  the People on the registers are unprofessional  !!! They are  rude and ALWAYS in a bad mood they demand tips and if you tell them you  left it on the table they stop and check to see if its True ...  it used to be a great place to eat after a night of drinking or after work but now is just awful management.. WE ARE NEVER COMING BACK !!!! -1 star for poor management skills

_IqsUj14uEORIz8PrP6BsQ.text: Yummyyyy!!! Awesome food, fast service, nice people, totally worth the money and the time! Best asian food in town!

We weren't greeted from the beginning and it wasn't even that busy. We never saw a single smile from the servers and felt like we were being rushed to order and eat. EJoAGfefOqvei3Jh5D2rkQ.text: My family & i went for brunch. We were seated right away. The service was fast but the staff just isn't friendly. oCMZPe-Hbbj84iyv91AziA.text: We came here once before and had the spring rolls for starters, then the combo pho and bahn bo heu noodle bowls.  It was pretty good. Not 5 stars, but definitely 4.  This time, the broth wasn't as good as we remembered and the noodles were overcooked and soft. Also, the peanut sauce for the spring rolls was so sweet that it was like dipping into candy.  We also ordered the three-colored bean dessert. Don't order this fraudulent junk. It comes in a tiny little cup and doesn't look anything like the picture.  It's mostly ice with some condensed milk and a few sweet beans and some tiny shreds of jelly. It's a complete ripoff at $3.75.  Needless to say, we won't be coming back to this place.

5djv_-VWWyo6l8MOysC9vg.text: This place had a cute setting and it was huge!  didn't think it would be that big until I went inside.    the pho here was okay.  I wasn't impressed.  I like the other pho place more, but I don't remember the name.  I also got to try their bun bo hue and didn't really like it either.  overall, it's okay but I've had better  ----------------------------------------- UPDATE: 02.08.16  it was actually better when I came here this time.  I had a bit of pho and the broth seemed to be better.  I don't know if they changed it or it varies from day to day.  I also had the mi xao dong.  it was good but I take forever to eat and the noodles got soggy.  if you're a slow eater like me, get the sauce on the side. ------------------------------------------- UPDATE: 03.21.16  I got the mi xao dong beef again and got the sauce on the side.  I posted a pic of it.  I super recommend doing this!  My noodles stayed crunchy and since the sauce is together in a glass bowl, it stayed hot.  So that was even better. 8nzESS-UaeCG6lbA8KDutg.text: I can't believe it has taken me so many years to get around to reviewing Pho Kim Long! This was the original pho place for me and my group of friends in Vegas. It was really cool for a while to replace this place with newer, hipper places but the truth remains: this is the go to at 2AM on a cold winter night! That's the latest I have come here, though. I have heard that anything between 3AM - 5AM is hell. The lines are long, all the customers are people that go clubbing, and the atmosphere sucks. I can't speak to that, it's just what I heard! I'll stick with my latest being at 2AM, thanks.   I don't wander when at Pho Kim Long. No experimenting for me! I know what I like from this place and I get pho tai with spring rolls and water. Boring? Predictable? Maybe! I'm okay with that, Phi Kim Long is a staple not an adventure.

4Yb9R72HhUUHGxqL5CREfA.text: Very good oxtail pho. Will absolutely rival those in Westminster CA. Definitely will come back if I'm in the area.

XklfTiiMMjpuXzw6tkxnsw.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and was intimidated by the large crowd waiting outside. My friends said that they just HAD to have Pho and that this place was worth the wait so I angrily agreed.  Went to get iced coffee from the Lee's Sandwiches next door, picked up some bread from a nearby bakery, and then we were called to sit down. To my surprise, the wait was only around 20 minutes.  After placing our order, the drinks and food came out almost instantly; as in, everything we ordered was on the table within 5 minutes. I have never had my food come out that fast, but the hangry beast inside of me did not have time to question why or to be skeptical.   I ordered Pho Tai and egg rolls. They both were delicious and quite satisfying. After adding lemon to my Pho Tai, the broth was flavored perfectly to my liking.  The prices are reasonable, the service is lacking but adequate - what you would expect from a very crowded Pho place, but the food comes out quickly and tastes great. I will be back if I ever am in Vegas and in dire need of a good Pho restaurant.

JW9IedcN6rtZy-aOcV4iLQ.text: This place is pretty awesome. The honey garlic pork chops are highly recommended. We also got the pan fried noodles and wonton egg noodle soup. My favorite dish was the chicken and egg roll vermicelli! Took off one star for service. I had to get my own water...twice. Overall pretty decent food.

BtsJqgbrvtLUi-jXyaLucA.text: Smelled like they wiped all their tables with dirty smelly rags... I can't eat in these conditions.

uVaLXnC21H5HPTJPo_VCkQ.text: Found this pho place on yelp with good ratings so my family and I decided to go try after arriving in Vegas late night from the east coast.   Went there after midnight and there were a decent amount of customers. The appearance on the inside looks very nice. Very comfortable place to sit down and have a nice meal. We got to sit next to one of their two aquarium. We enjoyed the company of the fishes.   Now for the food part. We got their pho, bum bo hue, this beef with rice, and wonton noodle soup. Overall they were good, but not to the point that made us go "wow". We had much better Viet/Chinese food, but the service+ environment makes up for it. The best part though was their Thai tea. THE BEST I had so far after trying many places that serves this beverage.   Finally, it was nice that they open 24/7. I read a lot of yelpers liking pho for hangovers. But as a person who isn't big on drinking, it it's still nice to know there is a nice pho restaurant that will serve well any time of the day. Can't go wrong with this place.

-a4Gx7UH7LO2At-0RHczaw.text: This is the best pho in town.  I've tried others but I'm always disappointed.  Now I just come here.

otn8b08BHeNEiV1Wp6PcLw.text: Very nice decor when you get inside. They say they are trying to remodel every two years. You can't go wrong with picking this restaurant if you're craving Asian food and can't pick between soup, noodles, or stir fried. They have a variety of food. All good food, but it seems like the prices of the food go up every year. The service isn't consistent. I come here maybe every other week for lunch and/or dinner. Sometimes the service is quick and on point. They kind of rush you so the next group of people can sit down, though. But, if the wait is 15-20 minutes long, at least let us sit down and enjoy our food for that long. Other times, even if business is slow, the service is slow and poor. Every time I've gone, my food always comes before my drink surely. My drink seems to always come when I'm half way done with my food whether I order a smoothie, tea, specialty drink, or coffee.

ARY4jMXMEmP6WgIrE46vIA.text: Best place for late night/early morning vegas dining. I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered here. Highly recommend the fried calamari and of course the PHo.

BMUCSUtXZyTwQDnNfplG9w.text: This is the second time I have visited here this week. I went on a Thursday and today. If someone asked me to recommend a Vietnamese restaurant, I would definitely say this place. The service was very quick and professional, and our server was attentive to our needs and very polite. I enjoyed the food.

JpmxT5FvLeCnw6wBpbevPA.text: You can't go wrong with the Pho here. Or any of the other dishes, as far as I'm aware, but the Pho is what's really stand out. The prices are very reasonable and being open 24 hours is wonderful in Las Vegas. This is a go to spot for late night. The only problem is that when the restaurant is busy, they can be understaffed, so you might have to wait for a table and the service will not be as great as one would like. But, considering the food and price, this is a minor complaint.

ZUc2t33ui94kaewx7MBFpw.text: If you come here, be prepared to flag the workers here if you want to be served (on a busy night)  OPEN LATE :) great for hang overs, especially in Vegas..  The name says it all... To funny...  F- HIM LONG!!

nYgqW2iFFgo0NTgbueWS0Q.text: Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio  For Thanksgiving dinner, the fam decided we had enough of the buffets and went traditional.  My mom remembered coming here a couple years back and had to come back here for dinner.  (With a myriad of choices, she chose this place!)  Rightfully so, the place was packed and bustling when we entered!  Now, coming from California and the east coast, I have had the extremes of great and worst Vietnamese food.  However, here, they fortunately were in the middle.  I didn't order the pho (I know, bad Vietnamese girl!); rather, another  traditional favorite, I ordered the Vermicelli noodes with pork and egg rolls (translated from above; don't be too impressed, that's the extent of my writing in Vietnamese: just foods!)   :)  It was good--all the fixings of lettuce, mint and basic with bean sprouts and cucumbers.  I enjoyed the prompt service there as well.  The staff isn't all Vietnamese, but they were friendly and speedy. :)  Downside, I think they truly specialize in just Pho, but created at 'Vietnamese diner' style menu, meaning there was just about every Vietnamese dish on the menu and included some Thai dishes.  I don't judge a place for the variety, but it does make me ponder...  Last unfortunate note, the chili container had LOTS of MOLD buildup...Pho Kim Long, please check up on that stuff!  Don't want to see you closed down because of poor handling of foods...  If I come back to town, I may dismiss this place; while it is ingrained in my memory for Thanksgiving dinner, it's not ingrained in my memory for stellar Viet food.

aKZpGk4kGTVuGgOv_1yMoQ.text: We placed a to go order and they left out one of entrees.  Once we realized when we were home and called them, they said there's nothing they can do.  No refund, nothing.  Very shady.

When we walked they told us the AC was broke and they had some smalls fans set up on the floor. We ordered the Pho, they only have one size ... extra large bowl. The soup was kinda watered down and the meat was a little chewy and a ton of noodles. We went here only because someone from California recommended this place to us...

IQhHkfbEeGse3uJ-h4FOuw.text: Nice place for a Vietnamese Restaurant near the Las Vegas strip. The service is fast and when I mention fast, they're very fast. They take your orders, your order arrives shortly after, and they pick up your bowls after you're done eating. I appreciate the speedy service, but I think they need to slow down a bit so they can catch a breather and for us to take our time to enjoy our food. If you like fast service at a nice restaurant, this place is for you. I would definitely come back to Pho Kim Long as my choice of Pho for the next time I go to Vegas.

0Ek1KqajC8G7MC6OqiS0Ow.text: Every time coming to Vegas and want a good Vietnam foods, this is a place to go to.  Portion is good and price is reasonable. They open 24 hours.. The place is clean too. BUT today, one of the young server/busboy, 17 yo perhaps... Had an attitude!!!  U can clean the table, but there's no law u cannot sitdown while u wiping the table, especially when the other server told me its ok to sit... Overall I like this place.

uVEBaBiC9WNKqYXfQJ9k1Q.text: Pho Kim Long my relationship with you has been great in the past, but on my recent trip something was different, you've changed and I don't think its for the better.  In the past I enjoyed super fast service and everything seemed to be running like a well oiled machine.  On the night I last tasted their delicious pho the machine had thrown a gear, and was stumbling on at 76% efficiency.    I would be in the wrong to rate this restaurant on one experience, but I feel that this restaurant has been going in a bad direction for a little while now, and tonight was the culmination of its backwards inertia.  Although the food in not in question as I think its still great tasting and fairly cheap for what you get.  Service counts, and because its never been stellar per say (the waiters are quick but not friendly), any small change (like to speed lets say) can turn a great place, to just an ok place.  One thing I noticed was the overall disconnect from the workers and front of the house management.  The place wasn't that busy and we still had to put our name on a list to be seated for some reason.  In the past this place would be packed to the gills and we would be seated right away, no problem.  Tonight we waited to be seated for 15 minutes even when it was relatively empty.  This seemed to make the workers who were standing around looking helpless and angry.  At one point I could see them pointing and talking about the host, and probably not in a good way.  Once we did get seated the food did take a little bit longer to come out mostly, I believe, because they were busy talking about the host.    When the food did come it was great as usual, and in all truth is actually one of Vegas's great late night eats.  Now I understand you have to take a place based on what it is, and appreciate that.  What is Pho Kim Long?  Well it's great Pho when you're out late on a Vegas night.  If you keep that in the forefront of your mind, you will enjoy it and forget about its faults.   However if you are taking this eating establishment as a whole, as I am trying to right now, then its shortcomings become apparent.  The truth is Vegas does have a ton of Pho restaurants some with better tasting Pho, and others with better service.  In the end you can call Pho Kim Long average with room for improvement, and you would be fair in saying that.   Will I go back again most defiantly, but I will go there with the understanding that "it is what it is".

plOw1zi5H505NMvMruaHxg.text: Very disappointed!! One of the worst service i ever experience. So incomplete n rude waiters

vly6FgsGOcH8d9V6anNMQQ.text: Last night was my first time having to wait for a table but bringing someone who has never had pho made it worth it.   I also enjoy their pad thai which is a generous portion like most of their dishes.

oyDUN361iMLymlJrNvTpnw.text: I've been going to this place for about 8 years.The food is bomb.The first time I came here we got very slow service but we left a good tip so ever since then we always got very good service.However I went last night with my boyfriend and our server was super rude.At first he made a few subtle sexist jokes.No big deal.(I wore a maxi dress with a slit on the side)He looked me up and down and said that where he's from the woman have to be covered head to toe in robes and weren't allowed to look men in the eyes unless they were married to them and that if a woman makes eye contact they slap them and call them b*****.We finished our meal and asked for the check and he jokingly said "You're paying for it right?Since all you woman in this country want equal rights you can pay for dinner".Not to get into politics I do agree with him that woman and men should be able to take turns paying for things but he didn't have to throw it in my face.

REr0rvy8NBWVd4bN8DiO_w.text: We came to check out Chinatown as is our tradition everytime we travel so we asked the Cab driver to take us there and he dropped us off where the arches were and we were sorely disappointed as all the restaurants in that square did not have any rating higher than 3 stars and me being an avid Yelper was not ready to settle for less. Once again due to a lack of public transport in that area and with the wifey famished things began to get desperate and I was fighting for my survival! Suddenly like out of the mist came these 4 young Vietnamese (to me they appeared to be 4 angels) and the wifey followed them into this joint after chatting with them briefly.  I had no time to Yelp this place and my Yelps were drowned with the sounds of my wifeys hunger pangs. I looked around and saw only Vietnamese faces all deeply engrossed in their meals and as no one was texting I knew we hit paydirt! It took a few minutes for our waitress to warm up to us too rather degraggled appearing starving folks but once she did she was very helpful. The wifey ordered the Rice with Grilled Pork and I ordered the Beef pho minus the tendons and we both quietly put our iphones down and were immersed into our dishes!  On finishing one of the best Vietnamese meals we have had in a while I wifey spotted the table next to ours having a Boba and fond memories of our dearest son Kev she had a Mango Boba  in his honour as he did not make the trip with us! I would definitely recommend this place to fellow Yelpers as it seems only the locals know about this place off the Strip!

NpV3mdI6KDZiBrgHDZl41Q.text: Wooooooweee.. Pho Kim Long has quickly become one of my most frequently visited places during a Vegas trip.  Why is that?  Convenience? Check Asian food? Check Good Asian food? Check 24-hour good Asian food? DING WE HAVE A WINNER!  That's right folks. 24 hours of Vietnamese goodness. What better way to ease that hang over or cure that headache with a hearty bowl of food and a side of crispy spring rolls.   I usually order my Pho Tai (rare beef Pho) or the beef or pork vermicelli/rice plates.  Reasonable prices paired with good and quick service, you've had me at Pho!  Lots of parking in the plaza lot, just make sure you drive into the correct one. Everything starts blending together if you are still feeling the night before.

AFAFbEfL9MVFdf2LqvCK6A.text: Great place to come for post-clubbing / hangover pho!  Personally, I'm not a fan of soupy noodle dishes (i.e. pho, udon, ramen, etc...I know bad Asian!) so I got the vermicelli bowl with grilled pork chop and egg rolls.  The marinated grilled pork chop was delicious.  I came here on a Saturday afternoon around 1p and didn't have to wait for a table.  The interior of PKL was once of the cleanest/nicest I've seen for a Vietnamese restaurant.

Everything was delicious and I love that portions are big enough to share or take home for leftovers.  I will say though the the water chestnuts in the egg drop soup threw me off.

6DzNJDHqygCRVAZTSKA8Aw.text: 24 hour pho place.  Check.  Besides that, I really can't say that much about Pho Kim Long.  The decor is nice and there is a cool fish tank that definitely brings this pho joint up a notch, but the pho itself is slightly over priced and not that amazing.  Maybe I am spoiled having lived so close to Westminster for so long.  I am not saying that this is bad pho at all, I just was not impressed.    The second thing that bothered me was that it took forever to be served and to get our food.  Usually pho only takes a few minutes to get everything in the bowl and then it is in your belly in no time.  I felt like this was the longest pho meal ever.  I probably won't be back anytime soon, unless I really really want pho and I can't find any other pho place to go to.  I expected more Pho Kim Long.  You let me down.

Today was my second time visiting this restaurant, and their speed of service, flavors, and beautiful decor have remained the same.  Their pricing and selection are pretty standard in regards to this type of casual dining restaurant.  I would dare to say that they could improve their quality of service in terms of their hospitality. I only say this because they seem in such a rush that they loose that piece a little, but not on a level that it merits you not checking it out!

Singapore noodles were divine, I did ask for pork and shrimp which I specified twice and they still left out the pork, hence the 3 stars instead of the 4 they deserved.

0LqpuTNeZk7VU3VBry0L9Q.text: If you're looking for the perfect spot to sober up after a night of club hopping or whatever in Vegas this is the perfect spot. This place offers plenty of seating for large parties. Service is fast and food is very delicious. At times there can be a wait and lines out the door but the wait goes by quickly. It is off strip and a slight drive depending where you are but it is a worthy bookmark to have on your list as an option.

zKkqNCE0o6CMcO6cw1WxUQ.text: Within close proximity of the strip and open 24/7, this place is great for recovering from a drunken stupor or hangover.  To start, I recommend the egg rolls and crab rangoon. Each order of egg rolls comes with 4 rolls, some lettuce, pickled carrots and daikon, and fish sauce. The egg rolls are piping hot and extra crispy. Wrap them around some lettuce, garnish with some of the pickled veggies, and dunk it in fish sauce.  The crab rangoon is surprisingly good. They're deep fried wontons filled with cream cheese and imitation crab. The wrapper on the wonton is one of the crispiest I've ever had. The filling is small but pretty tasty. You get the hot, melty, cheesy creaminess of the cream cheese mixed in with decent imitation crab. This is a great bite sized snack while you wait for your pho.  The pho here is satisfactory. The bowls are a bit small and the portions aren't stellar. The broth isn't as hearty or flavorful as you'd want it to be, but it's not bland. There's also a ton of fat in the broth, as evidenced by the copious amount of fat droplets floating around. The noodles are on the softer side, and there isn't the full complement of meats to choose from. I was a bit disappointed they didn't have fatty brisket. If you stick with the classic rare steak and you'll be okay. It's thinly sliced and super tender. Make sure you separate the pieces and swish them around in the broth for a bit to ensure they're cooked. The bowl is finished off with sliced red and white onions, as well as chopped green onions.  Service is friendly and very easy going. Everything we ordered came out quickly. Try to hang out within shouting distance of the main entrance so you don't miss them calling your name when your table is ready.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Rangoon
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho tai nam

tZFOrzftmxl8y9IO7O_gEw.text: My favorite pho place in Vegas, and it's usually pretty busy so I would recommend visiting outside of the lunch and dinner rush. The pho broth is incredibly flavorful, and my regular order is the brisket pho. However, my other favorite dish here besides the pho is their calamari. It's crispy, salted well and flavorful without it being too heavy. Would highly recommend for a lunch meal in Chinatown.

qhrYmF-j-fZjDkii5feNJQ.text: Best place to get pho to recover from Vegas! Prices are reasonable and the portions are quite large. I really enjoy their pho and my friends have had the bun bo hue and said it was pretty good.

5caU4_osB5tKvFMqfzG3HQ.text: Food is good but service is terrible! Came in around 10:30pm for takeout and my meal was $7.75 plus tax haha I gave the man a $20 and he gave me $10 back  and walked away fast.  No receipt or anything lol!!! Come here if you want the takeout guy to tip himself without you doing it!

HnxhOziHEm5li8xQNoeLTQ.text: Great food delicious but their customer service not good. Waitstaff does not take the time out to listen or give you service

_3rHDaVApV2q5jcKPpIT3w.text: What a weird but very catchy name. This place was recommended by many others so my friends and I went for lunch. Their eggrolls were very tasty. Very flavorful inside and crunchy outside. Their large pho was actually large. Good amount of meat inside and very flavorful soup. This place might be on our list of restaurants to go in Vegas if anyone is drunk. One of the best pho restaurants for me so far

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H250PYBm_rdHaf3-xV8AYQ.text: Oi Oi just the name itself deserves 3 stars lol I'm going to pho Kim long tonight! Actually I went to pho Kim long 2 days in a row...  The menu is pretty extensive, and I'm sure you can find something that will tickle your fancy. Of course people go there expecting to have pho, but I didn't feel like it that day so I ordered their pan fried noodles.   The Pan fried noodles were Sooooo good! They used thin egg noodles and made them really crispy. The house special one tasted better than the seafood one. The gravy was a bit darker, maybe they used beef broth. The house special had beef, seafood, chicken, and the seafood just had seafood like squid, shrimp, imitation crab and surprisingly fish fillet! Egg rolls were just OK. Not super hot and crispy. The pho was decent but nothin special id say.   The restaurant is big and can accommodate a party of at least 10 people with their big round tables. There can be a wait and you'll need to put your name on the sign in sheet.   Plan a trip to pho Kim long. You won't regret it ;-)

7pM7RCDDZhGTKJwiAXsGXA.text: Not gonna lie I love coming to this place every time I come to vegas but this time they only gave me half the portion or not even half.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZhQioEJDeOBXheokVSEDFw.text: One of the only pho places I find my self going to consistently. Come early because you usually have to wait to be seated, some days up to an hour. Once seated though they get the food out right away! I love the pho, its definitely grand with the rare steak. The amount of food you get in one bowl is insane, it fills me up incredibly well and it takes quite a bit to fill me up. Really only come here for the pho so can't comment on other aspects of the menu but I must say the pho is cheap and good. Open 24 hours so after a late night on the strip its nice to get your fix of pho before going to bed.

AyN9v2G5VGEH1IMQLV9h2Q.text: No Pho place like this one. This place is always full. You have to make line but it's worth it. They are opening a second location in Town Square. Can't wait.

UtlfyZ-kixUvJyw7AH4naA.text: I wanted to come here for a long time but there is always a line. I came during the day mid week and was seated right away. Our server came right over with a menu and waters for the table.  We decided on sharing some chicken lettuce wraps. These were nothing out of the ordinary and was a nice starter for two of us.  had the raw steak pho as my main coarse. Very flavorful broth and the right amount of your standards pho ingredients to add yourself to what you like. It was definitely worth trying but I wouldn't go out of my way or wait in a line to come back.

-TllLIW3uLNUfD-E1XvwcQ.text: Can't go wrong with 24 your pho! So close to the strip love how china town is right there! Get your Vietnamese food, Japanese food, Chinese food. Thai food also! Anyhow this spot is just what the doctor ordered after a night of partying!   I usually make it here once in every trip to Vegas. Morning night day, don't matter. They open.

mywzHKsLCcr-VZSD3zUvtA.text: First impressions : Line was out the door  we waited to be seated for an average of 5 minutes due to the crowd I taught it would be amazing    Im sorry but the #17 pho  was mediocre -the thin  filet was dry which kinda surprised me given it was floating in the broth - but your Vietnamese wall artifacts are beautifully displayed

dzPGDCsYcuZlMupX73xVMQ.text: Service was very attentive even though they were slammed. Food came out fast and was very tasty! I've never seen salt and pepper fried eggplant anywhere else and would come back again for this. Try it with a side of white rice topped with chili and soy sauce. ;) They also have lots of vegan options like vegan chow fun or vegan pho. My partner said the pho tai was tasty but the portions are small. Also bathrooms could use some attention! :3

5tRw_MQGeB8HvxaCFzbRzA.text: Our favorite restaurant to go to whenever we in Vegas. They can get pretty busy and you might have to wait a little but they serve the food fast, so you won't have to wait for too long. Love the Bun Bo Hu here!

S_Xd5hHd7Tct4saA0XnOOw.text: Best pho in town hands down. Make sure you ask for the beef balls if you want them. Very very packed though. Wait list at the door and there isn't a place to really wait for a table. Hard to get service because of it after you are seated . The pho is out of this world though so it's worth it. Vegan pho is amazing as well! Almost hard to choose between the two. 24 hours so it's a great way to end a long night. Spring rolls are also good. They have smoothies and Thai ice tea with boba as an option. The combination pho comes large by default, and it is a very generous portion! The small of definitely enough to fill you up if you choose the other options. Combination does not include beef balls unfortunately. VERY generous with beef.  Plenty of flavor in the broth. Just all around great pho.

JCZ5-lVLVlgeAecmQTuxYA.text: If ya like Pho, this is the place in Vegas. Broth is exceptional, service is excellent...def recommend

5IBiKLQmNovGE2jERpvNjQ.text: Good quality pho soup but price is slightly higher than other locations.  Clean and good service

t_cIIKNvT4Rn-gIlGgO_WA.text: RawChicken On New Year's Day  It was 2:30am, so we have decided to go to Pho Kim Long coz we were craving Pad Thai and Honey Shrimp Walnut. When we got there we have waited like 15 minutes for the seats, it was okay coz of the holiday. We ordered beverages and soups for the beginning and the rest was food. When they served the food all together, it was cold and the plate of shrimps was mixed with raw chicken which is very unacceptable and disgusting. We called the waiter to cancel or the orders and we ended up paying the beverages.  No one of them at least saying sorry about what happened.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9bQJ69mUl9gXSbPzBBx0gg.text: Yum! Been coming here since forever and it's pretty consistently yummy. There are some off times when the soup tastes too watery or is off in some other way, but that's a rare occasion.   I always always always order the pho and egg rolls. The broth is sooo on point and perfect for any type of upset stomach, and the egg rolls are pretty good too.   Their menu has gotten significantly bigger over the years- I should probably venture out and try other items haha this restaurant can get pretttyy darn busy sometimes and the parking lot isn't the greatest :( BUT! The wait is never too horrible and I feel the pho is worth it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggggggg rolls

k7qhBDg84f_j3Hkv1JFQZw.text: First time eating here! It's really good I love their service!! They are busy! But it's Worth it! And their Thai Tea! Just makes it even better! I would definitely be back again!! Thank you!!

M6Nmiitt6akQjtKqUjcmvQ.text: Pho is perfect for your hangover needs and late night cravings away from the strip. They're open 24/7!! The wait can get pretty busy here at night so just remember to write your name down on the clipboard as soon as you get through the door.   You can't go wrong with any of the pho selections, food comes out quickly and piping hot! My only complaint is that the broth isn't as clear as I like but that could also be because of the rare pieces of meat that the broth is poured over. Still, it's a solid place for pho in Vegas.

NfFxk3B1cvaMVAexjjzFuA.text: It's your 24/7 pho restaurant that's good for everything! Good when you have some pho craving and want to eat at 2 in the morning or coming from a club trying to sober up before going home.  Great for groups and family. This place is always packed from people that came from the strip trying to get their pho fix after a night of drinks and dancing. Although, it's always packed and the lines are long, the lines pretty go fast. People just come and eat and then leave. Service is pretty fast too without compromising the quality of food. Either you come here and eat or get food to go, it will surely delight your appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_f2EoeKgwOp6NFsLmE1KAw.text: Wow! Amazing fast service! Food delivered before we barely put the menus down! And fresh, hot and yummy!

VbLRtp-CZX8H8Sa0Vc2CJg.text: Customer service rate: 1  RUDE  Food: 8 PRETTY GOOD   My family and I stopped coming here after they told us we were required to tip, which was new, and then they announced out loud that we weren't tipping.   Tips depend on the customer service. Sometimes we don't tip a lot or at all because we felt they only came around once. Good luck trying to get a refill - you'll have to wave them down and if they stop, they'll make it seem like such a hassle to wait on you. And I've worked as waitress - I understand! There's a difference between being really busy so you're unfortunately unable to stop by tables often AND just not coming by or checking on you at all.   They never used to push the tip on customers and we freely gave tips with every meal. When my mother asked if they were serious about the tip requirement, the cashier then announced out loud to our waiter across the room and in front of the whole restaurant, "Table 15, NO TIP!"   It was so uncalled for. It's a shame because their food is pretty good, but it absolutely rubbed us so wrong that they force you to tip and if you don't, they announce it. It was just plain rude. Didn't expect them to treat longstanding customers that way. We have not gone back and are not going back!

xSs6_xVwwY-faOt1MO8Xpg.text: Came in late on a Saturday night, place was busy but we were sat quickly. This was my first time having pho and i absolutely loved it. Service was excellent, menu was a little hard to read. Boba smoothies were delicious as well we got the honeydew and taro. Would recommend trying!

aFV4apPEm5JqdaEiUqLiRQ.text: My girlfriend and I ALWAYS eat here when we visit Vegas.   Tonight I had an terrible experience from their manager/cashier.  Total bill was $19 for two bowls of Pho, +plus $3. We also ordered food to go, and the cashier insist I also give tip on that order.  It was the insisting part that made us upset... We felt we were getting hustled for tip money.   I guess I just have to laugh it off and give a 1 Star.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the cashier that will insist you to leave s tip when you order food-to-go.

DUbBbKqG97JYEviEn2BfRw.text: Good location good authentic Vietnamese food clean and good service is the big Restaurant. Open 24/7 food still kept their standard.  Good job!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Bo Hue

TJ8vMPIGNVwamyAJQPdg_g.text: The worse service ever  Took them an hour for a order I made over the phone  By the time I got my food  I was cold and the guy working the register was the worse  I will never dine here again  This space should really be call Dick's pho Kim

_oJqxi-nhRyjloypuSOgsA.text: Omg, the charbroiled  pork chop was so tender. I love this place. So many choices in the area for food and this is the place for yummy food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tender pork chop

-gFteKTouDwHXc3Zc5iJCQ.text: I LOVE This Place!!!! First time in Vegas for my bachelorette party! Of course everything is expensive. My squirrel friends and I were desperate for food. A Bartender at the MGM grand recommended this place. The food and service here is amazing!!!!!   My first time ordering Pho!! So yummy! I can't remember which one I had! But it was amazing!!! I also ordered spring rolls. My bill!!! Wicked cheap!! I'm going to stop here because I will return in 2017!!! So Too be continued  July 9th 2017 (I'm BACK AGAIN)  This year I brought my husband, the wait was about 15mins-30mins. After being seated we immediately knew what to order. **Side note** the staff moves quick here! You food will arrive in no time. It's no surprise we both ordered the #23. Vermicelli w/ Grilled Pork---however my husband decided to replace the noodles with rice (who does that) Anywho, everything was perfection!! This is the best place in China town! Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #23. Vermicelli w/ pork-one dish with and w/o rice

i_HVYhCoVbSRMi3OGONSMA.text: Great place, the food was very good and clean. The prices were affordable and the food came quickly right after I ordered. Every time I'm near that area I have to stop there and grab a bite.

3OqkYDlrNE-w_MLraOdbzw.text: Best Vietnamese in town! Pretty much anything on the menu is delish!! Even better that it's open 24/7 especially after a night of drinking "adult" beverages the pho is the perfect cure!!

4j2RuYYpQHuLUel3QxmZVQ.text: I've come her for years now and have never had a bad experience. The food is inexpensive and the service is pretty good. It's awesome that they are open 24 hours for those long nights.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak and brisket Pho
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wor Wonton
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Ragu

9uahN38WfFQRZU9e1-7KDg.text: Not sure why it took me so long to write a review for this place since I'm constantly here. I have always had good service and food for the past years. I have tried other pho places but I keep coming back here because the food is just better. Shrimp spring rolls here are also why I come back, other places the peanut sauce is gross. They always have seats available but do get very busy here where you will wait 15 min or so but the food comes fast and always good quality.

_dCuGo2q468-Udf8g6rHBw.text: We. Are. Always. Here.  It's impossible to pass up Kim long , We've been coming here for years.   It's popular so there's usually a wait. But I don't ever remember it being extremely long, maybe 30 minutes tops at one time. It's a spacious and Clean restaurant. The staffs are always wonderful and quick.   We have tried there pho, rice and whole chicken, spring roll, egg rolls, egg drop soup, vermicelli noodles and all were great! But it's their pho thats the star of the place.   Once you leave, your clothes will reeked with the delicious vapor of pho and a happy tummy. lol Afterwards, we walk 10 steps over to Lees sandwiches because duh it's a ritual.

hClu5gQwH-Xx5W3toy7OOw.text: This place used to have one of thee best calamari...but all they served us today was batter and hints of the actual squid itself. For twelve something dollars, it wasn't worth it. To top it off, the sauce was not to my liking. I am usually a person to order calamari and putting an end to that at this establishment. The pho was alright, a little on the room temperature/warm side but I was hangry! This place is supposedly recommended to most out of town guests but not one of mine.

hf7Roz_q73QGD5DXlwZuNA.text: Horrible service the employees rush you the whole time you eat and just make the whole experience really uncomfortable.

X3LYzxUXt5TumCRA8WMU5A.text: To be honest, I'd like to believe that this place has such a medium rating because most of its reviewers probably come from somewhere with a REAL Vietnamese food/pho scene (especially those of us from Orange County/LA). Relatively speaking, for the food alone this would merit three very solid A-OK stars.  But...  Open 24 hours. REALLY fast, efficient service. Clean (for the most part, if not a bit outdated). I got the bun bo hue, bro got the rare steak pho, we split an order of spring rolls. The rolls came out last btw (lol). Peanut sauce was to DIE for, but the rolls themselves were meh.  I loved my beef soup, bro loved his broth too. Standard accoutrement. I mean, the fact alone that this place is called what it is (hahaha), plus being chock full of young Asian patrons at 2am (we'd just cruised over from midnight Christmas mass, lol), they have to be doing something right.  Price was perfect. Again, it isn't Little Saigon pho but it's absolutely fantastic for a late Vegas winter holiday. Four super stars!!!  PS. Try your soup before you dump the ish into it... delicious!

dtku7dnue8dFprVtHrL97g.text: One word.... AMAZING !!!!  every time the food is the best I've ever had ! Service varies but typically always good this place is one of my favorites and it's open late!

MBon7d9EgpPmhpqelUAV7Q.text: The Canh chua and ca kho to is what we are today.... Canh chua is good. Ca kho to has a kick of sodium to it

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gq4Ma4m9_wIT8ZUcZKnB4Q.text: The food here is pretty good but it's a bit pricey compared to other pho places. I usually order a Pho Special/noodle soups or vermicelli. This restaurant is 24/7 so it's convenient if you're out late and feel hungry, you can stop by and get something to eat. It's also convenient to meet up with friends here if they are here visiting and staying on the strip. This place does get pretty busy though so if you come with a large group, be prepared to wait.   The service here use to be horrible and the staff seemed like they didn't care about their customers and hated their jobs. However, I do see an improvement on their customer service now. Our server today provided good customer service and checked on our table a few times.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Egg Rolls Rice Vermicelli.

FQ2-rbaSOMTEsm6BEsYVDg.text: Coming from a long trip yesterday, ordered take out: calamari -,looks good on picture, ordered it, opened it at resort we're staying. It looks so gross, no crunch, pale  looking pieces of squid wrapped in soggy flour. "Special"fried rice is ok, rice plate with yellow colored pieces of chicken, so, so., $38+. Could have been in sushi place. Noticed the entrance floor mats look old and dirty, inside is dark and dingy. Menu list wrapped in plastic needs renewal, kind of sticky. Regrets, threw most of the food. Overall, place needs renovations. Not to give business next time we visit VEGAS. Bay Area Vietnamese restaurants are a lot better.

oIHwa-GCL0fro2NN4m0_tg.text: This place doesn't deserve any photos, the broth is doodoo. Out of every pho place I've tried; this one stands out with disgust. The pho is edible don't get me wrong, but the broth was salty and the meat had a stinky aftertaste. The meatballs tasted like intestines. Good thing I was Vietnamese and I can eat those things, but this is not a good pho place. The service was excellent and the interior was mediocre. The bathroom. Don't get me started. Just don't come here because you'll get disappointed

DkEdiKTcTcSPZ71UfMPDmQ.text: This is place is so busy, it is almost like someone is giving free food.    This place is crazy busy at 9pm in the night and the service is was super quick.    The chicken wings, calamari, soup & pad Thai is a must to try .... FIVE STARS.    Fried rice was not great to my taste buds, but my friends enjoyed it.

eTYbwvLvecLmZh0UVlHBHQ.text: Had to wait awhile, service was lack luster but food came out rather quickly and was pretty tasty. We got the chicken drunken noodles (65) and spring roll (#1).

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls (#1) are very popular. They weren&#39;t the best I&#39;ve had, nor the worst.

udX5JKMsGJEgqpObk0t6pw.text: The pho here is wiggity wiggity WACK here!   Yes this place in 24 hours... but still a 10 minute drive from strip or so. I was better off eating some fast food before I went to bed.   Just an FYI, they do not offer pho with TENDON !  Since they didn't have my beloved tendon, I opted for a mix of both rare and cooked steak. The soup was super salty like borderline undrinkable, meat was meh, the only thing they got right was the noodles. Although the meal was mediocre at best, I just continued eating as a means of recovering from my crazy night in Vegas.   Final Verdict:  I know for a fact that there are better Vietnamese restaurants in Chinatown, so peace out!

2K8q7dr4qeq_qzHDbVgYvg.text: Apparently this is the go-to pho spot in Vegas so my friends and I had to go! Pho is the best hangover cure hands down and one of the best comfort foods. The crowd waiting outside for lunch was a True life struggle when you are starving but the line moved pretty quick - probably waited for ~30 minutes for a party of 5 people on a Saturday. There was a Lee's Sandwichs a few doors down in the same plaza so we got some banh mi while we waited. Once we sat down at Pho Kim Long, we all ordered pho, some spring rolls, an eggplant dish, and a chinese veggie dish. The pho soup was good - not too sweet which is what I dislike about some places. It has a hearty beef flavor that was nice and clear. The noodles could have been a bit more al dente though but that's a personal preference. There was also an abundance of meat that I definitely could not finish, Everything was great and really hit the spot. Their salty limeade drink was also delicious. Service was average but they are super busy so I don't expect much. I would definitely come back again when in Vegas!

W4uJc16mU25VtTej-nAPrA.text: I'm unbelievably picky about pho.   -this place has it down.  I ordered pho tai -broth was on point... spring rolls -good, and the fresh coconut drink -saved my life..  This will def be my go too place for pho when I am in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Coconut Drink

dQ0NV8V84ZP-v5yRZjn6BQ.text: I admit, everytime I drove down Spring Mountain Rd. or passed the big billboard for Pho Kim Long, I would just bust out laughing. Just because of the name, I had to try this place out. Best thing is, I was hungry late at night and this joint is open 24 hours!  Upon entering, it's in a regular old strip mall. There's enough parking fronting the restaurant. I didn't have many high expectations of this place. The seating reminded me of a traditional Chinese restaurant with round tables, rather than a Vietnamese restaurant.  Service was ok, but not overly friendly. I got the shrimp banh xeo for the appetizer, which is a shrimp fried pancake with mint, lettuce and other conidments to wrap it in. Delicious, crispy but not too oily.  I ordered the pho tai nam. I love their broth. Very rich, piping hot and tasty. Noodles were cooked well and not too hard or soggy. Plenty of condiments from the sweet basil, beans sprouts, garlic chili oil sauce, etc.  I would say the best broths I've tasted ever. Beats any broth in Hawaii hands down.   I loved the food. Food came out fast. Service wasn't that friendly, but hey, if you are efficient and fast, I'm okay with that. Love that it's 24 hours and wished we had something like this in Hawaii.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fy_eUFbgqT_Qnn7AsJycQA.text: This place is always super packed.  This place came recommended by all the local Asian/Vietnamese people I asked.  The wait looked a lot worse than it actually was, we got seated within 15 minutes.  Coming from California where Pho is aplenty, I think they did a great job.  Although not the best pho of my life, definitely above average in my book.  I also ordered a grilled pork chop rice plate which was decent, I would say it was pretty average.  Overall, good Vietnamese place if you're craving it in Las Vegas!   Also, if you haven't tried an iced Vietnamese coffee, it's one of my favorites to get at a Vietnamese restaurant.

Squ6P99M3A-cGJMHT5xk4w.text: This place was VERY busy, but we got seated within 10-15 minutes. The pho was ok. I was told this was one of the best pho places around. It's not. It was bland. I didn't care for their spring rolls either. They were kinda hard and dry. Their Thai tea was also watery and bland. My friends got bun bo hue and wasn't too impressed either.   The service though, was great and quick. Friendly staff!

QQIqK3PHz05pMyyu8g4rmA.text: Been here before... Had dry noodles for a change... Always good food here... What can I say....

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had to have this... Deep fried tofu....
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cornish chicken with brown rice...  Really good ....
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork and egg roll over vermicelli... Love it

Hbj8BvbC4ZQUKJtdvwZ_Fg.text: This place used to have horrible customer service, but it seems like it has gotten better. They're food isn't too bad. I like the pho noodle soups and vermicelli noodles when I come here. They're service is quicker than before.   On weekends, it can get pretty busy and packed, therefore, their customer service might slack a little. However, if I'm around the area and feeling Vietnamese food and the wait isn't long, I'll stop by this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Charbroiled Shrimp and Egg roll Vermicelli

yAGPNsAW1vWszSpDiF2YJw.text: The service was quick and to the point and the food was plentiful and delicious. Highly recommend you go if you like Vietnamese food.

3upSzp7CEZsjSb2te2R7Cw.text: This place has amazing food 24/7. If you're in the mood for delicious Chinese/Vietnamese cuisine that you can eat at any time and is always made fresh then look no further. The pho is unbelievable as well as the chicken pad thai. If you're looking for good starters I recommend the egg rolls, spring rolls or pot stickers. The wonton soup is also a personal favorite from here. You get huge portions of delicious food made fresh no matter what time you come in. This place is always busy. I have been here at dinner time and 3am. Each time the place was full making for a fun atmosphere. Even though it's popular the service is fast. The only reason I gave 4/5 stars was because when we came to place a takeout order the man taking our order was extremely rude and short with us. It was upsetting cause I love the food but had a really unfortunate experience with the staff. We were describing a pho to see if he could help us determine which one it might have been. He responded " I don't know. I have no clue what you ordered last time" in no way did he even attempt to help us. With that said the food is great and besides that one unfortunate incident the service has been decent. Definitely recommend no matter when that food craving may hit.

Aonqd7dgtBwipdRgzub36g.text: This is the worst experience ever.. we waited for over 1 hour n they couldn't seat us for 6 ppl. There is only 2 tables that seats 6 ppl and they sat 2 ppl each of those tables and we had to wait for them to finish to be seated. There are other 7 seat tables but they said it's their company policy that they need to reserve those tables for 7-10 ppl.. it is absolutely ridiculous to make any customers wait like this at 2am. Don't go there unless you want to starve to death. Very upset customer!

EsHKnD3g6DwkVYedb3Q0uQ.text: I came because I was starving and the appetizer egg roles come with lettuce in the lettuce had a snail on it so disgusting

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. they give me this plate without flavor and the manager gets mad because the chicken and the noodle it&#39;s like plastic.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here is the snail on my food

PklKrIHEtRNylDthclBTRg.text: Two words: HELLA GOOD. Wish we had one of these in Oregon! Visited in October while on a business trip. So glad we chose this place over the pho place a few doors down. Nothing against the one a few doors down, I have never been there but EVERYTHING about our experience at Pho Kim Long was awesome. We chose this place over the other solely because the name was too awesome to pass up and I couldn't resist a check-in on Facebook.  Everything from our appetizer to the dessert was amazing. We started with the Calamari which my mouth is watering for as I write this review two months later. Very salty but nothing wrong with that! Next up for me was the pho which is hard to screw up but surprisingly some places in Oregon do. It was spot on- perfect flavor. For dessert we had the pineapple half with ice cream. The ice cream could have been served a little but it was still great.  To top it all off our server was one of the most friendly servers I've had. I believe he said it was only his second day working there. He did an outstanding job and was very personable. The whole family left very satisfied!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mi1XfyElPnztsBvF3Ju_ag.text: Terrible customers service and they have the audacity to asked us for at least a 15% of the bill.. the good always mediocre, waiters were not attentive at all.. when I went to the register to pay the cashier asked if I leave any tips at the table yet? I said no I was going to leave the tip.here and he said ok how much do you want to leave and give me the option of 15 18 or 21%. I said so I can't just give the amount I feel like the service deserve? He ignored my question but I said it again and he forcefully said sure sure.. I still gave them $10 even though I don't think they deserve it.

A3AIjGDKyap65GrE8L4gsA.text: The food is good but the service sucks! We had to approach the server so we can just order our food. I get that they're busy and all and they're probably making money so they don't care who walks in. I've been going to this place for awhile and never had this experience. For some reason, their service changed and even water they did not fill our cups. For our bill we had to approach the servers again. For a business that's been going on for so long, customer service is what matters. At this time, they failed! What a disappointment!

1gvORhOCsQnwAB4U4hhNPQ.text: So we are in Las Vegas and of course paying Las Vegas prices for everything! Well sakino, as usual, jumps on yelp and JUST HAPPENS to find a Pho place... Coincidence right? Little Rock to Honolulu, LA to Vegas... Okinawa all the same. This Japanese wife of mine loves Pho.  So of course, off we go.....  I must say, it's hard for me to necessarily tell the difference between Pho (broth etc) but SOMETHING about this place just seemed slightly better. Now then that's not to say the others were subpar... Just this one is somehow ... BETTER.  My wife, whom is some kinda pho semi-pro-am taster expert, confirmed my suspicions by vocally stating over and over how GOOOOOD hers was.  I don't know the names. I had pho something with brisket. Large. Dumped sriracha in it and went to town. No veggies (onions etc) just meat and noodles and I Jammed out. No hassle from Waitstaff.  The wife got Pho Ga. Loved it. Large size. Put it like this... Of all the restaurants I review, she has never actually finished her meal, ever.... She slammed that large bowl, totaled it. That is a testament of how good/legit it was.  Vegas can get expensive... This place was refreshingly cheap and super delicious. About 3 min drive from circus circus. Parking is a B***h but whatever, circle around until you find one. It's worth it.  If you're visiting Vegas or a local... Get some Vietnamese in ya life... That Pho FoSho!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whatever I had.. Pho something with brisket
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Ga

5cPvuFNQh4QnIh8TbazDiw.text: Food is good but the service is terrible at night.The fobby asian guy with his hair slicked back has an attitude. Got my order wrong and charged me extra. When i asked him about it he gave me an attitude and told me i was the one that was wrong! Wtf.

sMBySsrmsz-i1PbwWXiIRg.text: Pho Kim Long is the perfect last meal before you endure that five-hour ride back to Arizona.  And why not?  Food is always light and fresh!  After indulging yourself for days in The Entertainment Capital of the World, give your kidney and wallet a rest and come here for some cheap good eats.  I like their egg roll bun with a side of spring rolls.  Nothing like a light vermicelli dish with all my favorite vegetables and some fried fatty egg rolls to soak up all the boozing and food from Sin City.  The prices are reasonable and service is fast.  I don't normally want something hot for the car ride home since it makes me sleepy so bun is the way to go for me.  Maybe one day I'll try their pho.  Anyways, Pho Kim Long is 24/7 so it's a perfect for all the clubrats and the hungover boozers.  Chances are, if it's after midnight and you're there, you're probably a clubrat or a barfly yourself.  We're all just one big family here.

ioas_Ky53VGRw0eAmTXjkQ.text: They have a wide variety of food on the menu... Problem is the quality. Everything tastes similar and kind of watered down. Also the portions are kind of small. My dad ordered the pho and he literally finished it in three or four chopstick-fuls. Haha

mo2vubuukL2giieClAnNPA.text: Delicious food, open late, and usually very busy. Been here a handful of times and even when it's packed, service is still on point. Be sure to order the shrimp spring rolls as an appetizer...they are DELICIOUS!!!

RpLrnTem2ka_LBeDmcJ2KA.text: Truly the worst pho I've ever had.  Cannot believe anyone would give this place 5 stars.  The nice decor and friendly waiters are basically lipstick on a pig.  The greens are dirty and not washed enough - the basil looked dirty, the sprouts were wilted and old, some of the onion bits in my soup seemed dirty too (both green and white types).  Putting these in the broth (which was middling quality) made everything taste dirty.  The steak tasted old and was a bit rainbow-y (generally not a good sign).  The fact that this place ever got voted 'best Vietnamese' is probably a reflection of how many drunkards there are here.  You can do better, people, even in the middle of the night.  If it's daytime, you have no reason whatsoever to come here.  There is worlds better pho just in the nearby area, let alone citywide.

rpvAQWXfN73g7aweZC3C-A.text: Yummy place for Pho soups. Their prices are reasonably inexpensive and the place is clean. Very busy but the staff move fast here so you're in quick.

7nVqOqAmLQjjmx0cz1Wurw.text: 24 hr Pho!  HELL YA!  And it's hella good!  I've been sick as hell lately...4am can't sleep want soup....perfect!  And I was sitting at my table and All the sauces and such were full with not sticky nice clean bottles and the waiter hushly came to table removed the plate of sauces so all my bottles were filled to brim. Kinda unexpected great service!  Get the large bowls cause the regular size doesn't have enough noodles makes u need and want more...so good so perfectly made!!!

qIsO2HaizO1q3T8w_sL9Ig.text: Yummy noodles....and its open 24/7.  Not crowded as we got this morning.  Sat down, ordered and food shows up quick. The pho special #13 was a bowl of yummy goodness with noodles, broth, and meat. Usually places skimp on meat and they don't.  Couldn't finished it all and they packed it up for me. They even separated the soup and noodles without me asking....4 stars for that. Who likes soggy noodles? Ample parking, open 24/7.  Huge bowls of noodles, so why not? Great inexpensive alternative and off strip, go there.

JYibNYZ1IOdYeprDNY42rg.text: Vegas, you Pho Me Long. All night long. ci7VOlRNIRvDUZRs3vEMpg.text: Customer service was horrible. Ordered shrimp fried rice and my rice was soggy. The shrimp were small. He just printed my receipt gave me a bag and walked off. Very rude. Thai tea was good though lol oh and I like the Togo containers but other than that I probably won't be back.

The manager didn't great us when we walked in and just said "how many"  I am not asking for my ass kissed but some sort of customer service would be nice.

-kj-LnIezF9Kn4egatmDhw.text: This is our go-to place after a long night of dancing. I like that this place is 24/7 open and their soups are always good to my hungry stomach. We had the beef soup, lettuce wrap and Vietnamese spring rolls- all were good

eEDbRtuSVEJkzLiw3BBL2A.text: I'm not able to eat pho anywhere else because this place has got me hooked. I always order their #14 Rare Steak Noodle Soup, great broth, but I am Mexican so I add a lot of lime and a few squirts of sriracha sauce and some jalapeno slices. But I can't just order only pho.
