eAeiEtUk_zg2_mNbkP-MxA.text: This place has the absolute worst service and it is the most rude place I have ever set foot in, I called in my order after working a late night shift and drove to that side of town because that place has food 24/7 when I arrived they didn't have my order, I asked how long it would take and the guy behind the register was extremely rude he proceeded to tell me that if I stop wasting his time he can put in the order I asked him kindly not to talk to me that way since I am a costumer and I wasn't being disrespectful to him, I asked to speak to the manager and he claimed to be the owner, didn't apologize or care to make it right he told me I could leave if I didn't like how he was speaking to me. I tried to verify he was the owner and security would answer my question. I left there very sad because it's very uncalled for to treat anyone that way let alone someone that is contributing to your business. I will never come back here.

dF7Oi86BAJBvLy5TyCPYtA.text: This venue in Chinatown of Las Vegas, the exterior of this place does not necessarily have the glitz and shine of a restaurant you would find at the Strip. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a place outside of the strip to eat at. It's a spacious venue and 24/7. There's no rush, but the food comes out quickly.  The fresh spring rolls were great and actually fresh. The pho here is rich in flavor - we got the combination platter. I also got Vietnamese Caramelized Pork (Thit kho to), which was flavorful and well done, but not really worth the $18. The mango smoothie seemed watered down, but was still a great dessert drink. The coconut drink was ok as well.  All in all, I would definitely go again though. The food and service were great for a cheap price and quick meal.

eJ49nsWMXIOJaxk9ILuNRQ.text: I cannot believe this place has such high ratings, a line AND a recommendation from my taxi driver. Maybe the rating is purely because of the entertaining nature of it's name.  I was getting my bracelet restrung at the World of Feng Shui during a trip to Vegas and got hungry.  I was by myself and thought, hmmm, let's get some Vietnamese since I'm right in the middle of Chinatown.....?  Long story short.  I waited for 15 minutes.  They forgot to bring my 3 color bean drink (the very first thing I ordered).  The pho was average.  I asked for just tendons in my pho.  I love tendons.  There might have been 3 pieces floating or buried under my noodles.  The eggrolls were greasy and very small.    Maybe I'm just used to Westminster, CA or Little Saigon as it's known as.  Or maybe I made the mistake of asking my Lebanese taxi driver where to get good Vietnamese.  Or maybe I just should have stuck with Chinese food in Chinatown......

EcpiqdjD0PFDo_qmKTfEiw.text: Ive been eating at this place nearly 20 years now.  They've always had great food.  Til today they still do and it's been one of my most favorite restaurants to go to nearly 2 decades now.  But their customer service has gone down hill bad.  A few of the staff are still great however in the last couple of times that I came with my friends to eat there they get aggressive when it comes to getting their tips. I work at a tip job so I give higher than normal tips when I get good service because I know how it's like. But I don't take out my tip until after I pay the bill. While paying my bill the cashier told me to put a tip down on the receipt. I said we will pay cash.  The cashier angrily told me that there is nothing on the table. Tips are earned,  not something you demand.  To the jackass behind the register,  you need to be fired for your actions. Almost 20 years i've eaten here and introduced many of my friends to this place.  Now,  I no longer want to go back.  Terrible customer service.  Earn your tips,  don't demand people to pay them unless they are a big party. Very disappointed.

fcF3dePLCtTwR2eAFqi6YA.text: Food is delicous. Everything I have ever orders I have never been disapointed. Love Pho GA the most. This is the only place in town where I get my PHO. Also love the chicken lettuce wraps and the boba teas

UY-TOSOB7-fgHa2TQilhfw.text: This place is just decent for pho in Las Vegas.  It is a restaurant, and not just a pho place.  I am not sure if there is good place for pho place in La Vegas, compared to the San Diego and Orange counties.

JQA-i1erSe3iNGzVnAkCkw.text: BEST PHO IN VEGAS.  I'm Vietnamese so growing up I've had A LOT of pho (but it's True nothing beats Mom's :P) and this place is just so damn delicious. The broth is really sweet and flavorful but not in that dump buckets of MSG into the broth way. The meat (I always get the brisket) is so soft, so so soft and tender. The veggies are always fresh and even the broken rice plates (com bo nuong) are amazing! A lot of rice plates are meh with the rice being too hard or God forbid too soggy, but the rice here is always perfect. They even include a small bowl of soup broth to compliment the dish-a must. I've been here a few times and despite all the amazing buffets/restaurants that Vegas has to offer, I need (NEED) to come here at least once. It's that good.  BUT and here's a reason why this place didn't get a 5 star review (trust me it hurts me too) the service is whack. I KNOW I KNOW, this is an Asian restaurant and they aren't known for their amazing service. Anyone growing up in an Asian community knows that (Asian restaurants ARE good for cheap prices, large portions, and amazing daily specials though) but I hate knowing that if I come here I would have to wait at least an hour. Because it's so delicious though the wait is something that just comes with the territory so I try not to get too stuck on it. BUT it's not so much the wait that bothers me, but the fact that I have to keep tab on the servers to make sure they don't skip us. I've realized that despite writing our names down, sometimes the server would skip our party (happened more than once) and we would have to wait even longer because of their mistakes. We would have to remind them and they would be like "Oh sorry, looks like someone crossed it out, I didn't know" and it happened more than once. Other people would come in complaining about the wait, and they would look on the clipboard and make some excuse about not seeing the name.   ALSO we went with a party of 6 and a party of 7 that went in after us got the table? Why? When my mom asked the lady just gave her some vague answer about another table getting up with 6 people, but they probably just wanted to seat the bigger table to get more money. I mean, I sure hope that extra one person made a difference in the budget. *rant over*  So if the service was just a little better (and less "forgetful") this place would definitely earn 5 stars. It's spacious and clean, and overall a must if you are ever in Vegas and are craving some bomb ass pho BUT you have been warned about the service.

4sme6AiHRnWbkmYvxpxN0w.text: Food avg at best,  very little ingredients mostly broth with mostly broth.  Service ok but food not good . To many other choices

5PnAHICASK4Ag5pfT5JlZg.text: If you've been going here for more than a few years, you know a lot has changed! From the decor to the menu to the crowd, etc. It's great to see how successful this place has become, but the high volume does make it difficult to have any type of traditional service experience. And by that, I mean you definitely feel like a number. It's great that the food is delivered so fast, but I feel like I'm being pushed out the door right after I have been seated. The food is good and the pho broths are flavorful, and they expanded their menu throughout the year. But with so many homestyle pho restaurants around the valley, I've found other places to go. What's great though is that it's 24 hours so when i do have that late night craving for Vietnamese food and my usual place is closed, I know just where to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese pork chop

7Uxn59KdCenB6P-Z-sDZ3Q.text: Very fast service. Hospitality ws good. There isnt really anything to complain about. Pho dac biet came to the table within 5 min upon ordering. The bo luc lac had tender cuts of meat. Both were very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho dac biet
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bo luc lac/ shaken fried beef
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup to accompany my bo luc lac aka as shaken beef

jVJaNICvRYBVa6a-Ul-bEQ.text: Great spot to catch pho. They've got lots of selections and service was quick. Atmosphere is also nice and has a trendy more upscale vibe than your average pho places.

06-TxV57inTcmKrbYN1SHg.text: Pho Kim Long is THE best place to have pho. It is extremely popular and always busy, so be prepared to wait! The customer service by every sever I've had is phenomenal. They're really funny and laid back, which is really refreshing from your typical server.  Now on to the food. I get the vegan pho with only broccoli and carrots and I add tofu. It is SOOO good. I've also had the pad thai and veggie nuggets with rice before. When I first thought of vegan pho, I didn't expect much flavor, but it was jam packed with it and has become my favorite dish to get. The veggie nuggets are outstanding. It used to be my favorite before I tried the pho. They aren't your typical fake chicken flavor and texture. I'm not sure what it is made with, but I can see some veggies haha. They have this unique, but good, taste and something I still order often. I've also had their strawberry smoothie and thai tea with boba. Their thai tea is pretty standard, and their strawberry smoothie was very creamy. I personally like to get both drinks with light boba. Overall, their food does not disappoint. If you are vegan or vegetarian, this place is GREAT for you! And of course, if you aren't a vegan or vegetarian, this place is still great!

gZQbryaDIBMSEtIUOsvhoQ.text: There was 3 of us. Little to no attention given to us. Had to wave down someone to ask for refills on our drinks and for the check. Went to pay and the guy up front asked me where's the tip. Did you do anything for us(without us having to ask) to deserve a tip? No. So yeah very justifiable that I am not going to tip. Don't be badgering people for a tip when you can't even keep up with your customers needs.

WKVrowVokxiFnwHZjOkV3Q.text: Great food. I ordered the pad thai & spring rolls. Portions are huge!! Ended up taking half home but that's okay!! Only thing I didn't like was being sat right next to the door. It was freezing cold and everytime the door opened I would get a brush of cold air. Aside from that, I would definitely return to try more items on the menu.

2lsmhjHTgfDMgtPRS671yw.text: Pay 17.95 for Sour Fish soup ( canh chua ca ) ... not thing be side fish and celery... the soup tastes really sour ... Expensive ... never came back again !

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pay total $60 for our meal !!! The soup so sour ... we just ate the fish ... could&#39;n finish the soup ....

A-7pPWxdEERs3MZjxoFOug.text: This place is opened 24 hours and a great place to get pho. The portions are big and broth is flavorful. We've also tried the eggrolls and spring rolls and both are yummy too. There's a parking lot, but parking can sometimes be hard to find.

vgB0V345kaj9566tZNKtQQ.text: I don't really eat Pho very often. But the number 23 or 24 is Delish!   Only odd thing is.. when it's not busy they take forever to seat people and when it's busy they seat people really quick. Weird?

SSFTVj001s9vtZbvBeQRrw.text: We were a table of 3. Ordered 2 bowls of pho, 1 drunken noodles and calamari.  When we came in, it was empty(Our table and 1 other table). We ordered our food and the first thing that came was the drunken noodles & my friend's calamari. (NOT RECOMMENDED: It was gross, way too much batter, calamari tasted mushy.) Some of the pieces were NO calamari & ALL BATTER!  Then like 3 other tables came, ordered AFTER US , and I noticed they were ALL getting their pho first....    I started looking pissed off. Then one of the waiters came by to look at our table and walked back to grab our pho orders..... which I noticed was sitting at the counter for a while.   It seemed as if they were eager to serve their people first. I mean, all 3 of the tables that came after us were Vietnamese couples.   Pho was OK, I've had better. Drunken noodles were good. Calamari was disgusting, terrible service, stay away!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Your calamari &amp; service needs help.

YZskPaNkyPK8DZG42mX4ww.text: Over rated food, busy for no dang reason. Service sucks, only service you get is when you order. Broth is plain, nothing to rave about. overall I did enjoy my meal.

IVm1VlrjILdE_LrcnIytMg.text: Since I've found out about this place a while back, I have never taken a Vegas trip and NOT stopped by this restaurant. Being on the strip and away from Vietnamese food usually makes me home sick and this place brings me home for an hour while I enjoy a bowl of yummy pho.

_SDtkhVLsb0rZzZ5f3pWsQ.text: After hopping off the plane at LAS, my mom, sisters, and I head straight to Chinatown. This was our first time in the area. We hail from the Midwest so we've had our fair share of pho and other Asian goods from Chicago to Minneapolis.  We didn't have to wait long to be seated. There were 7 of us. Food came in super fast. The egg rolls were delightful. It came with a side of lettuce and shredded, sweet and sour pickled carrot and daikon.   The pho portions are good portion sized. I just wish there were more noodles. I would have to say it's the best pho I've ever had!!! A squeeze of sriracha and a tad of hoisin sauce was all it took. My sister, the nit picky unofficial pho connoisseur, was very fond of the broth as well. The meatballs looked homemade, not like the rubbery kind you buy frozen from Asian super markets.  I took a star off for the service. They want you in and out. This place is also open 24-hours! So good, I even dreamt about going back. I only have my pictures to relive it.

WvtmOP7r4XlO1yUyV5QzHA.text: This is by far my favorite PHO SPOt. I come here whatever time and its always 100% from service to the food. The only thing its wait time is long especially after hours. But its worth the wait.

XuGp4743zK-fWVVJ7c_L6Q.text: People and their creativity on pho names always make me laugh. Hehe. This place is huge. Service was quick and friendly. Tried their calamari it was really good, huge plate enough to share with a lot of people. Thai tea was yummy! I got the rare steak pho. The soup was very delightful. Definitely cured whatever I had the night before.

iSXxH5uxLsJQqlNdkieO4A.text: One of my favorite dine in spots... excellent customer service, open 24hrs, you never have to wait long for your food to be served, even in the busiest times the wait time food is unexpectedly fast!

aVILRhozVl0gGRMU9Lsp_A.text: The best Pho noodle ever. But always in a hurry, rush rush atmosphere. Two waitresses try to take our plates twice even though we're still eating. Gave the bill so early, not even halfway eating. The restroom is dirty.

3MZzQ5OZBi4DviTIU5o2_Q.text: So I always manage to come here at least once every time I visit Vegas. The service is pretty okay. The food is also pretty decent for the price. I loved that they had vegetarian options for my friends so that was nice. They also have pretty decent portions. I always get the vermicelli and that's always good. They have good portions and the taste suits the price. I would recommend checking out this place at least once.

My bf ordered pho which included meatballs and tendon and we got 2 additional charges for that too... $1 beef on the side... $1 tendon.... $1 meatballs. We thought it was included already in are soup so i dont get why there was any additional charge....WTFLIP... big restaurant and busy too. The good thing is that they are open 24hours!!!

wcPqQ4LD0WTe65EWlMuhzw.text: legit, authentic vietnamese food  If you are looking for great service this is not the place. Be happy they are giving you utensils.  No credit cards allowed

rGF1yhhlkzHtuIWN_kor2A.text: I can't believe this place has lower than 4 star rating! I'm glad I didn't choose a restaurant based on Yelp review this time because I wouldn't have tried this place. My parents told me they had a great pho at this place, which is the reason why I decided to come here while on vacation in Las Vegas.   I had a combination pho and I was so impressed that I came back the next day. I shared shrimp pho, lettuce wrap, mapo tofu and seafood crispy noodle with my family and everything was sooooo delicious. I think the food was excellent because the ingredients were high quality and super fresh. I had pho in 5 different states and I would say this place made the best pho ever.   Mapo tofu was not as spicy as I wanted it to be so it was my least favorite but I can see how people who can't handle my spicy level will appreciate this place's version of mapo tofu. When I come back to LV, I'm definitely coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lettuce wrap. Crunchy and yummy.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef combo pho. Simply amazing.

kho3wHsHS725CUS1SVV8nw.text: Rude ass cashier.   I ordered on Postmates orange chicken with fried rice and it was $14. I ordered it 2 days later for pick up when I was in china town and the cashier said it was $26. I said what......?????   I got to the restaurant and showed him my bill from couple nights prior and he literally laughed and said "that's not my problem here is our menu" and showed me the price in the restaurant and that adding fried rice for $2.50 LIKE YOU CAN ON POSTMATES is not an option in the restaurant.   I said I'd like to speak to a manager and he literally laughed again and said not my problem....I get it the language barrier was clearly an issue but he also knew exactly what I was saying and showing him.   Not worth dealing with inconsiderate assholes for some average orange chicken and $12 side of fried rice. Of course I messaged the business owner the next day and never got a response. Who cares, right? Not them.

jz1i8Zzh_f69f6ATtfO7_w.text: To be perfectly fair the food is pretty ok and the hours cant be beat. I went today as I had done several times in the past and paid as I normally do via debit card. I put the card in the bill holder and the waitress took it to the front, and after twenty minutes it still hadnt been returned, prompting me to ask at the register for it back. The manager at the register didn't have it, had no idea where it was and looking at my banking app showed the card had been charged for a totally different order and several other charges after the restaurant, indicating the card had been stolen. Again the food is great and was comped for the trouble but I'm just not sure how somewhere can allow someone to steal a customers debit card right from the register and only say "oh well, that sucks". It really makes me wonder what other issues the place might have.

z6915iBNrib4SOpzE26zeg.text: THE WORST SERVICE EVER!  Me and the boys sat down and waited for about 20-30 minutes for a server to even greet us.

M9u7kOt80Lmierfs7GalqA.text: I come to this place about once a month for they're noodle soup which is amazing !!!!!  Cheap / clean / quick and satisfying!!!!  They really do deserve 5 stars....  The owner is almost always there and they make a quick cheap and nice dining experience!

j0h-NRXUu3x0lhp2jW16qQ.text: Very bad customer service! Your guy need re-train your waitress and customer service! I would never come here again!

q66xp5JA5khc_dzlF6OhnQ.text: Worst customer service I have ever experienced. I will never go here again and will take my services to District One instead

or-i1DZf9yr6_TKd2AkNJg.text: There are a few restaurants in town that I have gone to for over 10 years and Pho Kim Long is one of them.  First of all, let's talk about the name. Yes, it does sound like something out of an R-rated movie...that's that, and now about the food.  PKL was the first restaurant that I ever tried Pho at--clear broth noodle soup with choice of protein, and lots of fresh herbs and vegetables. My favorite is the seafood pho. It always comes with a good amount of sliced calamari, shrimp, and some imitation Crab meat. I add some chili oil and sliced raw onion, along with the plate full of vegetables. And just like that, it has become my favorite hangover food. While eating seafood pho, I often order Charbroiled Chicken & Egg Roll with Rice Vermicelli to go for my lunch at work. The way they pack it keeps all the ingredients fresh and easy to mix when I am ready to enjoy it.  They are open 24 hours a day, so if you are dancing or clubbing all night, this is the perfect spot to hit on the way home, or fill up on some yummy food the morning after to kill your hangover. You certainly don't need a hangover to enjoy Pho Kim Long though...you can always come in just because, and have a nice bowl of soup for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Their menu is lengthy, so if you like something else, come with friends and share.  - 2017 Review #39 -

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable Pho

o96fb4Hu13H9IolufD4vOA.text: I found a maggot in my food. We ordered the egg rolls and as we all took one the maggot started walking on the plate. As I said what is this and the waitress took the plate right away. So disgusting the manager didn't even say sorry or anything they let us walk out.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OqAe8BjYx9JYvb5E8eGPpQ.text: Seriously love all the food here! I've always great service. Everytime I have family come visit from California I make sure we stop here. Thanks for the great service guys!

rVij8wH_FllZQIOQyeow_Q.text: They are open 24/7! Which is nice. Specialty is PHO and they even have vegetarian pho. Its most famous for their catfish hotpot and sweet/sour soup to eat with rice. WARNING: it does take 20mins to order. Overall service is good and ample parking

QbIpP8P0H99wkwYrXQXLGw.text: A few co-workers  and I were in Las Vegas this past weekend and were having lunch at Buffalo Wild Wings. I asked our waitress if she knew of any good Asian places,without hesitation she immediately wrote down Pho Kim Long on a napkin and gave it to us.  Since we had tickets for a show that was ending at 11pm we decided to give this place a try as they are open 24/7.   Both my friends had never tried Vietnamese food so I was a little skeptical, not knowing how they would react and whether they would like it. Forget like, they simply loved it!!  Great place, good service and reasonable pricing. I strongly recommend this place but be prepared for a rather long wait. If you want to avoid the wait go after midnight. Give this place a try, trust me you won't be disappointed.

RVAkZg9IG-iW9oHMSIfdNQ.text: Given that this place is 24 hours, the food is decent for a Pho restaurant. There weren't that many options of pho to choose from. Hoped the broth had more flavor to it, it was bland even after adding some sriracha, hoisin sauce, and sate. This restaurant gets super busy, again being 24 hours, it took us about 10 minutes to get seated for a party of 4 and an extra 10 minutes waiting for a waiter to take our order. Would I come back, maybe, when I need something after all the drinking in Vegas.

mC8UYvCLzRgnenC8jNfDpg.text: Hearing so much about this place really hyped me up. Usually the line is pho king long so I never stopped by. The one time I get to try it and I was disappointed. The server and food runner were friendly but the other staff members weren't as much.  The goi cuon was dry and loosely wrapped... The nuoc mam lacked in flavors... the cha gio was average...  What I did enjoy was the bun thit nuong! Grilled porked was sweet yet savory. The bowl contains a good amount of lettuce to balance out the rice noodles. I thoroughly enjoyed it.  Another missed opportunity was the boba slush. They use powder for almost every flavor so I'm not a big fan of that.  Overall the spot doesn't strike me as a staple location to recommend or go out of my way to eat at. Better service could have changed that if they had anticipated the guest's needs and concerns more.

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun thit nuong cha gio

LUy1c9j_bBBlB3LubEKeyg.text: The best drunken Pho cravings to kill in Las Vegas but dayum the lines can be intense even at 2am! But the wait is worth cause the food is freshly hot and delicious. One of my favorite spots to go too in Vegas....kinda off the strip but you won't be disappointed.

lWE-VPp81Uu_wg80D6hC_Q.text: OK pho. Came here multiple times over the last year and feel the last few times have been rather mediocre. I used to claim this was one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas, but no longer feel compelled to visit as I once did. Spring rolls were extremely dry as if they had been from the day before. They brought the bowls of pho without all of the accoutrements and had to ask several times just to get some sprouts and basil. Was not a busy day (Tuesday 2pm) but server was exceptionally rude. It's a shame because I couldn't wait to come here and now feel I need to find a new go-to Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.

JyMGSLyrnWEjVoLkPW834Q.text: Open 24 hours!!!   Ever went back to your hotel from a night of clubbing and craved some pho? Well folks, Pho Kim Long is open 24 hours! What more could you ask for?!   It's off the strip but nothing a taxi ride won't get you too. We ordered the mi (stir fry noodles), chao ga (Vietnamese Rice Porridge w/ chicken) and their pho (beef noodle soup of course). All pretty tasty for a bunch of girls that are hungry after a night of non-stop dancing. We devoured our bowls and plates without hesitating.   Love the convenience of it being opened 24/7 on top of the location which is away from the strip. Sometimes it's breath of fresh air to get off the strip. And that is why my friends, I give Pho Kim Long 5 stars.

t8tvzXiXGsFMZvZnKqX7BA.text: Richard Pro here with another review.  After seeing lines going out the door 3 nights in a row at this restaurant, I decided I had to give this place a try.  The spring rolls were fabulous. The pho was delicious. The service was meh.   The 3 color dessert was horrendous. You get a plastic cup, a mound of shaved ice on top that is impossible to eat with a plastic spoon because the ice hardens, and the green gelatin layer tastes like green hardened rice noodles. The coconut milk, instead of being liquid, freezes with the ice. Quite disappointing, really, to eat such a poorly prepared yet simple dessert.  3 stars. Pretty comfy and bright interior. Food is average and there are a lot of options.

CuweVtKxlwZB6m5dQ-QNQg.text: Pho Kim Long... say that 3x's fast!!! LOL  Not only is the name great.. but the food is amazing!!    And take that from a Vietnamese person!!  If you are new to the Vietnamese food world... stick to the basics and get a Pho Ga (Chicken Soup)... but if you're feeling a little adventurous... Pho Kim Long definitely has more... hence the name... LOL  I always, always get the claypot pork.  A perfect compliment to that is steamed rice and canh cua (hot n sour soup).  If you are in the mood for fish, they have a crispy friend fish that is really good.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu... so it's really about what you are craving that night... or morning (after the clubs)!!  Enjoy =)

4q5uKApOzM_tWv1E_0Nmzg.text: I wouldn't say the best Pho I've ever had, but it's good.  They gave me a huge bowl of pho (like a large bowl) and plenty of meat.  It's a little more expensive than what I'm used to paying (like around $5 or $6 for pho), but they make up for it in size.  My wife's vermicelli dish was just ok.  She had charbroiled chicken & egg rolls in there.  The chicken & egg rolls were missing flavor a little bit, but still good overall.  The service was actually decent.  We got seated right away, someone came  by to take our order relatively fast and they did an ok job with filling up our cups.  I would definitely come back.

gLirVeIKwERHiDD-J8MyqA.text: We ordered the Calamari and it was pretty greasy and not that tasty.   The pho was descent.

xThXAqbRqunRUcHGaHNk-w.text: This place is always packed - which is a good sign. Service is very prompt and efficient. You may feel like a this place is a cattle call. When you are done eating, you are expected to quickly pay and leave. The food is great. I typically go for the Pho Tai Chin and the spring rolls. Both of which are made fresh and served within minutes of ordering at your table. This place is conveniently located just a few minutes drive from the Spring Mountain/LV Blvd area of the Strip.

NmZfC_QrCNMsY2tSgEy9kw.text: This is the only pho place i go to when i'm in Vegas.  It can get packed during lunch and after club hours but you get seated pretty quick. The place is pretty big with lots of tables. Their pho is good. There are many reviews about it below so... Since i always get pho, i wanted to try something different. I tried their hu tieu dac biet and it was not good. It was just couple pieces of meat, seafood, fish balls in soup loaded with msg that u can taste.  BUT their bun bo hue is surprisingly delicious. I love the fact that it comes with so many veggies/herbs. Their broth isn't red like some places. You get the chile paste thing on the side to make it spicier and red.  Next time i'm in Vegas, i will definitely get bun bo hue again.

mf3DUtW9fDHJ8kF1CoTj7g.text: pho all day every day if you wanted! their food is good. also, they have veggie pho! and its delicious! the service was fast and it was 6am saturday morning. the place was so busy and yet service was great. they draw a good number of people late night/early morning. its great being there  and watching everyone sober up from a long night just like you!

F0An7X885xB00ECtrxRmew.text: Well you're in luck if you don't mind terrible service...  I came here the first time because Kung Fu Plaza was closed and the people I were with suggested this as another option.   So in we go.  They saw us come in. Nothing. So we waited. Nothing. Waited some more. Eventually they asked us how many in our group. 5. So we were finally seated. My seat was sticky so I moved over one. Fine. We ordered our drinks and once they came we were asked if we were ready to order. We weren't and asked for a couple minutes. I guess by "a couple minutes" the waiter assumed we needed a few hours to decipher the menu because he didn't come back. We talked and waited and well,by the time the waiter DID come back 3 of us were more than halfway done with our drinks.   I was NOT pleased with the food or the service.  I went back another time deciding that maybe I just had a bad experience that first time,  Yes,the service sucked.

efVIr-Nu6P0bEnwIyVV_8A.text: If someone says this is the best place for pho, you must be on drugs. First, the employees are douche bags. They didn't understand a word I said and gave me the wrong type of pho. And the thing that pissed me off the most is that the cashier expects you to know how much your meal was. If you go up and tell them you don't know, they stand there and tell you to calculate it. And in the customer point of view, THAT IS THE EMPLOYEE'S JOB. Then they just throw out a random number if you don't know what it is.   Second, the soup to noodle ratio is inefficient. They provide more soup and less noodles. I'd rather pay for more noodles, I mean that's what pho is right, A NOODLE SOUP. I want to get my money's worth. Also, they aren't careful with how they handle their bowls. Since their is too much soup, it spills over the edge. And they don't even clean it up for you. I also tried my cousin's boba, and it was garbage.  Overall. This was enough to influence my decision that I'm never going here again. The employees need to learn how to do their jobs and learn to have better customer service skills. I do not recommend Pho Kim Long for pho lovers.

s0eGvKC-msAlRpX1dEwZDA.text: I would give 3.5 stars if given the choice.  This place was packed 3am in the morning!  While the pho is fairly priced and tastes decent in Vegas, I cannot give it 4 or 5 stars due to the wondering choices I have tried in the Bay Area especially San Jose.  But, since there's not a whole lot of pho options in Vegas, this will have to do.

ThyUilh3rg3oAtaNr4VhFA.text: Service was great for me but I was turned off by a piece of cubed fat i found in the pho. I'm guessing they use it for flavor. Little more expensive than other nearby places that are open late as well and equally if not more tasty. Also has smelled a bit funny in there when I take-out latenight boba (not the typical pho joint smell). Atmosphere is nicer than the majority of pho places in town. Kind of hip, swanky, dim lighting. Good for a date.

4d-9MWAcgO_zW2PC1WerhA.text: Although this is a vietnamese-chinese restaurant, we've only eaten chinese food here. I love vietnamese food too, so it's a little ironic. I came here several times with my older brother and a couple times with my family. It's been a few years since I've been here, but I can tell you that in all those times, I never had a bad meal here. Since it was a big group, we always had it family style (large platters to share). We always ordered several dishes to accommodate our large group. Service was usually pretty good. Popular restaurant in a strip mall near Chinatown with a small parking lot. Funny name, good chinese food.

bX4Ca-Xn6DD4fk-EFQtdMA.text: The one thing I enjoy the most about Pho Kim Long is an extensive menu that offers Pho and various dishes available at all hours.    Prices are cheap, portions are generous.  The quality, however, strangely varies.  I had Singapore Rice Noodles this week and it was kinda weak - not strongly seasoned or generous with anything but noodles and onions and kind of dry.  Last week, I ordered the same dish and it was delicious and kinda SPICY!  I was disappointed this week, to say the least.    The service is always flakey with no personality.  They get your food out pretty quickly but refills are slow moving, particulaly with water.  I start singing loudly when I have to wait more than five minutes and they show up pretty quickly after that.  After they drop your food off, they are gone for a good ten minutes.    That previous reviewer isn't kidding - this place is hopping ALL the time!  You sometimes may have to wait a few minutes to get seated... rarely because there's a line but because the servers are booking it all over the place  The food is NOT spicy enough for me, generally.  I have to tell them to make it super spicy since their scale for spiciness is a little off.  They're a great place, though, if you're looking for a decent, run-of-the-mill Pho restaurant that's reliable and 24/7.

xcH1LI3FCsM4GepbtemODg.text: Thumbs down. Customer should always be right and appreciative with utmost respect but not this restaurant for being open throughout these long years. I am from Oklahoma, came here with family members of 16 wanting a table all connected to have a great time and conversation- Seated at a table of 12, not able to connect any table because the owner said- new floorings! NO! 1)So we sat apart.  2) Waiter/owner did not ask us what we want to order while the family of 12 orders are out 1st. Bad idea- I'm the one paying. 3) Lastly final ticket came out but left on table without a word, helped other table first, left us hanging. This is not what I call "1 fine day".  If you do dine in groups- EAT at Jenni Pho!!! Family had a great time with awsome modern atmosphere on Spring Mtn.

vNld6wTuIEQIJ-a1axAOAQ.text: Always a good place for Pho in Vegas. Open 24/7.....late night eats and breakfast. Ate twice here in 3 days....that tell ya anything???  My first visit there a few years ago went like this...  Female Server - Hi, what you want? Me - Pho Dac Biet. Female Server - "You want Large bowl or what?"  Me - (speaking) Large bowl...(thinking) what happens if I say "or what?"

OpBE6n4xRreDnsZpJ5Tbsw.text: My fave place ever to eat at 3am, also best hangover food. I come here all the time and recommend it to satisfy any late night hunger cravings .

ks74BcWJhpLrydPUYLIj8A.text: In my opinion, this is the ONLY place to eat pho in Las Vegas. This place has the best broth, and if you don't believe me, believe the line. This place is definitely always on the schedule for any trip I have to Las Vegas. Prices are reasonable, which makes this place great (somethings in Las Vegas are just WAY overpriced). Going at an off-hour for Lunch/Dinner will usually give you a better experience.

LlEr8BAJskJzSHbo3M4mdg.text: First time eating Pho.  It was easy to order, quick to be delivered, and delicious.  I will be going here again and again.  Plus, read the name if you aren't Asian....come on!  It's hilarious.  Way to go.

Sy9Mi9zjGndNzuybbnuDxA.text: I really loved their pho here. It is now ranked number one on my list because the broth was so flavorful. Their meat balls aren't my most favorite because of the texture but for sure the broth is what brings it home. It also wasn't skimpy on the meat. I will be back for the combination pho!  What's cool about this place is that it is 24hrs. So after a long night of staying up for EDC we were hungry and this really hit the spot. Loved it!

6mZo2T_QlbXd-N_3-HoB8g.text: Omg.... they have gone down the hill real bad...  it's been worsening over the years but we kept going back ONLY because it's OPEN 24hrs!  But no more...  Noodles over cooked in the Vermachili salad. Grilled pork over cooked and dry :( Fish sauce doesn't taste like anything. Pho broth very bland.  I'm sad it's still packed all the time lol

QPNIc5L4wBG2ldlowS8UfA.text: We were looking for a place to eat pho in China town and started exploring Yelp. The first 2 places we went to were completely empty. (Not a good sign) so we started driving around and cam across this restaurant. It was super busy. I quickly checked Yelp for the reviews and decided to give it a try.   The parking lot is packed due to multiple popular stores/restaurants. So be patient while looking for a spot to park. The wait wasn't as long as it seemed it would be. The testament is fairly big, clean, and kid friendly.   We ordered pho, pad thai, chow mein, and fried dumplings. The dumpling came out at the same time as the food instead of as an appetizer. All the food was tasty, the service was slow. But we would still come back!

-R1h1QWBAx-kQRDCdoE_3A.text: Haven't been here in while definitely didn't miss much place was very dirty and service was horrible. Food taste like cook just didn't make any effort. Egg rolls and pho ordered, didn't even bother finishing. This was the go to place for pho , not sure what happened.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork chop

4WTvpWDputJznt5enyrA9A.text: I'd give this place one star except they had a crispy salt and pepper eggplant, that was pretty damn good. I haven't been here in years, and we defaulted and came here because the other place we wanted to have dinner was on an hour-and-a-half wait. We signed our names on the wait list, and got seated shortly after. But nobody came to our table for at least 15 minutes. I had to get up and have somebody come over to our table to take our order. We ordered tofu spring rolls which were trash. Literally just a little fried tofu and Shredded Lettuce inside the rice wrapper. They actually have a vegan pho on the menu and they should probably work on adding some FLAVOR to it because it was BLAND AF. It's nice when places offer vegan pho, with the Veg broth, but you can't just have some bland ass shit and put it on the menu likes it's a great idea. Because it ain't! Nobody is gonna go eat it if it SUCKS.

5yJ3xNOoCjCpPTb6-0PtVQ.text: I come for the PHO.   I concentrate on that when I go there. It is perfect. It is delicious. It is consistent and the ingredients are first quality. The ambiance is casual and relaxing. It is a good vibe.   I have had other things on their menu, all of which have been delicious, but it's the PHO that keeps me coming back.

JE2h7iG9sbh0s0mcZ6aZeA.text: I went here for only one reason and only one reason because the name was funny that's why I didn't go here because of any other reason.  Instead I got a plate full of gristle next to my pho. I would never recommend this place and also it seemed like they were afraid that I was going to run out without paying. SMH racist and the food sucks. Ho chi Minh would not be proud of you.

Q1x8Vkwo4Nq0zncE8p73-A.text: Did you have a soul-crushing, physically destructive night of partying last night? Well come on in to Pho Kim Long where you can get a nice, steamy bowl of pho so you can sweat out the regretful decisions you made!  More often than not as I depart from Vegas, my friends and I will always find our way to Pho Kim Long for a bowl of pho for lunch. And the fact that the restaurant is usually packed and there's a bit of a wait during peak hours is a testament that everyone is thinking the same thing. At an incredibly reasonable price, especially considering that it's Vegas we're talking about, you can get a solid and filling bowl of life-granting noodle soup.  No matter which pho place I go to, I always get the pho tai chin which is the noodle soup with sliced rare tenderloin alongside well-done flank/brisket. Also pro tip as someone who loves meat on the rare/medium-rare side is that I always ask for the tai meat (the rare tenderloin part I mentioned) on the side. Because when you order the tenderloin meat, it's already placed into the soup for you by default. Thus by the time your steaming hot bowl gets to your table, the meat has been poached almost all the way through. By getting it separate, you have more control of how rare you want it by dunking it in at your own leisure.  The soup itself is clear yet packs strong beef broth notes. It's been skimmed of all the fats and simmering spices but you still get the sumptuous meat flavor throughout the broth that compliments the rice noodles, slices of various beef cuts, and the array of bean sprouts and herbs in your bowl.   Even better that this place is open 24/7 because no matter what bad decision you made, you can always follow it up with a good one by dropping by. This has been my comfort food all my life and as I take each bite at Pho Kim Long, I can feel my spirit revitalize from the void. It's like this miraculous bowl is telling me that everything is going to be ok and that my hangover will be gone soon~

5_1iwcDjkFiCYtpvob-E4A.text: This is by far the best spot to come eat Pho ! I've tried other pho places and honestly none of them compare. My husband and I come here at least 3 times a week just because it's sooooo damn good. I absolutely love their Thai tea, everywhere else legit tastes like spoiled milk    If you're looking for a good spot for Pho this is definitely the place to check out !   The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because when I order my Pho I like to get extra lime since they only offer 3-4 pieces on a small bowl (even if there's orders for 2-3 Phos) and I always seem to have to ask about 3 times before they actually bring the extra lime to the table and honestly it's annoying having to ask over and over again.

rRiNhoDcBuCVN9ljqXJPdQ.text: This restaurant is quickly becoming a staple favorite!  I've visited here 4 times in the last few months, bringing out of town guests. But tonight's visit was all about satisfying a craving for pho.  As usual, we were seated quickly. Order also came out pretty quick. This time around it was crab Rangoon, pho, and Chinese staple dish.  Until next time....

4lYRtEJwj11DPVp1ZF407A.text: This place is still good but was much better. A few years ago all their regular servers disappeared and with them their familiarity with customers and some of the foods flavor. Still very popular place just not what it used to be.

9H-YwzTpxFbsZvuXXZUIWg.text: My go-to-place for a great pho  Service is pretty quick as well. Another fave is their fried spring rolls. I'm a certified lumpia-monster and this one is much tastier

pyuDN3dEgFR79nxLbRxf6w.text: My friends and I went here on Labor Day weekend around 10:30am. By the time it was 11:30am, the line was out the door! This place is popular. The prices are really great. The food and service was great as well. I got the pho tai bo vien. The food came out so fast!! I was shocked. The restaurant itself is really clean. There was plenty of free parking right in front. Easy to find and easy to access. It's right off the strip.

c_dzwv6v85gSj219vqczNg.text: Best of the Best 10 Service, Quality,Taste 100I love everything soup,lettuce wraps,Wings is so addictive and I recommended the coconut slushy with boba

D0K8uhz2LNfPV2VbEItOVA.text: This is not a review on the pho - I don't eat pho, I go for the bun (vermicelli noodle bowl). Those are my faves. Wow, their chicken bun is good! The chicken has so much taste, better than I've ever eaten anywhere else!  They give ample sauce for me to drown my noodles in, which I also appreciate.  I also tried a coworker's grilled pork from her bun, no-no, the chicken is so much better. She agreed after I gave her a piece of my chicken. Next time! Service is fast and not so much chit-chat which is no surprise but we didn't want for anything so it's all good.

5ZoERLyUdJYEi_FvAzgTwg.text: 24 hour pho?! Yes please!! It's located on spring mountain across from play it again Sams and a few store fronts down from the Golden Tiki. It's never really slow here... honestly, the slowest I've seen it is between 5-6 am. We have had to wait at 4:00am but it is always worth it. The crowd is usually industry workers and people leaving the club around that time.   There menu is extensive and easy to navigate. I always order the spring rolls with no tofu and the vegan pho extra vegetables/ light noodles. They load the veggies in and it's amazing. The broth is delicious and full of flavor. All the sauces are on the table when you sit down. The price is extremely fair and the service is usually pretty quick and accurate. My boyfriend usually gets the rare steak (extra steak x3) and he loves it. They don't skimp on the extras when ordered properly. I definitely recommend this place for dinner or a late night bite!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak pho extra steak
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan pho extra veggies!

7kSOLLiWbgsY4bgERQV08w.text: Great Vietnamese Restaurant located in Chinatown off the Vegas trip. Definitely worth the Uber or Lyft ride from your hotel for quality Asian food and for decent prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Salt &amp; Pepper Wings
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Pork Chops w/Steamed Rice

EPTsOBqXjbwRCDM7scTJIw.text: This pho place is one of the original pho locations in the Chinatown area of Las Vegas.  They're open 24/7 for those late night cravings or early morning hangovers...lol  Their broth is delicious and not over powering.  They portions are a decent size and you always have the option of upgrading to "jumbo" size and/or ordering extra noodles.  I Iike this place.  This just might be my new go to place for Vegas Pho.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MjGMxDMNF0a-ZD8hEPCgTQ.text: I cant wait to go back!  The fact this place is open super late is even better. My buddy suggested it as he always goes there. It's not expensive & service is fast. The portions are huge so if you're not like me & more like my friend, be prepared to take it home with you. I took his leftovers because he doesn't like to bring Pho home.   I wasn't feeling well so I couldn't wait to have some Pho. It was so good my friend said the color came back to my face. I felt so much better.   I ate the classic Pho with shrimp & had I ordered spring rolls as well. WOW WOW WOW! So tasty & service with a smile. wish I had pictures but I ate it too fast. Lol next time.   Thanks for everything! See you soon!

6eeRbhzx_-mCmWrTlTs85g.text: Good bun bo hue and I loved the fresh coconut juice!!! The others got bun rieu and pho. They seemed to like their food. I like that the bbh broth wasn't too oily. Nice flavorful broth similar to how my momma makes it. Food came really fast and happy that they open 24 hours.

LAXN-glSsL_sitvqpi9duA.text: Look, I come from the Bay Area... more specifically San Jose, which has a large population of Vietnamese and of course Pho restaurants, so I think I've tasted what's close to the real deal. However, of course the morning after some heavy drinking out in Vegas, the first thing that comes to a Bay Area native's mind is "My God... some pho would be the perfect cure right now." Hence, my cousins and I went on a hunt to find some pho. Funny thing is there is also a "Pho Kim Long" where we are from, so we thought we'd give this place a chance. Hopped into a cab and asked the cab driver himself if he had a favorite Pho place. And right off the bat he named this place!   The restaurant itself is bigger than most pho restaurants I've been to, and definitely the NICEST looking. I'm used to cheap restaurants that look a bit dirty inside. This place actually has ambiance. Service wasn't too shabby as well, and honestly don't know if it was because I was super hungry (and slightly hungover) but I could say this was the best pho I've ever eaten... surprised it was in Vegas! Even my sister's vermicelli salad looked bomb and perfectly proportioned. Be warned as they only have one size and no "larges" for you hungry hippos. Or maybe they do, but it's not listed on the menu.  Definitely should open a location on the strip and they'd make so much money. I wiill definitely consider coming back to this place for my hangover cures if I am to return to Sin City.  Side tip: Taxi ride from Cosmopolitan hotel to Chinatown where this place is located is about ~$13.00 (one trip)

VjsRKBuLvrqbfZ76xAEB2w.text: The place was moderately clean, you expect that with very busy places very good food nice atmosphere. Long wait though so don't go if your staving

f8RSTkKdUCJ8FG90JRpZsA.text: I first came here about four years ago.  The manager was the brother of a dealer I worked with at GVR.  A group of us from GVR went there after work and were treated to a fantastic meal.  The food hasn't changed.  It's till delicious and very reasonably priced.  The calamari appetizer is an absolute must, and the small bowls of pho are enough to feed two people.  Good food, good price.  Go.

GQ3kHRkoPkZyvpVQ7dvvAA.text: We went to this place after we dropped by at the other Pho restaurant and learned they didn't open until 10 AM.  We arrived at Pho Kim Long and placed our name on their list for 17 people at 9:30 AM. There was hardly anyone waiting except us. When other people arrived after us, they let them in one by one.  After waiting for about 10 minutes, the host lady came outside and asked me what my name was. I told her we were in the same group that already signed up. I continued to tell her that we could be broken up to different tables if needed.  She just simply and totally ignored me and called out the other family that just arrived.  I thought to myself this was just a typical rude, unfriendly Asian customer service that I must accepted. By the way, I'm also an Asian.  It's about 10 AM now and we were still not called in.  Her list showed she already called in 5 other families that arrived after us.  My patience was running thin at this time.  I went in but she was busy at one of the tables.  I approached this little young Asian cashier guy whom I believe was the manager/owner.  I informed him nicely what happened.  He told me they were busy, therefore, I should continue to wait.  I told him we had been waiting for almost half an hour now and five families that arrived after us were already called in.  His next answer was shocking.  He said, " the door is open, go somewhere else."  I was pissed.  I called him an idiot. After, he was in my face and I dared him to touch me.  Luckily, he didn't or he would be waking up in the hospital that day. By now, it's already 10 AM, we simply left and went to Pho Kinh Do, the restaurant we went earlier. We had a wonderful time there, the service was excellent and the food was great. 5 star rating there.

1gLiSnJGFyQ2FwjeVgMPtA.text: My friends and I came to Pho Kim Long to eat dinner around 8PM. Upon first impressions, I liked the decor of the restaurant. It was nicely decorated and roomy. We were also seated immediately. We all sat down, thought about what we wanted to order... 10 minutes had gone by after we were seated and no one came up to us to ask us what we wanted to drink. A couple of minutes later, an older gentleman took our orders. My friend and I both ordered Pho Dat Biet (special combination tender beef noodle soup, $8.75), my boyfriend ordered half of the Ga Chien Gion (deep fried chicken with fried garlic, $13.95 for half chicken), and my other friend ordered Com Chien Tom (shrimp fried rice, $11.50).   Here came the most disappointing part. I'm not exaggerating when I say that 30 minutes had literally gone by before the first dish came out, and that was my boyfriend's deep fried chicken dish. I thought that this dish was pretty good. It wasn't too salty and I loved the fried garlic. Do note that this dish didn't come with rice so you would need to order it on the side. At this point, I'm starting to look around the room hoping to catch the attention of the workers to see if they had brought out our dishes. 5 minutes after the fried chicken came out, both of the Pho Dat Biet came out. Honestly, I didn't think that it was too good. The broth wasn't anything spectacular and for the "special" bowl of Pho that we ordered, there was barely any beef, tripe, tendon, and all the other components that goes in the special.   At this point, my other friend who had ordered such a simple dish of fried rice STILL has not received has order. We started trying to track down the employees and finally managed to spoke to one about how we haven't received the last dish of fried rice. There was a couple who was sitting nearby us, who were seated way after we were seated and had managed to receive their food order BEFORE we even got ours! And how is it that the fried rice would be the last dish to come out? Makes no sense to me.... So about 10 minutes after both of the Pho dishes came out, my friend's fried rice finally came out. It didn't look too appealing either... He also mentioned that some of the parts in his fried rice were cold and not warm at all...  I don't know what happened with our order honestly. Pho Kim Long is open 24 hours, which is great for people who want to grab a late meal after EDC, clubbing, etc ;]. Since Vegas is the city that never sleeps, I'm sure many people there appreciate how late Pho Kim Long is opened. It's possible that at night, they don't have as many cooks in the kitchen or they simply forgot our order... who knows! I most likely wouldn't visit Pho Kim Long to eat again unless I desperately needed some soup or Pho late at night!

XRxvOHMx_XwnravZaxS6Dg.text: Pho Kim Long. Pho Kim Long. Pho Kim Long.  Yes, it's no mystery; I love the name. I also love the hours and the quality pho served during those available hours of operation.  My Yelp star rating: 4 stars  My reasonings for giving Pho Kim Long 4 (Yelp) stars, instead of the 3 I would have given, is for the sheer convenience and availability of some great-tasting pho. This is definitely not the best bowl of pho I've ever encountered, but it sure is good to be able to have "good" pho when I want it and need it most (at 4, 5, or 6am). Take-out pho from Pho Kim Long is my favorite after-Vegas-club remedy. And even though almost anything and everything tastes good when you're drunk, Pho Kim Long is good even while sober and/or hungover!  The broth is flavorful, but thankfully without that overwhelming, aromatic star anise taste. And it isn't too sweet, either. I like the rare beef/steak pho, and the meat tastes pretty fresh. And perfectly reddish-pink in the middle.  There is no question as to where I will be having pho when I'm in Vegas!  You can Pho Kim Long all day and all night!!!!!!  Yelp 365 - #289/365

YKx97YVPA6_WJYTcjRKOXw.text: If you have been eating pho since before it was trendy this is the spot. The broth is on point and the noodles are always perfect. I always get consistent service that is decent. I have never tried any dish except pho here but, why would you? This is a pho resteraunt.  Cruising by Lee's sandwich on the way here brings me back to Tully Road. If you know what I am talking about then eat here.

Jod9I3AI_-7_i8H01tND8g.text: I love Pho Kim long the pho is really good but this time I went with my boyfriend he decided to get the fried rice and I got the vermicelli noodles with pork. My food looked really good so he wanted to trade so we did. The fried rice was so horrible it was dry and hard it didn't have any flavor barley had any fried egg in it I was highly disappointed. I will never order the fried rice again I'll stick to the pho.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea

sJR6HF7I49Eu_MIDeSPL3A.text: First off - awesome name! haha! Now that we got that out of the way, one of my friends (who is a Vegas regular) recommended this place after a long night of eating, drinking, debating about politics, thinking about going clubbing, not going clubbing, getting old, and then getting hungry again!  I was excited, not becuase of the name, but because this place was supposed to have some really good PHO!  Sad to say, I was very disappointed!  The pho looked good, but didn't measure up to its good looks.  My pho had rare beef and beef balls, both of which were dry and flavorless.  I added my normal squeeze of lime and tons of sriracha but the broth was just not doing it for me.  I took a few sips/bites and I was done!  Finished up my beer and left quite unsatisfied.  Maybe it was just an off night or maybe because it was 3 in the morning?!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho with rare beef and beef balls

SCg31eXtapboNRXRFIyVhw.text: Awful customer service, the noodle is below average, the water is not filtered. Don't waste your time and money.

Q6JceOmk_lnXdi_TPw8IOQ.text: Wow this has to be the bomb of Vietnamese food in Vegas. They are always packed it seems. I have been here a bunch of times. One of my favorites!!! I love the chicken wings, Spicy pork, There is so much that is good but my over all favorite I get just about every time we go is the Pho Thai Soup. My friend told me to try it since I never had it before and it is the BOMB!!! So good. The broth is great, everything inside is so good together. Add some of the sauces they have on the table, add a little extra hot sauce just not the fish one that smells nasty! I always get my steak on the side it is rare and I can add it in and it  cooks fast inside the soup.  The bowl is big and I always end up taking some home for lunch the next day. Prices are not bad here. If you like Vietnamese or Chinese food try this place out. Has a great reputation. Service is hit or miss depending on how busy they are. You can ask just about anyone walking by who works there and they will help you out.  It is nice they are open all night for that late night snack or dinner. We recommend this place totally!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak for my soup...
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho thai soup.. so good

Nt8HYV9penfYzq6o9IXoug.text: Came here because we were visiting in Vegas and was in the mood for some pho. We ordered the egg rolls and two bowls of pho. The egg rolls were kind of bland in my opinion. The pho broth itself was a little more cloudy than I am used to seeing, but it tasted okay. Wasn't horrible and wasn't the best pho I've ever had. The prices are comparable to what I'm used to paying. The service was okay, prompt but nothing to brag about. Overall, I think I would only come back if I wanted to go play ping pong again next door and this place just happens to be near it.

_HszNJ39HPqU3lioSGQirQ.text: After a long night of crazy partying and probably too much booze you need a nice steaming hot bowl of Pho to cure your inevitable hangover. If you can get yourself out of bed and actually manage to stomach more substance into your body, this is place to go to cure whatever you got.  Yes, you will see an array of sleep deprived, miserable, post alcohol induced individuals at this spot trying their best to forget, or remember, the night before. This spot is always packed, especially Saturday for lunch.  There is usually a wait...but bearable. Once seated, the service is good and attentive, food comes out fast, and the pho is decent.   Don't expect the same quality nor quantity as you do in California. It's going to be more expensive and as of late they really started skimping out on the portions.   Expect to pay around $10 for a bowl of pho including tip.

GxUAQxLDj5-x_7giRKtLKg.text: Food quality: 4/5 The pho here is awesome! I loved my pho tai chin with some bo vien. It wasn't too hot and the noodles didn't stick together. The one thing I wasn't impressed with was the spring rolls which are something my girlfriend and I almost always get with our pho, hence the 4/5.  Customer service: 5/5 It's good for any sort of asian food place. The people were courteous, kept my water filled without me asking, and delivered the bill promptly/returned the receipts.  Ambiance: 4/5 The place is in the heart of asian town on Spring Mountain Rd. It's nice inside and smells strongly of pho (which is why you're going here, right??). The one thing I disliked was the fish tank looked quite unkempt while I was there, but that could have been something they were in the process of cleaning or something... Still, minus one star.

Rplc-sLuIEdCS-YxjfBojQ.text: Love it! Been going for 10 years!! Chicken pho rules!

RlnKMfiwG3-2Cw-L5YX4nA.text: I really dislike that my first ever yelp post is a negative one, but you the people deserve to know. I had once thought this was a great place, but that's till I actually tried out other authentic Vietnamese places right near this very one. On top of that I was stiffed on my egg roll order, and the manager neglected to correct their error saying that my party and I had already eaten the order. When this happened we decided that the service and respect that we were receiving were much less than desirable, and opted to no longer have our meals there. (Please take into account that all we had received in our egg roll order was 1, when the order should actually come with a total of 4). Of course since we all had not had anything to eat, we felt there should be nothing that we have to pay for and decided to walk out. Oh... was that a big mistake!!!! as we casually walked out to my car I was tackled by one of the employees, Literally to the ground and held there till the police arrived. This was truly a traumatic experience for me. I will never come back to this place again, and recommend you save yourself the time, and money as well.

LNrudFxqA8L7FA2Qae4hDA.text: Pho Kim long is located in china town or near it. Off of spring mountain. The parking is tight. They serve great food. I would rate their service a 9/10. They are fast speedy and helpful. They seated us right away and gave us our check without asking. The food is seasoned perfectly and is always satisfying. I love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho vegan

Qahke-hbkEM_I4oxUQ_gLw.text: This is my after club grub place to go too, no mater what time of day we go the staff is always friendly, funny and fast!!

K8RGIu7Kpq5pYI-_fXpTug.text: Average run of the mill ehh Pho place  Decor: nice clean interior  Pho is always the best hangover cure, however this place is an ehh.  The broth wasn't as flavorful and I felt like they were super stingy on the meat and veggies. One plate of veggies for 12 bowls? Really. =[ The plate of meat had 5 pieces all about half of a baseball size of the thawed frozen cut meat.  Overall - there are plenty of other Pho places that are better. Skip this one.

FdJ7P3E3zLYB1rurLncF7Q.text: thumbs down! This is the worst service in China town or all of vegas. We have been there 3 times out of convience and each visit has been more disappointing, we will not return.  THE Service is Teribble and on our third visit and first serious offense the manager was Very Rude and basically told us he did not need us. I was polite and patient the manager defensive and rude. But it was a simple complaint we did not get the food we ordered and the manager was Very rude to us when we Tryed to get the order correct he told us we had to pay for the wrong food.

A-fVrNVyfLgc4H-tjC9o4w.text: nothing cures a hangover like a good bowl of pho! we were most definitely surprised to find good pho in vegas of all places.  fairly large party, so we were separated into two tables. one group actually showed up a little later but were accommodated quickly considering it was a busy weekend lunch hour. they were also able to seat us fairly close.  in addition to pho, they also serve many other vietnamese rice and noodle dishes. we also ordered the chicken wings as an appetizer. lucky for us the portions are super filling so the chicken wings ended up a great after hours snack back at the hotel room.  they also have a super size which is seriously humongous! i don't remember if i saw that listed on the menu, but one of my friends was joking with the wait to super size her bf's order and the next thing you know they came out with one of the largest bowls of pho i've seen yet! too bad we didn't take a pic, it would've added to the prosthetics. but after all it is vegas! good thing the pho here is actually good, unlike the pho challenge in sf...

98tHMfxUViNTYnFBq_kMug.text: Not bad but def not great. My pho was a bit salty. Nice place though, great service.

0Dzx7cGCnZ59YvOwsDYEGQ.text: A friend took us here late night cuz this place was a local hole in the wall pho joint. i must say, its wayy better than the shit i taste in cali..would come back here if im in town again. but service was kinda horrible.. not surprised.. =I

3dOG9tFDpndGL51EKIVXHg.text: ive been here twice and want to really like it, but always found it to be sub par.  sure, the food is cheap and its open whenever you need food, but its always mediocre at best and sometimes tastes kind of funky.

sIu8SMKAOOpn9PjR0a56Nw.text: Forget the strip--I will fly down to Vegas just for this place's pho! Amazing broth, oh so nummy.  Great prices, too! We hit up this place right before heading down to the strip, at MIDNIGHT! haha I love that it's a family joint. The place was packed not only with twenty-somethings like me and my group of friends but with families with young kids. AT MIDNIGHT! Only in Vegas I guess? Anyway, even if I hadn't been starving I still would have found that delicious bowl of pho to be one of the best I've ever had, in Nevada or CA. Dammit, now I'm craving pho....

pDCsqsBalrZRYDo-qEcv7g.text: Decided to check out this pho place after some drinking and gambling.  The pho is just ok, probably average by SJ standard.  The broth could be hotter as mine was just warm.  Frankly, I get suspicious when the broth isn't steaming hot.   Anyhow, I just ate it and thought to myself, these out of towners just don't know what good pho tastes like.  I probably won't return, but I can now say I've been here and it's way over-rated.

i4mve0a8B48h_LTvQPj7fQ.text: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant here in Vegas. Great prices and service is really quick. Food is tasty as well. And most of all, 24 hours!!

Y0T8uGwNn3dae2I7DE7KPw.text: Thank god this place is 24 hours! Its treats my hangover no matter what time it is!!

mM_dJ8r1K7Vxq2gCFFjxFA.text: This place is my go to for pho. They're fast, consistent, cheap, and delicious.

1Z_JkruIecxSJrvvsjfdbA.text: I've been craving Pho, because I've had a killer cold for a week.  My friend suggested Vietnamese food, so I thought of Pho Kim Long.  I'm so glad we came here.  My first time here was w/ Susan R. and it was sort of an unsavory experience, not because of the company or the food, but because a certain a-hole that we both had the displeasure of knowing was the main topic of conversation, anyways, that's neither here nor there...  The Pho is great! My friend ordered the Orange Chicken and the Scallops with Black Bean Sauce.  I love the fresh ingredients in Vietnamese cooking, it really adds a distinct taste that sets it apart from Chinese food.  If you're gonna do Vietnamese, go to Pho Kim Long, I highly recommend it!

O8RMx4QRqT9EEyuSldD7-w.text: i got here at 9:30pm, but i got a seat of 3 people in 5 minutes. waiters were very friendly. the food came out really quick. i found the pho pretty good but the noodles little too cooked, but its fine. my sister's pad thai was amazing though, it tasted vietnamese style which i like.

Q93BWfuwo9PKq_oyutvwSw.text: Had dinner here on Monday night.  We ordered half a hai nan chicken, oyster hot pot, salt and pepper shrimp, and the pork chop combo rice plate.  The shrimp and the hot pot were good.  The hai nan chicken had no flavor at all.   The shredded pork in the combo plate came out cold.  It wasn't great but it wasn't awful either...  so hence the 3 star rating.

tWI4G9a67BQkOoxPSxKx-Q.text: Love this place. Just took down the shrimp rolls and some pho, always good no matter what time.

A1hVLeCHJP9LHo_MBund6Q.text: I've been here a few times. After the club and work after midnight.  Pho is good. I like the fact its only as good as you prepare it (adding the vegetables and condiments). You get a decent size bowl. The service isn't that friendly but lightning fast. We ordered spring rolls and they were there. Wow I was impressed. Food wasn't impressive but good especially for late night.

7xLXupQZgdUWFIVRR5UWhw.text: The rare beef pho is amazing! The best part is they're open 24 hours.

fpHZ4w5fhVjimOUCniO5PA.text: open 24hrs!! I ordered house special Fried Rice cost almost $10.00. Unbelievable!! Cost almost double compare to L.A.

JMvBDRe1TLrXfH9YNOX7bg.text: Came here a couple of days ago during lunch. Got in there and didn't know who the host was. We ended up having to write our name on a list. We had a group of 16 and were told it would be a half hour wait. Since it was over 100 degrees outside, our friends decided to go to the boba place right by since there wasn't any room in the restaurant to wait. When the lady asked who had a table of 16, we said that was us. She asked where everyone was and we let her know they were on the way. She then said she could not seat us if everyone wasn't there. We again said they were almost there and she told us she was going to give up our table. Luckily our friends ran in right then and there. They still missed a seat so our friend had to stand around for a couple of minutes. The pho was disgusting. It was so salty that no one at our table finished our bowls and I was only able to take two bites. One of my friends had to pour his water into the pho. Worst dining experience of my life. I would never recommend this place to anyone.

WP-5dbzZCBaicDCNWKZVCg.text: Best drunk food in Vegas especially since it's open 24 hours.  My favorites: bo kha and the bo luc lac.  If you're planning on attending a pool party the next morning, don't eat here.  Not only will the food take away ripples from your six pack but it will give you major shiiizzzzeettss.  But IMO, the food is worth it.

_5ekXggKG0AzyHa3NU4fVw.text: You know... definately not the best Pho on the planet by any means but after trying like 5 other places everytime I stop by Vegas in the last few years, this by far has been the best experience in terms of food, cleanliness, location, and service. It's no wonder why its the current hot spot for people to grab a late night bowl of sweet broth and tasty beef noodles. I would say, unless its packed up to the brink, this would be your go to for Pho in the town. It's not very far from the strip either and the prices are really good compared to your forty dollar buffets in the Casinos. They have a bunch of other stuff besides Pho too so if you're craving Asian/Viet this is your place. The Pho Ga (Chicken Noodles) weren't that great but that's my two cents.

_CspSKGB2-SHO-xIomuY9Q.text: This place has the best pho in the world- hands down.  In recent trips to Vegas I've visited this place almost every morning for that perfect bowl of pho (best cure for hangovers).  This place is very busy so service can be erratic at times, but overall, friendly and prompt service. I'll be back here many more times, I'm sure.

UK9sBEYT11DH4owvO35MVA.text: Great food great service! Great for a hangover cure after a long night out. 10/10 would recommend

uIknaqlYYMlJJ3zvNDjmMw.text: They have a huge menu to choose from but unfortunately there's not a description of what is in the dish. The menu has some small pictures of some of the items but because they are small it's still difficult to tell differences. Service is incredibly fast and the food is delicious.

MvQlqg6Ai47hY9l8Ed65xg.text: I would have normally given this place a 4 or a 5 but due to me ordering a VEGAN PHO (Tofu and no meat) a couple days ago and eating the left overs today I found chunks of hidden meat. I about barfed. It was labeled VEGAN. They need to be more careful. I probably will not be able to go back here for a while as I am still grossed out.

JHkL8qNnJx0wS2oO6sR4Bg.text: Ordered : Drunken Noodles (chicken),  delicious, good peanut flavor, could use a little more basil flavor. Overall I would order this dish again!   Salt & Pepper chicken wings, had a sweet cinnamon flavor, garlic was good. I would not order again.   Vietnamese Coffee was delish but too much ice, I wanted more of, too much ice left me a 1/2 cup...   Fresh coconut drink was cold and fresh...   Overall well come back to try additional menu items!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Young Coconut
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Drunken Noodles
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt and pepper wings

F6RPIpYI09Z-8SOoUmf1nw.text: (Duck review) I know no Vietnamese Lasvegan favor this place because everytime I talk to Vietnamese people, they don't recommend here. They recommend me Saigon 8. I've been here a couple of times and the food and the service is always good to me. I never had authentic Vietnamese food in my life. Well, I come here for duck. I eat pho, too but the main purpose of me coming here is duck. Their duck is reasonably priced and pretty good (not too fatty). It's super crowded everytime I come here that I have to wait 30 min to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sopDn2CNOzjbahJMi_mDbQ.text: Pho Kim Long brings me so much joy. I love pho so much (probably more than anyone else). I love scouting out new pho places and sure there are some other awesome places but I always say "it's nothing like moms! For some apparent reason I see pho Kim long the mother of pho.  Pho Kim Long has a variety of Vietnamese cuisine from delish appetizers, soups, meat & rice entrees and of course my favorite Thai Tea!  *tip- when you get your bill, simply get up and go to the register to pay *

4XR3ARVOBLQcje6f8Wqq9g.text: It's a local spot for me and my family. Large selection of food, decent seating capacity, wonderful staff. Oh, I almost forgot, it's OPEN 24 hours! Only down side is that it can get really busy especially at night and on the weekends. Holidays are generally packed but to be honest, it's a hit or miss with lines out of the door. You just have to be lucky. Overall, love the food, the staff knows me surprisingly (flattered), but great staff, and will always be going back.

FMJ_lGra4fAvmW_IHknBWA.text: Used to eat here on a regular basis. The service was never the greatest but the food would make up for the mediocre service. I would even recommend this place to tourists for the great food but after our last trip in for dinner I probably won't be back anytime soon. The food was hardly edible and the beef was like chewing leather, the menus were disgusting and most likely haven't been cleaned ever and the front of the restaurant is very unorganized and the meals came out before our appetizer.  It used to be worth the wait to eat there but not anymore..

3bvYeRTor-Ml35nOtUy53Q.text: This is our goto place for pho in lv. It's fast & efficient. But on this visit there's no tripe or tendon in pho Dac biet.

lwnol7vHqJTnbgRTW1pyqg.text: Great mixture of Vietnamese and Chinese food. Pho is one delish dish. Flavors are consistent, always busy from late afternoon until almost 5am. The food is quick, most servers will stop and help each other's tables. It's worth the wait. Pho is especially good in the winter spring, fall and winter seasons!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Rangoon appetizer
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt and pepper Pork chop
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried chicken with Garlic

33F1T6IZ_hw1JPPt39Rj0A.text: It may be that I wasn't feeling it after 3 straight days of raging HARD at EDC... but this place was okay.   I give it 3 stars because the broth was really salty to me.   Props for getting our table 15-20 minutes for a group of 7  Props for the iced coffee though.   Props for actually putting big pieces of tendon in the pho  Mad props for keeping our water glasses full.    I'm sure if I had a regular alcohol hangover I would have felt better and ate better and maybe it wouldn't be as salty to me, but... until then, next time!

vnhICcsjJtvj4pnjJHvCTw.text: It ain't what it used to be anymore. And used to be is like last year.   This spot used to be banging. Nowadays it taste like cheap effortless shit. They ain't even got grilled chop chop. It's "charbroiled" with some garbage sauce.   PKL why you ruining memories for.

Z0bIrmYwrMqdHRnByKvzEg.text: Pros: food has a great taste Located near the strip  Cons: LONG seating time Store is u kept and outdated Bathroom is gross  I like the taste of Pho Tam and also the crab Rangoon! It's so delicious!! The table is sticky which I do not like but I'm guessing it's a pattern at Vegas restaurants. Service is fast but seating time is slow. Overall, I enjoy the food and how the pho broth is not salty or butter. It's just right and the shrimp doesn't taste like iron. It's fully deshelled, which is a plus. Good place to eat Pho.

qPJYLp7VTzSBCCoxAg2XYw.text: Really good pho! There was a bit of wait but was totally worth it. Fast service and the food tasted great. My boyfriend and I both had the steak and brisket pho small bowls and it was plenty.

M0GV4P4aRHTyRBb-71FKhw.text: Pho Kim Long is pretty much my first stop whenever I fly into Vegas. They're open 24/7 and I always enjoy having some noodles after a long plane ride.
