Their location is also easy to find with lots of parking available.  I always order some pho, egg rolls, and the tofu nuggets. I love their pho broth. It's always been one of my favorite places for pho and I hope that never changes. The egg rolls are crisp and flavorful. And even though tofu nuggets sound weird, they're super yummy, too.  Basically, I show up at this place without fail every time I'm in Vegas and I will continue to do so as long as the food is yum-tastic.

9FPZa9pF5RCSpuKhylmlRw.text: Came here for the 1st time on Sunday after a sleepless night. I was starving and wanted a quick breakfast that was on the way home because I was really wanting to finally get some sleep. It was 7 am and this seemed to be the only place open in Chinatown so it was my perfect opportunity to finally try it.  I was craving pho the last couple weeks which naturally guided me to select from the pho section of their extensive menu. I went with a #13 which was a beef combination pho and included meatballs, tendon, rare beef and brisket. The broth and noodles were right on point with its flavor and wasn't too bland or strong like at some other spots. The meats were good, except for the meatballs which had a weird taste to it.   This is a fairly large restaurant and probably the biggest pho place I've seen. Do people have parties here like they do at Chinese restaurants? Let's have a pho-king party! Being 24/7 definitely is also a plus and I'll have to keep this place in mind for late night or early morning outings.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #13 combination pho

n5Os0S0GrktzQTJgn07x2g.text: Best PHO in Vegas!!! It is a must after a night out!! Definitely a hangover cure!!! Only place where the PHO is so tasty and juicy that it blows minds . My new slogan for Pho Kim Long is "when you go to Pho Kim Long two nights in a row; it is great Pho!" Thank you for your professionalism and awesome food

srujcgLMfQcNJ-p6SRu2Rw.text: Pho Kim Long is one of those popular after hours eateries. When you are partying all night or just working long hours ... and craving a hot bowl of soup ... then it is the place for you. Open all night long ... Always crowded, prepare to wait for the table.  It is completely different atmosphere in a daytime than the night time. Most likely very loud crowd at late night!   We were eating here forever, breakfast, lunch, dinner, everything between. Food is tasty and affordable. We love Pho, so we eat it often. Tried almost all from the menu. Our other favorite menu items  are: Sweet and sour pork; Seafood clay pot; Oysters in black bean sauce; House special fried rice, and many other things. Pretty much we like everything ...  Service is fast and average. We are going to keep coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House special fried rice (to go order)
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad thai (chicken &amp; shrimp) to go order.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #29.

dvFR1Fk6HiH2GjQP1Sg8zA.text: The pho was excellent; however, there is a long wait to be seated. I would definitely go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California roll.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BmPDnoLaH8j89_jaJi4ppA.text: The food is fantastic!! Tasty and delicious, lots of variety. And you can't beat 24/7!! But the service is ATROCIOUS, especially the guy you have to deal with when you order take out. He doesn't acknowledge you at all when you walk up. The interactions have repeatedly been marked with long awkward silent pauses and no semblance of any courtesy. I have dined in as well and service there is slightly better but still not great.

Bq0QmOg8pMHuYoEv4_x6xg.text: By far favorite pho place in vegas aways fresh broth hot I don't like the waiting lines sometimes but very well worth it aways recommended and aways coming back.

KgMpVDHCPjNDFF92LmIIjQ.text: For the hundreds of great reviews, I was disappointed. Service was poor, hard to get our server's attention when we wanted a spoon and definitely rushed due to the huge crowd. One of our entree's orders didn't go through and thus waited a long time. Pho broth was watery, skimpy on the meat, meat itself thin, overall not good. Any other pho place would do better than this place honestly, and I'm a lenient pho rater, not a Cali pho-snob.

dl2VLThQvqAR7PPuv1cFCA.text: My food was to-go and my friend recommended pork chops, rice, salad and a pork dumpling or something on the side. The pork chops was very DELICIOUS!! Lots of green onions on the pork chops so if you like pork chops...order it. Can't wait to eat this again.

GTbeaG0YLlscd4wkYoPu4Q.text: Extremely rude patrons, specially KEN, the manager.  I ordered fried rice and Vegan Pho , to my disbelief the rice wasn't fried and my Pho was lukewarm, so I waved the server down and asked him to have the rice re-fried, the fried rice I received afterwards was bathed in oil and mushy.  I asked one of the random servers to take it back after waiting over five minutes for someone to come check and see if I was satisfied.  I asked for a freshly prepared rice dish and again  I got mushy fried rice!   I stood up and walked to the cashier, the cashier is the manager, well this m*t*h*e*r%^&*#$, told me how this is how  traditional fried rice is made, and that this is the way they make the rice, and that he wasn't my servant, a comment he made after I told him how the customer is always right .  I proceeded to tell him how it wasn't traditional fried rice and that I wasn't  going to eat it or pay for something that I haven't eaten, he refused to give me my money back and told me to dispute it with my bank.  I came back to my table and the security guard asked me to step outside, I was embarrassed, cold, and my girl was left hungry.   I was treated like a drunk fool, and I wasn't even drunk.  The security guard tried to mediate the situation having me and my girl wait outside in the cold while he would go inside and talk to Ken the manager.  Well, the guard told me that Ken didn't want to deal with the situation anymore and that he was just going to make the fried rice (to go) one more time and that he was done bartering with me.   p.s.  food is overpriced and their quality doesn't match, spend your money elsewhere.

V_oplRc4LAg8i7O3tJI-JA.text: i think everyone on the planet knows about this place? whether it's cus of the name... or the 24/7 pho nearby strip? it was yummy, the service was FAST, almost too fast...   loved it, will go back again if i feel like i need some pho fix in Vegas!

qW0vCOf7PcnocquwnTu74Q.text: One time, I stoped by and walk away imidiately, so many people, it is very long line. After that, another time I went with my friends. This PHO is very good, this taste is not Truely Vietnamese but that is why many US people love that :)

IY4HGvAVTxmQdGwBqQH7Fg.text: Ok it was late night and we were both trashed, it was about 2am and we had just left Sapphire so we decided to get some pho before we went back to her place., any way service was good and i felt safe knowing that there was 2 security officers on duty in and outside of this place which i thought was a nice touch., i guess a big ass fight had broken out before and things got out of control.. good place to go when hammered and hungry, food came out fast and we were eating our bowls about a little under 10 minutes right after we sat., that's just my experience at night. I've made an attempt to come here at around noon and the place was packed which i totally understand but i wasn't trying to wait around too long to get my bowl so i went to the one around the corner, OVERALL i liked it and would patronize here again.

4YYNb0REAWJhApIklUKQ9w.text: This place is awesome! The pho was so authentic! We also ordered a sandwich, I must say that the bread was some of the best  I've ever had ! Its a must !

wjMmxqIEem4avq0rmyFq2w.text: Yea to expencsive and the staff believes that they are so busy customer service is out the window.

OFwvZlsIrQxKQ2R1ZbAN7Q.text: The 24/7 pho spot. I've been here a few times. One time at 7 in the morning they were bumping EDM. Not cool when you're hungover. Other than that, the food is decent.

E33SlMJYWuvQtVa-tLs_qg.text: Best pho place in Las Vegas. They are extremely fast and are 24 hours. The price are decent and the food is really good.

-XMUq6exFO6Igp29IVe93w.text: The pho here is decent, but the service is atrocious! Went in for 20 mins just to be seated and 10 mins later nobody took our order or got us drinks. We told a server we were ready to order and he started walking away and saying VERY rudely "in a few minutes"

77PTmw0hnfiNjrJKZROEhQ.text: Hands down the best pho in Las Vegas! I will go out of my way to eat here even if it's a busy time of day. I've tried a few other dishes and they are all amazing as well, you can't go wrong with anything here.

DIBGixUSHGDgCQZvvQJJUA.text: I give one star not for the food but for the service! We had a very bad experience today during lunch time. Our server was a male old asian guy. I forgot to get his name because we just want to get out of this place asap! He was so rude and sarcastic! Hope the management will talk to him so he will straighten up!

9PP9xzapnL10nH5kMcdYLg.text: As most have already mentioned, this good is perfect for hangovers. If you get this sober however, you might be a bit disappointed.   The perks of Pho Kim Long is that it is 24 hours. The staff is friendly. The food is also cooked and ready within minutes. The best time to come is early afternoon. No wait :)

VKkGAMfIK7-CWQVe16cU4w.text: Had high expectations since a lot of my friends raved about it. First off, the service is horrible. Took about 15 mins to get seated when it wasn't even that busy. Took another 15 mins to get our orders taken. Second, My pho dat biet came out super salty, my moms vegan pho the veggies weren't even cooked & salty & my dad's pho came out cold. Won't come back.

U5LHcacK3feNZYJ7FqbGiw.text: I came here sober in the morning and intoxicated at night on the same day because it was that good! They are open 24 hours for the party goers and late night eaters.  I strongly recommend the fried chicken wings because it's so bomb! They even have the ones marinated in fish sauce (nuoc mam) which had TONS of flavors. The fried calimari was also good being crunchy and topped with flavored seasonings. The Pho here is perfect after a long night of drinking to sober you out. I had the beef and meatballs (Pho Tai Bo Vien) twice and it was delicious both times. My friends had the chicken and complain it was too dry..  Service was great, food came out quick and the decor had a modern Asian feeling to it. Great place and I will surely come here again in my next Vegas trip.

HCqie2-eXp3AP1op_zEhoA.text: Good Pho especially for late night cravings. It costs a little bit more compared to Pho So 1 but I don't mind sometimes.  Good atmosphere, very big restaurant with decently cleaned bathrooms. The only thing to really complain about is their customer service. I rate it as poor. But then again, I never have high expectations of asian restaurants in their customer service category. The only best customer service at an asian restaurant I've ever had was Sushi Freak and Mashisoyo.

CFNxavZSKzvv35gV65fStw.text: This place has changed a lot over the last few years. Probably because of the popularity. Open 24 hours and has quite a mix of patrons coming through which is cool but the staff is becoming lackadaisical and I notice ego and that's not a good sign. I hope they fix a few staff problems because this used to be one of my favorite places to eat pho. Now? Not so much. Almost too popular which is why they seem to be losing their professionalism. Maybe just a bad night but very different from when I remember in the past. Was 2am and the server couldn't careless about everyone else except the table full of girls sitting across. Forgot several items and was still charged for them. No point in complaining because my meal was already ruined.

vNFuLSRHqF0YSgfktHjO2A.text: Big banner on the outside prints Best Pho in Las Vegas?  But taste all the same to me.

D9Y6-wAeOGGM7_q0mPsO9w.text: Overall it was good. Before going inside there was a line out the door, however seating was immediate. They brought over water and took the order. Spring rolls came first which were delicious. Then the calamari (which I did send back because of the amount of grease pouring out of it). Then the vegan pho was served. It was delicious. I've been here before and it's always a hit with me! Absolutely fresh and flavorful. Not too salty! Great amount of veggies, and plenty of smiling faces. Good place for large families although expect a longer than usual wait time for a table! They are always busy

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan phô which was phenomenal!!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari, was sent back because it was too greasy, and the squid flavor was drowned in the flavorless deep fried batter
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken egg roll

jP1cQWOI9brCagYVT_7gSA.text: My friends and I came here to eat before we ventured back to California.....idk why we picked to eat Pho on a 109 degree day, but we did and the long wait didn't help since it was busy which meant other people were probably thinking the same shit as us eating on this hot ass day. The pho is by no means the best nor the worst, it just hit the spot in filling our stomachs, nothing really stood out from this pho. I ordered the special (I forgot what it was called, but it had everything that was suppose to come in the pho). The bowl size on the special is the largest so the waiter won't ask which size you want. Price is whatever, some people say its high compared to other places in Vegas, I haven't been to any other, so basing it off from the prices in California, about a tad above average I guess. The service wasn't bad, our drinks got refilled when we asked, we got our neccesary things.

sAoNwlmUBpQB9hkiIPlPzw.text: Great pho in vegas, tasty, unkind staffs (maybe their cultural stuffs), overall 4 stars^^  Ill come back for next time.

j8GU1P3w7KGwtzqFsMQlQg.text: If you come from California this restaurant can not compare to any cali restaurant.  But with another state this should be ok Another + is they open earlier than another restaurant around here.  Com tam and pho is good over here in my opinion.

I95Vu0jC1WeX4MAuw7GZAg.text: One of the best Pho place in Las Vegas. In if onto those kind of food, you should definitely try this place. It is open 24 hrs . The place usually busy, but they try to get people in & out real A.S.A.P. The wait time us reasonable, even on busy hours. The food is great, from pho to seafood to rice plates. The prices are somewhat reasonably to somewhat pricy, but I can tell that is worth it. The servers are ok and ambiance is alright.  You should definitely try this place without hesitation!

nwGJyZsmEsuURgjm5qeUjw.text: The only good thing about this place is that it's open 24 hours. Most disgusting pho I've ever had. Not only was the soup gross but the beef ball was very flavorless and nasty. I would not come back here.

tCwIp2i4WcCZ6T-Gnc5i6A.text: The pho here is the best I've ever had! Super tasty! My only complaint is that they don't have a good system for seating. We waited a very long time to be seated because it was very unclear if we needed to sign in or wait for a hostess. Definitely a must try place though.

j04wm8iUEgYoeHp-fI_p7A.text: I dunno know so good about this place? Pho was salty and doesn't taste like pho. Bun bo hue is water down broth with lots of pho meats. I wouldn't recommend anyone to come here. Bad food.

VUNu3l63t1qRJSkZ2QC8GA.text: Fine stir-fry dishes can be found in this IT spot. I vaguely remember the pho, but people love them and they are served generously.    Item #122: Chicken with seasonal greens is delicious plate of sliced tender chicken, brocolli, Chinese brocolli, baby bok choy, carrots, bean sprouts, and ginger in a salacious opaque sauce is almost perfect. Probably loaded with MSG...but delicious. The calamari is a guilty pleasure for me. It's greasy, heavy breaded and sprinkled with a fried I'm-not-sure-what-to-call-it, but it resembles hair dandruff on steroids. I will eat it anytime.  Parking is baffling and amusing. The lot is tight and small. I witnessed people yell at each other due to near collisions. Service is no-nonsense and apathetic. At the end of the day, they're not here to make friends and will probably throw you under the bus.

RcLKm1JGefOTKKGg3r0Wew.text: This would be equivalent to Mai s restaurant In houston. I tried their rice pork chop I love the style of cooking when they , carameliz the sugar. Yummy I lick this  porkchop.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GIHvpua8tn4E1HNvaDQysQ.text: This is my first time that ate in this restaurant. I took my family here for late dinner as we spent too much time on strip during the night, we thought this should be a great place to enjoy Vietnamese food. After 30+ minutes standing waited for table then we waited for another 15 minutes for waiter, and then another 20 minutes to get pho on our table. Pho is OK, not as good as other said and reviewed. Pho supposed to be hot and smelled good (and real hot too) but this pho is so warm or even it was not "warm" enough in every bows. The service was below average; a man who was a waiter seem to be not speak well English and also seem to be not very polite during servicing/taking orders from customers.

2WP9iXDjISrVqYLkH-4B3A.text: Went here last night with a couple of friends for the first time in a while because they were craving pho.  It was a fairly busy early Saturday morning.  We were sat pretty quickly which was nice, happy that they have such a quick turnover for tables.  The food is consistently good every time I come here.  Today the dish I usually order (pork chop w/ baked egg) was extra delicious!  They had a special salt & pepper eggplant that was pretty good as well.  The only reason I took away a star was because they forgot my drink order and when I asked for utensils they also forgot to bring some by.  They didn't check on us after all the food was dropped off and we had to go to the counter to get our check.  But all in all, still a great late night place to get your Asian food fix after a night out of clubbing or work!

9IDoHcejO8EHdb04n2MxxQ.text: Great food service and Hot girls oops i meant pho lol haha must go trust me!! Always the best spot After the clubs on the strip! Place to go

xreD1dO2fK_ov7URv1gsGA.text: The food here is not what it used to be. I find it difficult to even get an employee's attention when I was trying to ask for extra napkins. For the Pho, the soup and noodles are fine, but the beef ball tastes rather strange.

vlyBdi4RG5OZejSdHdcXyQ.text: I'm from LA so I am used to pretty good pho. I wasn't disappointed. They have really delicious food here. Decently priced as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pho and green beans. Both really good!

biQr55eqVopqgxXwZsDrJA.text: I had this place bookmarked since my last trip to Vegas (June 2013) but had never had a chance to try it. With my most recent trip to Vegas being a bit longer of a stay.... finally, I had enough time to make it out to this 24/7 pho joint. I'm glad I did!!  First off, the Crab Rangoon was so good that I ordered a second order... (don't worry, I was sharing haha). So definitely try that!   For my main dish, I ordered the beef and flank pho... sooooo delicious! I think I'm getting the hang of how to eat pho! I'm still quite the novice pho eater, so I don't have a bunch to compare to... but the pho I had in Hawaii was on par with this establishment.  To be honest, this place was a lot bigger than I imagined and a lot nicer, too. For a place thats open 24hrs a day, I figured it'd be a little hole in the wall... but there is ample seating and the ambience is surprisingly a slight step above casual. (Though you can stroll in here casual, dont worry).

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0bf6OwEonF2uR5wXplf88A.text: The fact it's open 24 hours is the reason I went in the first place. I've been a couple times and the service was always really fast and pretty friendly. I particularly like the fact they have vegan/vegetarian items, as it's always a downer when you can't get Vegan Pho at a restaurant. The prices are inexpensive and you get a lot of food. I've also had the veggie nuggets which were great and the thai tea.

TSdHDNP_A151kFnWhjRAOQ.text: Unbelievable. This place is a joke! The employees and manager are beyond ridiculous.   Here is the story. My mother and I had gone right now and had ordered some food and one of the many foods we ordered was Chicken Pad Thai. When our dish came out and we ate couple chopstick full & looked at this so called "chicken" that was thinly sliced, chewy and what seemed and look like fat attached was simply "pork".   Like any customers would, we called over our waiter, he took it back unsure as well than ANOTHER waiter aggressively came back with the dish and claimed it was chicken. We argued about this for several mins & because we didn't want to make a bigger scene we told him to take the dish back.   NOW, this next part gets better. As we continue to eat our rest of the food, the waiter and his other employees gather around near by we were sitting and have the nerves to talk about our situation and laugh about it. So, as a customer I was furious. Asked for the manager to let him be aware of his employees behavior. Of course -_- manager isn't any better with his behavior so possibly that's why his employees aren't any better either -_- so anyways, manager comes to our table, not making any eye contact with me and fights for his employees (which is understandable defending his employees). Finally got an apology and ended the conversation.   This gets even better, once the check arrives, we were charged for Chicken Pad Thai (in most case in other restaurants, the dish is taken off the check) so we only paid for what we only ate and with that kind of a crappy service, we didn't leave tip. As we were leaving, the manager came out to our car and told us we didn't pay enough. This is how the conversation went:  Manager: "you didn't pay enough!" Me: "no, we paid for what we ate." Manager: "shut up!"  So at this point, I was beyond furious and got out of our car and went up to him and he had the nerve to say he didn't tell me to shut up. So now I'm apparently gone crazy and hearing things -_- then he aggressively argues with me that I didn't pay enough, so I had to RE-EXPLAIN to him that we ONLY paid for what we actually ate and not what was taken back (since we didn't eat it!).   This is where he failed miserably as a manager...not only did he verbally fight back, tell me to shut up, but he had his biggest nerves to tell me my service was unwanted there and for me to "go to hell".   Uhm, are you serious right now?! How in the world can a restaurant manager say all that to a customer?????!!!!!! My mind was so blown away. Un-freaking-believe-able! For sure NEVER going back there and it is such a disappointment cause I been going there for many years now. I seriously think they are so full of it!       This doesn't even deserve a (1) star but I have to give something to leave a review...FML -_-

JlxG12JdeO_u7dZBoDGQJA.text: I was stoked to find out there was a Chinatown in Las Vegas! We were craving Asian food after a weekend and lucked out with getting sat in a half hour. Worth the wait, but there are plenty of other Vietnamese spots in the area too choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls

jz7ukt7HXUvvjzZZiD0Akw.text: don't know how people rate this place more than 2 stars. The Pho was not good at all. Pad Thai had no flavor. kinda made me sick to my stomach. much better places at better prices.

YFtUiXImjfxAjfeF4uIxww.text: TERRIBLE SERVICE. Don't waste your time going here unless it's THEE last resort on your list. Food is satisfactory, good to get you through the day/night.

J472r04M9QXnH2hHzY35Rg.text: Not bad at all! I was pleasantly surprised! Restaurant had a nice ambience to it, clean and pretty spacious! Definitely not like OC pho places!  I got pho tai nam and egg rolls! The broth was pretty addicting and tasty! I figured out why a bit later: MSG. I'm a walking MSG radar because for some reason my body resists it and Induces all sorts of symptoms...headaches, itchy nose, eyes get slightly watery, and queasy feelings! I felt really sick so I had to stop eating it.  Egg rolls were really good, hit the spot for some reason! Probably hits the spot for everyone who goes to this restaurant. Pho is the remedy after a crazy, drunken night(s) and hangovers.   Enjoy! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eats like a True viet

JbS1Qra1RAMPjT-wjQQczA.text: I'll start off by saying I love Pho Kim Long! So you're probably thinking "well, your two star rating doesn't really indicate that". It doesn't. I love the pho and the food in general. It's great! I've had pho at a few other places and it's just not the same. I also love that this place is open like 24 hours (maybe they close at some point, but I'm pretty sure I've ended up here past two a.m) The chicken pad thai is pretty freaking bad ass too!   So the reason for my two star rating is because I've had pretty crappy customer service at this place. I like to rate food establishments based on a few standards....quality of food, cleanliness, and customer service! Quality of food gets an A+, however, the other two categories fail miserably. I've been here plenty of times, which gives this place a lot of chances to improve their customer service, and they just don't!   One time we had to wait forever (which you can usually expect if you're going on the weekend or anytime during the dinner rush) and our waiter was just generally unpleasant. Nothing specific, just a bad attitude. The most recent visit, the waitress brought over our water and said she'd give us a few minutes, which happened to be maybe twenty minutes (I'm indecisive, but I don't need twenty whole minutes to choose my dinner). The water had a very tiny bug in it, which I really didn't think was a huge deal. I don't get grossed out easily so I just asked for another one. What really kind of got me thinking was how calm and casually the waiter reacted to it. He just nonchalantly said "Oh, sorry. I'll bring you another one" and quietly walked away with my bug infested water. Not the worst part. While still enjoying my pho and chatting with my girlfriend I was asked TWICE if I was finished with my food and almost got my plate taken away if I didn't respond fast enough! That was the deal breaker for me. I like to take my time when I eat, especially if I'm having good company and good conversation. So that really irked me. I felt rushed and uncomfortable. I wasn't asked if I wanted a box for my leftover food (didn't really want one, but I feel like servers should always ask, specially if there's a lot of food left on the plate). There's been other occasions in which they just refuse to accommodate a simple request or just show absolutely no enthusiasm. Lame!  So, in conclusion, if you want good pho and shitty customer service. This is the spot!

s3i2mc5LFKiVPFEouULgYQ.text: If you are in need of decent, cheap pho and various Vietnamese comfort foods, this place will not disappoint. Though not at the level of places in Westminster or San Jose, I feel the tranquility that only an ethnic foodie dive can offer to escape the strip. The pho is tasty, the fried rolls are satisfying and the pork chops are seasoned expertly. It's open all hours so spend the money on a cab and get your hungry self over there-it will save you money on that strip club you were considering. Plus a great hangover prevention move.

wyX1ptiOHnHmCleK1xVTWQ.text: First time here and wasnt very impressed. A lot of my friends come and enjoy the food here and I stopped here for a late lunch.  I ordered the Pho Tai Chin -Soup was ok -noodles were ok  Nothing special nothing bad.  service was good and prices seem fair. I would have to give this place another try

hNOsKYMMgw9CqgrLnD04Wg.text: Best Pho ever! Expect exceptional service and great prices. Order the #14! Don't miss out!!!

Gl4VytoviwFmy7_WMYBqiQ.text: Came here with a group of friends after a night of drinking and clubbing for them. Pretty spacious place and got seated right away. It seems that if you order pho it comes out super fast because our friend ordered it and it came out in no time. I ordered Bun Bo Hue because it's one of my favorite dish as I don't like pho too much. WOW it was SUPER DELICIOUS! I usually don't get the sauce on the side like that and it made the soup really flavorful. It was a good size portion too and it has to be one of the best ones I've eaten. Although it may not be the cheapest but it was worth the money. My bf ordered the Singapore noodles and he really liked it! You can definitely taste and smell the curry spices in the noodles. I would come back to this place again for the Bun Bo Hue!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bo Bon Hue!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q5Xel6Y70lXGSK3TzutySA.text: 4 stars for being open 24 hours and having a sweet name....  2 stars for eh food.  I was pretty sobered up by the time we got here, maybe it's ah-mazing when you're drunk?  My bun with bbq chicken and spring rolls was ok.  Mike C. didn't like his roasted chicken with rice at all, said it was super dry.  The pho was eh, not the best.  The porridge was tasteless, had to add hoison and fish sauce to it just for the sake of adding some flavor. They did have a pretty decent variety on their menu from what I remember and our dishes came out pretty quick.  1 star for my friend having to wait forever for his fried rice.  Everyone got their dishes before he did.  Fried rice?  That should be the first thing out, I was about to go to the kitchen and whip some up myself.  1 star for bad service.  The servers gave looks like they hate their life and lagged on getting our check and filling our waters.  Sure it's 3am and they probably don't want to be there let alone put up with a bunch of drunk Asians, especially some of the ghetto fabulous ones I saw there.  But sorry, you're in customer service so please try to fake it for us at least.  1 star for being stranded here because our crazy ride ditched us and we had to walk along the street to flag down a taxi to take us back to the strip.  This place is not walking distance from the strip but only 10 minutes away by car.  Ok this isn't Pho Kim's fault, but just thought I"d add it in anyways haha  I'd only come here again if I had a ride locked down and super drunk so I couldn't taste anything or care about service.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun with bbq chicken and spring rolls

3GrhlLkh4GUC-nLxgSFz0Q.text: I typically rate places based on food and food alone. However this is an exception and will explain why.  My husband and his friends stopped here (at my recommendation and others) for lunch and enjoyed delishly prepared and priced food. The group walked out the door when my husband realized he left his phone on the table.  He turned back around (maybe 1 minutes time passed) went to the table where it was being cleaned and asked the waiter did someone see my phone it was right there. To which the guy replied "no" and kept "working"  Annoyed and confused the group returned to the hotel by cab. I decided to whip out my phone and locate his.  Low and behold we look at the iphone locator only to find that the iphone (30 min later) was in a car in the employee parking lot behind the restuarant. We were mid-tanning so we figured we'd head over there in the next hour. An hour later it was still thre so they try and hail a cab and locate the phone only to see it moving- in the car that the EMPLOYEE---  Eat at your own risk- keep your phones hidden these employees have no common courtesy.

FJ2UhvcPJP8zzZRpq31lEw.text: Our server barrel spoke English, which made ordering and asking about menu items difficult. We asked about the clay pot dishes, and all he could tell us was that it took 30 minutes to make and that we wouldn't like it. Jason HATES when people.. ahem me.. tell him he won't like it, and he would have ordered it but was too hungry to wait.  Calamari: DELICIOUS! Definitely the highlight of the meal- garlic covered fried calamari. YUM! Seafood Sizzler Platter: BLAND!!! This was one of the most expensive dishes on the menu, and I was so disappointed by how bland it was. There was more calamari than anything else (a bummer after we split a huge appetizer of calamari). I didn't finish the plate, and didn't bother taking it home. That says a lot.  Pork-Bowl Thing (Jason ordered it by photo): The pork was really good, but the rest of the bowl lacked creativity. He wasn't a fan of how much salad was in the bowl, and the sauce was bland.   Upon leaving, I asked the server if they accepted AmEx, he told me yes so I left my card with Jason before I went to the restroom. When I came back, I was told that they don't accept American Express, just "regular cards". Huh? Again, language barrier. Frustrating.  PROS: Calamari was good  CONS: Language barrier Service unhelpful No checkup on how food was Bland food  All in all, I definitely won't be back

yFTsV5b0doohic8y496wGw.text: Im just A-OK about this place.  Props for it being open 24/7...and its a spot where my friends and I go to when were not sober...specifically around 4-6 AM in the morning. I can eat pho anytime...and pretty much everyday. I love pho & I love it even more when Im not sober. THIS IS EXACTLY HOW I KNOW whether its a guud pho place. Going intoxicated to a restaurant is similar to wearing beer goggles when checking out chicks. They all look/taste that much better. Coming to Pho Kim Long...yah i was intoxicated...so I should love the food even more right? For me, it was a No. I was satisfied (but not too satisfied), it was just A-OK, and I was starving like a hungry hippo.  Service was great though, but the food was just A-OK for me.  UNTIL THEN!! ^-^

cXcFftMLEM-OtMT89vBl5A.text: Such a great place for a great price! Was recommended to me & completely made my night. Will be back next time in Vegas!

I1-SQObptrAWKXfdPkyL-g.text: Pho Kim Long is the shiznitz! This place is a must go for me everytime I am in Vegas. You know what they say about pho... Best hangover cure ever! Anyway, I've been going here since I hit 21 with my friends. The prices are so reasonable and their food is absolutely amazing and hits the point everytime. One of my friend who was craving for it this past weekend when we were in Vegas, woke up from her nap and seriously drove there just to pick up the togo order, with a two hour time frame to get ready before going to Marquee. That is how good it is! Haha and she's not even Asian! Pho does the body good. I always get Pho Tai Chin, which is well done steak and rare steak. Their Roasted Chicken plate with seasonal rice is bombdotcom!   I'm Vietnamese and I know how pho should taste like. Go here if you crave for some pho while your visit in Vegas! I promise you will not be disappointed!

6tgKHAo_7tbs8GHz7LH_zg.text: Used to like it until I got tired of the horrible service and the food just wasn't hitting the spot.

SiA7Br88ud7tsyXOe_AL0g.text: Probably the must go place after a wild night at a club. This place is pretty darn good for pho. It is about $7-8 for bowl of pho.   Pros:  Takes Card Open 24 Hours Fast service Easy Parking Spacious  Clean  Cons: gets super busy around 2-3

gtz6erDwo7NLclYWKFUTwA.text: Always made it a point to stop by for Pho when in town.. Love the 24 hour service

ObVFPBg9XZFVLKSHM4qlAw.text: The best pho in town! I always go here, specially when it's a rainy day and it delivers what I'm looking for, some warm delicious soup!   Also, they have a huge menu of thai fare.

ObRq54SDaYi3z2O2SvlUMw.text: This to me is the after hours spot where you go after a night out. Great food served all day and night long. Although I'm not a big pho fanatic, I love this place for everything else. I usually order the pad Thai, crab rangoons and Thai tea here. Never disappoints.

OhsN8e4YYANO-EizSREVVw.text: The only thing after a long night of partying is some good warm food! Service is fast and honestly at 4 am I can careless of personalized customers service cuz I feel bad they have to deal with us drunks. This place is  phonemonal

Mx90P4ScEfylLW43AScvyA.text: This is one of my most favorite places here in Las Vegas. At any given time, this place is always packed - we even had a 20-min wait one time at close to 11pm!  But we endure the wait, which turned out to be not as long as we anticipated.  My favorite is their Rare Steak and Brisket soup. The broth is full of flavor. I've tried a lot of different places around Las Vegas but no one has broth like they serve here.  I also like ordering their spring rolls. It comes with sides of bean sprouts, mint leaves and lime and you wrap it with lettuce leaves. Yummy!  On our latest visit, we ordered the Japanese noodles. We keep forgetting to order it every-time we come here and finally this time we remembered it before we were already full. It was really scrumptious. No wonder why almost every table we saw had ordered this as well.  The fish stew was also delightful. The fish was tender and not overcooked. It was sauteed with ginger, which gave it a clean flavor. It was so good, I was conflicted whether I wanted to make more room for that or the rare steak pho that I usually order. I ended up eating the former and took the rest of the latter home.  As for my 4 star rating, as good as their food is, I take away a star bec of their service. The staff isn't very friendly and most of the time, their service is lousy. Lousy service won't keep me from coming back to this place though - I would just ignore it and look at my bowl of soup and it completely makes up for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare Steak and Brisket Pho

t4lTZs9ZmJsEOO45RghUmA.text: Found this place thanks to Yelp! Some friends and I were craving pho late night Labor Day weekend and we couldn't be happier with this place. I have been back several times since. The food is fresh and so cheap, a good go-to for your pho fix.

ZaBzeXxtKe5QsnpxtNy_rw.text: Best Pho I have had in my life! This place is so good its popular. They even have  a sign in sheet. That tells you something!!

uMINEzyQKY668AFqa6juxw.text: Horrible Customer service! Third visit in a row and each time their service got worse. Worst restaurant I've been to in vegas hands down.

Wu8yvFC-66Yyjlb66oE1bA.text: All the food we ate here was amazing. I love pho and this place has the best pho I've ever had! The service is great and the food comes out fresh and quick. This is definitely one of my top favorite places!

Tyl6u3iLC-RdbPM3flTczA.text: Just had a meal here. We had so much yummy food. Fried calamari , fried tofu , the chicken wings, roast duck, bo luc lac, special combination egg noodle soup, pan fried noodles, and bun thit nuong. Everything was so delicious and the service was excellent!

hYJSZ5iSOfGU1UtZ_O2ylw.text: I'm giving it 3 stars because I only like 3 items here (not the other items on the menu), but these 3 items are actually really good and on its own deserve 4 stars.  I only like pho at 3 locations here in Vegas and this is one of them.  It's good and the place is cleaner than Pho So 1.  I also like their che ba mau because it comes with shaved ice, and they serve it in a plastic to go cup (in case I don't finish it).  Their spring rolls are pretty good too, but I can make those at home.  Update:  I changed it to 4 stars because I've missed it so much while I was gone that I ate here twice a week while I was back home for break.  :oP

eMZv1oJb47hxvSzG0ELbbA.text: The food is comparable to other good Vietnamese restaurant. I usually get the Pho Chin Nam (Brisket & Flank) and egg rolls. It's always busy. The service isn't always that great. For the most part, they get you your food and then leave you alone until you're ready to pay. They charged a 15% gratuity on a party of 7. I don't know many Vietnamese restaurants that charges gratuity. For the service that we received the last time we went there (in early July), the gratuity was undeserving.  If you have a hankering for Vietnamese food, this place will give you what you want. They have good selections.  If you're just hungry for anything, I'd say skip it.

8PNrzxaKcKHHN33CPHKo7Q.text: This joint is open 24 hours!!!  Sold.   I had the pho dac biet, and it was super good.  The broth was flavorful and clear and the meat was, surprisingly, very tender.  The noodles were firm and everything was just delicious.  I would normally order pho thai rather than pho dac biet, but I was feeling like a fatty and went ahead with it.   The wait staff were friendly and patient so that's always a plus.  The facility was CLEAN!!  Now, that's something you don't see very often in pho joints. I also ordered the che ba mau (three-color dessert) and it was just okay.  It was in a small cup and I was charged $3.50.  Kinda pricey, but, meh, I've had better.  I took my parents here (who grew up in Vietnam and are self-proclaimed pho connoisseurs) and they really liked the food.  Score!  I pat myself in the back. The only downside was that it's a little pricier (by $1 or $2) than what my family and I were used to paying compared to pho in LA .  A couple dollars may not seem as much, but it'll add up.  That aside, come here and enjoy the pho.

eoheVtP2uioE75j9dsx_UQ.text: open 24 hours: PERFECT! pho is GREAT!! got a half order of duck, love the sweet sauce that comes with it but not a fan of the oyster sauce on the bottom it makes the duck skin soggy. the soft noodle with seafood great, lots of flavor. Vermicelli was good, one of my top 5 choices in vietnamese (sp) restaurant. service is always good when im there. fast and friendly.

YKRJU-cjS550nTx2FPkxkw.text: Great place, nice speedy staff, even remembers me and my reg orders. Food is good, quick, and hot. Real friendly best buddy atmosphere, plus open 24/7. A Vegas staple. Win

9JyCVZ3HHEYb4gYcEm-qkA.text: Great name but the experience is all downhill from there. Food's ok, but the portions are small. There's a bad mildew-y smell that knocks you in the face when you walk in and the service is horrible. It's like they're mad at you for giving them your business. And don't dare ask for a refill on water...

JRDUmTuiFLi_jishn2Z2WQ.text: What can I say. First off, very crowded, mostly due to the Hype. I've been to alot of Pho places and this place looks nice, aside from that the cooks/servers are all vietnamese. The bowls of noodles are large and plenty, lots of meet, it taste okay, nothing I haven't experienced. Kind of pricey, but this is Vegas we are talking about. Great service/food.

ms70KVm55OINTaQRw1U3aQ.text: if you want pho or vietnamese food in vegas then this place is cool  nothing super special. but its decently cheap and off the strip.   i hear its open 24 hours which is cool too. pho when youre drunk/hungover is the best.  if you dont like pho, get the bo lo loc (filet minon cubes with white rice)

GZ3ApEE42lfIPhQQ3Aoq6Q.text: I should know Vietnamese food, I cook it all the time.  The food here is great.  It's authentic and absolutely delicious.  My favorite is the bun thit nuong cha gio.  Vermicelli with grilled pork and egg roll salad.  They make it just like my mom's.  Also, I've tried some Chinese foods and it's not bad.  The deep fried salt n pepper squid was nice and tender.  Almost like fried mozzarella.  My date had the pho and it tastes like my homemade broth.  For the Vietnamese restaurant, this one is pretty good.  It's nothing like the places in Little Saigon but this is Vegas and it's great.

8rsJh9Lm8ks67HY91n_qjw.text: We came here after clubbing in Vegas to eat Pho.  The wait to come inside wasn't too long.  I thought this place was pretty good.   I ended up ordering Pho. The broth and noodles were delicious.  I am Vietnamese and there is always home cooked Pho at my house so I would know if it's good or not.  This place is not bad at all.  The service wasn't that great because the wait for the food was so long.  The prices for food here is average.  It's the perfect place to come after a long fun night out TRUST ME!  =)

Gj2gQEW1D5_VhuTderxuSA.text: Get ready to feel like you aren't welcome by the rude guy that has seated me the 3 times I have been there. I only go there for the funny name. The wait staff is rude and very slow. I will go back if someone else is buying. I'm sure I can find better Pho places in Vegas.

MTs1GJdeLEk9nQqXtO7u9A.text: Ok I have had a change of heart. I really like this place. I have tried Chinese food in other parts of LV and so far this has the best tasting food. I love their Wonton soup, shrimp with honey walnut and mixed veggies. My family likes the pork chop. I also like the fact they have fresh coconut which I am a big fan of. It is open 24 hours and the service is great.

EsIPLJHlV319-lvNXCR-7Q.text: Just had an amazing meal at Pho Kim Long!!  Food was great and service was execellent!

3it3qed2w-XI4ar2qybs7w.text: Another late night joint in Chinatown.  Actually, it's like Vegas.  It never closes.  #24 with an eggroll added to it.  That's what I get.  Staff can be difficult at times with so many people showing up but when you want noodles late at night at a decent price this is where you head to.

UVoQhGXffSliMIH5ULnbEw.text: Went last night Sunday labor day weekend , restaurant was busy , not expecting much in service been too lots of Asian places if u don't speak the language u get ignored, well kudos  to wait staff for being attentive . Ordered fried calamari little salty for me, house noodles very good, chix Hainan good, char broiled beef good will go back and try the pho

bwW-XEtEi_rLRD0bubomvg.text: After a long night of clubbing at Tryst, my girls and I were on a hunt for some delicious pho.  We were searching on Yelp for a few places, but our valet guy told us to head to Pho Kim Long since it's open 24 hours.  The place was super packed at 2:30AM!  Not even just young club go-ers, but families of people were all enjoying the pho.  We ordered 2 rare steak phos and an order of the fried calamari appetizer.  My bestie mixed the fish and the chili sauce together to make a yummy dipping sauce for the calamari.  Apparently there was a lot of Star anise in the broth that made it a little sweeter than normal.  Otherwise, the pho was yummy and perfect for what we needed that night.  Service was a tad bit slow, but like I said, the restaurant was packed so it's okay.

RBZWZG9tU775MHuLGlHaXA.text: In my opinion as a Vietnamese myself I think it's disappointment and personally I think this place basically overrated as the fact it's been opened for a long time and close to the strip plus it's 24/7! A plus. But when it comes to food quality? I will never put this on top of my list. Ordered fried egg rolls, chicken fried rice and a large meatballs noodle soup. I'm sorry non of them tasted as least reach standard point to me. Thick skin egg rolls, plain fried rice which much needed of flavoring. I do believe the fried rice they served was not freshly stir fried, not to be mean it does tasted like Panda Express fried rice. Now comes to the order of myself. meatballs noodle soup. Flavor is ok but the meatballs!! The meatballs....oh my god! For a moment I'm not sure it's real beef meatballs or something. The texture is horrible, almost like cardboard been soaked till it fall apart and mixed with some sort of cheap meat paste to create these meatballs. 2 stars for nice receptionist and nice decor.

pQVLVROcU9BjQ5MCw_pGbw.text: Fast and affordable. The Singapore noodle is the best in town. Always busy for a reason.

z2-P3NDey93OUakKuSGnEA.text: Love love love this place! We were in Vegas for 4 days and ate here 3 times! The pho was good, ca kho to and canh chua were awesome and thit nuong had great flavor. I'm from Houston, home of great Viet food but this place was even better then most places! Highly recommend!!

pcG0Kpu7ry3dLNZoGmz0bw.text: ...this place really does suck ... last time I was here abou year ago ... food was great ...now I come this time ... and I have to say not exaggerating ... this is the worst ...most pathetic acuse for chow mein I've ever had in my life !!!noodles werent traditional ... but where the flat skinny noodles ...and maybe the most blan thing I've ever ate in my life !!!i no joke had to pour 4 packets of soy sauce just so it could even have a tad  bit of flavor...like I said ... when I first came here a year ago food was great ...I hate to say it ... it taste heartless ...there's no flavor ... no love ... I've had better fast food Chinese then this place !!!!

Ge-rU_NS5ok431X_aaeQ6g.text: Worst place ever.... waiter doesn't have enough energy to walk out the door to call customers in. Service stinks! Found a bug inside the food. Yuck!

NKCuSJLiLTp8WVNiX8M0GA.text: (I was a tourist to Vegas and came with about 10 guys)   Don't expect to get served if you come in at 4am.  We left because they didn't want to serve us.  Didn't take any order for drinks or food.  Didn't even bother to properly seat us.  Just grabbed the menus and placed it on the table without telling us to follow.  When we asked if we were suppose to be seated, he gave a light nod so it was hard to tell what he wanted us to do.  His communication skills was lacking as if he didn't want us there.   After 15 minutes of being ignored, we left.  I don't know what their problem was but if you're going to open a restaurant until 5:30 am in the morning, you should treat all guest like they are wanted there.  Don't be surprised if any of the other 10 guys from my group rates your restaurant with a 1 star.

rhZ8IEUKvU5bppHN2R21Xw.text: My bo bue hue was really good and it's a big portion. The pho wasn't great Tho. The serviced wasn't great. Be prepare for a long wait almost at anytime

yCCQ1N3PhXkSJaJlFj6KTA.text: I mean what can you say about this place that hasn't already been said 1000 times.   Food is always spot on but service is awful! We use to have decent service but past 2 times mine or my fiances food has come out wrong. The servers rarely pay attention to you when you are speaking which is why it comes out wrong.

dITIoEr0VNb3xXunmw7q2w.text: We came here because it had decent reviews and it was opened at 9:30 am.  We had to wait for about 10 min for a table of 3.  We sat down for a bit and tried to flag down a server to take our order. No one insight. We flagged down one server and she said to wait and she never came back. Finally we got a person that was cleaning the other tables to grab us a server. The person behind the counter (owner?) ended up taking our order. No apology for their bad service.  We ordered 2 Phos and eggrolls. They brought us eggrolls and 3 Phos! The server argued with us that we ordered 3 Phos but I insisted we only order 2 since my child doesn't eat much. He took the 3rd one away and looked annoyed. When our check came, sure enough, they charged us for the 3rd pho we didn't order. My husband had to take to the guy behind the counter and finally took off our bill. Again, no apologies were given. Will never go back. Service sucks! Oh! And not to mention that their pho was super salty and was not good at all.

f30EiNrdoVOiAxp94vpjxg.text: This is a solid pho place.. Service can be a little slow sometimes and the staff can seem uninterested but my orders have always came out correct and delicious so I'll let it slide! I usually get the veggie pho and my bf gets the rare steak, I'm also a big supporter of the combo drunken noodles. The spring rolls, egg rolls and crab rangoons are all delish in fact the only app I'm not a fan of is the calamari.. It just feels super heavy and fried and I'm pretty sure the marinara sauce was straight tomato paste... Anywho it's open 24 hours which is super cool and pho is pretty much the most magical of all hangover cures so enjoy

b1ZhpWqiZa1v_zc8CHUbXQ.text: Not sure if the meat sits out or if last night it was old but my boyfriend is violently vomiting (we were sober BTW) from the pork fried rice and I can attest it looks and smells like it.

D5crDev3mCf6CA5Ge8FWWA.text: Amazing. We ordered #1 #56, #64 and #16 they were delicious. we also ordered some chicken I don't know which number, it was so tasty and cooked to perfection. This is my second time here, it definitely won't be the last one. The food runner Jose was very nice, and our server definitely knew her menu.

cp_ru-8k8w8isbktRN7P6Q.text: I got diarrhea after eating here. Prob bad meat or E. coli.   No it was nowhere else. It had to be here and I won't get into details why I know.    Just trust me.  It was here.

ps7TkhE-NlxFl0CSGxExtQ.text: Pho was really good as well as the spring rolls with peanut sauce!  This is now my pho place in Vegas and It's great that they're open late.  The place is nice and quite large and we were seated immediately.

ocbddR7KQpHrPZSpJjXvQw.text: We only went here because it is open 24/7. This would be the third time I eat here. Overall, the food has been disappointing every time. I would not recommend this place. The service was not very friendly and the pho and rice dishes are very bad.

AzKI8X4mh22MR1aHr7Obyw.text: The food is decent at best and the service is beyond terrible....there is no sense of any manners among the staff very disappointing ...will the last time to give it a chance.

rKvUBAOpoHDnpR3_0EEAIA.text: I love the convenience of a 24-hour Vietnamese restaurant that serves food faster than many of the fast food restaurants in town!   In my opinion, the food here is average, and the same with the service. However, I do love Vietnamese egg rolls and eating their salted pork chops! One extra star for the chefs/cooks being able to make those two dishes quite a treat for me at 2:00 a.m.!

liEaG1WBPennFhb-8UxJ3w.text: Ok. The food here is awesome. I'll give them that, if they ever serve it on time.  Then there's the Customer service. . . ITS HORRIBLE!!  Waiters/waitresses look like they hate life. They are rude, and I had to wait 20 min just for a glass of water!! Dafck?!  ATTENTION  Make sure you check your bill before paying. Bastards like to add extra sTuff.   Then there's the parking dilemma. Let's just say you're better off parking across the street where there is enough space to where you won't come back out and have a dent/scratch on your car.

87nPx2y9J8BT9YFPU5KLQg.text: My fiancee and I visited Kim Long Pho twice during our stay in Vegas and we loved our dishes both times. In all we had the vegetable pho, seafood pho, salt & pepper fish with brown rice, and crab ragoon.  They were all amazing. Great quality ingredients used.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

eidFnInLl0FOve8kJrOKqw.text: I will always be a fan of this always-open pho spot. Sometimes the servers are kind of rude but I'll always come back for the pho.

AQlBN7FOFLPUQ1-D8hcVTw.text: I've never found a Vietnamese place that serves up a good Steak and Red Rice like this place we always used to go to in Concord when we lived in Cali. We saw something similar to it on the menu, so we decided to take a chance and we also shared an order of fresh spring rolls and a combination Pho.  The steak was kinda disappointing and the rice was okay, but the saving grace for our dinner were the other two items. Their Roasted Chicken with the Red Rice is actually a better option.  We are still fans, as the service has always been good, food comes out quickly, and its open 24 hours...ALOHA!!!  YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(201/365) "The Search for Steak  and Red Rice"

N4OUXoIM6jMPxfO7bZmWQQ.text: Pho is good but the service is rude and sort of minimal. There's an older gentleman who doesn't care to ask you how your meal is going or if he can get u anything... not really worth the wait they always have if you ask me.

LGciNKMmOeolZYANT7eulw.text: Looking for Pho? This place is pretty darn good. The broth is flavorful, the portions are huge and the service is mega fast. When the friend you invite is the only non-Asian in the place, you know that it's authentic. I only gave it a 4-star because the 3-bean dessert was lacking a sweetener. It's was pretty bland. If you're in Chinatown area, you have to at least try it once.

SvMiYgBsMKV0cIhvTW0sQQ.text: Very great place to eat at, my group of friends and I always come here after a night out and they tolerate us being loud, and having fun! Only down side is when you try to go around dinner time. It's usually a pretty lengthy wait upwards to 20-30 minutes.

LUqhED93AJBCbEMRhYUrmQ.text: I love this place, it's  24 hours which is convenient for me with the long hours I work, and thy are fast I dont ever call in my order and its always ready within 10 min from ordering when I walk in.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #14 Rare Steak PHO...YUM!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best to start with! Shrimp/pork spring rolls

R5vS0YMQvMwGhzgLd1926Q.text: We stop here every visit to Las Vegas and have never been disappointed. Great Pho and Bun that the locals debate if its #1 or #2. My wife wants the t-shirt!

kDcivBnNtELlJwGCs1oOsA.text: This restaurant caters to tourist. I totally understand that many small businesses survive off of tourism here...but I just wasn't impressed. I came for the food not the ambience or decor. It gets packed in here. The tables are small...no elbow room at all so it feels like you have to overlap your arms with your neighbor to try and get a chopstick full of food in your mouth. The servers were servers...customer service could be improved but then again they didn't speak much English...I think that night they had nothing but Brazilians serving.  Go E.O.E.!  The food is just ok. It doesn't taste any kind of authentic...it's pretty bland. I dislike having to add salt in broth when I go to Pho restaurants and that's what I had to do here...uugh. Get the broth right please! The water cups look like they've been run through the dishwasher a thousand times too many. But the soda was good. Our bill for the 4 of us came out to be about $90...WTF?! I've never spent so much on PHO!   To sum it up...it's pricey, bland and made for tourist. I would only come here for a late nite 2am Pho craving...but then again there are other 24 hour pho places too. The bells and whistles here are nice but if you don't have the taste of the food to back it up it's just not worth it.   I like saying the restaurant name long and slow though...tickles me every time!

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6rzSwqvZTan637SyC81ZLA.text: Great service at this Pho restaurant! The ladies were very efficient with all service .. the food was excellent too! Atmosphere was really nice ! Very spacious!

Uh-PvlaqAygW8sqexgAZJw.text: On a Monday morning, no one came to seat us, we sat ourselves and was told by the cashier that he wasn't going to give me a menu.  Rather than serving us, he gave me a nasty attitude and refused service.  Never eating here again, it's not the only pho option in Vegas.  Shouldn't be subjected to such attitude first thing in the morning

VET6aslYlqZEVe-z_UPo_A.text: This is still one of my favorite pho spots in Vegas. I enjoy how the beef broth actually tastes like beef. Even though they don't have the best customer service, the food will be brought out to you really fast. I've tried a few things on their menu and I've liked all of them. My favorite one so far is the broiled pork chop. All their pho is good. Best thing about this place is that it's open 24 hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broiled Pork Chop

x1GY0s-G-f5iON7cyvbKrA.text: First time ever coming here and first time ever eating Pho and I just simply did not like it. I literally left the whole plate in whole. The manager wanted me to pay for something I just did not like at all. He was rolling his eyes , mumbling stuff under his breath, snatching my card out from my hand , slapping things around on the table and being a complete ass about the situation. Telling me there's a 30min wait for the food and after those 30min you have to pay for ur food. I am Completely unsatisfied with this place and it's customer service. We didn't even have a waiter come to our table every so often at all to ask if we needed anything. The manager felt like he was in all the right. And his manners were just so disgusting. Who put him there? Why do they have a nasty attitude manager who can't solve problems. My situation would have been less problematic if he was understanding and more apologetic about the food that I didn't like and offering me something els to eat at least. But no. All I got was a nasty attitude. And to top it off he told me not to come back again.

C3tGlKQ7koIsyTrcM-b0Yw.text: I used to be a regular here.. with an average of 2-3 times per week; however, I have really stopped going due to the fact that the lines are longer and longer and that the food is more expensive each time I go. Items that were $4-5 or $9-12 are now in the range of $8-12 and $13-18. This is just absurd for some chicken and broccoli. Chinatown is lined with good Vietnamese restaurants and same cold service without the wait.   Pho Kim's food is delicious with a much bigger menu, but I'll rather take my business elsewhere since they have gotten so greedy and have forgotten the locals who have kept them in business for the last 15 years or so. Side note: I ordered chicken and string beans (which was always on the menu, now showing as chicken and greens) and there was a $3 up charge for the beans. REALLY? The cashier was so rude, saying how expensive the beans are and that otherwise I'll get bok choy. The order cost me $20 -- $20 for a dish that is $8,75 at ANY amazing Chinese restaurant. This was the last time I paid Pho Kim a visit. I was infuriated with the drive, the wait, the rudeness and extortion.   On another note, a server was asked about MSG content and it was divulged that they use Massive amounts of MSG in all of their food. If you feel super bloated or tired after eating at their restaurant, know that it is due to this nerve impulse transmitter that has been known to cause brain nerve damage in lab animals (unfortunately, for those little beings). This is one of the reasons why their food is so tasty and addicting. Take away the MSG and it's just plain ol' cup of noodles.   I'm happy taking it up the street when the cravings hit and saving a bunch of money while I am at it.

NQl_Rkc67wv8_rqyx9Yj2w.text: Service sucks but the pho is amazing! Pho comes out very fast; if you order anything besides the soup you will wait a very long time. Lines are only long on weekends after people get tired of the club - weekdays aren't so bad.   I come here all the time and highly recommend it!

dOHMNy2sNI2IJPcBAsnw9g.text: (4.5 stars)  After a long night out, my cousins and I woke up Saturday morning wanting something to fix that typical Vegas hangover. What else but pho, right?  This spot is located in Vegas's version of Chinatown, located right off the Strip. If you're taking a taxi, make sure you ask your driver for their taxi company's phone number so you have someone to pick you up. It's a frequent spot for taxi drivers, so it shouldn't take too much to describe where you're at.  Ordered the #13, which is basically pho with every type of meat. I don't know, it's not the world's best pho, but if you have the drunchies or need a cure for your hangover, this may as well be the best pho you'll have within the next hour.  Personally, my drunk Yelper self would say that they give a good ratio of noodles to broth. However, my sober and more critical Yelper self would wish there was more meat. But my drunk/hungover Yelper self wins this review.  They're open 24 hours by the way. Pho after the club? You betcha.

-J2W8k6szcn9g-Gn3L7aOw.text: Affordable delicious pho! We got take out and it was the best hangover cure ever. The restaurant was packed at about 3am Sunday morning but take out was really fast.

USj8_4eMTFEJuLW3M73K3A.text: My go to late night munchies place west of the Vegas strip on the other side of highway. Open 24 hours. Great pho on the relatively cheap. Highly recommended.

6tW7jkltlnrzsH4biZJh-A.text: I came here some friends. The food is delicious especially the chicken fried rice, but I had a terrible experience with the service. From the beginning the server only came to our table 2 times during our meal once when he introduced himself and the last time was when we had been sitting there for awhile. We were asking the other people that worked there for our server and he never showed till the end. We would raise our hands and completely ignore us. The tables next to us were visited more than us. We decided not to tip for the terrible service. I signed the bill and left. My friends and I were saying good night to each other outside when THE MANAGER COMES RUNNING AFTER ME TELLING ME THAT TIP IS NOT INCLUDED. HOW RIDICULOUS!! I let him know how terrible the service was and that was the reason for the no tip. He then informed me that the tip is for everyone. I reluctantly tipped on my bill. I don't care how delicious the food is I will never come back.

lhG98yHZWLPCMFXYEEJv4g.text: Anticipate a long wait... 45mins or longer. Food is mediocre. There was a bug in my water. Dirtiest restroom...don't know what all the hype was about. Good luck.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2DB_8Qn55VmeciNlxywkng.text: Pho Kim Long has the best pho name and probably best pho in town. Open 24/7 this place is busy no matter the hour. Despite the amount of people, getting seated never takes long. I always order pho and it always comes out within 5 minutes. Service is average, but not stellar.  Overall this is my go to pho place in town. Everything is consistent from the taste to the service.

SeljudWtkwMfgiNljuTjtw.text: So, the great thing about this place is that it's open 24 hours. After an all-nighter stretching from California to Vegas, I needed sustenance, hold the grease. Luckily for me, Pho Kim Long was open :)  Now the bad: I felt that the noodles were a little thin, and the soup a bit less flavorful compared to the SoCal variety. However, I was sharing with a friend who was too afraid to order flank and tripe in the soup, so the absence of these delicious meats might have led to the unfavorable comparison.  Another thing about my friend, she won't eat flank/tripe, but she'll order an avocado smoothie...as if that's not weird.  Nonetheless, the smoothie was great. Just don't let it get warm, because then you start feeling like you're downing a cup of sweet guacamole.

yU0RkoLIqItWg5X-n_dk6A.text: Ordered the chao bo and it was so bland.  No flavor.  The bread cost another $2 and was old and stale.  Worst chao ever and over priced! !! $13 + Not to mention no vegetables came along with it.

lesY_2VLKbI5h62oNTPwgg.text: I can't see how some reviews are saying this is the best Pho. Either they were drunk or just never had real good Pho before.   Just had breakfast here. The pho portion was tiny. The broth had absolutely no flavors or aroma, it was pretty much MSG loaded. The service was non existant because the server never came by once and ask if we need anything. None of our pho had side vegetables. My bowl had no onions/clitrantro when I didnt specify for them to do so. Worst part was when we checked out to pay, they circle gratutity suggesting we give that amount. Anyhow, this place is just not good. First time here and will never be back.

BjNDEcWpkShe5PwKH34sWA.text: Food is okay. But customer service sucks ass. If there is a party of 6 or more they won't make 6 or more separate checks. Everything has to be combined or divided into 1, 2 or 3 checks. After we got done eating every one started to pay in the front. The ones who paid first went outside to wait for the others who is still in the restaurant waiting to pay. All a sudden the man runs out and starts yelling saying there is two more dishes and that we better pay for it. He was piss and we were also because everyone who was outside paid for theirs. 3 minutes or so after my friend and her boyfriend came out from the restroom they went to the front and pay. The man basically just stood there quiet. Looking like a dumb ass for thinking we were gonna run and not pay! Not worth it!!!

9lDdhFqHbAT_IFBs9IE2Cg.text: Absolutely awful experience! This was my second visit with them in hopes that their customer service and food quality had improved, but instead of making the situation right and apologizing for the bad service they had a guy in a black suit claiming to be deputized "escort and 86" me and my boyfriend out of the building. He told us to get the fuck out now. And the guy in the black suit tried to take my picture without my consent and tried to make me give him my ID. Eat here at your own peril if you want to feel unsafe. I have contacted my attorney about their verbal harassment and unlawful behavior.

LOL

tDHKlMbaTpryANAItguVJA.text: I've lived in Vegas for over a year and gave up on Pho (one of my favorite winter meals) after trying several spots... All of them were a HUGE  disappointment. I kept hearing about Pho Kim Long... But not wanting to get my hopes up I stayed away. But a few weeks ago I was craving Pho so made the 20 min drive... BEST PHO IN LAS VEGAS!! Authentic, delicious and friendly... They get you in and out and they're 24/7 which is perfect for Las Vegas!!

uzMtAoMdVe2rovG7yXWiOA.text: hands down THE BEST PHO I've ever had. Our friend in Vegas introduced us to this place the first night we were there. Went back every single day. It was specially amazing after a long night of club hopping. The waiters are all super nice and helpful. There was this one lady who was motherly mean...if that makes any sense. LOL  Oh, and the tea...omg it was delicious. Anyways, I'm already planning another trip to Vegas mainly because of this place. oh yeah and i guess the clubs too.. :p

QiBSi4AgF_-WnyoS1_xaFw.text: "CRAWFISH" is a new addition to Pho Kim Long, and that's what brought me here in the first place.  They only started offering this shellfish in June, weekends only.  My luck that the Sunday I choose to come in, they weren't offering it. We still sat down for dinner and this is what we got:   * Hu Tieu Hoac Mi Bo Kho (Beef Stew Egg Noodle) - $7.95: The Big F enjoyed his noodle soup.  I was too busy with my plate to eat much of his.  * Dau Dua Xao XO Sauce (Stir fried String Beans with XO Sauce) - $9.95: Tasty string beans, a bit on the pricey side though.  A nice spice kick as well.  * Com Ga Hai Nam (Hai Nam Style Chicken with Seasoned Rice) $8.50: I've always liked Hainamese chicken since my friend's mom made it for me, along with the seasoned rice.  It's good here, but definitely not as good as my friend's mom's version.  Pho Kim Long II is a huge restaurant with lots of big tables for large parties.  A great place for families to eat and friends to gather after a late night.  Their menu is pretty extensive so there's plenty of choices for everyone.  And portions seem pretty decent-sized too.  (I wish they would get a bigger fish tank though because there are way too many fish in that tiny thing up front!)  From this experience, I give it a FOUR stars.  I love Hot N Juicy Crawfish up the road, and I definitely believe in some healthy competition.  So, last Friday we decided to finally check out their crawfish and see if it's worthy.  We decided to start off with two pounds and see where we went for there.     We noticed a neighboring table with their order of crawfish and was definitely excited.  It came in a large bowl with red potatoes, corn on the cob and sausage.  They also brought extra bowls for the shells and a plate for us to eat on.  The Big F requested limes, salt and pepper to make a dipping concoction.  I dove right in and noticed the big difference...the crawfish was not fresh.  It was old or way overcooked.  The tail meat didn't come off the shell easily and was broken up.  I thought it was just the first one and continued eating.  Unfortunately, this wasn't the case.  There was little to no head juice either, which was very disappointing to me.  The Big F was easily disgusted with the crawfish and we were glad that we only ordered two pounds to start.  (We usually go for two pounds each!)  The corn, potatoes, and sausage were good though, but it didn't make up for the bad crawfish.  Since it comes in a bowl, there's no sauce on the bottom for you to dip your crawfish in after you shell it.  No bibs were provided, which explains all the stains on my shirt.  When I'm craving crawfish, I'll drive up the road and spring the extra cash over at Hot N Juicy.  For this experience, I give it a TWO stars.  Overall, a four stars for their Vietnamese food, and a two stars for their bad crawfish.  I'm giving Pho Kim Long II a THREE star.  (Pics are posted!)

MLoa0x1llC5nX-YsoWW0rA.text: Pho kim long is a Real asian restaurant.You know... below average service,average to average food and reasonably price.I usually judge pho restaurant based on their Dac Biet ( special combination) pho and this place is no different. for the newbies pho Dac Biet is pho with triple, lean steak, beef balls,.... service was subpar as expected: not very attentive, took a while to order and not entirely friendly. but hey, I was already on board with that before walking into the door.
