aiNSTTaMM80LbFg4um5QjQ.text: I like to look at myself as a pho expert. I eat it at least once a week. This place was a huge disappointment. Not only are they racist! They think I don't know how to use chop sticks because I'm white!!! But the broth was so salty it tasted like they poured salt all over my food. I will not be going back here.

Xen5WiqnVMjyuNIMZp_zRw.text: This place has wonderful Pho, pork bun, and Vietnamese egg rolls. Those are essentially the only things I absolutely love there. It's also open 24 hours which is great when I'm digging Vietnamese late at night. I would give them 4 stars, but the service is either a hit or miss.

v8pV5e4XoPfr6axpipnbNA.text: About a 20 25 minuet wait but food got out pretty fast Thai tea is pretty good and the pho tasted about average, overall friendly staff pretty clean and fast server 3 stars for the food.

oxQjVTOqLtTajrLsCFoBPw.text: Best Pho I've found in Vegas so far!  The broth was superb, although their selection of Pho isn't as big as most other places. I usually get the Pho Dac Biet anywhere I go, I love the tendon and tripe but this place only had rare steak, brisket, and flank. They put a lot of meat in it too which was a + in my book, but the noodles and broth are what made it for me.   Especially being in Vegas, this might save  your life the morning after a long night. After leaving Pho Kim Long I felt like new, ready to take on whatever vegas had left to throw at me. I WILL be back to this place again, thats for sure.

SYZ3dtCTLSn9dGulqq4I6Q.text: a must go to spot after a weekend of drinking!  the server is def funny.. came over and started to ask if we were hung over.. the food was ok.. of course sgv is better.. it's is def expensive..

k6Uuj1hbnQexuDL3EryHTA.text: Good place to eat after a hard night of drinking. Pho Tai is pretty good (from what I remember). Cheap. Well all pho is cheap haha. Service, if that's what you wanna call it, is pretty much nonexistent. They take your order & bring your food... and that's about it. A friend ordered duck and it had that bad smell and they took forever to make it & bring it out - we were pretty much done with our meals by the time it was out. I wish this place was closer to the strip so that we can walk here. Usually we have to take a taxi  =\.

Rmfg7sz0c5RirFMWp_yHrA.text: I really wonder if they named this after Kim Long or they meant to Pho Kim Long Time. Either way, out of many many Pho restaurants I've tried in Atlanta, New York, San Diego and San Francisco, this one is one of my favorites. Only Pho I've tried in Vegas but they know what they're doing.   You'll be greeted by a huge Sea aquarium the type you see in MTV Cribs worth thousands of dollars. This place must be doing good business because the decorations inside are pretty hard core. They have another aquarium with a King fish and black and white Nemo's. Pretty awesome!   The staff at this place is excellent at serving the customers. I think everyone that was working at Pho Kim Long (I can't stop laughing at this name) came up to our table (except the cooks). We had a busy table so you know how it is when people like to add picky stuff to their Pho... garlic, limes, extra mint, chili paste, nguoc mum, sriracha... etc.   I ordered the Bun with Egg Rolls (cho gio) and char-grilled BBQ pork. The bowl was a bit smaller than usual but it was very well made. This is a simple dish but the key item is the noodles. Sometimes they are too soggy or they can also be too dry and sticky. This place had perfect noodles for the Bun.   The servers gave us some Pho broth since it was so cold outside. Very nice gesture! Everyone had a small bowl of broth which was very good in flavor. However, if this is the Pho broth they use for every dish then I would avoid the Pho since it was a bit heavy in texture. I thought it should be more watered down. We had an additional order of fried egg rolls which was pretty decent, nothing fantastic but still good.   Something unique about this place is their variety of Asian cuisine. They are obviously mainly Vietnamese but you can also find Chinese dishes and even Pad Thai. Very unusual in my experience. One of my friends ordered combo #108 which was amazing. It was similar to Bo Luc Lac but with bigger meat pieces and with excellent steamed broccoli. I'm getting #108 next time.   Found my hangover spot a couple of miles off the strip! Pho Kim Long Soon!

guj6Rud7nCzNitVqVcpBrA.text: I use to live in Vegas so there's no excuse for me to make such a rookie mistake. The pho here is terrible. I blame the alcohol for making me come here so late at night. Pho So 1 and Pho Saigon were already closed. They offer much better pho. Next time, I'll just eat ramen in my room. Or better yet, I'll resist the temptation and go to bed.

qpwo6EkJe_TUM3mOUpjTOQ.text: So this review is on my last experience only.  I have been here many times and will write more reviews as time goes on.  One of the things that amazes me with this place is it is constantly upgrading subtle things within the restaurant the staff seamed happy for years but lately the natives are restless...  The staff almost seems stressed which I can understand because they have become too busy.   You can no longer walk in at anytime and sit down, they have a security guard at the door checking you in and taking you to the table.  The problem with this is he is not trained, at all.  We walked in and were ignored until another couple walked in and I spoke up and said "oh we were next"  he replied "oh"  I said "do you have a check in list?" he said "ahh..." I said "why don't you write our names on that and keep track of all the people? :)"  I am never mean and rarely rude or brash, this was getting close to my breaking point.  So anyhow he seats us and man things happen fast from there it has always been fast but this was crazy fast.  Kind of stressed me out a little bit!  No greeting from the waiter just "are you ready to order?" "No but we will have a hot tea and a water" "ok be back"  he comes backs and we felt we needed to be ready at this point, we ordered and the food was being served within minutes.   So a plus for fast food and a minus for somewhat unregarded service.  I had the very tame but oh so good Charbroiled Pork & Egg Roll with Rice Vermicelli (a cool salad perfect for 112 degree weather that evening (boy we are having a hot summer! :() My pork was perfectly done chared to perfection, my egg rolls were also perfectly done (but you can't really mess that one up right) my salad was fresh and my sauce was good as usual, however my noodles were stuck together and really hard to get apart to eat and mix into the rest of my dish.  I think this is a sad casualty of a really big and really busy place at this point.   I am totally ok with hardcore asian waiters/restaurants and what not but this place has TONS of young, hip and many races and no longer has the excuse of "we are an old school chinese restaurant".  You want your favorite places to get busy but not so busy they lose touch with what and who got them busy to begin with...  So I am giving stars for my food taking away for my stuck together noodles and taking away as well for the kind of crappy service from the front and the wait staff.  I will be back and will write about my next experience.  I hope this place can find the happy medium for making big bucks but remembering why and who you are making those big bucks from...

whWreTnYGaFiYlMqcxVt4w.text: This was definitely the perfect cure for our morning-after hangovers. It was surprisingly very nice and clean for a Vietnamese restaurant, but maybe I'm too used to 'the dirtier, the better' mentality of Viet restaurants in Little Saigon.   They had a huge selection to satisfy all of your Vietnamese and Chinese cravings, not just pho. However, I just got my usual Pho Ga (I loove dipping chicken in the ginger sauce). Definitely DE-LISH!  It definitely had the whole Vietnamese-people-running-around-busy atmosphere. They were too busy running around that they forgot to bring one of our friend's bowls... and she was the only one sitting there without any food when everyone else had ordered the exact same thing. Goodness.  But I'm glad to know that I can always satisfy my late-night-after-clubbing pho craves. YAYY~

Tnqt4aHMAQVgQ_qdjs0ucA.text: Me and my Family love coming to this restaurant all the time.  We love the beef Pho soup especially.  We're planning on coming again this Friday for some Pho soup!  The place always packed.  Sometimes it takes a while waiting on food or your check but the food always good.

yOqv-BnHKnS30WaLijMERg.text: Pho is one of my favorite hangover foods, and now, it's become one of my favorite drunk foods!  A pho place open 24 hours that's less than 5 minutes away from the strip?! GENIUS! Located in Chinatown, Pho Kim Long is a short drive or cab ride away! I arrived at 2am and they were packed. No wait though which was awfully surprising. This has to be the biggest pho restaurant I've ever been to. We ordered and within seconds our food comes out! Gotta love that! My girlfriends and I shared and order of egg rolls and each had a bowl of pho. I know what you're thinking... when you're drunk, everything tastes good. And although in some circumstances that can be True, but I gotta tell you, Pho Kim Long is legit shit. And seeing that I had pho earlier that day, I realy had a fresh comparison. This broth was savory and light. I could drink the whole bowl! The meat to noodle ratio was spot on. I got the rare steak and brisket pho and everything was tender and delicious. The egg rolls were scrumptious as well. Not greasy and not too meaty.   I can see why this place is so busy. When we left one of my girlfriends decided to order some food to go and boy was that the smartest decision she's ever made! Bo luc lac for breakfast the next day? Yes!! I've never had beef this tender and I'm not even a fan of bo luc lac at all! But this just might convert me.    You bet believe your ass I'll be back!

FEm2gtOuie4TAokDEYgqLw.text: I know there is a lot of mixed reviews of this place on Yelp but, I really liked it and I am a big Pho fan. I guess I need to keep looking arround to compare. Since I my only comparison since moving here is that crap at Treasure island.  but, for now you 4 stars. The spring rolls and Thai Tea were bad though. However the deep fried pork pork chops were pretty decent.

UGPR3wiVocueFdR_raBapA.text: You will definitely find Authentic Pho when visiting Pho Kim Long. I recommend eating here if you're not in the mood for buffets or if you had way too many drinks last night.  The rating for this place can fluctuate from 3 stars to 4 stars. It really depends on how fresh your bowl of pho comes out. I've had one great experience and one OK experience when visiting Las Vegas. The rule of thumb when eating Pho is to avoid going at night (the soup taste better in the morning / early afternoon).  Pho - 3.5 / 5 stars  Egg Rolls are not that great. They're not fresh here.  The restaurant makes them in advance and re-fry them when they receive an order.  2. 5 / 5 Stars

XaW-MhXg0OxqElu6mlDC7Q.text: PHO MY PHOKING GAAWD!!!!   Honestly new to Pho, ive seen all the signs up around Chitown for PHO DIS, PHO YOU AND PHO ME but @PHO KIM LONG! Good call fursure, the service was excellent, and the food was great. I got the shrimp and pork spring rolls as an appitizer and a Pho #13 Meat combination! Phoking awesome, i was feeling a lil sick and now, 2 hours later, im clear of any flu like symptoms from that Pho cure!  I cant wait to go back as they had really good looking duck on the menu, and the table next to us had this mountain of Calimari that looked to die for, i cant wait to go back, Really good price, for really good food, and really good service.

iBR3V8TJHVjj2ni57iEzWA.text: Great service and friendly staff. If you'd like to get off The Strip  to find some good food and save money --- this is the place to be. Their restaurant is very clean and spacious. Their pho was good and their rice plate with grilled porkchops wasn't bad either. Tried the chops with their seasoned rice (garlic fried rice) and it was just scrumptious.  They give you plenty. We also had their fried spring roll which you roll up in lettuce and dipped into the fish sauce. Yummy!!!  When we come back to Vegas we'll come and definitely eat here again.

SVoBFEAk0OMJT6bJ5PiWrQ.text: Food is good. But really poor service from a 40 years old like guy. He was the worst server I've ever seen. But other stuff were not bad.

bL8JjmaWbXVWqSlzYio69w.text: I LOVE pho kim long! They are always busy no matter what time you go but the wait is never too Long. Their spring rolls are amazing! So are their crunchy fried noodles. Never had a bad meal here! Highly recommend this place. Awesome food.

AVbRQAXId32hNVZfolcahQ.text: Favorite pho spot in town. Open 24 hours. Check out the  photos I uploaded. Fast service and moderatley priced. In the heart of chinatown.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lh6r0UFEU-I6jImkLsB5_Q.text: I think the only excuse to come here is if it's 4AM.  Well, PKL has definitely made a market out of the fact that it's the only 24/7 pho place open in Chinatown. It's not bad, but it certainly isn't good, and it's expensive for the quality you get, man.  $5.50 for two of the shittiest spring rolls I've ever seen. It just looks skinny, sad, and... flaccid. God knows how long they've been in the fridge because the wrappers are tough. Shrimp are small, and they're just dreadfully bland.   Pho options aren't the good stuff, like tendon and tripe. They don't even do the legit stuff here. Their Bun Bo Hue doesn't come with blood sausage, and they don't have cooked cabbage, lemongrass, or any of that other stuff that normally comes with BBH.  Listen to the Asian people. There's no reason to eat here if it's outside of normal pho operating hours. Uber your ass down to Noodle Bar, where quality is SO much better. Nothing to see here, folks!

XXIeuXu3fiPZPYnb-z05Ow.text: Bless this place for being 24 hrs. My girlfriend and I were craving pho as our drunchie and since our AirBnB was in Chinatown, this place rescued us from a bad hangover the next day.   Fast forward a month later and a group of us came here to cure our bad hangover. The wait was not terribly long, about 30 minutes, for a large group of 6. The broth was nice and rich.   My friend and I got the chiken wings with the special sauce. After an immature giggle, we took a bite and couldn't stop reaching for them. Apparently the sauce was just fish sauce...  For the price and the quality, this is now my go to whenever I'm in Vegas. This place has saved me and my friends everytime we come to Vegas.

-MmwMmDSayXF3bO_v9pvSg.text: Very very very amazing Thai food and pho. I always come here with my friends really late at night after work ( 12 am ish or later) they're open 24 hours. There is never a wait then but if you come in the day it's very very busy.   I usually get #13 the beef bowl if I want pho, but their chicken pad Thai and their Mongolian beef with white rice is amazing. Service is ok, friendly but they don't talk much. They just drop off your food and drinks and go for the most part. We just come here cause the food is amazing.  Definitely a great place to go to after partying all night and drinking and etc. it's amazing, best Thai spot out here.

LcWGA0ZXAl-jUKfdRpKqxA.text: Came here when some friends and I wanted pho and some other Vietnamese dishes to share before we set out onto the strip for the day. For a table of ten people, they sat us pretty quickly for a Saturday afternoon. We only had to wait about 15 minutes. In addition to that, I was really impressed with their extensive menu. There's something for everyone to enjoy. I know other reviews had mentioned that their customer service lacked a bit, but from the experience I had the workers were pretty attentive to our table and came by to check on us frequently. I noticed as we were leaving that they were open 24/7 as well! Not a bad place to come when you're craving some late night/early morning pho and bites to tackle the day!

O_491zu80a-TKrp-e3x9MQ.text: This place is packed at all times and it's for the food not the service. The whole experience is kind of impersonal, the waiter barely says their name only really cares about getting your order and heading to the next table. I had the rare steak well done pho which was really good, just the right amount of noodles. The food came out pretty fast, if the waiter cared a little more it might have a better dining experience.

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Rangoons

cp-lk7TSYck-zsdGrdcv7g.text: I don't usually write reviews, but I ate here FIVE days ago and I've had non stop diarrhea ever since. I threw up all Saturday night. I've been to the doctors twice already to restore my fluids and get medicine. The most f'd up thing is I got the plain pho?? A worker must have been sick or they are handling their veggies wrong.   I know it was Pho Kim Long because that is the only thing I ate that day. Nevvvver evvvvvvver going here again.

1gUQwsTpx4hFE3vc6pjNhw.text: This restaurants odd hours off the Strip is where I go to get my Chinese fix. Not amazing, but I'd come back here.

dSDBzmY6J5ZQIw5PZuPvcg.text: I flew in to Las Vegas for a Trade Show and decided to grab a quick lunch at Pho Kim Long. Located in the Chinatown shopping center on Spring Mountain Rd. Pho Kim Long is an institution for Pho. The number 1 Pho has a bunch of different toppings and the meat is super tender, almost falling apart tender. The broth is good. Its always busy with a real eclectic crowd.   The service is ok and sometimes its hard to get the attention of the servers. Parking is hit or miss depending on what time you go. But its good Vietnamese fast food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gWlkMYTZBsg6RxRd6PpfgQ.text: Excellent vegan pho soup!!!  Awesome service!!  Good value and nice atmosphere!  I will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZJkPSRW4_QK3lpSl0kF_eg.text: I LOVE this place!! We drunk really much yesterday....so we wanted to eat pho!! I search in yelp and found this place. We ordered pho and beef fried rice.  They have small and large portions. So you can choice how much you want to eat!   I am live in Los angeles. So i've been a lot of pho restaurants but this place The best ever!  Food is good. Staff is friendly. Easy parking.

cWzkwJdU-Nw3n_MvuFutXw.text: Where do I begin? This place is so delicious and convenient. It's 24/7!! I mean, who wouldn't want hot beef noodle soup at 3am? Trust me it tastes better and better every time I go.  This place has many different options not just soup.  I always get #15 which is beef brisket and rare steak noodle soup. I love noodle soup and wouldn't go anywhere else.  There is always a line but it's for a good reason. Pho Kim Long is spacious so you shouldn't wait to long. Enjoy!

3xcuHczDvwMquobKTapgBA.text: After a night out at the club either dance or strip, this is a great place to drop in and have some delicious Vietnamese Food.  Been coming here for years and it never disappoints.   I enjoy their #13 which is filling and reasonably priced.  It seems to me that everyone that visits is dressed to the nines and either barefoot, from wearing high heels or drunk.  Service is always fast and what's amazing is the line is never Pho Kim long...   Parking would normally be an issue during the day as it shares a lot with other establishments but between 2-6am, parking is a cinch.  If you're not a fan of tripe, then you'll love this place, they don't offer it!  Other places do and usually include it in most dishes, so you're in luck.   I'll be back for sure when visiting my Disneyland.

V8TLNVuvUQh8MCKgcYAxYQ.text: The Food Is Good But Service is Horrible. I didn't get his name he was at the register to pay for your meal and had a attitude for checking us out and got our bill incorrect. Thus having us hold up the line because he messed up . We were patient with him and tried to be understanding but all we were getting in return is a "i don't wanna be here attitude" . In the end after we signed the receipts He Did Not want to give us a reciept  . I had to stay an extra 5mins because he was ignoring me . I did not raise my voice or disrespect this man throught this whole transaction. My advice DONT GO HERE !

cONU2gxPlqvlNYO-Oac-aw.text: Kim Long is the worst restaurant,  seafood was raw, smell and stink. The foods were horrible. I will never ever come back.

w_W9ojUiuFFLSuz8cwPAVA.text: Asking for MANDATORY TIP. If you don't, waitress give you bad and rude service. What happened??? It's sad because their foods are good.

FRA8XNSbIfZn-9uxzVArSw.text: 11:55pm plane lands. We are starving after the 6hr flight. "Where do you wanna to go?" "I wanna go Pho Kim Long!"   And so our Vegas adventure began. We tried the beef stew pho, the papaya salad and the summer rolls. The beef was very cartilagenous and bony but the flavor was good. Service was quick and attentive, and they accept credit cards!   We'll definitely be back again soon to Pho Kim Long!

-UJkJs8D8RX4XUia5zGBIg.text: We came around 10pm on a Friday with a group of 12 people and were seated right away! My party ordered mainly rice dishes and pho which came out within 20 minutes. One of our pho bowls came out not as hot and when we told the server he was more than happy to give us a new bowl to make sure that we were satisfied with our meal. Everything tasted like a Vietnamese mom's home cooking which is a good sign to a Vietnamese restaurant especially for those in Vegas that need their pho kick to keep them going

9ZFMsVd_XkN-R2Fa3BBiEg.text: I stood there for more than a few minutes without anyone greeting us, paying attention, or eye contact. I just went to Lees next door who has great sandwiches

IZliiubFIFtpStbh2dH2sA.text: The pho was delicious. We also got spring rolls and egg rolls. The spring rolls come in two and the other egg rolls come in 4 but they are much tinier than the spring rolls. The veggie pho doesn't come with tofu although that's what it says on the menu if you read the description - you will have to order it on the side. The place was very clean and spacious. The service was fairly quick. I'd recommend this place to anyone trying to find a pho place in Las Vegas.

EpvSHjn15MNPy4D2HyhibQ.text: If you're looking for something off-strip, cheap and to cure your hangover, COME HERE. Pho is the perfect remedy the day after a night of partying and drinking on the strip and this place HITS THE SPOT.   It's not too far from the strip, maybe a 5-10 minute lyft ride over and this is exactly what I needed to end my weekend. There's really not much to complain about the Pho, the broth is great and they give you a hefty portion of meat on the side. For $9 a bowl, I'd eat this over anything else on the strip on any given day.   Another thing that is very necessary is the Vietnamese Coffee, it's sweet but also packs a punch, so it does give you the jitters.

K3EDS9HAWSwf_4V1kfSq0w.text: Pho was not too impressive and but with it being 24/7 it'll do if you got the munchies in the early A.M. My fiance disagree and said it tasted like instant pho lol but we have very different taste buds. Service was pretty quick and water refill was great, we got the pho combo which consisted of meatballs, brisket, very good pieces if tendon and barely any tripe. We went in during the afternoon of EDC week.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broth is kinda boring but will fix your drunken munchies

0hZtaZxrXoJy5pb60K4z9Q.text: Craving for pho so we finally stopped by Pho Kim Long. 11ish and the place was not crowded yet. The lady who took my order was very helpful. The restaurant looks clean and welcoming. I ordered the combination pho for takeout and can't believe the quantity of food. It fed 3 people! So much noodles I could have made pad thai with the leftover.   When it comes to taste, it was good, but I've had better pho in Spring Mountain. Might stop by one day to try their other dishes.

MtQatwA0e-b84O-QjK0pFA.text: The crowd is majority after club crowd. They come in party clothes and at least semi drunk.   Food is alright. I have to admit I didnt have their pho but some chinese dish like wonton soup (in vietnamese style) fried clams and somw vegetable dish. Its not memorable and particularly good. The clams are frozen clams that remained the froze taste. Dont think I will go back again.

UvVmB66lBfr85SEMvfPGIw.text: It was pretty packed but our party of 3 none the less was seated within five minutes. The servers definitely pay attention and were at our table to take our order the second the last menu was set on the table. Brown rice as an option is great for us semi-conscious eaters lol

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What da pho
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and shrimp roll
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey walnut mayo shrimp

Kpu8dsxBRlnVtIdTIG8WgQ.text: This place is great if you're looking for a late night meal and you're not reeeeaalllyy up for a McDonald's drive-thru. Apparently this place is packed during the day (I've heard that it can get up to an hour wait!) but we always go after mid night and we get seated straight away.  Everything we've tried on their diverse menu is yummy :)  Although... My favorite Vietnamese restaurant is one back at home in New Zealand... I just can't help but to compare the taste! Hence the star rating!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WAPiQKZxA9F9d24FCJTuXw.text: I'm not a big fan of Pho, due to the fact that I'm not a fan of rice noodles.  My friend loves this place, so I thought I would come with her and try it out.  The great thing is the option to trade the rice noodles with egg noodles.  Ok, that fits the bill.  Broth is delicious.  I like the fact that it's opened 24/7.  If I ever have the late night munchies and need an Asian soup fix, I will think of this place.

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a7W9hSl2pflQSZOSLxAByg.text: This is my first time here and I must say, FIRST IMPRESSIONS LAST.   They SUCK! Service sucks. The Pho Tai here sucks. I got maybe 5 strips of steak.  We had 4 different guys serving us. You wave your hand calling for one's attention and they ignore you, straight up! They look the other way. That's why we had 4 different ones.   I had a better service at a 'mom and pop' pho place in San Diego than this place, considering this is a tourist town. Their egg roll is rock solid. One order is 4 pieces, unlike 6 in SD. Their calamari is oilier than a porn stars butt!   Not coming back!! Seriously, just go somewhere else. 1000+ people and this place has 3+ average. Go figure!

hn-H7TSukq0Cb83IIn5XQg.text: We always come to this restaurant whenever we are in Vegas.  Overall not bad, just a bit overpriced.  Will come back again if we go to Vegas since there aren't many choices there.

caPjvOxabulGYlBAqX2UBQ.text: Besides opening super late, I'm not really sure what's so spectacular about this place. For some reason it is SUPER crowded at all times of the day. The food was subpar, the wait is crazy long, and most importantly the service wasn't that great. So what makes this place special? I'm no entirely sure, maybe I just caught them on a bad day. The one thing that had me really not happy was that when my girlfriend and I wanted to pay our bill, they took the money quick but didn't bring back our change. Not sure if they were just expecting us to leave and forget about our change, but it seemed like they did that to a few tables. Very sketchy thing to do.   Anyways, I think any other Pho place would be just as good as this one. Way overhyped and not worth the wait. And definitely not worth them trying to just keep your change.

xF2ZXdGyNpU9BWNog0HzCw.text: Sometimes you walk in and it smells funky. Sometimes you walk in and it kind of smells like pee.  I come here for two reasons. One because someone I am at lunch with people who picked the place or two because I really, really want Pho and the people I am with are newbies to Pho and might not order Pho. Since, they offer other Asian eats, it is almost a win-win for everyone.  With that being said, my service here is never consistent. Sometimes it is good, sometimes it is horrible. I will say it is consistent about one thing, it is NEVER great.  I have had problems with getting my food on occasions. One time I ordered Pho and my friend ordered pad Thai. Well my Pho came right when she was done eating her pad Thai. Livid. I was going to send it back but because my friend treated me to lunch, I did not want to be rude.  The Pho itself is not bad. It isn't great. It has a decent broth. It lacks in ingredients however, and just leaves me wanting more. More meat, more flavor, more something.  But this place is always crowded, so maybe I am missing out on something.

CVaugU7T1KywUAGpFVjxvw.text: I know I came on a Saturday night but still they need to attend to their customers 10mins or less upon being seated!!! Waited 15mins for a waiter to take our order then another 15mins to serve us!!!! THEY NEED TO HIRE MORE STAFF if they need to keep good feedbacks from their clientele...

zVv2nwWZT2wgQl_tsgtDyw.text: Not much as changed since I wrote my first review over 3 yrs ago. Many visits later...the food has been solid....some of the best Pho in Vegas. However, the service here is still weird....servers are still miserable and unfriendly...I've come to accept it as fact that they don't like us because we're not Vietnamese. Combine that with all of the drunks that come in here during the late night and early morning hours and they have a generally bad disposition to outsiders coming to eat here. It's become part of the lore that is Pho Kim Long....at least amongst our friends. My fav dish here is the Beef Combo Pho....so good, I can eat it morning/noon/night...yum! yelp.com/biz_photos/pho-... yelp.com/biz_photos/pho-... As long as they keep serving up great Pho, I'll be back. Return Factor - 98%

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VI6A_nHw-gF0kuP4Afcwqw.text: We had the #13 (combination pho)  and #14 (pho tai), gave plenty of limes and serve steak on the side rare when asked, also open 24 hours. Only down side was that they don't serve tripe, and the server asks you your tip amount while standing there before taking your payment, which was a little weird.

diSwjytBurbNtQBFuIzH7g.text: Not a bad place for late night pho. Way to busy.    Food is usually Ok.   I've eaten my share of viet cuisine.

-HRSI-7r2ZV8kUGF1pih8A.text: I'm from LA and have been thoroughly spoiled by tasty cheap Asian food, especially Vietnamese food. Pho Kim Long is okay but definitely not worth making a visit during my trip.  The wait was pretty long since early in the morning. We were seated after almost 20 minutes and ordered a bowl of pho and a bo loc lac. The portions were pretty small for the price on both.  The pho was too salty and there was a lot of broth with a small amount of noodle. I have had a lot of better pho elsewhere. The bo loc lac actually tasted really good but it was pretty expensive for the small portion.  The service was actually pretty good for a Vietnamese restaurant.

P8mUWJUlh7khhEj9LW96mg.text: The worst restaurant in all of Vegas. Warning, stay away from this place. When we first arrived we were  rudely greeted by a big hispanic guy dressed in black clothes with an ear phone like he's a club bouncer. We asked for a table for 6 and there were literally 15 empty tables everywhere and hr told us we had to wait. Really? Then finally after 10 minutes he sat us down at 1 of the 15 empty tables. Next we waited at least another 15 minutes just to get water. Then another 10 minutes to order food.   The food sucks too. Stay awya

tt3YpeHH2HM-P_Ky6SM6rQ.text: So good that my friend and I went twice on our 3 day trip. The pho is phenomenal. It's not on the strip, but well worth a detour.   The service is prompt, even when busy. The broth is delicious, not overly salty and extremely flavorful. Perfect amount of meat for the amount of noodles. I eat a lot and the large size was just enough.   Recommendation: great meal to have to avoid/cure a hangover.

jUG5uLCOwlP9f_NVdYRDbQ.text: I ordered the Bun Bo Hue here and it was tasty. The meat they used is different than the one I'm used to, and they didn't provide pork blood but it was still tasty. The broth had a lot of flavor, although it left a bit of a greasy residue feeling on my tongue afterwards. Service is fast and attentive, and there are lots of servers if you need to flag down someone. We went at lunch time and I heard this place is 24 hrs so this review is during that time. Overall, a good place to go for anyone craving Vietnamese food in the Las Vegas area.

mhwaDxnv1yb7REuPnrp2hA.text: AMBIANCE: 4 - Always full of people. The line can be a long wait!! A lot of the time, when they are busy, they have you write your own name on the wait list, so make sure you're paying attention or you'll never get a table lol.   The tables are very clean, but I wish restaurants like these didn't leave soup spoons out in the open..it's a little semi-unsanitary since I've seen kids be very touchy-feely.   SERVICE: 3 - The service was good, but seemed very unorganized! I could never find my server as he ran all over the restaurant to wait tables. They might need to afford more staff, but there was never a moment that I had to wait a very long time for something to be done; except for getting someone to take my bill for change!   FOOD: 4 - good food, no matter what you order! and trust me, me and my friend ordered a lot! The salt and pepper chicken wings are my favorite dish. Plus, any pan-fried noodle dish is bound to be delicious. They have a giant menu, so choose wisely :) boba drinks are too sweet though!!   Local Specific Info: Open 24 hours.

3_RaKwLv7p9lCWBsrkfaaw.text: Best Pho in town. Love that they're open 24 hours, great spot after a night out with friends!  Service is friendly and your food is out pretty quick.   The kids enjoy watching the fish and sipping on their mango boba's.

xdHXN-ZBDE9gHf9b5NiEbA.text: Came here on 6/23/19 around 4pm. Pho came out fast but after that service never came back. Wanted to order another pho but server never came back. I was waving my hand up high and other servers made eye contact but they ignored me. Screw this place

166K_v_KdAOVpFoUhNzMeA.text: The vegan pho is pretty good, add some fried tofu for $2 extra and you got yourself a good meal.

5dugkqTRPQ1kQ-SYv-zpwA.text: They used be one of the best pho place i have been in las Vegas. Every time we come to vagas it was always one of the place we eat. Last time we went was terrible service and also food been changed. (More like new ownership ?) We were noticing they were different from few previous visit. I will find a different place next time, there are many other places yet.

GIpM6Zv4ZkW90LcAnj3L4Q.text: This is one of the better places I've eaten at in a while. One of my fav. Places closed and have been on the search for a replacement for some time. I'm not from Vegas and this is now bookmarked in Yelp for me and I'll return when back in Vegas. Staff were very attentive and friendly.  Partner eating with also enjoyed my dish. Great job, word of mouth is great and I'm speaking of you to anyone planning to visit Vegas.

GYQKiZj73W17GhKJVGvBHA.text: Decent vietnamese restaurant.  Bf and I got the chicken plate, shrimp and walnuts, and the fried calamari. I also got a beef stew with vietnamese noodles and a vietnamese coffee (not pictured)  The chicken plate was good as well as the shrimp and walnuts plate. The shrimp and walnuts plate was pricey for the few ppl pieces of shrimp; it was $17.   The beef stew noodles seemed like it was a bit watered down as they didnt get the soup base right. The calamari was alright, lightly seasoned.   The vietnamese coffee was perfect. It was strong and it worked wonders after a long week of work.   We went there around 4:30pm and there was no wait. We got seated quickly and the servers were great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken plate, shrimp and walnut, fried calamari

-lgU2guBhecD4SyUnCMO9w.text: There was a huge bug in my bok choy. I didn't order bugs.   Asked for a full refund for the rest of my food, because if they don't wash the bok choy, they probably don't wash the other vegetables. I was only given a refund for the bok choy. If I were pho kim long, I would have given me a full refund.   Actually, I would have not given me a huge bug in my bok choy to begin with.

MaQgFP00KtIMBFwrlYrl4Q.text: Pho Kim long is solid Vietnamese. Nothing beats coming off a huge trans continental flight and rehydrating yourself with a piping hot bowl of fresh noodle pho soup. Flavours were rich and they are open for late night eats. The spring rolls are monster big and come with a generous serving of leafy lettuce in which you can wrap your spring roll in. Menu offering is plentiful and the place was busy at 10 pm when we were here. For late night eats this is a very good option. Would I come back. Absolutely hells yes!

I6hupYFF-i1bFf_tZJqlXQ.text: This place use to be really good the food the service everything but now all the employees and staff seem so unhappy in their jobs ,they take forever to come and offer you your beverage there's so many employees walking around but it's takes them 10 mins to come take your order ... they don't ever check on you , and they seem so miserable , makes you uncomfortable. I can't eat at a restaurant where the employee don't care because it makes you wonder what's going on in the back ... I have given them plenty of chances I'm a local I live close by so I come a lot and it took me forever to decide that they just aren't a top pho restaurant anymore ... I was trying to justify the service, I would say to myself maybe they are short staff , maybe they are just having an off day but nope they just don't care how they handle customers.. maybe they shouldn't stay open 24 hours if their employees are tired and can't give the service that's expected ...

Eg3cKT04nTpRvCtb28MEIg.text: Great food, trash service, almost not worth my money.  Originally when I had come here, I almost gave this restaurant 3 stars. But after my recent Postmates order, I brought my review down to a 2.  Food: Food is great, a little better than the pho you'd find in the inland empire in California. Portions match the price on the menu and you'll most likely not finish your food. One pho dish is enough for two people!  Service: This is where the restaurant falls completely short. I can't fathom of how poor quality the service is at this restaurant. The first time I came here, they got our food wrong, they took hella time to bring out our food, and the man that picked up our check left our card and receipt lying somewhere. We had to raise hell to make them find our check. More recently, my friend had put in a Postmates order through them and when the food arrived, a lot of our food were missing. They had labeled the wrong soup so my other friend ended up getting my other friend's meatballs, they didn't get us enough utensils, didn't bother giving us a good amount of napkins, and to top if all off, they forgot to even make my whole order. I wanted the special combination beef pho bowl but it didn't even make it to the food line. Good thing Postmates decided to refund the payment.  Overall, if you are a glutton for punishment, I suggest coming here. The food quality is great, but if you want to be treated absolutely poorly, be their guest.

RjT93U8cgm-BnFoSJxgBvQ.text: My boyfriend and I just finished our meal here and it was so yummy. The calamari and crab rangoons were perfect appetizers. For our meal we had drunken noodles with shrimp, pork chops, and sweet and sour chicken. All were delicious. I just wish I'd had a few more shrimp on the drunken noodles. The service was great. I love how the servers were attentive and polite without False peppiness.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles with shrimp, pork chops, and sweet and sour chicken.

Xf3AdKystqAHK24Wdmyg1A.text: Read some decent reviews and decided to come check it out. This restaurant is very busy and has nice decor.  You have to raise your hand to tell them you are ready to order, otherwise, you will have to wait. The pho soup we ordered was not hot, heard from another table the same. Since they are very busy you have to catch them and tell the waiters and waitress what you want and need. I would recommend improving on customer service and follow up.

jn28eP_uwxPkD3bCpaK1Tw.text: That's so bad food and really bad customer service. I was asking for extra lime, they just said ok and then they did not give me anything. We went there for 5 people, on the menu they write the policy if more than 6 people, they will charge 18% for tip, but we only have 5 people. When I was asking for it, they were so rule to answer my question. I don't mind the tip if I give us a good service, but they're so suck. I don't recommend this restaurant

R2p2H5vadSJ7MKH8Za3WRw.text: So I've been coming to this place for years ! Like 3-5 years and I've been here at all times of the day from 3am to 10pm. The last couple times I've been in it hasn't been too busy. We went yesterday and we were seated in about 5 mins. When they took us to our table they set the menus down and the guy just left. Cool, we are looking at the menus. This other guy comes (about 5 mins later so by this time we are ready to order) and doesn't even acknowledge us he just puts the waters on the table and leaves. About a couple mins later our server comes and we order our appetizer and our food. ALL of the food comes out about 8 mins later but we were bummed we didn't get our appetizer first but whatever. At this point we are eating our food which is delicious, but no one came to check up on us or refill our water or see if we needed anything. We were trying to flag people down but they just kept on walking right by us !! HELLO !? We still waited like 10 mins after we were done with our food to see if they would bring the check and so I could add a boba to our order. NO ONE CAME ! I had to chase someone down to pay and order my boba. After I paid (cash) I was organizing it back in my wallet in front of the register and the guy was like "move over there". I wanted to walk out so bad when he said that but I had already paid for my boba. Safe to say I will be taking my business elsewhere from here on out, your food is great but last nights experience was horrible.

e-FIuRcgrfe9Da92HzRxQw.text: Fave pho place in Vegas!! I've been coming to Pho Kim Long since I was very little and I feel like every time I've been to Vegas, I've stopped by.  Parking can be hard to find in the small plaza since there are a lot of other stores around and plenty more being added!  Inside is big and roomy and not tidy clean but what do you expect?  I usually always get their Vietnamese iced coffee because it's so good!! Love how strong it is and I always have to pace myself when drinking it so I don't drink it all and leave the ice.  Then I get a large bowl of pho tai with beef on the side! Their broth is quite good.  Recently I tried their egg rolls and they're super crispy! I think I will order this again next time.  Their shrimp rolls were eh... wouldn't order again. Something about it tasted weird.   Also they're open 24/7!! How perfect for Vegas!

YwMHbay0PetcjNU15dY-UQ.text: Best and fastest way to fill your viet food craving at 3am in the morning. Be careful though a lot of drunk ass people come here too so don't be surprised if the staff is irritated. It's not you it was the drunk fuck that cursed him or her out and they are trying to keep there cool. But great staff when u get to know them all!!

I definitely told the couple once I saw what happened.   WARNING: Do not come here unless you like debris in your food. The dishes are bland and distasteful and her action was revolting. 10u1qfz4hZCyqHYP8kBZBg.text: Pho Kim Long (and hard!)  The restaurant was pretty big with a lot of hustle and bustle. It was nicely decorated but loud. The service was friendly and quick. The food was middle-of-the-road but a good value for the money.   The Pad Thai was good and the portion was very generous. The Chicken Teriyaki was dry and and the sauce was nothing special. The Taro Root Smoothie and the Watermelon Smoothie were especially delicious!   I give Pho Kim Long 3 Stars because the food was good but not great and the restaurant was way too loud.

0IhNejZ6svq2uVVjuuT_wA.text: Come on Pho Kim Long, you've come this far and achieved a level of success where I believe your customers deserve at the very least, newer and cleaner eating utensils.   After going through your entire supply, our nice server couldn't even find 4 decent spoons for us to use. All of your them are covered in a film of stuff that can be scraped off.  Embarrassing on mgmt.   Furthermore our table ordered 4 bowls of Pho and all four came out really fast and under temperature.  That's not a good look.  I don't know what's going on. These are some of the most basic requirements in a restaurant.  I really hope mgmt steps it up.  Would be a shame to see this place flounder. Totally disappointed. Not returning.

We finished our Pho and had to wait 10 mins for our rice dish.  Ok so you would think there PHO dish would be the most popular dish given that the name of the restaurant has Pho in the name, WRONG! The broth was lacking in flavor cmon it's all about the broth. The meat quality were poor especially the meatballs wtf you could taste the dryness after every chew it was like chewing on a gum that had the flavor sucked all out of it already.   I looked over the menu and it was all over the place. They serve many varieties of dishes from noodle soup, rice dishes, duck, fishes to family meal that offer several courses. Seems like the large variety of food options that are offered is causing less attention to what's really important QUALITY!   I will not be returning! Quality over everything!

o9eZbpBCQX6p4mrSDph9Dw.text: A 24-hr pho place right next to the strip? Life-saver. This location's situated in a bustling plaza with neighboring Asian comfort food restaurants, but I can't think of a soup more soothing and remedial than pho.  A bowl of pho will run you about $8-9 here, a little more than average, but that's Vegas for you. One star off simply because I've had deeper and richer broths before. But four stars because it's 24/7, the service takes care of you, and it does the job of nourishment.

k2cGXQZknHKOYqlNT6Ifkg.text: The food was good. My kids are very picky eaters, so I was impressed they actually liked the food. r_ehX9EXV9DRXnRv_DCABw.text: I had my doubts about his place. First of all, I come from a city where pho restaurants are in abundance.   But this place had good food. The restaurant was clean. The parking lot sucked. The service was good. I was happy that we had a large table so we never felt cramped.   The honey pork (#115 I think) was delicious. The pho was solid. CsB0cUk2tsv9LNsM7GlB3A.text: Tipsters.... service is mediocre at best. I will never Pho Kim Long again. (Or even short either) They force you to tip and immediately go after it. They let you walk up your check and cashier demamds you tip...(a bit suspicious) and you have to tip minimum 15% for them to take your order and drop you your food orders. After food is done they they drop you check and go..then wait for you to pay. There host are walkie talkie connected. So when you say tip is at the table they dispatch as host to collect your tip. And they will tell you if are short of their expectations of their tip. Never never never again. The taste is not worth the tip shakedown. I wouldn't put a star but that is the only way I can educate you on stay away from a business that demands a tip for their service even though they have the right to do what they want with their business...

Dbx17PVGfU3T1rm4OO-XCQ.text: As a genuine Vietnamese and a person who had eaten here every single day in Las Vegas, I would say this restaurant is the best Vietnamese restaurant in town. People in Vegas apparently have the same thoughts with me. As the restaurant did not take a reservation, the customers usually walk-in, stand for twenty minutes to half an hour to get a table. And yet, people just kept coming and patiently waiting with no rush at all. We even met a family who had come all the way from Colorado to Vegas to eat here. What a surprise! The Pho here is even better than some Pho I had in Florida and D.C. The broth was cooked so awfully well with the real taste of beef bones, oxtail (perhaps), with some spices like Vietnamese cinnamon sticks, cloves, coriander seeds, star anise, and cardamom. The Pho here is very Southern Vietnamese style, and I like it, even though I am from the North. Not only that, the Charbroiled Beef with Vermicelli which was not listed on the menu was delicious.  For those of you who want to try, just tell the server that you want "Bun Bo Xao", as "Bun" is the rice vermicelli, "Bo" is beef, and "Xao" is the method of cooking. The Vietnamese Iced Coffee is excellent too. Overall, if you are craving for a piece of Spring Roll or Pho, head nowhere else but exactly Pho Kim Long restaurant.

nuKCP52ELhkxYmC21_xZ4g.text: I'm definitely a fan of Pho Kim Long!  The fact that the restaurant is open 25/7 alone gives it brownie points as you never know what time of the day you'll be craving pho.   It's a pretty popular place on the strip, and there is a wait whether you go for Sunday lunch or for late night drunk munchies during the weekend. The good thing is that the waits are never usually that long; service is quick and efficient.   My go to items:  - Kim Long Fried egg rolls; comes with a dipping fish sauce, lettuce to wrap the egg roll in, and pickled veggies to top it off  - Pho with brisket only; tender and delicious  I've also tried and enjoyed: - Rice Vermicelli with charbroiled chicken or pork + egg rolls; rice noodle topped with fresh chopped lettuce, fresh veggies, charbroiled meat and sliced egg rolls, also comes with fish sauce to add in - Crispy calamari; salt and pepper, very flavorful, comes with a Mozzarella dipping sauce - Mongolian beef; add spice to your liking, very tasty and comes with white or brown rice   Pho Kim Long is convenient and a restaurant my friends and I go to at least once a month. Fast service, good prices, and filling dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charbroiled chicken deliciousness! (Vermicelli)
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho with brisket only

5p_3i14YMfm91nkJUoEQpg.text: I've been here multiple times. First of all, it's open all day and night. This is THE go to spot after clubbing if you're really hungry. On top of that it's located right off of the free and close the the strip. Depending on the time of the day you go parking can be tough, but 99% of the time you will find some, it might be a bit of a walk.   Upon entrance we have never waited more than 10 minutes. Their table turnovers are relatively quick. It's always at least half full to nearly entirely full. This restaurants brings in a lot of regulars.   Our waiters are always very friendly and attentive. The menu is very straight forward and easy to order. The ambience and look has a very transitional Asian feel. This makes it look like you'll be eating authentic food. Once we have our orders placed it didn't actually take our food very long.    I always order the traditional pho. The soup bowls are rather large. If you don't have a large stomach I recommend you share and split between 2 people. The broth is perfect. Not too salty and not too bland. I love mine spicy so I always ad chili. The hoisin sauce is also good if you want more salt. It won't ruin or change the flavor of the broth too much. The noodles have a great texture and man is it good. I love the vegetables on be side allowing you to customize the amount of veggies you want.    I always order egg roles to go. The egg roles come with veggies and a lettuce wrap with some sauce on the side. Some people don't know this but you're supposed to wrap the egg role into the lettuce so it gives it both a refreshing and savory flavor. It is a must every time you come!   Pho is good, but coming to pho Kim long is GREAT! Please.. check this place out if you're ready to get full! And even if you're on a diet like everyone else nowadays haha! :)

dnrn1VDvArlNnvP1Hc3BAA.text: First time going to this place. Crab Ragoons were amazing!! Had the chicken pho and was delicious! Definitely will be returning. Server was nice, food was pretty fast even if it was busy.

5IyycBzWEXuKXVHtg9-lQA.text: I just went today and the tables were dirty and smelled like mold, the bathrooms were filthy. Asians have the most disgusting bathrooms. They had tons of staff to accommodate the crazy wait and crowd so why not hire one more person to help keep bathroom clean. I asked the lady for scissors to cut my pho noodles for my kids and she handed me dirty ones. We sat in the back room and it just smelled there. The calamari had so much batter it tasted like I was biting into battered oil not calamari. This turned me off to fighting the crowds for suboptimal, overpriced food.

qNa5Q9uVe39iJbT3CUGg7A.text: I had the vermicelli noodles with egg roll & pork.  It was alright.  The service was also just alright. We went during lunch hours, it wasn't busy at all.  The food came quick, it was great. However, I asked for lime with my water, the waitress didn't the lime.  I needed to ask another waiter for the lime, he brought it right away.  All in all, Pho Kim Long was an "alright" pho restaurant. I gave it 3 stars because our food came out quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N15CwYqV4PoffKFA3jA2gA.text: Okay I've eaten here 3x in the past 3 days lol. You know it's good Vietnamese food when it's packed with Vietnamese people. Nothing like traditional selections of family style & comfort food here in Vegas. These servers bust their butts off working here. Some servers are not even Vietnamese & they know to pronounce the dishes on the menu in Vietnamese. & I truly appreciate you guys working on Christmas Eve, Christmas Day & the day after!!!!!Most recommended for late nights & hungover mornings for drunkies ;)

fet9fZTtLnjShD19NwbECA.text: Super busy establishment, quick service and mediocre food. We came in at 930 am on a Thursday morning and it was super busy, but we only had to wait about 20 mins before we were seated. The restaurant offers many different options ranging from pho to more specialty dishes such as caramelized clay pot fish. We ordered the pho and spring rolls. The pho only comes in two sizes small or large. If you're from a state that has tons of pho restaurants (e.g colorado, Cali..) their large is like a medium at the restaurants in colorado.   The pho was okay. I guess I'm spoiled because the pho in Denver is just amazing. What I didn't like was their meatballs, it had a really weird taste, like it had just been thawed from the freezer or something. The veggies that were served with the pho were definitely old. I always eat basil with my pho, but I just couldn't bring myself to eat theirs. They also forgot to bring out our spring rolls, which we ended up canceling... i guess when you're that busy... it's bound to happen.  Service was quick and the servers were nice during the little interactions that we had. Overall I can see why this restaurant could be a hit... because when you're intoxicated... everything tastes good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Page 10
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Page 9
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Page 8

av9EZva6GoMfVLcfuWuAKg.text: Vietnamese pho? Yessssss! Get the beef noodle soup! Great tasting in the soup and the noodles with the beef is fire. Authentic Vietnamese food! Oh get the spring rolls too!

VW4r20JiammLQwg8SCyuog.text: Whenever we are in Vegas and longing for comfort food, we head to Chinatown on Spring Mountain Road. I usually get the special Pho which has everything in it.  So yummy and the broth is just delicious.  My husband loves pork chops and so he orders pork chops where he goes.  When the pork chops came, his eyes opened real wide.  Chops were on the thinner cut but nearly covered the entire plate.  Yummy yummy he said!!!! Look for this place.  Has long opening hours!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C9u4NcUA3BGDx0mjVc-mVg.text: I ordered 4 small portioned plates and the total was $91 dollars. Definitely not worth it for the quality that it was.

El0lDo71Glf3IPUlWOSvIg.text: The food is always good, but the service fucking sucks.  They don't have a host, you have to sign in on a sheet and an angry busser comes and gets you.  The server is so busy they don't properly greet you, they don't follow up on your meal or even offer refills on their shitty water.

B-eBoxv1jF22UlKR4lf0DQ.text: this place is a freaking joke!  I would give it 0 stars if I could. Crappy ass service, mediocre food and the place is dirty as hell. The chopsticks and spoons still had crud on them. The tables were sticky and wet. The place wasnt busy and yet they didnt get our order right. The food wasnt anything great. And when it came time to pay the rude cashier made us tip. We already had left cash on the table and he accused us of not doing so. And he proceeded to charge it on our card.  Of all the pho places in vegas this one was the worst. PLEASE dont wast your time here. Go somewhere else like pho so 1, viet noodle bar. Anywhere but here!!

NE1fIQLcy_9iAwcKUffRrQ.text: Pho: broth was okay, meat was good, not too many noodles which is a plus, meatballs were baddd (very odd mushy texture and weird taste) Also for their dac biet, I kind of expect there to be some tripe, not just meatballs and meat.   Calamari: way too greasy and salty but at least the squid was tender  Spring rolls: hard to say, it wasn't bad. Just not very memorable.   Service: nothing to complain or comment about. It was good.  Would I come back? Maybe, but I'd definitely avoid any meatballs

dC9iEAhbYuWrVeMbIHYmXw.text: Lukewarm soup... They changed ownership!? Getting worse... so disappointed...  In my current situation I do think I can not come back again.  Saigon 8 is a good restaurant in Las Vegas.

sKlJs9erPXhNpVyoME-81g.text: Be prepared to wait a long long time...thus the name! Lol. This place is always packed!  Waited for 30 minutes to get a table at 1am! I ordered #23 Vermicelli with BBQ pork and egg rolls and had a side order of spring rolls.  I highly recommend #23!  I also had the fried calamari wich is also a must try!  Pho Kim Long has a very large variety on their menu which makes them a very popular spot.  Plus theyre open 24-7!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #23 BBQ Pork with Egg Roll Vermicelli!

hztVEJgxjfMQF0TXQcGa4w.text: We stopped by based on the recommendation of a friend. This place was very busy when we came so I was under the impression that the food had to be amazing. Well it was just ok/ mediocre compared to the other Vietnamese and Chinese restaurants I love to go to. The pho broth was not as flavorful as what I am used to, and the other dishes looked nice but taste wise did not impress me.. If this was my only option after a long night of partying with friends I would probably give it another try but not under any other circumstances. I did love my fresh coconut beverage and the service was pretty good.

0xwuIrmrJYzU6Dn8n-iJpQ.text: I have been here a few times, and thought I would be a return guest until today. We had a party of six and all needed separate checks. In the past this hasn't been a big deal, and shouldn't have been a big deal today as the restaurant wasn't busy at all.   I go to the cashier to pay my share of the bill and the guy has a very clear passive aggressive attitude about the hassle of splitting the check. When I go to ring up, I noticed that the bill was also higher than normal. I figured it was because gratuity was included so I asked him to clarify, he said it wasn't. The lazy bum actually charged me more for having to split checks! It was only a few bucks so I didn't want to create a fuss about it.   Low and behold, we leave and my group realizes he did that to everyone. Long story short, large parties beware if you split checks, they probably will charge you the wrong amount and be passive aggressive about it.

TLn2VfgFB9Udzu1STP1kEQ.text: It's great that they're open 24/7, but their food is well below average. They are highly priced compared to other restaurants in the area. The Pho is super bland. Egg rolls are very nice but also very thin and stingy. I've yet to try their other dishes, but I highly doubt I will. I would never even have stepped foot in this restaurant if my usual choice for Pho was open late. They are in a very busy location, and parking is always difficult.
