bGK578xd6PPq45U6VtbqOQ.text: This place is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant, it is 24 hours and food quality and size is perfect. I almost tried all options on the menu, my favorite between noddles is number 66 as combination, in rice and chicken go for 37 with seasoned rice( i called it red one) if you like fried chicken go for half fried duck , it is enough for two and taste like heaven. If you want beef go for number 110 with American brokly and one seasoned rice and it is good for two. Also between pho go for chicken one it is awesome. Put some basil in it and enjoy of a True pho taste. For seafood i just tried combination of seafood on the skillet i think it was number 133, it was good but i am not a seafood person, i am sure if you like fish and shrimp and squid you are going to like it. Be aware that there is line list to seat so get there earlier, also the busiest time is weekend around 5 pm to 3 am.( it is crazy that people go to eat at 3 am i know i am one of them) food comes fast and hot also you can customized  it if you are familiar with their seasons which i am.

7_J5Rop5VGR_nQkM4MlkCQ.text: Can we say super delicious? At least thats what I remembered when I came in after a long night of clubbing and being fully intoxicated! LOL! I think it's really nice that its 24 hours, perfect place to eat at drunk or hungover! It was super packed at like 3AM or so. I had their pho and the egg rolls and it was all pretty good and standard.

bevvtwkxgqrkVCwE7HGJ_Q.text: The pho isn't out of this world but it's open late so I'll go here after the club or on Sunday morning before driving back to SoCal. Gets really busy. Not cheap. Small portions. But quick fix for your hangover before the long drive home. They also have other Asian dishes but I've only had the pho and eggrolls. The servers seem to always be busy so if you want more napkins or extra onions, be prepared to ask multiple times.

cg8t7prRr173L20HNoIVnQ.text: Love Love Love this spot! Kelly seated and waited on us today. She was very attentive and helpful. My Sister and I started with their 'spring rolls with shrimp, pork, and lettuce' and 'deep fried tofu'. Both appetizers were bomb!!! For our meals we ordered their 'singapore noodles with shrimp and pork' and their 'braised cat fish in clay pot'. Both were bomb as well!!! This place hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. braised cat fish in clay pot
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. singapore noodles with shrimp and pork

P18uoya09DSjR0ml9Sgn-Q.text: This place is actually pretty good. I am not sure how Vietnamese food here in Vegas tastes...but I wouldn't expect it to be totally awesome like it would be back where I am from in CA. Considering this place is the go to place for drunk munchies, I liked it.   There were tons of menu options from an array of noodle dishes, phos, and rice plates. It is open super late, so after you're done partying on the strip at like 4 am, you come here to eat! Came here with my gfs and our new found friends and we got the pho. YUM. It was really good! A little on the salty side but the meat was freshly pink and the noodles was yummmmy.   The fried rice was kinda gross though. It was pretty bland and tasteless. I felt like I was just eating it just to eat it. My gf got the drunken noodles, which are the wide flat rice noodles. Kind of too oily for me but it was really good. Tons of basil flavor in it too!   Even though the rice was bad, I give this place 4 stars because it is cheap, open late, and fun place to go to after you club.

Y3cHTC_sgay5Tqvju47KYQ.text: Me, my boyfriend, and my mom went to this restaurant a couple days ago. We enjoyed the food however the customer service wasn't all that amazing. I felt very rushed when ordering my food. But the food was delicious none-the-less. I ordered the Pho with rare steak. It came in a really large sized bowl for a "small" order. It was very tasty. My boyfriend ordered the combination pad thai and it was TO DIE FOR. I was picking off of his plate most of the time. My mom ordered the salt and pepper chicken wings, which weren't my favorite. They tasted pretty bland. She also ordered the pho.   Over all, I enjoyed my food and my boyfriends food but the customer service wasn't all that great.

wxk_59biRehiIG56nb0wkw.text: Broth was good, but not as sweet as I'd prefer (should boil with sweet onions instead of brown onions). Service was fast, and the servers speak english fairly well. Probably the most friendly Vietnamese restaurant I've been to in a while (usually frequent westminster and alhambra for pho). Very popular place, so be prepared to wait for a little bit. Prices are a little on the higher side too: $3 for a SMALL bowl of pho broth and about $9-$10 for a bowl of pho. All my hung over friends enjoyed this place.

cBpkwOVGkrTXKn6Sp3wrLQ.text: Nothing opens at 10 am in Chinatown except this place, which is 24/7 (only positive thing about this place).  Cost wise- way too overpriced!! Only six of us and the bill was already totaled up to $95. Omfg! We didn't order any drinks. We just had one dish per person and two orders of spring rolls!   Food wise- sucks balls! The spring rolls are so dried! Yuck! The sauce for the spring rolls is so bland. The pho is alright. Nothing special about it.   Service- the service was slow. We all had water, and not even ONE refill was offered. Sucks!!  I'll give one star because it's 24/7.  Not going back again! Peace!

nzmj7SXOfX5yLhtHxQjsDg.text: I been here a couple of times an I usually can take any sassyness but today was the worst . First we get seated and the guy bringin is the water put the two cups in the table and threw the straws without looking at us as if he was annoyed...I spill some water on myself and asked for extra napkins and the same guy came back and very impatiently said I ha e someone already coming to clean up. Pointing at me and acting upset at me. ?! Really ? I have a lot of friends that come into town and always direct them to this place but now only will have something g negative to say . It seems like it's ok to be dicks to your costumers at this establishments ---- wow now I have to add this!!! As I was eating my meal and the lady next to us jumps up and gets startled by a cockroach on the table !!!! Wow I'm never eating here again ! I'm sorry because I dislike writing negative reviews :(

46WtFjtn151qfBCkRs8UQA.text: Good food, big portions, reasonable prices. The only thing lacking is customer service, not sure if the waitress was trying to get rid of us or what but we hadn't even looked at our menus before she started asking what we wanted and when we told her it was our first time and we needed a bit to figure it out she came back in about one minute and every other minute until we decided.

BV7ee5UMi7olgXdPxs7MPg.text: Love this place but they have the best seasoned chicken but I wish they were more  generous on the meat portion    Fresh spring rolls are bomb and  pho is great Pork chops AMAZING!

dcEXf1Hu88q4QNa2JcwzMw.text: This place is a good place for a late night snack. Their famous for their Pho! They stay open for 24 hours and the service is very fast. If the line is long you won't be waiting more than 35 mins. When you go make sure you get Boba Tea from Fat Dumpling!

NV4yEWF4K0clHNi28BMIdQ.text: I've been here give times since I landed in Vegas but my phone was always dead .. Lol I love this place their veggie pho is to die for .. Always a wait to be seated but well worth it

K_xD_PiXkgNBPe9C1arE7w.text: Just saying the name brings a smile to my face.  Eating the food makes me just as happy.   So before the fucking long (see what I did there) road trip home, we wanted something different.  So we decided on a meal off the strip.  Heading over to the Chinatown area of Vegas will give you a whole different Vegas experience, especially if you go during the day. If you've never ventured off the strip for any reason, Pho Kim Long would be just as good a reason as let's say a strip club.  You'll get just about the same level of satisfaction.  You want authentic vietnamese food and friendly service at a reasonable price.  Pho tai, spring rolls, fried egg rolls, strong iced coffee ... they got it all.  You know you wanna come here just so you can say ...   Pho Kim Long

uobXz4yQ06HZkDulWR1U7g.text: This place is NO BUENO. The only good thing here is the young coconut... Slurp that one up and it's delicious. Next time I come here I will only get that...  Ok but to be brief, the service is sloppy. We ordered a beer and never got it. Still was on the bill. We had to flag our waiter down to order. Once our food was at the table, no one ever came to check up on us.   The pho i overpriced, the broth is not very well flavored. I was not satisfied. To pull a restaurant name like this, much more is expected.

LjmFigZrMhuqZr2KmBF3Ng.text: Always delicious, Pho Kim Long is our "go-to" for Vietnamese food no matter the hour of day. It is open 24 hours, and more often than not there is a short wait for a table. The salt and pepper chicken wings are a must, and their pho soups and vermicelli noodle dishes are consistently flavorful and filling. Right now they have a special appetizer of pork belly buns that are soft, sweet buns filled with BBQ pork belly, cilantro, jalapeno slices and a sriracha mayo. Divine.

otfagym-bRDvO7E6az-8pw.text: Canh chua ca kho to is the best!!! We are looking forward to come back to Pho Kim Long again.  We received good services and excellent recommendations for the best courses.

sBNzn0HoA4DLr7nViYxu-g.text: My brother has been raving about this place and we went there last night and had wonton noodle soup the Wonton had a smell that reeks of rotten meat so I djust push each of them out of my soup. The egg noodle looked and tasted very old, not to mention the broth tasted like dirty dish water, or what I would imagine it to taste like. Best thing was my Sprite. The service so so, but I hate to admit the won ton was expired how do I know  I'm writing this review from the toilet stall at work.....

qYFdqLqkc_8IYTkW0IUy1g.text: Of course I'm a fan, it's become a bit pricier since I first came so we'll keep an out eye for the others around the area, especially when they're really busy.  Great variety, quick service and can't go wrong after a long night/morning on the strip.

vHYk6RTknb4n_5YBQX61RA.text: Place has definitely remodeled.  I guess the catchy name of the restaurant or word of mouth of this place actually got around where people love coming to this place ha.  I came here one day when it was super packed.  We had to wait over an hour.  Ridiculousness!  Finally, we got seated and we waited awhile for the waitress to come.  My friends ordered the typical pho bowl while I got my fave dish, bun thit nguong.  It was delish!    When it came time to paying our bill, we asked the waitress to charge certain credit cards to the specific dishes we ordered.  She had to ask us a number of times and then finally got it, supposedly.  Then when the charges came back, we realized the lady just split the bill into thirds.  Sheesh...

9o77_CfwSoKaXkfh9O9niw.text: Going to be quite honest- I was fairly inebriated when I ate here, so I can only go off from my memories from that night. However, I do have amazing taste inebriated or not!   Definitely think that the broth here is quality. The service was by far the best coming from a pho shop and I was impressed that they were so attentive even when there were so many people going in and out of the restaurant. They even called us a cab for when we were ready to go home!  Would definitely go there again.

zkaw7ei-Czu1YHzZZFrGpQ.text: we were here on a saturday afternoon at 2:00 and were immediately seated (a table for 4).  about 15 minutes after we arrived we noticed that several families and couples started coming in and since the restaurant was full they had to wait.  i'm just glad that we got there when we did since i get really grumpy when i'm hungry!  service was what you would expect from a pho restaurant - average.  i got thai tea which was a bit too sweet, but my mom's iced coffee was good.  our table got vermicelli with egg roll, bun bo hue, and pho.  i don't know why we order pho when it's like 108 degrees outside, but we were glad we did.  food was so good that we were trying to figure out when we'd have time to come back here before going back home to utah.

oRBBf89l4kDfz4ejyvX99Q.text: They have good food but not AMAZING. Definitely not amazing enough to have to put up with their horrible service.   I repeat... HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE SERVICE!   Host doesn't notice you and won't seat you unless you're with a larger group. He was also extremely rude when we pointed out to him that he's walked past us several times and stood in front of us without even looking at us. I had to walk up to him and say "Party of 2" right in his face for him to realize I was standing there trying to be seated. And this was in the middle of the night when it wasn't very busy. There was a party of 5 in front of us which he was attentive to (and having a nice long conversation with); they all went to the bathroom so me & my boyfriend were the only 2 standing there. Instead of kindly apologizing, realizing his mistake, or trying to make our experience better, he was extremely rude about the situation. Because of that, we walked out the door and took our business elsewhere.   If you're not going to be attentive to the people walking in the door and you're going to be rude, you shouldn't be working the front where that's the first thing people see.   I know from past experiences here, you don't have just one server; your waiter is anyone you can catch the attention of, which isn't very easy unless you're part of a larger group. I think the waiters/waitresses all share their tips and it makes them not care about the service they're giving.

eT1X9XMliEdQ3ZfxQcJqCg.text: Currently in their parking lot about to throw up after having calamari, #14, and a Thai tea.

fjEigU74dodfiVv7G_Cx3A.text: This is perfect place for you to eat Pho or asian food when your family travel to Las Vegas. They have big place and nice service.

J3p0Rby-33PonbyHh2BBHQ.text: The food here is awesome! Always made fresh and tasty. This spot is one of my favorite places to eat! Its also open 24 hrs. My only problem with this place is the service. Sometimes i never get checked on or get a refil.... Cant go wrong with anything i order, i know i will like it! They also have bobba drinks to which is a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Oy96psWYCDvjxIYLoSe8lw.text: This place is probably appreciated by those who are hung over. Unfortunately (in more ways than one), we patronized this restaurant sober as a blade of grass. On a Sunday morning, I found this place to be quite dark. Again, the dark would have been appreciated had I been hung over or still buzzing. The pho broth was salty and unbalanced. It tasted like it had too much star anise.   I was adventurous and ordered the bun bo hue. Huge mistake-- again salty broth, the veggies that normally accompanies this disk appeared sad. The offering of frest mint was very stingy. Instead of cabbage, there were pieces of ripped up lettuce. Sure, they may not have red cabbage, but they could have at least cut up the lettuce nicely.

Mdck_gg5XTYUkKKLmi524A.text: Always my go to for PHO. How can you possibly go wrong when its open 24/7!  Good service, friendly vibe and awesome menu. Great shrimp, tofu PHO with extra brocoli. Yum!

V7p9tvT7pw-ZaRcb1C9dRw.text: Pho is not bad but the service is terrible and the place is dirty also when you leave the restaurant you smell like pho all day..They do open 24/7.

ilghOafjhnczJThDMBPfiA.text: Awesome food and a fun experience for someone unfamiliar with Las Vegas' China Town. The chicken wings had this green onion sauce that was better than the chicken itself. The Crab Rangoon is not fluffy like what I'm used to but better with a thin and crispy outer shell. The waiter recommended the pad Thai as their best dish - it was very good, but I felt like there had to be something better than just pad Thai. The parking situation during dinner is horrible, but I was lucky enough to pull in at the right moment. I would definitely come here again if I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wPy9OVlwZHjSbDPrlVMIwg.text: Pho Kim Long,  A 24/7 Vietnamese Restaurant with probably the most extensive menu of Viet Cuisine here in Vegas; that even my mom from Cali knows the place.  I came in for lunch with my girlfriend and we got a table fairly quick. The server was quick and always attentive to us with whatever request i.e. more lime, small bowl, and etc.  I order the Pho Tai (Rare Beef) Large and the flavors definitely reminded me of pho from Cali, but the portion felt a bit small still for a large size and the meat quantity was definitely lacking.  My girlfriend ordered the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio (Grilled Pork Vermicelli with Eggrolls), and again the flavors were reminiscent of home, but the ratio of noodles to veggies were off. Too much veggies and too little noodles. The fish sauce accompanied with it was fantastic though!  All in all, the service was great and the food tasted great as well, however the quantities and ratio can be improved upon leading to my 4 stars for super service.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Tai Large

woIrP4S7phHveeLZRJ3OBQ.text: Ive been here a few times before as in groups and it was always a pleasant experience.   This past memorial day I came alone for a nice bowl of pho. I was skipped in line and was ignored as I requested siracha hot sauce. I had to ask my neighbors table for their hot sauce to season my pho. The service I received was so bad I didn't leave a tip. I felt bad not leaving a tip but the way they kept ignoring me made me feel unwelcomed. I will only recommend this place if you are going in a group but not alone. I'd recommend going up spring mtn and finding another spot.

wz_CnYHmC4yKttRnM4a2cA.text: If I'm comparing the pho broth here against the ones back home in San Gabriel Valley, CA I will say it's just okay.  I ordered the meatball pho and my family ordered the rare sliced beef pho.  The broth lacked something that I can't quite place.  If you are craving pho this place will hit the spot for being out in Vegas.  The price is decent and the service is good.  Our server spoke English and Mandarin as well so it made it easy for my parents to order.    There's plenty of free parking in front of the restaurant.  And the restaurant is located right next to a bunch of other Asian restaurants included Chinese and korean food.  If you are craving Asian food this is the area to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RCUXjwaUv5rpPXJBAp1S_Q.text: I see Dirty Dining and Restaurant Impossible for the future of this place.   What happened to this restaurant?! The quality of food is not as good, its filthy and the customer service is shit.   This use to be the go to place for my family whenever we get together. Sad to say that it will never be again... very disappointed and disgusted.

cFWl-0PyLq8f6t8ZAZfK5Q.text: Pros: used to boycott this place way back in the day (due to terrible service), but I'm 99.9% sure they're under new management now. Fast forward to the present and their service is above average for your typical Vietnamese restaurant. Always quick and friendly. The vegan pho is amazing and normally ready in under ten minutes, sometimes five. Highly recommended. It's nice to have a 24/7 option. The city that never sleeps definitely needs more of those.   Cons: the dining area seems like it's never completely sanitized. This could be an issue if you a have a problem with germs. I'm okay as long as the utensils and cups are clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan pho

ekgnIoirjfmzoWAKNbmGQg.text: Pho Kim Long fed our hungry souls under this Nevada heat. Food was great, servers were all attentive and we didn't wait too long for the food to arrive.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y51BL_XCzkW8mgNIPnAfTQ.text: We had been going to this restaurant over the course of the past 7 years and I have to say I am very disappointed to what they have come to!   They changed the menu and offer less quantity with hiked up prices!   The quality of the food has also become worse.   We will be exploring different restaurants!

SqjqKV-VTjJ-7iibMqwDLg.text: I was here for the first time, and I was VERY happy with my visit.  We were seated right away, the food was great, and prices didn't break my wallet!   (I paid $20 for a bowl of pho inside the hotel on the strip once...)  Anyway, parking is easy.  There's a Lee's Sandwiches next door and Meet Fresh across the street.  I'm excited about the 7 Leaves coming soon!  I ordered the egg rolls, which were surprisingly REALLY GOOD.  I usually never eat egg rolls!  The order came with four, and I ate two of them by myself.  I also had a #16 (rare steak and flank) small size, which was more than enough to cure a hangover.  The broth was delicious. They have sauces and bean sprouts ready before the food comes.  This restaurant full of Asian/Vietnamese people also confirms how authentic their food is.    Service was great.  The servers know what they're doing, and they also care about you.  They asked every table how things were going.  I love it!  I'm def coming back on my next Vegas trip!

DsNC3u4PCQTS6Tv8zJrjIg.text: Don't eat here. Left full and very unsatisfied. Came here 8pm on a Tuesday and had greasy, gooey Vietnamese pancake with no flavor and super cheap on the no-flavor meat and shrimp. It was FULL of lots and lots of bean sprouts. Had spring rolls with same no-flavor meat and shrimp used in spring rolls (I didn't know this beforehand) and it was awful at $6 I wouldn't pay $1 for one. The sauce for the banh xeo was just horrible looked  and tasted like sugar water with a few drops fish sauce. Had to ask for lime and fish sauce and still couldn't eat the partially cooked/uncooked pancake.  Next, the combo pho taste like someone reheated an old bowl of pho. And/or added hot water to the broth. What the hell? Meat was horrible, once again and dry/ tasteless.  Lastly, our waiter forgot my soda to wash this down with. I just asked for it to be left off the bill.   Why didn't I just complain ? You don't want to complain at an Asian place unless you want something " special " in return.   Really disappointed. Keep your money, or Go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bean sprout &#34;Ban Xeo &#34; (lol)
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bean sprout &#34;banh xeo&#34;

WYG__5nXPrkWAYwbJTCmZQ.text: Visiting here from Florida and upon arriving to Vegas on a cold morning, my family was craving pho at 9AM. What better place to go than 24/7 pho?!   Now being that this place is 24/7, I did not expect much from the pho. I ordered the pho tai chin and it was pretty good. The bowl was smaller than most pho places I'm used to in Florida, but I was still full after eating the entire bowl. As far as the broth, it didn't taste as good as most authentic pho places, but I was willing to settle considering there's not many places you can get pho this early.   Overall, the service good and food was good. If you're looking for pho anytime of the day, this is definitely the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho tai chin (rare beef and brisket)

N3jbFmjQf6QSL9W0y3UrSA.text: Whoa. This place was seriously a hidden GEM. I will be coming back over and OVER again when we visit Vegas. So here's the story...  We visited Vegas on a chilly and nippy weekend. We had a party of about 13, and we all decided we wanted Pho...or some comfort food along those lines. Our aunt suggested Pho Kim Long, and I'm so happy she did.   Although my original plan was to get Pho, after seeing the menu I was eager to try everything. We ordered egg rolls, crab Rangoon, Terayaki chicken, Pad Thai, orange chicken, etc. The appetizers came out HOT and fresh! We also got an assortment of delicious dipping sauces as well. The Terayaki chicken was fabulous, no complaints....the PAD THAI though...the chicken Pad Thai I will be dreaming about from this moment forward (ok a little dramatic, but still ). The sawwwwce was perfection. Just the right amount of heat and consistency.   The service was GREAT! They accommodated our large party just fine, and we were seated in a timely manner for a busy Friday night. It started getting busy when we left around 830pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qGK7mWuNGsALztVzkJBsmA.text: We came here after seeing Enrique Iglesias at The Colosseum and all that excitement made us hungry!!!  So Dude suggested we eat at Pho Kim Long as it is open 24 hours!  I love pho and to have a restaurant with pho open 24 hours is heaven!   We all ordered soup noodles and I ordered the seafood egg noodle soup and I inhaled mine and finished it before Dude and my girlfriend finished theirs!  It was hearty, piping hot and delish!  Too bad we don't have one of these restaurants in the Bay Area!

I usually enjoy some pho or the charbroiled chicken, but I was in the mood for adventure and the charbroiled pork bowl with vermicelli noodles caught my eye. It was super tasty! It was also super filling. This place is often bustling, but today we were seated right away. It was nice and quiet for a change, perfect for some conversation, and we had a nice time.

ziqLbPb6DbYLJ8l6we3aiQ.text: Well I was headed to another location I stopped in here for some takeout. The customer service seemed interested when I thought I was going to be sitting in any eating but when I found out I was getting takeout I seem to be rushing just get me out of there. The food was decent but not something that would draw me back.

ZdmTP98a5zJ-OOEa1u60-w.text: Tonight we waited for at least 20mins and we didn't even get offered water or anything and they weren't even busy to say that was the reason. So we left to a different restaurant with better service. This was the last time we come here

FQn4MSm4x8pXYqrTvXOpdQ.text: The pho was disgusting. It tasted like toilet water and basil. The staff is rude. Had to wait a very long time for our food once it was ordered. Once the food was at our table, it was cold. When we told the waitress, she said she'd get us a fresh plate. But she lied. My plate had a small lipstick smudge from when I picked it up to smell the food, and it came back in the same plate. Still cold.   Never coming here again. My party was a party of 8 people you'll never see again.

9XSiHVSbWIc3MvihHxi5gQ.text: The cream cheese wonton was good. The soda lime was meh. It was missing something or needed more of something. It just taste like fizz water lemon.  The pho broth was not clear. It had a lot of little residue floating. We order 1 large bowl and one regular bowl. It both came out the same size. Don't recommended to get the large bowl for the extra cost. The meat portion was okay. Order extra meat ball for extra cost.  Felt like we were rush to order, eat and leave.

-qglxXV7vCleK19yrGYhgQ.text: ** Cheap and affordable pho that tastes authentic and has decent portions. Combination pho is popular and recommended.  Stopped by before flying back to California, and was feeling pho. I got the combination which was recommended to me by the waitor, and it didn't disappoint. The main thing that stands out about the pho is the meat. The combination has several different types - meatballs, brisket, steak.. all of them tasty and good quality. It didn't seem as sketch as some of the other places I been to where u don't know what type or where they even got the meat.   Service was friendly and decently fast. Come check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pho - pho king tasty

teCfICko6tcDCYPB2Rb4Fw.text: A decent Vietnamese Chinese place in Las Vegas. Located in the main Chinatown strip mall. I think it's been here a while, always crowded. Open 24 hours a day. Not the most authentic Vietnamese, more Chinese, but not bad. Decent selection on the menu.

VS9TVfmQTRU3rb-utGt4Sw.text: Went here on New Years Eve and boy was that a huge mistake. Wait time was roughly around 40 minutes which wasn't too bad.   The food was decent.  But Westminster and Garden Grove have way better vietnamese food. The only reason I came here was the fact that it was open late and I was hungry for rice and pho. If there was a different resturant open I would have gone there instead.   Food Ordered: Pho with brisket & rare steak  8/10 Pad Thai 7/10  Rice 5/10 ( the only reason why it was a 5 was because the rice was hard) and it took us forever to get.  Only complaint is that the staff was unattentitve. Our server was all over the place, only saw him when he took our order and then he was gone the rest of the night. He didn't even bother checking to see if we had got all our food, he never checked to see if we got water, he never even came back with the check. Waited over 15 minutes for my rice, so instead I had to go up to the counter to get my rice. We didnt even bother waiting for someone to give us our check because service was so bad.Instead we went up to the counter to pay.  Overall experience:  If you have patience then by all means come here, because you'll be waiting forever.

NnchzdgmJD8VluAcBVkxpQ.text: We normally make a stop in Chinatown every time we come..this was no exception.  We normally would order Pho but its 115 degrees outside, we just ended our 8 hour road trip back from Idaho and we are starved!  It was 1000pm and Chinatown in Las Vegas is always open!  Thank God ...so was Pho Kim Long.  You signed in and the waiter said about 45 minutes wait...it was only about 15.  We were seated and our waiter not the warmest individual (but it's ok we were warmed up from the weather outside).  Anyway we were given water, ordered our food..it probably took another 20 minutes or so...then silence!  All you heard was chewing..we ordered spring rolls & crab rangoon for appetizers.  The spring rolls were great, but rangoon was exceptionally light and crispy....delicious!  Then the real food came..walnut shrimp, crispy house noodles, salt & pepper pork chops, beef with eggplant stir fry, and garlic ong choy, and roast duck.  Our entire table was well fed ..that was for sure!  The food was very tasty and flavorful.  As a matter of fact this was the first time we ever ordered family style dishes.  We were certainly pleased.  So my take on this restaurant if your looking for quick service and good food..maybe not so bubbly waiter (although he was very cognizant of the empty water glasses that he continued to fill up - which made up for any shortcomings).   Definitely recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BfY6KGjjHnsfYVZBE-YdmA.text: After long nights on the vegas strip, pho Kim long is my go to for pho. It's right in the middle of china town at a spacious location and less than a 10 minute cab ride off the strip. Our last visit, we actually ordered other items on top of pho and it was surprisingly pretty good. The consistency of the pho broth can be hit and miss, therefore the lower rating. But overall, if you're hungover and need pho.... this is the place to go.

PokBo5FpXRvSoCeBfukGrw.text: Came here on Monday, Christmas eve and sea of people waiting. Wait was not too long and this place is the model of efficiency. Orders taken and dishes served timely.   All dishes were excellent and prices were more than fair for Las Vegas.   Big plus - my brother's pho came about 10 minutes after ours and the manager (I'm assuming he's the manager, young Asian guy) approached us to apologize. Great customer service and we really didn't think anything of it since it was Christmas eve after all and so many people. I would like to think these people really care about the customer. You read so many horror stories and bad experiences at restaurants during the holidays. We were glad this place was the opposite.

IARhvUtNveoqX5wkTshyNA.text: We went there yesterday party of 9.  They are not that crowed.  We said we ready to order but they walk around and around ignoring us.  My husband had to say third times.  They charged 18%  tip automatically on the bill.  So be careful you may end up give them tip again If you are not check the bill.  Exactly like other people said, food are cold Nd the broth taste not that great.

CXkq2JZbYc3jnulAjxVSYw.text: This is one of my favorite late night spots in China Town. It's open 24/7 and the food is great. The only down side is it gets really packed so most times you have to wait a little bit to be seated or it can be a little difficult to get your servers attention. However, tonight John is our server and he has been extremely kind and attentive. My favorite dishes are are the lettuce chicken wrap, orange chicken, fried rice, and Sweet and sour. There's a big menu with a lot to choose from. If you have a sweet tooth, be sure to try the Taro with Boba, another one of my faves!   I wouldn't recommend coming here for a date night, as it gets a bit loud but it's def. fun hanging out in groups here. It's also a bit messy looking at times but that's only because there are so many people coming in and out that it's difficult to keep up!   Great spot where are the locals come for after hour noms.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed beef noodle soup
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singapore noodles!

ZQdqwD8sR-y9_IRPZ1ZhjQ.text: Hands down the best place to go late or any time of the day for Chinese and Vietnamese food that really hits the spot honestly while drunk or sober. Food and service is fantastic! They are open 24/7 which is really convenient for fulfilling those cravings. My husband and I went on Thursday night around midnight and got seated within a minute of entering. From start to finish the service was quick and courteous. Every employee that came over to the table from the bus boy to the waiter were on point. Our water cups were always filled and we never had to ask for anything. Here is what we ordered:  Appetizer: Salt and Pepper chicken wings Soup: Won ton soup no noodles Entree: -charbroiled shrimp and pork Vermicelli bowl -half roasted duck -tender cubed steak with black pepper sauce and steamed broccoli  -orange chicken   I HAVE TO SAY FIVE STARS ALL AROUND! Period.

p6XyjGPUhh_AxJKihBrLCA.text: Could be a long wait standing outside as there aren't very many chairs inside. I happened to wait outside for only 30 minutes, but on one GLORIOUS 118 degree afternoon, sweat drippin down my spine and all! (sarcasm)  Unfortunately, we were seated in a corner near the bathrooms where we were easily forgotten by our moody waitress. The time it took to track her down to finally order did award me the opportunity to view the beautiful interior decorations though; lots of faux wooded pieces, tree and plant life!    I did finally go with *#23, vermicelli with charbroiled pork & egg roll* for $9.95. This comes with a giant bowl of fish sauce with no shredded carrots or daikon. Bowl of noodles I did eventually receive was actually rather large, but somewhat deceivingly. Mine had a decent amount of meat and sliced up egg roll with crushed nuts and chopped scallions on top, but there wasn't much noodle. Just a bunch of shredded cabbage underneath. The actual presence of vermicelli noodle in a bun is rather important to me. Thai tea for $3.50 also a bit 'meh', but welcoming on a hot day of death.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #23 bun with pork and egg roll

y7WhLPA1tuwFcZeo4I15IA.text: Food is ok ,services nothing only take order bring the bowls pho .Never arks you need something time serviced don't have . When the bill tip take 20% including maximum.Not right to take the tip without service.We have four people during time the diners.Two times have dinner Now on We notes recommends for comeback trying any food charges to high service not quality.

50Un7cdWGysp85mEhKso5g.text: Horrible customer service, they never answer the phone too and click on you. I try calling couple times and it's always the same problem.

_P8eoiPKwJvDH0jWntr7Hw.text: 10/17/18 late night dinner after picking up my mom from the airport. To keep it short, this place is still awesome. Great pho, great sides, customer svc is at par and food is quick to order. Keep it up guys! Happy late night eats!!

4CEYN3zblbHYelyZuzBLhQ.text: Best bowl I've had in years!! Definitely the best in Vegas that I've ever had!!!!  The broth by itself was fantastic, so after adding some extras it was bangin!! Spring roll order too for a perfect meal today!

IcXv2GEn9IM2A4j2rjlK0A.text: Great food and service is excellent. Friendly staff and open 24/7. Definitely a must go place to serve my hangover lol

uzTTh7T_62NkgcjIvYycsA.text: This is probably the best Pho Soup I have ever eating. Highly recommend. Fast service and great staff !

01a83W_iLkmQT2mmOpeYpw.text: Excellent yummy appetizers. I especially liked the dumplings. The atmosphere is good. My only main criticism is the pho assortment on the menu. I've been to other pho places with many options of types of pho.

f2wOr2ZgWUpqwy4X2TmYnA.text: I absolutely love this restaurant! I've been coming here for over ten years and it is one of the best places to come if you want pho in Vegas! I also love that they offer Chinese food, among other cuisines. And not only do they offer other cuisines, they do them really well! There is not a bad tasting dish on the menu. They also serve an array of drinks Vietnamese and otherwise, including boba! The service is also top notch.

wIxMkqOfBkMTArGj8P8JKg.text: The food was excellent and the service was great as well. I took one star away because they dropped our plates of food down without telling us what each dish was (kind of annoying). Other than that, we didn't wait long for the food and never had to ask for a drink refill. I would go back again.

rEH_CLYvRD9xlMkp2J7Jtw.text: Hoang at Kim pho long is flat out rude! I did a to go order for postmates. From the moment I walked up and said hello. He ignored me. I did my order and handed him my card. Not once did he say one word to me. He slid my card across the counter and put the paper and pin down for me to sign. As I was standing near the front door there was another postmates driver waiting for their pickup. When her food was ready he simply walked over handed it to her she said thank you he didn't say anything. About 15 minutes later my order was ready. He just yelled across the restaurant postmates! I walked up and noticed there were two bags. My customer only ordered 3 items (small) so I pulled out the receipt to verify the two bags are for me. ( I didn't wanna walk away with more than what was paid for or with the wrong order for my customer) I asked him is this order match the order I placed? And was trying to show him my phone and receipt because the food names didn't match the receipt. He said you read it to me right? I said yes I did. I am just trying to make sure I am giving the customer what they ordered because the food names don't match the receipt and the food I ordered. I'm just making sure this is the correct receipt. (If your unaware postmates drivers sometimes have to order and pay for the food with a prepaid card. Then we have to take a picture of the receipt and the dollar amount.) this is why I was making sure I got the correct receipt and order. He put a thumbs up and rolled his eyes. So I walked over and checked the order. The customer asked for extra sauce. However it wasn't in the bag. So I said excuse me can I get an extra sauce. He ignored me and walked away.... flat out ignorant. I never been treated like that! Maybe he shouldn't be in the service business if he doesn't like to deal with people...

nDPRH8MrNA3rRQmyy4kpSg.text: My first Pho experience was here and I loved their decor. It really added to my experience when trying a new cusine. The service was a little slow and it was crowed but I'm sure that is because it was super busy.

OrF2d1vCdpwqPNOywH5lKQ.text: This place is always super packed but I guess that just goes to show how good the food is here. I had to knock down a star because the servers don't check back with you often and I had to find myself getting up multiple times to ask for a server to help us. I always get the vegan pho it has a lot of veggies and the broth doesn't have a weird after taste like a lot of vegan pho's do. Also a note to my vegan friends the egg rolls are made out of chicken which I they did not mention to me so definitely watch out for that. Overall I love this place and I always come back.

nUBmY4aI3KbVeLLKr-kOTQ.text: Went here with a group of 10 and it was a great experience the food was really good and the server was really attentive and we got our food pretty quickly. The only problem we had was at the end when we were trying to pay with such a big group.

HzVTIKFiOisNI7m1dNTHTQ.text: This is the best place to stop if you're still tipsy or drunk from a night of drinking and you're hungry for something delicious. The Pho is delicious per usual but the fried egg rolls and the Singapore noodles with the pork and shrimp are the best ones on the menu without a doubt. Definitely a great spot to have late munchies with friends

VPzaJ_EaMxbcy39XJ6M2Rg.text: This place was okay. The food was average. Not amazing. However, it is definitely convenient because it's open 24hrs. The place is also pretty Americanized, and have higher prices due to being more of tourist spot. They are not outrageously expensive but higher than most spots for pho. I do give them a thumb up for presentation on food delivery though.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks amazing, taste not as great.

uWPhyoIVh0HwKIrnQod-MQ.text: Came here on a Wednesday afternoon to cure a vegas hangover. My party of 5 was seated right away.   I got the special combination pho with flat rice noodles. The broth was very flavorful and not too salty. This dish only comes in a large but I finished the whole thing because it was that good! They were very generous with the portion of meat. This is one of the top pho places I've had. However, I was a little disappointed after not finding any tripe in my bowl.   My boyfriend got the Bun bo hue and it was very different from the other BBH I've had before. It wasn't spicy and almost kind of bland. We also got fresh spring rolls to share, but these were also disappointing. They were on the soggy side and fell apart after the first bite.  I recommend the special combo pho! Especially after a long night of drinking. I felt brand new after leaving this place :)

Iqx-wjjdtg63Zl61_b593A.text: Heard it was good...complete disappointment.  Service was terrible and food even much worse.  I eat a ton of Vietnamese food and this is the worst I have had in Las Vegas.

seigASIClXdQtM2q7EGmeQ.text: It was my first time to try this restaurant, and I got a big bowl of Pho Bo Vien, the soup was not good at all! It tasted nothing like hot water and they put some flavor of meat ball. And the server was not even taking care good of us and the receptionist too... I wrote my name down before that guy but that guy got called his name first and I asked her, she was like bcuz I got a table was meant to be for 5 people. That was why ... I was like ??? Really ???? She should have told me that before she took them to the table . That was so unprofessional and the excuse was so ridiculous.  Not recommended for anything  I don't know why the google showed that they are in one of the top 10 of best pho in Vegas !

iCbcSv6PQGXnNmAzsAhmzQ.text: This is a solid joint for vietnamese food. They have one of the best pho in Vegas. What I really enjoy eating here though is the Canh Chua and Ca kho. Sweet and sour soup and carmelized catfish in clay pot. It is so delicious. I've eaten many Canh Chua Ca Kho and this place makes it the best. My bf who is not a fan of fish, enjoyed it very much.   Anything you order here has good flavor. This is my go to place for asian food when I'm in Vegas. Service has been pretty good each time I've went. Whenever your hungry for vietnamese food, this place will hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ca Kho. Carmelized Catfish. Hands down best Ca Kho I&#39;ve ever had. So good!!!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Canh Chua Ca. Sweet and sour soup with catfish. Delicious!

RgTK7vL1ApHDvRi-oAymsg.text: Took my family to eat there on the weekend. Order pho amongst other things. It was not bad at all. But I gotta service was not too good. She took our orders, someone else bring out our food, she never came around to ask if we were ok or to refill our drinks, and went it was time to pay she kept insisting that I tell her how much tip I wanted to give her so she can write it down herself . I told her I will do it myself after she charges me but she did not take no for an answer. although I always give 20% that made me feel really uncomfortable. Been to a lot of places and this is a first for me. Don't think I will be back here.

5lqpHIgkP8BXJPC3GJ6UFA.text: Amazing since they don't close at all!! After a long night of clubbing, this is the perfect spot to go to

EyebEYM98nxFuh-WXXSXlw.text: Disclaimer: As a lesbian, this establishment's name is off-putting lolololol.  But! Five stars because I used to hate Pho and this place makes me crave it. Service was good - everyone was friendly and the food came out surprisingly fast, considering there were a few parties waiting to be seated when we got there.   Like the majority of soups ( or food? in my opinion), they are what you make of them. There's only so much a chef can do to the food until it's up to you to make it exactly what you want it to be. You like kick-in-the-gut spicy? You add it. You like punch-to-the-face sour? You do it LOL. So, after jalapenos, half a bottle of Sriracha, some weird dark purple sauce my GF convinced me was plum sauce (prune sauce?), four limes, and chili paste later, my soup was perfect haha. Not that it wasn't good on it's own because it completely was, but I added my own flare and this Mexican likes ~fuego~.  I guess my only "complaints" (for lack of a better word) are..  1. more napkins, please. one is not enough. 2. the shrimp rolls in that kinda see-through, jelly-like wrapping were SO sticky that I had to cut one off the plate LOL.  Other than that, I'll be back.

u6eZXDKdP8u_k9s-47WZ_w.text: This is 24hr open restaurant, so you should come during night or not regular meal time if you would like to avoid long waiting. I went twice this place 2015 &2017. I think helpers were nicer than before.  Food are all absolutely wonderful ! I wish they open at CA.

U1N67oDfe2XfqcnF9ZMidA.text: These people really need to learn customer service. Their food is ok, only go there because they are open all the time, but avoid going here because of the customer service

FbcDlMPgKT7oXwhGMwekZg.text: This is an excellent pho place in Chinatown Vegas. I've been here a couple times. I always ordered either the Beef/Chicken Pho or the Broken Rice Com Tam BBQ Pork Steam eggs rice plate. The pho order usually comes very quick. The last time I was there, it took forever to bring out the rice plate. And they have excellent che 3 mau (3 colors desert). The price was a bit pricy comparing to Cali standards. About 10-11 bucks for a bowl of pho and 4.50 for the Che. There were a couple things that kinda bothered me, first, most of the waiters and waitresses, they're not fluent in English so there usually is some sort of miscommunication. Second, I was eating my rice plate the last time, several of the staff were kinda staring at me the whole time. I was feeling uncomfortable a bit. But I think it's just an Asian cultural thing or I stood out very obvious as a Tourist from the strip lol. Anyway, i left them a good tip. This place is cool, you can always eat pho and get a smoothie bobba at LEES next door. 4 stars.

pXg7gonIay3wUWrP0UkayA.text: Great bbh and environment is quite elegant for a pho joint. Their boba sucks and they know if but hey we're here for the food

MROgOcKqwoPp5X2BWlS3Bw.text: Came here in the morning to have some pho. I ordered small steak and meatball pho. It was okay I thought I didn't like there meatballs, the steak was pretty good. The broth was a little salty but otherwise I would go back when I visit Vegas!

wemI3NNDDs10Gi-u_4HbyQ.text: Excellent service and excellent Pho noodles. Their pho broth is just simply marvelous. 2 thumbs up

EzlvUhbSGe2sQapZc_sTNQ.text: they were super busy at 9am but we were seated right away. our waitress th was energetic and super helpful. the food came fairly quickly in about 20 min.the pho broth is not tasty, too sour for me. the broken rice dish is actually regular rice which was disappointing. the bbq pork that comes with the rice is well seasoned and delicious though. after we finished eating there was a huge line of people waiting. the owner at the cashier was asking us to tip at the cashier which was shady. hopefully our waitress get her tip.

0ILRdO7W74_wdQzltbZLeg.text: A long time favorite of my family... came here when I was little, during our fam Vegas trips and would have family style meals of a little bit of everything on the menu.  Now I come here as a hungover 23 and only get the pho. But it makes me just as happy as it did when I was younger. The pho broth is pretty good. I always try my broth before I mix in any of the sauces and this broth tastes good by itself. guess it's not consistent because I hear bad things and there are times when the place is a lot busier.  I'm pretty sure if its a place my old folks and fam still love, then it isnt so bad!  The wait is always long on weekends for lunch, but I always see the servers moving quickly to clean tables and arrange the seating so that everyone can be seated faster. My name was 10th on the list one time but I only had to wait 15-20 minutes.

WyXzAO8w1wX8c3OyhkTWQQ.text: This place freaking sucks. Ordered pho and it took over 20 minutes to come out. All rice dishes came out and the pho still didn't come out. Ended up canceling the order for the pho because they took too damn long. They didn't apologize or offer anything they simply said " the soup is coming." Never coming to this crap place again. Useless ass waiters.

xoCooaN4PZtEL1M2G5t7qw.text: My friends and I went to lunch here today.  Pho is very good hangover food and a good way to start the day after a long night in Vegas.  The restaurant is very big and offers a full menu of lots of different kinds of Vietnamese/Chinese food dishes in addition to the pho, which was a bit of a surprise given the name of the restaurant (I find most restaurants that have pho in their name are pretty limited to phos, rice or vermicelli bowls and eggrolls).  The pho was 3 stars, pretty good but nothing special.  Same for the eggrolls and the clear roll.  Good decor, clean restaurant and the service was good.

hzDpbcowg1QHourjjF7r5A.text: this place was OK. I felt like the portions were too small for the price you paid. We ordered calamari, and most of the calamari that we got, it was mostly batter. Also, the broth that they have was kind of oily for my taste. Will give this place a go one more time and I hope they do better. Also, the server that we had was kind of rushing us to leave even if the restaurant was slow. I did not understand why. Maybe it was an off night, but I will give it another chance.

hwIhtARoo8Clg01YCvPItg.text: If I can not give stars I would this is the worst place to eat pho the meat has nasty freezer burns the service is trash they would be irritated and throw our phos to us and It would spill and they would give attitude and when we pay they ask for why there's no tip very rudely with attitude and facial expressions and they demand a tip for one transaction from one person overall everyone of them is trash all of my visits have been trash service

fAzxhdYqahT2iJ7smnhhdw.text: Happy they have vegan options for pho and they are open 24 hours.  However - ZERO customer service. No smiles, at least with my server I had that was the case. Cut and dry. They are very busy.

pC4fjmNnbNCFZYhCg1WgoA.text: We live in las vegas and a friend of mine recommended me to this place. The food is average. We come here once in a long while and usually go for the pho and orange chicken. Menu could be better just because you have to order everything separate and the quantity is not alot for the price. We consumed 70.00 worth of food and it was four people in our party. The waitress came to our table twice.. once to take our order and second to bring out our food. When done  my husband only had a few dollars change and left to go pay at the cashier while i sat behind packing up our leftovers. While i was doing that a waiter stopped by the table i assumed he was going to start cleaning but quickly left after picking up a plate. Well i was wrong he communicated with the cashier and let him know only a 2dollar tip was left. Like i mentioned we only had 2dollar change and were going to leave a few more dollars. The cashier was rude and demanded my husband to leave a 15% tip. We always leave tips to our waiters off course the bigger the party the larger the tip but it also counts if you where satisfied with your service and to us for the two times she helped us was not worth 10 extra dollars. Be nice to your customers and maybe tell your waiters to be more attentive and they might get the tip they deserve.

EmjGe5LAVKlL83a4JxPh0w.text: Why was my pad thai so sticky? Wait, why did I order pad thai here?  Lots of seats (But why so many large tables? How many 8+ sized groups go for pho together?), fast service, open early (many other places aren't). I'd rather buy cheaper, ghetto-er, better pho elsewhere.

ShxSmlr7lIVIMg0o8M-SJA.text: This is my stop every time I'm in Vegas. Always good food and great service. However, this peppered calamari was the worst dish EVER (sooo greasy, all you taste is the battered). Where is the calamari? After one bite I knew I just threw $13 down the drain. Hopefully they take it out of the menu before they piss off other customers...... With that being said, I still give them 4 stars for the hard working waitress there.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t EVER order the calamari here...

8uhur3g7zzUypviWV23A9g.text: This place is alright. I find myself here every time just before I leave Vegas. The remedy cure for hangovers for sure. The Pho here or broth I should say could use a little bit more flavor and be hotter. Most times I've been here that's the most common problem. I'm not sure if it's because this place is open 24/7 and they just don't seem to make a new batch or something. They carry a lot more than Pho though, but for a restaurant named "Pho Kim Long" they should have really good Pho. The pork rice dishes and fry rice is good as well. There are a variety of drinks on the menu as well.

wTi6iRV1vtaCK3kJTbpLOA.text: With a hard crave for Vietnamese food, and satisfying broth/soup, we made it here to Pho Kim Long in Vegas!!! Let me start by saying that I ENJOY this cuisine A LOT. I have a lot of respect for the spices and "complexity" the flavors bring to ones taste-buds! Hence, this is definitely on my top 5 places for pho/Viet restaurants. This time, I ordered the Bo Kho (Beef Stew) and it was outstanding. The soup consistency was perfect and full, and I was extremely satisfied. I cannot wait to get the chance to come here again.

q1JWpoA-tTOYPNrh5JHrfg.text: Honestly, came here around 2am on a Monday night and was very disappointed. The wait was not too bad but the service was terrible. I tried to order fresh coconut juice but our waiter said it was sold out. Then I chose the thai ice tea. We got our pho orders. I then asked about my drink that hadn't come, and another server said it was sold out. THEN I see the table next to us and they got fresh coconut juice. If you're going to be lazy with your service, you better make sure it is not obvious.  The egg rolls we ordered were completely bland as well. The pho was decent.

vChxYzqf7dlp0Y0djGSmLQ.text: I've been coming here since there was smoking allowed in restaurants many years ago I just barely Yelp and for a 24/HR Asian joint the food isn't too bad, it's good but the service is a hit or miss as well as time when ordered to table.  There have been many incidents but this last one bothered me a lot.  Usually me being the foodie, I order the food... My daughter had to use the restroom and I didn't expect my BF to order but he did and mistakenly ordered beef pad thai instead of chicken.   Nothing allergic, just a preference... I'm usually not picky and I am behaved until treated with disrespect that I know I didn't deserve...  My daughter and I weren't in the bathroom long because as soon as we got out and walked back to the table the server was leaving our table from taking the order. I flagged down the closest staff member to correct the order and this guy gets mad. Pissed off to be exact, a highly unexpected attitude. I thought maybe... 'He's just having one of those days...'  Now, for starters, I'm in the culinary industry for a living and I know how the kitchen works, hospitality and understand how irritable it would be to have to change an order once it's already rung in and we started cooking it... We literally just took the order and the place was decently busy...   In the politest way possible I asked: "Excuse me? If it's possible to change the pad thai to chicken instead of beef. We ordered beef by accident"   he said "chicken pad thai?! you ordered beef pad thai" Me: "I understand if it's too late to change that's fine" He points his finger at me as he said something angrily to where I didn't understand him because he was walking away and hits the wall... The people next to us on BOTH sides of us heard the whole conversation.   He literally points, walks away, smacks the wall as he turns the corner and comes back and tells me "it's too late to change, you ordered beef and it's already ready"  Just watching him, his attitude and how fast we ordered, him walking to the kitchen to check and come back telling us our food is ready before our appetizers, I knew he was BS-ing... I then asked him "if it's already ready, how come you didn't bring it out?"  He walked away saying that we had to wait... I found the guy that ordered our food and asked nicely if it's too late to change it.   Our server said "yea that's ok, I just put the order in not too long ago... I'll go change it real quick before it is made" As I was talking to the waiter, the other staff member who was rude to us, saw us talking to the server and came and started another scene, one which wasn't needed, I didn't mention the other server until he started the scene. He started yelling saying our food was ready and that we ordered beef. Luckily our server was very calm and spoke to him even though I didn't know what he was saying, I felt VERY uncomfortable not understanding what they're saying and him pointing his hand towards my BF and making my BF upset.   Our server apologized for the fellow coworker but found it wrong for someone else apologizing for someone else's doings.   I believe PKL is a bit overrated and lacks consistency. I don't know what kind of service I will walk into when I come here but like I said, for a 24/HR spot the food isn't too bad.

TIc5mRQ2kRbOKGJelciG6g.text: I  was looking forward to an authentic Clay Pot with crispy rice. The metal pot with rice on the side left me highly disappointed. They are busy and not attentive to single parties. I  would say I will give them another go but there are so many places to try it may be awhile.

fyiRSfnVOB9dZ2pqutVShw.text: Place is overrated for pho after hours. Came in with a group and cashier guy put an auto grad without letting us know, so we actually tipped an extra amount. Came back to the cashier guy and he has the worst attitude. Said that we should have known and that it's our fault while giving us the dirtiest look. Food wasn't too bad, but rated a one star because of the cashier guy. Pretty much his fault . He needs a hug or something.

ADGpN8U42ok-n56nYX3i4w.text: This place is always busy but it's not long of wait to be seated. Their vermicelli, pad thai, bbq pork and pho are my usual orders. Good food for its prices and even better when you need to sober up.

iZMnRQPtcwYDkIOS7xGgUw.text: C'mon, it's PHO KIM LONG.  The name already tells you that you need to come here.  I've made this an official mandatory stop whenever I'm driving home from Vegas. Wake up, check out, go over to chinatown to nurse your hangover with some PHO or CRISPY HOUSE NOODLES because both are freaking delicious.  Pricing is decent. Service is always fine.  Bathrooms can be cleaner....but hey I mean it's chinatown vegas....  Boba is decent, nothing fabulous (coming from a boba connoisseur).  Lines can get long but they have a fast turnaround!  But really......those crispy noodles though... yum.

r9eFa5A_oOfR-Kb1a6yYzQ.text: This seems like it is more of a fusion place than a viet place.  I had the meatball pho and it was still really good, setup was missing items that I like, but the meat and broth tasted really good.  Our spring rolls seemed fresh and good.  We also had some of their wings, which were not fantastic, but they were good.

xzs83J895uPTa6XidhKBSg.text: I was pretty upset that I got a dirty share plate so ended up washing it myself with my water cup and a napkin even if the food was pretty good the dirty portion of the experience leaves me giving them a 1 star

VJYb3Yf6cGxUxyOyoRPj1A.text: They are the best pho in town so far I am always satisfied with this restaurant .

IhHcV5D6pnYFxKef9RqJfg.text: This place has a very decent food and its open 24h but the service its the worse specially the guy in the main register, its just crazy to see a place with such bad service but people still come for the food can you imagine if the service will be just a hit decent, makes you wonder

BvGXJ8Hb_dE3wWbCtXNGJA.text: Probably the most popular 'drunk pho' restaurant in Vegas, open 24/7 about a mile from the strip (easy 5 min cab ride for $6).  Nothing is better for sobering up / morning hangover meal than a tasty bowl of Vietnamese beef noodle soup with numerous types of meat and warm, filling, life renewing bone broth. Yes please.  Service and decor are excellent, food comes quick, it's fresh, hot and has tons of flavor. Throw in some lime and all your clubbing / late night shenanigan issues go away with only the fun memories of a wild night (hopefully).  They also serve coronas and other drinks for $4 and have tons of things on the menu, but i've been here 5 times, always for beef pho dac biet (special). Get it to cure all your issues. Line can be long at 3am FYI.

oV_gVXHfsYCy12wcmFqeLg.text: Honestly, any type of pho would taste pretty good to me after a weekend of drinking and no sleep in Vegas haha. But I'd say their pho broth is pretty good! Usually I am pretty sensitive to msg and get super thirsty for the next couple of hours whenever I consume some. But I did not get that with this place!! So don't fear, go on and drink that soup buddy. I got the Beef Ball Pho and was satisfied with their beef balls! (haha) They gave a pretty good amount and it did not taste artificial or sketch.  I was about to drive 4-5 hours back home right after the meal and decided to take the rest of my iced water by pouring it into my water bottle (lol no shame). One of the female servers walked by and actually not only offered to fill up my water bottle but also gave my friend a to-go water cup! She practically saved my life. The wait can definitely get super long around lunch time. I came at 11:30am on a Sunday and waited for around 15 minutes for a party of 7. But the wait got pretty bad after we were seated.

xCcxFLkuMa_vENj9AxE_aA.text: Food was reasonable. Customer service nonexistent.  Waiter never came to ask if we need anything else. Never saw him after the order. I was eating my vegetables and one waiter snatched my plate away. I had to hollowed to bring it back. They rush you in, rush you out, and take your money. Do not recommend.

ro4CqIW4yAd1V639Y3gmbw.text: Aside from the name and late night hours of operation, the rest was mediocre. I was not impressed with any of the dishes the first time I visited that I decided to try it again. I would come back here if I was drunk late night and there was no other eatery open in town.

vtfVGOfXopK_AoDIrAIBDg.text: I've seen, heard and driven by this place more times then I can count but today in the words of my girl, " I got my Pho Kim Long cherry popped!" The line was long but not fuckin long (pun intended) and went by quick, considering it was lunchtime. I selected the #15 Rare Beef and Brisket Spicy Noodle and shared a couple of egg rolls. I'm still new to the Pho game and I really like the different variations of condiments that can be added. I like spicy so I loaded it with Siracha, herbs, and more spices to meet my desired heat/taste. My nose was runnier than the day after a night on the strip with Charlie Sheen. It hurt so good! Prices were ok, servings were plentiful, and customer service was satisfactory. I will definitely be back. I might try some Chinese menu offerings next time as well. Pho-Get-Aboutitt!

hIezy8-JEnopC1U-IDnZEA.text: Just a quick update as I have been there about three times in the past three months!  a. Parking - No longer easy. The plethora of good / decent places to go like Lee's Sandwich, Fat Dumpling, Mr. Tofu and etc make parking here limited and in high demand. It is nearly difficult to find any parking here, even if you are willing to walk.  b.  Reasons - That is because PKL is open 24 hours!  The food is darn decent at times.    c.  Late meals - Finished a movie and midnight and came here for noodles on Friday night. At 1:00 am, the place was packed.  Our team waited only ten minutes for a table in the back room, where it says " Employees only"  Looks to be a room that they will slowly expand into and perhaps was another restaurant before?    d.  Pho - Had Number 13, which has everything in it and also the Bun Bo Hue with Pho noodles instead of rice noodles (vermicelli).  OK, don't hate that!  I know it is traditional to have BBH with the rice noodles. It is just that the consistency of the Pho noodles is soooooo much better and the texture is amazing. The way the noodles drape over your chopsticks as you shovel a huge portion into your mouth is just what the doctor ordered.  Hard to do with the rice noodles as it is bigger and the consistency is such that you cannot pack a bunch into  your mouth.  Hey it is part of the noodle experience if you ask me.  Just watch any movie where you watch the Japanese salary-men at lunch slurping down a bowl of ramen and I think you will get my drift.  Noodles are meant to be hoovered!    e.  Pho Part II - Anyway, the Bun Bo Hue at 1:00 am is a very, very good. The broth is just right, they serve the spice separately so you can make the soup as hot as you want.  They serve all the bits of tendon, offal, pork hock and everything you can imagine that was eaten in the city of Hue due to well, the poor economy.  I finally learned that offal is the stuff in meats that you cook that most people don't eat.  The offal is awfully good!!! It is what makes the soup.  My son had number 13 which is nearly like BBH without the pork hock and the spice. He slurped that up, but I won because my BBH came first and I had a head start!  f.  The Chicken - Yep, ordered once again the Salted Baked Chicken with Ginger sauce.  Why?  Because it is so good, nutritious and a very good measure of the chef and the restaurant.  Simple to cook, yet easy to over cook, the meat has to be so juicy and tender. It is either that or overcooked as the entire taste is from the chicken itself.  It has to be on the bone, and it has to make you caveman like to use your hands to gnaw at every morsel of meat on the bone!  The ginger onion sauce has to be so good that you are putting it on the chicken like you would butter and you have to ask for more.  This time, the chicken was great.  I went there two weeks ago at 8:00 am and it was absolutely horrible.   So, I think that the chefs know at 1:00 am they will have a ton, so they are making it and storing it just right. At 8:00 am, the last time, I probably had a heated up stored chicken and it was as if "I made it myself.  just mehhhh".  Fresh and hot is best and it was rocking at 1:00 am.  Overall, great menu, many of other choices on there that you would find in a Chinese restaurant and a great place to end up!  Now they serve brown rice for 1.50 more.  This Chinese people are so good at making money on rice!  Here is the dealio though. At 1:00 am most of the people there are drunk or buzzed and needing greasy fatty foods to recover. I don't think they are so worried about brown rice....   GK says, this is the late nite place to BE for sure!

VMeJo5IdbGfhwujgCavEBA.text: This place open 24 hours and I love it was a great food Very good times whit my son it's a good place to come I very happy to come this place you have to try and put your review. Thanks

doLlRKN815rM2acZ8fJUkg.text: My inner Vietnamese Pho snob wants to give this place 3 stars. My hungry Vegas cheap college student wants to give this place 4. So let's settle for 3.5.  Parking: nice little private lot right in front. Yay I love vegas, you never have trouble looking for parking like in LA. Service: very attentive. They have a freaking army of servers even at 1AM. I was very mindblown. They came by to refill water once or twice, gave us an excess of lemons when we asked for more lol .  Food: definitely the best.pho.ever. A very big bowl contains not that much noodles and beef. But I very much enjoyed the warm comfort food at 1AM in the cold dessert weather after clubbing. MMM MMM MMM. Prices are a little jacked up.... but we have to deal because there aren't that many pho places close to the Strip that are open late-nights. Very FRESH and clean bean sprouts. I was very impressed! All the legit leaves were there too!  We paid and were about to leave. DUN DUN. Ice and Coco for E's Ice Loves Coco came in. THEY EAT PHO?!?! Mindblown part 2. Just for that, I gave Kim Long the extra half a star for their coolness! Will be back the next time I'm hungry for some cheap eats late at night in Sin City :)

dc7vnbOpcO2X5Pp_k47FHg.text: My first time trying pho and all of my friends suggested eating here (many insisting it was the best and only place to get pho in Chinatown). The service is quick when you need something and then non-existant after you've received that something, which I find appealing because my dining culture revolves around talking and enjoying the company of my party while eating/drinking. We had the spring rolls, the egg rolls, and the Rare Steak Pho. They were all delicious! I had never tried the spring rolls which from my recollection are shrimp and chicken with veggies wrapped in a rice paper and paired with peanut sauce. It is chewy (almost like mochi) but with the fresh taste of shrimp really juxtaposed to the sharp peanuty flavor in the sauce I would highly recommend it. The broth for the pho is beefy, hearty, and will really warm your soul! I got the small and as it was my first time I didn't add any of the condiments that come on the side so I could just enjoy the flavors. I will definitely visit this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tried the crab ragoon the other day with the peanut sauce! Sweet and tangy and delicious.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rare Steak Pho

qT0qxILLgitvhSKoXioF7g.text: Came to Las Vegas for 5 days and ate here 3 times. The 4th time the line was just a little longer than we could do just because the child was super hungry. The pho is just fabulous. Also had excellent vermicelli bowls and boba smoothies wide selection of flavor so. Can not say anything else. This place is just delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu vermicelli bowl: 1st dish I order at any Vietnamese to gauge quality. Insanely delicious. Came back for more more more!

9zbVGkahGvyOdSSXa4hKAw.text: #47 chicken porridge was pretty plain, taste watery. #58 was ok but it's not salty enough. #13 was ok. Highly recommend their deep fried tofu. But the service was TERRIBLE .   After the first bowl of pho arrive it took 20 mins for half of my orders to arrive and the waiter told us the rest of the order will arrive very soon, 20 mins later we asked about the orders again and turns out they never send the order at the first place even they double checked with us at the beginning. When the rest of the order arrive the waiter was very rude that he just shoved it on the table.

qdM-aUx5ZwtFAKGKBFdsHQ.text: 3 stars is decent. As of right now. Not sure. Ordered the pho brisket / steak combo and the drunken noodles. Both come recommended. Will let you know how they are.

LTCR5FDQmjWx_c2y8afzoQ.text: Every time I've been here the food has been great. That said tonight I experienced terrible service and want to make sure people watch for it. Our server was fine but her manager Lam (or Lamb?) was a nasty person. I heard him speak so negative to our server using profanity for something that was his fault. A customer should never hear that nor should an employee be crying because of bad management. I hope the establishment takes note because we go there often in large groups but it's not worth someone suffering  over. I hope this guy gets what he deserves. As a business owner I can say he would have been let go a long time ago for his attitude and bad work ethic.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f1DiyboUDUPZdH1rALpm5Q.text: Been here a good couple of times during my trips to Vegas and let me tell you, it's one of the nicer Pho places but typical priced meals! We came Saturday at 12pm and it was a 10 minute wait, not bad at all. I got the rice plate with pork and egg rolls. But the wait to get our food took forever! I was staaaarving. I think it was because they mixed up our order with another table. But our meal was satisfying and good. Wish they gave more meat but it was cool. My total came out to $12ish (included tip) and we paid at the register. If you're a tourist and need a ride back to the strip, I suggest calling for a cab right before you finish your meal because we had to wait 30 minutes after for ours to arrive.   Plan to come back to get my pho fix after a night out in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great pad Thai.

lamKDuJb-iB8lBMnSVRdpw.text: Pho Kim long is fucking suck, we getting waiting list with other 4 family ahead us, then 3 lady walking in they get fucking table right away, without sign in waiting list, i di ask, they said that 3 lady was working here, so why fucking restaurant make a waiting list for, give me fucking good answer. I give you 1 star because that lower I can go.

8wy8f8dUbr0dWXuMQJ6ZFQ.text: I'm leaning more towards a 3-Star rating, but the pho itself is so good that it deserves an extra star. I've been eating here for years, and there has been a steady decline in customer service. We hadn't visited for several months because the restaurant had become so popular that wait times were too long. Last night (Friday) at 7 pm, more than half of the tables were available. Yet, our server kept rushing to and from our table without so much as eye contact. And I noticed all of the other servers treating the other patrons the same way.  We ordered our favorite app, calamari. It was so over-breaded it was almost comical. A lot of the bites I took didn't even have squid in it.  But onto the main event. The pho is still the best in town. The flavors in the broth are deep and intense. The noodles are comforting. The rare steak and brisket are tender. It's enough to keep me coming back even though the service is not great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho #15 (no white onions or cilantro)

ZywArl_le8lo-185r4jxaQ.text: The first time I went I was surprised. We sat down and we're the only ones there about five minutes later the place was jampacked.  The food was so good it's all I've been thinking about. I have to go back!! I got vegan tofu Pho and I was completely happy.   Since the first review I have been back many times and everything has been consistent. They are always fairly quick everything is completely fresh. My biggest thing is that being vegetarian people screw up my order sometimes and that's expected but this place has done nothing but exceed my expectations. If I bring a friend they absolutely love it as well.

-fNDUBm4WbhfaADt947pnA.text: This place is my go to in Vegas for 24/7 Asian cuisine. Whenever you need it. It's definitely nice to have an outlet to go to after intensive partying on the strip.   It's a pretty big restaurant so it can accommodate your group of friends or if you just want to go yourself. We came with a group of about 20 and were seated in the back.   The reason for 3 stars is that although they're open 24 hours (which is amazing), their food is okay. It was mediocre compared to the food I've had in LA and D.C. Where I'm from. I ordered the crispy noodle special that came with an assortment of meats and seafood. And I ordered calamari as my starter. The calamari was good with a nice crisp, I could definitely tell there was msg in it though. As for the crispy noodle, it was a small portion for the price I paid. Others who ordered pho waited a long time for their meals to come out. They got it after mine. I would think that pho would come out first, either way the folks who had the pho said it was not bad. But either because we were all hungover or just hungry.   I'll still come back though because of the convenience of it being open all the time. And I love Asian food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry for the Snapchat filter. I thought I saved another pic. House special crispy noodle.

vRIhdm6HqFENMgY6Bihw-w.text: Food is great , customer service can be horrible sometimes. Would recommend the food but they need to work on their customer service big time.
