EKppZ3jC8gcZXmcCApYqNQ.text: This is my go to place in Las Vegas for pho and bun bo hue.   The perfect cure for a hangover.. Where else can you find a bowl of pho at 2:30 am after leaving XS.

yM-iC5nk855bbsmrvr_Mew.text: Hands down, best late night post clubbing eats in town. After a night out, nothing helps sober you up like some 24 hour Vietnamese food! Depending on the day/time, there can be a bit of a wait. But I have been here a couple of dozen times and can honestly say: big venue, lots of tables, quick service, consistently good food.  TO START: Get the GOI CUON (SPRING ROLLS). Comes with four shrimp/pork/lettuce filled cold spring rolls with peanut sauce that is literally crack. Their recipe for it is so perfected, I can literally just eat it with a spoon. Also go for the CRAB RANGOONS. Eight perfectly fried wontons filled with cream cheese & crab, paired with sweet n' sour sauce.   FOR HER: I ordered the SHRIMP PAD THAI once when I wasn't in the mood for pho... and was mind blown! Seriously the best pad thai I have ever had. Yes, at a Vietnamese place! How? I don't know. But it's so filled with flavor & perfectly seasoned & lots of noodles... I can never finish it on my own, meaning leftovers for later! Try the combination for a mixture of shrimp, beef & chicken too. Delish!  FOR HIM: This place has great (and cheap!) pho. He always orders the RARE STEAK & WELL DONE FLANK NOODLE SOUP. Cheaply priced, a generous amount of soup, noodles & meat... with a side of sprouts, jalapenos and all that good stuff to add as you please. More than enough to share with someone too! Add a little hoisin sauce, maybe a little sriracha for a kick. So good! The ORANGE CHICKEN is also a fave!  Only bad thing I can say? They don't have any lemon for your water... I think I'll survive though.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange chicken.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab rangoons.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak &amp; flank pho

OmQnPSoaQ3M4t4FXeZh6FQ.text: Such a madhouse, OK food but just avoid unless you have a lot of patience and like bad service.   Parking is so bad at this complex so you need to luck.  They said 30 minute wait but when we checked the list less than 15 minutes later we were crossed off. We were standing right there outside but they didn't call our name?  Because people are worried they'll lose their spot, the waiting line inside was so packed. I had several hovering right behind me while I ate! I couldn't believe it! Don't let them seat you by the door.  They have so many easy ways to increase the waiting area, move the huge fish tank (with no fish in it anyway) and move the other huge table not being used at all, so big that it could hold another fish tank, and they'd instantly have twice as much space. Instead tiny waiting area leaving random people standing 10 inches behind my chair as I ate.  Service is unreal bad. I've been here 5 times and they never ask if you want drinks. Shows the owner doesn't care or doesn't like making money. The just drop off water and food and run away. There is just endless room to improve service but they want you in and out.   Food is good but not great on some dishes. Pho seems kinda bland and not very impressive. Pork chops looked good but were very thin and small with lots of fat; chops came with way too much rice in portion to meat, took two huge bites of rice per tiny bite of chop.   Another huge turn off and maybe scam that other reviews mention and that I noticed on my last visit is that when you pay with a card first get asked 'how much do you wanna tip' and they stand there while you and your group then decide while he's hovering over you. So rude! What's worse is that bring back the receipt to sign and you can leave tip again if not paying attention. The group should not feel pressured during payment. The only time the waiter should come and leave quick they don't but rush away every other time lol.   After coming here many times over the last 5+ years I can promise this place will not change or try to improve. Could easily read these reviews and make changes but I'll get out goes unseen.   I'll be back and hope to update. I live close and like many of the food dishes and give them 4 star, but overall 2 stars is fair.   Hope this helps. Enjoy!

nlZeHLuEL7sGl9mZdQXM4Q.text: This is probably the only pho place I visit when I am in the Vegas area and since I'll be moving here I plan on being a regular. Some tips before one gets here.  This is totally a tourist place so weekend be prepare to wait. Lunch time is crazy and there isn't a lot of parking space so car pool if you can. Also has other restaurant to eat around the same plaza fyi  Bowl of pho runs about 8-9$ and they have other Chinese and Vietnamese plates if you don't want pho. Service is decent especially in such a busy establishment. If you have a part of 4 or less you don't have to wait but a bigger party has a bit of a longer wait since you want to get a bigger round table.  Also a perk? Totally 24 hours. Go have fun at a Vegas night and then uber or lyft your way to get over your future hangover!

iM6udE1b8JH6B4K21cgytA.text: I don't get why this place has less than 4 stars. I've been for the first time today and it was pretty good! A friend of mine swears by this place, she comes here a couple of times per week so when it came time to planning a dinner date we followed her lead and agreed to meet here.  I tried Chicken Drunken Noodles, Chicken Pad Thai, and Rare Steak Pho. I really enjoyed the drunken noodles  and pad thai, great flavors! The pho was ok, I wasn't crazy about it. It seemed kind of bland and flavorless.  The portions are big enough to share and prices are beyond reasonable. Service was fast and friendly. AND I noticed they're opened 24hrs, YAS! All in all, I'm definitely coming back!

vvPqJ475Qtk7xCXRrfhm_Q.text: Food was okay. Absolutely terrible service. Wait staff had the worst attitude. After splitting the check, the manager checked us out, did not pay attention to our charges and drastically over priced us. We went back to correct the issue but had to fight then entire way to justify the charges. Will never eat here again. Not worth the time or the money.

xv6pJAx02j-xCfdzpNolcw.text: This is our family favorite for pho and chicken egg rolls are so delicious in my opinion! They are very fast in taking orders as well as in serving you even on busy nights I have not had bad experience here with rude customer service to be honest everyone has been friendly to us and the food has always been exceptional oh and the orange chicken is one of the teens favorites! A must try portions are very generous too.

FvJoYvYBWqV3XtoYGfC-xw.text: This is a nice experience for a place to go in Chinatown.  Parking is a little tight at the location, you can park over by the larger plaza area as an option and walk over to the place. It is well worth the short walk.  The Vietnamese Crepe is my favorite!! It is different and makes for a great appetizer.   If you have people visiting in town, this makes for a unique place to take them and the Crepe is a truly different dish.   The place is open 24/7.  During the weekends, it does get packed, especially during the later hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese Crepe. This is an awesome appetizer!! Served with lots of different greens. Great with Sake!!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singapore Noodles with Shrimp or Pork. Got it with shrimp and it was awesome!! Great main dish and there is enough for 2.  Spicy :)

b2dRbuSf23XzR-TJiN4vLA.text: Literally the best Pho in Las Vegas! You really have to try it. I've tried so many places and so far this has been the most delicious and customer service is great!

GE1z9TVPBKwIuo4457jeow.text: Quick and efficient service. Food was ok. They get busy during afterhours. The wait wasn't too long around 1:30am. Always a go-to place when you don't know what to eat. Open 24/7 which is the best!

BR0bGOcVUU8v2uWDlWZ2xg.text: One of our favorite spots for pho and Vietnamese food.. Services is good.. Its always busy here.. so be prepared to wait a bit.. Parking is limited.. Charboiled pork or beef is really delicious! worth a trip!l Its best for a cold night!

1DuCGz7n_kDtQwCi9LgOmw.text: The place is always so busy! I went for a few times and it was great service and then bad service. I feel like we are always being rushed, it's hard to get a waiter to our table. Barely any space to walk around. Last dinner date I had here the pho soup was cooked wrong that my husband and I had stomach issues for 2 days! Never coming back again.

yAWj4zrhH6JPQB6rgrzqFg.text: No hostess for 15 mins had to walk up and ask for a seat. Very rude staff and employee. Overall terrible service won't be come back at all!

uQfy8IOkCkWPe7hXaIbCrA.text: First of all, this place was really busy. That's usually a good sign, especially since it was around 1:30 am. The wait was longer than I would have liked but at 20 minutes it wasn't too terrible. I ordered two items, fried calamari and the special combo pho. The pho was good and had I only had that I would give this place a four star rating. However, I also ordered the fried calamari and that was pretty bad. The squid itself was overcooked and the seasoning was very bland earning that plate two stars.. Overall, I would go again if I was in Vegas and it was late, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go.  FYI the service is a bit rude and hurried.

GC06OU5GL1gO3D00XX3noA.text: Small parking lot. Its located in a little cute asian plaza. This place gets packed. I waited about 15mins for a table for 7. Most of us ordered pho. Pho: 3/5 Chicken rice plate: 3/5. Chicken was super dry.  Chow fun: 4/5

bDXWQn0jvqK_NHxDDBWh5A.text: How is this the only 24 hour pho joint?  After a hard night of partying, my girlfriend and I decided to stop here for some late night recovery at 5am.  Keep in mind that we are both from Orange County where the pho is probably better than in Vietnam's.  There was a 10 minute wait and the restaurant was packed and busy.  You gotta love the bouncer looking dude who signs you in to be seated.  Chatted with a few drunks and finally got seated at a thankfully corner table away from most people.  My girlfriend went for their hot and sour soup and I went for a pho bo vien.  My girlfriend's hot and sour soup came out in a huge bowl and was very good.  It was perfectly season, flavored, and full of ingredients.  My pho was good but the bo vien (meatballs) took me off guard.  They were very soft compared to ones I am used to.  It gave it a weird texture.  Overall though it was decent.  It's about $8 for a bowl of pho here.  I liked that they had plenty of other items on the menu besides pho.  Service was basically like any other Vietnamese restaurants.  The inside is large and nothing fancy.  However, it's one of your only few options for pho late in the night.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet and sour soup
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x-1aVBSLq5JmbXrdvI1Wig.text: They've gotten better the last few years, because before, I hated coming to this place.  Food is average, prices are reasonable, decor has gotten better, and service & cleanliness are just okay. Every time I get a rice vermicelli dish, I always have to ask for extra sauce to add more flavor. I rarely get pho here, but the party I'm with usually has to add hoisin sauce, etc. They're open til late, which is a plus. However, they can get super crowded sometimes.  I go here every now & then, but I still prefer other places to get Pho or Rice Vermicelli dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef &amp; egg roll rice vermicelli. They charged me $1 more for the beef (since it&#39;s not on their menu).

ZziyZdUGF-popiJquvfRFg.text: If the service wasn't so crappy, I would have given this place five stars. lol  The waiter was slow in seating us, coming to our table, and taking our order. He took other people's orders before ours (a big no-no for me). I consider that bad when you are at a Vietnamese restaurant. They are usually super prompt about that.   Other than that the pho was the best I've tried in Las Vegas so far. Very flavorful and delicious. Maybe a little too much MSG, but I can't complain. Pho tastes so good after a night of drinking. The place is also priced well and clean.

oAqdYbOgM47F_aAZtJxiEw.text: Love this place after a good night on the strip or even on an regular day. Food is well seasoned and full of flavor. After 12am they really have cheap prices and happy hour during the day. Always crowded but they have fast service.  so love this 0lace

NP7mFO7GvQeSmAyAkBjYYA.text: Great Pho! Pad Thai is very nice. I and my family loved this restaurant. My kids also enjoyed their dishes.

TNP9MSuYRjn_hEoYbUCBEQ.text: If I could give it ZERO stars, I most certainly would.  I used to frequent this place a lot when I worked in the area. It used to be really good. After tonight's experience, I will never patronize this establishment again. I hope the owner reads this review. Their customer service is some of the worst I've seen, and I've lived here 50 years. Upon walking in, the hostess never greeted me nor anyone else.  There was a waiting list, and apparently you had to write your own name on the list yourself. When my name was called, still no greeting, just "Follow me" with a menu in her hand. She drops it on the table and walks away. My server was very nice, but not prompt at all, as I waited for quite a bit of time before he arrived. Although it was busy, all tables were not occupied. I ordered a bowl of Wonton soup and a glass of water. It took forever, and when the runner brought it out, he brought no spoon. Seriously? I tried to hail someone, anyone, to get their attention to get me one, but it was as if I was invisible. I finally had to get up and go get one from the area where the setups were. My server laughed, but did not apologize. The soup was not very hot, and flavor was rather blah. The only other time the server came back was to drop off the check, and I don't remember hearing a "thank you" or anything. Then I started getting "the eye" when apparently they wanted the table for other customers, although there was no line or waiting list. I took the check to the register.  The guy working it never said hello, asked how my food was, nothing. He didn't say "That will be $10.01, please." Nope.  He never even made eye contact with me at all.  Just said "$10.01," and that was IT!  I paid, and he never said thank you nor made eye contact while handing me my change. He did manage to say "Where the f**k are you going?l" to his fellow co-worker, who had just clocked out.  VERY professional. 24 hours or not, don't bother. Go up the street to the west a bit, to Joyful House (not 24 hours).  They have MUCH better service and food, and they actually care about the folks that come in and patronize their establishment.

mCss_lyyZqx07YlYZHMv3Q.text: The prices for pho are standard but their other dishes are twice as much as places in Chinatown.  The pho broth wasn't too shabby and they give you an average amount of meat.  I also enjoyed their shrimp spring rolls.  The shrimp was fresh, the wrapper was just the right consistency, and the peanut dipping sauce was perfect.  I think Viet Noodle Bar has slightly better pho and they also have oxtail pho which is hard to find.  I would also try the pho at district one, as it's a little more flavorful and they have lobster pho and surf and turf (steak and lobster) pho.

gSTWF8ZOMsWMsJaPx9XOyA.text: I always thought this was a really good place to eat after the clubs in Vegas! Until I came here sober! I ordered the seafood pho with wontons. The waiter gave me just the seafood pho.  I asked for extra cilantro, which they were very generous. But when I put it in my soup, I took a bite and it tasted like they didn't wash it!   Place is totally overrated! The only reason why I will come here again is for their fried spring rolls! Now those were delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood phi with wontons
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m glad someone was enjoying his pho!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where are my wontons?

y3utzeneI6KKXPkXXvcqBw.text: I use to come her all the time one day I came they sat me down this black security guard I never seen told me I needed to leave or move out my chair. Everyone knows me there and then he started to get racist and tried to hit me. He wouldn't fill swing because now and days there's cameras. My food came out uncooked and he smirked I left talk to the owner and never will be back down there again going about 3 x a week then this this black racist man I would never eat there again he called me names and the owner didn't do shit young kid called himself a owner wow get your facts and business right horrible service already talk to my business guys we will no longer attend this place

7S8QYx8_4gNPD5P_Psy5GQ.text: I come to here all time when I go to Vegas. Pho is of  course good but Shrimp with Honey Walnuts & Mayonnaise Sauce is the best!!! You should try it. And also the fresh orange juice is sooooo good!!! It's the best fresh orange juice in my life!

xs8ur_caBDJM3eikiH3E2g.text: This hurts my heart. From 2013 to 2015 Pho Kim Long was a routine stop anytime I went out. But not anymore :( the portions have gotten smaller, the quality is substantially worse, and the prices are an insult.   The shrimp fried rice used to have actual shrimps in it. Now they're the miniature ones you can get in the frozen food aisle.   The Mongolian beef entree used to have a heaping amount huge, thick slices of beef. Now it's just a small amount in the center of a large plate.   All of their plates used to be shareable, making the actual price a great deal. Hence why they got so popular.   The pho? Why wait in line and pay that price for decent broth.

7dpIiuOgIj91pMHZx-isrQ.text: The best is their Cm Tm , ph and mi hoanh thanh ok , others are just so so. Will come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho is just so so. Little bit salty

9TDyiiStgvhTUrIy3kMZZg.text: Unfortunately this place used to be my go-to favorite restaurant to visit, but not anymore. Initially, the quality and taste used to be great. After tonight's meal, I've decided not to come back. We ordered the vermicelli bun with pork & egg rolls, the Beijing beef, and the sauteed green beans with minced pork. I will say the flavor for the Beijing beef and green beans was good, but the portions have been nearly halved from what they used to be; but the vermicelli bun was literally cold mush and extremely dissatisfying. The romaine lettuce that used to be the bed for the noodles has now been replaced for iceberg lettuce and makes up for about 80% of the overall dish. The noodles were so over cooked that they were a gooey, slimy mess. It's the first time I didn't finish my meal here.

M3ltjOkdLbN4789lvJ5BjA.text: This place really piss me off, they demand a 15-20% tips. Even their service wasn't that great. Yes is a tourist area but still don't demand. Never ever again

sKx3GJ--1P8wQRuM1w1A7A.text: I had food poisoning and ordered some vegan pho to make me feel better. The pho broth is flavorless, but I liked the array of vegetables in the pho.

D5JxPGdApQgtdKbearqndw.text: Best place food comfort food. The house fried rice and calamari was bomb. I don't eat phone so I ended up having won ton with egg noodles. Best I've tasted...don't need sauces or anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Won ton with egg noodle.

SzSfskpRvbLFfGpR9opyWQ.text: Bomb dot com! Idk why this place doesn't have a higher rating. Everything we ordered was on point.   The bun bo hue broth was perf. Omg I literally just wanted to sit there n sip the broth all day. The salt and pepper calamari was crispy and had the right amount of saltiness and spice from the jalapenos.  The stir fried udon was surprisingly pretty good too. I'm just a fan of udon noodles, so I really enjoyed them. It kinda just reminded me of chow mein made with udon.  The vermicelli with pork had good flavors too. The meat had a smokey taste to it. Mapo tofu had the right amount of spice. It doesnt come with rice so you have to order it on the side.  Most definitely left the place feeling healed! After a night of drinking I would most definitely return to this spot again.

qB5UipiJCz8_slsrU6ohlg.text: As much my friends love this place but I'm never going back here, waited to be seated for 15 mins just to get our seasoned rice cold, pad Thai ic cold and our honey walnut shrimp has raw chuck of chicken with bones and skin, and instead of apologizing the cook got mad on us. Then ask us to pay the sodas.

kFCFL7hH5QTghl6Al1I_bg.text: Came here because its open 24hrs and I wanted Pho at 1am. Ordered the Pho special combination and all I got was some meat with noodles. What happen to all the other stuff like tripe and tendons? The most important part of Pho is the broth and it wasn't there and not hot enough to cook raw meat and bean sprouts all the way.

-50mkE4W_-X8PvYczrWHeA.text: My favorite Pho spot in Vegas. It's always worth the 20 min drive across town. The serve is fast and efficient, clean dining room and the Pho is BOMB DOT COM. I love bringing my peeps from Cali here too when they visit. They also love it. The other dishes are great as well but any Pho bowl is great! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Pho Noodle

OsBFbvKz3FSAIxUs3UdKTQ.text: The food is off the hook.  I love going here when I can.  The price is a little high.

uppvnrAszS598gHHYaBW8g.text: This place is so overrated! The only reason it's busy it's cuz it's conveniently located closer to the strip. Drive further down to Pho Saigon 8 for better Viet food!

uqw9aaumHiFMruD5TgPs2g.text: I find myself craving a bowl of their #16 & some crab rangoons about twice a week, I swear! (...and I must admit, I usually end up getting my fix, whether it be by rollin' in later at night with my friends - they're open 24/7! Hallelujah! - or via Postmates while I'm at work.)  Always quick to be seated & quick to be served when I do swing by, Pho Kim Long is easily one of my favorite restaurants here in town.

ha2CGkD9xmZcmRYFxAiDmQ.text: Foods were pretty good! Busy place, service was only ok. Not too friendly IMO. Open 24 hours. Its not a wow place to me as claimed "voted  #1 in Vegas". I'm not too sure about that. Its worth a try if you around the hood.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef stew noodle soup

r0bDOlyIGbxK9obShLmZTg.text: 24 hour Pho at your service!  Every time I visit Vegas, this is always the spot we go to after the club. I've been here a handful of times now and I love that this place always has parking in front and the workers always accommodate us and the place is big and clean with a giant fish tank. I always get the seafood Pho and I add tons and tons of lime, jalapeno, cock sauce in mines because I like it spicy. Now I don't eat like Pho but if I have to eat it, I only like the broth and the seafood inside.....there's just something about Pho Kim Long's broth that makes it so addicting. I literally drink the whole bowl of soup and leave all the noodles. Price is right with the amount of food they give and the freshness.   Friends here have also tried and loved their spring rolls, cold noodles and their fried chicken wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IeggAXNCYXLQrA2PO1ppyQ.text: Been coming here for close to give or take 7 years.   Really good pho! I usually like to do either the rare beef with brisket or flank and the spring rolls.   Salt and pepper chicken wings are great! (The jalapeno is the pepper)  BBQ pork appetizer is great as well.   If your feeling authentic try the braised catfish clay pot it is excellently full of flavor!  The service is very fast unless you come during their peak times then you might wait just a little longer.   Definitely one of my favorite pho spots in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This bro just took his wallet out and paid for my food cause I forgot my wallet. Wow! Excellent customer service!

M_sGp5JiS66_yfZGGirkiA.text: Food was alright , ordered take out . Service was EXTREMELY HORRIBLE. Ordered take out I came into pick it up . I paid for the food he told me to wait in the front , I'm waiting there 10 minutes and I see this bag of food just sitting there , I have to walk up to him and ask him if that's my food and he said "oh yeah" . So there I go taking this cold food away . Will definitely not return due to the horrible service !

tCnQam8pFamVrhWLa5F_lQ.text: Best Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio I've ever had. Definitely get this if anything else.   Pho Tai Chin is comparable to most other decently good pho places.   Cafe su da is good too.   Giving 4 stars for the Bun Thit Nuong. But knocking back 1/2 for the pho.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BTNCG

T4JXUOio_v6BQ_kWU8U05Q.text: I returned back to Vegas after living here for nearly 12 years, and I desired to find a good Vietnamese place.  I found this gem after everyone found this amazing place on Yelp, and instead of going to the 2015 Best In Las Vegas pick for 2015, I went here and I am beyond happy.  Now, whenever I am sick, achy, or just in the mood for good food at any time of day or night, I always go here. I sometimes wonder if they ad sick of me coming in so much lol. I always get the Spcial Combination Pho, and the portion of meat is out of this world. I've never seen this amount of beef given to me for Pho!!! And the food is solo good. The broth is amazing.  I even deviated once to try the Won Ton soup, and it was fabulous. The broth was even more amazing, and the won tons themselves were incredible!! Now it's a hard decision between the two, but if I am feeling a bit sick from my chronic illnesses, this is my go to place and it makes everything feel a lot better. My family even jokes that the Pho is my "medicine."  You cannot go wrong here.

sfVHVoECXv6a75B3eIhBug.text: This place was really busy. Service was great. We ordered combination pho. The noodles were boiled too much. Meat wasn't that great. But the broth was good. I have had wayyyy better pho in different places. Most likely won't be back

lPUwJ610IUVSN93NkDXUKQ.text: I checked this place out about a year ago and it was so good that I had to come back. This place is open 24/7 so it's a great place for drunchies. Or even hangover food lol A little off the strip but that's cool. It's a pretty big place that seems be busy all the time. Last year, I came after clubbing around 2am and it was packed. This time, I went around 11:30am and there wasn't a line so we got seated right away. But by 12, there was a huge line out the door. For how packed it was, their service is pretty decent. Not too slow, but not exactly fast either.  We ordered egg rolls and lettuce wraps for appetizer. Both equally delicious and fresh. I got the pho combination and they fill the bowl to the very top. To the point where it's almost spilling. It was so good but I couldn't finish because the bowl was so huge! Overall, a great pho place to check out. And if you're not a huge fan of vietnamese food, just go for the name ;) hehe

32ZXz5ZI2gqXg7hi_Zmh2Q.text: Wow great job guys stepping it up a customer service on point foods is fantastic the Ice-T is ice cold and the service is great keep it up  I'm assuming we  had a employee meeting keep those  meeting is going it's doing great

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. By the way wouldn&#39;t get charged this time extra for the to go cup and ice tea is still ice cold it&#39;s ice ice baby!

h4a8zDQlkraMtjcE0Ri5Bg.text: Delicious pho, quick service, and great prices! Definitely satisfied every time I stop by!   This place is open 24 hours and there not one hour in the day that it isn't busy. What's nice is that if you are waiting to be seated, the turnover is so quick (because of the fast service and food) that you aren't ever waiting too long.   The pho is HOT! Which is great, because as you know, the broth can cool down too quickly at other places. The chicken egg rolls are delicious and if you eat them "Vietnamese style," you won't regret it.

l5mokJpPQwb7HX5s1q0R-g.text: In need of some good pho? Look no further. This place is hands down the best I've tired. I've been to pho Annie, Jenni pho and this place has the best soup and egg rolls!   We walked in and immediately got seated, at first I wasn't expecting much since all the other pho restaurants I've been to has provided mediocre service to say the least but, then not even two seconds later our water was brought to our table (mind you it was very busy, so I was very impressed.) We ordered some appetizers eggs rolls and crab rangoons, and the egg rolls were brought to our table in the matter of minutes!!! The crab rangoons were so delicious and tasty along with their sweet and sour sauce that we had to order a second round. Then our pho came out and my sisters and I all ordered rare beef steak pho, so yum. If you don't want pho there is a lot of other dishes to pick from.   Must try, you won't regret it.

wPgThBAbUQxgMURCrsk8mw.text: 1st time having it. Great taste, the service is expected when this place is busy. My wife and I followed the crowd and it paid off. I got the #13 combination. It was delish.. I dont have a picture to show you because as soon as I took the first taste i could not stop.  sorry. MUST TRY IT!! CHEERS.

anz0UZTqzBCYMInN5Gb4UQ.text: Have been here a couple times when I'm in Vegas.  Sure, Pho is the best hangover food you can get, but personally think they're a bit on the pricey side, and their broth isn't that special. They do offer a lot more different kinds of food other than Vietnamese food though.  However, their service is HORRIBLE. People always say, oh yeah you shouldn't expect good services from Asian restaurants , or oh yeah the worse the service is, the better the food is! No, just no. We had to ask them so many times for them to bring up waters, they came to us with the wrong food, server was very impatient when we ordered, and when the food came, they just quickly put the food down anywhere on our table, we had to move the food ourselves.   Meh. Also there's always a long line. Unless I really want Pho and I can't wait till I get back to LA, I probably won't come here again.

5KZ2XSMGk_iQHnHtw1SF8w.text: This place is great & is 24/7. I love their Pot stickers, spring rolls, egg rolls and their  Luc-lac steak. Plus their plain rice noodle Pho. Yum and I've never had bad service so that's a plus and our waiter Brian was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bm3TCmsjR88hJKrwWes6Og.text: I'm from California and have had lots of good pho... this place is great. The broth taste really good and the noodles are perfect. Great pho for sure. We also ordered the chicken wings and egg rolls... they were just okay, still good through.  Typically when I'm in Vegas, I only eat at Earls or the big buffets. I love pho for a cheap recovery meal after a long weekend of drinking, and this is the go to place! Great service and I'll definitely be back when I'm in town and feeling like pho. Then I happen to always run into cute girls there lol

UlQQffwssyJGXnvsC7Rbjg.text: Open 24/7 after a long day/night of drinking? Yaasss. This place is located a bit off the strip but not too far. The broth is really good! Perfect hangover cure ;) however the noodles were a little over cooked and the texture of the meat and meatballs were not that great.. Different from other pho places that I've had. But I'll have to give it to them for their 24/7 convenience and great tasting broth .

g8Vs5UZHUZ3-592Ea08PxA.text: This was definitely worth trying. They have delicious authentic food. The ca kho to,duck, and canh chua were so good it was like a home cooked meal. Definitely worth trying if you craving vietnamese food and they are open 24/7

9jLQp77TaatTr_N3SkHX0g.text: Ah Pho Kim Long, glad to know you're still pho king open after all these years. You guys never fail to deliver comfort food after a night at the strip. Beef combination Pho is still my fave. Been here many times in the past and I can say your service has gotten faster and better. Keep up the great work and we'll keep coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0DjMXA-P6KgByYmzBGR7QQ.text: Best Pho in town. If I am hungry anytime of the night I always can count on Pho Kim Long.

368NXWgvA8v4I2oXyw8fTg.text: This place has good food!! I have been going here for years and I love that it is open late and located in a good area. I love their fried porkchops, special fried rice, porkchop combo, and of course their pho!! My favorite is their eggrolls! Theyre busy all day but especially late at night.

nwfNXvgBmiy5QhLWh03bxA.text: The petite male asian guy was a freaking AH, he wanted me to pay the total amount tip guidance on the receipt, he said everywhere in vegas it is required to pay a tip, I understand and I always give a tip but dont tell me how much to give when I am not happy with the way you treat us, I asked you to separate the bill into 3 groups and you want me to shoulder the tip for the rest of the group. This guy insisted the tip guidance and he even wrote it by himself on the transaction receipt including the total amount! I have never had an experience like this before, this guy is hungry for money, I wonder if he is the owner who doesn't pay his employees well or he is an employee who doesnt know how to to treat his customers and fight over a tip, wait for my credit card dispute, I will never tolerate this kind of abusive behavior to uour customer. Don't go here, their service is not genuine and very abusive.

qr2azyFDXFyzhRSxkrF-DA.text: I am giving it three stars because the pho is pretty good, and decent price but the service is bad, we gave them money and it took them more than 10 minutes to come back with our change.. The other reviewers were right, the servers were kind of rude, but we did get free water, next time I'm going somewhere else to get my pho!

k1NjI49n5-hE4uotnGvsog.text: Good food. Service is lackluster. It's open 24hrs (big plus) yummy Pho. Large and Jumbo portions of Pho.

F6O9rujWCWWGqUB-vNDUyA.text: I always eat here on my way in or on my way out of Vegas.  The food is always fresh and good.  The soups are flavorful and the meats are fresh and juicy.  The service is also good.  -one of the best Vietnamese restaurants I've eaten at

2AnOa4_rWDDWcAXfDyrk1A.text: Been here a few times, and the Pho still tastes all right.   Because I'm not a Las Vegas resident, I would not know if this place was great compared to other Vegas Pho restaurants. If I were to compare the Pho to Southern California  Vietnamese restaurants, then it would NOT be ranked that high....and it was pretty expensive for a bowl of Pho ($6-8)  To LV locals: what's YOUR favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas??

mLsxSjqjAEbEst4j0EQH6Q.text: This is the place to go for some nice Pho noodle soup and classic Vietnamese food! I usually grade Pho noodle shops by a couple of things... First, the flavor and quality of the broth, it can't be too greasy, great deep color of the broth, nor too much MSG. Secondly, the quality of the meat! I usually get the combination, of tripe, tendon, and the rare beef . Lastly, the quality of, what I call the extras, i.e. Thai basil, white onions, bean sprouts, jalapenos, &etc.   The second dish I usually judge a Pho joint is by the quality of the spring rolls. Now, I've been to many places where the spring roll just plain sucked! It's hard to find a place that has all the elements of a good spring roll. i.e. the shrimp, not too over cooked. The pork, is it flavorful? Is the vegetables mushy? and the overall quality of the flavor, not too much vinegar, a slight touch of mirin, and of course the quality of the peanut sauce. Makes me hungry as I write this! This place hit all the mark!   Now, let me say this, when a place is called Pho Kim Long...Pho soup is the way to go! Enjoy what they are known for! With that being said, the bowls of delectable Pho has to be one of the better ones in Vegas. It's not to say that the Banh Mi sandwiches are not bad, to be exact, it's actually pretty good!   Service is very prompted, friendly, and professional! Nothing negative to say about it at all!    Price wise, it's great! Everything is pretty much under $10.00! Can't complain too much here!   Enjoy!    n ngon nhe

u5lUJZwOMk7fAtCbYKN7rw.text: Pho Kim Long i guess it is pronounced "Fu.cking long" i think the owner was talking about his penis....haha   This place was just "ok" if you looking for a quick cheap bite...we came here to grab some food because the Pho Hua in Vegas closed down, WTF!!

m8br1fXE4y20Xu9FjT2g4w.text: I wish I could give you guys 7 stars. Me. My sister and a group of friends ate here around 3AM. I expected the food to be awful given the time of night. Or morning however you look at it. The staff was courteous. The food was AMAZING. I had Mongolian beef. And some type of soup. I would eat here 7 nights a week if give the opportunity. Thank you guys. Love you!

BRx8x_icqXnDAfqv95SBOg.text: I must try everything on their menu!!! this place is great. Also the scenery is awesome cause its 24 hrs and all the drunk club kids come here afterwards. People watching!!! lol

6NFIUFe9QeJlvyy-VCgqTg.text: A great run for some late night pho. Whenever I go to a pho restaurant, I tend to order the same thing - beef flank noodles and fried egg rolls - for a couple of reasons 1) they're the perfect match 2) comparison purposes. I gotta say it was just as good as Pho So 1 by Decatur and Spring Mountain. Service was smooth and speedy. I have yet to know (or so I doubt) that they replace their vermicelli noodles with the yellow egg noodles. till then, i'll rate it 3 stars up for now.

bkWsMs6a9wxqclcpL9Mxcw.text: This is the perfect place to go after a late night of debaucherous drinking. My friends took us to this place for lunch, and it hit the spot perfectly.  I got the Pho Tai (pho with thin beef slices), and requested that the beef come on the side so that they weren't cooked well done in the broth by the time I got to them. The broth was really good (above average, I'd say). Ironically I put the slices in the broth a little too late, and my last few pieces wouldn't properly cook because the broth was no longer hot enough. I asked for a little more broth too cook those pieces, and they happily obliged (probably with a chuckle, knowing the amateur mistake I made). This pho tasted better usual; to be fair, it could've been because of the previous night that I had, but it was delicious.  I also recommend ordering a fresh young coconut to drink. They give you a coconut with the top cut off, and with a straw to drink and spoon to scrape off some of the meat. Quite tasty!  One thing I was a little disappointed about was that they added $1 to my meal because I asked for the beef slices on the side. I know some other places do this, but it doesn't mean that it's cool to do so.  Overall, this place really hit the spot and I'd go back.

lFQjHC4PNsCX1og_qnpcqw.text: I'm from Sacramento, CA so when we were in Vegas we were really craving for some authentic Viet food.  This place will satisfy your cravings but the service was horrible!!!  Upon arrival the waiter spilled 2 glasses of water on my friend.  They were very rude when we asked questions about the portion size of the pho.  We also asked for change so we can all pay the bill separately and they were really rude about that!    There's so many other Thai & Viet restaurants in the same plaza so if I were to go back to Vegas and wanted some authentic Asian food I would not go back to this place.  I'd try another restaurant in the same plaza.  As a matter of fact, we went to the Kung Fu restaurant on the corner of this plaza and they serve Chinese & Thai food and the food was great & service was good as well.

wThMEapTlIOy522KDa3t1A.text: This place had a wide selection of food to choose from. Plus there food was good! Anyone who is in Vegas HAVE to go here. Place has a nice setting. Not that expensive either.

SrmePQznE7SpDSaWe1arSA.text: This place has all of your typical pho, BBQ rice plates, and other Vietnamese dinner entrees. I love that this place is located close to the strip and is open super late. It's nice to get some decent non-expensive food when you're hungry after partying on the strip.   Had their pho with rare steak and it was similar in quality to other pho places.  Nice that this place is huge and pretty clean as well.

O0hCimydqkfHDC3zPsFpSw.text: Besides the fact that the name of this place said 5 times fast always sends me in a fit of (totally immature) giggles, I have always enjoyed my meals here during almost every trip I've made to Vegas.  Their menu is huge, the service is fast, ingredients fresh, and the prices totally reasonable.   Also, if I'm not in the mood for pho, they have both vermicelli bowls and porridge (with century egg!!!!!) that I can partake in.  Also, their egg rolls are perfectly light, not too greasy deliciousness.  It's a no-fuss, no-muss pho place that has not disappointed.

3uvL7LcHZXp0WHyZ844HcA.text: Great place to eat after a night out. We came here everytime we go to Vegas! They open 24hr which is very convinience. Service is great, and the foods come out fast. We tried couples items on the menu and all of them are good generally speaking. The restaurant is about 5 min away from the strip so when you are sick of the buffet , you can always come here at any time for a bowl of PHO :). It costs $12 to take the cab here :) when you can't drive :).

DIdwGlcA8HMst1jIaYtxjw.text: Arrived in Vegas early in the morning and was hungry for something to warm my stomach. We had rented a car so we decided to go to the Asian plaza to check out the restaurants. We were there at 9:30am so everything was closed except for this establishment. We took a chance and tried their combination stir fried noodle with veggies, chicken & shrimp and a bowl of soup noodles with the thin flat rice noodles with beef balls, shrimp, calamari, and chicken. Service was a little slow and I got my soup noodles way before hubby got his stir fried noodles. The flavor of the soup was good but a little oily, noodles were soft, and they gave a decent amount of seafood. I enjoyed the stir fried noodles also - the crunchy noodles, meat, and vegetables was covered with gravy.    The place was crowded for a Saturday morning and people seemed to gravitate to this place for their soup noodles. It's lively and the service was friendly but a little on the slow side. Prices were decent: range $7-$10.

jOqVfZQp0KYpAuP-6rHY3g.text: This place is a staple of Las Vegas. I've been going here since '95. They've come a long way from being a tiny tiny spot with karaoke to this perenial powerhouse of good food. Their prices went up a few years ago and I was a bit unhappy bout it, but dammit, they've got me hooked. Love their Pho, I never stray from Pho Tai because it's my comfort/one food to eat on a deserted island food. Their beef pan fried noodles are well made cantonese style and delicious.

dFLKHNQombYXYBMpt-RWPA.text: It's a taxi ride away from the strip, but definitely worth the trip!  Pho Kim Long is open 24 hours and they even carry vegan pho.  Top Picks: Tofu Spring Rolls, Cha Gio, Pho Tai, and the Young Coconut (only $3.50)

oI2vS-HwS8yAGs4iMId56g.text: This place has gotten so big and popular so quickly that it's forgotten what decent service is and what quality food is. The recognition is unwarranted and ratings were probably purchased. They need to get back to the basic fundamentals of a good restaurant

pJqE4PPXWdSy1IXe8CMK0Q.text: This is the first Vietnamese-Chinese food place I tried in Las Vegas. Great food! As for service, you have to hunt them down. I am already use to doing this at a few places in Los Angeles, so no complaints there for me. Maybe for people who expect to be checked  once-in-a-while will complain. When you ask for a request, they come back quickly which is good. The ambiance was loud since there were a lot of people who showed up to dinner at the time. The decor was nice and fitting. The chairs were comfortable. This place is open 24 hours. Big plus there in my book! I will come here again.

3MJQiLAIa7reTJdGbxbpNg.text: FAVORITE Pho in Chinatown.   Open late night, this is it.  Why look further, they are awesome.  The Awesome Noodles, Drunken Noodles and the FULL Chinese menu besides the trendy pho and vietnamese is all insane.   The Spring rolls come with a bowl of peanut dipping sauce that you want to lick clean, bu tknow its totally fattening, but get one to start.  Its enough for two!   I also love the Combo Pho here, its balanced perfectly.   The staff here is ON IT!  Great service.  Great prices.  INCREDIBLE Food.  Get some.  #1 place for Pho in China Town, I say!   Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get pho

NfQJR-5bmSCDeyKuGRfuhg.text: i came to Kimlong last night. i ordered 2 beef noodle soups with meat ball. it was very bad. i will never come back again!!!!

uwurES1kb7p3J58aazD2ag.text: The pho was surprisingly more decent than expected considering they're the only 24 hour option I could find, that's what earned this review a star. Service was crap, I was sitting for maybe 30 seconds before the server asked if I was ready. Food was out VERY quick which is great but worries me at the same time if you know what I mean. One sip of the Thai tea and I immediately could tell it was old so I didn't bother with the rest. When I mentioned the tea I thought the server acknowledged what I said but my bill suggested otherwise. This is one of those last resort options(go figure for a 24 hour joint), I'll only come back here if I'm forced.

ryGkwiVPPHqdZ4I6KxN91A.text: Table for 10, I think. We roll deep.   I forgot that Vegas clubs differ from San Diego. (i.e. They don't close at 2am)  My friend who lives in Vegas was an awesome host and showed me and LT a great time and how/where the locals party. After poppin bottles, dancing for four hours, throwing napkins into the air we were ready to go eat.   I recall going to a pho place on Spring Mtn a few years ago, but this one was different. I think it was Pho Little Saigon and I had broth spilled all over my legs and they gypped us on the bill.  #1 Rule: if you want the Pho Tai Chin order it by it's number. When they bring your order out the pretty much ask Who got #_, #_, #_?! Heck, I don't know what number it was, I just know it has well done brisket and rare steak... LOL but you can't see the meat under all the broth.  Another guy at the table ordered the same thing. He gave me his, but it didn't have the brisket! :( lame sauce.   The pho was alright, for being open 24 hours and having to deal with a bunch of drunkards they do a good job.   Anyhow, we were pretty much sober by 5am and my friend happily dropped us off at our hotel room.   Woot less than 24 hour trip to vegas was a success, and yes we did go to the buffet the following morning (5 hours later).

YqAxYrul_Ru6SLhFYzUbzw.text: My opinion the best pho in town. I love their wonton soup and the fried calamari is still my all time favorite:)

zludS0JKyJ8fRKdePmiszQ.text: Anytime you can get pho at 2-6 AM after a night of drunken debauchery and shenanigans is a frickin' blessing and shouldn't be taken for granted.  The fact that this pho is also good and the meat doesn't resemble rubber is also a plus.  Whether you are sober, drunk as shit, or your jaw is sore like hell (looking at you etards), pho is food for the soul and will over salvation for any occasion. Come here at any time of the day or night. You know you want to Pho Kim Long all night long ;) or just maybe for 5 minutes and then split, only to Pho Kim Long again the next time you're feeling a little tipsy...

kyUou4aExO_Ar3XT93h1Vw.text: Horrible service, orderred food and got kicked out by scrawny manager that insisted on calling security and when asked why when one of our group members put their head down for being tired he ego tripped and wanted to fight but had security escort us cuz he was not man enough.... Unprofessional place. Go down the street one intersection over by the 15 to the other 24/7 pho place (tons better)The manager here is always rude and power trips. Will not return.

OQ0h7tp5G4V74xDoA2TQuA.text: Good for a morning hangover. Good portions for a decent price. This place gets busy at night and in the morning on the weekends.  Thai Tea was disappointing though.  Lots of meat in the pho.

xBowlbfS6gYW4FadRiGfLA.text: Another perfect late night restaurant for after-clubbing munchies. I love pho at any time of the day! We were so thrilled to have found this place.  The price is a little high compared to other pho places.  The menu was full of Vietnamese, Chinese, and Thai dishes. The bowl was pretty good size, very tasty, VERY FULL OF MSG. I was thirsty for days. They definitely need to cut back on MSG.   $7.99- Pho Ga (Chicken) $6.99- Pho with Rare Steak $9.99- Shrimp Fried Rice  Overall: I'll come back every night because it is open late, affordable, and satisfying!

gi_usiVNZCtCIcn5jXLuag.text: The broth is perfectly balanced with just enough cilantro, thai basil and lime.  The noodles are fresh and not greasy.  You leave feeling comforted and less hungover.   OH PHO SURE this is the best.  However, the bathrooms are basically hell on Earth but...just hold it and wait to go back to the hotel.    It's worth the cab ride out there but getting back was SO hard...so we're going to do take out next time!!

qEDDZJYT9oINoNz8GXVNGw.text: They're alright. Food is kind of pricy compared to better Vietnamese restaurants with better food quality that's cheap, but it's one of the nearest spots for Vietnamese food if you're in Vegas. It's always packed.

-AIJUDvH-tC0yHQphZv49w.text: Costumer service is terrible! The pho is terrible! I would not recommend this place at all unless u have no other choice.

ERqjCZl7AONl7FNRpH5cPA.text: So I've driven by this place laughing at the name for years until I finally decided to try it out from the recommendation of a friend. First, I'll say they were extremely fast.  We sat down, they took our order after just a few minutes and our food was out.  Props. But, the pho was mediocre. Broth was bland.  The pork chop was under seasoned.  It looked delicious but tasted really bland. The spring rolls were meh.  The fried ones were good. It was also pricey. Probably won't ever come back to this place since there are def better ones around.

cw1Tz7pxTmZh3EbPVfPg7A.text: Great food but the wait and service kill it. Hour wait to be seated. Rude waiter that didn't even know the menu. Cleaned our table before we were done eating to rush us out. Cashier gave attitude when leaving. Plenty of other good pho places to go. Don't go here.

wA5r6KICb-4EGOMcW9A1cg.text: Service really sucked here. The food was good but I was really disappointed with the service. After we finished our lunch and paid the man at the front counter he demands that we pay the 15% tip. We left a really good tip on the table but he was still asking for the 15% tip. Over all I was really unhappy about my experience there. My first and probably my last time at this location.

Y-ZqTt_EL6pq2s-dLAL-Mw.text: One of the best Pho restaurant in Vegas. Enjoy Vietnamese cuisine while in Vegas.... service is fast. .. as always. .delicious Pho.

d0jPbTyFwlHDulo2eFWhBQ.text: BEWARE! Made a mistake on my order and customer is not right here...do yourself a favor and turn around.  Being very dirty for one star.

reM7EkLIjzFbbOq8R_Jclg.text: I ordered the traditional beef Pho. The beef was not trimmed at all. My soup was full of fat and gristle. They're either lazy, or cheap? Either way it wasn't good. When you're searching through your soup for edible beef you might as well search elsewhere. Wasn't worth the drive from centennial hills.

Mt_WKgDcjG6cOgrILkTdPQ.text: This place is popular so expect a bit of a wait. Our server was really sweet and the food came out pretty fast. We ordered fried egg rolls (5/5) rare beef pho (5/5) bbq pork fried rice (5/5) and viet iced coffee (4.5/5) only reason i docked .5 points is because they premix the coffee and the condensed milk. I'm just used to the traditional slow drip coffee but it was still nom.

ZK5zHZmHYB8WdHDeOuxK1Q.text: * Spring Rolls ($4.95) - 5 STARS: Super fresh and delicious. Definitely get this!  * Beef Pho - 3.5 STARS: The broth is pretty good, but the noodles tasted grainy like they've been cooked too long and there wasn't too much meat in the bowl. Despite this, after a night out this really hits the spot.  * Avocado Smoothie - 5 STARS: I think I had the best avocado smoothie of my life here. They got the sweetness, liquidity level, and pearl texture perfect. Not to mention the avocados were perfectly ripe.  It's such a short cab ride from the strip, and the food was all around pretty good. I would definitely go back. I am still on search of my favorite pho spot in Vegas though!

DMnrEQHDlb2gR06JXpaBxw.text: This place was much better a while back. Portions and food are less impressive then they once were. I will trying new places next time I visit Vegas.

ynC30Vl-4CTVmK0y8pFvxg.text: Wow! Amazing rare beef pho, chicken teriyaki was the bomb (which I never order), and my husband's pad thai was great! Service was friendly and prompt, and the restaurant was nice and clean. Great experience  all around!

Q8fEZJyUcvXF_ekIimgqkA.text: Had to make a review since I was absolutely appalled by what I saw upon walking in. Although most of the tables were empty, some not wiped down, containers for Hoisin and Chili sauce definitely needed a good cleaning from being caked up with sediment, some of the tables needed a good wiping from large food particles left behind from customers, the bathroom had toilet paper all over the floor and trash cans were overflowing with trash...besides being unclean in some areas, it was extremely cold in front of the restaurant where I had more inside the back. Also, my order was a tendon and brisket pho in which the tendon served was hard and crunchy. After 30 minutes of sitting, no one even came to check on me to see if I needed anything else.  This place is not how it used to be when I came in the early 2000s.  Don't plan on coming here again since I know of other places open 24 hours.

The thai tea price also bothered me too the menu said thai tea for $3.75 and the waiter charged me $4.25 for boba ! Isn't it a GIVEN THE DAMN BOBA come in the thai tea or is that just me?

OpvnMnFMyKHPe8YrI4r8og.text: This place is horrible! Poor customer service. The food is not that good. The pho broth taste like it came out of a can. The veggies are really old. I even several protein insects in my bowl. 4 out of 5 stars for this place is overrated.

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three little insects in my bowl. The broth is NOT suppose to be that muggy.

uvh31k_3OUz4HyaM8Xc7zg.text: Gotta love Chinatown when you're in the mood for pho at midnight! This place was open and busy late on a Tuesday night- so you know it must be good. Add to that the hilarity of the restaurant name itself, and you'll know how I ended up there with a snickering group of dudes with a late night appetite.  Our table shared the Vietnamese spring rolls as an appetizer, along with a bowl of pho, the pan fried noodle, and the chicken wraps, all of which were really good. The panfried noodle was a good amount, but I would personally have preferred more veggies and the inclusion of something other than the baby bok choy, such as mushrooms and broccoli. The chicken lettuce wraps were good- more chicken than lettuce, but tasty enough that we didn't mind and much better than the other way around.  Service was a little slow but was efficient. Menu is large, and it took a while to make up our minds- unfortunately my first choice order was the crepe, and I was told they were out. I'm not sure how they'd be out of eggs or how that works, but I guess it just means I'll have to come back another time to have it.

Sz_Yz6maHVGcPuY92qOWkA.text: PHO KIM SLOW!   What we got from here was slow service and some diarrhea.   I came here around 2 am and it wasn't busy but there was a 25 minute wait. The guy at the door didn't not know how to seat people in a timely manner.   When we were finally seated, it took forever to get noticed to order food or get some water. My boyfriend ordered pad Thai and the rest of us ordered pho tai each.   After we received the pad Thai, it took at least another 10 minutes for our pho to come out. Everything tastes okay.   BUT after we went to sleep, my boyfriend had to go to the bathroom multiple times in the morning. I had to go multiple times through the day, got a migraine, and then a small fever the next day.   I knew it was the pad Thai because none of my other friends got sick because they didn't eat any pad Thai.   Never again.

HOUwAtkLVyx2qP76HePJHg.text: This is one of my favorite places,  they have the best soups..  The only thing is the food for the entire party don't come at the same time,  making it weird seeing people in on your same table while waiting for your food.    They have an option for vegan food or vegetarian..  Their pho is great,  don't get fooled by their name lol

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ya_pW7i4KY9ZqJ4d9E08Qw.text: First of all, I'd like to say how rude the guy in the front was. I went in to order take out & he wasn't friendly at all. It's very loud in here so I could barely hear anything he was telling me. Apparently he had told me to wait up front for my order but with how soft he was talking & how loud it is here I didn't hear him. So I waited near the register & after standing there for 5 minutes he looks at me & tells me, "wait up front". First time here & probably the last. I've heard good things about this place but probably won't even come back because of the poor customer service the guy up front gave me.

jA2KrFTeYllf4mUJSrxNKA.text: Food was very good and the customer service was great as well. It's a place that my family goes back to from time to time.

V11sIs-td_NgVc7cH3p3cA.text: good service good food, Great hot and sours soup see for your self youtu.be/SUVM4yBMjcE

9ybwdwyoIVwKM3trSz7PVQ.text: This is probably one of my favorite PHO restaurants in Las Vegas. I come here at least once a week I always receive great service from servers but I felt like today I didn't receive the service I deserved, so that being said didn't leave a tip this time and when I went to pay one of the cashier was really rude insisting I leave a tip with an angry face. I told him I didn't feel like the server deserved it and explained to him why and still with an angry face and rude voice and attitude said "so I still want you to leave a tip" and we went back and forth until I just walked out without leaving a tip. Walking out I hear him whisper yes get out of here. e

Du5ezC72NQAF_gYKX1JGwg.text: Love the pho here! Consistent quality and generous portions, especially if you get it to go.  I work nearby and always get the #16 at least once or twice a week.  They are really popular though so the one issue for me is that there is almost always a long wait for both takeout and a table.

lS0HZbTyIIrtj88nhsaThw.text: Drove all the way from Modesto, CA. Took us Pho Kim Long to get here. So worth. Will be coming back here

mbn3Tjgyfxgo_Ho-xRAyAQ.text: Maybe its because I've tried almost every single Pho restaurant in OC or because I've tried the Pho in Vietnam but Pho Kim Long's pho isn't very good.   I'm going to guess that its ALWAYS crowded here because its located in a busy plaza in Chinatown near the strip. I've passed by this place a few times during lunch and there's always a bunch of people hanging outside waiting for a table. Parking sucks because the plaza has a lot of shops but not enough parking spots.   Pho is ALWAYS good for a hangover because of the beef/chicken broth, but I felt that Pho Kim Long's broth was very watered down. It seemed (IMO), that they just tossed a few beef bouillon cubes in their broth and added pho seasoning. I ordered a small bowl and it was a good size, but I felt that there wasn't enough meat.There are chopsticks, spoons, spices, and hoisin sauce on the table. While the food came out quickly, and the veggies were fresh, the pho broth and service weren't good. Like most Asian run restaurants, the servers weren't friendly and seemed to always be in a rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho broth seemed very watered down

D-s0vCHog2_VG9nZiXYFSw.text: Around 11am on a Sunday, my group and I dined here during our Las Vegas stay before going home. There's 8 of us so I understand that it may take a awhile to get seated but the people there lack courtesies and services. They have not come back to us to update us on our table. We basically we have to get their attention and bam we were accommodated. Now move on the the food, overall my friends enjoyed their dishes and so did I. Big portions for reasonable prices. So yes the food aced it but not the workers. Such in a hurry we did not take any food orders. But yummy fooood!

-cGAVnt2XwRaOT0_mF7tjA.text: Great atmosphere for a "pho" place.  Feels like fine dinning with the noise and buzzling of constant activities.  In addition to pho, they have a full Vietnamese food and drinks menu.
