jYqkg6RfF2u1QNwNzykAqQ.text: Best pho broth in town. Food is super good, comes out super quick, and for the most part service is pretty good.. My favorite pho spot!

xINNCS-hkYY8Z7LOXtmNiQ.text: Well the food was pretty yummy, but this place gets 4 stars because of the hot waiter with the tattoos and mohawk!   I got the noodle things with pork (chow fun?) and my friend got some other thing that was super tasty!   The waiters are nice, and I will def go back for the hottie!

ZfrSRtmxYR-tTjMb9i5lgQ.text: The worst customer service! Waiters are rude. They won't tend to you until the third or fourth request. We'll never go here again!

pR1dDwNqcr0yO4-tnrriCQ.text: Racists!  I've been treated poorly by Asians before, but this place takes the cake.  My friend and I were seated and ignored.  A pair of Asian men sat at the table next to us ten minutes later and so the waiter HAD to show up.  Of course he took their order first and our food made it out eventually.  I paid with my credit card and went out to my car where I was chased down by the manager who asked me if I had paid!  Evidently the "waiter" was quick to our table only if it meant money in his pocket.  Hateful racists.  Is all of Chinatown harboring such hatred?

JnJqwzufgEXbpG5RHsbSiw.text: Eh. My boyfriend and I frequent this place maybe once a month. I reluctantly agree to go because he loves it here. But, again, I have to reiterate- eh. Service is absolutely terrible. The staff has a way of making you feel like you're bothering them for whatever you ask for. Waiting for a table has never taken long, but forget getting refills on your drinks or checking on how the food is. Your order is taken, your food is brought out, and good luck finding somebody to bring you the check. You basically have to wave one down like a taxi. Now, their pho can't be knocked, it's fresh, tasty, and always comes out quick. If you're feeling adventurous and try tasting some of the other some 1000 options on the menu, such as pad thai or beef and broccoli (slight wtf, isn't this Vietnamese?) it's a real crap shoot. 50/50 chance of getting something solid tasting. On a lighter note, they have pretty good boba. And nice fish tanks to distract from all the post-club-we're-all-starving-and-still-drunk sloppiness that's going on late night.

RSD-q53SAqV9uF2m8bZ4WQ.text: Originally, we wanted to eat some Thai Style Noodle House.  To our dismay, they were closing in 10 minutes when we arrived.  So, off we trecked to the next Asian restaurant and landed in Pho Kim Long.  One thing about this place is that it's open 24 hours a day and I was informed that they are the only pho place that has these hours.  Please correct me if I'm wrong.  It was my bf, and two of our friends who shared this experience with us.  I never really know what to order from here so I had our friend order for  me.     When the bowl came my way, I was very excited as I'd never had it before.  I believe it was pho with some kind of beef balls.  There were other meats in there but I forgot to ask what type it was.  The broth was good without the extra sauces that people normally put in there.  When adding the bean sprouts, mint, and jalapeno's the kick it gives is a whirlwind of pleasures in your tongue.  My boyfriend ordered the fried rice.  The color was somewhat orangey-yellow.  We've never had anything like it.  Per our friend, the way it's made is the cook adds just the yolk to give it that sunshine color.  It's definitely different but I can't say I'd order it for myself in the future.  The other dish we had was a spicy tofu.  That was really addicting.  Normally, tofu doesn't blend well with anything because of how bland it is.  But, they added the right amount of spice to give it a pleasing taste.  The atmosphere of the whole restaurant was very relaxed.  Most people come here to sober up after a wild night at a club or bar.  It only makes sense.

siDmtFW8CdyykbuKqtluAg.text: Best Egg Rolls in Chinatown!!! They come out super fast too.  The selections of Pho and their Chinese menu are perfect night caps.  Plus after midnight it's a eclectic crowd from Tourist, locals getting off work & Club peeps rolling in drunk LoL. Nothing bad on menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rp7oA3OemmVam5_JCqV85w.text: 24/7 pho, can't beat it. There's always a lot of people hanging around outside, but I haven't had a wait in The few times I've been. The egg rolls are awesome and the only soup I've gotten was the rare steak, which is better than a lot I've had. Loud as hell, but always a good time.

th9bZI9d2p0rt1VUssbl9g.text: Very bad service, i wait too long for pho. The servant said they lost the ticket but didn't do anything. In the end the pho came out, but the way they servant serves very rude, he threw the bowl and said "do you want it or not?" It's very unacceptable behaviour and service. Even they have many crowd, but it's not a reason to treat customer like that. Not recommended.

n6TiHIrkm0WyZebJhIGwxw.text: If you are hungover, and ready to go home from Vegas come here to eat. Their pho is good, and the service is good. Also they serve their coconut juice/ water straight from the coconut. Delicious! Party hard, and soup it afterwards! ENJOY!

lZOVF59gRzzEzcaH3Vm5XQ.text: Everytime I'm in Vegas and I want Pho I come here. But it's weird cuz I don't eat the pho. I usually come here when I'm about to leave Vegas and don't eat the pho because I don't want to stop on the way home (to OC) so I get non-water based food.   Last time I got the vermicilli with meat & eggrolls. It was okay, I had better ones. I didn't like how they put the Americanized bag salad as the veggies in the dish. Then the last weekend I got the rice & pork chops. The pork chops tasted weird, it had this nasty taste after only on the sides and the part with the fat. It was not a good pork dish. ugh. they also put that fake american salad on the side and not like a real lettuce & cucumber like the real pho places in california.  anyways, I heard the pho was good, so come here for pho and not the rice dishes or the vermicilli.

3l5aBC3tzfDOTq6Tg-eMAw.text: I really wish I went here late at night than for lunch. The wait is pretty long.  Their broth wasn't too bad. I liked how they decorated the place.  It doesn't look like your typical vietnamese pho restaurant and the servers are dressed up as well.  Here's a tip: when you sign in, I'd advise waiting around in the restaurant because if they call your name and you're not there, you're pretty much out of luck.

LkfPC_BMhHZXOjCJx3QpQA.text: Long  wait times for mediocre food that is bland with no taste.   Tried the pho  tai  regret ordering it,  soup was so bland with no flavor and the meat was dry with no flavor.   The vegetables provided was obviously not fresh also. My group didn't like what they ordered also.   Never going to this place again whenever I'm in Vegas, and they definitely are not what they claim as best in Las Vegas.

dJnyjbsG3UZf9XdUqquZKw.text: Very good food, came out quickly. Only issue was the delay it took to get our food order.

1KlBB0GkDmD-Vk_x_88crw.text: Moved here about a month ago from San Francisco excited to try the pho in Las Vegas. Had high hopes for this place as it was highly recommended by some co workers & from the sign saying "Voted Best Veitnamese Restaurant." Wait time wasnt bad at all, but it took awhile to get our orders placed. It didnt bother me that our waitress couldnt bare much English but that was the reason why my order wasnt satisfied. She brought over a chef or manager or whatever guy she brought to the table. I, ever so nicely, told him about my order and he, ever so disrespectfully, denied me and walked away. I've never been so embarassed like this in food service before. I asked to see the manager and he as well was rude but I dont wanna bother wasting any more of my time on how dissatisfying my experience was here.

r1mh-JxqG0nkGIQZBz8XLA.text: According to my friend, Pho beef soup is too salty, maybe they don't know to cook Vietnamese pho.  I had rice bbq pork, it was okay.  No come back here again since the service was slow and no know to cook Vietnamese food.

CIiZxWnQPfprt7rSpIBAPw.text: This place is legit! We loved it! fast, friendly service, hot, fresh, delicious food. Who can ask for more!? I recommend the Mongolian beef, Pan fried noodles, and Kung pao. They didn't have any trouble getting us a table for our larger group.

nwJy2eFcOGoQDY1FfltbbA.text: Ended up here at 3am. Feeling TORE UP! Pho is healing. What else can you say? I love this place. I love that it's 24 hours. Casino food gets old quick. I ordered the vegan pho and some Chinese broccoli with steamed rice. The food came out in just a few minutes. Quick, efficient and delicious. The pho was flavorful, the vegetables seemed fresh. Huge portions! The broccoli was cooked to perfection- just the right amount of that yummy salty, garlicky flavor. I am definitely coming back here!

jzNKEZKGm204UnOrrI6LpA.text: This is the place in Vegas for pho.  It is so good!  Big bowl of broth!    Every time I tried other pho places (because it is pretty far from where we live) it didn't compare to Pho Kim Long.  It was worth the drive and you can always count on them being open.  And no wait really and the food comes out fast!  The only thing is sometimes it smells like wet rag.  Not sure if its the tables or floors?  But, the smell kind of goes away after 15 min

s1zikGZpd78zRagH1NXRhQ.text: Ugghhh. Oh my! This place was alright the first two times and especially because of the take-out order I made the other day, I decided to come back. It was pretty busy, like how it usually is, so I waited. The host barely even noticed me. He didn't notice me until I asked him for an order to-go... Anyhow, I barely even got to look at the menu he handed me and he already asked me what I wanted, so I just basically ordered what I ordered last time which was chicken chow fun for me and orange chicken with a side of rice for my boyfriend... It took a while, but it was fine, whatever, because it's busy. I went back to the front to wait for my food and like 10 minutes later, the same host who helped me asked me if I had been helped... -_- Anyways, I paid right when the host gave me the receipt, but when my food came out, he brought me back to the cash register and tried to have me pay again. Luckily one of the workers there saw that I paid and said that it was okay. I finally took the food home and what do you know?! There is HAIR in the orange chicken... Long black hair. Not just one, but two strands... And maybe more. But I just threw the food away... Blahhh, I'm so disappointed. This is not ok. I tipped too (because I usually always tip) but this is unacceptable!

MRxT0KyqWNwfQx0bVcFSvA.text: love this place! yummy food & they also have Thai tea with boba which is a sure fire way to make me happy. Open 24/7 which is nice too. service isn't amazing but food always comes out quick and it's fairly cheap.

2bAW1LdL7xZRsXIn_AazLA.text: We came to this locale two Mondays ago for brunch. It was among the few small "last hoorahs" we will have had before heading back to San Jose.  Pho Kim Long in Las Vegas happened to be comparable to many pho restaurants in San Jose. Surprisingly, as I didn't think pho here would be any good.   We ordered:  1 Regular Pho Dac Biet 1 Jumbo Pho Dac Biet 1 Hu Tieu 1 Pho Ga 1 OJ 1 Sinh To Xoai  Bill came out to be around $45ish  Overall, some complaints we had was that they didn't have the vinegared onions .. how can they not? Also, my friend ordered dark meat with bones for her pho ga, and they gave her white meat.  Service wasn't so bad.. they weren't as rushy and unpleasant like most pho joints. Would come back to try other items on their menu.

6p7Vu5SKGBRIUrv9lBljEg.text: Spray painting the front counter area this morning.With an open kitchen right behind the area....and RUDE waiters telling us...don'like,don't eat..

ZaLBgF_679TYKB8UNTRUyA.text: This place hit the spot after a long night of being out and about in the cold. And it definitely made me feel better after learning that Avatar in IMAX 3D was sold out.  The fresh spring rolls are so good. Granted, I don't think you can really mess it up, but the peanut sauce was yummy! The pho is your standard pho...meaning it is good any time of day.   Service is fast, food is cheap. Will definitely go back when I'm in town.

h7-Ky7thVOGa54tq8bwJ5A.text: Amazing!   From the greeting at the door to the wave goodbye...the experience was perfect.  You have to try the  Calamari.

A64KylgpHuh3nXK02t7iew.text: One of my go to places for Pho and vietnamese/chinese food in Las Vegas. This place is well known by locals to Las Vegas and visitors. During the weekends, Pho Kim Long will be packed especially during the lunch hour (as most people will come for the pho after a long night of drinking). I usually like to get the special pho with everything in it. The other items that you have to get are the fried egg rolls, the fried salty/spicy chicken wings (these are the best in the area), and of course the ice coffee.

yMYZj0RxG_BGh2ORPTMLTw.text: Best Sea Food Chow Fun, Pho and spring rolls in Vegas. The staff is also really nice.

0-4UFvzWMkLQJscbMUAfCQ.text: yea the name is so pho-king funny...har har.  located just northwest of the strip in the Chinatown area, this little gem is THE SPOT for your pho fix. this has to be one of my all time fav spots and the pho here is on point. the eggrolls and spring rolls were decent, although i do like the ones in the valley (Pho So 1) better. i also tried their calamari with some friends and highly DO NOT recommend it. though it's tasty, it's literally dripping with grease and not presented very well. i think i ordered the #13 (the typical pho bowl with all the meat stuff).   my friends and i loved it so much, we ate here twice during our NYE trip. pho is definitely the cure-all for hangovers and hits the spot after a long night partying in Sin City.

yXnxopUJNrlU1tw5QfrSXw.text: Lightly fast service. Three waiters run the floor of the whole store and they manage perfectly!  Open 24 hours! What a life saver! Overpriced for Pho, but good. Comparable to my all time favorite Golden Deli from LA.  We avoid this place like a plague during peak hours -- crazy lines.

674qTyGtYt4msC9TITxjLQ.text: My whole vegas trip was kind of a blur, but the brief time I spent sitting down and eating here was a nice enjoyable break. Ordered the vermicelli bowl with pork and egg rolls. I've gotta say, their pork was pretty top notch. Barbecue'd and juicy with a nice fire grilled flavor. Damn!! It definitely was a step above all the other vermicelli bowl's I've had. Everything else in the bowl was pretty standard; comparable to most Vietnamese joints, but the pork was the extra kicker that gave this rating an extra one and a half star. Service was pretty nice too and it was clean inside. Overall pretty nice experience.

NEH53j3ZFOWsk-5qe0k5lg.text: Simply the best, fast service, great food, and reasonable prices!! Tr y the rare beef pho soup, delicious!!

ZSPHEKfGp2REAm5DwZ_YbQ.text: bad food , high prices, arrogant owner . If it wasn't  for the the people from out of town in  need some hot soup after a long night of gambling. This place would not even make it. I would never come back again.

aV4TngqPtCOw0M7eDqU5lQ.text: I will Pho Kim Long -er. I just wanted to say that.  Food was okay - decent, I mean Im not big on buffets so pho was soothing and tasted ok. I ordered the CafeSuDa and it was already mixed, which I don't like personally - it was too sweet for me.  The service was good, and although we had a contagious fit of toppling over our glasses of water, the staff was quick and replaced our water promptly with no attitude.  Inside was decorated better than usual pho spots. And I'm glad to have an off the strip alternative.

xYW2ueJWGgJo-6DASb-diQ.text: "Pho Kim Long" You've got to love the name!! I went there about 3:30am. The place was packed. We all had Pho [fur]. The service, price, food, atmosphere were all good!!! Taxi's available.  Would i go back? Yes I have been back enough times they recognize our group.This is one of the places many people go after partying,

2Xt_WlQYLpNhnqeZMDdkrQ.text: This used to be my favorite pho spot in Vegas.  Some days, you tire of the endless buffets with rich, greasy foods and you just want some nice comfort food.   Pho Kim Long (yes, the name turns us all into giggly 12 year olds), was that place for me.    However, on recent visit, I noticed that they have remodeled/redecorated and their prices are really inflated now.  A bowl of pho there used to be like no more than 7 dollars but now, there are bowls of noodles over 10 dollars.  I think they are trying to reach into the non-asian market or something and trying to make it more upscale.  Bah!  Their food is not the greatest, compared to LA standards but it is pretty darn good considering the few choices that you have to select from.    I would have given 5 stats but took 1 away for unconscionable pho prices.

74ZQZqF1JqbCo65Z99ZKSQ.text: Came here for late night pho. Opened til 5am. Was pretty packed when our group came. Server was pretty accommodating and fast. We ordered, ate and paid in a timely manner. Was generous enough to split our check (not sure if they usually do this). Price was around $8 for Pho. They called us a cab afterwards.

n6c13CUJjtXZGv_5Wy9Lkw.text: I often eat Pho but I've never seen a Pho restaurant that big. We arrived at 6:45pm on a Monday and It was packed, which is usually a good sign! The food was served really quick, like we sat down at 7pm, ordered (7:05pm), and the food was served (7:06pm)! It's was almost faster than eating at McDonalds!

OmuMFEqfI5bBFACVv36oUw.text: This is one of my "Go To" places when I feel the need to have some Vietnamese or just about anything asian cause it's all good, well actually the Pho is OK, not my favorite but just about everything else is really good.  The atomosphere is pretty chill.... It's a pretty big place but the service is fast and the food is always the way it should be.  My favorite is the shrimp/pork vermicelli bowls that they have... I think it's #24 on the menu, if you get a chance give it a try ;)  Also another thing I love about this place is that it's always open when I want to go, so another reason this is one of my "Go To" place for asian cuisine.

ZC2jUdCsNf-HxHnPQ21D6A.text: For a Vegas Vietnamese/Chinese restaurant, this place isn't too shabby.  Coming from the O.C., I'm used to some of the best Asian food that is cheap.  Prices here are a bit steep but I guess I don't mind eating here so I can take a break from all the other foods here.  Pho Dac Biet: mmm I like their noodles.  It's very nice and soft.  Okay meats.  Soup base was...not bad.  I felt the MSG a little bit past midway eating.  Plenty of veggies given (bonus!) and water is always provided :)  Overall, I would get it again.  But with a coke.  Walnut Shrimp: really good.  Not too oily.  Delicious caramelized and crunchy walnuts.  I love the fact that the shrimp was so plump!  YUM!  Clean and contemporary atmosphere.  Diligent service.  Will definitely come back. :D

v7e8FQLUx0Tr7waUVZdY3Q.text: I agreed with Marie T. Food is ok, but the service is definitely the WORST!!! We ordered wonton to share between my husband and myself as a soup for starter. The waiter brought out the wonton bowl as big as a "pho bowl", so I asked the waiter for a small soup or rice bowl to spilt the soup up. He said, "ok". So we waited and waited and waited... Nothing. Another waiter came by, I asked for the same thing...again nothing.

cFCfQaRZqPMm3qZz1t5maQ.text: The food here wasn't spectacular. I feel like I've had better pho back in LA. I guess it's a good break from all the Vegas food that one typically eats when visiting. I had the vermicelli noodles with BBQ pork and egg rolls. It was good but again, nothing amazing. We ordered egg rolls for appetizers too but I feel that they were a little expensive. It was 4 egg rolls for $6 or $7.   The service wasn't too great. It's the service you'd expect from an Asian restaurant. Impersonal and sometimes difficult to get the waiters' attention. They automatically charge a 18% gratuity for parties of 5 or more. That's a lot of tip for a small party. And I feel that they don't even do a lot to deserve that much tip. They take your order and serve your food. They don't refill your water automatically and they tend to ignore you if they can!

WjFQsQuHPxAhibSQOOrJqg.text: My first time trying Bun Bo Hue ever! Parking was easy, they have their own lot that is shared by other restaurants. The restaurant is very big and we were seated quickly. Service was a bit slow compared to the many employees that night. I felt like most of them tried really hard to avoid eye contact with their customers...I didn't like the Bun Bo Hue because it tasted kind of weird. Sort of like pho, but spicy... Their portions weren't big either. My bf and my dad had to order an additional rice plate to share and usually they don't need to when it comes to pho. Maybe it was a hit or miss. It was kind of pricey too. Perhaps, we should try another place for pho when we're in town.

nCFP9GnWRp8xPPUIR84pcA.text: I really enjoy this place. They are open until 3am, so every time I drive into Vegas, I stop by here for a 2am snack  :)   The second you sit down, they bring you water.  Love it! Order the combination pho, can't go wrong.  The waiter is ready to take your order as soon as you are ready, no waiting.  The food comes out within 5 minutes -- the portions are large,and the prices are great.  About 7 bucks for the pho.  Can't wait to go back the next time I drive into Vegas.

2zRz_OSQp41ie_9f984LLw.text: Great food. Absolutely HORRIBLE service, actually brought wrong food, didn't bring drinks at all, didn't fill waters even once, didn't clear dishes and didn't bring check.  They were not busy, the waiter just wanted to talk with his friends,  As my people say, NEVER AGAIN!

hmlnsDZJAvjImvkSFWeFwA.text: I guess it's "okay" vacation food...  Staff are nice and food came out pretty fast.  I had the wonton soup, beef cube steak and roast chicken rice noodles.  The wonton was very mediocre, the beef cube steak was barely acceptable and the roast chicken was rather dry.  One redeeming quality: the price tag isn't so high...especially compared to other eats in Vegas.  Will I be coming back to the restaurant on my next Vegas trip?  Probably not.

0XIsSgnKezU0q2aOwwDAgg.text: I would have never knew about this place if my friend hadn't introduced me. My friend Annalisa took my friends and I here since we wanted something cheap and something different than what was on the strip. It is in a little plaza in Chinatown. From the outside, it looked like a typical Vietnamese restaurant, but once I stepped inside it was totally different. It was very spacious and clean. I am very picky when it comes to Vietnamese food and I quite surprised when I came here. It was a little pricey, but the quality of food and the atmosphere made up for it.  My friends and I were greeted and seated immediately  upon arrival. As we were looking through the menu, I was very indecisive about which item to choose. Everything looked so good! I finally came to a decision and ordered the Hu Tieu. I was content with my decision. The bowl it came in looked very small and deceiving, but as I was working my way through the bowl I could not finish it. The broth was very clear and tasty. It was so appetizing that I kept wanting to eat more but my stomach couldn't hang.

pfs-kD8n4j54Vsh8wPM-0w.text: Love this place.  They have a good pho and they are open 24 hours hours.  Hello, pho at 5am = happy drunks! YES, PLEASE!

3-0pvp8Lhuf0071kESXvwQ.text: First time was bad, came back this morning and had the worse experience with this place. I ordered the biggest pho bowl there, and i swear it was a kid size bowl. Manager/owner (white button down shirt, shaved head) was extremely rude to customers. Worse of all, he humiliated his worker right in front of me..Bunch of horrible name callings. I refuse to come back to this place...!  Tourist beware...this place does not deserve your money...

WFSVASI_mpJwVOgw0yDYig.text: Man, what happened to this place? They remodeled and upped the prices to an uncomfortable amount. I can no longer get the under 20 for 2 deal I mentioned in the earlier review. The food is still the same good quality from before, but now I am hesitant to order anything but the main course.

Y6ai1MHHUzC8Xp5DhZbsHA.text: Starting to wonder if there's anything this place cant do.   My cousin told me about a crayfish place next to kim long he wanted to try out. Once we parked the car and looked at the sign we realized that it wasnt next to kim long...it's is kim long.  we both split 3 pounds of crayfish, they came out in two bowls so i'm guessing pound and a half each. Nicely spiced but HEAVY on the garlic which is a good thing i guess. Some of the seasonings were a bit on the heavy side but a swig from a corona fixes that real nice.   Only down side is when we were served the bowls weren't steaming hot they were just warm, but that could be considered a plus cause we didn't burn ourselves.   Just a personal thing but i'd like more sausage and potato chunks to bite into every once in a while and there's not enough in one bowl to make me happy.

S_s8SIDWkhPzWWybkEOIdw.text: HOLY NOODLE PARADISE!!! Best place to come for noodles of love and goodness at 4am. The place reminded me of a spot you would find in Brooklyn or Long Island which instantly made me feel like a hug from home. The noodles and broth are sooooo amazingly good and even though it was 94 degrees outside I didn't care. The noodle soupie was speaking to my soul. A MUST TRY when in Vegas and want to roll like a local.

u9zInBxNi7wV_dbw3xRcDQ.text: This place is awesome.  Food great.  Prices low.  Service attentive.  We got all the normal appetizers: spring rolls, egg rolls, crab rangoon, fried calamari... everything was awesome... especially the fried calamari which was flavored w/ salt and pepper and crispy garlic and scallions..... I got pho...standard stuff... everything everyone else got looked really good.  Service was great and the place was clean.

4-CBGGcx2HM9PEy-qfdxPA.text: I give this place 2 stars for their pho. The extra star is for its name.  Way back in January, I'm sitting on this shuttle bus that runs from the convention center to Rio, Palms, and Caesar's. The bus goes over the highway, and I happen to glance out the window at a billboard on my left side. "Pho Kim Long", I read, out loud. And proceed to giggle like a little girl. I think to myself, 'Pho King is a clever name, but Pho Kim Long is genius.'  Fast forward to the next day when we were hungry for dinner and not looking forward to the long drive back to LA. We couldn't think of anywhere to eat, and then all of a sudden that billboard flashed in my mind. We all agreed to go to Pho Kim Long, because with a name like that, you've got to at least try it. Sadly, the pho was very lacking in flavor and doesn't really deserve a 2nd try. Still, gotta give props for the name.

6nWcVEFD8cHUUSrmn5srVw.text: As a homegrown Las Vegas local, its sad to see where this place is now.   Before the 2 expansions, It was a excellent, hole-in-the-wall vietnamese restaurant. It was all the rave in town, constantly packed and everything about it was great. Great tasting hot broth and fresh vegetables and noodles.   Then, the expansion. It seems that all the owner is thinking about now is maximizing profit. Such is apparent by the reduction in overall quality and waitstaff. Pho broth is bland, food is overpriced in accordance to the price and the service is negligible. I do have to say however their Chinese food isn't half bad. Although I'd rather go to K.J. Kitchen for that.   Maybe I'm just being an elitist, or am still bummed that this place used to be so good. Nonetheless, this place is nothing more than average by far.   Ahh, then I discovered Saigon 8.

MBgIktQXBh3Jdwg2oqhraA.text: It was our arrival to Las Vegas from the grand canyon and my parents were super hungry. i could have gone for a hot dog. but you know some asian parents, don't like to try other things, olllld school.  yeah this places pho from what my parents say and my one spoonful was comparable to my own mothers. and man it was good. it was pretty pricey for pho but you know what, the ambience inside was very nice and classy, clean and cool, it didn't even smell like pho inside. [this is where you say OMG REALLY?] Yeah, REALLY.  So I wasn't feelin pho, but i should have but i got the chicken soft noodles, beef soft noodles, and fried rice and shared with my siblings.  The fried rice was SUPER bland, and the noodle dishes didn't have that savoriness to it that you expect form most asian noodle dishes.  the pho and ambience saved its rating how ever, the other dishes messed them up.  OH! and the bathroom is nice and clean! [You know i love my clean bathrooms!]

sqr6OA_BCj78BmF1OGp0ig.text: Pretty decent.  Has a lot of selection and not your typical pho only shop.    Pho wa pretty good and hit the spot as that's what I was craving. Wife had a bun vermicelli noodle. She said meeting was not that great.   The appetizer of garlic calamari was pretty good   All in all nice break from expensive spots on the strip

_V4D3u1yiA3GsA40mNATaA.text: Pho Broth was goooooooood. It could even be considered a bit salty but I loved it. The spring rolls are delish. The Pho and rolls are spot on. Even better the late night hours to accommodate the Vegas lifestyle. I have been twice. Like it a whole lot. Fast service. Water always refilled promptly. Nothing to complain about at all. Clean establishment. Friendly professional service. I'm hooked and telling everybody about it!!

-UR0cGQ1MXaHrQvZ3mwyvw.text: thanks for the tip, yelp!  nice decor (especially impressive for a pho restaurant!), open 24 hrs, and, most importantly, yummy pho (tasty, rich broth, perfectly chewy noodles, fresh veggies). this place was so good my vietnamese mom, who is a pho expert, expressed her approval!  other non-pho dishes were waay too oily. the noodle dish we ordered was shiny and there was a pool of oil at the bottom of the plate... and the chinese donuts were overly crunchy, missing that slightly sweet and chewy flavor that i love, and also dripping with oil.   i'd definitely go back for the pho, but would probably discourage being too adventurous with their other menu offerings :)

q75Xn_wi0zyf15pGziT2IA.text: They're pho is very fast food tasting and their service is terrible. They're rude and kind of racist especially when bringing people not Asian. They mess up orders for them or don't even bother to write down their order. I used to like the place, but when I saw discrimination and prejudice towards people I brought with me...I stopped going. They don't deserve my business.

sIchOqbR9qEWZmkyNwqtBQ.text: The food here is photastic :-P service is a little slow, but the soup comes out quickly! The place is always busy, but they seat your party in a timely manner. The price is reasonable and best of all its open late!

XO6f0qVgw-HvLKmDpV4mdQ.text: Never liked pho till I had it here. Not the greatest service or the fanciest place but definitely worth it!!!! can't wait to go back

EUayv89z-8GD_LJDxVe2kQ.text: Excellent place to grab a bite to eat.  Even when they are on a wait, you get seated quickly.  Reasonably priced food makes eating here easier on your wallet.  Some of my favorites are the seasoned rice, chicken teriyaki, pork chops, pho tai, Singapore noodles, and egg rolls.  They are open late which is convenient.  Quick and friendly service.

xLa99zj2hL1tDNam3ElAvQ.text: Food was ok, it came out fast & hot, only issue I had with that is that it all came out at different times. Service, ehhhhh not so much. Server forgot my husbands drink and by the time we saw him again to remind him my husband was already done with his dinner. The server was none too apologetic about it either. It seems like the staff there just wants to get you in and out. I too work in a restaurant and completely understand the need for quick turnovers however customer service needs to remain a top priority.  O and on a side note....honeydew smoothie, coconut smoothie & Thai tea were amazing!

8zM_FnodRF7feXMScIc6tQ.text: Came here for the 1st time a few weeks ago and have been back many times since then. The orange chicken, spring rolls, crab wontons, and Mongolian beef are some of my favorite dishes. Food comes out hot, fresh and quick. The fact that it's open 24/7 is amazing and convient. I always order my food to go so I have not had the chance to review the dining service. Food is A+, as a local that works at a casino I would 100 % suggest this place to my guests.

6PUvHw46kDMFrkisle2lAQ.text: Go to place after late night lounging in Vegas. The Pho's are the stars but honestly everything is excellent here. Open 24 hours, service is always good, and the food is always consistent. You will be happy here.

xa9xPwcZV4YftwjjOORXqw.text: My husband and I fought over the bun ho hue here.  It's fun to people watch in the morning with the clubbers still wearing their outfits from the night before. It's a great 24/7 place to recover from your Vegas trip.

d07aYILffz_ZlhC5U2cx-A.text: My favorite place!! Open 24-7 and get whatever you want!! Sometimes super long wait in the late hours, and once you get your food it's hard to get someone to come by. But good is hot and great comes pretty fast. I love how they have waters ready for you cause sometimes you're just dying of thirst!! Pho Kim long eggrolls are legit!! Get them every time!!

KSbbAlIXMFbfDiB__rPnJQ.text: Good selection.  Pho is great.  Open 24/7.  Always busy but never crowded.  Leave the PF Changs in Summerlin.

28WB7mXOybsyDKqeltBUuQ.text: Honestly, I don't understand the hype of this place or the giant lines.  Yes, the place is very pretty and absolutely the service is very good, but the food?  Meh.  The first time I went there was a couple of years ago for lunch and it was very good - delicious pho.  Went for dinner with a bunch of friends more recently and the quality was just not there.   I thought it was just okay.  Pho wasn't entirely hot when I got it, which was disappointing. As others have mentioned, some foods taste like they were bought pre-packaged and not made in house. One of my companions is Vietnamese and came from a family of caterers, to boot.  He ripped the place a new one over the food - spices were off, dishes were not done properly, etc.  I was genuinely disappointed as I love all kinds of Asian food and wanted to really like this place.  Unfortunately, I think they've gotten a little big for their britches, they know folks are going to show up no matter what and just are phoning it in now.   Now when I want pho I go down a few doors to Fat Dumpling - great pho with all fresh ingredients, no ridiculously long lines, and better price.

ZILK891N6wOOObkqdfyXLw.text: We came here on fourth of July day at around 8am. When we got here the restaurant was pack and there was a waiting less. The wait for about 15 minutes which was fine. This place is nicely decorated with I think two fish tank. One once you enter and the other is on the right side on the reaturant by the round tables. The food was actually pretty good. Can't complain. This phoresturant sits in a plaza with Lee's sandwiches, hair salon and some other store.

7Wu3d6Bp7kJWy9zj5_vXbA.text: Benz is the greatest! He remembers exactly what me and my boyfriend order every time I come in after work and pick up food to take home. I get honey garlic pork chops just ask for extra sauce because sometimes they tend to cook on the dry side.

ghAls4D1sCngtZ3n3uH1qw.text: Ok I do come here often after a club but their service sucks they always bring one person their food and make someone wait like 10 mins later it just doesn't make sense

Bhsm91pqB9MrCTZQWzeHeQ.text: The best pho! Its phobulous! Super over priced. Great atmosphere. And yummmy!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Bo hue with flat noodles
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Bo Hue with flat noodles.

a6cjfUI8jk4UqbJHPFv_kQ.text: Pretty yum.  They were short on everything because it was EDC weekend, but the dishes tasted authentic and were satisfying

Aq16HeXzj_2cnhKIhTFQ6g.text: Yummy, ample portions and great variety.  Good sized restaurant open 24/7.  The staff was attentive and the food great.  Great deal, we left stuffed.  Had two appetizers, dishes and beverages.  Would go back again.  Not for those with tiny stomachs.

RxW8lJSK7-br8vNEMEBb5g.text: I love this Place! im from LA. But every time when im in Las Vegas im visiting thig place. Pho is very delicious!

mE7gDvhATfB2efTcaP5KJg.text: One of the best drunk foods there is... as long as you have a DD.  Certainly not the best pho of my life or even Chinatown, LV. But for being open late, serving up some decent pho at an ok price ($8-9 a bowl), and for being open on New Year's! Solid 4 stars.   And remember kids... the drunker you are, the better it tastes. As an added bonus, you'll feel less hungover the next morning too.

ayLYIcoBe0NCTH8sbnZHnQ.text: Tried their bun bo hue and it was disgusting. The soup wasn't hot when it came, and I think there might have been too many fatty pieces of meat in there, but I felt nauseous after eating it. It wasn't spicy enough (I actually think it wasn't spicy at all), and was really flavorless. Only redeeming quality to this place is the hours.

5d-GNkYMWOycQTA-ZHf3lg.text: I always thought the name of this place was extremely funny I always thought shouldn't be called for her long laugh out loud five stars did a good

l2kkLNyD4iV1HotsfJ8Byw.text: A bit on the pricey side compared to other Chinese-Vietnamese restaurants I've been to, but hey this is Nevada and the selection for authentic Asian food is relatively low.   Had the vermicelli with shrimp, eggrolls and BBQ pork. I recommend.   Service was just alright, not that memorable. I remember it took forever for the food to come out. We were a party of about 10, but they just kept us waiting forever while I was famished. I just wanted me some good Vietnamese food in my tummy.. :(

XFwntqL8MWex-GsF6_QSkA.text: I think I will attempt another review "in progress" had a good session at Wynn after waiting 2 hours for a seat. Was driving home and realized I had barely eaten all day. Decided to give this place a try on the recommendation of a friend. There was a line at 1 am on Sunday! (Well technically Monday) in line people were raving about the food. The smell was making me insane. So good. I loved the sparse simple decor. The line went fast and they have all my fav Vietnamese food on the menu. Fresh rolls with amazing peanut sauce, made me really happy. Deep fried tofu tasted like deep fried butter, which to me is heaven. And the Pho... Yes the pho! Perfect. I will sleep well tonight. Then tomorrow I will thank my friend for the suburb recommendation.

CRaxGIFG1yWM92XEbscmCA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! ... when they served roasted duck noodle soup.  It used to be my go-to spot after clubbing.  Oh well.

3eMfhFaIzplUbZb-Omy6hw.text: If you are a vegas regular , love vietnamese food, hungover and do not want to overpay for food on the strip go to PHO KIM LONG!  The interior of this place is suprisingly "classy" inside (as compared to your hole in the wall pho place) and how can the name of this place keep you away?

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bun!

HVjMp89QJiKBt_KkEn4MYg.text: Everybody loves it every single person that I know who comes to Vegas love that it is the number one restaurant for a reason this place is amazing I always get number 13 and I got a coconut Boba there's no reason not to come here it is delicious from start to beginning and is open till very late at night

Hfxvsd1HH0ZGGhW29vpDQw.text: The food was alright, but the service...not so much AT ALL.  We came in here with a group of 7 (they add on 17%  gratuity to the bill for groups of 5 or more). They sat us at a big round table and we had to wait about 20 minutes just to get our orders taken. We got the food pretty fast, but we were completely ignored after that. One of the girls in the group literally had to walk up to one of the workers just so she could order another order of eggrolls since no one was going back to our table. That second order of eggrolls probably took about 30 minutes to get to the table, which made no sense at all considering the first order only took like 5 minutes. After we were all done and waiting there for a longtime for someone to give us our check, we had to go up and ask the cashier for it, so they finally dropped it off at our table. Even after we put the money down on it, we still had to walk up to the cashier to give it to him.  I have no idea wth was up with this place. We were the biggest group there and not one server was attending to us. This place wasn't exactly full either.   Again, the food was okay, but the service was pretty bad.   Will not come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4D7YOlSJlZ5H4uPK_Hy4yA.text: If you're in the mood for some delicious Pho then you found the right spot. Great prices and they are open 24 hours. I had the #15 beef pho and a side of crab ragoons. AMAZING!  My new favorite place.

ngxC5T9uk7Zw_BBlZGUJqQ.text: I absolutely love this place! HUGE selection. HUGE portions. Everything is very fresh and the customer service is great - the food comes out quickly and I never need to ask for a drink refill. My only complaint is that it's always very crowded and the tables are very close together - it leaves me feeling a little bit claustrophobic.  And it's a bit loud, also. Not great of you're looking for a place for conversation, but I absolutely recommend it for a fun night out with friends :)

rYpPkAAcY6M3eRbrw8wVhg.text: Zero star for service and 2.5 for yhe food. Food is not bad here. Pho is good. Wontons are good but soup it comes in has too much msg and salt so not so good. The fried rice taste ok but too oily. Service is horrible. They only give bare minimal service like a taco bell except taco bell still has better service. They have really stuck up attitudes. And their price is about ten bucks for noodle dishes which is a bit on the high side. Decor is nice.

dTNBbIsi9pyVEAowdFcyFw.text: Service and the food are ok only. But the guy that collect the money (cashier) are so rude and no smile. I mean... If we don't understand why is there an extra charge of corse we will ask. That guy gave me a big attitude and ask me " than what you order" I repeat my order and he say "that what we charge you." That do not answer y I'm paying extra and especially with a big attitude.

tpgySEHnoXd7kxigUHq__A.text: Taste was good, the beef didn't cook through in broth. I guess they were just too busy to serve hot pho or they don't need more customers.

297idi0hbM351ZPbu9ubfg.text: Pho Kim Long, Vietnamese with a Chinese menu.  I've been to PKL a thousand times. Nine times out of ten, its 4 am and I'm really drunk. They're 24 hours and one of the few affordable restaurants close to the strip. But seriously though, food is supposed to taste better when your drunk, isn't it?  PHO: Sometimes my soup comes a little greasy. On occasion, noodles are under-cooked and I feel like their beef and other fillings could use some improvement. Also, pho is served with "rare steak." So why is my beef tai 100% cooked when it gets to the table?  CHINESE: I came here a lot with someone who didn't like Vietnamese food. He ordered off the Chinese menu because lets face it, who doesn't like Chinese food? The seafood combination pan-fried noodles and the beef stir fry with broccoli are pretty good. Entrees are usually served with steamed rice. The fried rice here is flavorless and not worth the $8. If you like Mapo Tofu, skip the mapo tofu here, it tastes strange!  APPETIZERS: Spring rolls are pretty good. But they're raw and  you drench them in peanut sauce--can't mess those up. Egg Rolls taste good but they're unusually small... For the same price, I can get decent size ones down the street at my favorite pho joint.   CREDIT CARD FRAUD: A day or two after one visit, I realized I never got my card back from the server. When numerous fraudulent charges came up, I had to assume a shady server swiped my card. They ordered things online and sent them to a local address. PAY CASH. Can't trust shady asians.  SERVICE: The service sucks. It's god awful and when you really need water, don't expect them to give it to you on their own. Don't be shy, flag someone down and demand what you need.  Nothing to rave about but not a bad place to eat when your wasted and in desperate need of food.  Don't forget to RATE & FOLLOW! ;)

HBxj30N3Qq1byCj4_ayMVg.text: Food is getting worse and worse every time I came. I get very disappointed even though this is nice place. :((

za9Tt5ME_U5ksBdycy_NuQ.text: Def my favorite Pho' restaurants in Vegas!!! I love this place! It's open always and the food is hot, plenitful and Delicious!  I sometimes get entrees, and they are always great, but my all time most ordered is the Pho'... I sometimes order it with the egg noodles for a different taste. Both fantastic. Hope to see you there sometime! :)

FSewIAi1i2FFihRN3SRxlw.text: The service sucked and it wasn't that busy when we arrived.  Appetizer came out on time, but they forgot about our main entree.  We asked 3 different waitresses(nobody checked on us, we had to track them down) and they said they would go check but never did. Waited 30mins for our main entree after our appetizer.

kvXhWAfQ0P0yhcNI3nIAXw.text: Haven't been to this place for a while but finally decided to eat here since this place is open 24/hrs. The host was friendly but after being seated we waited about 5min to have our waters served and another 10min for someone to take our orders.. The main person I was concerned about every time I come with friends is the guy that is always at the register. He is very rude and gives you a smug look every time we ask if we can split our checks. He never speaks to you and is always in a rush to get your money so you and your party can leave.. No "have a good night" or a simple "bye". Food was mediocre and unpleasant and found a piece of plastic wrap in my food. Never coming here again.

Gui4HFjmXTJfkypNXHFpUg.text: The food and service here is really good. I ordered #25 from the menu, with a boba Thai tea, it was delicious. I loved how fast i got seated, and served. I will keep coming back. Highly recommended!

MxvFexk9TX7DYD7YX3DNMw.text: This place is always busy, dirty, and the customer service can be a hit or miss. I keep coming back though. I do like their food. They now give you options of a small or regular sized bowl of pho. They've got a good amount of menu items to choose from as well.

M5TQjBdBm_Cz_aZUcSb9vg.text: Had to try.  Everyone was talking about this 24 hour pho Kim long. Pho was really good.  Wait time was way off when we signed in. You put ur name on a piece a paper.  It seemed like if u didn't pay attention to the list u will be waiting for awhile.  They were not organized when u walk in.  But once u sit and put in a order they are fast.  I would go back just because food was good.  I think they should have better system when it's time to check in.   Try to say "pho Kim long" really fast 5 times and let me know how it sounds!!    Haha.  Enjoy pho? Gotta try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wait is long but they move fast

sfNi-QSwI7kgQzhBqLiuTg.text: Food wasn't that great. I guess it's because I'm from SF, where we have the best and most authentic Vietnamese food. We came here for lunch while we were in Vegas and just wanted something outside of the casinos. I ordered the Pho Ga (chicken noodle soup) and it tasted really bland. We also had the Spring rolls which was just ok. Pho is always based on how good the soup is, and the soup here was not authentic at all. It tasted more like msg mixed with water and it tasted really fake.   It's cool that this place is so close to the strip (driving) and a good place to get some soup if you have a hangover, but as a meal? Neh....

BI8UvMHkTPn1pjjenTc3hQ.text: I saw the sign stated that they are the best, that's why we had to come and try, the Pho flavor was ok, not so good to drag about, not even compare to Pho 79 in Westminster, CA. ONE THING its annoyed me that the waitress and the owner i think (older dude with spiky hair) hung around the font and had  aloud conversation since we came in and after we left. The customers sitting on 4 tables around us so quiet eating because they  were talking so loud about non-sense shit. They were ruining everyone peaceful breakfast morning.  We didn't come back next few days, we avoided them and went to another Pho  Restaurant for our breakfast down the road. (For the waitress: Xau  ma\ con\ dong phim ac!!!

1iF5gmAsb67wGpxviqFIog.text: Food portion was disappointing for the price $10 / bowl). And service / attitude was horrible.   Have been here many times over the years. Taste is not bad. Still pretty good. But, everything else is horrible. For those reasons I can't get myself to give them even a 2 star for good taste and thumbs down on everything else. 1 star is what I felt was deserved.   Let's see, where do I start: 1. Was rudely greeted as we walked in. We had an infant with us so I had to roll the stroller and etc. we were following her as close as she would've liked i guess, so she kept hurrying us and waving In a rude way. And by the way, the restaurant was half empty so it wasn't busy.   2. We ordered pho and bun bo hue. This is the saddest part. Just a giant bowl of soup. Each of our bowl had 4 slices of meat, that was so small it was probably shredded from one piece of meat.   3. That wasn't the worst part with our food, that the meat was almost non-existent. Worst part was when we couldn't find the noodles in the giant bowl of soup. We almost called them over that they forgot to put noodles in there before my wife said she found it, the barely 3-4 fully chopstick grip full of noodles. With so little noodles swimming in a giant bowl of soup, it was quite annoying because you only get a few strands with each grab. So annoying.  There are many other great pho restaurants around the area now a days. For cheaper. Skip pho Kim long. This place went to shit.

bIgnM_7ZMexbmIBoRP0F-g.text: Diminishing quality over time, they jack up their price and also forced us to pay a 15% tip and told us that it is mandatory. I also saw instances of the owner and/or cashier writing tip without asking the customer if they're paying with card. The food quality is average but the altitude of the owner is horrible. I'm not recommending this place.

HETOAiZo5p81xl1aZRhcVg.text: This place seemed like a decent place my coworker recommended we go to eat after our shift. We arrive and the waiter came to drop off waters and hurried away from our table, without saying nothing. Didn't bother us until we got to order food and he seemed to want nothing but to leave our table ASAP. We thought it was strange but didn't bat an eye. Didn't see him again until he dropped off our food. No one came to check on our drinks or ask how was the food, which I though was odd as it's almost customary for a waiter/server to do for any table. Still yet we weren't too thrilled about the service. After finishing our food he came back again and silently gave us the check and ran off again. Once we got to the cashier to pay for our food they almost seemed to insist that we left no less than a 20% tip. My coworkers weren't happy with the service but I understand sometimes people have their bad days so I paid the 15% tip on my part of the bill even though the cashier circled the 20-30% tip part on the receipt and pointed it out to me. For me that really irritated me once I only left tip for my part of the check but that wasn't what totally left me in disgust. After seeing what I tipped which was $3 on a $20 bill with bad service THE CASHIER SCOFFED AND SHOOK HIS HEAD AT ME. I took back my receipt and scratched off my tip part. I gave the bad service a few passes but that was the final straw. I get people have their off days that's why I still decided to tip despite the subpar service but you want to shake my head at me after not tipping the crazy amount you WANT vs what you DESERVED? I rate the food 7/10 but if you come eat here PLEASE don't tip unless you get a fantastic waiter who knows how to do their job and please their guest and knows how to do the BARE MINIMUM. As far as the restaurant is concerned check your staff cause most of them can't do the bare minimum and expect some $100 tip HA

lvKT-UelfmlDFUIfv5akLA.text: I would not recommend a friend to eat here. The poor service does not make up for the mediocre food they have. Today my family and I decided to go and eat here for lunch. The waitress who served us didn't ask what kind of beverages we'd like and just gave us water. Plus throughout eating she never bothered to check on our drink if we needed a refill. Then portions are fairly small and not worth the amount you pay for. After eating here and getting ready to pay for our check we still leave a tip for the lack of service we got, we left $6 for a $30 check. When we get to the register the cashier demands we leave at least a $10 tip. Never have I had such poor service and a demand for a bigger tip. Not worth the waste of time and money. Definitely never going back.

yLQNs64XflkbQAu6vPU-nA.text: Was recommended to try this place out so i did the food was good but had my doubts about eating it cause the front entrance was dirty, i worry about what the back of the house looks like if the front of the house is not up to par. The staff is very friendly and nice.

szBSRvCBIjRwIUB7AWO8dQ.text: I recall a time when Pho Kim Long used to be great before they expanded.  Expanding doesn't always mean the best thing.   The best thing I could say about the place was how fast I was sat and how attentive the servers were with filling my water. That's always a hot button for me at restaurants. How attentive servers are to my table. That's one of the signs of great service for me. The small details count.  I ordered the shrimp spring rolls. Sauce was very congealed. The noodles inside melded into one thick strand that was not very  appetizing or pleasing but had to eat because 1. I was hungry and 2. I didn't want it to go to waste.   The pho I ordered was good. Not the best.  The most off putting thing to me was at the very end. I went to the bathroom and it was trashed. The garbage was over filled with used paper towels. Seems like someone forgot to do their cleaning duties that night. Just because it was late night doesn't mean the employees should slack on their duties.

0ISv1zZxP5KVa4RixNVyrw.text: I went there 4 days ago with my friend around midnight . It was our first time for this restaurant. Their service was almost very good , when we were at the table and we got a very good service with some guy wearing the gray t-shirt , he asked us about where we are from and talked a little bit about our country that we were born. That's a nice conversation !!! And also the foods were very good and yummy !! After we finished eating , we had some guy wearing the black t-shirt and his face was like he was always getting angry someone took bill for us and his service was so bad ,he treated us like we weren't a customer !!! I may go back again because of food not a service !!!

T8ol-7nFgrFAfBos5oi5Og.text: So this will be my updated review. On my past review I said that this was the best place to go to after a late night party or clubbing.  I went here for dinner on a week day with my mom who was visiting. Servers are rude and totally do not accomodate to what you want to order. My mom wanted this seafood soup which came with vermicelli noodles, she just asked if she can have half vermicelli and half yellow noodle and the server said NO. Flat out NO they don't do that there. Their bean sprouts looked old and were soggy.  I don't think I will ever come back.

iUL9jU_QwOodwL-Z7vMHNQ.text: So anyone in Vegas understands this is a perfect spot for late nights. Do not go there on a Thursday night. I just had definitely one of the worst experiences there.   You can tell how they divided the tables and one side were the drunk leftovers from the club. The smaller side were just regular people ready to dine. I went there after picking my girlfriends mom up from her late swing shift. We get there around 4 AM. No crowd but the security guard actually seats us which was fine.   We sit down and were given menus. My girlfriends mom waves to her coworker that also just got off work. We were finally given some water and looking at the menu and after about 10 minutes we are finally asked if we're ready and sadly we weren't. So he said "Okay" no customer service with a take your time yadiyadiya... just left. Then comes this solo diner that sits next to us. After about 5 minutes of him waiting he was upset and walked over to the security guard. Security guards asked if he would like to start with appetizers. Guy replies "no I just want to order, number 13" blam.  Done deal. He places the order and security guard comes back to us asking if We'd like "fast" appetizers and sorry for the wait because they're back up... which is believable but.. I know for a fact they weren't. The same guys that were ready to take our order saw us. We figured okay maybe they think we're still pondering our great options at pho kim long. No we want pho homie. It's simple. Surpringly our spring rolls came out just minutes after ordering. At the same time our solo diner already had his food but tells the server "you guys forgot my drink and napkin".. they didn't apologize because they knew they didn't want to serve him as it seemed he was a "regular"  We sat there with our empty plates and half empty glasses of water. The guy who supposedly wanted to take our order then starts to clean up the table that was next to ours and the girlfriends mothers coworkers said a peep and he walked over, placed there order. Right after that the solo diner was done he paid and left. Before we even had a chance to order. The guy cleans up and another guy basically asked how much and he said zero. And the employees seemed a bit off.  Now everything was cool it seemed fine until after our meal. Sure I can understand horrible service for people who always have to deal with drunk leftovers from the club... but you sat us on a side with regular people just waiting to dine. We asked for a to go box and the check. I work in the tipping industry and understand we should tip. At least. As for restaurant tipping I truly believe that is based on the customer service we received.. I felt like we didn't get any.. so do they deserve any? Sure. I gave them 3 dollars. I felt generous. I usually double the tax but for this I kept it as is.   I walk up to the cashier and pay with card. He rips off the first receipt and says it very bluntly "choose one" and circles the tipping options and stares at me. I say "no thank you I already tipped you cash." So he immediately steps back and calls on the "radio" which was clipped to his shirt but says very loudly where the restaurant can hear "get the money from table 6" and the guy responds "Okay I got It" cashier responds "What?" And no longer using their little walkie talkies they said 3. And everyone was like "THREE?!" I didn't realize it at the time because I spent an hour waiting for food it was 5 am. I was tired and ready to go home. It was just completely rude.   If they wanted a generous tip they should have given top notch customer service to sober people versus kissing ass to a bunch of drunk idiots who more than likely gave them a stiff. It's a common spot to go here and I've never experienced customer service like this before. Only quality thing they had there was security.. so if you want late night food/pho with a high chance to see a fight(why else is there a security guard at a restaurant) go to pho kim long.  Smh.

NFCsEPTgOu8ZRXmEOyDMJg.text: If you care not about customer service than this place is for you. They get pretty busy at times so they just rush you in and out. Because of their poor customer service I think most customers stiff them on tips which is totally understandable once you been here. Not sure if their poor attitude is due to bad tips, or they get bad tips because of their poor attitude.

fmpaHJTm-YPrWwIONT_6cw.text: I had the bun bo hue and my friend had the combo Pho. We split the spring rolls which were clearly premade since the rice paper wrap was a bit chewy from sitting around. They were nothing like the picture in the menu. Reminds me of McDonald's menu pictures.   I tried the pho broth and it was just ok. His pho came out in less than 2 minutes, that along with the spring rolls. Out waters came out after...... if that tells you something.  I tried the bun bo hue broth and it tasted exactly the same as the pho. I about got up and left and probably would have if I was by my self. They give you a side of the seasoning to add to the broth which is just plain lazy. If they don't know how to make one of Vietnam's traditional soups then just leave it off the menu instead of embarrassing yourself.  Only reason I came here was because it was a 24hr joint. If you want good Vietnamese food go to pho khan do down the street during regular hours.

xIkJEObUv9jnjES7EXd7zQ.text: How can you not go pho a restaurant by any other name than Pho Kim Long?  Been coming here for the past several years...lunch, dinner, business trip meals. and most often, after clubbing, hehehe. Not on the strip, but worth the little trip to China town.   I always order combination pho, but I have on occasion, partaken in the pan fried noodle dish, I forget what it was called.  The pho is good enough to satisfy my craving; the broth is pretty good(before I add in all my extras) and the fixins are fresh.   Service has always been pretty good here, so no complaints there.  PKL can get pretty busy late night, so I expect service to take a step back due to the stress of the volume of people, more of them drunk and crazy, coming in and out during those times.   Parking can be pretty chaotic; so I would almost always opt for a cab if it's within your means. It's china town, so you know it'll be crazy, even during weekly lunches. Which is again why I would choose not driving if possible.

LF9hBKqVcnkhUV-rsiZiuw.text: 4.5 stars  When craving for pho, Pho Kim Long is the place to go to. Just a few miles off the strip, this place is not at all hard to get too.   We were seated pretty quickly. I ordered the #18 chicken pho. And my god, if I had a glimpse of heaven, this would be it. The chicken pho was on point like a freshly opened exacto knife. The chicken was good. The broth was perfect. I usually order the beef pho with the special tendons and tripe but this time my cousin and I were really feelin the chicken pho. I'm glad we made this decision. Service was as expected. Just like other pho places. They serve you, you eat, and your group leaves. The pho bowls range from $8-$10. Not bad at all if this is what will revive you from the dead. Or put you on the right tracks of bringing life back to your body.   In conclusion, I was very happy with my meal. I felt like a zombie from the walking dead, eating like there was no tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pho with Thai tea. Bomb

fubMHa9Rf3QCtY3l2z7o-A.text: This is my go to place when Im craving a late night meal! This place is an amazing 24/7 restaurant, super close to the strip, right by Chinatown.  Few things to keep in mind.  1. On weekends it does get pretty packed, so don't be surprised if there is a 20 minute wait.  2. Customer service is lacking half of the time, depends on the staff working that shift, just be nice to the staff and call them if you need something. (COMMON CURTESY) 3. Repeat the full order at least once to make sure you get exactly what you want. Sometimes there is a language barrier, once again, so be courteous.  Personally I am not a HUGE fan of the Pho, depending on how busy it may be, but everything else on the menu is fair game. The size of the entree is relatively big for me so I tend to share with who ever I am with, and the prices of most of the meals are under $15. Defiantly a go place to after a long night out with friends.  Personal recommendation-  Fresh springs rolls for appetizer with delicious peanut sauce Drunken noodles or Pad Thai for entree (I like it with chicken) Thai Tea.... because I just love tea :]

jCe9pmNQSBf0Hc7fYVN9Fg.text: Don't get the hype around this place.  We got 2 bowls of pho...the broth wasn't even hot. My bean sprouts were still raw by the end.  Soup flavor was just ok. Noodles normal.

vicaE1S866QKFHV8dA631Q.text: Terrible service.    The whole experience was bad.  The final straw for me was when they brought me a two bills. One for the food i ordered and the other for the refill for my pepsi.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PmTzRMcpmpjonkSH5dEDmw.text: Everything absolutely everything here is a most try !! The pho the house fried ricee soo yummy and the pho kim long egg rolls wow just wow so freaking good ill order like 3 sets like so good the good service they take ur order real fast even if its busy the food will get there no long then 15 mins thats why i love this place is actually my favorite place to eat :)

u-MSnxkwA5e3mwl2jYkMtQ.text: I came with a group of nine people around 6pm on a Monday night and it was pretty busy. Our party came in separate cars. One of the servers was seemed very short with us. Repeatedly asking us how long when I had told him that the rest of our party had just parked and they were walking in right then.  We ordered our food and didn't receive our drinks until after some of us had been served, which was my first disappointment. We also had to ask three times for extra condiments for our table before someone had brought it to us. When the food came out, my boyfriend had ordered a Pho Tai Chin and our server took our order wrong and forgot the chin (brisket) and then offered to add it on the side. When our bill came out, he had charged us an extra $2.50 for it even though it was his mistake that he took the order wrong. We asked him about it and he said that it would've came out to the same price and I just double checked and he didn't and he actually charged us extra.  I had ordered bun bo hue and for $9.50 a bowl (over priced to me), it was really disappointing and bland even after dumping all of the extra mam ruoc into it and squeezing lemon into it.   After coming up to pay the bill, the cashier charged us $3 when the check had said $2.50 for the extra side of brisket and when my boyfriend had told him that he was wrong he still charged us $3. We were so done with the service that we just paid it. More than one person was rude to us and I will not be returning. It was over priced, we were charged extra for mediocre Vietnamese food. Busy or not there's no excuse for rudeness.

fFW7inmVPfYJ2ixi-sx9XA.text: First time come here ...   1. Bad service and attitude ...( minus 1 star ) 2. Dirty rice everywhere on floor.( minus 1 star ) 3. Pho is good but i order honey garlic pork chop soo mushy , crispy calamari with tomato pste as a dipping ?!? ( minus 2 stars )  4. There is an egg shell on my wife sunny side up egg ... ( any star should i take off ?!? )   I might not coming back if they dont do any change

PVCmkME33HiFbCIMK67jsg.text: this is actually the second time I have eaten here and each experience has been wonderful fast and friendly service the food comes out very quickly and very hot! We got the chicken egg rolls which were absolutely delicious and shared a small combo pho, only thing we were missing was sauces on our table but the very friendly table next to us was willing to share so a very pleasant experience indeed  Very nice ambiance and beautiful art work all around
