sX0JcWFY1bMGC_1yQkL4KA.text: Ehh. Ordered the house special noodles with beef, chicken and shrimp. Also ordered an order of spring rolls and a watermelon boba. They are a bit expensive and also my noodles in the spring rolls are undercooked. Not cool. And the house special noodles were extra extra crispy and I'm not talking about the good crispy either. LOL. The upside is that it's open 24 hours which is really cool.

BjZhBRotBj_rMrnzhFH78Q.text: i was the first time came to Las Vegas,I was so hugely when I arrived this resturant,I feel bad when I arrived,bad service,late food and bad food,I don't want to came again.

3ufaNOzzroHXyAw_w6T40A.text: HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE experience for my family and I when we ate there.   We had a total of 11 people, so they had to split us up (we weren't allowed to move the tables closer together). So the breakdown was 5 people at one table (the table I was a part of) and 6 at the other. My table only had a total of 3 orders (I shared with another and one of us wasn't hungry, but just wanted to hang out). Anyways, in the end they combined our orders (even though we were at separate tables and weren't able to talk to each other). As a result, the imposed gratuity was much more expensive. I walked up and complained that they should split up the order into two separate transactions. They gave me attitude since I was adamant about it. WHEN MY TABLE GOT OUR RECEIPT OF JUST 3 ORDERS, THEY STILL CHARGED US GRATUITY!!!! I was at my breaking point but my friends persuaded me to let them go.   Other nuisances: - Some people at the table ate there before. They have always had pickled onions. This time when we asked for them, the waiters claimed that the restaurant never had them. Liars. - My cousin asked if they had different sizes and they said, "No." Later on, he found out that his friend was able to order a small. Liars.  I reside in Little Saigon, California. All I can say is that the food is mediocre for the price offered (around $6-8). Here, a delicious bowl of pho could sell for $4 for a large.  As a result, for mediocre food that's a little bit too pricey compared to other pho places, the disgraceful service just tops it all for being BLACKLISTED on my list of "Restaurants That Aren't Worth It."

4Vw68et96jjRdBFdVW1VrQ.text: We order the ca to canh chua and it wasn't all that. The chicken porridge was crap as they used frozen chicken breast and not the free range kind. It was late so we thought to give this place a try and boy what a friggin mistake. We should have gone to Bubba Gump!!!!. Oh well our lost and their gain. Also what with the 15% to 20% tips on the check. You are viet restaurant and we tip you however we feel like.

7TeSYr8uV8HupPVk7bcmNA.text: Pho Kim Long is my go-to for Pho and Bun. I live in Henderson - which is a road trip to Spring Mountain but the food is so good and every Sunday after basketball games at Tark, my family heads to PKL to get our Vietnamese fix. I can't get my boys (2 &6 yrs old)  to eat anything but burgers or pizza but they LOVE, LOVE , LOVE the Pho. The only downer is the customer service. Asian establishments are notorious for horrible service and each time we go this is the case. The past Sunday was the worst. My son dropped his toy and when he went to go pick it up -  what looked like the Manager came over and scolded my son and then told me not to let my children run around! He was up for 2 seconds! It was really rude and could have been addressed in a more professional manner. Because of this incident I might have to look for a new Pho spot.... .

NiXDSJBEXlXTg8QegBwkCA.text: Pho Kim Long may not look special on the outside but once you open the doors you'll see the nice earthy decoration and will be greated immediately with a smile.  Service is fast and the place is always clean.  The menu has a variety of Pho and other types of yummy foods. There tofu spring roll with peanut sauce is creamy and delicious.  Hong Kong style pan fried noodles with beef, bok choy and carrots #57 is my favorite!  The food is always fresh and the place is always busy.  This is one of my favorite noodle houses in Vegas.  Oh before I forget another cool thing about this place - it's open 24 hours!  How cool is that!  Oh and another plus is this restaurant listens to 98.5 KLUC!  Whoo-Hoo!

mgCXcjMGU5iw8eQa5OqDSw.text: The real deal...it's my "Lotus of Siam" of Vietnamese food...(at least here in Vegas...)  My husband, the chef, eats here weekly with the boys from the kitchen and a few chef buddies from around town...They always sit in Ben's section - he makes great recommendations when Chef is feeling like having more than #11 (pho) and some orange chicken (hey it's usually 2am so he's entitled to be a creature of habit of sorts...).  Since I work more normal hours, I rarely meet him -- but when I can, it's always a treat...  Last night, since I had the day off today, we went -- and it was yummy!    Ben was there and in addition to my usual can't miss dish (the salt and pepper calamari -- with jalapeno, green onions and crispy garlic), he suggested the Vietnamese salad with chicken -- it was brilliant!  Crispy cabbage, crunchy crushed peanuts, fried shallot rings, crispy garlic , tender pulled chicken, cilantro and a miso/ginger dressing that was perfect -- I love salads that are balanced in flavor, texture and acidity... he said they make it with duck, beef, shrimp, calamari, just about every protein they have in house...    Then he suggested we try the lamb -- I know...lamb at Pho?  It was phenomenal -- tender lamb chops with Chinese spices, grilled to medium rare...over a cold, crispy romaine salad -- again another great dressing -- not sure about ingredients in this one though...  Then he told us they had venison...but by the time he got back with sauces it was 86d, so he ordered the beef for us.  Out came a large, smoking hot black river rock -- a plate of sliced beef, with chunks of butter and limes.   He melted the butter on the stone, then put the beef on it and we cooked it to our degree of doneness -- squeeze of lime -- a dip in the sauce, and it was tender and delicious and took seconds.   That rock wasn't going to cool down anytime soon...  Last night, the spring rolls weren't that great, and the dumplings were tough -- so I'll avoid them next time.  Hey, I can't eat everything...so it's fine with me -- but I'm still looking for Vegas' best potstickers...   But for a chef to come, and when he's in the mood, for the experience to be totally different -- that many think is just same ol, same ol --  and for us to be treated like royalty (uh, we're not Asian...), is a real treat.    I've been in a few times by myself for a quick lunch -- and they always remember me.  It's nice because I'm not the kind of regular that I'd love to be...

U4zJMM4jHZdgPWCtA9ir7g.text: I brought a friend here to have him experience a real Vietnamese meal. We're both out-of-towners, and I was trying to remember the location of the Pho 8 place another friend had taken me to, but settled for Pho Kim Long. BIG MISTAKE. We asked for a fairly standard dish we couldn't find on the menu, Ga xao sa, lemongrass chicken. There was no lemongrass in it, and they charged about double what all other places charge for the dish. We asked for Cafe Sua Da, and they prepared it in the back and brought it to us in styrofoam cups! No on- the-table filters! Stick to Pho 8. Its the real deal. This place has a nice build-out, but the food leaves much to be desired.

kUI_gILQkY76zNfRmKhR6w.text: i don't know what's up with Pho being so medicinal. especially when you're hung-over or still drunk from the Vegas festivities. all of my friends were whining about how much we wanted Pho for dinner- so we went to this place that our local friend took us to. of course we cracked up about the name... Pho-Kim-Long... how can you miss that? oy.   the service is so-so. our food came out relatively quick.... but we waited forever for our drinks. those were the first things we ordered! however, my soda with sugar & lemon was so delicious... i didn't complain much. my shrimp Pho was decent. everyone else didn't finish their Pho, though. i think we're used to delicious Pho in Seattle. plus, my local friend told us this place was a little Americanized and not the very best. it was our last choice because of what time it was.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

icC7l6sIoWpsPCEGgkgYvQ.text: Craving noodles after the club?  Well go to Pho Kim Long for all your late night dining craves.  The entrees/items sometimes surpass the Pho.  They have an extensive menu selection to choose from.  And they are open till like 4-5am.  Food is served really fast and the restaurant is clean, it has been recently remolded.  Great choice for inexpensive late night/ after the club food.

M8GMpwGsOJj9ko0qTKUaKw.text: Ok first of all, the name itself gets 5 stars- LOVE it!  Whether it's intentional or not, it's hilarious and made me want to go there. After a long night of partying and drinking on the strip, my girls and I were in the mood for some good Chinese food.  We asked our taxi driver for his recommendation, and he told us to go to Pho Kim Long for the Vietnamese food.  Man, are we glad we listened to him!  That was the best drunken feast I've ever had in my life. The spring rolls and the honey walnut shrimp were on point!  Everything else was super delish too.  I'm hesitant to give this place 5 stars ONLY because I was slightly inebriated when I dined here, so I don't know how trustworthy my judgment is.  However, I will definitely be coming here next time I hit up Sin City. Pho Kim Long and Pho Kim Gooood =)

JHdXILP2YSb22VSp7zRCVg.text: Does he Pho Kher Long too?  Back when I used to live in Vegas, this was the place after partying.  Opens 24/7 and has a variety of Viet dishes.  Not just your typical Pho and Spring but also the Catfish claypot and the shrimp pancake watchamakolit.  Atmosphere is definitely better than the others.  The motif reminds me of my grandma's house.  Furnitures are laquered shiny inlayed with mother-of-pearl.  For us females, this is one place we are thankful for not getting our hair stunk.  Overall, food and service are better than other Pho house.

jDasE8M52HWAJlTxP-9sTw.text: Pho Kim Ripoff...  heinous-snail-paced service, portions smaller than Top Ramen,  Vietnamese customer priority, bland broth, owner looks like a wannabe mafia leader, and non-pho-like prices... Pho Kim no thanks

Yske1taEQYVMzOXCGFcmtQ.text: Went there last night with Fellow yelper @Phillipe Gomez.  And the food was stellar once again.  We ordered old reliable #12 Pho, consisting of rare steak and brisket.  And orders of Salt and pepper pork, and a beef cube dish.  And as always the food came out quick and was delicious.  I have been going here since 06 and can say that this place is always up to snuff, after all night of binge drinking this place is great to satisfy your hungers.   highly recommended go there next time your in Vegas...or ill punch you in the face

qspv8XDxqhHjyjdQLG752A.text: We went for lunch one day and we were extremely happy.  First of all it's bigger than I thought it would be, and it was pretty full.  Very busy, people were nice.  We ordered some iced Vietnamese coffee which always makes me happy.  The menu is huge and has a lot of food that is not Vietnamese.  The boy ordered a combination bowl that had rice, egg rolls, veggies and sauce and was very delicious.  I ordered the duck noodle soup which had a flavorful broth and lots of good stuff in it.  The duck was very good and crispy.  We also ordered a long bean dish with ground pork.  This was my favorite thing by far.  So flavorful, perfectly cooked and I would easily eat only this for a meal, it was so interesting!  Definitely awesome.  Be back soon!

_akXM0Y-x9UTKFv_k_dijA.text: Got tired of eating along the strip, so we all decided to head off the strip and go for some authentic asian cooking...some comfort food since it was freezing cold out (literally, temps were at freezing point or below).  For a party of six, the bill came out to be just shy of $90 and that's already including the tip!  How can you beat that in Vegas.  We ordered:  (2) Hu Tieu Hoac Mi Ga -Chicken Rice  Noodle - 5.95; (2) Kim Lon Egg Rolls; Pho Tai 5.95; (3) Rare Steak Noodle Soup; Special Combination Tender Beef Noodle Soup - Pho Dac Biet 6.95; 4 Avocado shakes; Soda Chanh Duong - Soda with Fresh Lemon - 2.50.  Service was good and food came in a jiffy.  I'd definitely be returning and the name of the place is hilarious...just say it really fast and you'll get what I'm talking about =)

yzlJyMVKFzdu-U-OIrFv1g.text: I don't know if it was a fluke but my pho tasted like cinnamon soup. I had the Pho Dat Biet and the combination of the meats were way off. They put mostly flank and steak meat, 2 pieces of the meatballs, and none of the other stuff. There is only one sized bowl, so be prepared to pay around $8 for a Pho bowl made for a giant.  What really stuck out to me were the eggrolls. They were really good.   Over all, I liked the setting, food, and the service. Would come back to try other things on the menu. Pho, however, is a no thank you.

ib635LgWgIPqNRE9WQiZNA.text: Great food, not just the Pho but all of the rice and noodle dishes.  Its always packed but the wait is never too long.  Open 24 hours a day I think.  The Pho is cheap and tasty.  The service is sometimes a little funny, a bit rushed, but they are mostly friendly, I guess you go there for the food anyway, and the food is great.

EeAJ4LC-IW66U4RSKyLjaQ.text: Soo good and meaty pho, but pretty bad service cuz its so packed. Got all the accoutrements in a typical pho place but the juice was more flavorful

HAt8UuuiyX32cBUgAMpYeg.text: The food is basic, Pho is salty af, the rice was overcooked and the teriyaki chicken was rough. The servers literally rush you out the door and the manager is rude as hell! I was with a large group of people for EDC Week so we asked if we can get separate checks. The server said the manager would do it once we were ready to pay. We stood there waiting at the cash register as he completely ignored us while he was playing around with some receipts. When he finally looks up he rudely tells us he cannot split the check. When I asked why, he said because it was Sunday, enunciating every word he spoke as though I was an idiot. I said ok. SO we scanned the check to see what each one of us owed as he huffed and puffed. Then he grabbed the check and literally guesstimated what each one of us owed. I'm sure he overcharged more than $20 but no problem since we're NEVER returning to this joint.

PKxxeBtk9SL7h93fh9qEOQ.text: Go to place after late nights out.. the pho 13 has a lot of meet and their fried egg rolls are great.  The fries tofu comes with a great sauce.  The service is your average Asian place lol so don't expect anything more or less.  My son loves their chicken fried rice.

dIh5kOgTtOG0MqF-zltiHQ.text: Food was pretty good. Our table ordered pho, vermicelli bun and spring rolls. Spring rolls were average but the peanut sauce was pretty good. Pho was delicious and they were generous with the amount of meat you get. My friend who got the bun said her bowl was okay. We got there at 11am and there was no wait. Service was fast as well. When we left at 12 there was a long line waiting. If I ever come back to Vegas I will stop by again!

IHOLdnXSmkb3f5ldli_ODw.text: Love! Love! Love! This place! I always order the chicken pho and wonton soup. The best time to eat this is when the weather is cold since it warms you right up!   I alway do take out because this place is always busy. I'd definitely go back!

j-HgJRrN_4KIYTPItlmUlg.text: It was the only place in chinatown with a long line so we were pretty excited thinking that it will be amazing. After a 30-4 min wait we were seated and ordered the regular pho. Within a few minutes our order comes out. I think they have everything premade because of the amount of people coming to eat. The food was on the salty side. I like a little bit of salty flavor but this was over the top. Not sure if its salt or msg.  I would rate the food maybe 3-4 stars even with it being salty. But it drops to a 2 because of the service and environment. The servers dont even look at you and are so hurried because they have so many people. Either hire more servers or get management to organize the system better because I had about 3 different people come to me.   Overall this restaurant is like an awesome movie poster to a terrible movie

9iO5z5kw39QUVzpIAJZTaA.text: This place has gone down tremendously with service being mediocre. I came in with some buddies and literally there were so many empty tables but we received no prompt service.  We waited for 15 minutes to get table at 5:30. We sat down and look around to see many empty tables. Service sucked at the point if you wanted something jus go and get it yourself. Food was just average and really oily. I was going to give a 3 stars but decided to go with 1 star

d9fm0R40DHOPMw2dXmmn3w.text: Bad service and taste bad! !!  Extra 7$ charge for extra large size ! And wrong dish! They have poor English also

RxYNrDhNwIiR2GoiG_rWfw.text: Only order the pho. It has lots of flavor and not too much msg. We tried the wonton soup, congee (rice soup), and fried rice and they were ALL flavorless. There's always a wait but you receive fast service and fast food. They do tend to seat incomplete tables which doesn't help the wait time.

wzXVMKbfJPOCg9V-ANaZrA.text: We experienced poor service. The host lacked in social skills (impatient, loud, no eye contact, etc) because she felt busy and rushed. Food came out cold. Ordered orange chicken and got chicken dunked in watery cold bbq mix sauce. Our Pad Thai noodles were cold, hard, chewy and the pork was flavorless and cold. Had pad Thai sent back for new one which did taste better but still seemed like it had been sitting. White rice was not hot but instead 1 minute from cold soon as the rice container was open. The chicken curry was awful. Currently I have 4 places I willing to go for curry and this won't be one of them.. The chicken was rubbery and there was like 2 TBSP curry sauce on a small skillet dish that was cold... It was so awful here that I felt that poor service was intentional. I endured because my kids were hungry. Since everything was cold, my kids didn't have to worry about tongue and finger burns. My wife was mad she picked another loser

AuV48BE6oy5PCde3J1FLWg.text: Hey really? What is this bum Bho hue? I was expecting a pork hocks but then somehow this looks like a dogs paw? Did you guys get a malnourished pork delivery or what?

kCU0uIjbAbiSqtZVjwxjNw.text: The soup here is so worth the drive!! I get the phu tai soup every time but this time I got it with shrimp. Our server was very nice and attentive. The only bad thing was the wait to get in but other than that everything was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5sGNmxR6EU0M51-hJX6j9w.text: To be completely honest, the quality of the food might be worth a 3-4 star (still great Bc I'm a harsh with food), but I'll give it a 5 star because WHERE ELSE CAN YOU FIND A 24/7 PHO RESTAURANT AFTER CLUBBING?! It's a little off the strip but you can easily uber there and it's not that far. Loved the combination pho and egg rolls! You usually can choose the size of the bowl too (except for combination pho).

bWLSoan6oBNmcXze_w0hBg.text: We always stop by here before we leave Vegas since it's conveniently open 24 hours, which means it doesn't matter what time we get hungry for some hangover cure. After coming here for years, before they even got as big as they did, I can honestly say that the service noticeably went down - sad but True. The pho still hold its original flavor, so no complaint there.   Accepts credit card Same lot as Lee's sandwiches so you can grab their amazing viet coffee before you head out for the drive

G1W1bCBrvS0PQ_fZC0jybA.text: SO UPSET BECAUSE THERE WAS A BUG IN MY FOOD. I come here weekly. This is my favorite place in the world to eat. But tonight it all changed.   8/12/15. Normally I have no problem with this place. I love it a lot. My experience ranges from pho, pad Thai, to their clay pots. But tonight I was seriously upset.   I ordered a number 24, the vermicelli with chicken. Half way through my meal, I find a dead bug in there. It was big. About the size of my thumb. I was so disgusted I lost my appetite immediately.   I work at a restaurant myself so I tried not to make a big scene. We quietly called a worker over and explained to him what happened. Showed the bug on a napkin. He nonchalantly said "oh it must've been in the salad".  WHAT?! Noooo, sounds like it's happened before. They asked if I wanted anything else, but obviously not after seeing that.   They took of my meal and gave me 20% off on our bill, which we only got Thai teas and crab ragoons but we shouldn't have even paid for anything at all. I was so upset and disappointed that my favorite place in the world, that I just wanted to walk out. Sorry pho Kim long, I can't ever come back. :(

onnmDz7NOzt3V6XxctrM6Q.text: There's a difference between being mean and being honest. I don't intend to be nasty and mean, but I guess I wasn't drunk enough or hungover enough to enjoy my meal here. It was a complete waste of time. The wait for a party of two was half an hour and once we were seated, it wasn't another 15 minutes before someone swung by to take our order.   We had just hiked for a total of 13 hours in the Grand Canyon and stopped here before heading to our hotel. I always crave pho after a hike and unfortunately, the pho here was a complete disappointment.   He had a pho dac biet and I had a meatball pho. The restaurant was busy and our noodles didn't come to the table until 30 minutes later. During the entire time we waited, we were thinking, "this better be some phoking delicious bowls of noodles!"   When the noodles came, all I can think was, "is this pho?!" My broth was mega salty and the beef flavors and aromatics were nonexistent. His broth was even saltier, which was quite amazing because I thought mine was salty enough. And even worse, our broths tasted completely different even though we both had beef based pho.   Honestly, my boyfriend makes better pho and he's a China boy! Maybe it was a bad day for them, but the pho really turned me off. I most likely will not return.

a7nPAcX9MhCYuFRMgwLc0w.text: Now I understand they're voted the best in Vegas, food isalways good Service is great And the reason why Pho Kim Long is getting five stars from me is, I accidentally ordered the wrong thing and they happily replaced it with no problem

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hu tieu plus Mi [egg noodle] dac biet, best in town for reals
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always good, no let downs

9lrOccjHfjEyMskiCq-fvQ.text: Well, it's open late... that's why everyone comes here.  If Kinh Do (a block away) didn't close at 10 p.m., I would've been there.  On a Saturday night at 11 p.m. we were quoted a 30 minute wait time but ended up only waiting 10 minutes for a table of four.  I live by Little Saigon in Southern California so if comparing to the pho there, Pho Kim Long's pho and bun dishes are normal/about average.  There wasn't anything that stood out good or bad about them.  I had the vermicelli with grilled pork and egg rolls.  My friends had the pho.    Drinks here are a tad expensive.  I think it was $3.50-$3.75 for Iced Coffee, Fresh Lemonade with Soda, and Preserved Lemon with Soda.    The service here is good.  Numerous servers came to check on/take our order.  If I was craving some late night pho after a night out on the town, I'd come here again.

GfLzh85I0rJ_FzaZP4hwXQ.text: Wow... now I know why this place is open so late. Sure, Vegas is a city that's open 24/7. But while other places close up shop, this one keeps serving. I didn't even know Vegas had a Chinatown, let alone an Asian mall. I believe I even spotted a Ranch 99! Just like home.... heheh.  I tried the pho, which was decent, but my fiancee ordered the fish hot pot, cooked authentic Vietnamese style. What a taste bonanza! We got the sauce to go, as it could be cooked with a lot of other food.   Only qualms are, like others have mentioned, that the service can be spotty. I had to remind them to bring me my Thai Iced Tea after waiting 10-15 minutes for it. I suspect the waiters are just inexperienced, as many appear to be quite young.

cbC04z5SU55OP-Fo6stlHw.text: Thank you "random cosmopolitan valet guy" for leading us right to best place for pho in Vegas.  Pho Kim Long hits the spot big time. Broth is tasty and service is really swift. My friends ordered different kinds of Pho and were not disappointed.  I personally went with the non-Pho route and ordered the Bun Bo Hue like all my fellow yelpers and it was spectacular.  (Mind you, i'm not really partial to having a beef foot in my soup ... yeah, not really my style - but, it was the bomb. seriously, it was so good.) I'll be back.  I'll definitely be back.  BTW, the eggs rolls were good too.    Side note:  After you've inhaled your grub  - you'll notice that there aren't any cabbies waiting outside to take your semi-sober self back to your hotel on the strip, so you'll have to take a chance at hailing one right on Spring Mountain.  It feels kinda shady at 2a, but you'll be fine if you have a few folks with you.   Side note 2: be careful of saying "pho-kim-long" out loud if front of your three year old. He repeats it out in public and people start giving your bad looks :)

GcigdSXgbl6iyoYyiDoLgw.text: Best spot for late night noodle cravings. One of my coworkers brought me here and it is so good. It's always busy and there is always a short wait but that means the food is good. I have ordered the crab rangoons, Vietnamese spring rolls, Singapore noodles, lettuce wraps, and the rare steak pho. Everything here is so good and made to order so it is hot and fresh.   If you're craving Vietnamese or Chinese food anytime of the day then come here.

1yZnx1mFNmH1yMDxtygtxg.text: Only came here because I got off work late and me and my friend were going out and needed somewhere that was open after midnight. I'd been here before with another friend and it was much nicer. Lets start with the wait.  We came in and put our names on the list, but I could see there were other couples who had obviously been waiting awhile. The place was busy, but no so busy at that time that people should have been waiting very long. I could see open tables from where we were standing. The guy said a 10 minute wait, it was at least 20.  We were brought water and weren't asked if we wanted anything else to drink. They barely gave us time to look before we were being asked if we had decided. My friend is a vegetarian so he needed a moment more and said so. Not even seconds after telling the first waiter, a second one comes over and wants to know if we were ready...i said yes and ordered while my friend asked if they had a vegetarian option available. This is where the service got bad, because the guy got nasty and was like "Number 21! That what I was just telling you, 21 only vegetarian option for soup". My friend wasn't asking about soup, he was just asking if they had other options since the menu is ridiculously large and the vegetarian options were all over the place. There was no need for him to get snotty.   Soup wise, it came fast, and the vegetarian soup was good. Mine was honestly lacking in flavor and I needed to add a lot of hoisen and siracha, which I usually do anyway but compared to Saigon 8 where I usually get my pho, it was still kind of lacking in flavor. I could also tell they ignored my request for completely cooked beef since they didnt have an option for one that wasnt paired with raw. My stomach is really sensitive so thankfully I didnt get sick.  Over all, the place is ok if you dont mind shit service, a long wait, and semi decent food late at night, but I will stick with Saigon as their service is at least nice and the soup has flavor. And no, I did not follow their gratuity chart they so kindly circle at the bottom. I dont tip assholes.

pzJhrNoQostHHwWgQTbr6A.text: This place is as good as it gets,  open 24/7 with something for everyone this place is my go to place for viet food

FPzfeQOv82y5RzScCllCdw.text: Best Pho in Vegas! I have been to almost all the pho spots in Vegas and this is still the best. Always hits the spot.  Service is good and quick. Parking lot is tight.   Pho Dat Biet - $8.95 - Broth is clear, clean, and beefy. Meat is tender. Beef balls is a different twist. No tripe in this dat biet though.   Bun Bo Hue - $9.50 - Great spicy broth. All the beef is sliced thin, but I prefer the shank chunks. Pig feet is my favorite part.   Prices are a little higher then normal but you get a TON of meat with each bowl. So full after.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Bo Hue - $9.50
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

4STr4jIYH63hOOBlJ0WiNA.text: Service is below average and the staff is beyond rude. They literally throw the menu and food on the table and walk away. I'm not sure why it's so popular because there are plenty of other Vietnamese restaurants in the area with better reviews. I ordered wonton egg noodles and it was decent but the meat wrapped in the wonton is a size of a dime. Definitely will never return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4MXl5s0KgHM-qDKq-HgQ8Q.text: 0 stars. Extremely bad service, their cashiers are very rude as well and I litterly found 2 pieces of hair inside of my food. Horrible please don't go here, what a unprofessional & dirty restaurant!! What a shame for a Vietnamese restaurant. They should get shut d

pAPMpuUjaKApQOWbq9WmNA.text: Ok if you haven't been here or tried #106 your missing out. It's the honey garlic pork chop. Choose your time wisely because it gets really busy because people love this place. MUST TRY!!!!

_pmXFX2TXGlASuoGMkA6_A.text: Its busy place. Pho is really good! Soup base is delicious! House special is my favor! Never let you down!

FcQ4m6mzan726LtjpaK2xA.text: Terrific! Great food, fast service, great decor, reasonably priced! Can't say more good things about this place. We ordered the fresh spring rolls, fried chicken wings with salt and pepper to start. Both were terrific. The chicken wings were seriously amazing. Then we ordered the rare steak pho, pork chop rice, seafood fried noodle. All was cooked perfectly and so delicious!

f0PH313jd6O7c82WhYOPMA.text: I've never had a bad meal here. Considering I've eaten here at least 50 plus times I guess the odds are pretty good. There were a few years where my husband and I went every weekend! We've taken big groups of our family here and big groups of friends and the service went down just a bit but I really don't expect great service at authentic Asian restaurants. It does get really crowded at prime times and waits can be long. We usually avoid those times. They are open 24 hours which is a plus and I've seen many people from out of town being dropped off by taxis and Ubers.   They get 5 stars for being open on Christmas. Since my hubby works holidays this is my Christmas morning spot especially when I'm sick and I tend to be every Christmas after being around lots of germy kids.

-TdBdrbxaUA7RXF-Qdkayg.text: Wanted take out and love pho called in my order picked up brisket and rare steak was so amazing. The veggies were fresh and good. I have tried a lot of different places here in Vegas but this is my new pho place. Fast, easy, fair price and amazing taste.

k3ZoStg-4j5H2X74SLmgeA.text: Worst Vietnamese food ever. The manager here is very rude and he doesn't even care how their foods are served.

Xp7EtIlyuFsRwg-fnzQrNw.text: The restaurant gets really busy. I waited for like 30 min to be seated. However, the wait was totally worth it! The food was delicious! I highly recommend ordering pho and calamari. For the pho, they give you 2 options for the size: small and big. The small size is not that small, I would say it's regular. I will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho

hup8NlsJGY8fISMQEQ53LQ.text: Their food is delicious and I go there because it's 24/7. HOWEVER there customer service is an ATROCITY. The cashier is not just poor customer service he is RUDE. I come here a lot and every time, the service get worse. The waiters never come check up on you for drink refills. If you don't leave a tip, they will PRESS you for one. The last time I went, the cashier told the busser to ask if I left a tip IN FRONT OF ME and scoffed at me.

P09uy58dX7vu8OoWuy8nLA.text: You know you have to try a place when every single person you ask about a good asian place in Vegas tells you to go to Pho Kim Long. My friend and I were there for fun and we were craving some comfort food--her current obsession was Pho, literally once or more times a week. I also am a big phan (aha!) but living in SF, I'm more accustomed to Ramen places so I was also pheeling in the mood phor it (alright, I'm done). I wasn't super in the mood for anything really since I had food poisoning from 2 days before, but I figure the soup would help easy all of the quesy-ness  You can't get to this place easily via walking. Sure, on the map it's like 1ish blocks away from the strip but that is one long-a$$ block, more than 27 minutes!!! So we drove over, one block to Vegas's Chinatown which is almost basically a strip of places all connected with a long parking lot parrallell to it. The restaurant itself  is packed, (also supposedly open 24 hours) and whipping out pho every minute like they had a giant pool of it in the back. We got there at maybe 2pm or so and put our name on the list. Estimated 30 ish minutes so we went over to the Chinese bakery a couple doors down to buy some snacks to go and a little something as an appetizer while we waited.  Perfectly timed, we went back to the restaurant and within a couple minutes we were seated in the still busy, still crowded restaurant. There were even more people on the waitlist now than before! Talk about late lunch....  We ordered and pretty quickly got our food--I took a small combination pho and my friend took the larger with just the flank. It was pretty good and really did sooth my tummy just a bit. The small is actually quite a lot so I'd recommend that unless you're sharing with someone else and taking a couple other dishes. Everything about the Pho was good, the meat, noodles, broth. It was a solid choice. I don't necessarily know if it was really *special* per say but for the price and amount and the speed, it was perfect and beats any other place we ate at in Vegas.  Service is a little slow since there's so many people. When we finished, we waited AGES for them to bring the check, and then another couple of ages before they brought the card back with the receipt to sign. However, for about $12 a head, it was great and I'd definitely recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak and brisket noodle soup pho

6XNHlzwLRJJPMbam6aQ2gQ.text: This is our go to spot before we leave Vegas to head back to OC. Fast service and good food! Pho is good, rice dishes are good. They even have pad Thai which is good as well. Opens 24hrs.

fJ1KHxt4p5heh5EAphNwKg.text: Awesome stuff here. Drunken Noodles with beef & shrimp is a must. Pan fried crispy noodles and pho with vermicelli both good too. Nice service. Open 24/7. 1/2 or 1/3 strip cost and better.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Noodles (near) and Crispy Noodles just destroyed! Awesome stuff

fauG_7dUdKEq9RhLzNatfQ.text: This place used to be better.  Service was horrible.  We didn't even finish eating yet and they asked us if we wanted to pack it to go.  Gave us our check, when the cashier picked up the money, he asked if we were going to tip them.  That is just rude and poor manner.  Their service is so bad that they had to ask for tip.  We were going to give them 18-20%, but decided not to because they have bad business ethic.

84OLdKiweW46qEyBQECnvA.text: Though this joint is off the strip it is VERY worth your while to come here! My daughter was feeling sick all of a sudden and I wasn't feeling well either (perhaps the same bug plus a touch of drinking?) - so what better cure than some late night pho? The taxi ride was super cheap and worth it to come cure our ailments.  When we got there around 10pm, we were surprised at how packed it still was! Sucks, but usually indicates that there's something worth waiting for. SO glad we waited! I'm a bit particular about my pho and theirs was soooo good. The broth was made just right and tasted very clean (if that makes sense). The portions were huge and we even took some back to our hotel.  We also got a plate of pad thai and that was also equally amazing. The flavor was right on, perfect amount of sauce and portion was plentiful.   We were definitely rejuvenated after our meals. My husband, our two daughters and I have a trip scheduled to Vegas in June and we're definitely planning to go back. It seriously beats some pricier spots on the strip. If you love pho and pad thai, I'd definitely recommend coming here for that fix!!!

eXr0Sw-EAMLtxMwqmAcL6Q.text: Came here with friends because this is one of he only things that are open this late during this time. It was probably around 3AM.  Depending on the night it can vary from being really busy or moderate. Usually our wait time for a table is 15-45 minutes.   The servers there are very fast. They immediately give you a glass of water once we were seated at our table. There was a lot of items on the menu but my friends and I usually order a couple plates of calamari and the combination pho.   Our food always comes out quick and it's satisfying being able to eat something with a few minute time frame.  Calamari is beautifully fried with marinara sauce on the side and the combination pho comes in a huge bowl and is awesomely satisfying.  This will always be one of my spots for late night meal.

08uNhobG2SGC0Ok6LbR5OQ.text: Pretty good pho place, but I think the reason it's rated so highly is that it's open 24 HOURS.  It was pretty good and tasty CHICKEN PHO but not out of this world.  The broth was good but a little salty and not that rich.  Noodles were good but standard pho.  I've been getting spoiled with these fat noodle pho joints...Honestly, if it were 3am and I really wanted pho, I think it probably would be just perfect.  The FRESH SPRING ROLL and the FRIED SPRING ROLL were really good - the spring rolls were more of a hit than the pho.  Great peanut sauce and dipping sauce for the fried ones too.  The COCONUT was really tasty.  They give you a spoon and crack open the top as well, but just drinking the juice was so refreshing!  There is a clipboard with a waiting list at the front.  Not the friendliest service but just deal.  Small waiting area and crowded parking lot.  The restaurant is pretty big but it seems to fill up too.  It looks like the restaurant used to be a Chinese restaurant since the style doesn't look like your typical pho place.  To be fair, it's better than any other pho I've had on the strip, but that's not saying much.  So if you can get off the strip for pho, this one is definitely worth it.

IRgi4AOdlTvcbf8KP18QzA.text: The pho was actually good since I thought they were more known for their Chinese dishes. But they have the crispiest juiciest cornish hen dish. The service can be little slow during peak hours so order as much as you can at once.

ZMnyJ51Ue6RLlLgjEyXmkw.text: I used to come here every time I was in Vegas and they have definitely changed owners because nothing tastes the same. It doesn't taste good anymore and it's disappointing in general as they're trying to pass off authentic Vietnamese food for...not authentic Vietnamese food.  They serve different foods like wings and more American-ized/Fusion dishes next to their noodle and rice dishes. I wasn't able to try the newer stuff but their usual food is not good anymore! Super disappointing.  Already skeptical, I tried to order the most fool-proof food on the menu. I ended up getting wonton noodle soup.   HOW DO YOU MESS UP WONTON NOODLE SOUP? Well, somehow they managed to. The soup base had this weird flavor when it should have been more like a chicken broth (How do you mess that up? If they're lazy, just use chicken broth?! Even Swanson's would have more flavor. I don't get it). Additionally, the wontons were smaller than a ping pong ball...HOW DID I PAY MONEY FOR THIS?

-H15Yr6UAJu_1PTAfhWTOQ.text: This is the only place we go to in Vegas for delicious pho and Viet food. My favorite to order is #31 which is the beef stew with egg noodle. The broth is tasty and comforting when you are recovering from a hang over. I just wish there was less beef fat and more beef. My friends like the broth of their pho and it's pretty tasty for what it is. It gets pretty packed on the weekend, but the wait time isn't that long because the service is good and quick.

gdtqy6YNmyob31bCUxrxlQ.text: Their service as waiters is okay. I've come here many times before because I'm a local. Their food is always out fast, I can tell they have plenty of staff. But the last time I came here was a horrible experience overall. Even though their food came out fast like always the waiter sucked. He didn't care about what any of us wanted. There were three of us and it wasn't super busy. It was around 1Am because they're open 24 hours. I asked if I could get a pho no meat and he told me they didn't have that, when I get it every time I come. I'm not a regular but I know they have it because it's the only thing I get. Anyway since I didn't get a pho no meat because they "didnt have it" I asked for a pho tai. My boyfriend got the same thing, and I told them no vegetables only lemon. Yet they still gave me onions and every vegetable in the soup, and they gave us the bean sprouts and everything. It sucks because none of us uses the sprouts, mint, or Jalepenos. I will point out that I noticed their vegetables always look fresh and clean. But besides that our veges were pretty much wasted. Besides the waiter messing that up. The broth doesn't really have a taste or flavor, It's pretty bland You can say it's cause I ordered a pho tai and didn't add plenty of veges inside but I've had pho from manyyyy places and this is the only place where their pho beef broth taste like nothing.

gT6UjFMOwHTtwCKSwVQd_Q.text: Love this place! We've been coming to this restaurant for a long time and have never been disappointed. Most of the time there is a 15 minute wait since they are always busy. The nighttime dinner rush is a bit more however, the employees are always hustling to get food served as quickly as they can. The prices are also very affordable. If you want a delicious meal Pho Kim Long is worth the money!

GbA6avNxg-3usnBRd3f0Mg.text: Heard great things about this place from friends but sooo disappointed. Tip: Check your receipt.   First and foremost, the server never came by after taking the initial order when we clear clearly indicated that we wanted another item. Then after the food arrived he never followed up to check on us.   The duck was extremely over cooked. It was like turkey it was so dry. What a waste of money. If I wasn't starving... many complaints would have been made at the time but I was done waiting for food. The salt and pepper pork was yummy.   Now what really annoyed me is that they essentially forced me to tip either 15, 18, or 20%. It was just me and my boyfriend not a big party. And if you are going to pre-tip, at least add it correctly. Like how rude of you to give horrible service and then make someone pay tip and add extra.   Sneaky shady business. The amount is not at issue, the fact that the this practice is allowed is ridiculous.

1p0RBzCOh9a3FdE2Ewc-aA.text: I have always come to this restaurant since 1999. This evening I came in with my wife and two very starving sons, a party of four. After signing on their wait list for 15 minutes, we were the second from the TOP list. One of the manager, Jonathan, called another name with a party of five on the third position from the BOTTOM of the list to the table. I asked him why he called out of turn. He responded that their party was bigger. I said a party of four and a party of five wouldn't make any difference. I wouldn't appreciate if he did so. He quickly responded to me that if I didn't like it, I could leave and pointed his finger to the door.  Wow this was the first time in my life that a manager of a restaurant actually didn't care about his customer that much. He would ask his customers to leave when it was his fault.  I don't know how the owner of this restaurant will deal with this manager's terrible behavior. However, if it was me, I would have a zero tolerance policy for that kind of very behavior.

UVNCxkbuPEfuVj0rxIFQLg.text: I been coming here for the last 13 years,  i ordered food to go, when i got home I was missing my entree  dinner, I thought , what a disappointment but I didn't wanted drive   all the  way back so  i opened my appetizer,  consisted of  springs roll "fresh" and I noticed the shrimp inside was grey, wasn't cook !! All raw!! I tried to call them but phone line was busy, I stopped by next day to let them know what happened and I brought back the uncooked food and the manager was abusive !!! I told him I understood people make mistakes, just fix them ! Do the right think! Give me the order of calamari that was missing and that of course i had paid and a a new order of COOKED rolls, but angrily he told me NO ! Like was my fault! He told me I should had drive back last night ! Like people time its not important!  I wasn't asking for anything free !! I just wanted to get what i had paid ! What if i give the rolls to my elderly mom and she get sick with the raw food! Come on take pride of what you do! Be respectful be kind , do right as a business!! With soooo many Vietnamese restaurants in vegas now , come on , do right! respect your clientele. This is a busy restaurant, owners are making money, you can afford to correct what you company did wrong, again We don't need free stuff! Only what its the right thing to do !! Why to support business with so low criteria when are many many many, LOTS of mama and papa Vietnamese restaurants with good food , kind, and respectful who actually appreciate our business .

kdAQuXeMpJGUbw9V_bEBCw.text: No customer service, just walked away didn't ask us what we'd like to drink. Their brown rice came out after my friend and I finished our first plate of order. No refills on our water. So my bestfriend and I didn't leave any tip. The guy that took my money for our order came back to me and demanded me for tip.   I will no longer be a customer here I highly suggest everyone to enjoy their dinner else where.

4KhZ_7Z-lj0-7iHWqZL8pg.text: Let me start by saying I've been coming here for years and the food was always pretty good however the service is so terrible here that I'm going to actively search for a new pho spot to regularly visit. No one is attentive to their guests here, you have to chase two or three people down in order to get your water refilled let alone any other need you have. Sucks but I'm breaking up with pho Kim long. It's not me it's you.

v3OUQNdG-77OPkTIMsX28Q.text: If I could give this place half a star I would. The food was not good. We ordered the bun no hue, pho, and calamari. The bun bo hue was tasteless and is supposed to be spicy but no amount of chili oil was gonna save that bowl. The calamari was oily and over-battered. The broth of the pho wasn't served hot enough so at the end of the meal, my red meat was still raw.   The restaurant is also not forthcoming about pricing. They charged extra for meatballs even though it's not listed on the menu that there is an extra charge and the waiter failed to mention the additional cost. They also automatically charged gratuity even though I was with a party of 5, not 6. There was nothing positive about the experience. If you're looking for a good restaurant to go to, avoid this place at all costs.

0djvBNyG-63hQBaWUj1COg.text: not one of the best pho places I've been to ,  Waiters don't have good table service, they served our food at different times , waiter also served lukewarm water , and I asked for ice he disappeared for 10min

gTru1igEl7HCfUCaw4w5GQ.text: Came here at 10:24am today and it took me longer to get my food than it took me to eat it.  Don't order any type of noodle soup if you want your food  quicker than 30 minutes. The tables around us had a mix of patrons who ordered rice dishes and pho. All the people with rice dishes got their dishes before pho came out. One guy at the table next to us had to ask where his pho was when his friends had already eaten most of their rice dishes. I don't mind the waiting since it's Vegas and we all wait, but don't selectively feed the table that came in after me because their dishes are quicker to make. At least three tables were filled before mine.   The waiter only came to give us food and the check. No one refilled water or asked anything else. And, they were stacking tables next to us and moving chairs, which was fine. Then they miscounted and there were 17 guest so they needed our table and chairs. That was fine but we were waiting on them to return our credit card so we couldn't go anywhere. It was absolutely ridiculous and no paying customer should ever have to go through that at 11am (by now it was 11).   I always tip 20% or more but this time, I tipped 10%.  In addition to terrible service, food was mediocre and nothing more. Bun bo hue was bland and the pho was meh. Listen to your yelper and go to another pho place. There's so many of them around here that probably has better quality food and service.  Update: The food gave me food poisoning. Yay...

TmZYq4F194cLrQhssgVwuw.text: mediocre vietnamese cruisine.  not sure if theres limited options locally or what, but this place is ALWAYS packed of the few times weve come. line out the door, 30+ min waiting times, and outrageous hunt for parking.    tip #1: their drunken noodles and udon stir fry dishes are pretty good!!!  very flavorful, however extremely oily  tip #2: do NOT ever even think about getting the salt and pepper wings.  they are beyond tasteless....  i wondered where the actual salt and pepper went.  it literally was plain/bland fried wings, and they gave us miniscule jerky wings at that.  horrible.  to compensate, that dish had about 5-6 extra crap, nonedible wings than our Fish sauce wings dish, where both flavor and meat was present.  lol.

dXwut64yxT2XcZw3oAjBwQ.text: Hands down my absolute favorite restaurant in Vegas. I could eat here every day and be happy. But, come on (specifically "Kelly") I've been eating there for 12+yrs and she has been working there 6yrs.... I order the same thing every single time and I frequent easily 2-3 Times a week.... but for some reason everyone else recognizes me but her. .....????!???? Very frustrating.

3C1klAVxkU9JPneAIyjiDQ.text: The Pho will bring you back from Vegas Death! The brisket Pho and Kung Pao was bomb! A local told me to come here and I'm glad I listened!

vkBchntzYMYN6Rw2GDLCmA.text: The best Pho in town. The staff is friendly and always has a pleasant greeting. They just remodeled and it looks fabulous. Even though they are always busy... our wait has never been extremely long. I highly recommend the food.

ywanGvKm7r6tsTv8Ta0xpg.text: My fiance and I came here after getting massages in Chinatown. The place was packed and that's usually a good sign. We were seated right away and our drink orders taken. We started with an order of crab Rangoon. They had a nice amount of crab in there compared to some places who just put cream cheese in the wantons. For the main course we shared the Beijing beef and the Pad Thai combo with chicken, pork, and shrimp. Both were excellent and was a nice contrast in flavors. The Beijing beef had a tangy sweet sauce and the Pad Thai wasn't overly spicy but very flavorful.  Portions are large and more than enough to share. We had no room for dessert but noticed they had boba tea so maybe next time. Total bill for 1 appetizer and 2 dinners came to $40. Pho Kim Long is open 24 hours which makes it a great spot for late night drunken Pho cravings!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles with combination beef, shrimp, chicken, and pork

fyAPkXLavvlEm0VU82Iy6Q.text: Pho Kim Long has been a go to place for me whenever I am craving pho, but unfortunately today I experienced something I am sure nobody would want to experience. I found a live cockroach in my food! When I found the cockroach I immediately told a server about the situation. All they said to us was, "So sorry" and took the plate away from us. I personally had to go up to them and tell them that I will not pay for this food. They handled this situation so poorly.   Eat here if you choose, but just know that there might be some cockroaches roaming around in the kitchen and possibly in your food.

VC9Nt7t7EXbjBVBsLhUVSA.text: I've been coming here for so long, recently the people here are so rude. Used to be so friendly and nice, now the waiters are not being attentive whatsoever. Are basically ignoring customers, was so unhappy tried to leave a smaller tip and the man checking me out yelled that we only left 4$. It was so disrespectful and rude. Used to love this pho spot, now I would never go back.

lUy2NqGSekQ41bW6dB81mg.text: Where do I start. The pho is lukewarm, legit someone in my party gave it back to the kitchen to microwave and I wanted to do so as well... anything to make it hot because who wants room temp pho who knows when it was cooked. Also do yourself a favor DO NOT get the meatballs in the pho SO GROSS, everyone at my table of six agreed that it tasted odd , flavorless and we believe it was powder not even real meat now sure how that can happen. If you guys are ever in the OC area please go get yourself some real pho ANY pho location in the OC would beat this place. I don't think they know what it should taste like here weird because they have been in business since 1997.  Even though Pho is in there name I suggest you DO NOT GET PHO HERE. I would suggest just go to lees sandwiches it's 24/7 as well probably won't even have to wait long regret eating here should have gone with Lees. OH and another note everything was so dirty I asked for extra bowls they came soaked wet and had bits of debris in them and two of the spoons that gave me had permanent debris on it as well even though I tried so hard to wipe if off with a napkin. One thing I would say is decent is their workers, service is good here I see all the workers hustling sorry that they don't serve good food. Would not recommend this place.

Fp15irEB7RyNPmDu2FVw-Q.text: After me and my ex failed attempt to eat at Hot n Juicy on a Wednesday night because of their hour long wait list we came to Pho Kim.  We've had it before and so she knows what she now wants.  She ordered a mango w/boba, the shrimp and crab with egg noodles, and calamari.  I ordered a coconut, pho kim egg rolls, and the meat combination pho.  Everything tasted great as usual but this time we got our appetizers out first which was rare.  I've always had the pho come out first.  It was the first time my ex had the egg rolls and I was trying to teach this white girl how to wrap it in the leaf but it wasn't going to happen.  The broth was extra tasty this time, I like the rice noodles but my ex likes the egg noodles.  Both taste great.  The coconut always comes out fresh.  Service was quick and the restaurant was clean.    Every time we come here we say next time we're going to try something different!  We never do.  So give yourself a treat and grab some pho here.  A plus plus plus to Pho Kim is their 24 hour service!  Perfect for me if I'm in the area while at work!

Cpzzscbhjlb3IVS3VL70Zg.text: Becareful to eat here !!The server there so thirsty of tip, they gonna push you to tip how much they want and they will wait in front of you to pay right away after they give u the bill. What a terrible experience!!

CtYBNIFdHxUDqzLFrQA7Sw.text: Open 24 hours. Both times I went there was a 10 min wait. Service is fast and friendly.

ssD3FNXypDBXNQs7ZlmL-w.text: Reliably delicious. Have a hankering for ph at 3am? No problem. This place is open 20Ph7!

80I-qlmUgE-j94vt98dCuw.text: Whoa! Very potent pho. You can smell it before you even enter the store! I personally didn't mind it (I love pho), but some of my friends thought it was unpleasant.   Service was great. A group of five girls can be very annoying/demanding, but they handled it very well. The broth was light and really hit the spot after the long drive over to Vegas. This place would be great for day-after hangovers! I wasn't craving brisket this time, so I ordered the shrimp pho. The shrimp were pretty small in size, but they give a decent amount. It went well with the broth too. My friends also ordered some fried rice to go. We knew that we'd be hungry when we got home after a night out, and their fried rice re-heated nicely.  Btw, you will leave smelling like you took a bath in pho. :)

KGEDHxm3nCarvZV3cGtwDg.text: If you ever wanted a "cold" bowl of Pho in Vegas then Pho Kim Long is the place to go to! . Oooh the bonus is the "horrible customer service ". We kid you not!! The waitress was so lack of skills.  We brought to her attention that the Pho broth was cold.  She took it away and put the Same bowl into the microwave and brought it back out without no apology . Totally disappointed and we will never ever visit this place again.  We would give it a zero star for the food and customer service.!!!!

ZzXd21JEh8WV52-xFcRFFg.text: Came here with my sister and boyfriend... it's was a cold night thought basic original style pho would do it.. end up leaving like I ate a whole bowl of msg!! Quick in service. Super busy.. but eh On the pho.

FGxUHFAKdt0c89EKsHfcXw.text: I always take my family there for a quick bite! Fast and great Vietnamese food. The Service is alright but very friendly.

WtX6a2DaHT5XppucE7OwIQ.text: I love this place.. best pho, I love the people that work here, they are all nice. I have never had any problems with my food

oQYtkgtiKYLXcE33leQCbg.text: Imagine this Scenario:  Drunk Girl: Pho Kim Long! Pho Kim Long! Pho Kim LOOOOOOOOONG PLEASE!!!  Cab Driver (language barrier): Me love you long time? *wink wink*  Drunk Girl: Yes, me love you long time if you bring me to PHO KIM LONG! FTW!!!  To be Continued...  Thank goodness, we came here sober because who knows what would have happened if we "attempted" to come to PKL DRUNK in a cab especially with a restaurant name like "Pho Kim Long". :X  On Saturday, December 11th, my friend and I came to PKL at 2:45 PM (OPEN 24 HOURS) to nurse our massive hangovers and our growling stomachs. PKL was half filled and we were seated immediately. PKL is only a 5 min drive from the Strip which is about a $8 cab ride. CC's are accepted.  F O O D: The menu is quite expensive so you can satisfy your Vietnamese craving for pho, bun, com or your Chinese craving for chow fun, ma po tofu, or various dishes with XO sauce for example.   *CHA GIO (Vietnamese Egg Rolls - $6): Meh! I like my cha gio wrapped in rice paper wraps because it creates a crispier and flakier shell. The ones at PKL is wrapped in the standard egg roll wrapper made with flour and water which seems to doesn't maintain its crispness long.   The cha gio arrived room temperature and some parts of the wrapper was soggy. The filling pork filling was a bland and the nuoc mam cham (fish sauce) was watered down as it was missing the pungency from the fish sauce and the spiciness from the chilies.   *COMBO PHO ($7.95): The PERFECT hangover cure! The pho was flavorful and comforting, but coming from SF it's not the best I've had. Nevertheless, it IS best and  most "authentic" pho you will get near the Strip.   The rice noodles were tender and al-dente and swimming in a pool of rich and savory beefy broth that wasn't laden with MSG. The rare beef slices and beef brisket were soft and tender, while the beef balls had a nice chewy spring to it. The bean sprouts, basil, jalapeno and lime were fresh and were the perfect compliment to pho adding a nice crunch and freshness.   My only gripe is there were no tendons or tripe in the combo nor was there any pho options with them.   *FRESH YOUNG COCONUT ($3.50): The SECRET Hangover Cure!!! Coconut water contains all five of the essential electrolytes: calcium, potassium, phosphorous, magnesium and sodium needed for effective rehydration and has 15 times the amount of potassium as most sports drinks. So this is a MUST order along with your pho if you want to effectively nurse your hangover.  Coconut water taste a little but like metallic water with a very hint sweetness so you can add sugar to it but you should really drink it a la natural. Make sure to eat the creamy flesh of the coconut because it improves insulin secretion and utilization of blood glucose.  S E R V I C E: The staff is incredibly nice, attentive and fast which is rarity for Asian restaurants. Our food came out within 5 minutes which is typical of most pho restaurants and the manager (?) checked on us numerous times to make sure everything was ok.   A M B I A N C E / D E C O R: Dark rich woods, granite tables, various Vietnamese and Chinese shrines, and elaborate fish tanks with exotic fishes create a very nice and upscale environment.   There are over 25 tables that are well-spaced out, so you don't have to worry about rubbing elbows with your neighbor.   With the festivities of drunken debauchery that occurred this weekend and the aforementioned scenario in my head, why do I feel like it WILL happen on my next trip to Vegas? *covers eyes*

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Young Coconut - $3.50
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cha Gio - $6
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pho - $7.95 (Boo for no tendon or tripe!)

9sF_LJ7Qf0CZfevm3h8fsQ.text: Some of my brother's Vietnamese friends eat pho for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  There are lots of pho places around Vegas where he lives, So when he wants  this even at midnight, Pho Kim Long is his go to place. They also make some decent Chinese food. Some of the tables around us had your usual pan fried noodles, whole fried fish, and sweet and sour pork.  But most people had pho.   Although more salty than I personally like, the simple broth and noodles has a light, nice aroma served in a large bowl.  Add meat, like rare steak slices, along with some condiments, like basil, bean sprouts, and onions ($7), it was an awesome meal in itself.  I was going to order the same thing, but for the same price, you can get a half rotisserie small chicken with rice.  It was crispy on the outside, and moist and tender on the inside ($7). So simple, yet so good.  Customers are mostly families during the day till early evening.  After that, they're the winners and mostly losers from the casinos, and sobering drunken clubbers and night shift workers. The inside is comofrtable and nicely appointed with ample booths or tables. During lunch dinner. no matter what day, it is crowded.  Finding a parking spot, however, is a war of patience and luck.  Fortunately, a guy was pulling out just as we walked inside, so we didn't have to exhibit our Type A parking lot Ninja tactics. While waiting to be seated, I enjoyed their relaxing goldfish tanks.   This place is so typical Vegas with a Vietnamese and Chinese twist. I'd go back to try a few more dishes.  Service was good, prompt with the soda ($2) refills and special requests, and making sure all was OK.

f_0lVaYhgYqPg0yyHRUENg.text: DO NOT EAT HERE!!! There was a lady bug in my soup! So disgusting!! The lady didn't even apologize! If I could give this place 0 stars I would! Gross!!!

QNsbjHgITFt9V_1tAyUiiQ.text: A few friends and I were hung over and decided to try this restaurant because of the name, and because we got a good recommendation from a mutual friend.  Service wasn't the best. The quality of the food was alright. The cleanliness was a little better than average (since most Asian restaurants/pho restaurants aren't that clean to begin with).   There are hit and misses when it came to the food. The beef stew rice noodle I got was made very well, but two of my friends' foods looked and tasted bad. The waiter will give out suggestions, and I think those usually are the most popular/freshes/specialty things that the restaurant is known for. Order that.  I heard this place is best for late-night hangover/Pho fix. To be honest, If you were traveling here for vacation and was looking for good eats, I'd rather fork over a few extra dollars and enjoy a good buffet on the strip.

xaHOX-CLwOfzaoe40nq4SA.text: If I could give this location on Spring Mountain zero stars I would. I use to love coming here with family and friends to celebrate and simply enjoy some delicious pho. But after my last experience here that changed my whole opinion. My family and I waited an hour for a table due to poor unapologetic service. We've been here in the past with 10 people and getting a table wasn't difficult but because we added one more person this time they said they were unable to seat us at a table we had sat at before due to size. I'm sorry but 1 extra person doesn't make that big of a difference. Even after we got our table (because we didn't have time to waste to go try and find someplace else) the hostess apologized in an insincere way. My family and I will sadly not be coming back to this location that I use to be so found of.

8kVWLn9lMtyJpNGzGFiU4g.text: 24 hour pho - what's not to like?  For whatever it's worth, I'm from Los Angeles (born and raised). I know pho. I've been eating it ever since I was a pubescent teen.   Pho Kim Long is good. Whether it be day time or night or dawn, you can always expect decent portions and decent taste from this place.   What really made me a fan was the customer service. I went here to eat at 4:30AM and yet there were more than 5 staff (waiting tables) willing and able to heed my beckoning calls.   Pho Kim Long is not only clever (in name), but in business practice and taste.   4 STARS well deserved! I would have given it a 5-star had all members of my party been fully satisfied. Unfortunately, we had a couple unhappy campers.   Even so, I heavily encourage a visitation.

40DJvqCZ_lL85ZR5IMpvTQ.text: First pho place I went to outside California, who knew Vegas has a decent pho place! I liked the atmosphere and the environment. Service was fast and friendly and the bowl of pho was pretty damn good. I had my share in pho and this is one of the top, maybe top 15. The broth was not too sweet or too sour; it had the right consistency to it. They gave us a lot of noodles but that's not a bad thing made me full pretty fast. The meat is good, very little though compared to some places.  Will come back here whenever I go back to Vegas.

hCKOAz0Zx9V6ynHoLE3KGw.text: Okay... Vegas may not be San Jose or LA's Little Saigon when it comes to Vietnamese food. However, with that being said, this joint really isn't too shabby either.  Pho Kim Long (that name will never cease to get a chuckle out of me) is the go-to late night spot to get your drunk grub on. I've been here way too many times for my own good, as my state of sobriety while eating here is usually (although not always!) questionable. Regardless, the food is solid and the locals seem to love it.  When I came to Vegas this past June for EDC (yep, as in the Electronic Daisy Carnival 2012 ---- suuuuch a crazy experience, btw), company preferred ordering family style dishes like shaking beef, ong choy, pork spare ribs etc. Everything was quite tasty and portions were ample, but I got the impression that this place catered more to American tastes. The dishes, while yummy in my tummy, were more like something you might find in a mainstream Chinese restaurant than authentic Viet food. Still, no real complaints as it was delicious nevertheless.  During my last trip over Halloween weekend, though, I ordered more "True" Viet fare like seafood noodle soup and Bun Bo Hue. I was surprised that the taste and quality were above average. Definitely better than Tung Kee Noodlehouse and probably better than a good portion of pho spots back home! I can see why the locals took me here so often because if *I* was local, I'd probably become a regular too.  However, here's the issue:  NOT being a local, I'm on vacation. And should be eating Vegas-y thangs. Elsewhere. Thangs that are NOT pho. Since I can get plenty of it. Authentic, at that. At home.  So...... basically......  Eat it if you're a local, eat if you're drunk and broke, eat it if you want Viet food while in Vegas. Heck, I'd do the same. If none of these things apply, though? And you have a choice to eat something else? I would. Because dammit, it's called a vacation. Feed me fancy things. Because that's what I want. Hence.... 3 stars.

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue aka spicy beef noodle soup. Nomz...
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hu tieu mi kho. Pretty legit. I used to think is place was a lot more whitewashed than it was... I stand corrected. :)

l6Ov_nXJBDmmW1rVC5zEFg.text: Food is bomb!!! I love the chicken pho and taro boba but the employees are super stingy and ask for tip but don't even check up on you to see if you're doing good unless they want you to leave.

-0iiYOBlKZUWRXX3S2GwYg.text: Things have changed......came back for the calamari  and the filet mignon pho'....... service was terrible!  The waiters acted as if we were annoying them or something...like waiting on us was a  waist of their time?  The food came out quickly, but had to wrestle up a waiter for drink refill, and when refilling my son's sprite... they poured water in his soda and walked off like nothing had happened. The quality of the Pho' isn't what past experiences has brought me to remember...not even close to the amount of noodles they used to give and the broth was mediocre at best...... I was sooooo looking forward to my old Pho Kim Long, and this wasn't it!!

ehPRBRr2NWnSjg15cz9lGw.text: This place was okay. We waited over 30 minutes to be seated despite plenty of tables being available. The workers just sort of ignore you and are running around seemingly short staffed. Once we did get our table we felt so incredibly rushed it was slightly uncomfortable.   As for the food, we ordered a classic pho which was rather large and had plenty of noodles- the broth its self was certainly homemade but relatively bland. The best purchase we made was the Mongolian beef and beer. The Mongolian beef isn't served with rice so make sure to get a side order. The flavor was excellent and the beef strips weren't fatty, I would order it again.   They lose stars for the level or service and unimpressive pho. Kudos for the great Mongolian beef.

8W_QeleLDHXxPLJmQJt8NA.text: Came here and ordered vermicelli with egg rolls and pork along with spring rolls. Portions is good but one of the waitresses forced me to tip 15% for my party of 6 when I was already tipping 12%. Tipping is optional and up to the customers discretion. This is one of the rare occasions where I was forced by a restaurant to tip more. Shake my head you lost my business...

z1Jkftd8wgWGeYkRuRgxrw.text: No matter how busy this place gets, the servers seem to know how to keep up with the pace. Their food always comes out hot and it has never disappointed me the many times I come in here. I always get #15, and they have a choice of a large and regular bowl. The prices are not astronomical so it's worth it for what you get. Just be prepared for the lines because it's usually packed.

9hubS47E1i2HEOyBHRV7iw.text: I've been here numerous of times when I were in vegas. This is a really good Pho place. love coming here in the morning for eating something just light and some hot soup. Staffs here are friendly and nice. very good service. They also open for 24/7. awesome

3RJFXvD-APTkxgqoiLefiA.text: I come here all the time, I haven't ordered anything I didn't like !!! Service was great

_BxIh2eAm9DlFHDPGNRzQw.text: FRAUD!!!!!! I've never been to this restaurant before but unfortunately woke to a 90 dollar charge from this establishment. Of course I called and spoke to a manger to let him know we have never been to this restaurant and therefore the 90 dollar charge we received was fraudulent. He then insisted our card must have been stolen and we should take it up with our bank. We informed him that our card wasn't stolen and is still in our possession yet he continued to argue that it must have been stolen. I'm not sure how this person managed to do this and I understand that maybe nothing could be done after they already charged the 90 dollars to our account. But after our conversion with this manger he still went ahead AFTER we informed him that this was someone committing fraud with our information and charged us an additional 20 dollars!!! Needless to say I'm pissed and will be going down to their place of business to discuss this in person.

DsCTreKkDLK4CUgmbiXPlA.text: It was 9am on a Saturday morning, and we're awake and hungover.  Pho Kim Long to the rescue!  We were staying at the Venetian, and had no idea where to go.  I searched Yelp, and voila! Pho Kim Long was only half a mile away.    I ordered my usual pho dac biet.  The prices were slightly higher than what I was used to in San Francisco, but it was well worth it. I'm not sure if it was because I was hungover or because I hadn't had pho in a long time, but I thought the broth was fantastic!  Everything else in the bowl was standard.  But my one gripe is that there was not tripe!    I've found my new go-to hangover spot in Vegas, and they're open 24 hours!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Dac Biet

6nFAytcIL-_iD-aWhtvrJg.text: The very first time I ever tried Vietnamese food years ago wasn't spectacular.  I'm glad somebody took me to Pho Kim Long and now, I'm hooked.  Pho in some places have that eeewww taste to it from not scooping out the gray meat foam when they boil the meat.  At Pho Kim Long, I've never had a bad bowl of pho.  It always tastes clean.  I get the one with the brisket and rare steak all the time...sooo good!  I also like their charbroiled porkchop with rice, egg rolls and spring rolls with Thai tea on the side.  Come here any time of the day since they're open 24hours/day.  Good place after partying, nursing a hangover or just because they have good pho (pronounced 'fuh' not 'foe').  Remember, you're coming here for the food, nothing else.  Expect obnoxious and sober tourists from 6pm to 11pm, obnoxious and drunk tourists from midnight to 5am Friday to Sunday, and locals all other times/days.

I had to wave the waiter down and ask him whatsup with my order. He ran to the back super fast and came back with my bowls in 5 minutes. And finally brought the thai tea after. Terrible servicio. Mesera de mal humor y grosera. Se tardan en atenderte para las bebidas... ya ni hablar de la comida.  No vale la pena

IRA8Y17enBvDJQQUEwAiuw.text: Horrible powder Pho! Don't eat here unless you are dying for pho after the club. They have the audacity to ask if u tipped your server when they don't even deserve it.

3vqJb10QOAmRj-RV938l1Q.text: Pho Kim is always a satisfying meal any time of day. Service is usually quick, same goes for time from ordering to receiving your food. Very appropriately priced in my opinion for the amount of food.  For new comers, I always suggest:  #15 - Rare Steak and Brisket Pho, #23 - Charbroiled Pork with Vermicelli and Egg Rolls, and  #38 - Roasted Cornish Hen with Seasoned Rice.   All three are my personal favorites that I feel caters also to those who aren't as curious for new things.
