EGQoHna2elp_4OPpRiwMmA.text: Popular amongst the night life crew, this place is decent. I ordered the chicken pho. The soup was alright for how much you pay. Lots of chicken, loved how they used fresh pho noodles. Service here isn't too great since they just want to feed you and get you out ASAP. Asked for a box at the end of my noodles and the guy straight up told me thats what the bag is for LOL I didn't even know this was a thing. Maybe I was being too prissy. Great place after drinking or need a quick bite but that's it.

bu8Z7XR4HJMFYmQKnB4Viw.text: Second time visiting here. It's a nice size restaurant. Was pretty busy when we first went in around lunch but cleared fast. Food came out fast, which was nice! I ordered the fresh spring rolls, they were smaller than I thought and the wrap was gummy because it was thin. I liked the peanut sauce though. The rare steak pho was really good, temperature could have been hotter. Because they are busy the service isn't the best but pho tasted great. I would come here again though, maybe when it's less busy.

Di1x65tL5TrlcTBn6Q6mUA.text: This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas. Every time I went to Las Vegas I definitely stopped by at least once. I'm a difficult person when it comes to Vietnamese food. I've tried their braised catfish, fresh rolls, fried rice, pork chop, pho, hue vermicelli, gio chao quay, and all of them satisfied me, my husband and even my picky 2 yo boy. Service was fast and helpful. Always had to wait in line but not for too long because it's a big restaurant. Highly recommend this place!

2_KBkyQNH41AIQZMYIkuXg.text: Pho was ok I've had better. Crab Ragoons were flavorful but are very small. And my fiance's orange chicken was good. I didn't like how they brought our food out 10 min apart.

1Yd0JkEekzlzgwFlLX8p-Q.text: This place has the best pot stickers/war wonton #23 lol..and chicken wraps...smoothies!!!...love it!!..thank you..

KmrK8ytyaeQw4UflAUEw_g.text: Pho = best hangover cure.   I go to Vegas a lot, and I have yet to find a legit, authentic, reasonably-priced pho restaurant on the Strip. Chinatown is worth the visit every time. The drive is not far at all. $10 max. on Uber or taxi if you don't have a car.  What's even better is that this place is open 24 hours! I like coming here on Sundays for lunch before I head back to LA. There's usually a small wait, but nothing too crazy. The restaurant is pretty big, and food comes out fast. Service is okay. Some waiters are a little rude, but they get the job done.  I usually order the rare beef and well done flank pho. They give a ton of meat. The small size is the perfect portion for me - big enough to warm me up inside and cure any headaches, but not too big where I feel like throwing it all up along with the alcohol I had the previous night.  They have many other options in addition to pho. A lot of Chinese dishes served family style. Sometimes I crave rice when I drink, so this place really covers all my drunk munchies.

g8NmfWkvxEvN2yK_udgJQw.text: We wanted something quick, but filling, before the Billy Joel concert on Saturday and decided on pho. This place has been on my "to-do" list for a while even though there are some very mixed reviews.  We waited about 5 minutes for a table, gave our order to the waitress, and were served about 5 minutes later. FAST! Tables here are turned very quickly and efficiently so they can accommodate the crowds.   We both had the number 16, combo Pho, and it was very good. The broth was not too salty or watery, there were plenty of ingredients in the broth, and the entire meal came together well. I've had slightly better pho in Vegas, but not at this price point.  Dinner for two was right at $20, which I consider to be very reasonable. I normally pay in the $15 range, per person...  The restaurant was clean, food was very good, and service was spot on as long as you realize they are able to offer these prices by turning tables quickly. If you are looking to have a leisurely meal that lasts an hour or more, this is not the restaurant for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Damn fine fast Pho.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Who can resist the name?

ysF7wsIlYyC1mEKgInabDw.text: This is an okay place. The prices aren't too hot, but hey, you're in the Las Vegas area so prices will be much more inflated.   This place seems to be popular with the locals as it was buzzing with people--for a random Thursday during the hours of lunch. The wait isn't that long though so don't fret. Our sever was semi okay, but my friends seemed to think otherwise as he made faces when my friend asked for a substitution. The food was average. I don't think any of us thought it was poorly made or anything great in nature.   I had some sort of Japanese fried noodle. I really can't remember exactly what it was. It tasted okay, but I thought it was a bit on the oily side. I think other menu item choices would have been better. My friend's fiancee had the pho ga, he said it was good.   I really like the fact that this restaurant is in the China Town area so you can definitely take your pick of other restaurants. There's plenty of dessert and drink choices to chose from as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The name of the strip where Pho Kim Long is located in.

yUE12PioZEY-VxuxqRSaVA.text: The alpha and the omega. The big daddy. The head honcho. This is the be all and end all of Pho in Las Vegas. The gold standard to which all delicious Vietnamese beef broths shall be held. It's 24 hours. It's fast. It's cheap. And more than anything it's very very tasty. If you're new to Vietnamese food get the rare steak pho. If you're slightly more adventurous get the special combination (my favorite) garnish with your chosen amounts of fresh herbs and sauces and you'll be in happy tummy heaven! The other dishes here are also tasty and filling. Don't forget this place on late night drunken prowls, Vietnamese pho bats really high in late night food!

c1KVdnxrmE1HEzPfoqBlkg.text: We used to look forward to having dinner here when we were in town, but last night was so disappointing. All the meals but one were brought out, I don't know what happened but when we asked it appears the kitchen tried to rush out the dish which ended up being gooey under cooked seafood. The food used to be so good but everyone  in our group said there food was just not good last night.

Ma-iGx_01T0BId59_WXsZA.text: I've only tried two orders so far. A combo beef bowl and a Vietnamese coffee that is iced. Nothing really stood out unfortunately with just one visit. The place is pretty big and they delivered pho as it should be. However a few questionable things regarding their service. When I came in, the table I had come to still had a bean sprout laying on the table making it uncertain if the table was indeed cleaned or not. However I was greeted promptly as I came in. The water they served was clear and no specks were visible. The Vietnamese coffee was bitter and sweet as it should be ^_^ and my Pho came in a timely manner. The beef was placed in raw which I expected and it was cooked just in time. The bean sprouts in the side however was very moist and looked soggy. Unfortunately I did not try it since I was too concerned on how questionable it looked. Over all the ambience was decent, the staff was above average.  In the end however left a bad taste on my first and maybe only visit; my receipt had the tip suggestion encircled, which to me seemed passive-aggressively demanding.   Overall I give this place a thumbs up. I got my order, got what I wanted and no mistakes were made. Only graded this place down for poor customer service and questionable food prep and cleanliness.

_tAH3WyI95-KMCEtImqVlg.text: My go to spot in Vegas for good Vietnamese food anytime of day since it's open 24 hrs a day.  I usually get the charbroiled chicken vermicelli bowl.  Egg rolls are yummy too.

Pu6E0YJtRGgGEMRU-xw_yw.text: Used to like this place. But the attitude of the staffs not friendly and they only care about their tips. Especially when you pay with credit card, they even try ask how much and write the tips amount for you.  I predict that the restaurant will be going downhill soon.

z1MQ_5aO0upKCbR1opV7vg.text: The worst pho and Bun Bo Hue I have had in Vegas. The broth has no depth of flavor, or in fact, much flavor at all of any kind. I felt like I was sipping a bowl of hot water with mediocre noodles in it. Moreover, the Bun Bo Hue advertised pork feet, but had no meat from the trotters, only a generous serving of bones and inedible gristle. I love bits of tender tendon or well cooked pig's feet but this was dreadful. Add a largely indifferent plus inattentive service atmosphere and you have a restaurant succeeding purely on location. Pho kim long is right in the middle of things, surrounded by excellent restaurants, many if which I frequent. This had to be the worst I have found.

0CACsaIsTEvxueeTR-x1ZA.text: Service is fast. Sometimes there's a wait to be seated. Late night crowd fills the place up. Love the pho & vermicelli bowls. Spring rolls and fried rolls are great too. My picky little nephews love their chow mein & orange chicken. They have Thai tea & boba slushes. This is our go to for pho. The broth has a better flavor than other places.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pho

NDpU7GF3mFbpwFolngkNgQ.text: My boyfriend, his family and I come here for the teriyaki chicken and its definitely worth the drive! Very quick service, and the chicken comes with veggies and rice. The sauce they use is very sweet which is why we are all addicted to this place now! I prefer to get my sauce on the side so I can gauge how much flavor I want with my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki chicken with sauce on side

T_2LA4iB5KE4Q9qElfF4cA.text: Food is good, great selection and variety. There is almost always a wait due to the heavy traffic surrounding their location.   Service is disappointing and not very accommodating. They want to charge you more if you ask for broth on the side or extra veggies basil, limes etc.

IllEwS0Qhk9a0yiNnWbPkw.text: First time here.  The atmosphere is a great.  The server could use some manners.  She's kind of rude.  She doesn't listen and likes to interrupt when you try. To order.  Also grabs things on front of you while your tying to talk or order.  I wouldn't come back.  I could say more but I'll let you be the judge of it

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s a nice place.  Just rude people working

SMVQjxlzhU8MLMf10vV0TQ.text: Simply the Best what can I say Services great food is phenomenal if you need good Asian food or pho you need to come here the best in Vegas without a doubt hands down been coming here for years and going to continue we move to California wish we didn't because we miss this place

E1mH3F-GJxcPiNP9n4NhWQ.text: This pho place was just okay. Our wait time wasn't too bad, just 5 minutes.   I got the pho tai bo vien and it was okay. Some of the meats didn't seem like it cooked all the way through. The broth, however, was tasty. The service was also really good. They made sure we had our waters filled and was really friendly. We were all able to pay separately which was a plus as well. That's what I like about pho places. No need to calculate the bill because they do it for you. Overall, it was a decent experience.

cWBTFw6d1I8-uI4LXs1fZw.text: Hard to tell how I felt about this place.   We had a party of four but when we were seated one of the people went to the bathroom. My friend told me the waitresses hound you to order quickly. She probably came over 3 times total while he was in the restroom asking if we were ready to order. He hadn't even come back yet and we had to keep telling her this.  I was happy to get a vegan pho. It was so good a huge! I don't know if anything else is vegan. Their boba drinks are made with half and half (told by server).  I'd go back, but I might consider other places since there are so many around.

yu_J7tPv4q9Ef8w__jIUFw.text: Vegas maybe the only city that does not have a decent chinese restaurant 9am in the morning.  When we are running out of options, this 24hr joint is a savior.  beef stew is quite "chinese" but the pad thai is really bad. I know, ordering a thai food in a Vietnam/chinese fusion 24hr joint has red flags all over it

2Nrsl-4ioZed2ksuFfuAOg.text: Pho Kim Long isn't great. It isn't horrible either.  Pho Kim Long has been my go-to for pho for the last few months for my lunch breaks. I like how their service is quick and the food comes out quick. Lots of people waiting for a table? No worries. The wait is never that long. Their take out is also quick. Therefore, I could get a good meal in before my lunch break ends.   I ONLY come here for their pho and fried egg rolls. I don't order anything else other than that.  I typically order the pho tai, which is the pho with rare steak.   The consistency, however, is not always there. Sometimes the broth is good, but sometimes the broth is really watered down.   Best part of Pho Kim Long is that it's open 24 hours. Late night clubbing and got hungry? No problem. Pho Kim Long it. Late night hotel party and got hungry? No problem. Pho Kim Long it. Late night drinking and got hungry? No problem. Pho Kim Long it. Shitfaced and hungry? No problem. Pho Kim Long it. HAHA You get the idea!  Though, one time, it took them 20 minutes to get my take out order ready. So that was a meh :/

khFTzxatYhL3-pmM7WUHug.text: The restaurant is nice and clean and can accommodate large parties. Service is quick and food comes out so fast! The drunken noodles were really good. The fried rice and hen with rice were not. Boba is terribly gross but the fresh coconut juice is a must get.   When I got up to pay, the cashier was soooo rude! He combined all of our bills together and got mad when we asked to split it three ways by table. (We're a party of 14 and sat at three separate tables) He said, "how am I supposed to know who ordered what?!" Then he didn't allow us to. And charged us 18% gratuity. That's a whole lot of undeserved gratuity! We left the restaurant very upset. Don't expect them to split bills for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken noodles with beef

SnK0d_eAef65yAtIorg7Lg.text: Poor service, decent price for the amount of food but long wait time for your food, came out tasted blanc, not authentic. The only good thing is they open 24/7, not worth a try.

Aadw7MkuRuyA3JoGbFs4RQ.text: Always convenient everytime I get weird shifts and this place is open. I call to order to go food. And also love the to go fresh coconut with meat drink.

OOrJYseVePm7ZUsTiJtykQ.text: There are good days and there are bad days. However, a bowl of pho always sounds good after a night in Vegas. Being Vietnamese and living in LA, I've had my fair share of pho and this place is decent and usually hits the spot. The broth is okay and I find that on some days they skip out on the green onions and cilantro in the pho. The last time I went, my bowl looked pretty sorry and plain. I usually get the Pho Tai (rare steak meat) and if I'm feeling extra hungry, the egg rolls with peanut sauce. The egg rolls are so bomb!! This place usually gets pretty packed and at the times the service is almost inexistent. Make sure you ask for everything you want (extra onions, peanut sauce, etc) at the beginning so you don't end up having to flag someone down.

UmNDDkwPnlZ1gF6Wc-57Kw.text: Heart of Vegas's Chinatown. This little gem is a must if you are seeking a delicious bowl of Pho! Open 24 hrs, this place won't dissatisfy. Try them with their rolls, just Phoking awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hke3TnN8zeMfQ-Pg48NHcg.text: This is a 24/7 pho place!!! Thank GOD! We went around midnight and there was a waitlist. We waited about 15 min but every table was taken up!!! We ordered 4 bowls of pho, pad Thai, and Pork rice plate. Pho: 3/5 the broth was mediocre I can't complain bc as long as it's 24/7 I'm happy!! Pork Rice plate: 3.5/5 decent flavors the eggrolls was on quite on the oily side. Good amount of food. Pad Thai: 5/5 this dish caught me off guard it was bomb.com! I wasn't expecting pad Thai to come off good from a Vietnamese Resturant but heyyyy it was delicious! I recommend for those who like pad Thai! Service was so awesome! 10/10 so fast! we sat ordered and within 5 min our food was on the table!! Like wth????!! Workers are great especially with the flow of ppl!

eHsxZ9-n_iov8MM6qHPwdg.text: This place is busy at lunch time! If you decide to go don't be shocked that the line is out the door. The waiting area is very small and there isn't much room outside on the sidewalk either.   We were told our table was ready so we followed the lady towards the back of the restaurant. As we were walking another group of people stood up from their table and the hostess says to us " oh you wait 3 min and you take that table instead."  So we waited as they cleared our table. When it was cleaned we sat down and they brought our plates and utensils. There were food particles on some of them so we pushed them off to the side. My daughter grabbed some chopsticks and those had a piece of dried on paper stuck to them. Ewwww  We ordered our food and waited. I realize that they are busy but drinks should not take so long as to come out before food.   All the food tastes good. I love the chicken wings. In my opinion they are the best anywhere. They have some kind of garlic seasoning on it without being over garlicky. We ordered chicken chow mein, shrimp chow mein, pad tai and beef chow fun. Yeah we ordered a bunch of needles. LoL. The noodles tasted good. Chow fun is my favorite kind of noodle.   What was weird is when I got my bill, the lady asked  me how much I would tip. I told he $18 then she went off to process my credit card. When it came back she had written in the amount. Huh? It was also written weird. I rewrote what the tip was and signed the CC statement. It was very bizarre experience that day. If that had been my first experience there I'm not sure I would be going back. Since I have been there several time I know this is not the norm.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings. Love them but wish the wings were bigger.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our pile of clean dishes that were brought out to us that were dirty.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chow fun

ZDc8C0Inhdmpd5_-POZnbg.text: Not a bad place, I came here after work one cold early morning. I had the pho, and spring rolls, that's what I usually get when I come to pho places. That or the egg rolls. Really like that this place is open 24/7 healthier then fast food  it was slow, service was fast, bathrooms where clean when I was in there.  not a bad place.

bPbGxMddut84v0wtuqlWXw.text: I just found a new, late spot to get really good food!  This place was packed, no waiting.  We were here at 11:30PM, lots of beautiful people, and really enjoyable food. I ordered egg rolls first. They were cold, I sent them back, and they made them right!  They were piping hot, and my shrimp and noodles were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved this dish, shrimp and the rice noodles.  Had great taste!  I&#39;m will defiantly be back.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari was good.  A little on the greasy side for me though.  I did enjoy it though.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

na1SfpTx3Z1KXDn1ea7omA.text: Food was very good and service was very good.  Food came out hot and delicious.  But when it came to the bathroom facility, this fell really low on the rate scale of useable.  There needs to be a complete renovation of the bathroom.  Stall door needs to be completely fixed.  Provisions of the paper towels needs to be re-supplied. RE-do the whole bathroom.

nYZG6KnKop9N225mn30hag.text: Everything I've gotten here has been pretty good but not as authentic as I would have thought. Love the meat on the pho it's perfect and compliments the soup perfectly. All the appetizers are good as well as the drinks

hPSzqGTNKuMW3QXbpZmREA.text: Holy crap I was in a cab in Vegas headed to the Bellagio buffet when my cab driver recommended we try this place. He said it was great. My friend that was with me eats only gluten free so we called ahead and asked if they had GF options, they said they did. Pulled up there was a long line outside. The line did move fast, we only waited about 15 minutes. Once we were seated nobody came around for our order for a while then when a waitress came she was rushing us and knew nothing about the menu. Nobody knew what GF even meant once we got there. I thought maybe the food would make up for the bad service. It didn't. Got a huge bowl of egg drop soup and orange chicken. The soup was on par with low end restaurants close to home and the orange chicken was not fresh and not good. If you're in Vegas stay on the beaten path!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1sWtJEpZrBRjUr1oJnuCsA.text: Last night I was asked to head out and try a new Chinese eatery, and of course who wouldn't right.  I walked into Pho Kim and was greeted within minutes, I signed in and did not have to wait very long to be seated. This place is open 24 hours a day 7 days a week.   So I sat,  was greeted by the server within seconds,  he brought us waters and went through the menu with us quickly. I ordered Terarki chicken and it was the best I have ever had. Being from the east, and living so close to NYC, and NJ I have had my fair share of A+ food, but this has to be the best I have tasted since my move West.  The price for the amount of food was worth the drive from one end of town to the other.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken teriyaki

BNKAZww2b2qJUhzQxqBz7g.text: Love the food here service is ok language barrier is kind of a pain but overall the are fast

l7zu-ZLM1a6iKgUtppoD2Q.text: Great Pho, always long line and waiting , food quality is consistent but not service.  Sometime you can see staffs running around , Not really pay attention to details... serving you .  But if you are here to seek for service , you will be disappointed, but great authentic Vietnamese food, pho noodle . You will not be disappointed

l1XOshzyZSqjknT8chFf9A.text: I've been to this restaurant over 10x and tonight  I ordered the udon noodle stir fry with chicken.  First, the dish comes out and it's on a small plate; not the regular stir fry plate which is fine but I made a comment like wow that's small for $14 to my server(he was cool).  Then, I noticed the plate is super greasy. Like the noodles were sitting in a oil sauce. I take a bite and the udon is super greasy. So I flag my waiter down and instantly he says; "yea it even looks greasy let me tell my manager." So he takes my plate and he stops the manager about a table away, hands him my plate who hands it to another waiter who then hands it back to my waiter. He comes back over to tell me that the manager said no I can't send it back. So my response was "can your manager come over here please?" So then the manager comes to tell me that's not the portion it comes in and that it looks like I ate half.... wtf that's what I said when it came out. So what do I want? This man takes the plate and throws it on the empty table to the right of us. We are in disbelief the guy at the table on the left of us starts apologizing because he can't believe what he just saw.  We all work in the service industry and couldn't believe it. Then my waiter had asked what I would like instead and I said a small rare beef pho, he said ok....  15 minutes go by, the guy on our left who is also a frequent diner here is literally in disbelief we all were just chatting about how crazy this experience has been and how the quality of this restaurant has gone down in the last few months.   Our waiter comes and asks if we're ready for the check and so I go "do I not get pho?"  And informs us that the manager refused to let him ring in another order for me...... ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I never once asked for anything but edible food. Even stated that I didn't care about paying, I just wanted to eat!!!!!! Like are you fucking kidding me!!!!!!!!!!!! I literally never cuss and especially not in a public setting like this. I love pho and I love pho Kim long but I have never ever in my life had such terrible customer service in my life. The waiter then apologized and said that he was so sorry and said that the manager is kinda crazy and he has no idea why everyone was in a bad mood tonight!!!!!!!! If I could give this waiter a job elsewhere I most definitely would. I am so dissatisfied and disappointed in this restaurant.

5i5G6YlVAWHxic_CG65-2w.text: I ordered Bun Bo Hue, took 30 mins with very cold broth. They also rushed to push you out after finishing meal.

au7C_suJTLlo9PHYLLhhkQ.text: For the price the broth honestly isn't good. 8+ dollars is a joke y'all don't be fooled. AND you suppose to chose between a small and large. Smh wild.

Neux1pORru3M0MDLha78MQ.text: You drag yourself out of your hotel room because like so many others, you did your liver no service & now you are paying the price. Hail a cab and get yourself to Pho Kim Long, which is an enormous Vietnamese restaurant that's pretty much where everyone goes to recover. The pho is pretty good -- fragrant with lots of meat and noodles, served in big bowls that will not only provide you with much-needed hydration, but carbs to soak up that alcohol, protein to give you energy, salt to replenish your electrolytes. It's not so much an eating destination for flavor, although this can be an experience in and of itself considering that a lot of people go here, but a place you go for much-needed recovery. My only quibbles: sometimes there's a wait, sometimes the wait for the pho can be longer than expected. It gets busy. There is, admittedly, sometimes a language barrier. Just embrace it, eat you pho, maybe meander through the plaza to go grab more food to eat in the dark hovel of your hotel room in shame & recover because let's be honest, you're going to do the same thing all over again.  Must-gets: pho... come on. But I'm a softy for anything w/ brisket & rare steak, and even though I don't usually like them, like, ever, this is the one place I like their meatballs.

MZsoERsGvByIZPbmfxKRDg.text: The best pho place in town. I have been coming here for years and their veggie broth is way better than any place I've been to. They are always busy so that's a good sign and they're open 24 hours. I love that it's right next to great shops.

HbGWhLRrxKfIH5tLMDCrlQ.text: The food was good. Reasonably priced.  So our waiter was Chuan Van and he was very attentive and helpful, he only been there three weeks but was very comfortable with our jokes and laughed with us.

KaCoxQHBPlGZSOxnFAL_IQ.text: In A Nutshell:  -This Pho Kim Long used to be the sh*t, now it tastes like sh*t. -Way too much MSG. -The broth wasn't even hot, we had to order an extra bowl of hot broth. -The noodles & slices of meat are lacking, please add more. -With all of the pho spots available in Vegas, you'd think this OG spot would adapt & improve.  Overall, please don't come here it's just not worth it anymore, I'd try one of the other pho spots next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Tai Chin.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra fat + green onions to boost your pho.

b5z2SOYZwcDvanMNi3ssxw.text: I really like the pho here, I have also tried several other Vietnamese places and they are not bad but their style here is my favorite. We love coming here after a late night out and the food comes out pretty quickly. Service is typically not great but the pho is!

3EONJ3PYpOOJPUBF1NAH-A.text: My place to go when I am up for a quick meal. All tastes pretty decent and the service is very efficient. I love that they are open 24 hours

LpmKMCKKDCxQxMHTADrmJw.text: This place used to be my goto place for pho and bun. Now, every time I go there it just plain stinks. It smells like wet rag. The service sucks, nobody checks on you, and it's too crowded. Gross. Never coming here again. Jenni pho is my go to place now. Cleaner, well decorated, and pho tastes better.

VPwFzzqUnJRJF6z9Elhk8A.text: Make reservations. this place had a line out the door. The Taxi driver even said it was his favorite restaurant. the Walnut shrimp was great

N3nhoWGN8u9ie2hXwU2OKg.text: Great Pho, as always. I tried the drunken noodles and it was amazing! I have yet to try something I don't like. We drive over 30 minutes to get here and it's well worth the drive.

1nVdxpwBw4biRdqjyoFQtw.text: Huge fan of the chicken fried rice.  Great service and 24 hours. Should be rated 6 stars.

cEojhWjKJ8MwquUliR0_xQ.text: I give the food 4.5 stars but the service sucks late night. Why be open when the clubs get out and there's no staff.

zCyofM_C693A48b05Odifw.text: I came here for lunch today & already want to go back. It's located directly behind my apt complex so access is very easy & tempting. For being such a busy place with diverse ethnicity groups eating here they sure to handle the traffic well. I ordered the fish fillet & mixed greens with great delight. The fish was soooooo tender & full of flavor I couldn't stop putting it down. The mixed greens were very fresh & full of flavor as well. I also ordered some chicken lettuce wraps on the side & those were good as well, nothing spectacular but definitely up to par. Would I go back?? YES!!! Also, going to bring some family through here also

B8jPPztrlxHjthJdBDO8mA.text: **** Good if  late night and you're high/drunk/under the influence ****   The Pho is overpriced and salty.  I guess they can afford to do so since it's close to the strip.  Just drive down the street to Pho So 1.  The only reason why I like this place is to give my tourist friends a laugh when they see the sign.  My 12 year old side wants to call them on speed dial so I can hear them answer.

YVLc7a6MtYmzQ94Gm9kNrw.text: BEST PLACE TO GET HANGOVER PHO, HANDS DOWN!  The delicious beef broth, light rice noodles, and strips of beef are sooooo delicious. Also, I've never had to wait longer than 10 minutes to get seated here. Not only is this place open till the wee hours of night, long after you've consumed multiple shots of alcohol and danced your booty off, but there's nothing better to cure a typical Vegas hangover than some MORNING-AFTER PHO!! I know there's now places to get pho on the Strip, but Pho Kim Long tastes authentic and you can get a decent meal for under 10 bucks.   I love this place. And it's a cult favorite. Literally every time I go I unintentionally run into someone I either know from 1) my sorority, 2) Los Angeles, or 3) other random people.  Virtually everyone who's a Vegas regular knows about this place and has been here.  And FYI - I have also had pho here when I was NOT drunk, and enjoyed it!  Recently they've had a restaurant makeover, making the place more classy. Yes, you can expect to see people there of all ages - from seniors, to children, to under dressed club hos.  Parking is easy as it is located in a small Asian strip mall. It's also about a 10-15 minute drive from the Strip, which is not exactly pedestrian friendly but definitely worth the trip if you have a car.

n8XZckfElDtGr698lqQc4Q.text: What. A. Joke. Las Vegas? What on EARTH are you thinking?!  It's 2am. I want some pho. To YELP I go. This seems to be the only place open. Parked. I see a sign that says they were voted best pho in LV and there is a wait. Yes, a 20 minute wait at 2am. It must be decent. BOY WAS I WRONG!  We were told it'd be a 20 minute wait so we just took a quick walk down the strip mall. We came back not 5 minutes later and waited another 20 minutes. I eventually go up and ask him when our table will be ready and he said that our names were called like 20 minutes ago. Say what? So apparently a 20 minute wait means 5 minutes now? Get your timing right! So i asked to be put back on the list and there was probably another 4-5 groups that came after me. Well, he sat all of them first. We  only needed a 3-top and all those other groups were pretty much the same size if not larger. I reminded him and he barely even gave me any attention. Eventually we got seated. The service sucked, the food was horrid (none of us finished), and we definitely didn't tip. I know the table next to us was also very unhappy and also didn't tip. You'd be lucky to get anyone's attention since they zip by you at warp speed.   It was past 3am and I was unfulfilled. I will NEVER be back here. Yelpers, this is fair warning.

ZCMt1zazYEoRR-h9MlKUJA.text: Rip off.  They think they are a 5 star restaraunt. 15% tips was automatically added to the bill. Water was not refilled until I waived down the waiter, waiter did not check to see what we neeeded, we had to pay at register.  Food B, Service C, Atmosphere B, Price C.

fjJDG9vnXJDiARhbBINO1A.text: The place was busy but there was still a lot of open tables, they sat us down and waited 15 minutes and no one ever came to our table to take our order so I raised my hand and called the skinny Asian guy that always wears a tight white dress shirt and told him we had been waiting for over 10 minutes already and no one had taken our order, his reply was "you have not been here for 10 minutes" I told him we had been here for 15 minutes and his reply was "so are you going to order or are you going to leave?", we went ahead and ordered and got our order pretty quick, but the pho was very salty and had very little steak and noodles and a lot of broth. To sum it all up the guy was very rude and the pho was not good, we don't plan on coming here again, there are a lot better places in town for pho.

3BrAEl3b_hVPZiqow33nUg.text: I MADE A YELP ACCOUNT just to share my experience !! Okay so straight to the point.. I found a SCRAP/CANNED piece of METAL inside my boba smoothie ! This is so disappointing & especially for one of the top known Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas. I took my smoothie home because I've gotten full from their food but as I started drinking my smoothie... I don't know if the little piece of "sharp" metal was in my actually drink or in the boba balls but regardless it SHOULDN'T had even been in the drink !!! Huge warning/red flag!!! It's sad.. The food was pretty good. But I'm never coming back. Chew your food carefully, you never know what you could potentially be swallowing.

3oZ1IMFsOxybd7CIXYZfAg.text: I am a fan. and this is why. The Pho may not be the best you've ever tasted, but Its pretty damn good. I mean really how many ways is there to make Pho? Had the Beef tendon pho, it hit the spot. Aside from the pho, they're ong choy (water spinach) was sauteed well, great sauce. Fried Calamari, was probably the best i have had, I couldnt stop eating it. and the roast duck had a lot of flavor, and you could tell it was made fresh, not re-heated. I can't seem to get a grasp on what type of sauce it was. the salted fish fried rice was also flavor, and you could actually taste the salted fish unlike other places (sam woo). these items are some of the same dishes I get at several asian restaurants just to compare, and the version here are right up there to one of the best i have had.   Just to comment on people talking about service and such, I don't mean to be harsh, or offend the asian culture, because I consider myself asian myself. But the bad service? first these types of places is not a pf changs or a pei wei. they're not here to ask you how your day is going. they're just not, some of them don't even speak english. yes when they bring out the food to you, sometimes they rush, or kind of pack all the dishes on the table, looking like they slam the plates on it., theyre a little rough and maybe your oolong tea spills a little from your cup. you know what thats a sign of? that it's authentic. Some of the best places I have eaten at in California were like this. actually my favorite place back home, was like this, won't exactly strike you as fine dining and not the most polite servers but best food hands down. I once went to a place in San Francisco, where you had to go down they're basement to go to the bathroom, a little scary, but what shocked me more was how good they're food was

etN2wD7ggUaWDhITs8Pk9A.text: Just terrible for vegas standards. Plenty of better places. You have to be really wasted if you think this place is good. Food was not very fresh especially seafood used in the salads and spring rolls. I had hue style beef stew Pho. I am still traumatized by it. One of the worsen I've had in my life and they had carrots chunks that were raw and you could not even bite into it

RMywIxF0dGp3e4-nm4ucdA.text: Went her with a friend, and we order the noodle soup. It was really good I decided to get shrimp with it. The soup came out fast, but the service was very poor such as having to flag down the waiters for the bill. I will be going back.

aBdjkvdz34WSYVoBEVh-4Q.text: Best pho in town!  This place gets packed fast!!!! So show up before busy hours if you know you're gonna be hungry for food here. We've left the place a couple times because the wait list was pretty long. I have kids so their hunger wouldn't last the wait time.

KTMQTQP-Pc4cL_ch6yBZQQ.text: Even though this is a Vietnamese restaurant, we always visit here for the Chinese food.  In fact, this is the Chinese food place we like to take guests too... I really really enjoy the food here.  The ambience of the place is not bad actually.  The decorate the place well, its large, and its cleaner than most Asian restaurants.  I think the prices are fair also - about 10 bucks a dish (more or less), I think maybe 7 for the pho.  Portions are of decent size.  I can't say much about the pho here, because I never really order it.  The boyfriend does though, and I've tasted it.  I think it's just OK.   When I go here, there are always dishes that I always have to get because it's DELICIOUS and awesome:  - House special pan fried noodles (chow mein)... Noodles soft in the middle, crispy on edges (AWESOME).  Saucy, flavorful and lots of goodies like bok choy and shrimp.  - The cubed beef with Chinese broccoli - Make sure you specifically ask for the cubed beef - they have regular beef and broccoli which is not so good.  The cubed beef is pretty much a MUST HAVE.  - Salt and Pepper Porkchops or Squid - Depending on my mood... love to have some deep fried pork chips or calamari with salt and pepper seasonings with my meal.  YUM.  The one thing about this place which I wish I could change is the wait staff.  It always feels like are trying to get you in and out quickly... and they aren't the friendliest either.  The service is usually pretty quick though I guess.  Also on the plus side, they are open all night so it's a great place to hit up after drinking.    Overall - even though the service is MEH... I have to give it at least a 4 just because of my favorite dishes I mentioned above.

fJ-X40xj__yGITbmr8HVng.text: So much to say about this place, but like the place itself, I'll keep it simple.    First off, leave your snobby expectations of phenomenal service at the door.  That's not the reason you're here.  You're here because it's late, and I mean really late, and you want something to help with your current...umm...'condition.'  And this place has exactly what you need.  Get the Fried Egg Rolls and some Pho Tai Chin and you're in business!  You'll be feeling a whole lot better come Sunday morning, trust me.

9C0M2qtx4uWzXIlREFp9FQ.text: Went based on reviews here and the reviews def were right. The place is very good. Nicer and more formal than most Pho places.  The vietnamese coffee was good but was shocked they go ahead and do it for you and put it in a to go cup.  Kind of killed the usual experience.    The salt and pepper calamari was great. The meatball pho was excellent and the broth was light and not oily. Lots of selection!!  Look at the whole menu before you order.  No tripe though ... which I was very shocked by,

The pho was bland and the meat ball was very chewy. My egg rolls were over cooked and burnt. The only thing I enjoyed was the spring roll. Never coming back!

61HTaUhabYeDVV84hXhgNg.text: Food is TOO SALTY from using TOO MUCH....MSG....Service is BAD also as you have to ask 3 waiter just to get what you needed. Sometimes the PHO came out good but sometimes it taste nasty as well because you can hardly taste the soup. That you'll wonder if they put or forgot to put broth on it.  But what I HATE the MOST is the service when I ordered to GO. The manager will say over the phone that it's like 45 minutes or so. But when I got there after 1 HOUR  the manager will say that it's NOT YET READY, that I have to WAIT ANOTHER 20 minutes for them to get me the soup. I DON'T KNOW IF HE DO IT ON PURPOSE OR WHAT??? And this is the third time already that they did this.  It's his voice on the phone how I can tell he's the one that looked my order. THE MANAGER HIMSEL AT THE FRONT.  NASTY ATTITUDE...that I won't forget. Infac t, sometimes when we passes by and saw that it was him  in the front we just live and decided not to eat just so that we don't get this kind of service. WHAT A WASTE OF TIME....   I would have give a 0 (ZERO) OR  even negative 1 for the score but it wasn't here. It's for sure that they're pretty busy but that's not an excuse to disrespect a customer.

JV-fyH89KLnojgeCQhCHdw.text: I come here often & the foods good but their service jus sucks... today we came in and yet we were seated quick but we waited so long for a waiter to get our order.. the table behind us ordered after us but they were there before us... how do we order first before them and get our food late? Then my boyfriend goes up and talks to the one guy not in uniform, he wears a hat all the time.. then he went to tell him what happened and the Uly was explains that it's there.. my bf came back  and let it go but yet the guy came after him yelling at like I sat you after them blah blah.. you ordered 2 mins ago.. and he kept saying it's fine and yet the guy kept harassing him.. then he wants to ask the guy next to us how long he's been sitting there. He got there after us and people took his order and didn't take ours. We've been ready yet they take so long to take our order. The guy in the hat kept getting into his face and harassing him. What kind of customer service is that? Like I don't care if you're a manager but if you're gonna talk to your customers rudely you shouldn't be in a place like that. Then you wanna talk to 2 customers about us and be like " they're probably having a bad day." The guy kept saying to us that maybe we're having a bad day.. you have no place to talk about us like that especially to other customers. You are in the wrong because it crosses peoples privacy. Never coming back again, I'll find a better & nicer pho place than you guys. I hope the manger reads this and thinks about how to train employees to talk to their customers

ye_OT3ubd-poRaozwgayFg.text: Pho Kim Long is a good late night eat. I've only been a couple times but it's always been really good. The pho with steak is great, I can never finish the big bowl but I eat like a mouse. This last time I went I had the chicken fried rice which was good, needed some soy sauce but was made really well, there wasn't any hard parts or uncooked chicken. Nothing crazy.

hAL3rvosdjipQEoPbEz1gw.text: Wow, 24 hours of Pho that actually tastes delicious? You have GOT to be kidding me.  We flew into Vegas and got situated in our home base (Treasure Island) at around 11pm. We got to Pho Kim Long, and giggled like idiotic teenage boys, at around midnight. The place was slammed. Super busy. We were seated immediately, and the hostess was incredibly friendly. We call this "Las Vegas" friendly. Like they're so used to tourists, it's just second nature to make the assumption that we're not from the area and treat us kindly so as not to destroy our vacation. There's a lot of this over there, and for that we're super grateful, being earthy, awkward Portlandians.   We ordered our drinks (I just had water, my partner ordered a beer) and before my partner's beer even had the chance to arrive we were served our starter (the salad rolls), followed quickly by the two delicious orders of Pho. Their peanut sauce was splendid, and the pho makes this my second favorite of all pho places I've been to, ESPECIALLY at midnight! The beer, unfortunately, came toward the end of dinner which is a no-no as far as my partner is concerned. Given the volume of customers that night, and the wonderful food and friendly, quick service, it was forgivable enough for us to come back and order take away to take back to our room a couple nights later when we were actually craving that delicious soup! We cannot wait to order from them again, in house or take away, either way the food is just as wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hehe

tHNp2ajLlMAL0_oqbI9oSA.text: Walked in and no wait time which I anticipated which doesn't bother me at all.  I ordered the rare steak & brisket soup.the portions are huge. I had at least 3 servings. The broth was amazing. Also very good customer service. I would recommend coming here for some great photo.

fdyAqJWHCwBQb2mc32BIbQ.text: The service here is incredible. Even though they have ridiculously long lines here, they get you in, fed, and out of there in record time. Pho is always the perfect after clubbing/drinking meal. The soup base here is great, not too oily, and full of beef flavor (exactly what you need to chase your hangover away). the egg rolls were pretty good too and so was the Three Colored Ice drink/dessert.

vhuv-KRijc6s2TYgOk8LWw.text: Absolutely ridiculous do NOT go here... I've been coming here for a while now & decided come at 3:30 am one night. First off the hostess was rude, telling us the wait would be way longer than 30 min while everyone was getting seated in less than 5. So because he told us it would be a long wait we decided to order to go. It was a small order there were only two of us girls and we paid first of course after he took our order. He then insists we tip him on a TO GO order ALSO insisting we give a certain amount!? Normally I would have no problem tipping even on a to go order but why would I tip before I even get my service? So he rudely makes comments under his breath when he thinks we weren't going to tip-then makes a no tip note on our order and we WATCHED people get seated on tables who came way after we ordered & RECEIVE their entire meal before us. THEN at this point we're absolutely disgusted at this service we walk up and wait directly infront of the rude cashier. We asked another worker if this was our order he was preparing because we've been waiting extremely long and the cashier leans over and tells him ITS THIS ONE- THE NO TIP NO TIP! At this point we knew he purposely made a note to have our order take way longer than it should have! PEOPLE WHO CAME 15 min after us were EATING. I am so disgusted I will NEVER give them my business again.

1Ptm4nEMW587V9UB59-CMw.text: Food is always good ... Hv been coming here for years ... Restrooms are one of the worst ... Still waiting for management to maintain restrooms as it is never ... I mean never clean   ... if not renovate ... !!

oEjbnzDGpvYgll9V_5atzQ.text: Service here is always fast and piping hot!!!  Love coming here. #13 is the best!  Lettuce wraps are very tasty as well

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #13 combination pho best tasting broth in Vegas!!

wPYeR_lqrCKvo3l8O2TasA.text: 2-Stars is me being generous.   Food: Overpriced, mediocre, nothing special, and not to mention my friend received a piece of a plastic bag in his bowl of pho and I crunched into a shell-like component in my spring roll.  - Pho: We all ordered the combination pho (pho ac biet) and it was large, tasty, but lacked a key element that we all enjoy in our combination pho - tripe. Apparently they do not sell tripe there (said the waitress). But they did make up for it by giving us generous portions of brisket and additionally included meatballs (bo vien) which I typically do not see in combination pho at other restaurants. The broth was flavorful and not too oily so that was also a plus. But I do believe a bowl of pho for about $9 is on the expensive side. All in all I would give their pho 3.5 stars.  - Spring rolls: I will post a picture of their spring rolls. They were composed of minimal elements for high-dollar. $5.50 for 2 spring rolls is super pricey in my book, especially because these spring rolls were far from anything special. Rice noodles, shredded lettuce, pork, and shrimp wrapped in rice paper (so basic!). They didn't even bother to add bean sprouts, mint leaves, or green onion to enhance the flavors. Also, their dipping sauce was a little too heavy on the peanut-side (some don't mind it but I prefer an equal balance). Never ordering spring rolls from them again (unless they actually read this post and start making better spring rolls and sauce).   Service: They took the pho (with plastic) and an order of spring rolls off our bill which was nice - but is expected when serving non-edible components in your food. When we notified our waitress about the plastic in my fiends bowl of pho, she quickly took it away and had another combination pho delivered to us pronto. The service is what saved this place from getting only 1-star.   Decor: Pretty modern but tries to keep an authentic Asian feel with the bonsai trees and fish tanks.   I suppose this place had a decent rep because it's open 24-hours and the name is catchy. I wanted to like this place but all-in-all, my experience was not one to bring me back. I can get better pho for cheaper at plenty of other places. Maybe if I was in desperate need of pho at a weird time of the night, I might settle for Pho Kim Long... Until then, Yelpers beware.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pho - Broth was tasty +3. No tripe -1. Had meatballs +1. A lot of brisket +1.5. Overpriced -1 = 3.5 star pho.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overpriced for such a basic spring roll - no bean sprouts, no mint leaves, no green onion. No likey!

When my food first arrived everything seemed fine until I looked to my left, and they're crawling up the wall, then I realize they were on the floor, dead! Even the bathrooms. J3r2rYwsUcF2Quxvtg5TQw.text: The Pho was amazing, their friedrice is equally delicious, would definetly go back when i am back in Vegas!!!

ddjjNiJ8yXkQKioC4XMJ8w.text: So damn good still one of the best in the town for pho yuuummmmmm!!! Egg rolls and the chicken lettuce wraps are da bomb and they are open 24 hours perfect for industry workers service was quick and attentive love it.

uuCp9VmCU5aCvgZpPJxNlw.text: Quan was such a sweet server did his best to be attentive even though his section was like half the restaraunt. Came with a party of 12 got sat right away even though it was busy we are visiting from westminster aka little Saigon in California but let me tell you it was some of the best pho I've ever had . Only reason I couldn't give five stars is because the rest of the staff sucked .

GpfOpYiWHczvRE-rDlGzWw.text: Rainy day...a little chilly....so what to have lunch? Pho of course! Rather than head to one of our usual spots, we decided to try a new place that I read about that came recommended by a local concierge.   I checked the reviews on Yelp and they were mostly positive, so away we went!  We went on a Saturday afternoon around 1pm. I had read that finding parking was a nightmare, but the day we went, we found plenty of available parking.   Upon entering the restaurant, we could see that they were adequately busy. However, we were seated right away and handed menus.   Serving staff was on it. Within minutes we had our drinks and our order taken. We opted for the Kim Long fried egg rolls (chicken) and chicken wings with Kim Long Sauce for starters. My hubby ordered the #13 (Special Combination Tender Beef Noodle Soup) and I ordered the #14 (Rare Steak Noodle Soup).  Again, within minutes, our egg rolls arrived. Delish! Crispy, hot and served with lettuce, mint and shredded carrot mixture. Wrapped our egg rolls in the lettuce, added mint and carrot garnish and dipped in the accompanying sauce...awesomeness!  Next came the chicken wings. These babies were tiny!!! I guess because they were so small, we received about 15 of them on the plate. Even though they were tiny, the skin was nice and crispy and the flavor was great! I thought they would be spicy according to the chili pepper listed next to it on the menu, but these were more sweet than spicy. Though they tasted great, if I come back, I don't know that I would order them again. I didn't really feel like I got a lot of meat out of them for the price.  While we were grubbing on our appetizers, our pho came as well. I ordered a large and it did not disappoint. I really enjoyed the flavor of the broth. Wasn't salty and had a nice aroma too. There was just enough noodles and enough beef to satisfy me. I added plum sauce, 2 limes, sriracha sauce, bean sprouts and cilantro to mine. Hubby really liked his pho too.   All in all, we will definitely come back. The pho was great, serving staff was friendly and very attentive. It is just a great place to kick back and enjoy some tasty food...especially on a chilly, rainy day!

F_oC7euU5AGRIbQs7TnZbw.text: Pad See Ew $13.50: I'll admit this is kind of weird to order at a Vietnamese restaurant, but it just sounded good to me at the time. Typically pad see ew tastes the same to me at all the Thai restaurants I've been to, but something about the sauce definitely tasted off here. It also took a while to come out, but that may have been because I requested tofu instead of meat. They were apologetic about the wait though.   Although I personally didn't have actual Vietnamese food, my friend tried the hu tieu and chicken wings, and wasn't impressed either.   *****  My Star Ratings:  1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry.  2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return.  3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to.  4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already.  5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pad See Ew $13.50 Tofu requested instead of meat

RxkS2CUon9NEv9vYJRQ_hg.text: Went here before and i thought food and everything was good.  But tonight its different.  Calamari Spicy sauce isnt good, it was really 'fishy' like you ordered a sushi. Pad thai was chewy af like chewing a rubber band.  Only good was the shrimp roll and the avocado smoothies. I don't think I'll ever go back again after this. I was really disappointed and bill came out almost $50.

8qspqHj3K4lRPw13pphYyA.text: Good pho here. I got the Pho Ga [chicken pho] and my broth was nice and clear, the dark meat was tender and delicious. The garlic fish sauce was good too.   Friends got the egg noodles with cha gio [egg rolls] and that was phenomenal. I will get that next time.  My other friend ordered the chao ga [chicken porridge] and porridge was amazing. Flavorful, hot, and delicious for your hungover tummy.  However, the service was short and very asian like....one thing did bother me. The porridge arrived soooo late and its the easiest thing to make and should be ready in minutes. We all finished our meal and he was still waiting on his! We asked the server twice and he kind of blew us off. I think he forgot both times and then finally placed the order the second time we asked. That lost a star.

nXU8Qyii-J-KkERULX0o8Q.text: First time having pho! My mom was raving about this place and brought me and my husband here for a nice family meal. They are open 24/7 which is very convenient, especially for my mom who works graveyard shift.  We ordered spring rolls and crab rangoons for appetizers. They were both delicious and the presentation was pretty. All of us chose the beef combination pho, which seemed to be a popular choice as both of our neighboring tables ordered it as well. The pho was delicious and the portion was huge. It's easily shareable unless you have a big appetite.  I docked a star because even though this place is beautiful and the food was good, the service was lacking. Nobody checked on us throughout our meal and we were seated close to the register so I saw they messed up someone's order and weren't apologetic about it at all. That kind of rubbed me the wrong way.

jlpH4VA1RiZE8wxbXFAwXQ.text: Great services, fairly decent food. I ordered the wonton soup, no noodles and it was hot and delicious. They do not skimp out on the wontons either, they add tons! I recommend stopping by here of you're craving some Vietnamese food.   * also offers vegan options!

vkMX6cb8mkcmwfo7Eym4uw.text: PHO Kim Long is in China Town and pretty busy, usually with people waiting outside and in, to get a seat. Luckily, Our party was seated already when we got there.    The first time I went, I ordered the vegan pho. The bowl was very tasty but nothing really stuck out to me. A friend ordered the orange chicken and that was absolutely delicious, I need to order it the next time I goS   Today, I ordered the beef brisket pho. That bowl was tasty as well, but still, nothing stick out. The table ordered shrimp spring rolls 9/10 and chicken lettuce wraps 6/10. I wish the wraps came with some sort of sauce and something besides just lettuce and chicken.   Someone at the table ordered the pork with egg rolls and rice bowl, #26. I have to order that the next time for sure! It looked so good when it arrived, I wanted to change my order.   The bathrooms are disgusting. If you can hold it, hold it. The trash cans are overflowing and toilet paper is not changed.  The condiments at the table are also not as clean as they should be. A wipe down between every few parties would do the trick.   Food was tasty but don't go in the bathrooms.

wlqC1Mamb0OGjqVwdVBfwg.text: You've been out late drinking with friends on the strip, you're too old to be out this late, it's 2+ AM in the morning and your options are limited...Pho Kim Long is here to help you recover..  PKL Ambiance & Service:  Picture a small hole in the wall restaurant..and they keep getting more and more dining space without changing the ambiance or decor and this is the dining area. A majority of my visits have been in the early morning and have been all over the spectrum: Amazing, ok and horrid.  It all came down to the staff assigned to us. All my visits during the regular dining hours have been pretty good overall with no major issues.  The kitchen is pretty good with getting orders to the table quickly at all my visits.  PKL Pho and misc. dishes:  For $10 and under, you get a pretty big bowl of pho and I've always been a fan of their broth.  The pho noodles and beef are good and you get decent value overall for the quantity and quality.  The egg rolls and spring rolls are on par with a good casual Vietnamese restaurant and they are ordered for table on every visit.  We stick to the basics and PKL has delivered almost every time.  Pho restos have opened all over Vegas in the past 8 years and PKL now has lots of tough competition in the immediate vicinity.  They are still one of my classic late night eats place and they're tough to beat when it's early in the morning.  There's a reason they're still busy at that time.  See ya there at 2+ AM in the morning.  =)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign in yo...
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu..

6zkmQaLXdspi_6aJqrZaSg.text: Came to pick up food to go. I have been working all day and they said the food would take 15 to 20 minutes to make. I asked if I could take a seat at one of the dozen empty tables in the restaurant and the guy at the cash register who I assume is the manager because he's dressed differently than the servers pretended he didn't understand English and then said I couldn't sit down and had to stand at the front door near the cold air blowing in and about 10- 15 drunk people waiting for a table. There are no chairs in the front waiting area.   I will not be back just out of the rudeness of this employee. I've never gotten food to go anywhere at any restaurant where the food took that long and I wasn't "allowed" to sit at one of 50+ empty chairs.

7xceRbv2ry3lgM7wMFdFbA.text: This place gets a lot of hype for low-par service and cold pho.    We were seated, greeted, and order taken and delivered very quickly (although, it's not that hard to ladle some broth and veggies in a bowl); so, I'll give them a star for that.    However, it was all down hill from here.    My pho was cold when it arrived; my daughter's was steaming hot.  It's the first time I ever ordered vegan pho so I thought maybe it was some hippie vegan thing to consume it cold?    I inquired with the waitress and it was definitely supposed to be hot. They took it back and it took forever for them to bring it back; to which, it appears all they did was microwave it bc all the bean sprouts and peppers I put on there, before I found out it was cold, were all in the same exact spots; obviously untouched.  But, whatever, I was hungry.    I take my second sip, and it's still not hot, warmer but definitely not steaming hot like it should be.    At that point, I just wanted to eat and not deal with the issue any more.     Like I said, it was my first vegan pho, but I didn't care for the veggies being raw and hard.  Maybe that's how it should be???? but I just don't want to crunch into a hard-@$$ veggies when I'm consuming soup.  I just ate the noodles and broth (which was really good, so I'll give them another star).    Then, continuing downhill, for whatever reason the busser kept putting the rolling cart to haul dirty dishes right next to us.  Maybe because I complained about my soup being cold?  Like, screw this lady and her whining @$$.   The cart was close enough each time she brought it by I barely had elbow room to eat.    She started just tossing (and I do mean tossing) dirty dishes on the to cart and slashing other people's half eaten food on me.  Apparently the disgusted look I gave her did nothing to discontinue to behavior.   The second time I got hit with food like I was at a Sea World show, I figured it was time to leave before I lost my shiz and was never permitted in any pho establishment within 100 miles.    I paid quickly in cash and left with my cold, crunchy soup.    My daughter liked hers though; she got the shrimp.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Pho (front center (raw, hard veggies(?))) and Shrimp Pho (back).

uvNE80cCdQYrQ995BnZRBA.text: I made a quick trip to Las Vegas just to drop some Porto's goodies for my friends who were visiting from Canada. I arrived late at night without having dinner. I was starving and it was kind of chilly in Vegas that evening. I requested to have soup so after checking yelp, we headed to this popular place in Chinatown.  Place was busy but they have a pretty large dining area with lots of seating. We waited only a few minutes and we soon got seated. Service was fast, or should I say, way too fast. It's a delight watching them as the staff move so quickly with the service. They certainly got used to the busy routine here.   We ordered the following:  Crispy Calamari (With Salt & Pepper)- $11.95  Fried Chicken Wings (With Salt & Pepper)- $9.95  Fresh Spring Rolls (With Shrimp Pork & Lettuce) - $5.25  Special Combination Tender Beef Noodle Soup - $8.75  Based on the stellar reviews, my expectations were high. Sadly, overall experience was underwhelming and kind of disappointing. Calamari was chewy while wings were a bit dry. Soup was good but I wished it had more flavor. Thank goodness, I liked the fresh spring rolls as the ingredients were fresh and dipping was tasty. Portions were generous though.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i25t_GxDZ7jacXDm5YMu3A.text: Customers beware!  This was such a good place, but now gets 1 star from me for deceptive business practices.    They cheat you on tip, being forceful and rude in charging tip to your card.    I always give 15% base and 20% if the service is good.    Was charged 20% gratuity automatically, without my knowledge.   They do this for ALL diners and orders. Beware.    They have posted on the menu that gratuity is included for parties of 6 or more.   Last time I was here on July 22, 2019, a party of 5, I was charged ~18% gratuity automatically.  Furthermore, their gratuity guide is higher than 15% (closer to 18%)  Food is decent quality, but not as good as it was 4-5 years ago.    Crispy noodle isn't that crispy.  Beef stew broth and pho broth isn't as good as it was 5 years ago.

RQMMhQH0gOi-QFDf1vmbng.text: So delicious and amazing!!!  I haven't had Pho in so long but it was sooooo delicious!! I really enjoyed my meal.  It was just so delicious and amazing!!  This place was recommend to me by my aunt and I do highly recommend this place to others.  It's well worth the price for such great food.

zNUixu19PK_tB0oKsasP0g.text: Incredible stop in Las Vegas! Coming from the east coast I always forget what amazing food selections they have on the west! This place stands out amongst the rest in the China/Vietnamese town area. It is fast, efficient, delicious and of high quality. I got the vermicelli bowl with a heaping portion of spring rolls and pork and vegetables. The taste and flavoring was just impeccable. The portion was massive and it was under  $12 with a vietnamese iced coffee. I didnt want to leave, and I wanted to order more! Also another perk: credit cards accepted. Will return!

mcOfDqGlaEENiIQ14-d6Bg.text: Our meal was so oily/greasy. I ordered the Braised Tofu and my sister ordered something else, hers was greasy too. She was able to stomach hers, but I had to send it back. I've been eating out a lot lately and have stomached some not so great food. This was so bad and greasy I could not even finish it, I had to send it back. Thankfully they took it off the bill. I don't think I'll be back

fyL6Aj5p1GRr5ByTrfFR_Q.text: 2.5 stars  This place was the only option available at 3 am on a tuesday night. The pho tasted a little bit too salty. It's better than nothing  or mcdonalds i guess.the price is okay 11 bux.  Don't order the chicken wings,they are overcooked small dried wings with salt and pepper on it.  The spring rolls were okay.

g3edtJfyNQU3YpajLD2grQ.text: As a frequent visitor to Las Vegas, Pho Kim Long was the place to head to on those hungover mornings/afternoons. They used to have one of the best Bun Bo Hue in the area but, our latest visit had us really disappointed.  Our first stop, once we landed, was to come here to get breakfast and kill time before our check-in. The staff is friendly and quick to seat us but the delivery of what you order came out super slow (on a non-busy day). My friend and I ordered Bun Bo Hue and hers came out first and I had to wait for a good 8 to 10 minutes before mines came out (my order was the last to arrive, while the pho came out quickly).   The food:  If you stop by here definately get the pho as it's the best tasting dish. What I like about eating here is they hook you up with hella meat! The Hu Tieu came with a lot of seafood, pho dac biet with large amount of meat, and the bun bo hue with plenty of pork pieces and large soft pig feet. What this restaurant lacks is tripe!  The Bun bu Hue came out lukewarm at best. I believe the other broths also came out lukewarm and just didn't really cook the raw meat that well. The bun bo hue broth was bland and wasn't spicy at all. The flavor was definitely lacking this trip compared to all my other visits here. I added a whole bunch of paste to brighten up the flavor but, yeah... it just wasn't working out.   End food review

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue... Lack of flavor and heat. Luke warm. This place went down hill

hHTtMts-9uHKRlOxGMobuw.text: What a "pho"-n weekend!  Food: Pho Ga (Chicken Noodle Soup)  Price: $9.75  Ratings: this place wasn't bad! The soup for the chicken noodle soup wasn't too salty. It comes with various onions, which gave the soup a lot of flavor. The chicken were thin-Sliced chicken breast. They were cooked pretty well, but it just wasn't super seasoned. I like that they gave a lot of chicken! Noodles were pretty soft and not too chewy. This place is opened 24/7! Service was okie! There's parking shared amongst the plaza.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Ga (Chicken Noodle Soup); Price: $9.75

rzEnLPM_8fqXJ-8A8v4jBw.text: Worst place ever they will overcharge you! My bill went from 13 to 18 they automatically add their own tip into your amount. On top of that the servers are a joke lazy employees. Not worth the money nor the time to even go back.  Legit waste of money and time there. You get better service at McDonald's

xon5NW7rEFUUJqZfDL_kIA.text: When I lived in Vegas I use to eat here at least once a week!!! No lie! Unfortunately I moved out of Las Vegas but when I'm out there I go the days I'm there. If I'm there 3 days, I'll be sure to go eat here those 3 days!!!

8Q_C3Jj3804yrf7sgzAe5g.text: I've gone to Pho Kim Long a few times while visiting friends in Vegas. It's right there on Spring Mountain Road, which is very busy decked out with restaurants and stores.   At times this place gets really busy. But it usually doesn't take too long to get in. I've tried the beef cubes which are amazing as well as their pho. They do it really well here. Last time I visited we also got the salt and pepper shrimp. YUM. I would say that is a must try.   This place is definitely one of my favorite spots to eat in Vegas. Best part is that they're open 24 hours as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salted Garlic Shrimp. -Taken with an Apple iPhone 5
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho. -Taken with an Apple iPhone 5

3YGX7Br_Kf6m1KGn9cdJ3Q.text: I am not sure why this gets voted 'Best Of Vegas' every year.  I always get Special Combo Pho wherever I go and consider it to be the best litmus for Pho. At PKL their "rare beef" is served in the bowl of hot broth and not on the side thus no longer "rare" by the time they run the food to your table basically ruining the tasty, thinly cut, beef that is best when still pink.  Another big faux pas is the fact that their Special Combo has no tripe, no tendon and you have to pay for meatballs.   Then there is the wait...I am guessing most of these folks are tourists adventuring off the beaten path. Fine with me. They can have PKL.  Check out Pho Bosa for some stellar Pho and no wait.

x7HIhtSbWacvWyuNoK8zbA.text: Came here to satisfy my late night hunger. Open 24/7! This place is ok. Nothing close to amazing but satisfying enough for me. They don't have tripe & their boba is nasty & old. Full of loud drunk people & couples who are arguing for everyone to hear. I guarantee you will get a free show to go with every meal, entertaining & full of drama if you come after 12!

agEl3C-uzm7egqw75a-gSw.text: The food here is awesome as far as service, it depends on who you get as your waiter there are some really good ones and some really bad ones  That atmosphere is pretty nice and clean it's gets pretty busy but be sure to remember what you ordered and to check your bill before you pay I've eaten here many times and a few times I paid for things that never came to my table otherwise I would have given this place five stars.

iPSTrIQvS2XfSL9DoNE23A.text: The best pho I've had in vegas so far, tried 2 other spots before that did not live up to standards. However, I think everyone else knows this too, so those days after clubbing when you're finally able to roll out of bed and your hunger finally outweighs your need to lay in bed and you think man I need some pho, best of luck to you on the wait situation. If you're lucky and it happens to be short, you are in luck! But I've seen the wait be up through 45 minutes before as well. Longest 45 minutes if you are already barely at the state of crawling out of bed. The restaurant is pretty big and has lots of tables and service is fast, it's just THAT many ppl want to get some.   PHO: The broth is very well made, this is pretty much the defining difference between pho restaurants and pho kim long is near the top of the list. I don't like it when place don't rinse the starch off their noodles and makes the broth cloudy, none of that here. Good portions of noodle and meat, yes! Also, no crazy obvious msg taste, here we go baby! Path to recovering so you can go hard again!  I used to take good pho for granted, but having experienced some bad ones lately, I really appreciate those that stay True to the craft!   LOCATION: If you are staying around the wynn/venetian side of the strip, you just go right across spring mountain a few blocks and you are in chinatown, not too far of a drive to get some tasty vietnamese beef broth in your system.

FJ1MWgS-GaLA8WDSOArfEA.text: Had an amazing dinner here with 3 other people. We just ate family style and ordered a bunch of different plates. The service was great and the food was perfect. I cant wait to come back here again!

50X-mtjPkuXh8ANWaF5GiQ.text: Went here twice recently when I was in vegas. Had the pho dac biet the first time, it was awesome. Probably best that I've had in Vegas. the eggrolls and springrolls were good too. the banh xeo was just ok. The second time I had the bun bo hue. That was ok but not as good as the pho. It also wasn't temperature hot enough for me either. Still good but the pho is the star here. I guess that's why Pho is in the name....

FUWUK3vt15w3VljLnAsAqg.text: I rated 3.5 stars. Deducted from poor customer services and long wait of line. However, the food was better than other pho place in around that area.

yxoaOoRpgYo8YZC746Zz0g.text: My review is base on two restaurant meals. There were no other local Vietnamese restaurants nearby while visiting with friends for three days so I dined here twice.   First off, their Pho Dac Biet was bland with no flavour. It seems as if they underestimated their peak hour business and so they must have ran out of broth and created some lame pho base. I can tell because it was diluted and also growing up eating so much Pho, one can tell what the broth consists of.   Second day of dining, their dumpling broth was sour, meaning that this probably went bad. I turned it back and headed on over to Lee's sandwich for some edible food. Of course they credited the overall bill from a party of 12.  The only dish that looked appetising was their thit nuong cam tam. It looked very delicious from what my friend told me and also it tasted on par to normal thit nuong dishes here.  Would I come back? Probably not since Vegas is a hit or miss in terms of food.

dhpjLtX8gCIXUrOzDYNKQA.text: After seeing all the hype and long wait at this place, I do say, it is worth it. Our food came out pretty quick and was delicious. I've had plenty of different pho places and this one defiantly takes the cake. I have to make a stop here everytime I'm back in Vegas for business.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The #13. Special Combination Tender Beef Noodle Soup.

b-N4XBPH0H5p4SeWEUlKJw.text: I will give this restaurant credit...I had a long night with some good friends and stumbled in here at 7:00am looking for pho. That being said, the food/ service was a little haphazard.   I ordered the combination pho and it came out very quickly.  In my mind pho is all about the broth. Broth is a make or break thing and a good pho will have those amazing multiple layers of anise, coriander, fish sauce etc. this broth was missing something. Couldn't put my finger on it, but the broth did not have the flavor explosion I am accustomed to in pho. I wasn't bad per se, but I've had waaaay better pho. Bland.   The service on the other hand was terrible. I almost walked out of the restaurant because the server helped two other tables that came in after me and still had me sit there for 5 minutes after. He failed to bring out my spring rolls and then hassled me when I asked to have my nonexistent spring rolls removed from the bill.   Kudos for them being open 24/7, but there are at least 5 better pho joints with .5 miles. Go there.

os02HgJkAKd1qzNBdeIdKQ.text: Stellar place with really fast service any time of the day. I always get the #13 special pho and order of string beans. Their pho broth is awesome!! Price is great as well.

U_2tC3Ch__tOV3Radd2FWQ.text: Alright ok, once you and your glazed weary eyed friends gotten over the name of the place, you'll find that this is a pretty decent spot to go if you're looking for that late nite, post-clubbing hangover cure as I'm sure many people know by now.   Great for drunken stumbling groups or for just you and a homie/lover/friend. I've been here a good handful of times through a span of 4 years now -- typically when friends are visiting and while their food may not be the greatest Viet spot in Vegas, they make up in their hours and the variety of traditional Viet-Chinese pho and rice dishes. Upon a recent visit I met up with a group of friends that never been to a Vietnamese-Chinese spot and all of them for the most part enjoyed their food. For that they teeter along a 3 and 3.5 in my book but I prefer to round up and give these businesses the benefit of the doubt!

Z_u1ONjgB57VmWTLanQF5Q.text: Terrible service! I watched the owner act like a child in front of the whole bar. Average food, but the service is just to awful for anything other than 1 star. If I could give zero stars I would.

jp_pwbBFcgd_IM2KvgfTVQ.text: I live so far from all the good Asian food but I'm glad I made the trip. This is one of the best pho bowls I've had and I'm so picky. It's always something somewhere else, old meat, old broth, not hot enough, etc but this one is across the board very decent. The charbroiled chicken was good too. The shrimp and pork spring rolls not that good. There's at least five other dishes i want to try next time. It was really busy that's a good sign.

VVAQAZV9qI-TLUZhqrB9tg.text: Best Pho I've had in Las Vegas, but their other menu items are sub-par. Then again, you are going to a "Pho" restaurant, so why order something else?  This place is always slammed during lunch hour, but in my opinion its worth the wait.

0RRTXwXaJCkwFmAUwPISoA.text: I have been to this location many times before and FINALLY THEY HAVE CHANGED. I never got to writing the bad review they deserved because I always had hoped they would get better and alas they have.
