Personally, there was never anything wrong with the food here, their pho is as good as it gets. However, the main problem was their service. The servers here were slow, and VERY VERY RUDE. BUT, finally they have changed for the better. The servers were nicer, more attentive, and faster. The food actually got better too! The pho was plated beautifully and consistently. Very presentable and tasty food. THANK YOU FOR CHANGING PHO KIM LONG.

acv6IS1-3_8aOaucuv6ZGg.text: This review is based on an order to go while at the restaurant.  SERVICE - 1/2 ... FOR EFFORT? FOOD - 3  I was excited to try this place since I always see that the restaurant is packed. I guess it's one of those places where food is decent but service is lacking - they take their time. My friend and I walk up to the counter and was greeted by a hostess. We wanted to order to go and she took our order, said it would take 15-20 minutes. Sure, it's a Sunday evening, restaurant wasn't full but it was getting there. This was 9:10pm.   9:40pm rolls around. We've seen other people who ordered after us with orders fulfilled. So, we walk up to the counter further in where the register is at and talk to the guy behind the register who is clearly prepping orders to go and picking up phone orders. He says our order isn't in there; He can't find it. I clarified the hostess took down our order over half an hour ago, he calls her over, she says something in Vietnamese that, by the tone of it, she admitted she totally forgot. STRIKE 1. He apologizes to us and takes our order. which were repeated to him (once by my friend, second time by me just to make sure he has it), said it would be out in 10-15 minutes. Fine, I paid, wait again.   He walks over to hand us the food himself, again apologizing. We feel better, even though we were really hungry, as we felt he knew we deserved better service. We then check the food and there's an order missing, and a missing side rice. Checked the bag and we couldn't find the order receipt. We approach him and he says we didn't order what we claim are missing. He prints out our order receipt and shows us. Clearly, he didn't add them in. STRIKE 2. We make another payment.  It was really hard to enjoy the food after dealing with this kind of service but by this time I was so hungry I ate up the whole thing. Food was decent, but I can't say it was great. I will make an effort to give this restaurant another chance and hopefully I can follow up to this with a more positive review and not a Strike 3. Nonetheless, It was a very disappointing night.

LJQKY3TPowyZ3KQEMyWhlA.text: Best rice plates in vegas. Affordable and open 24/7! Everything on the menu is good! Can't go wrong with this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best rice plates and pho in vegas!

ckMeTTOlarAPiH-yzHqkKw.text: Always open, consistent, good prices, even better team serving. When I want to show off my favorite Vegas spots, this is one of the few. And oddly enough, the chicken wings are the best in town.

_lm8evzsZP9JVxBnsga0KA.text: just OK. the pho dac biet lacked tripe, etc. decent broth. other diners said other dishes were a tad spicy. still, it totally hit the spot, and i would probably go again, after trying many of the other pho spots within blocks. solid pho, but nothing gastonomical.

xnVecKha2gIqcPwo5opAJA.text: I can't describe the taste except that the pho has a hint of windex taste to it.... would try another pho restaurant....

iSnqerviy4b8Q7Qvjx_xSw.text: I was in Vegas for new years weekend and we decided to eat here. Good food but the wait was crazy....extremely busy. Service was okay but i wasnt expecting much because of how busy they were. I had one of their Vermecilli dishes (always do at Vietnamese places) and it was one of the best I've had. Definitely check this place out if you get a chance.

eOj4ChrFKoOuPPTBp7HWpg.text: this place is amazing every time i go i request for the server FREDDIE He is the best! the food is amazing. i get the number 14. extra large ! but also the chicken  teriyaki is very good along with the deep fried wings. the thai tea and the fresh young coconut! this place is a must!!! i go at least 3 times a week the prices are great 8.50 for an extra large! cant beat that

pnsE1-mn3H2vfJulYrvDvQ.text: "Baby, stop the car!!!! We've found Chinatown!!!!"  Ooooo and it smells like Asian heaven too.  Spring Mountain Road--where the brown people get their rice fix.  Spring Mountain Road--not just the same street as Fashion Show Mall but! If you keep going down it you'll find a plethora of Asian restaurants.  It's not just Chinese food and 99 Ranch Market folks.  It's Chinese, Thai, Vietnamese and, yes Filipino restaurants.  For me, it was a dream come True.  Pho Kim Long was the first lit Pho restaurant we saw so we veered left and parked.  I was expecting some hole in the wall place as most Asian restaurants are when clustered together.  What we got was a CLEAN, yes I said CLEAN and modern looking Pho place.  The food was excellent.  Their Vermicellii was super fresh and so was the Pho.  And, they are open til 3 am in the morning! Then again, what places in Vegas aren't open that late or even 24 hours, right?  Bottom line, for this Asian---it gets good ratings. --fresh food, clean restaurant, friendly service.  No wonder this place is packed. Plus, they do take out.  And lemme tell you, when you're craving hot soup in 112 degree weather in Vegas at 11 pm, this is where you wanna take out from.

2UvxjrWDEnKAPEncnket-w.text: yay! i'm a fan! if i am in the vicinity and in need of some grease for the hangover ...PKL hits the spot...

sQW_g8MTdxDB15N7byS7UQ.text: everything in this place is good i could tell this was so from the locals that were hanging  out there and the flow of of people that were coming in after 1 am. not bad for being a couple of blocks off the Las Vegas strip.

sDiO6CApDM0aqPI3jrPLLQ.text: Wait was long... service was bad ( aside from one bus boy).  Food???  Not worth the price you pay for.

VJUncontg3OLCScUMxr2sg.text: the inside of this place is like an upscale pho place.. but the food was wayyyy too over priced for a bowl of pho.. which was like $7.25.. and a bowl of porridge was $9.... food came out in a decent time... rather have went to a cheaper place that was more authentic

lm1cNhDF7vqXOk1UiCo1jw.text: The vermicelli with egg rolls and pork was wonderful. The food was delicious. It felt great to be able to walk into a restaurant that was clean, roomy, and cool. Finally, my friends and I have a good place to hang whenever we are craving for pho/vietnamese food when we're in Vegas.

O6FFq108It8EL29U69HSpw.text: over price !  Ca Kho To never taste the same ,  sometimes salty , sometimes no flavor at all ! never go there again.

ttGnv-RBow2XXsjGb6HTgA.text: The best thing about this place is the fact that it opens 24 hours. We had the pho and the summer rolls with shrimp. Both were good, this is definitely the place to go for early morning breakfast.

mpwAA9IkSk_lVzXir4I4RQ.text: Pho Kim Long was a very nice and clean restaurant.  The menu is very extensive in terms of various Vietnamese dishes - it's not just pho. My friends and I had breakfast here,and ordered the pho dac biet and bun tit nuong. One friend wanted the pho ga as well as the pho dac biet, so she ended up asking if she could have the pho dac biet with the tit ga in it and they were more than obliged to do so! My other friend ordered the bun tit nuong but they gave her chicken instead of the beef. My friend not being so picky ended up eating the dish, which turned out to be pretty good.  The table adjacent to us ended up getting her dish instead. The waiters knew they made a mistake as did we and surprisingly acknowledged their mistake, which is always great and rare for any pho restaurant to do. Good thing we're not picky eaters, plus we were on a time crunch so we were more interested in eating and going.  Our food came with a good amount of meat so it turned out to be very filling.  I do believe the dishes are priced a little high but since I did not see too many other pho restaurants I guess competition is scarce.  All in all a good place for Vietnamese food, almost like home cooking.  I enjoy eating off the Vegas strip.

rYsYAG1lIa2fcwWNM9Imhg.text: Amazing appetizers, including all the egg/spring rolls and Calamari!

JGN6ScxYEfVBsSn0mA7JwQ.text: my friends and i wanted pho after a night of partying so we took a taxi to spring mountain to find a pho restaurant and came across pho kim long. i had been here before but this time they have remodeled so it looks better. the food was pretty good but the prices were high. but my brother said pho in vegas is about $7 unlike in the bay area, but the porridge was $6!!. ...i heard in the same area there is another vietnamese restaurant in the plaza in the next block but its upstairs. so ill probably check that out first..so i guess i would come here again because its the closest place to the strip.

-PI7zt0O6KpidsOYkJqTTA.text: i've only ordered pho from pho kim long so i can only comment on that. with that being the case...i've tried about 4 other vietnamese restaurants, and this has to be my favorite place for pho. whenever i get pho i'm never able to finish it, but i always seem to finish the pho at pho kim long. if someone can recommend another place i can try, please do. i usually order pho tai chin (rare beef & brisket) or sometimes just pho tai (rare beef).

OHqSmCViLw910cn8Qx_kVQ.text: they get the job done. they don't even have a 24 hour joint like this in the bay. what's up with that?

0naxOMn-ajL_FP8jVRwNvw.text: Food was okay but SERVICE was HORRIBLE! The only nice service we got was from the young hostess in front (they got an extra star because of her). We came in with a large group so we had to wait before being seated which is understandable. Once seated, the waiters taking our order did not seem happy with their job but we were still okay with the service. We paid our bill and left a GENEROUS tip due to the large party. The HORRIBLE part was on the way out. My husband was carrying my son out first (while the rest of the party was gathering their belongings) when a waiter said to him in a very rude way, "Move out of the way". Come on now, you can at least say excuse me. That was the final straw for my husband, he told the waiter that he was extremely rude, and he would like to speak to the owner of the establishment. Turns out he was the son of the owner and the owner was not there. We asked for his dad's number so we can call him but he of course wouldn't give it to us. We probably would have been okay if he had just apologized and said he was in a rush or something but he didn't seem to care. I guess if the son of the owner doesn't care about how he treats the customers, there's no reason for the other workers to care either! Needless to say, we won't be going back.

Y_V95IZIoWO0jKGsKZp8LA.text: Pho Kim Long has the best Vietnamese food especially family dishes like canh chua ca kho to and honey garlic spare ribs. Our family only goes here when we are in Vegas. Highly recommend this restaurant when u have a craving for Vietnamese or Asian cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UtJQYF3pw_57_p-f8WSKWA.text: I always end up here when I'm in Vegas. I don't want to say it's the best pho I've ever had, but it's really good. Or am I just really drunk whenever I'm here?  In any case- it's spacious so the wait is never that long. The prices are decent. The food comes out fast. It hits the spot.  I always get the combination pho bowl. I wished they offered smaller sizes... I'm never able to finish that giant bowl!

Co_2iU3uEKFrG_brCZsBdQ.text: Great pho! The crab Rangoon were a little more well done then what I am use to but still delicious. We also got the lettuce wraps and they were delicious as well. Great atmosphere, will try to seat you asap, our waiter took a little longer to get our ticket but it was busy. If you plan on splitting the check just get the check and go up front to the cash register to pay.

1FrbEY_LH7XLpyt6mNSXwQ.text: Best cure for exhaustion and a hangover? A big a** bowl of Pho, of course.  Came here with some girlfriends after a couple long and crazy nights in Vegas, and replenished our bodies with some good ole Vietnamese soul food. Pho, vermicelli, egg rolls, you name it.. they all did the trick, and we were ready to party again when we finished.  Take an Uber or Lyft, because parking can be rough with the high volume of traffic to this strip mall. No one wants to be hungover and fighting for parking.

bAOrGb6-ZIf08XQaUNjEWw.text: They say third time is a charm.  This is my second bad experience with this restaurant. Food is fine. Staffs are so rude, though. One hostess has very bad attitude. She would not sit us (13 people) at the tables which could fit us in. Instead, she would split us into 2 small tables where they could only fit 10. When we questioned about it, she went on and on like we, customer, must follow her bad lead. She talked to her manager. Finally, the manager could sit us in the tables which she hid it for other guests. Afterwards, I saw her talking about that to other staffs and they both laughed at it.   I don't understand how the owner would not care about his/her restaurant and hire such bad staffs.  When one works in the restaurant, he/she should satisfy the customers to have great tips. Now I'm holding back on my tips.

nG2i_AdFHphpiDM-UQkRgw.text: Absolutely the best Pho I have ever had and it's open 24 hours!!!! Amazing!!! We bring everyone who comes to visit in for dinner and they all love it!

Wj4n1bJItvY9VOjHP8smvg.text: Pho Kim Long is one of the most popular after party sober up spots for locals.  They serve your Pho before you even put the menu down. Perfect after party food... The barbecue was really good/ It is where everybody goes to eat after and it isnt impossible not to see somebody you know.  We always order the Charbroiled Porkchops. Another favorite is the Beef Stew. Its good if you want soup but in the mood to eat it with rice instead!   I love that it is open 24/7. Simple, and quick Vietnamese food.

BfOFIF61WeMntbUKz9Rp2g.text: When I visit Las Vegas, my very first meal is pho. I don't know why. This year I wanted to try somewhere different.   Pho Kim Long has nice interior. It's a big place. I was sitter right away. Good customer service.   I ordered #16 pho with steak & flank. The soup had good flavor to it. It wasn't too oily which was nice. It was $7 something. The price was right.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #16
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #14

hgsl5OT9VpqDYy2puLtBDA.text: The drunken noodle was phenomenal. I've heard a lot of great things about this place. I will be back again and will try the pho this time.

oBswFtpfasRW7Rr8Zy4jSA.text: fast, friendly service and DELICIOUS food! hubby and I stopped in for lunch and we had a great time. we were seated right away and the server took our order. within a few minutes we were served our food and drinks. very tasty!

SnEfEiZdcE4z9Bg_9f-tYw.text: Pho for lunch was the best idea! This place was delicious I can see why there was a wait. The wait wasn't too long because the restaurant was enormous! After being seated our waitress came quickly. We knew what we wanted to order, spring rolls, summer rolls, and two of the everything pho bowls and two regular sized tai chin's. Pho was great! The bowls came out very quickly. The summer rolls were perfect, crisp and tasty! You have to wrap the lettuce around it and dip it in the fish sauce!!!! When the pho came out we barely spoke with each other! Haha unfortunately the spring rolls didn't come out which made us sad... and the waiter forgot to bring us water. We ultimately cancelled the spring rolls. The food was good thats all that really mattered! If you're in vegas and want some good hangover food come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3hWCJTjnDZ6fCXPU_2zjUA.text: Hmmmm what keeps me coming back...  It's the fact that I've come here after the club - faded - with a bunch of friends who want pho! To me, it's not the best broth but it'll do.  The flavor has been okay every time I come back and with appetizers being ordered that taste kind of bland, it doesn't allow me to give more stars.  The broth is what makes the soup. The noodles are basically the same at every pho spot. The added protein, white onions, green onions, thai basil, lime and sprouts are all additions to the pho. The broth flavor has to define itself and that's how I decide which place is better than another and it's just okay over here. Actually better when you're super faded - lol!  I love the customer service here as they are super fast, very attentive and want to make you happy so you come back.  Anyways... I always end up coming back but it's definitely not my favorite.

FF2_Pzi7WF0nMdxt_EpjVw.text: Don't let the long line waiting to be seated discourage you. They move tables quickly, the service is always great and the food is amazing. I can't count the times I have dined here and it's always been awesome.  The appetizer egg rolls and the pho tom are always on point.

69EQ6R4VvBSi0zim_UaCkQ.text: This place is our go to spot for pho when in Vegas. Open 24 hours and is usually packed for 24 hours. So be prepared to wait in line. We had #3,#14#15.  All fresh and excellent. The egg rolls came out to our table a little cold but they were still good and it greasy.

WEcBTcFvPIYN3PQnQj9K3g.text: Came here late around 12 am with my family of about 25+  people after a trip to the grand canyon. We were all hungry and when we went in we were told that they couldnt accommodate such a large group at one table which was expected, the server led us to one table which fit about 12 of us. The original server also gave us another smaller table next to us to squeeze into which was somewhat doable but then the guy behind the counter was telling the server no no no, to not put us there. So they moved the rest of us 13 people on to a small rectangular table that could barely fit 8 and told us we could squeeze and that we would fit... we could not fit. We asked the guy why we couldnt have the round table and he said he had other customers. We ended up spending about $ 300. First off it was not that busy, secondly there was a bunch of tables open in the back. We complained and ended up getting the round table as well and that just fit us perfectly. All of this took about 15 min just to sit, and we were hungry.  The servers were rude. the food was just okay, we definitely will not be coming back. Theres other places that are better with better customer service. Only reason i gave it another star was because the food came out fast.

5acP6fsyagDuTyLHRnxGZQ.text: The pho was mediocre. Nothing special so I didn't really get why they always have long lines.   Prices are pretty high for anything outside of pho. Pho averages from $8 to $10 while everything else is around $15+  The pho broth was luke warm but they put a lot of MSG, meat was pretty good, noodles were cheap, got soggy very quick.  Drinks is over priced close to $4 for Thai Iced Tea when next door is only $2.50  But, if you're hungover, you won't tell the difference haha

ZNQgTLsiNdAGFny4kqcn5A.text: Amazing Vietnamese food in Las Vegas only a few miles from the strip.   The canh chua and ca kho were like home cooking on steroids.  The honey glazed pork spare ribs were also super delicious.  This is a must visit every time i am in Vegas.  Open late, it's the ultimate Vegas food destination for Vietnamese food.

yBuUuEeQHnXBxxJ61cGwWQ.text: You can't complain about pho Kim long's good. It's delicious and opened 24 hours if you're ever craving pho or finishing off a long night out.   I came here around 3am craving crispy noodles. My friend was craving pho. The good was amazing. The service in the other hand wasn't.  The place wasn't busy at all but they did take a long time seating us. Then taking our order. I let it go when I got my food because it was so good. I was willing to give them a solid 4 stars. Until I checked out.  We paid in cash and I brought it up to the register. Instead of giving me the change to leave a tip on the table the cashier was very pushy about what I wanted to leave and leave it with him. The tip amounts were uneven numbers but the middle one 18% was a nice rounded number 5.25 I said that'll work. When he gave me my change back it was wrong. I didn't want to argue with the man at this point so I just let him have it. It was super uncomfortable being pushed as if I wasn't going to leave a tip or something.

0LTHBwl5XE2TfrsCR7T7dg.text: Pho Kim Long is a place I would try to stop by whenever I visit Las Vegas. It's pretty convenient to have a 24 hour pho restaurant.   I would normally order the rare steak pho and a side of spring rolls when I go here. The pho is not the best pho I've had but it does the job when you are hungry at 3am. There are other food items I would like to try during my next visit to Las Vegas.  The prices seem to be a bit higher but that's expected when you have a 24 hour pho restaurant that is in Las Vegas. I would definitely pay extra to get my pho fix in the middle of the night.   The service was average but I don't expect GREAT service from Asian restaurants. I am mainly there for the food.   I would definitely come back here when I am back in Las Vegas!

C26nPDrhmiJYvt2rCdaQ4Q.text: This is a great example of the worst service and environment. The food was alright - let's be honest, Vietnamese food in LV.   Also, who the heck asks for tip pre-credit card swipe?! That boggles me.   I think your store should invest in customer service training or hire better people. There's plenty of people here looking for a job and I'd bet they would be happier people.

6e1PuJxCZY67VVHq4vPPyw.text: This is by far my favorite place to go for pho! The restaurant is clean & the service is great - even when they are slammed. For appetizers, you can't go wrong with the crab rangoon, calamari or egg rolls. Lately I have been changing things up & getting the wonton soup with egg noodles, it's absolutely delicious!! I highly recommend this restaurant. I know I will keep coming back!

YyXV3CWVZ3nLOmPqycJy9w.text: Im sitting in the restaurant right now. They  started taking orders from people who arrived later than my party. They totally forgot about our table. We got angry and called the first waiter we saw. He took our order with an attitude. The customer service was really bad. I think maybe he was just tired or having a bad day but still. He doesn't even say a word and just write down what we ordered and left. I manage a pizza restaurant, i know customer service. This is the worse customer service i have ever experienced.  Its been 45 minutes and we are still waiting.

Rd6aT43XbfKiv_Z9O0Ek9Q.text: Having eaten Pho in various places I can say by now this was certainly the best I had in many years. Pho Ga, so good and big portions. I little more expensive as your average price. Open 24 hours. I will be back.

vyL7kFu1rACVfT_hrSi6SQ.text: I wonder how they come up with these names...  Nonetheless, the pho was great. The wait to get a table was short and the food came pretty quickly. There were a lot of things on the menu, including some Chinese cuisine. The prices are pretty low too. However, I just wanted some simple pho. I don't really know how you could get pho wrong and I hope to never experience that, but this place did the trick.  Also, it's open 24 hours.

54b1BoHqKTbXKsDt2TbGYQ.text: Can never go worng with this 24Hr PHO!   It's fast and tasty!  Drunk after the CLUB? Take a cab here!!!

hb0OHUVlO3IAXlsIlrMplw.text: Whenever we go to Vegas we insist on stopping at Pho Kim Long! It was the name that initially attracted my attention, but the food is awesome too!   They have a lot of vegetarian options, but my favorite is the crispy noodles that look like a nest.   The service is fast and pleasant and prices are very reasonable.

j2QXi2EbjuwbqcyE-fvRBA.text: Great Food ... but the service was horrible we waited for water for 20 minutes we ask for water and still nothing. .. my sister had to get up from her seat and get it for their side station........

TCMrxFdGzqOabR4-tM0dog.text: I enjoy the convenience of a 24 hour pho place. Service is always okay but the food has never disappointed me.

sYi_SPLa7mXUv63MWYLcTw.text: Pho in Vegas?  Who would have thought?  And 24 hours?!!  Coming off of the best pho I've ever had at Vietnamese Central in Westminster, Orange County, CA...  this place was flavorful, but not AMAZING.  [=THE 411=] I'm assuming if you're a visitor, you'll come here either for cheap lunch or for a late-night, post-clubbing chow-down.  I think this place will do it for either one -- as long as you're craving pho.  [=SERVICE/WAIT=] We came in with a group of 10 for a late-ish lunch.  Parking wasn't too hard, even though the lot was pretty full.  They seemed pretty busy too, but we only had to wait 5 minutes or so to get seated, so that was surprising.  Waters came out quickly, so OK on the service.  [=THE FOOD: PHO=] Pho is definitely the thing to get -- cheapest for the most food.  I had one of the pho with three cuts of meat.  It was a little salty and I wish they had more noodles, but no other complaints.  I wish they had given more bean sprouts and basil for our large group, but I'm sure we could have asked and they would have gladly obliged.  [=VERDICT=] I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here next time I visit Vegas unless I was specifically craving pho -- but chances are, I'll get something better/more expensive, or cheaper/closer.  If you're only visiting Vegas for a few days...  why get something you can get anywhere else?

WS-DeM_f1PclFOH-DLQjCQ.text: 24 hour Pho, they know how to do it.  If only they didn't make the broth so salty it would have been good.  The meat came out medium rare, just enough so I could dunk it under the noodles to let it cook a little before consuming.  They definitely want you in and out.  A few people wanted to take our order and before we could finish we were asked if we were done and the check was coming.  Maybe the other dishes were good, but when they say Pho, the first item I would go for is the Pho Tai.

UOQQ6NWH4QhIrcEnMWgTJQ.text: Large portions for amount paid. Food was really good! Great atmosphere. Knowledgable waiters. Family oriented.

24WmmcKJeWk0rSjxefw5QQ.text: First time here. The wait was not too bad. The hostess was super nice. But it seemed like the waiter took forever to come by and get our order. When he finally did come, he was obviously impatient and started tapping his foot. The food came out slower than anticipated for a pho place. Food was ok. Lettuce wraps were a little burnt. I may give it one more chance and order something different. Soups weren't anything spectacular. I'll stick to Pho So 1 for my pho fix.

tgA6tCTpNIkz5KYIO_4a-g.text: It's nice to get off the strip, and this is one of the places where I'd take you.  Hungover? Tired of American food? Dehydrated and mal-nutritioned? Come here for your fix!  I remember everyone's food was pretty good. Decent prices, definitely cheaper than any mediocre Vietnamese food on the strip. About $7 for a bowl of Pho or any noodle soup.  I got the Combination Noodle Soup with both Rice Noodle and Yellow Egg Noodle. Holy crap!! The soup was delicious! Very good broth and tasted pretty darn close to perfection.  Also, the decor and interior of this restaurant is extremely clean and modern looking. One of the most appealing Vietnamese/Pho restaurants I've ever been to.

-YTMQSn6cJRYObDoN3OigA.text: The food here is OK, nothing to brag about. In fact its a little expensive compare to the other pho places in town. If your looking for a quick fixing, pho kim long does the job right. It's conveniently located in chinatown as soon as you get on to spring mountain rd. I like coming here after work usually around midnight because its so close to work.

GYKbwfYSrdIGKbDN6TxTWw.text: So, this is the spot that a lot of Asians like to go to while in Vegas..and the morning after...with a hangover.  Maybe just me.  But anyway.  Considering it's the only Pho place I have been to in Vegas, maybe I'm just too spoiled coming from SoCal where there's Pho places everywhere.  The broth had a different taste to it...and it was much heavier.. more msg?  The noodles weren't as soft (even after letting it soak in the broth for a while). The meat was okay, but there were pieces that did not look appealing.  The service was okay, they were nice.  They were very quick in seating 9 of us, but took forever in coming back to take our orders..We had to flag them down.  Also, they seemed a bit hasty in clearing our plates (maybe they were running low?).  It can be kinda awkward..especially when I'm still eating and they're trying to take my food away... Overall, it was okay.

UAcfIuX7QLOcLeRwqHuT5Q.text: 10mins wait time on saturday night at 10 pm but two orders of pho came out in 3 mins! Pho soup is full of flavor but the portion of noodles and bmeat is smaller than I've expected, vegis are really fresh but cillantro is little dry. it will get you full though.

ajEOQLRIGvJyr15G4b1mnQ.text: I am a food snob. Therefore it's hard to please me completely. I've been here many times and never been disappointed!!  Always wonderful food, always a friendly, warm, fast staff!  This is the best there is!

34DYHC7rzvBQHC2r5i3ekw.text: There is more truth in these reviews for this restaurant than any other restaurant I've read upon on yelp that I've visited. Ive been many times and my experiences range from awful, to mediocre, to fantastic.  Pricing is really not that bad.       Service ranges just like the food...sometimes its terrible, and sometimes its great. I do agree with a few of the other posters in regards to asian customers seem to get better treatment and food. And i say this with the most confidence and its my friends family who owns the place and I've been with there, with her, and other family members, and we got NO discount or any other special treatment.    Also, this place plays no games. I've seen many people kicked out of the restaurant. You too drunk? Goodbye! Your too loud? Goodbye! Rude? Sleeping at table? Taking forever to eat? Goodbye!        Parking sucks and the place stays busy. 24 hour restaurant. Some of the best Pho I've had has been here as well as some of the worst.        I'd highly recommend this place when all is said and done. Its hard to beat a place that is close to the strip, thats 24 hours. If you 10 times, you will enjoy at least 5 of those trips....but thats expected at places like this that stay this busy all the time.

qXMG7mMa2C481RSw1haRzg.text: Four stars for their quality of food and how quickly it comes out. Their egg rolls are delicious, and they have a great com bo luck lac dish as well as their mi xao don. Most dishes are prepared quite well. My boyfriend loves their pho, but I am not a huge fan. It's not bad, it's just not authentic. It tastes as if they didn't have time to allow all the flavors of the star anise and herbs to get pulled into the broth itself. Probably because of their high rate of table turns. All in all, great food though... available 24 hours which is a huge plus. The only reason I only give them 4 stars is because they lack customer service and caring for their patrons. They seem to be so busy, that they just want you to eat and get the hell out. Lol! I guess I can't blame them... to go is always a great option if you're looking for quality food fast with no customer service. It's probably best to get to go so you don't get offended or upset by their service.

ZVaUDOmbmztnj4IKsWDSvg.text: Honestly, i dont get why people love this place so much but I'd give it 3 stars for being open 24 hrs, including all kinds of asian foods, and good service.  Pho here sucks IMO. Maybe its because Im from the bay area where they serve bomb pho so im kinda spoiled. but pho here sucks. their chicken pho sucks too.  i only come here when im drunk. haha

X6_IBqYKUpFORkXaiuDkIw.text: There Pho is pretty good.  I have tried their Chow Fun and it's excellent.  Weekends it gets too busy.  I ate here few times and so far so good.

-qJC75TE36Ahfwmv1T2_Tg.text: losing a star.  Since they've gone to 24/7 hours, the prices have gone up and the quality has gone down.  They turn so many tables I don't think they care about service anymore.  Still the best spot for viet food in LV but viet food shouldn't be too expensive, it's comfort food from a 3rd world country!

AwnaYZGAKws5ve7ceOO3-g.text: They are always busy but still seat you and take care of you kudos for that. I have come here about 8-9 times. They have the best vegan pho. When I'm feeling under the weather it's the only thing I crave. Their calamari is also delis  and they are open 24 hours. Prefect spot to visit after the club if you do that sort of thing. Oh and their coconut boba is amazing. Love this place.

msQ9_j-YimT72kFqdeDHrQ.text: Let's make this short...  Place was beautiful and clean. The Pho was so-so because mine came out pretty salty. Not much different Pho varieties. And I was a little bit confused about service. We didn't have one server we could talk to. There were multiple servers at a time. That makes it hard to ask for something if you needed it, or to get the bill.

HtWfxP-1TJPQXlHsASEQHg.text: I love this place, food is outstanding more times than not. I never go here and feel disappointed when it comes to the food. I am by no means an expert on Pho but I absolutely love the Pho here. I've tried almost every variant they offer and I've enjoyed them all. Even the vegetarian kind and I love meat. Their salt and pepper fish is also to die for, it's honestly one of my favorite things to eat just in general from anywhere. Only downfall of this place I would have to say is that their service is pretty iffy. Sometimes it's on point and I have no complaints but other times, even when it's not very busy people tend to ignore you and it seems you're being over looked by everyone working there. It's quite frustrating and makes me second guess this place every now and again. But still I do enjoy it when they get everything right, which they usually do.

kWPLUlM9TNvLAkJb3yuDJw.text: This is a prime example of a restaurant with too large of a menu and only a few delicious staple dishes. Best dishes is pho, hu tieu, and bun thit nuong. Everything else falls very short from even mediocre including their version of an egg roll. The chow mien is one dish they really screwed up, the crunchy noodles came out too soft and the sauce was too bland. They tainted my palate for one of my favorites.  Jose our server was nice, but the lack of service from everyone else is due to them being very busy. So busy they don't have chopsticks and spoons at every table, so prepare to grab your own from another table.

abclzhv2QnRMdtwZYcL63w.text: Family and I went in for lunch on Sunday around 3. We were able to get seated fairly quickly because there was no line. The food and service was mediocre at best. The one star rating is because the waitress demanded more tip money. The bill had came and I paid with tip and placed the money on the tray which accompanied the bill. The waitress came by to pick up the bill and when she saw the tip amount she told me "This is how much 15% tip would be."  I told her I'm giving you 10% because that's what I believe you deserve. Mind you, I'm not cheap and I often tip up to 30% if the service warrants it. In this case it did not. My family and I were all so shocked that she demanded more tip. This is the first time this has ever happened to me. I believe that once a business gets established and has a lot of customers they tend to take customers for granted. We will never ever ever go back. Maybe they thought they were the only Pho store in town. There's like another five to ten Pho store within a one mile radius that we will rather go to next time we are in Vegas. Btw, I'm not the only one complaining about the tips. There's other reviews also.

6Wlaxd5xLRmTcZsu-5F4EQ.text: Pho is alright, broth is hot, sliced beef are very good and rare, but can't compare to anything from NorCal or SoCal. 24/7 hours is good for the late night partiers in Vegas, and near by the main strip. Ambience and interior is nice.  As typical with most Asian places, service was subpar. Not even a single hot water refill, even after paying a buck for tea.  Do NOT order the spicy salt fried calamari; crazy over salted, I barely ate 2 bites.  Not good, not bad pho, doubt I'll come back again.

dbmEEL-kH5JhMXsbP_THuw.text: Came here for lunch starving. Saw the pho Kim long line driving on the street (teehee, yeahs im corny af) and thought "okay it has to be good with a pho Kim long ass line like that." Got seated after about 10 minutes, lucky we beat the crowd. The line got even longer after we were seated  We had the pho combination, it sounds like pho Dat bietch. Jk jk 2 orders of pho dac biet and some bbq pork rice dish my girl ordered. No opinion on her food because I was like why dah pho u order rice at a pho joint, what dah pho?!?, pho Dat bietch.........aaaah love yelp, see how long before they delete this. I enjoyed my pho, home girl said they felt it was salty. I was like mang u salty u ordered that hard rice bbq Moar pork dish and eating more of our "salty" pho and giving me half her pho Kim hard rice bbq pork dish. Luckily I'm a bland food F-ing eating machine, so I ate that hard rice and pork. Would go here again only if there is a short wait.

x5ZhUBoofbbNsn6VGBPa0w.text: Came here after a long night at Tao. This place is 24/7 so you'll see tons of people here for some late night munchies. I got the #13 which was the combo Pho. It was delicious. The broth was amazing and the meats were so good. Noodles were perfect... not too chewy nor soft. Good way to end a night.

w7DizauoAVmGdfkoBj2V1Q.text: They use tap water as your drinking water. It tastes like chlorine. The broth was alright but the meat had a very strong odor that I couldn't even swallow. I find the waitress was very rude when she told us how much we should tip. Check out District One if you want quality Pho and service.

C15-T0WLrxmJXfFCcf6y0g.text: This is an update. Their regular pho is garbage. However, I've been vegetarian for almost 7 months now and I can honestly say that Pho Kim Long has a very good veggie pho. Just make sure you're getting veggie broth.

_J09f3uqK1czMN9JoWe5Jw.text: PHO KIM LONGGGGGGGGGG the place that opens all night LONGGGGGGG! Yes that is right they open 24 hours in Las Vegas so after a night of partying all night LONGGGGG, you should definately come here to cure your hangover! There menu here has alot of items. From rice plates, to soup bowls, to smoothie drinks! One of my favorite spots for late night eating in las vegas!

1sRCjKevCjSmrQcC9r1gdw.text: We came here on a Tuesday night and ordered the well-cooked beef pho, fried egg rolls, and seasoned rice with roti chicken for $30  - Fancy 24hr Viet restaurant. Nice flowers and fish tanks - First ever Viet restaurant where a non-Asian was our waiter. Not saying its bad, but I appreciate the diversity! haha - Living in SoCal, the pho is pretty darn expensive. But compared to SanJo, it's a bit comparable. $8ish for a reg bowl of pho. - Pho was great. Not bland, not too salty. Beef was tender. Pretty comparable to the other Viet restaurants around the area.  - Average tasting egg rolls. Crispy. pretty thick.  - They serve food other than Viet. I'd be a bit pessimistic trying it. Pad Thai? I think I'll stick to a Thai restuarant.  - Seasoned rice and chicken was delicious. Chicken was cooked well and crispy. Excellent flavoring for the rice. You don't need extra sauce to taste any flavor. Perfect!  - Service was good. No complaints.  - To call it the best, I'd have to disagree. But the presentation is a lot better than many other Viet restaurants. Great place to introduce your non-Asian friends to Viet cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and rice
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare and cooked beef pho
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls

hOntqN-bVm94R5LkrIY5Qg.text: I've been coming to this place since grade school!!..I can honestly say..they've lost that consistency and the love etc..with their food!!..back when it was a less than 10 table restaurant. .food came out and u knew it was gonna be a good bowl of pho!! I mean it was as authentic as it can get!! Now a days ..I can say I've had a bowl of instant pho and it tasted a lot better!! I guess expanding the restaurant for more bucks is better than consistency for them!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Kim long

5Z3l2u1awZYbYCu_5mQoyA.text: We orderee frying calamari and pho. Frying calamari should be renamed frying flour. The broth was decent but the noodle tasted really really weird. It tasted like they hadnt bought the noodle for a long time. We could still smell the dish wash on the spoons when they gave us spoons with veggies. The waitress saw us leaving the whole food on the table but she really didnt care. She just gave the bill and left us there.

722JRS64U_3DN23PirRYqA.text: There ok there beef pho taste like they put tomato paste in it and I don't like that. I like my broth to tastes natural if you know what I mean

Pm6yI6CyZpBDjyXFN_PUxw.text: During my college years, or at least those years I was 21+, I made several late night/early morning trips to Pho Kim Long.  Sometimes it was to feed post-clubbing munchies and at other times it was to nurse a post clubbing hangover.  Pho Kim Long was always one of the first Pho restaurants that popped up on Yelp when you searched it and in my less than 100% state I remember thinking it as pretty good.  But now that I'm a little bit older, wiser, and more sober when I eating here, it is more like 2.5 stars (I rounded up for the good blurry memories).  A bowl of Pho is right around 7.50 which isn't cheap or crazy expensive.  You can pretty much order any combination of rare beef, tripe, tendon, meatball, etc. that suites your fancy.  They give you a very average portion of everything.  One of the things that stops me from giving them more stars is their broth.  I feel that it is all about the broth; it is what makes or breaks a bowl of Pho.  I just don't find their broth to have very much flavor like other places.  Another reason why I can't justify giving them more stars is because their service is on the slow side.  I've been there on more than one occasion and even though they have lots of room and should have figured out a way to handle to their customer flow, I still always find myself waiting for really long periods of time for my food.  I don't really order anything fancier than a bowl of Pho so it shouldn't take that long.  I'm sorry Pho Kim Long. I want to like you more because of our history, but you are just another average Pho Joint and nothing special in my mind.

8ENbjr2cc6hoKWQawZQE8g.text: This has to be the best "vegan" pho I've had in vegas , they fill that plate with goodies .. at some point i got tired of eating as it was way to much vegetables ..  The noodles were soggy :) BTW  I call this place "fucking long" ^_^

3nk-l90vqxSK8vEUjeHNRA.text: Long wait means good food! Located on a busy china town. Best time to come here is before or after lunch or dinner traffic, no waiting time, plenty of seats.

nOgtJYGrbshJXtqR_UQhKA.text: I am so disgusted ...  I am pretty sure that they have changed management because the old manager would never have let this happen or treated his customers thus. I would give this place 0 stars but it will not let me.  I have been coming here for at least 10 years and sometimes 3xs a week and I can't tell tell you how grossed out I am.    Let's start off with the dirty sticky tables and dirty silverware, which had food stuck on it.  That should have been my cue to get up and go somewhere else.  First off I ordered the special fried egg rolls and they tasted rancid and cold, so they remade it and they tasted like the old ones were thrown back into the fryer and served back to us. Then I took a bite of the chicken teriyaki that I ordered for my 3 year old son and it tasted slimy and cold in the middle, I took apart 5 or 6 pieces and they were all clear and pink in the middle, so I ate RAW chicken .  I told the waitress and then her manager approached the table and when I told him that the chicken was raw his response was "you don't know what you talk about chicken is pink" at this point I didn't feel like arguing with anyone so I paid for my 3 young coconuts and my Thai boba totaling in $22.49 and left (yes I left the poor waitress her 20% tip bc it's not her fault that they hired cooks that do not know that chicken needs to have an internal temp of 165 degrees)   I would skip this filth ridden place and I wouldn't be surprised if they ended up in dirty dinning soon.

wBkeylwgoegUDxVSvUVXRQ.text: I cant believe im just now writing this review. I was really sick, when i came here with my best friend so i wanted some Pho. I ordered the large and of course ate none of it. So i asked the lady who was serving us if she would box it up. I wish at this moment i would've been recording her. She proceeds to put my food in the containers and we were watching her. She drops one of my shrimps on the table. So she looks at me and says "that's okay" I'm looking at her and  nodding my head yes thinking she's asking me if that's okay if she dropped one of my shrimps on the table. No, i was wrong. After I shake my head yeah, she picks the shrimp up off the table with here BARE hands and puts it in my to-go container with the rest of my food. I couldn't believe what I had seen, that was disgusting and unsanitary. I didn't even have the energy to argue with her about it. Common sense you don't do that because I don't know where her hands had been and if they had cleaned the table. That food went straight in the trash. I will NEVER eat at this establishment again and I will warn all my family and friends. I'm surprised this place hasn't been on dirty dining yet.

z8DdbN4uHnKFGzcfZZLN0A.text: Just plain delicious.  I had their combination egg noodle soup.  Very very good.  My wife had the beef noodle soup.  Also excellent.  We eat here every time we are in Las Vegas.  And the service is also good.  The place is clean and the food fresh.

XBoGfejnB4V9wzEjk4YGKQ.text: Best Pho in Vegas. If you're looking for a place to go on a rare rainy day in this desert, this is where you should be headed. The pho is delicious, but if you aren't that kind of person... There is a huge, delicious menu for you to peruse over. And it is just an added bonus that this place is open 24 hours.

cUCj51gUnv6P_CwO66VKAA.text: My friends and I ate here for two nights in a row after a long night at the clubs lol. I love how it's open for 24 hours, which is the main reason why we ate here. I'm sure other groups who have been out all night go here for the same reason. There are plenty of seats and we didn't need to wait long to get seated.  Both nights I came here, I had pho with briskets in it. I think it was #15? I'll have to double check. The portion wasn't too big, and I had more meat than noodles the first time I came here, which is fine but I'm someone who likes equal ratios of meat and noodles. It was pretty good, but just in general I don't like the water in Las Vegas, which didn't make this the best pho for me and I always feel queasy when I drink water outside of where I live, but it did its job of feeding me.  Overall I had pretty good service, food came out fast and the dishes itself were pretty good. I would still come here again next time I'm in Las Vegas. Hopefully I won't feel too bad from drinking Vegas water next time.

rO19Abe8BHW9PJ0uToNPAg.text: Decent pho. Tasted more beef stock than bone stock but it was yummy. Nice cut of meat. Pork chops were spectacular.   Server was polite and attentive.   Open all night a plus.  Can  be really crowded at times

XoT2Pr3_lupBKO4xKaZgqw.text: The food here is not the best, services are like any other Asian restaurant , not as good as any other restaurants I've been too. The man that checked me out was rude and unprofessional ,when I came up to check out he did not ask to see if everything's ok , the only word he ask was do you want to add the gratuity in the bill , I said no I'll do it myself and he gave me a nasty attitude . I will not be back , there's plenty other VN restaurants around .

hdnw0YqKxZjR_QgXDRBcyg.text: Vegan pho was great from what I can remember. Was so shit hammered in surprised I can remember anything at all. A nice gem in the otherwise vapid shithole that is Vegas.

fN_-vONKNnCFRAm4m0lPQQ.text: I use to like this place, the food was good never disappointed me. It's been a while since I ate here and the quality of the food is horrible now and I think increasing the menu prices is a joke. I definitely won't come back. Just not for me.

5dsuNR7uh71Q8Ql1GCQKdA.text: Use to be my favorite place. We get seated, they take our order and bring our food. They never checked up on us and never got a refill. We waited for our check for about an hour. Once we finally asked for it, we went up to the front register to pay. The night manager kept trying to make us tip him. We were trying to tip him $4 in cash for the bad service. He just laughed. I asked if we get refills. He ignored me. Then i said "we should've just tipped him one dollar." He then told us "take your money". He was so rude. I will never come back.

KgfJq3Ij42CCCclEfygjOg.text: I always been too faded by the time I make it out here to truly rate the food but i finally made it on this past trip!  Pho Kim Long is located off the strip in Chinatown area of Las Vegas. Very popular late night spot for locals and frequent visitors. If you're craving pho, this is the spot to get it at!  Extremely reasonable prices for the food (very cheap compared to the Strip!) and good sized portions. Pretty much every dish is under $10.  As far as the quality goes, its pretty good! i'm from San Jose so I'm pretty familiar with Vietnamese food, and Pho Kim Long can hold it's own. No complaints with the pho, rice plates, or vercimelli bowls!  Only downfall is that it gets super busy around 3am. So if you're super wasted and don't have the patience (or ability lol) to sit around and wait, I would look for other options.But other then that, this is one of my favorite off-strip joints in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PTlBBo4tauOfnGKl5M-7SA.text: The wait is usually long during peak times. And for good reason, it's the locals go to especially industry service crowd. Expect to wait but it's worth it for traditional Pho

-C_PR1An9lvkn2Rug-2_rA.text: Cool staff and interesting menu choices making everything a hard pick. So far everything is cool but loud atmosphere. Perfect for late night outings

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super full not a single table available! Manager is phenomenal &amp; operating on super sonic speed!

8snSANmSmptcIF0Pg1up0A.text: I don't like being negative, but I don't mind telling the truth. The most mediocre Pho I've ever had. And some of the crappiest service around...unless you're asian.   I absolutely dislike saying this, but it was so clearly apparent. Our waiter was a jerk! In the entire restaurant, there was only our table and one other table that wasn't asian. Both tables were neglected and weren't even given chopsticks. Come on!!! White people can't use chopsticks?   Our waiter also forgot my sister in laws noodles and two beverages. How do you just forget an order that you wrote down?   And my Beef Pho wasn't very flavorful and the beef was nearly inedible. It was so fatty and chewy. But, it was inexpensive. $7-something and came with add-ins. Like jalapenos, basil and mung beans. There's also house made sauces and spicy pepper sauces like Sriracha.   And I guess you need to go stupid early, because A) Parking is a Nightmare and B) there's a 6 p.m. dinner rush which means you will be smushed in the doorway with a bunch of grumpy people for an hour.   It's also open 24 hours and located within Las Vegas's China Town.   All in all...I'm not recommending this place if you want good Pho or if you're not asian? I totally don't understand the reviews. Because apparently the clueless white folks are getting the crappy scraps or something.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A8RFbHeoz88nlDVwxghDJw.text: Very pleased with the food and the customer service, this will be a mandatory stop when close to Vegas. Loved the vegan pho! Pho chay for life !

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mandatory stop while in vegas :)

AjwD5MEe-K0gUri4Rcu-7g.text: Forgot how good the pho is! I've had it twice in the last week, a dine in and a take out. Service is fast, and everyone is moving around very fast pace. Staff is friendly and food is good! Definitely recommend!

sbwwEM9RkwoL1gcIMk-P9A.text: Terrible! Never go there ever again. The food was bad. Missing lots of things like no napkins and sauce. Requested for napkins and they never came. Kick us out of the table when we were waiting for someone to get out of the restroom.

IZz4DCK6snE2dw4Bnr_G1w.text: I tried to enjoy a meal at your restaurant yesterday afternoon and i got food poisoning from there. I had pad thai and a bowl of regular pho with rare steak. Even though it was busy during my visit that gives no excuse to NOT prepare food correctly. The soup was not as hot as it is usually and the combination Pad Thai looked okay to me. I felt okay up until around 7pm on 11/26/2018 and then it all hit me. I could not stop throwing up from 7pm until I went to the UMC ER and they gave me medicine to bring down the nausea. My stomach pains unbearable which was reason enough to go to the ER and get checked. I really believe this restaurant should follow lawful procedures when preparing their food. Things like would never happen if you people took the time to care for your guest eating at your restaurant. BE CAREFUL EATING HERE PEOPLE!!!

aB2ucl4acXZKp9s30jGOIA.text: I have only been here a couple times and from the looks of the place thought it was going to be a pricey one.  Great Pho, just be sure not to add too many of the leaves or it will ruin the whole soup. I like to squeeze a little Chinese hot sauce and Oyster sauce to bring out the flavor. Overall a very clean environment and real fast service when it comes to food being prepped. I received my order within 10 minutes for sure and this was after waiting in line for 10 minutes for a place to sit!  If your hungry and think the best food joints are closed, think again.  I will surely stop by whenever im around the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination Pho
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring Rolls w/ Peanut Sauce
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast Duck

qGjLZIwDx54X7vrOsnuweQ.text: Unfortunately, Pho Kim Long did not meet my expectations that I was hoping for.  The service was pretty good. Our server tended to our requests in a timely manner and did what we asked. The food came out on time, too. However, the quality of the food was mediocre at best.  I started with the fried calamari. It was drenched in salt. All I could taste was salt. I was a little "salty" when they did this. The plate also had shells of fried batter that did not have calamari. In fact, half of the plate was fried calamari and the other half was fried batter. This plate is probably for people who REALLY enjoy salty foods and have a small craving for calamari.  Now, onto the entree, the pho. I ordered the Pho Tai (rare thinly cut beef) Bo Vien (meat balls). The broth and noodles were average; they did not have me jumping out of my seat because it was delicious nor did it have me throwing up because it was awful. The Tai, on the other hand, was pretty good. It was what I expected it to be, easy to chew and flavorful with the hoisin and Sriracha sauces. I wish I could say the same about the Bo Vien. They were the worst meat balls I have ever had at a vietnamese restaurant. I ate one meat ball and put the rest of the meat balls on a separate dish to be thrown out later. It seemed like the meat was processed with plastic. It had no consistency and quickly broke in your mouth without even chewing. It was absolutely disgusting.  As a final thought, I think you would be best trying something else other than the Pho Bo Vien.

20BVrBbX98rKXsw8f4CKmQ.text: Went here twice in one day.  Not because it is awesome food, but because it is open 24hrs and was accessible.  The Pho is great.  But my favorite is the beef cube.  The biggest disappointment this time was the chicken fried rice.  There was hardly any chicken and very bland.  Not sure if it was because it was 2:30am and they ran out or not.  But other than that, a good place to get your late night fix.

YKr1H5HCEA0IN70pbpUAow.text: It opens 24/7 meaning they don't have any down time to CLEAN and to train their staff. What I saw was poor service and dirty tables, as far as the food, Pho was served cold and the broth was made in a hurry for a quick serve.  Here is my suggestion to the managers there, if the food is not ready to serve then do NOT serve it, simply let the customers know, everyone understands that.  Our pho took nearly 25 minutes to come and the waiter was extremely RUDE.  My family for sure won't return here and my guess is that all the reviews on yelp are being paid for.  Not even a 1 star.

HM89r2NtXrTn5AwZ9tOtqg.text: #37 Bomb !!!! Service wasn't right but very fast. I end up eating my other guest food not knowing it wasn't mine guess that was the server fault lol. But AMAZING AND 24/7

QM3u3wP3THom8Mrh9lazGA.text: Soups were average.. Service needs a little help. They accept credit cards but really stress that they want you to pay cash! Only plus is that they're open 24 hrs!

fbvHNz7b5ZJMBPf0v_x5kg.text: Hands down, the BEST 24/hr Pho place I've been to! I've been to quite a few, growing up as north OC girl and all.  We pulled in around 2am and was seat promptly. Waters came right away. Waiters took our food right away. The food came right away. Speedy service!  My pho's broth was amazing! One of the best I've had. Light, savory, and not too sweet. Just how I like it!

iYYiSSDymuWyLi_rxBB68A.text: This place has really improved within the last year. Their service has dramatically improved. I am assuming that this place has recently gone under new management for the better. The food is still delicious and in my opinion does not need to change at all. I will continue to be a customer.

72aGrntWCBaRJLvxneHr0A.text: Really bad service. Everyone in my group received their food and they left me waiting for the longest time. My friend reminded them about my food and we continued to wait. I waited too long again and I had to go talk to a waiter again. By the time I got my food everyone was almost done with theirs. They didn't come by to apologize or to tell me they were having trouble with my food. I had to take my food to go.

1C8eDkvn_eA7fyhL9yJp_g.text: Since moving away from SW Vegas, away from my beloved Bamboo Bistro, we decided to make Pho Kim Long our main Vietnamese spot, and it hasn't really disappointed!  All dishes that we have tried are very affordable in price and even more generous in servings. We have enjoyed most of the dishes they have served us.   The usual night hostess is very sweet and helpful, always taking drink orders and actually paying attention to the patrons. I remember when she went out of her way to bring me my soda when our server forgot about it, very awesome.  Speaking of the service, it's sub-par really. Most of the servers we have received don't check on us often, let the glasses go empty for awhile, or don't seem interested in ensuring great service. Being a manager at a restaurant on the strip I have high standards, however I realize that not every business is like mine, and I can't judge other servers too much.  Food, amazing. Atmosphere, very casual. Hours, amazing, 24 hours. Go. Eat. Now!

hviDhPbOcRINX0eU1-MZaA.text: For Vegas food, this is a to-go place for those who seek Asian food and for those who need something to cure a hangover.  It is reasonably priced, but for our party of 5, it went up to $80 (yes, they charge gratuity!).   Service here is friendly.  It opens late (which is great!!).  My only complaint is that they might forget if you ask for water, need additional plates, spoons, etc.

THU2kQSDil6HTJQz9h36QQ.text: Delicious pho! The service isn't very attentive, but the food tastes great. I have been here twice, and both times were packed but didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes to be seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Number 15 pho with Thai tea

8REtgJiJe5R54tBL8aMdiQ.text: Shitty service. Perfect pho. Perfect fresh spring rolls with peanut sauce. Vermicelli is always tasty. 24 hours open, totally works for me!

2wNDs5goRZeEuqi72V6hDw.text: Favorite place for pho. Nice atmosphere, quick service, and good food. Can sometimes get too busy to get a seat during lunch time though.  My favorites: #13 combination special Shrimp fried rice Pad Thai

ZanUygr7BM3_Jr7dmvrEfw.text: We got there around 1am for late dinner.  The servers are nice but they are way toooo busy for us.  We waited more than 20 mins before we can order.... i was starving!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  gosh....   overall the food is alrite... but i'm glad they opened almost 24/7...

lGGZn3eNmbDJDYAQaCredQ.text: I guess after the rapid growth of business, Pho Kim Long starts having some issue on their QC and customer service. Last time me and my girl went there, we found a cock roach in the soup and told the server about it. And guess what? He came check out the bug body and then took it away. Then he claimed that it was just some pepper they used to make soup and left a check then walked away. I can't believe this is how they treat their customer.

2nVZEVkub1iTaYQRkicP0w.text: It's like a fusion asian restaurant usually when you think of pho, you'd expect only Vietnamese food but there's a variety. The atmosphere & vibe is great. So is the pho, which was excellent. Next time I'm in Vegas, I plan on trying out some new stuff here. This is a really great place to get a pho fix, I consider this a place for excellent delicious sober food.

8wOX_TP51XJK9g6rk31pVw.text: Decent pho open 24/7. I got the pho dac biet was pretty good although quite expensive for around $9. The service is here is pretty subpar which is my main reason for knocking this place down a bit. The waiters here all have pretty crappy attitudes and were slow to help, part of it could've been attributed to the fact it was 6AM and they were fairly busy but they definitely could've been nicer.

9Od9DWJJcpAZyaSwzJquow.text: My family and I were in Las Vegas a week ago and were craving some Vietnamese Food because I mean, look at Las Vegas. No pho restaurants. But holy mother of God, they have one near LV. So we went in and I could see they decorated this place pretty well. But the line had like 70 people in there (well, at least my mom said so). We waited, because Asians cannot go a week without some Pho or rice. When we got to our table, it was a little sticky (well, almost ALL pho restaurants have those) but we didn't care.   The pho was a little pricy, but they came out fabulous! Totally worth your money. It's not like Pho Kim Long is the Gucci of pho places, but definitely it's great. Pour some of dat Sriracha and hoisin sauce into your big bowl of pho, add some bean sprouts and jalapeno, and squeeze in some of dat lime. Delishussss.   Okay, maybe the service was a little slow, but this is the only good and authentic pho place in town. And how to know the pho is authentic? The broth must have this layer of fat on top, but it's no big deal. I mean, if you have never tried pho before, shame on you. As I said before, delishussss.  And parking...meh. Service...meh. Forgets orders...meh. Those things made this a four star review. But still good though.

dbHFE-C2EZRAAl4-lF6ekg.text: A bit of a wait, but that's expected for a popular joint. Best pho ever!  Kind and fast service with great food! Open 24 hrs and near the strip.  Even if you are not into pho, they have great selection of different varieties. Liked this place so much ate here twice during the same Vegas trip.

zIwiAwrOphL-OO8KK7no3w.text: Worst service ever. If pho kim long wasn't 24 hour and open for me after 4 am, I would've never gone. They do not pay attention to refilling your beverages. The servers inattentive , you might as well just walk out without paying because they just don't care about customer service.   All I wanted was to eat pho at 5am, but what I got was the worst experience. I waited 20 minutes for my check and ended up going straight to the cashier which was mandated by an arrogant worker who was dressed like he was going to a club. He was so rude asking what I ordered when I clearly did not know the exact numbers for my table. He ended up getting mad at ME because HE couldn't find my check. He couldn't even walk a couple steps for me to show him what table I was at. I honestly wouldve gave this place no stars, but then it wouldn't have let me write a review.

L4KHUsTFbwkIQH8ayeB1YQ.text: The food here is always amazing. No matter what I order from here it's always good. I used to only come in for the Pho but I'd look at other tables with plates and finally decided to try the Japanese Udon Noodles.....game changer!! I get it every time now. Knocked off a star bc the service is crap but the price and food quality are so good I don't think anyone cares. Servers usually just come to your table, take order and you won't see them again until they drop your check (unless u wave them down while they help their other 15tables). Sometimes I don't even wait for them to run my card I just go to the cashier soon as I get the check because they take forever. Go for the food, not service!!

gpRPtp6QBahCkmM-R--AJQ.text: Ive actually been here twice since my last review. Always delicious food. I always love coming here. And its open late which is fantatic after being out on the strip.

6B1GOETDF6DI2tGcGji7kg.text: I went here on a Friday evening and only waited about 10 minutes. The food was alright, it was a tad salty. Our waiter was quick and efficient.   My group of friends and I came back on a Sunday afternoon, we only waited for 10 minutes again. The food was still a tad salty, the waitress never brought us more vegetables for our pho. She asked us how much tip we wanted to add on our bill, we said we will add it afterwards. I thought that was rude.

jE7LtN1O2XZYX-OeN0Y_yQ.text: Very tasty food, extremely fast service and the staff were very friendly. Prices are reasonable. They have bubble tea!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Bubble Tea

YbAh0x-eaDZz_qrRnEQjhw.text: Real authentic and delicous the servings are appropriate definitely will try again, we are from out of town and was recommended by someone in the area.

Xf2A7ZdzPwmr9z2BSQLTiw.text: After 5 years, figure I will give them a chance to see if there are improvements. NOT!  Soup stock is luke warm, still excessive amount of five spices, meatballs has more fillers than beef and taste like chalk.   Definitely NOT coming back ever this time!

mOa6uTvFTvvaEiLuVN6jdw.text: Whenever I come in to eat I usually have a large party with me. They are always very accommodating with our needs.  We always order the Pho, Spring Rolls, Egg Rolls with all the sauces, and whatever else captivates our senses that particular day. This restaurant has never let me down with the quality of food or service.  The atmosphere is the normal hustle and bustle of our city but the food and service reigns supreme...if you have to wait to be seated,  it is well worth it....

T3NZDFaCZwY0Y-CIqYf-1g.text: The pho here was average. We had to wait 30 minutes to be seated but it was still a good meal and we had a big party. Unfortunately, it was so big they split us into two groups.   The fried egg rolls were delicious but they only had chicken and they had a good amount of veggies in it, the whole time I wish they were pork but they were still good.   The pho was lacking something to make it stand out but it was still good.

3tVAmRID1vQejGHbJ6H4pA.text: Absolutely love the pho here . Love that they have vegan pho as well . And the fresh young coconut, just awesome . Me and my boyfriend come by here every month or so . Definitely one of our favorite spots .

VoN5sl1jxYlhI6NLZaTSuQ.text: The default place to go for decent Vietnamese food in Las Vegas, NV. The service is fast & efficient. Their Pho is acceptable. The seafood mi (egg noodle soup) is OK.   The grilled chicken rice place has several good and not-so-good elements. The chicken breast is tender, well marinated & flavorful. But the green onion in oil is still raw; it subtracts so much from the dish. And the nuoc mam is watered down.   The Vietnamese ice coffee is typical.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Cha Gio (fried egg rolls). Many mint leaves beyond bruised. Nice light flavors. Rating: Pretty Good.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Dac Biet (house special beef noodle soup). Rating: Acceptable.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Mì (egg noodle soup). Flavor on light side. Good portion. Rating: OK.

PQN-rfS9eV7gguRRgLeeTg.text: Bad experience with the Vietnamese iced coffee. They don't even drip it in front of you. They do it in the back and bring it in a styrofoam cup. I've had Vietnamese coffee at many places and this had a weird medicine taste. Maybe I got a bad batch. If you order it, hopefully yours will be better!  Their other food was great. Pho and vermicelli noodles were delicious. I think their prices are a little higher though compared to other places now that they have become well known. :)

TT6ay-8P3vN8JNJJsQ9WOA.text: Terrible customer service, everyone works there looked sad and not friendly, this is the only pho place that open 24hours, so I guess they might be tired. They took forever to just to ask us what to drink( they are not busy at all). I got their beef stew noodle soup, spring roll, beef broccoli, the soup and beef broccoli was way too salty and had way too much MSG in it. Sorry to say the only decent thing was their egg roll sauce! We paid our check and tipped 20% and leave. Anyway we wouldn't eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HFEl_PVJgU67O3EVTaIgbw.text: The food was great. Especially at 4am, I am glad we found that place. The service was so so, but I still gave 5 stars because the food was good and affordable.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; nuts.

nYHu4Mv0Tm_WAgj4PkYUmA.text: I order shrimp fried rice, with Mongolian beef, and roasted duck. Shrimp Fried rice was cold, Mongolian beef was good, roasted duck too greasy and over cooked. I know some of this items are not cooked daily so they are reheated but please don't over cook them. Also waitress was rushing us to take our order. She was polite but she only gave us a minute of her time. We couldn't ask questions about the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fried Rice was a lil cold, Mongolian Beef good, the Roasted Duck A little tooo greasy and too over cooked for me but it was ok.

NoFbB7JrdcPDNwRdpyYRDA.text: Very busy restaurant with at times long waits. Authentic Viet dishes that are spot on and available 24/7. Kids had the Pho. Adults shared the ga rang muoi, vit quay, canh chua, ray muong xao, thit kho, ca kho, muc rang muoi. Will definitely come back if we visit with our parents again.

OOk6W7gac4E6OKtwDCM0Ug.text: I just ate there, food and customer services was really bad. I'm never coming back. sorry

OwgSq9Q-wenBAOwWiGJm_A.text: Busy place but food is great and the price is ok.  Staff is ok depends who helps u.  Parking is iffy but I got cuz it's so good

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey pork chops
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasoned rice
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggies for pho

hqUIT4AJ2p98MzdvGGGIig.text: Came here after a long night at Marquee with about 8 people. The wait was 15 minutes even though it was only 11am in the morning. Surprisingly the place was filled with a bunch of families, not hungover partiers that I expected.    The pho selection is surprisingly small but you can customize it by requesting add-ons. I got a #15 and added tendon The pho came out quite quickly but somehow they made a mistake on half our orders. I got a large bowl of pho with no tendon at all even though I requested a small. They said that add-ons automatically upgrades it to a large which I wasn't even told. However when I looked inside the bowl, there wasn't even any tendon! I'm fairly sure they messed up my order and forced me to take a large. They finally came by with some tendon after multiple requests and it was terrible. The tendon was chewy, hard and tasted like cardboard...one of the worst tendon pieces I've ever had.   My friends said this is one of the best in Vegas but if this is the best...I don't want to know what's the worse. The soup was bland and flavorless. The only saving grace was the huge amount of meat. I am still not sure why this place is so popular, maybe people are looking at the yelp ratings only? I would recommend you to consider other pho options in Vegas instead of coming here.

AbSGp0fblb7jJ1dTdAPY6w.text: This place stays packed! Open 24 hours which is convenient. They are quite pushy once you are seated to order. I guess because of the long wait, but still that kind of ruined the experience for me. The food was good, and the place is pretty large and clean. Would visit again. They also point out the "suggested tip" percentage on the receipt multiple times, which is pretty annoying because I'm a server myself, and felt that it was kind of rude to show me over and over.

CVtJdbWl6ITSi0LVrpv2wA.text: Pho Kim Long....more like Pho Kim Wrong.  HORRIBLE, RUDE, UNPROFESSIONAL, DISRESPECTFUL "MANAGER"   I was just at this establishment (at approx. 2:30am) and it was just appalling. I have been here a couple times before and I wasn't expecting such horrible "management" skills from their "manager". The service staff wasn't so bad. Throughout the meal our cups were filled and they made sure everything was up to par. Everything was running smoothly up until the bill arrived. I was in a party of 4 and we needed a split check. We went up to the register to pay and it took a while for anyone on staff to assist us. Once we ask for a split check one server gave us a dumbfounded look and walked away from the register. Then another man went to the register and flat out said "We don't do split checks."   *Sidenote* I have been here before around the same time and they were able to do a split check without any hassle.   I told the guy that they were able to fulfill the request last time but he said, "Thats impossible, not without my approval". He was very rude and when I was explaining this to him he was practically ignoring me and a my group while he was counting money from another party. Flat out ridiculous. He also charged my friend our whole check before we were told we couldn't split it and faked a void.   NO MATTER HOW DESPERATE YOU ARE FOR FOOD ON THE STRIP LATE AT NIGHT YOU'RE SERIOUSLY BETTER OFF AT SOME GREASY DRIVE THRU THAN PHO KIM LONG.

_1dybLNyw1dB_ltecPRqoQ.text: This is my favorite viet restaurant to go to after hours!   I always come here cause it's open late and the food is great! I always order the crispy garlic chicken and rau muon. I also order the walnut shrimp.

7zfVm6BKArovFA5KhVrc6A.text: This was the worst dining experience. We get there and order. My guest wanted a soft boiled egg in her Pho (which she requested with no noodles. So just meat, broth, 1 egg) the waiter said of course, not a problem. She gets her soup and it is a raw egg.  No one comes to refill our drinks the entire time  Finally get our bill and we are charged $4 for 1 RAW EGG! When we asked about it the manager said well we should have known and there is nothing he can do. He was absolutely rude. Will not visit there again!

dr3-w2JKFqUX6dohMV_iog.text: This is my go-to pho place in Vegas. Ample parking.  Service isn't bad. Portions are large. Pho tastes pretty authentic. They accept card. There is a restroom. And the place is pretty clean. Above average compared to other pho places!   Recommend getting the combination pho a $12 after tax and tip :)

NGc5yhnAIqgnuOze5UfHvg.text: Great vietnamese food in Vegas close-ish to the Strip (you will need to Uber..)  The pho and bun bo hue is fine. There's no pig's blood in the bbh which is a little disappointing but otherwise it's very authentic and yummy.  some of the appetizers were a little different from the pics so I'd be wary of that. the chicken lettuce wraps were the best app we ordered and would recommend.

3KgCjKzfwrZHiMaR5GWDzQ.text: Decor was interesting, as it was half Chinese and half Vietnamese... but that didn't distract me from enjoying delicious food with my friends. Service was quick and efficient. We were seated instantly and given water right away(I always appreciate that anywhere I go).   I definitely recommend the pho there, but we also got a calamari appetizer for the table that was quite delicious. The Chinese food selection looks great as well but I'd probably never try it.  I probably won't come back here because I know that there are better pho restaurants around the area. But if you're in need of some pho quick, this is your spot.

oOdY9HWlqcCtKGFh1E3LQg.text: This is my favorite pho place in Vegas, and I'm not alone. Even in the late hours of the night at 3 am this place will have a bit of a wait, even longer if you come at a prime time. But BOY, their pho is the best. Their broth is really what makes it. I always order either the #14, with just rare steak, or #15, rare steak and brisket. Other than the pho I love the tradition fried eggrolls. This is the best spot to go to for your hangover cue after a late night around town because it's 24 hours.  They also have extremely fast service which makes waiting for a table go by faster. The restaurant is quite large, so there are always people leaving, opening up new tables quickly. The only time I thought this was a negative thing was when I was unsure of what I wanted and the waitress kept coming to the table for my order. If I timed it in between she came back every 20-30 seconds to ask. Now that I have been here a lot, I know my go-to order, so it isn't a problem anymore, but for newbies, this can put a lot of pressure on them. It makes sense though. Lots of hungry guests at the door, they'd want people in and out so they don't lose any customers who can look at the menu as they wait for their seat.
