zH2qe9sKc3jJN4gg3Dk9zg.text: Wait is long but I didn't mind it. However, our food wasn't worth the wait. Hubby got pho which was OK, and I got a rice plate with wok seared flank (no luc lac) It was bland, nothing special about it or memorable. Definitely think this place is overhyped. There are a lot of other options that are so much better.

F4f8FH6UjadIRA6rOi6DiQ.text: They have a good service and also good food. I definitely go there again when we go to Las  Vegas on the next trip.

ugJbhgK20FezrEDL7esWYQ.text: Came here for take out to bring back to our hotel . We ordered a chicken teriyaki box and a Singapore meifun. My noodle dish was alright, not great but not bad. A good portion but not too much toppings and meat. The chicken teriyaki on the other hand was a very small portion and my husband was so angry because this is perhaps the most infuriating chicken teriyaki he has ever had. Not worth $10 for like 4 pieces of chicken and 1.5 piece of broccoli.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken teriyaki on top

ZkhHEQoU1LEdwtaUk5Xlbw.text: My favorite place for soups. The masters. Love it.  Service is fast, food is great.  Highly recommended and addictive. Haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PoL_uwuPtHdEya7ztAQgoA.text: Another place that has it's fans and a decent following, but the food is kind of greasy and items such as fried rice is bland and again greasy.  Yes, it's popular nearly all the time. I just don't know why. The food has to taste good and to me it just doesn't cut it.

hvA368lLEH8d-CCpf7dF-Q.text: The staff were very helpful and the food was very good.  We had beef noodle soup, fried veggies, vermicelli with chicken and fresh coconut drink.  The noodle soup could be hotter, but it was still very tasty.  The coconut drink is worth ordering for sure.

vBylAVIsJGkt3-K9KRKyYg.text: I realize now in retrospect that this entire bad experience was my own fault. I was the fool for coming here sober. Funny name. Efficient service (or could it be "uncomfortably rushed", as another yelper wrote previously?). That's about it in the way of pros.   Cons: Their canh chua (like a sweet/sour soup) comes out much later than your other items. Everything else comes out a split second after ordering and is lukewarm at best. Water takes forever to get. Typically complimentary condiments are by request only, and that's if you manage to get someone's attention. With all the competition Vegas has to offer, we won't be back.

acAsvaiuXs4BiOmXJghucA.text: We were skipped over on the waiting list, then got seated for 15 minutes and ended up leaving when the waiters kept passing us by. The final straw was seeing later customers get their food while we havent even ordered food.   Awful service and unorganized. Disappointed and will not come again.

yOcBFmN_OF683FYpLiWOFA.text: The food was delicious and flavorful! I was famished so was very happy when the food came quick! The spring rolls never disappoint and the pho is a must have! My friend got the drunken noodles and got a stomach ache so I would probably stay away from all those peanut oils! The server were average and didn't check on us often.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let&#39;s get this pho!

BhK-IZApTLJq5j2cZ7a39A.text: Finally decided to check this place out on recent layover in Vegas. Pho kim long is located right in the Chinatown area. It's very nice location with parking available. Parking can be difficult to come across, but it ain't too bad, especially during lunch area.   I always get the Combo pho dat biet wherever I go. It has beef balls, rare steak, beef brisket, tripe, etc... I love all the meats and soup broth was pretty good. Not terribly expensive, it cost like just under $9 bucks for the large. I didn't even know there was a small and large version. My girlfriend ordered the pho with just rare steak and it was a small size. We didn't specify which we wanted.  I would definitely come back for more, especially that it's open 24/7. Can't get better than that in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bD_XeNsZlQhn165AmJYpVw.text: Spring Mountain road in Las Vegas has plenty of good places to eat, and this Vietnamese restaurant open 24 hours is a very nice to place to keep in mind for late night eats.   The seafood noodles and spring rolls were delicious, and getting that for under $20 before tip is always nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seafood soup (imitation crab, shrimp, and squid) and spring roll

zWyBQ4FoAp2Y7eJp6KxOMQ.text: It is always popping here! I am from Houston and have been coming here since my cousin introduced me. You know if the Asians are waiting in line for a table it's legit. My parents and I came in late Friday night as we just touched down in Vegas and picked up the rental. We waited about 5 - 10 min to get a table at about 10pm.   The restaurant was full and seemed like everyone was enjoying. We wanted some comfort food prior to checking into the hotel and resting. My parents both ordered the pho dac biet and I got the thit nuong rice plate with egg cake and a fried egg. It took a bit for the food to come out and for some reason I got my rice plate before they got their pho.   All of the waiters seemed to be guys. They were pretty busy so I had to flag some down for things but everyone was really helpful. I tried to come back during lunch on Sunday but the wait was too long. Will come visit again next time I am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #35 + fried egg

_Pfb4QeE-_YOzWFesNUTVg.text: Looking for bad service but good food in Las Vegas ? Come to Pho Kim Long. The service keeps getting worse and worse. The only reason I come back is their pho and food. No smile, no eye contact, absolutely NOTHING! I don't recommend anyone to come here. I will definitely will not be returning.

jcROc9CcpmfJPWKlRcTwYQ.text: This place has amazing service, the food comes out super fast!! The waitresses are super friendly, you like Vietnamese cuisine come here!!!

UbTPBDJ71-LdSMAnPeoFlA.text: Been coming here since they were only half the size of not less .. but the food is going down hill .. ordered the duck and I think it was fried .. then gave another chance and ordered something simple sweet and sour pork and omg all you see was plate and I couldn't tell if it was pork or beef !! On the hunt for a new favorite place

lC7g1xrWNgpuLD2mcThZ1g.text: Very good restaurant, the service was fast and the food was delicious. I love pho and it's hard to find a very good pho place and this place definitely better than any other pho restaurant I've tried in Vegas.

e-My3t-jeWZ-p1LGx0bCsA.text: "You've got to be kidding me...." says my gal pal.  "Nope, that's really the name of this joint,"   says I.  Reluctantly, she took her hungover self there. She's still dreaming about the flavorful pho.

LDDnp2WDDIJIPX8BxK8dtQ.text: Yes, I'd have to concur that a catchy name like Pho Kim Long(say it together) is hard not to remember, but the food isn't so bad either.  Actually after that other place we tried nearby, this place is pretty darn good indeed.  And they open super late so if you're looking for a midnight snack after some major walking or club hopping on the Strip, this is the place to come to.  The place is fairly new and clean, nicely decorated, fish tank with variety of saltwater fish, has plenty of large tables for bigger groups and the food is served fast.  Dishes are nicely presented and are good size portions.  We tried the pho, rice plates like grilled pork chop, and some other chinese dishes (tofu, vege., fish).  Located in the plaza by the Ranch 99.  I'd definitely come back when staying in LV.

fWs2FmuHVwRY4-EBnw2PYg.text: Note to self... don't order hu tieu at a pho restaruant. It was so nasty :(   Service here is hit or miss. I like how when you come in they bring you water really fast. But then after they hand you the menu they come back half a second later and ask what you want to order. Damnit wtf is with Vietnamese places that do that? It's seriously my pet peeve. Can I have a few minutes does not translate into "come back in a nano second".   Com tam and pho here is pretty decent, as well as their chicken wings. Every time I'm in Vegas SOMEBODY (not I) makes me eat here. oh well...  On a side note... my navigator in my car can't pronounce the name of this place. instead it says "arrive left on F!@king Long" lol

VV7EwTQTXoKALJOlG2nd4A.text: Despite having such a hilarious and fun name, I did not really enjoy the Pho here...even if I was pretty trashed and needed some Pho for hydration. The springrolls were pretty delish and piping hot like others have said... BUT THE PHO was too HERBY for me! I like my greens (including mint), but I felt like the pho broth was infused w/ tea or something! I don't like tea flavored soup because I sip/drink tea, not eat/slurp it! Sorry! But my boyfriend and his friends thought the spot was decent!

23GySfyOTTMeoMnvKPtadw.text: The Husband & I randomly chose this place to eat brunch for our first morning in Vegas.  I was really amazed at how spacey the place is, very clean & sophisticated!  All of their employees were very nice & quick to anything you asked for.  I loved Pho', so this place didn't disappoint me one bit since mine was delicious.  This place is open 24 hours, and accepts credit cards.  We ended up eating brunch here again right before heading back to the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wnYi2gBwVlg4HSnpC4vToA.text: Needed a pho fix at 2am in Vegas. And got it.   The food was decent. I kinda wished the bowls were bigger, but they satisfied my craving after hours of gambling.  The service was nice. It was funny because my girlfriend wanted meatballs and asked the waiter how many balls are in the bowl. The waiter replied, "yeah you get about two balls," and chuckled. Our table chuckled as well. The service was good and gave up water when needed. But pretty much like any ordinary pho place.. nothing too special except the being open 24 hours.

jemlbnXwaZMeKWeFRLpoHw.text: A great go to if you're looking for Pho. Their spring rolls and egg rolls are really good too.

khqwYJ0o4vV897MbSHM4Zw.text: One of the best Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas, that also why the place is always really crowded. Expect long waiting time, but with awesome service. They always have many servers no matter how late, and very attentive.  Pho & family-style dishes are very good, and have authentic taste. I love their deep fried tofu and fish in claypot.

7zLS6jK1_MEbgdCvtL0SnQ.text: I have to agree they got good Pho and love that they are open late.  Price kinna high for Pho.  Good service and fast too.

8AIlE0gZuYnQf0NPj1yF7w.text: Food: I was honestly, pleasantly surprised. I didn't think I'd find good pho out in the desert, but this place wasn't bad at all! It was not greasy, good broth, and had good portions. It was a little pricier than average, but what isn't more expensive in Vegas? Good cure for partying too hard the night before for sure!   Venue: CLEAN! I really care about cleanliness especially of restaurants that are usually pretty dirty. It was pretty decorated for a pho restaurant haha.

IwooReFdpmHWjBKnSacYaA.text: Was visiting LV August 2008, now found out I'll be moving there permanently soon.  Went here for lunch one day, and the meal (pho) itself wasn't bad.  The broth was tasty, the proteins were good (I forgot what I ordered) and the serving size was also good.  I guess my issue when I went there was that whenever the wait staff would give me my beverage or check, it was placed at the end of the table away from me, which I found to be unusual.  For example, since I ate lunch by myself, I had a single table that seats only two people.  The bev/check was actually placed at arm's length.  Is that a Viet thing?  I'm pretty sure it was the wait staff's perceived issue with me.  But, as I mentioned before, I'm moving to LV soon and willing to give these folks another go.  Love Asian food, being Asian myself, and would really hate to not come here because I perceive some kind of issue or displeasure with me.

VLfRq16a25y33KNVPFW9Dg.text: Love this place, this was the first pho place I went to when I moved back to Vegas. The service is always good even on busy days. Food is fresh and gets out quick. My girlfriend and I go here every time I'm in town.

8F2OR_HwJbEcKTj9sYqD8g.text: Went here for the first time food was not bad, a bit salty. Was depressing to know they didn't have any desserts available.

HFqw3N2hzqfsbdwvcRZFbA.text: This place is a godsend to people who just say PHO it after a night at marquee or xs. Its essentially open around the clock, the pho is pretty tasty, and the prices are very reasonable. I'm not usually in Vegas to have Vietnamese cuisine, but when I do, this place is it. I'm only giving it 3 stars because Cali spoils people on Viet cuisine  and this place isn't quite there yet in terms of taste. I'd give a 3.5 stars if I could though.

goiXgbAtf-_92r2RBE760Q.text: This place was not as great as everyone said. The pho broth had no flavor at all! It was less greasy than Pho So 1's,  but when it comes down to taste...there was none! Also, the service could use more work...  (Maybe I'm just spoiled by good 'ol California Vietnamese food...)

jRTnIQ7PT-Ofe1NNHBYutw.text: Food is OK and waiting too long.  We order sweet-sour soup with flounder and the soup has little vegetable and a lot of water.  It costs us $35 to ride the taxi from the casino and the food is not worth it, especially white rice is not coming with the food, we paid $3.00 extra.

txzkyFUrmaVE4nO0FVRKwg.text: OK, OK...yes, it's True, we've been driving past this place for years on our way to dim sum. Yeah, it's also True there is no shortage of giggles and laughs every time we pass this place (think Beavis and Butthead..."HEH HEH HEH...you said "PHO"). But hot damn, I am through making fun of the name, this place is damn good! (okay, maybe I'm really _NOT_ finished making fun of the name)  #10 rocks, so do the egg rolls. Try it. You can thank me later.

84Mxb4yptkHW2W8YVqphVw.text: They have the best PHO in Vegas!!!! I always get extra noodles and meatballs.

CJu3UBh0sm-tlTotQEGFrg.text: It used to be a hole in the wall, but they expanded and redid the inside, it looks very nice now.  It was pack for post new years lunch time.  They messed up on multiple items (the order was given in Vietnamese so there was no language barrier problem), usually missing meatballs when we wanted them, and including stuff we didn't want but got anyway.    I got the shaken beef with white rice for $10.  Pretty good.  I do not reccomend their bun bo hue: the meat had no flavor, it's kinda grey, as if it was merely boiled in water.  The chili does come separate though if you can't handle spiciness.  The pho was decent, it has the strong anise star aroma.  An order of eggrolls included 4 of them with veggies.  I'm not sure what the price was but they were small fast food type eggrolls.  If you eat here i recommend trying to be seated in the separate bar/lounge room.  It's less noisy and secluded from the hussle and bussle of the main room.  However service is kinda lacking in this room as well.

PFnfi65pmOcjZ0hE_hqVtg.text: PHOKINGAWESOME.  I like to believe I am Pho's #1 fan! If I had to choose one meal I had to eat everyday for the rest of my life it would 100% be pho.   This place!!! you guys this place is literally the best kept secret! I only found out about this gem because of a local black jack dealer at the cromwell recommended this place to me!  The service is so quick and on point, they really know what their doing! They are prepped to handle any rush of customers being that they are open 24/7!   Okay now I shall rave about the quality of the food! the spring rolls are to die for!! The consistency, the flavor, the texture, the sauce everything so fricken good! The pho broth was the best ive ever had! it was clean, not to oily, not too clear but legit just right. I always order my pho with steak & brisket inside and this only enhanced the broth!   JUST TAKE MY WORD ON THIS- look no further, this is the spot you're looking for! thank me later :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Spring Rolls
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of the Rare Steak &amp; Brisket Noodle Soup
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

881LYXZAe-WmzrZ-goI3hQ.text: Aside from the front parking space being empty... When we got there...my friend and I noticed how quite & empty the restaurant was for a Friday afternoon compared to a long waiting list.  We have also noticed that their Pho quality has gone bad. Their broth was warm and not hot as it should be; the soup was not authentic as it used to be either.   Last of all, the brown rice was served spoiled and sprinkled with little black insects which my friend thought it was just part of the rice but it had its wings & little legs that was too consistent for it to be a seed of the rice.    There was no apology from the management. We payed for our meals and won't be coming back since the quality of the food has gone down tremendously.

FNj_kQ6kT8ueELQQ4BfTvg.text: Warning: Their pho quality has declined. I suggest finding a different spot.   We used to come here each time we visited Las Vegas, but stopped coming to this place a few years ago. Now we know why. Ordered their large combo pho, since it only comes in large and their chicken pho. Both with rice noodles.   The bowls of pho came out quite fast, like within 5-7 minutes of ordering. The broth is warm but it's not hot where usually a lot of pho restaurants serve it as, so then the broth will stay warm throughout the time your eating. A few bites in we realized the broth was just off. The beef broth was okay, but it was lacking the homemade beef broth. The chicken broth was a mild saltiness to it but didn't taste like chicken to me. The rice noodles tasted a little odd to me like a dry taste.   We asked for steamed bean sprouts and those cake out quite fast. The bean sprouts were warm but we could tell it was not steamed for long, maybe ran through hot warm for a moment only.   They only had four other tables to serve at 9 am when we got there. I honestly will not return and suggest you don't either.

CDsSoEYaRYBKZ_509Z0B7w.text: Always up to explore new restaurants over in Chinatown here in Las Vegas, I was told about this restaurant by my Lyft driver. He couldn't say enough nice things about the restaurant, the employees there in, and especially the food!  So I found myself looking for something great to eat and recall the conversation I had with the driver, so this is the place for me! I flipped through the Yelp app and found two of my favorite things; chicken spring rolls and hot and sour soup. So of course I had to order both!  The spring rolls come out and they are like heaven! Perfectly crispy on the outside, and the insides are packed with flavor. The hot and sour soup arrive shortly there after, and it is on the money!  So here's the rundown:  Satisfied? Yes  Return? Yes  Advocate? Yes

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Kim Long Fried Egg Rolls

Ysx_3gQCL609Um7HXcTIng.text: Today after work my co workers and I decided to come to pho Kim long for a late night bite. This is a wonderful spot just off the strip to get some food late night. Great pho (broth soup, with veggie; some have meat); spring rolls, pot stickers and . They have the boba of your choice either in tia tea or in a smoothie. The service was quick and friendly. The table was kept clean and we were frequently checked on. Most of us had a lot of left overs to take home. Portions are pretty big just a FYI. Overall, wonderful experience of enjoying pho soup and a co worker bonding.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Vegan
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charbroiled Pork &amp; Egg Roll
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare Steak &amp; Brisket Noodle Soup

bUfbT0BFte550-j2Af6IUg.text: I'd stick with the namesake for this place wouldn't venture outside of what they are known for--pho.  We ordered something as a group to share family style and were disappointed in the price compared to the quality and amount. It just leaves you wanting more and did not stand out from going to your local Chinese takeout location instead.  The orange chicken had a bit too much breading on it and the fried rice and chow mein were subpar.  Again, just go for the pho! It's what they do best!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u4JvSsVj1Kt2rOCgtKLezA.text: Service counts for a lot and here the service is just very poor.    I have been here before and it was much better previously.   First of all, as we waited for our table, the host/waiter was not very friendly, no smile, no greeting.   After we were seated, asked for a high chair and received no acknowledgement of the request and then ended up locating one ourselves.     After waiting about 10 minutes, the waiter brought our glasses of water then we waited about another 10 minutes to flag a waiter to place our order.    When the food finally arrived at the table one of the dishes was incorrect.  Despite the poor service the food is still good.   They have a very extensive menu with Vietnamese and Chinese dishes.     The restaurant is located in a very busy strip mall so parking is hard to find and may take a couple trips around.

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauteed Oysters with Black Bean Sauce
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stir - fried Cube Cut Steak

jwFj57WFdWLmhTyqKwDeKA.text: My family and I are in Vegas for the MVA finale (dance competition) to support my niece when we decide one day to have Vietnamese food. This restaurant showed up on my search and it had ok reviews so we decided to give it a try. The first thing I noticed is the chaos and the rudeness of the employees that should've been a queue to leave.   As we were waiting for them to get our orders, I went ahead to use their restroom. It was so filthy. There were feces on the both of the toilet and papers were on the floor as well as diapers. I've always had this rule that if the restroom of a restaurant  (room seen in public eyes) are dirty, what do you think the kitchen looks (not seen by customers) like? Is it hard to designate someone to check on the restrooms every so often making sure it's still up to the standards? Wow is all I can say.   Took them 15-20 minutes to take our orders and when it finally came it was a disappointment. The kids ordered the wonton noodle soup. According to them the wonton tasted so bad especially the after taste so they only ate the noodles. It had this awful taste that can't explain (not real meat for sure). I ordered the grilled chicken plate combo, but when it came to my table it looked like a roasted quail. It was just ok. I was more grossed out. There's this very odd smell to their food. Needless to say that was a waste of $138 of food because none of us really ate. We had 3 adults, 3 kids.   This place is in China town. There's plenty of place to eat around here please try to find another restaurant before coming here. I'm not sure why they have so many customers for a place that's so filthy (beyond filthy), over priced, and rude. I will never come back to this place again and will NOT recommend it to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton Egg Noodle soup
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken (supposedly) meal
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The restaurant

qv9MMw5lqTI1U3heYEiNPQ.text: If I can be completely honest, this place is not as amazing as everyone has built it up to be - I don't understand what the hype is. I can understand that this is the best thing after a night of drinking cuz one would be sooooooo hungover &once that broth hits the tip of the tongue of someone who's super dehydrated - then yeahhhhh this would be 5 stars to someone in that situation. Lol. But the broth is not that great.   These are my top favorite pho places that I would recommend to someone who is on the hunt for some good 4-5 stars worthy Pho:   Pho King Vietnamese (on Eastern Ave in Henderson) Pho Saigon 8 (on Eastern Ave in Henderson)    Pho Kim long has a ridiculously long wait line for no reason. Again, I don't understand why this place would have such a long wait line: pho is usually serviced out super fast and again, the food is not that great. The broth didn't have the oomph for me and it lacked a lot of beef flavor. Even after adding lime, jalapeno, and chili paste - it's not that good. The rare steak and brisket was dry and lacked flavor. Not my favorite at all.  This is just my opinion. *wink.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy AF

KWo2Xc10V4shk-77V6X74w.text: I was looking for good Pho soup and my friend suggested this place. I was not disappointed!  Restaurant is very nice and rustic, with aquariums and Oriental details. Menu was easy to read with a lot of pictures and well sorted out.  I was looking for good soup so I was asking for recommendations from my server and she said Pho mixed meat soup is great. I also saw spring rolled and they looked awesome, they tasted good too ...  soup was great, very flavorful... I just didn't like mixed meat! It was too much cartilage and maybe that is how it gets great flavor but I didn't like it. Noodles were soft and great too. Next time I wanna try some other stuff coz it looks great.  I recommend this place for all foodies!!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed beef pho soup
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls

rPdSUtYFuMrCDAmY77HD4w.text: I have been here a few times now. If it isn't because this is the closest pho store to the strip, with supposedly decent rating, I probably wouldn't come. Was here earlier this year after going to Lady Gaga's Concert, nothing much were open at 1AM so we went here. We waited quite a long time to be seated and for our food to arrive, not to mention that the restaurant was practically empty at 1AM.   Came here again last week before heading back to Los Angeles, they brought out our Bun Rieu but not the other 3 pho. 10-15 minutes after the bun rieu, lady came to us apologizing and that our pho will arrive shortly. THEY FORGOT OUR PHO.   As a vietnamese and working in an area full of pho stores, the pho here is definitely average. I can't really taste much pho or beef flavor in the broth. Overall, it is ok.

sjHU_CtuWguzpr5F-4GW3w.text: I'm not sure why this place does t have 4 or 5 stars it's amazing I eat here like 2 times a week while I'm in Vegas! I love that they have a True vegan pho it's delicious. And they have vegan fresh spring rolls!! My man gets the orange chicken and he says it's perfectly crispy and sauced up!! I must admit the customer service isn't the feat Abd I think that's why they have only 3 1/2 stars but  the food makes up for everything. But I can say they are fast! Give this place a try!! Oh on a weekend at night around midnight or later it's crazy busy lol

jMdFG64PnAoLBJ-UEmSRZw.text: Went here late on a Saturday night after a long day on the strip. It was pretty packed but we got seated quick. The food came out stagger but quick. I recommend the Pad Thai here it was by far my favorite of all of the dishes we ordered. We got the bill and they already added tip so make sure to check before you pay.  Tip: Make sure to order everything you need when your server first comes to your table. The servers don't stay still very long and its hard to get their attention once their on the go.

KsDsyXczJkbPzgqjUoIYKA.text: Very good! Fast and excellent menu with variety for all  They're busy so service is meh but not bad at all  They are nice and get the job done

MNCuxaKQIRNnW5kmOW95GQ.text: I'm disappointed in the quality this place provided. I came recently with a large group and while majority of our party's meals were decent my dish was very subpar.   In particular, I ordered the Bun Bo Hue. Absolutely love this dish and have ordered it hundreds of times elsewhere so would say I'm pretty familiar with the dish. When my order came around it did not have any spices in it. As a dish that is supposed to be spicy, it was not only a let down but confusing.   After asking the staff if the correct dish was served they took it back and added chili oil to it. After that I gave up because we already waited about 20 minutes for our food to be served. I didn't think the dish could fail any more past not being a True Bun Bo Hue dish with pork broth vs beef broth. It already lacked any sense of the spicy and balanced flavors I've come to love to Bun Bo Hue. Even so, I managed to find some faults with the dish.  After going through most of the toppings, I made my way to the pig's feet. I'm usually not disgusted but this was the first time I've experienced the hairs not properly cleaned off the foot. Suffice to say after that I cannot recommend this place to anybody. The quality of the food was subpar and the dish itself was not Bun Bo Hue.   The only saving grace would be their chicken wings which isn't really enough for me to justify coming back. The wings were about the width of a quarter with very little meat on them.   TL;DR Bun Bo Hue wasn't made correctly and the pig's foot had hair but their chicken wings were decent

Jb1ZB7IId3bR-RfsjJQW9w.text: Best PHO in Las Vegas. We always take our friends here. Ya its not on the strip but it is in our China town. Service is always prompt. Food is always perfect. Serving size is enough for multiple people but I always refuse to share mine! The meats are amazing. Best broth by far I have found in a long time. Spring rolls and many other items are always great too. Lets be real we go for  the PHO. Staff is fast. Don't expect to chit chat but they will answer questions if you cant pick out food. Come when its busy? They have a fast turn around! Dont be surprised by lines waiting out the door... trust me worth the wait!!

3-46U6sYdGqmrJzVn4YDXw.text: We've been coming here for like 5+ years and the pho is good. It would be 4 stars but the cashier I ran into today was a complete jerk!!! Everyone one else was koo. We usually get the brisket pho with a side of tendons, super good! They have a nice fish tank there, that table in front of it is money and we always try to get it.

uhpVBVDGBdJNA_66Nn3wbA.text: Really Good Pho, Good Servings, Good Service!   Some some reason this seems to be the go to spot for people preparing for the arduous journey out of Las Vegas to where ever they may be heading next.   We were hungry and needing a belly full before journeying back to Arizona after a crazy roadtrip that found us unexpectedly in Las Vegas! We made some cash on the Roulette wheel and decided to have a little pho on the way out.   The staff was pleasant. The pho was really good!  The Beef Stew Was Tasty!   All in all a great spot to make your belly feel good!

bRv8NLyL1KGGfhpjs-OScw.text: The price is good compared to the $20 pho bowl on the strip. The pho is pretty good here very authentic. I got the pho tai chin. The raw meat was okay a little thick for my liking but the brisket was very good. The portions were a good size for the price. I also order a coconut juice very sweet and good. Not much authentic drinks to pick from just soda lemon but no sugar cane or penny worth. Very fast service and very popping. Highly recommend

9SSd8-UHQURts0lzL2OtnA.text: Highlight about this place OPEN 24 HOURS. So you can come to get your late night fix or early morning if you prefer, any time, any hour.   I came here unsure of what to expect after going to so many other pho restaurants (I'm still trying to find a favorite location). When they first brought out the plate with the sprouts and other additions to the pho as you can see from the pics the sprouts didn't look very fresh, and the spring rolls were alright. There was one tiny piece of lime and barely any basil on the plate with the sprouts as well. I didn't let this discourage me, maybe just off to a bad start.   Then the pho came out. I don't really like onions but I don't mind the yellow onions that normally come In pho because they are cooked and the flavor isn't overpowering. However, here they use red onions and they use A LOT of them. I wish I would've know prior to ordering. I removed all the onions (which was a process) and then was able to fix it up a bit and eat. The pho was decent, more onion flavored than I like but not intolerable. I probably wouldn't go there again personally but it wasn't a completely horrible experience.

x5y7zCA5j9vTLAdQCjTdig.text: My boyfriend and I come here at least once a week. We love the Pho here especially the chicken one. We'll usually get one pho plate and and extra bowl and be full with only $12 (tip included) so we love to come here for a delicious and affordable meal. However the service here can be bad. They have a few waiters who are very rude but if Jonathan is your waiter you'll have great service.

kDoSJDs9Pf4ZacP6nszcfA.text: Excellent pho, one of the best places to go in Vegas.  Noodles, broth and meat are fantastic!  Try it out, no regrets!

9ugkBpe8T8G5GisioERpOw.text: Ugh!!! I used to come here every Saturday after Japanese school with my mom.  I have FOND memories here, but something has happened. Something terrible......    - The servers don't speak English nor do they speak any other Asian language.   - I ordered tea and got a green tea bag in my mug... A MUG!! ... GREEN TEA!!   - The small dish for dipping is a deep black little cup (customary for ketchup or ranch)   If you know Pho.. AUTHENTIC PHO you know those three points are enough for a strike.   The taste has declined and I was SO incredibly disappointed.   Highly Americanized and the awful parking lot really doesn't make this place worth your time or calories.

AV5Q2tCYlq9hEdNpfaQHvw.text: yo this joint sucks! they dont give us water or napkins like tha fuck kinda restaurant is this shit?!?! i try to get their attention and they ignorin my ass!!!! wheres the hospitality in dis shit???????  the food was bomb doe

J4We63UPeDfZ6qmVBsJwaQ.text: Food is great, fast service, but be aware, they charge for side of rice.

QnWc5rhO9iTewQwvyIpbhQ.text: Love this place. Best Pho, fast service. So goo. I've gone here multiple times and I've never had a bad experience

ef5A1K0oBFaJ-BtrYkda2g.text: Yes I'm a white boy from SoCal but I used to live on bolsa in Little Saighon  so i know Pho! This place is straight up awesome in comparison to Little Big Saighon Pho'.  I love the Pho' Tai so much here because the soup is flavorful and the portions are perfect at a affordable price.   Great service and awesome Pho'.   When I'm back in LV I will make my way back to Pho' Kim Long for sure!
