At first, I was kind of miffed by that, as many place don't, but I realized that this is very reasonable, considering that many people don't finish the whole thing and waste a ton of it.   Wait out the line and try it! It's such a great representation of Asian food (: You must be tempted now... Go! it's now 24 hours for all you night people ;P

Fo-IjxIcvLSxR9z8CpKpTA.text: I came in for a to go order and I love their food and I had asked for one of the blended drinks he said they did not have any for the kind I wanted he had an attitude the whole time he handed my food no thank you!!  just seemed mad the whole time !!!! Seconds pass and I see a waiter coming in with blended drinks I wanted so Iike I said I love their food but service not liked!! it's funny to find out it was even a part owner to the store!!!! Mike who works in the front host position helped me out lots better tho!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy shrimp!!! Fried rice

r1TZyC-WBpvRZm_qCP_ufw.text: Poor service, no communication she must of had the whole left wing of the building. I ordered salt and pepper calamari they didn't put red pepper which the picture clearly shows over battered the calamari to top it off no flavor at all, I tried calling the server but just didn't hear me I guess. Tried calling her again to see if they had garlic chili sauce but it was impossible to get her to the table. I can't complain about the pho it was just like any other place "Saigon" but evidently the don't measure the noodles I ordered regular noodles but didn't have much in the bowl and my date ordered flat noodles and had a pool of noodles. They need some work.

hzrUu-PMWM-RPrhdt_gfzA.text: I try eating in other Vietnamese restaurant but there's no match, pho Kim long looks like a rundown restaurant compare to others, but the food damn.. Probably one of the best Vietnamese/asian restaurants in the West. Yes is that good

LDlbylurfprTmQ1Jcfq5zw.text: They have bad customer service. Throws the food on the table. At the register the manager only rounds off how much your food is. My pad Thai was $12.50, and he said it was $15. He tipped himself, cheating everyone! Please, do not go and eat here! BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE! Shitty place.

22UwUdmq3dQLVrZ0yJt3Qw.text: I've eaten pho all over the country, and I have to say this is my top spot!! I have never had service so amazing, with a super sexy vibe. Everything we had was fantastic...let's not forget to mention its 24/7!!! If you need a cheap late night drunk food spot...I promise this is it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Bo vien

FmTXeMURieME_LnNcC4w5g.text: In our 5 days in Vegas we cabbed out to Chinatown 3 times to eat here....  We are pretty lucky here in Vancouver to have access to an abundance of Vietnamese restaurants but I was excited to find something in Vegas with the same quality and taste as the restaurants back home.  It is open 24 hours so one of my visits was after the club - it was busy but we didn't have to wait. On another night that we went to eat here there was a 20 minute wait but that was around dinner time so that should be expected.  I had the grilled chicken on rice (loved it!) the chicken was tender and moist and it even had the criss-cross grill marks on it. On another night I had the beef pho and it was delicious. As with all food in the US it felt a little heavy on the sodium but it wasn't bad like the places that put tons of MSG in their soups for flavour meanwhile inducing days of thirst after consumption. On the night that we went after the club I had the chicken fried rice and it was really good. Huge portions so we even took the rest to go.  The location is really convenient because it's on the outside of the plaza facing Spring Mountain Road.

GHAZo9Z-mSsjvENBqBFRXg.text: Service here is garbage. And their excuses for not splitting checks is just lazy. They said they'll do it some days but not others. So their customer service quality depends on time?  Food is okay. Better than average. But you can get the same quality at plenty places down the road, not infested with drunk clubbers.

eD3qWVGue09WGmIeI242FQ.text: I am from orange county. Home place of vietnamese food outside of vietnam. I do not see the appeal why this place is so packed.  Most people from Orange County travel to Vegas for the weekend and wants to eat subpar vietnamese food at higher priced than back in Orange County. I DO NOT UNDERSTAND THIS.  People go here for Pho, as lines are long. People actually wait for Pho here.  I guess it is cheap food when compare to Vegas food on the strip.

t3IgtGT8ziuE1ArkjFStNA.text: Dood this place is bomb and I love that it's 24 hour. Good place to eat after a night of drinking

8MJT4oTfDgN8QbBuacPEhA.text: They used to have a great reputation with great food to match. tried it today for the first time in a long time and was very disappointed. The caddy on the table was missing spoons and sauce cups. The server was very loud and Brass when conversing and taking our order. The seafood crispy noodle was Bland and plain the only good part was that the shrimp was very clean I would probably not go back because there are so many other great competitors where I would get my money's worth

_kUpEF_qfBilnoHG3xwjjg.text: Food is ok not the best for the price of the food the portion is small and it's really busy here waited for about and 1hr to b seated

N666zKbh5OX8VTuwT7MFMQ.text: Five stars for service. Sat pretty quickly, we were constantly checked on, waters filled, plates removed, etc etc. Everyone we spoke with was in a good mood and accommodating. Orange chicken was amazing, crispy and hot. Although all the food that was brought to the table was hot, fresh and timely, some of it lacked flavor, such as the chicken lettuce wraps (they tasted sweet) and the chicken egg rolls, were just egg rolls. Lost a star due to the bathrooms. Just gross and unacceptable. I'm sorry, but a place where we (and the other guests around us) are spending upwards of $200 (not including gratuity) I should be able to sit on the toilet. Not cool

DRM5-8_YanqNI7u7ACR-HQ.text: First time having pho... I enjoyed the chicken pho, I added chili, jalepeno to it, it was delicious!! I would go back to have it again. Also had spring rolls-delicious!! Will be coming back on next Vegas trip.

dyN5GnNbJXmDzPAe5jkVUA.text: If you had a long drive into Vegas or arrived through an airport nightmare and need a hot and spicy pho to wash away the headaches, go to Pho Kim Long. It situated 5 min from the strip and it's the volume pho leader in Vegas for a reason. It's 24-7 and they serve up some good pho and they do it fast and furious. Many locals, industry workers and club goers will be there at all hours. Expect a ton of people especially on weekends. The food quality is actually on point after all it has to because it's serving the Asian community in the heart of Vegas China Town! Always casual and just right.

SjZAvxJa15tE3vnIktRfvw.text: This place gets a lot of hype. It's good. But I wasn't overwhelmed.  Pho is solid - can't go wrong with any of the choices. I also tried the clams in black bean sauce (good), fried mussels (ok) and mayonnaise shrimp with walnuts (good).  They asked if we wanted rice, we said yes. Was charged $3. Wish they said something before we saw it on the check. Plus, most places give you white rice for free if you order mains (I can understand if we just ordered pho).  3 mains (in addition to a pho per person) and I'm charged for rice? I'm big on principle.  It's a good deal compared to 99% of restaurants on the strip (for those visiting) but by the time you add in cab fare round trip, it loses some of its value.  But if you're craving pho after a long night of partying - can't go wrong. (though I would also suggest the noodle restaurant at Venetian - its closer, soupy and relatively not pricey)

5Z2h_RMukmChpLApWOhT5Q.text: Excellent pho! Got the dac Viet pho and tasted great. I've had my fair share of pho, coming from DC, since there's a large Asian community out there and this broth is great. Friendly service!

KBwY0KU_Q0A1JPxb1jHlXw.text: Really delicious pho, affordable price large portion. The service there can be quick depending the time of day. Customer service is okay.

BHfhxirAZJCF72Jn8Ospow.text: Consistently friendly, fast and delicious - 24 hours a day

93Day30tm3z4yLROiJVZyw.text: The best food I ate in my life. Usually I order the vegan soup, vegan pad thai, vegan rolls. Amazing!!!!! Very good service and fresh food. Thank you  For sure I'll come back again and again.

98WbsoWBlpdZOm-UfPT0RQ.text: The food here is amazing. Best pho in town hands down. But the service is extremely lacking. It makes me dread going there. Eating in isn't as bad as take out, but every time I order take out I say about 3 words to the guy and he never makes eye contact with me. Once I ordered to go, went to get my order and asked for extra sauces (hoisin, soy & siracha) and he looked me in my eyes, laughed then reluctantly threw my sauces in the bag and said "I already put some in there but I put more". I'm sorry it's such a big deal to get extra sauce! Granted, I'm sure the language barrier is a main reason the miscommunication is so bad as well as the service. There's one girl that speaks very good English and she's a sweet heart. Great food, awful service.

NU_kg8LHPiPeZtkGM7fxCw.text: One of the better pho spots in Vegas. Super crowded at all times of the hour though. Line usually doesn't take that long. Even at 2-3am expect a little line as most of the club goers come here after since it's pretty close to the strip.

NOcT_5nVKShfPcxkM3l5iA.text: If you usually like chow mein get number 66 it was sooooooo good one of the best noodles I have tried. Also the Pho was really good, they gave a good portion for under 10$. Also they had a really cute fish at the entrance hope you still get to see it.

5vhEcLTP7jGxRL9YQ7TyuA.text: If I could give zero stars, I absolutely would. The food is all right, the service is terrible. The service was actually some of the rudest I've ever experienced. They took forever to bring us the food when they were really slow on this particular night, they brought out one plate and my friend was sitting there waiting half an hour for hers, which never showed up. So we just asked for the check, waited over 15 minutes for that, so we decided to go to the front and just pay up there. We got to the front and her food was waiting there on the counter getting cold, and even though we didn't want to tip them we left 10% anyway, and then we were asked if we wanted to leave 15% 20% or 25% because what we left apparently wasn't enough. I told him whatever the change is, you can keep. And as we turned around the guy scoffed at us and mumbled under his breath. Never come here if you want to be treated with respect and good service.

zVlyWYh4awB0m8d9hWXXpw.text: Was excited to see that there was a pho kim long here in las vegas. I did question whether it was the same owner as the one in San Jose, Ca. One perk is that this place is open 24 hours. It can cure anyone's hangover from a whirlwind night of drinking and partying hard.   The menu was probably comparable to the expensive las vegas area. The bowls of pho were a little on the pricier end in my opinion.   I thought that since this was supposedly the best rated pho restaurant, I would have very good pho broth. There were limited options for pho since they serve other things on the menu. You only had 5-6 pho combinations to choose from. Although, I did not bother asking whether they would change anything on the menu to your taste.   I was very disappointed that the pho broth was VERY VERY watered down. I felt like I was just drinking a bowl of salted water with MSG in. The broth was pretty much almost clear and without color in the bowl. Must be because they couldn't keep up with the supply and demand of pho and watered it all down or this might just be the quality of the pho broth they had.   I was so disappointed that by the time I got home, I went home to make a gigantic pot of pho broth. I'm Chinese and I feel like my pho broth was even better than theirs. At least it looked like pho broth by appearance. It may make you reconsider going out to eat pho ever again or especially at this place!

sJzBTNIfHfcCy3Mk-yKvEA.text: This review is about pho, service and installation. Pho: broth was way too salty. Basil was not fresh. I won't be back here for pho. Service: servers are attentive but not necessarily friendly. As the restaurant gets busy, their service gets sloppier. Installation: nice, clean restaurant. Very spacious.

9WQrBaciLA1vRR4BiJE3vQ.text: It was good! Not the best, but I liked the price for what I got. Good, solid pho place. I also like how extensive their menu was, ranging from rice plates, to pho, to hot and sour soup, to even fried rice! It's a good place for big parties where not everybody wants pho. Since the place is also really big, the waiting list moved along quicker than expected. Thank goodness!

j4BKWL7WPD-OlScq4chHzg.text: I don't know what all the hype is about, but the foods was average at best. I gave the restaurant 3 stars because the customer service was adequate. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meh

COLR_eHszopNMv6HF-0mQQ.text: This place is always crowded but has such a friendly environment. The staff is always so sweet and the tofu nuggets are simply the best!

-_HWf_b7TTA10tuAr-jRcA.text: One of my favorite pho joints.  Pho: The pho here is definitely on point. The broth comes out steaming hot and the broth is seasoned so well. This is one of the places where the broth is so good you'd clean the entire bowl out. It's addicting how good the pho is here. My equally just as good favorite dish to order here is the calamari. It's literally the best calamari I've ever had. They deep fry in a way that isn't super crispy but also is kind of soft in a way. I don't know how they do it but its the perfect deep fried texture. Also, the portion that they give is enormous! It was just two of us and we couldn't kill the entire plate of calamari.  Service: Service here is okay. They seat you quickly if it's not busy and the food comes out quick. If you get pho, it always comes out before anything else does. The waiters were quick with the refills but if you're there for a while the service get slower and slower. It took us a while for them to realize I was trying to flag them down. Then it took even longer for them to get the check out to us. Service here is my only complaint.  Best part to this restaurant is that it's open 24 hours so you can get your pho craving in anytime.  TLDR; Good Pho and Calamari. Bad service.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho and Calamari

dYeK85vnbad-Eg4oLBZetQ.text: Host skipped us, server took the order of the table that was seated after first. Couldn't get water refills, had to get my own condiments. 3/4 dishes were good, my friend threw up his pad Thai . The server argued with us in the middle of the restaurant about taking the pad Thai off the bill . After a temperamental and mediocre dinner the credit card machine went down . I ll never come back .

bzS5jKzT4fBq6-FtE3l8mw.text: Since we moved from San Francisco Bay Area, we had a hard time finding a good pho restaurant. But finally, Pho Kim Long delivered! While not super fancy, the pho was pretty good. And open 24/7!  We now have peace of mind that when we crave a bowl of pho, Pho Kim Long is there.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 64. Singapore noodles with shrimp and curry spices. Unimpressed.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 23. Charbroiled pork &amp; egg roll with rice vermicelli. Awesome.

72PgffHO9AKW-Ykt1-E4Qw.text: I would of gave this place either 4-5 stars if it wasn't for the mute, slow service. I must admit though, their interior design makes this pho restaurant upscale than others. I've been to a good amount of pho restaurants here in Las Vegas and if you have too then you know that pho & drinks are served to you pretty fast.  Now before I go on to my little rant, I must add that their pho is never a disappointment. What I always get is number 13 which is the combination pho which has a little bit of most things & the steak is flavorful. So good job Pho Kim Long for yummy pho ! But BOO for the lack of service you offer !   My boyfriend and I went and we ordered two #13 combination phos and I also ordered a tai tea boba. About 3 minutes later our pho is served to us but not my drink. You would of thought my drink came first, right? Well, I thought, "Oh, maybe they're still making it" so about another good 5 minutes passes by & my boba is still not served to me & I started to question my thoughts about this place. So we asked one of the waiters where my boba was and he just walked off without any acknowledgement or reassurance that it was coming. So we waited another 10 minutes and my boyfriend and I are just about done with our pho and still....no....tai tea boba. I asked another waiter, "Hi excuse me, I've been waiting for about 10 minutes for my tai tea boba now and I still haven't gotten it." & he got the job done but he didn't even apologize for the long wait.   I got my boba just in time we paid for the check and the boba was great but ugh the service is whack. I need I add that we did go there during graveyard hours but still, you can't lack on a job especially if it runs 24/7 and stays busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #13 Combination Pho

uLhRNs5jWeWufSNxdqxoDw.text: Bad service!  Short stocky Asian waitress gave my wife a death glare. My whole table was shocked by the bad service. Pho was also just as cold as the service.

4p_YMDJb2CCTT8p5UZaGLg.text: Food wasn't overpriced, but took a while to get them out. Ordered pho and teriyaki chicken. Pho was ok, but could use more spices. Had thought they would use dark meat for the teriyakichicken but they used white and I did not come out looking like the photo. Waitress was great though!

OWviAIILQSjaAvD8Jnh4Gg.text: Great Pho place. And other chinese foods are pretty good too. And 24/7. Even service is not that goood, still my favorite pho place.

jsTAr6lbQtUwTm5ckfkLhg.text: You really can't expect much, 24 hour pho place in Vegas..  There's always a line and when they tell you 10 minutes, they really mean 20. I guess you really can't complain about Asian places...

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 25/8

57ZB2Hkj8sq7Ykav8TM3YQ.text: This was my first pho spot many years ago and like an avid foodie/loyalist, I come back. As a server, I understand how hectic it can be during rushes and times of day so I do my best to be patient as possible. I get it you're busy but early this morning was the last time they'll ever get my business. Now, my friends and I have been coming here for years and just a few years ago it became the biggest pho spot so as loyal customers we still come back. Management and service changed big time. (This mornings incident/latest experience)We got sat first before these three other tables and we were not acknowledged (they're busy they'll notice soon enough, not an issue). But then one server went to the table that sat after us and took their order. Then another server went to the table that sat after them and then another server went to the next table after that table. We're all neighboring tables. Servers looked at our table and seen we still have our menus (that means our orders have yet to be taken, service tip 101) but still walked by. I think waiting 25 mins was long enough. So we signaled the waiter and he gave the excuse that he had to take that tables order first because they were first. I let him finish his story and then explained to him that we were first out of the four tables that were sat back to back (he could check the wait list). Longer story short, they forgot my girlfriends calamari (that's fine. Just please put a rush on it. It happens. I get it. Seriously I do) but I would never treat my customers as if they owed me anything! I would never demand a damn tip. Especially when living in a service city at a restaurant where the service was horrendously below par (not the first, second, or fifth time) and I made so many excuses for the service as it is. I apologize for the long review but my once favorite pho place has changed in many great ways and although my business may not affect their business now but know that you should not feel rushed, Unwelcome, forced to tip in a city that survives on its consumers. I do not recommend this establishment.

TgJgvnmn-_BddIsCLbz7WA.text: Always a stop worth. The Pho here is really good. I like the taste of the broth and it is refreshing, always a good choice. Had the calamari as appetizer, crisp outside and fresh inside. Recommend it.  Only 4 stars cause I ordered onions and didn't get them.

eoMAD41xCV89Gv4FBz2M9g.text: Great food! Lots of choices. The sweet sour spare ribs were really good. Haven't tried the Pho yet but will do when we come again. The service was a bit slow in the beginning when we arrived but the awesome food made up for it.

Qom8lbqmCrH8_Csvzw_CKA.text: If I could give this place no stars I would. I use to love this place. But I noticed that lately they have been inconsistent. One day the portions are generous than the next day they give you half the size.   Most recent experience: When I asked our waiter why is the portion so small he responded, "that's how we make it now." and he grabbed our food before asking if we wanted something different. I accepted it and continued eating. As I walked out of the restaurant I noticed a family that had ordered the same thing as I did and their food looked way different and the portion was very generous. So I brought it up to our waiter. I asked him how can he tell me that what he served was how they make it now, but I see a whole table with the same exact food i ordered and our meal looked nothing like it. So the waiter brought it up to the manager (Jonathan) in front of me. Before he even asked me what the problem was he charged my card and took a phone call while I was waiting to talk to him. He gave me the receipt to sign and then he tried to just brush me off like nothing was wrong. I explained the situation and he didn't care at all. He said, "I should've grabbed him when I thought something was wrong. I said, "I brought it up to your waiter and how am I suppose to know you're the manager?" So he said he didn't know that something was wrong. But I mentioned that I heard the waiter tell him right in front of me that I was upset and he got caught in a lie. After I explained to him that the customer service was bad and obviously the food was bad he asked me if I could move over because the line to pay was getting long. I asked him for a refund and his response was, "no I'll remember you and the next time you come in I will make sure your food is good." I thought to myself...I know this restaurant is busy. How are you suppose to remember me out of all the customers?   I knew he was full of it. So I just left. It's sad how this place has gone down hill. Even the staff is different not as good as the old staff.

DIieXR7h70ftqa59cxREPA.text: By far the worst service pho place in town. They are so many other 24/7 pho places that I'm not sure why anyone would bother to eat here. Every food order, no matter how big or small, takes 30 minutes plus. The nighttime manager is a young Asian fool who is rude to customers and employees alike.

IpBpucuJfxxTekc44ScqDg.text: Food was delicious! We had a small group of three and decided to go family-style with main dishes plus rice to share. Had the honey walnut shrimp, garlic veggies (too oily for my liking but the garlic flavor was perfect and the veggies weren't overcooked), and braised fish. The first server we had was attentive and refilled our water glasses frequently even when the whole restaurant was so busy.   The deduction in my rating, and the only negative thing I do have to mention, is because the 2nd server who took over attending to us, while friendly, was too pushy in trying to get us out of the restaurant asap. My friend was sitting at the table by herself for maybe 10-15 min tops (I stepped outside to take an emergency phone call while my other friend went to the restroom and then stepped outside for a smoke afterwards), and she said the server asked her twice during this time if we were all done. Even when we both came back, he came around two more times asking if we were finished. For crying out loud, there was still food on the table and we were clearly still eating! Yes, the restaurant is busy and there's a line to enter (we also had to wait 30 minutes to be seated), but please remember that we're still paying customers who hadn't finished their dinner yet and that insistent pestering made us uncomfortable.

8xrxAV3t1N9YErCA7SFVzg.text: I order this place via Postmates, it's just that dang good. Their pho is great! Their spring rolls are even better. I literally can't order from here without getting Spring rolls. I find myself comparing other places to this one.   Pho is something I always eat when I'm feeling under the weather and this does the trick every time!

R47FlL_Lg12hHIrYw6hoyw.text: Food is fantastic. People are so nice and quick. Love this place :) they got us in right away. Super clean and peacefull.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love their pork grill

90cX-uyswfgCuPMGNuoomw.text: THANK YOU, VEGAS, FOR HAVING A 24/7 PHO RESTAURANT. My miserable, hungover soul is so grateful.  I rode the struggle bus (Lyft) here on a Saturday night around 10pm after suffering from a dreadful day club hangover. I found my cure in the wonton egg noodle soup and the fresh young coconut. (I know, I know. Who orders wonton soup at a pho restaurant?) But the egg noodle soup was surprisingly pretty good! Coming from San Francisco and one of the largest Chinatowns in the country, I can definitely say that I've had better, but for what it was, it hit the spot. I was craving a lighter soup than beef-based pho broth anyway.   But the light at the end of the hangover tunnel was the fresh young coconut. SOO GOOD AND SO REFRESHING. Comes served in a coconut, and they give you a spoon so you can scrape off the pulp inside to eat. I felt like a brand new woman afterwards! Okay, not really, my head still hurt, but the coconut/soup really did help.  Service was friendly and made sure our water cups were filled. I look forward to curing future hangovers here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton egg noodle soup and fresh young coconut

DDmyjDQMRXXYXUHNqGud-A.text: This place doesn't even deserve 1 star.   When you try to get a waiters attention, they legit look at you and walk away.   In my opinion, even if you're not the server, waiter or whatever, the least you can do is say, "I will get your waiter". Something at least!!   Instead of make eye contact and walk away.   They barley acknowledge you or ask If you're doing ok or need anything else.   I'm not even from here and I was recommend to go here and I am extremely disappointed.   There is an African American worker that may be the manager or supervisor or may just the host, and when you address him, he automatically says "I just work here, not my problem.   It would be more expectable if the food was really good but it taste old.   The African American host or whatever he is pot used water cups and re filled them with water to serve again without washing it.   I thought it was a mistake but I witnessed it twice during my dinner.   This is just disgusting and gross  Who cares about it being open 24 hours long. The food isn't even good.   It's just a hype.   Customer service is beyond trash and I know this review won't change anything.

XF53AnFNgiWx-0aaVQrxKw.text: Don't know what happen to this place but the food was disgusting lack of customer service and worse of all bill came out high due to the lack of updating there menu price also they try to force me in to pay gratitude which is bullshit. Even tho I left a tip but seem like they wanted more but in my opinion gratitude is usually for mig party and if the food was great n service was on point then maybe I wouldn't mind but it wasn't

kLAo4MRwQJN0-hGPpe2AXA.text: Stopped in for lunch. Salt & pepper eggplant for a shared app. The fried garlic on it and scallions were fabulous. Perfectly seasoned. Ordered the #14, rare steak pho. Really enjoyed it! The broth was delicate and flavorful. My sweetie ordered the ginger clams. The slices of ginger in the dish were a little over over powering and the clams had a little grit... only downside.   Service was fun and friendly. Very accommodating..I asked about the fish sauce at the table and she brought me a 'diluted' version... Tasted like it was mixed with rice wine vinegar. Delicious with the eggplant.    The bill was a little high for lunch... Compared to surrounding pho joints, but overall a good choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger clams... Little disappointing.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt and pepper eggplant. So good!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak pho....mmmmm!

5Re0jyLclyutpjIt4B-qaw.text: Disappointed!!! I've been coming here for years and this past experience was pretty bad. They gave my pho order to the table next to me, and after they realized they gave them the wrong order, and knowing that they had stated eating and dipping into the bowl, they took back the order and acted like the mistake didn't happen. They brought me the bowl and pretended like they didn't bring me food that someone else had started eating. This is really messed up... imagine what's going in their kitchen. Will not be going back to this place, as they really don't treat their customers or food with respect.

ns1SqbCFY48VHUlM9aK78A.text: This is not the best place to go to after the bar. Service was horrible. You have to ask for a refill on drinks and their employees are not customer service friendly. I didn't think they deserve a tip. They guy at the counter asked if I was going to tip and I said I wasn't because of the service. Then he tosses my change at me. Wow, I told myself I wasn't going to come back again. Second time I came it was for a friend's birthday. As we were eating we were excited that it was our friend's birthday so we yelled happy birthday. Then as a response the whole restaurant yells happy birthday as well. That was extremely heartwarming. Then an employee comes over and asks us to quiet down as if birthdays weren't tolerated at this restaurant. My bill at the end of the night was $22. I gave them $25 and told them to keep the change. Then the guy goes, what tip? So I responded excuse me? Then he ignored me while counting my change. The customer service here is not the business.

ZFMKdUh3Pyj0fRGYoWCDWw.text: ***Busy, Quick service***  I've been to a lot of pho restaurants and although this place is busy, I don't think it's the best pho I've had. The service is quick like most pho restaurants, but the quality of food is below my kind of standard. Parking is also very inconvenient.

GiYyaOeqnkJ2Tx51uqPw9w.text: Pho Kim Long is another one of my Las Vegas favorites. I try to go at least once during a trip usually late at night or the wee hours of the morning.   This place is just great. Open 24/7! It's always packed no matter what time of day or night and it's not just the clever name that draws the crowds. The food is excellent.   We started out with the fresh spring rolls, fried egg rolls and the crab puffs. All were excellent, but the fresh spring rolls were the favorite.   For the main event we all had the small beef pho. Absolutely fantastic, great flavor and full of meat and noodles. I regretted not ordering the large bowl once I started eating it.   To drink I had a Thai iced tea. Delicious!   Service is excellent even when it's packed!  In Las Vegas and need a Vietnamese fix? Be sure to Pho Kim Long!  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pho (small size)!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh spring rolls, crab puffs and fried egg rolls!

oGfo8IcLDGtRbAM0tum-Fw.text: Amazing!!! The Pho was delicious, service was fast, appetizers were great! Perfect Vegas Pho spot!

Pp_pQcPwnRhyoFaskIy-bg.text: The food itself here was not bad -- I may be biased because I come from Orange County where Vietnamese restaurants are authentic and plentiful, but the food was pretty good. My boyfriend and I ordered the Hu Tieu Rice Noodle Soup and the Vermicelli Noodles with BBQ Pork and Eggrolls (Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio).  Hu Tieu Rice Noodle Soup We have definitely had better but the noodles were cooked very well - chewy but not underdone. The noodle to soup ratio was perfect but they could have used a little more vegetables in it. Most Hu Tieu Noodle Soups have quail eggs in them and this one didn't but that might just be something my boyfriend and I look for.   Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio Really great presentation! And the food came out very quickly -- but with that said, the egg rolls weren't fresh so they were slightly soggy and warm. The dish was served in a really small bowl and anyone who's eaten this before knows there's a lot of mixing to be done so not having a bigger bowl made it difficult. Last thing about this was that there weren't mint leaves in it! Traditionally this dish always has stronger herbs to mix in, but still it didn't make or break the meal! I'd still recommend you try it if you haven't had it before.  3 stars but an extra star for how quick their service is.

B_xYX_c72g3Q-dQbTIj7Mw.text: Service is so fast. You come in , write your name , it takes only 15 minutes for each group to sit. The servers are fast and polite. The guy who took care of us was even able to give us complete name of each order only by number In front of each menu's name.I went to this place twice and every single time the service was fast and nice. The only reason I deducted one point is the food is too greasy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #10
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange juice
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #15 large

zKseXlLGQk236m34Lv_oaQ.text: Truly one of my favorite places to eat REAL Authentic Vietnamese Pho. My favorite is the Beef Stew Pho. Normally a good balance of stewed meat with some fats.  However today, my favorite Beef Stew became "Fatty Stew" I ask the waiter to be sure the Chef knows of my Valid Complainyy

0BAt7ubg7thArTZr0hZVyg.text: The food is good, but the customer service could do a lot better. I have been coming here for years since my dad found out about this place. Customer service was not horrible back then, but in the last 5-6 years it has greatly declined. I will admit, we still come here at least twice a month. Our children love the food and once seated the food is served hot and quick so this is why we continue to come here. Lines and wait times can be crazy, but not too bad. Do prepare yourself for the faces the servers make when you are requesting refills or for anything "extra" like more limes or napkins.

a5UgJiDuf1Xte3-IlUIsqg.text: Good Vietnamese food and affordable prices.. and good service as they give u ice water when u sit down.. warm atmosphere

yxeMfE8HiTYwHhbLugRQ8w.text: Poor customer service and rude the people working there, we ordered food to go, we waited almost an hour, but they don't offer a chair for us, we ask if we can sit down, the guys said, no you can't sit down because we need a prepared the table? So we're waiting, and then when we get the food, we asked for the fork & spoon, he said he put a lot in the bag, but when we back to the hotel there is no fork and spoon or either chapstick. Not recommended

b0vIa9vLiudZKqLx50rbbA.text: One if the best late night joints in town. Great pho! In fact everything I have ever tried here is very good. Check it out next time you gotta eat late.

MXx9Xfq1zOYRxqg2vdgm0g.text: Went Saturday night, Food was excellent, service was prompt, And our orders are brought to us very quickly. If I'm dinging them for anything, it's that the wait staff  glares at you when you linger a little too long at your table. We were only there for maybe 45 or 50 minutes, but there was still a wait for patrons waiting to be seated. A couple of the wait staff made a point to stare at me until I made eye contact with them. I understand the more they flip tables, the more money they make, but it's perfectly fine to let a patron longer without intimidating him/her.

a-JQOecZVJvWE7HMOdiGGw.text: Food is supper salty and looks like the they just throw it on the plate and the place is dirty, definitely not a happy camper. The only good thing is they open 24 hrs but still that I'm not even recommended

JdOiF94vw8ytOZ8UQaPdRw.text: I and my sister just recently order chicken wings with pho Kim long sauce, soup and steam chicken i like it . My sister love Chicken wing with Pho Kim long sauce I don't typically care  however the food here was good. But the way i like they open 24 hours . I like stop by off i done work .I was also won over by the good service . We will definitely be back .

f3mF7qW2AW34oPUgQdiKMA.text: Pho Kim Long is the place to go in Las Vegas. I go there regularly for the Beef Stew Rice Noodle Pho, excellent. It's open 24 hours so after work its a great place to relax down. Pho Kim Long  is so good that last Christmas Eve when I arrived there was a lot of people waiting for a table and new comers didn't know you had to sign in and how many people were in your party. If they put a sign near or in front of the door that to be serve that you MUST sign in. That will solve a lot of problems right way. Other than that is my only issue.

MPU51RoswOjFPrLWDZJgyw.text: tldr  My go to, post nightclub sober up spot! The food is surprisingly fast especially if you're getting pho (soup). It can get busy during their peak times, and the lack of waiting room is a bit frustrating but it's always worth it to me.  Got: -fresh spring rolls; comes out quick with peanut sauce, great appetizer -crab rangoons; bomb, fatty, but bomb -orange chicken; tangy, thick sauced and decent -pad Thai; a must order, get the combination

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pad thai

tXhczlxn2XTmpQHR6t8jJg.text: After closing out XS, we were cold and hungry. Not knowing where to go, I whipped out my handy, dandy Yelp app and came across Pho Kim Long. It wasn't a popular choice with my friends, but I wanted soup, darn it, so away we went. When we got in the car, my friend said we were going to some soup place, and the driver already knew where to go without even saying the name.  There was a line when we arrived, but we were seated pretty quickly, and in front of some other parties. I was starving by this point, so I got a rare brisket pho and some mixed spring rolls. The rolls came out first, and they weren't all that good. Because of my state, however, I ate all of them in record time. The pho was okay. I don't really eat pho, because it's not my favorite, but it hit the spot on this particular evening.   We left around 5:30am, and there was still a line waiting to be seated.

iAvS-RKPwBer2eA0FmR4dg.text: Always good and fast service. We always stop here for pho when we are in las vegas. This is our go to place for sure

kbfe6J1ZX5j4h10t2Yrcbg.text: The worst pho ever. I saw on yelp that it's the most famous in Las Vegas and I wanted to try it. Although the Vietnamese driver told me that it's not good and it is famous because the white people like it, I don't care and I want to try how good it is. I got pho tai nam and my husband got com bo luc lac. They were very bad taste and not decorate to look good food and make you feel like you're eating "com hop Vietnam". And the restroom is very old and not clean. Never come back!!!

l7qrKcWj06RSliT7MzCx4g.text: One of my favorite restaurants. Pho soup is good and the Thai tea plus the option of Vietnamese coffee always a win.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #13PhoDatBiet (Speical combination tender beef noodle soup) (only comes in a large bowl) and #14PhoTai (Rare beef noodle soup)

bwVSVdb_LyhZSaN6Sq545A.text: Exceptional service. As soon as we walked in, we were sat immediately. By the time we sat at the table, water was already being placed in front of us and menus were placed in our hands. Table was very clean and there's tons of room to stretch out. Place was very busy yet our server was over so fast to take our order. Drinks arrived as soon as the server left and minutes later, our apps and food arrived.  This place is so quick and it's not a bad price at all. Will definitely be coming back! And I'll be bringing friends next time. Would recommend to anyone looking for a great experience.  Only downside is the parking here. I had to park all the way down the street because of how busy it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PjKv6l84O7VNeiIYhAnjlw.text: The service here was terrible and the food was also very low quality. This place is overrated so you should do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

Z69mkX_OdS5zmPwfgxVpLA.text: Overrated venue. No excuse to eat here unless it's late at night, you're drunk/high or a tourist. Seems like every Californian/out-of-towner has heard of this place somehow, someway and wants to eat here for the hell of it and post it on social media. But that's really a shame since there's literally a dozen other venues you can choose from.  The place is always crowded whether its day or night. Takes forever to get seating and once you do, ordering takes time as well. The food is very mediocre. If I wanted to show my friends a good pho venue in town this certainly wouldn't be my first choice.  What's good is that they are 24/7, which is probably the only reason why they're so popular (oh and their name of course). The only reason why I'm ever here is because they are always open and sometimes I am that guy who is drunk at 2am in the morning.

2G-xFmH0pmAAVboUq4hoxg.text: Pho isn't my fav here. I always came here for the calamari. But the portion was so much smaller this time. I tried their wonton noodles soup for the first time. It was surprisingly good! Added to my list.

-gjFNImijDYZqH53iVyadA.text: So, I don't know what kind of magical fancy pho the rest of the people leaving reviews have had before, but I love the pho here! It's tasty, it's inexpensive, it's fast and it's open 24 hours a day... it's really all you can ask from a pho place... I'm a very indecisive person, so I always get the combination pho so I can get a little bit of everything. I also love their Thai iced tea (with boba) and their chicken lettuce wrap is always a hit.. the only thing I've had there that I didn't like was the calamari. It's too oily and no seasoning. No one liked it when my friends and I tried it.   I would rate this place higher if it was only about the food. But sadly, i have to agree on this part with the other yelpers: their customer service SUCKS!! I have been spoken down to and mocked by a manager. A manager! All because I didn't like calamari and wanted to send it back... lesson learned. DO NOT ORDER THE CALAMARI.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gpj4Kav8OVYuD0EL9Oy-5w.text: The food here ranges from totally average to quite good, depending on what you get.    But it's more than the food, it's a bit of an institution.  A 24/7 spot that can have some pretty outstanding people watching depending on what time you show up.

nB0U_67MA8N4AJ6f5oJtdg.text: BEST discovery in Vegas. Coming from LA in search for a latenight dinner we found this hidden gem. Nestled in a strip mall in Chinatown serves some of the best Pho around including LA which is pretty impressive. The broth they use is amazing, not overly salty or under flavored, this place found the right mixture. 5 stars for a place the serves  a 6 star bowl of Pho! Ok enough of my overly Pho tastic experience. The place seems to be busy at 2am on a weekday so it must be fantastic! Especially if you see other Asians eating there. That is always a mark of a great restaurant when locals are enjoying the food. Service was ok, we did have to try several times to get ahold of our waiter for water or to give us our check but that's understandable when your taking care of several tables at one time.   Definitely a new stop while visiting!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie pho

4kr8No7ZRIvLj3v3WfjU8g.text: I was in Vegas for vacation and EDC (Electric Daisy Carnival). On my last day, I was craving pho, so my cousin and I searched yelp for recommended Vietnamese restaurants in chinatown. I saw that there were mixed reviews here, but the overall rating was good, so we chose Pho Kim Long.  When we got to the restaurant, there was a long wait, so I was anxious to try the pho, thinking it was going to be delicious. We finally got seated after 20 minutes, and the waitress assisted us right away. We ordered our food which was out in less than 10 minutes. I ordered a small bowl of pho and my cousin ordered a large bowl. My bowl had just about the same amount of noodles (a lot) his did, so that was strange. He ended up having to order extra noodles.  Overall, the restaurant was beautiful, the service was great, but the pho was kind of bland. The pricing was very affordable and cheap, so it was worth it for hungry tourists.

B_DnLgr-jnJrNN4-SKSycw.text: This place has changed SO much since I last came here as a kid. It looks NOTHING like how it was when it first opened. I remember the food being pretty good as a kid, so I looked forward to coming here again.  My girl and I shared rice with BBQ'd pork and hu tieu with beef.  The BBQ'd pork was nice and smokey. I was surprised by the broth that came with the rice. Normally it comes in a dinky ass rice bowl, but it was at least twice the amount of a rice bowl. F yeah! Our hu tieu was good, but definitely a little too salty and that's coming from someone who loves sodium. Speaking of salty, their broth is a little on the salty side too, but it's also packed with a lot of flavor. The service was also very friendly and amusing too.  The other pho spots in the area are repulsive. Just put up with the wait and eat here instead.

e92DoTNcz0_wlj6HmgYtEg.text: After a hang over this is the place to be. Long lines but worth waiting for. Love the Pho soup with meatball and enjoy ever bit of this place. Customer service is okay but there all older looks family owned. You just have to waves yr hands up but the food comes out fast and they don't for get anything or over charge or charge extra. But make sure all your party is there at the same time so they can set you all at once so you do have to keep waiting.

6DGNRDz_OK4JdsHYn3VAFw.text: This place was great! A hidden gem that is 24 hours! I've never been a pho fan ... But man was I surprised! The menu you is HUGE! Not just pho... But So much more! I got the beef drunken noodles. I loved them and the service was so fast! I couldn't believe it. There was a wait... But it's s popular place in china town so I wasn't surprised at all and it wAs completely worth it.

cQPj1uk5ReuNGDJMLgZ3tw.text: I wish I could give this zero stars.  My friends had wanted to go here.  Obviously they don't know anything about asian food, and neither do the people who work and cook here.   I am a vegan, and eating vegan in Asian cuisine shouldn't be an issue.  I never had a problem with it back home.  And this is Las Vegas, the restaurants here are supposed to be better than the shitty small town I come from.    But when I asked for the Singapore curry noodles with no animal products, and only vegetables, what they brought out was a plate of noodles that had been mixed with curry powder.  No vegetables at all.  I sent it back saying "There's no vegetables here, I wanted vegetables with it", and they asked what kind and I said "Just mixed chinese vegetables like you would put into just about any other dish, just no animal products".   They then brought me out another plate of just noodles and no vegetables, but this time a different kind of noodles. I sent it back again.  Finally, starving, I got a plate of noodles with some vegetables and I ate it even though it was below par.    I don't know what is wrong with these people.  It wasn't that they don't speak english, because they spoke perfect English, no accents or anything, a lot of the people who work there are american.  I think they're just completely lackluster and are one of these restaurants that don't pay any attention to what they are doing.  Eat somewhere else.

-phkyeYbOexQVUuV1fA6XA.text: Great late night spot and their wait time has improved since late year. HUGE selection and open 24hours. I love their pad Thai and they serve BOBA!!

iIA_800przEW1MHqpmgLJA.text: Ordered chicken wings as an appetizer and what a surprise. Chicken was not cooked , blood drenching out.  The server didn't even say sorry, he only said don't worry we will fix it right away. My friends order pho and Mongolian beef along with fried rice. I wanted to play it safe after the appetizer incident so order chicken teriyaki. My food was so gross didn't taste clean. I mean this place just looks and smells questionable. I will never eat here again.

-Q2xbNa6rPllFCBjqUrQvQ.text: Anyone who says this is the best Pho on Vegas, hasn't had real Pho. I've had better Pho in TX.   It's a hole in the wall like most pho places.  Typical ambiance one would expect.   I ordered the rare beef pho with meatball which was not rare at all (chewy and overdone) and came with exactly one meatball cut in half. The bun noodles were soggy like they had been sitting broth all day. It at least came with all the typical accompaniments including basil, jalapeno, bean sprouts, and lime.   Service was passable.  Food came out quick.  Won't be back.

YMjHwcTQX0cvTR49PM9THQ.text: Greatest Pho experience I have had in a while, this restaurant will have you you begging for more. The customer service was one for the books, felt like a prince while partaking in this Vietnamese feast of noodles. Speaking of the noodles, so tender. I was heavenly. The broth was to die for, made by the gods of pho themselves. Would recommend for anyone getting into pho, or someone who has been eating this delectable beef noodle soup for years. Thank you for your service to Las Vegas, and your great beef noodle soup.

MdWg_dxKvLf4BbSf9crzYA.text: First time here tonight for the won ton soup, was really good and glad I came here. Soup was hot and served quickly. Good prices and the staff are nice

qPnKbpVVtyqCzx2ibPXHcQ.text: It wasn't as good as before. I believe they changed owner. I ordered the pork chop and it wasn't seasoned well. I must say they didn't season the meat at all. The only good thing about the meat was tenderness.  No one came to refill my drink or touched table.

xYHqhvzZJHBpu-bIsXWGoQ.text: Pho Kim Long has really "pho kim long" wait times to serve your food. The service was lacking and it took such a long time for our food  to be served. We were all hungry and grumpy. The food was mediocre. Definitely taking this place off our Las Vegas list.

Sa7NRcru2gshKxQF4qYY3Q.text: Great as usual. Stop I'm every time I visit Vegas. All the Pho with veggies are great. Try  a Vietnamese iced coffee (condensed milk with a shot of expresso) Clean & pleasant atmosphere. Staff friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorging on combination beef Pho.

NYZhZJvc0jlL661j_fSoIw.text: Now I thought it was just me but it seems to be the trend with them I ordered food togo and mistakenly forgot to get soy-sauce and went back in to get it and the cashier told me I didn't order anything and don't lie you can not have anything! So I said if that's the case how about you give me my money back? He said no! And what makes it worse my meat wasn't completely cooked all the way through  never again with they have my service. Good luck if you plan on eating there with extremely poor customer service and uncooked meat!

iJdifmIfXOtIFIrWJH27-Q.text: RE-TRAIN YOUR STAFF TO SERVE GOOD QUALITY SERVICE TO YOUR CUSTOMERS! I'm a shift manager at a restaurant and I dont even treat My customers the way your cashier (it was a Guy) treated me and My friends. To you MR! Leave your nasty ass attitude where you came from! Stop being a grouch!   I do not recommend this place .. there's a lot more places to eat than here.

cj1nfMI5vD0-2h-j7JJruQ.text: Since my first tine being here, these guys have aleays impressed me! Fast and friendly  service, you won't be waiting long to get your delicious entrees!

gZ0RysOpOWpnHPIaEVLHmw.text: i had very bad experience at that place , no customer service at all , the servers are ignoring it was my first and last time there.

_Z9Syoeielyx62qHa9bZ6g.text: I ordered the Pho Bo Vien for my favorite Pho bowl on an occasional visit to Chinatown in Las Vegas. The soup here was okay, but the beef balls were very tender not as tough and leathery as they should be. Three stars are given for this place.

mZjG1-atCe_Lqc8CuyT8_Q.text: Always one of my favorite go to spots here in town.. the pho is pretty good but I love the chow mein, Mongolian beef, and my favorite the honey walnut shrimp. There is usually a line to be seated but nothing too bad.

bkwzQthOXLbRuplfUiYgsA.text: oh man... look around you. look to the right and to the left.  you will notice their blood shot eyes and lackluster emotions on their faces.  YES, everyone is hungover and tired.  but everyone seems to come to this place for pho to cure their head ache.  i've been multiple times after a night of clubbing and it usually hits the spot. before entering, you will usually have to put your name down on a wait list,  but don't fret, the wait time is very short.  The portions are big and the broth is tasty.  I like how they have the condiments on the table.  if you are one of the types of people who need white onion with your pho, make sure you specify white onion.  my friend got green onions before....lol... wtf.  If you want fast food, get PHO.  i once ordered the pad thai, and when everyone got their phos and was almost done with it, i just got my entree.... so i don't know what the fuck i was thinking ordering something that wasn't pho at this place.  but real talk, the pad thai was delicious.  i might get it again when i come back to vegas.  haha.  come here if you want fast service and cheap good drunk food. and they are open 24/7!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Getting pad thai at a pho place??  Lol...  Sure.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best hangover cures.

jEyWlMEmymX1lUcjMvDilQ.text: came here after a VERY LONG wknd in vegas lol and thought the pho was great here! It really hit the spot and the broth was especially tasty to me (or maybe i was just craving salt lol). The meat was of good quality and the portions were of good size. The prices were pretty average for a bowl of pho.  the restaurant is pretty big inside and they seat you rather quickly. once we placed our orders the pho literally came out in minutes :)  its located across the frwy from the strip and is an easy drive but if you must take a cab it will prob be around $10 to get there =)

IBLnq-yS1_vEaxINDcnCkQ.text: I've heard so much good stuff about Pho Kim Long, and plenty of jokes about the restaurants name, but the food is definitely no joking manner.  Opened 24 hours  and on Spring Mountain Rd, this place is great for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and the late night hang over snack. But be warned, normal wait time can be  anywhere between 30 min to over an  hour as this place is busy as ever.  We ordered  Pho Tai (rare beef), Bun bo hue (it's like a vermicelli noodle soup with different types of beef and you can add this spicy sauce to it), and the Cam bo luc lac (diced tender beef with steamed rice).  The Pho soup has amazing flavors and is rich in texture, but their small and large isn't much of  a difference in bowl size so I'd recommend opting for the large. I can't say much about comparing bun bo  hue to other restaurants as it was my first time, but I'm a fan! My only grip is that I wish they had given more meat for the bo  luc lac dish...it seemed on the skimpier side but the flavors were really delicious.  Staff is very attentive for refills, taking empty plates away, and utensil requests. Ambience is clean,  surprisingly  spacious, and constantly busy. Next time I return to Vegas, I can't wait to return to Pho Kim Long!

Qz65wy0iCa4lX-RuaTdZcQ.text: This is my favorite pho and vermicelli place in Vegas. Enough said, considering the competition. BTW- don't go to a restaurant of this sort and expect American version of customer service.

hRXWwDVNoslNX9K4y3PPkQ.text: One of my favorite places to eat after a long night of partying or if I just want some good authentic Vietnamese food. Fast cab ride from the strip and easy to call for a can back. Prices are pretty reasonable!

Rx0m5XMBnI3oMtsJvMzYyQ.text: Wow this restaurant is open 24 hrs! I currently reside in Prov RI, was on vacation in Vegas and was getting up at 8a and was craving for pho ( noodle soup), found this place on the Internet, and there pho is absolutely delicious and i was served right a way!! Deff will go here again when in Vegas!!!

ha_1c3tXeu69PKOQo2q7WA.text: Don't order the salt and pepper calamari! The picture looked so much better than the outcome. So disappointed. The batter was gross. Ordered the roasted chicken plate, and honestly the chicken was really dry.   Other than their customer service being excellent, their food really needed some improvement.

TceNUjGjh9DEoMjNiii8WA.text: Pho Kim Long is my favorite Vietnamese spot for pho!  The peanut sauce is delicious and the shrimp rolls are perfect. Make sure to try all of the different sauces...the fish sauce is my favorite even though it is very salty. I had the shrimp pho, shrimp rolls, the Chinese doughnuts, and Thai coffee and I could have rolled home and slept for hours on my full, satisfied tummy!

tUGNoq1pTThD4498-CzFdw.text: Hands down the best Pho restaurant in Las Vegas. Only complaint is the wait to get a table is sometimes really long (upwards of 30-45 minutes at times). In the end I think my complaint only plays into the quality of food they serve here. It's so good that everyone I know if willing to wait to get a nice hot bowl of their Pho. Added bonus is they're open 24/7 so you can get this delicious meal any time you want.

4_dzksm0qJAw4MQOvuenrg.text: I can't give this place a perfect score because I wasn't entirely sober when I was here but it was a great place to go to for the state my friends n I were in. The morning after we all agreed that it was pretty good pho and none of us had a hangover the next day so id recommend and probably return to this place.

v5kYZH7svXo-BRoRim19Vw.text: A staple every time I visit Vegas..Pho is outstanding..Spring rolls are always a go to..   Service always spot on..

UKxZ0qH7_jImQANxMZxMLA.text: The food is not that great and it is the priciest vietnamese restaurant in town. The service is the worst thing. The waiters are so mean. Has No manner in customer service. Talk really rude to us when we ask some question. These people need to take a manner lesson.

bl7elP3C2stSAMLGlw3G2Q.text: Used to be my favorite place,  but the last couple of times I went in were terrible.  The service was awful (I couldn't get a refill on my water,  and had to chase someone down to get my check) the portions were smaller,  and the pho was just not as good.  Very disappointing. I've switched to little saigon!

7zvDaaAblSRxp39lbwerlA.text: Ok.  I know that everyone loves this place, locals and tourists alike, but honestly, I didn't think this place was anything spectacular.  I tried this place with my entire family awhile back and we ordered some chinese dishes which were alright (though the seafood items were a no go).  I came back recently because I wanted to give the pho noodle soup another try (I had forgotten what it tasted like).  Turns out, I forgot because it's nothing too memorable - not horrible, but not exactly mind blowing either.    Here are the pros:  They have an extensive menu with pictures, and a variety of different dishes beyond what you see at your traditional pho place.  Their wings with special sauce were pretty delicious too. Sweet and slightly spicy.  It's pretty clean and looks pretty new.   Here are the cons:  If you're coming just for a regular pho special noodle soup, I'd say that it's decent here, but not great.  The one big gripe I had was that their pho special does not have tripe in it.  But if you're not a tripe fanatic like me, I guess it wouldn't matter to you.    Also, I don't think they give as much meat in their pho noodle soups as other places - the pho special large was really not that large, and only had a few pieces of rare steak and brisket in it.

2ibhNdlz7fp2FYSbx7v2xw.text: The place was busy with board for a waiting list.  We were promptly seated.  The service was speedy but the problem came when we were served with the wrong dish.  My was right and my friend's was wrong.  We had to get servers attention where no utemcil, chopsticks, nor soup spoon were offered.  Pleaded for their attention and got slightly flustered telling them we couldn't eat with our hand and his order was wrong.  Took it back and finally his Bun Bo Hue came and it looked strange because there is no lemongrass chili sauce and it is the exactly the same with Pho.   Called the server  and gave us a dirty look saying the sauce were on the side and we got to mix it ourselves (first time ever in Vietnamese rest and my buddy is a owner of Viet rest).  Broth is decent, food was decent, the service was as rude as one can be.  I really should raise the issues with the manager but my friend told me NOT to do so.  No apology was given for all the mistakes.  Typical rude Las Vegas service that this city is famous for.

uokN_crDAf5wyK4Lggn_Mg.text: Food is quite good. My review is colored by the intolerable hourlong wait to get into the place.  There are 12 Pho places within 1.5 miles (according to Yelp) which means now way I would'v waited if not for being in a group at the time.

v_X-aBBCKU21x4VvaLRdwg.text: I usually make a stop at Pho Kim Long during my Vegas trips.  Friendly and quick service 24/7.  Everything I've tried has been great, but my fave is the fried rotisserie chicken.  Skin is nice and crispy and the meat is juicy and flavorful.  It is served with red rice, which is another plus.  Place gets super packed on Sunday when people are nursing hangovers and getting ready to head home, so come early.  Price is good for Vegas.  Make sure you check your bill because gratuity is added for parties of 5 or more.

dGQcqAnHvTXb34H-iBmwIw.text: We typically come here for the pho but idk today the broth was off. 3 stars based on today's lunch.

AMBS2ewV-vZfdQL2Jd_FEA.text: We started out at the pho place in TI... I vaguely remembered being unimpressed with it. Luckily my bf checked yelp reviews before we actually threw our money down the pit & we bolted out there and came here.   I told him Chinatown was right around the corner & pho places would be abundant. Yelp helped us choose this place above the rest.  At first u think it's gonna be a dump but when u get in there u realize this place is pretty snazzy. We like to judge places by their quality of Thai iced tea. Theres was pretty damn good. I prefer the strong tea taste instead of the overly sweet powdery mix.   We order pho tai & rice with the egg & pork.   Pho tai: He made it jumbo & it was the perfect size or him. The beef was tender & he said it was one of the best broths he's had (MSG? He doesn't care)  Rice meal: I can see why people would think their portions are normally I would have agreed, but honestly tonight it was the perfect size. I finished everything & was very satisfied.   Next time I come ro Vegas I'm definitely stoppping by here,

k9wrvHSHIM5Sa-BAKZye0w.text: Very good pho restaurant although service is not so great. Prices are decent and get the large bowl it has a lot more noodles

sdE60sMg9rqOzJTjTN31dQ.text: Want an idea of how popular this place is? After a night of clubbing, Kalila and I went to Pho Kim Long to eat quickly before going home. We had left our friends behind at the club. As soon as we finished eating, who strolls in? The rest of our friends that we had been with just about 30-40 mins earlier. We hadn't told them where we were going. Watch out Jack in the crack, people just LOVE pho when they're drunk.  Pho or vermicelli always hits the spot. Everyone has their own way of eating pho. Some people prefer lots of bean sprouts & chili paste or sriracha in it. It's all about preference. The last time I ate it, I was a little bummed that I ran out of noodles.  A good thing to take note of, is that you can order pho in a small or large size. Kalila is little and she actually finished her small bowl.  The location is rather large with lots of tables from wall to wall. They do accommodate to bigger parties, putting multiple tables together if need be.

9tt9N0A-Cqs8AP0beS0P0A.text: If you say "Pho Kim Long" quickly, it does make me smile... did it make you smile?  Anyway, this restaurant was a "pho kim long" (again, say it quickly) wait!!! Yeesh. Usually pho takes five min tops to get out but it took like 20 minutes! What's worse was, one's pho dish got here after 5 min of sitting, while everyone else's took 20 minutes. My poor friend wanted to be polite and wait for at least one other person to get their food... so that was not fun. Probably did not taste that great for her, either. I ordered the grilled chicken and rice dish and the chicken turned out super dry.  We had a grumpy server who practically did not check up on us at all... man, it was a painfully long wait! I'd go to a different Vietnamese restaurant instead.  Perhaps if you come here late at night (or early in the morning) it'd be better. esp since it's open 24 hours and you can prevent that hangover from clubbing all night!

lUk6igEEE0viU4fySPXokQ.text: I just got from this restaurant having dinner with my daughter and mom earlier today....we ordered the crispy noodles which my daughter's favorite and the combination soup. I've been eating this restaurant so many times but just today i was so disappointed, upset and traumatized what i saw on my plate was a 1 inch worm with a small bite comin from the bokchoy vegetable on the crispy noodles, I immediately call the attention of the server and they just said that it was from the bokchoy and ask sorry and we didn't pay anything from what we ordered but still can't take it anymore... My God they should clean and check it thoroughly the vegetables before cooking...VERY DISAPPOINTED!!! I can't imagine how it looks like their kitchen at this point!!!

B7M2Yqn-dhZAsIlSqR9pcw.text: Pho little Saigon is my GOTO place and then I discovered this place.  Another place that served crazy shrimp Pho!!!!!!  Wow!!

d25YpxNuZTYr0ZcekH30-Q.text: This is our go-to spot for Pho in Vegas, but this time around we were disappointed in the food.  The pho was pretty good as always,  no complaints there -  but the spring rolls (our favorite) were too chewy and we also ordered duck which was not bad,  but the pork chop which we order all the time was chewy and had no taste and we had to return it.    Also the water tastes bad and they don't have bottled water (huh?).   We might have to search for another spot for Vietnamese food, unfortunately.

YjV5uu7mTVIBdOZ9ojskZw.text: I really liked this place lots of options on the menu . The atmosphere is so cool . Service was very nice and fast . The pho had a really nice flavor , I just wish they had cilantro on the garnish plate . I had the beef stew with seasoned rice it was amazing . We also ordered spring rolls and fried roll . I wouldn't recommend... but other than that it was a great dining experience .

GmdvhmhU4zP7M-cOx3wrag.text: Pros- open late, wide variety of choices, good Central location  Cons- too expensive compared to other Pho places, food is rarely fresh which is insane with all the business they get, service is slow and robotic, always crowded yet isn't good so its basically just full of wanna be's who think this is good Pho, food wildly inconsistent from order to order so its like playing roulette if you want a decent meal  In summary my opinion is if you want to pay 150% for 50% of the quality of most any other pho joint while surrounded by people who will be discussing thier favorite dj and best flavor of axe body spray well then roll on in to the oh so cleverly named Pho Kim Long...get it? Fornicate him for an extended period of time. .. Comedy gold.

6fpwG0PHy1lbPax5ZZPdMA.text: Manager was yelling at employee infront of customers. I tried being friendly and asked how he was doing yet he didn't really care.  Bad customer ser

8hbqTNVcz-14DDF48J5F8w.text: Relatively clean environment, in terms of pho restaurants. Inattentive service. Fair prices for fair portions. Food tastes good, including the pho; can't argue that.   As a local, visits are less and less regular due to popularity by tourists. The food is good, but not 30 min wait good.

NSHhBGYoCRSjOXg3w4FjVQ.text: I've never been to any business or restaurant in Vegas' Chinatown. I've always wanted to try something down here but it's nowhere near my home and unfortunately, the most adventurous restaurant my family will try is Panda Express (bleh) Luckily, I FINALLY got my Vegas Chinatown cherry popped when Beau S. took me for dinner here on 4/20/11 after coming to see the show I worked for.   We checked out the menu and prices for Beijing Noodle No. 9 at Caesar's and I quipped that the same food would probably be about $6 in Chinatown, about a 4 minute drive away from the Strip. After a quick car ride, we were here.   24 hours is always a good sign to me because it means two things - the food is tasty, and it's probably not too pricey.  We were seated quickly and were asked if we knew what we wanted to order after a few minutes. Because I hadn't been there before, I needed more time to check out the extensive menu.   Pad Thai is kryptonite for me. I absolutely can't pass it up. The spicier, the better. I ordered the chicken pad thai and asked for it to be as spicy as possible. The waiter looked nervous when I said I really did want it as spicy as possible. I want my food to be "sinus clearing spicy" every time. Delicious. Beau ordered a beef pho and the Thai Tea.  The waiter brought me a fork and a spoon and Beau... nothing. I didn't catch what Beau meant when he said he liked how the waiter assumed he didn't need a fork and spoon but I did, until I thought about it the next day. Maybe white people tend to not know how to use chopsticks? I don't know, but I know how, and I obviously wasn't offended, so the fork and spoon were left untouched.   The waiter brought out our food fairly quickly and was giving me a look like they might need an EMT soon due to the spiciness of the food. I was actually a little scared based on how the waiter was acting. I took a bite.... MILD, borderline not spicy. Pssssh. Typical. Maybe it's because a girl, but regardless of what type of restaurant I'm at, when I order "spiciest you can possibly make the dish" apparently the waiters think I can't handle myself and it comes out mild. Wah. I doused my plate in chili sauce and Sriracha sauce to the point of ridiculousness. Perfect. The Pad Thai was killer and as usual eating things that aren't cut up, I'm sure I made a fool of myself trying to get it into my mouth semi-daintily.   I liked that the waiters were on top of their stuff. My water glass was never left unfilled. One waiter even said he read my mind as he filled up my glass, and he was actually ahead of me. That's how it's supposed to be so not only was the food phenomenal, the service was great too.  Beau made a fantastic choice bringing me here and I would gladly go out of my way to eat here again.

9bxQUkJjwx5fk1LRYfaf_A.text: So I'm not really a Pho person. Why? Well, I'm from NY, where pho places are plentiful..but none of them taste GOOD. They are all very generic with just broth, noodles, meat, veggies and basil on the side. None of them are SPECIAL.  This place quickly changed my mind. I ordered the vegan pho with tofu nuggets. Broth was extremely flavorful. Noodles weren't too mushy. Vegetables in my pho. I'm a happy girl.  All of this can be said with their regular pho, as my friends finished every single drop of broth and every single strand of noodle. Add in the fact that this place is open 24/7, and we have a winner for the first time I liked eating pho.

T7OPed26bik-wiLedycZpw.text: Hangover food!  After a big night out club hopping all over the strip, we decided to hit this place up for a nice salty bowl of pho to dilute the booze. The restaurant was packed at 3:30 AM in the morning. Some were still in their skimpy clubbing outfit, others in their PJ most likely suffering from insomnia, and lets not forget the pervy men who just got done at the strip club.  Pho came out in a big bowl full of salty broth and a seriously lacking in content. Two thin slices of pork and 3 pieces of bok choy is not enough to compensate for the 5 hours of dancing we just did.  Was too hung over to check out the bathrooms.

ua4lXuZ7fP3-1eMHeGicdw.text: I forgot why I hadn't visited in such a long time, but now I remember. Everything was so unmemorable. We visited one evening with a friend when our first choice in Chinatown had an hour wait. I should have trusted the instinct of not going to your last choice.  We ordered the Salt and Pepper Calamari to start. The batter was strange and oily, but still pretty tasty with the chopped chilies, garlic, and etc. Plus, the dipping sauce was good. Ruben ordered the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio (charbroiled pork and egg roll with rice vermicelli noodles). The pork was flavorful, but the dish as a whole was not very cohesive and bland. I ordered the Drunken Noodles with the Vegetarian option. I really like the flat, thick rice noodles and lots of fresh vegetables, so I was immediately drawn to this dish, however, it lacked in flavor and depth. A bit of Sriracha sauce saved it toward the end, but any great dish wouldn't have to rely on a table condiment. Our friend, Juan, ordered the Chicken Pad Thai and it was okay.  Needless to say, I didn't enjoy the meal very much. The highlight was the Calamari and still, that was no where close to being the best calamari dish I've eaten. Obviously, I didn't try Pho and perhaps that may be something they do really well? I wouldn't count on it since everything else was so disappointing. Service was okay, no complaints. Anyway, there are so many other spots in town serving up better Thai food, Vietnamese food, and whatever else they're serving here and just steps away.

x1GCaFuBRXggWa1UL5W-5w.text: Pho was very good. Pan toasted noodle dish with chicken, veggies, & sauce on top very delicious.  If it was at least partially organic they'd get a 5 star.

Du4ZC2cYmZM-fFfwuIhNrA.text: Service: it was attentive at times but I disliked how the girl in the pink punkrock belt was being disrespectful to her own staffs, specifically the busboy. I understand you want to sit down all your customers but her attitude was a bad first impression of the restaurant.   Food: the food here was pretty on point. Once again, water is tap water.. Our food took 20mins to come out..yes 20 mins and all we ordered was 2 bowls of pho. Other tables had their food before us. They did however make it up checking up on us.   Overall, if you are craving pho late at night and looking to spend less than $10 on pho, come here!

a4G_SJDGvOAXaUCtdS7e9Q.text: great service the people working there were really attentive to our needs I recommend going a little later at night due to the long wait time oh and make sure you order the Black bean clams it was delicious

BBuS_8w_FO4sXaKJgT-w0w.text: Had their pho, salt and pepper calamari and egg rolls! Pho was good but I've had better! So it's a decent place to go to not too far from the strip and plus it's open 24/7! The salt and pepper calamari was flavorful but alittle bit on the salty side for me! Other than that it was yummy!! Egg rolls are ok. Next time, I want to try their other dishes because they sound and look so good!!!

eRl2vN74881FI0Ba-ozisw.text: Waited about 10 mins to be seated... It was pretty packed. I ordered steak Pho! It was delicious. It's better than Jenni Pho that is down the street. Customer service is nothing to rave about but the food is quite delicious! I recommend you guys try their bobo's

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Pho

bCdd9BaUE92Lp-0RYXQWxA.text: My last visit at this restaurant was disappointing   I only came because I was next door having drinks. The food we ordered tonight is so much better.  Orange chicken and mixed vegetables. Both definitely something I'd get again.

KS70v_VrjifHz1ZKy2rK2Q.text: Crispy calamari with salt and pepper was huge ripped off. There was 5% squid, 95%  fried batter.  It costs $12.25 for nothing.  I regretted to order calamari here.  Please stay away from #10 under appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Calamari with salt and pepper but NO SQUID!!!! Cheating! 95% was fried batter

uL0nHZHBVGaj-WYKIon8iQ.text: Great healthy foods and great services in town. We reserved a 24 person group. The restaurant was busy but they kept theses table for us even we were a bit late.  Check it out if you are in Vietnamese foods !  Enjoy ! Dave P

EJ2UvftI8e2gql3JnK0DXg.text: THEY ADD 16% GRATUITY ON YOUR BILL!!!!...And we went w/ a party of only 4.   Now, let's get to the food. The pho here is average to below average. The vermicelli noodles w/ eggrolls and meet was decent but the PORTIONS ARE TINY!!   If food alone were the criteria, I would give this place 2.25 stars overall  but the kicker here is the freakin sneaky gratuity they slap on you w/o ever telling you! SHAME on you Pho Kim Long (fist pumping) !!

Ud1vCyWsE8bGN1Tg8kjQ7g.text: This place sucks... They will served you lukewarm soup and if you want to change they will take it to the kitchen and will just pour hot water so the taste of the soup change...very bad bad service I swear this is my last visit to this place ...

XAZo8dvLekK2Rek6X6THPg.text: Can never go wrong w this place! Got the #13 w some spring rolls and wantons. Everything quick and on point. Also open 24hours, perfect for the Vegas life

t5dOfZgBgQ5hooSXIyx5Zg.text: This place is hands down my favorite place to eat Pho. I used to come here every time I was in town, but now that I live here it is becoming an obsession. Great food 24hrs a day and swift service. These guys are nothing if not efficient.

GFpWEKvKijsfw4yUrB4UXQ.text: I'm a local so I should've known from the get go that it was a mistake coming here, but it was 3 AM and nothing else was open near by except for this place and Lees Sandwiches.
