-3EvpEKdG91lAL0T8om5-w.text: Need a hangover cure while in Las Vegas? Well, come here!  Likes: -Cheap.  -Definitely good when you are craving something soupy and low-key have a hangover.  -Service is quick.  -Plenty of parking in parking lot.   Dislikes: -Not the friendliest service, but frankly, most Asian restaurants, like this aren't. -It's not totally convenient since you cannot walk there if you are staying on the Strip, but it is definitely close enough to drive.    Recommend: Yes!

Ct-UAbPYeUlRtnh92M5bwQ.text: Did some research on Yelp. Decided to give this restaurant a try. We went there around 2pm on a Monday. It's not that busy inside. They have a very big dinning area. I guess during dinner or weekend they could be very busy. As soon as we order the food. The whole course come within 3 minutes ( a order of egg rolls and 2 noodles soups). I was amaze by that. Even tho the food come so quick, you can tell it was fresh.  Their rare beef in a soup (Pho) is very tender and thin. I liked it very much.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. inside sitting area

ZwFfMPQ91R8IqFJYonz64Q.text: We ate here twice during our last stay in Vegas.  It was awesome both times.  The spring rolls were great.  Open 24 hrs and fast service.  We definitely will go back next time we are in town.  The 1st time was at 3am.  The 2nd time was at 11pm.  They were busy both times but the wait to sit was very short.  I had pad thai the 1st time.

ICEDpvuhKenDf2FBhJlHMQ.text: You can never fail with number 14 (pho with rare beef), and egg rolls. They are delicious, and all we ever order is a pho of some sort and the egg rolls.. We've ordered Chinese from here before, but it is not their forte.

sNUHPvKXFxqI8SMHuWWKCQ.text: say the name real fast three times.  Despite the name, it's good Pho.  The only problem is that it's super popular and your better expect to wait and wait.  The service is less than adequate because of the crowd.  They don't need your business and they act like it.  The food though is good -- not the best but still well prepared.  I'm spoiled by living in So Cal.  But by Vegas standards, it's a thumbs up.

Nl5GJ8aREjX_ECrd8m6Ulw.text: Cameher for dinner and walking into this place is very nice and service is good. Ordered the spring rolls which come with a sauce idk what its called but its very good and addicting. I ordered the chicken pad thai noodles and my gf ordered sweet and sour shrimp. Let me tell you the chicken pad thai was very good and flavorful. The sweet and sour shrimp was good but not my favorite. Its a little to sweet from others i have tried. But overall i will be coming back to try other items on the menu..

9EevurtGgDWEyAzQGYKksw.text: When it's cold outside, I don't need the month of May, I need some hot soup. Speedy service, reasonable pricing (under $10 for some pho and a drink), it's clean, and it's always open. The parking lot is terrible and it's only a matter of time before I get hit, but it's worth it for a nice hot bowl of Vietnamese soup.

u_YMfm7QG4-jCSjVF3n9uw.text: Great atmosphere and great food. Seated our group of 15 quite fast and easily. Definitely recommend to all.

JIAkXgDD8HY2mj8tAWWWiQ.text: Open all night, I ordered charbroiled pork chop and steamed rice. Delicious.

FWt_Iz4BuCYpK8Lpn8eQNA.text: Just a-okay for me.  Pros: Opens essentially 24 hours.  Close to strip.  Good place for some pho after clubbing.  Ambiance is cute too.  Cons:  Food was okay.  I had much better, but there stuff was edible.  Service was okay.  They messed up my order, and instead of changing it, the server asked if it was okay if I just ate it that way.  Odd, but I agreed anyways.  Price was a little much for just some a-okay food.

CgMi_PtJL3Zj6z7rHKZyWA.text: this place deserves another star, here is the reason why i only gave it 3. I ordered the pho, the broth was very tasteful and portion was "ok" i guess and they only had one size bowl, the other reason was they dont have tripe. (i love tripe,espicially with my pho) i also ordered the pork chop over rice to go, i asked the waiter if they could add 2 sunnyside up eggs with my order, waiter responded with "we dont have eggs". wtf??? no eggs?? all the pho places ive been to have tripe and eggs i dont know why this place doesnt. overall i enjoyed my meal.

pt34BWf7kqGnOaLD7Tg78w.text: This is the go to spot for late night meals when we have a rental car and cruise over to Spring Mountain.  We've probably tried it all here.  Pho, entrees, congee...never had a bad experience.   Love getting the spring rolls w/ lettuce wraps.  Not sure why more don't serve it like this w/o having to ask.  It's convenient, open all the time and hits the spot.

ACDqCRaDkwRFE3JMAr3dFg.text: Signed in (8 names deep) to wait in line because so many people and their kids come here. Didn't wait long, like 5-10 minutes. Ordered food and by the time I took a sip of water our food was out. I ordered spring rolls and a large bowl of the special pho and it was excellent. Our waitress Kelly was so nice. Definitely a place to go for Vietnamese food.

ZM8WhxAYk3nKwA6ST1Wjgg.text: Pho Kim Long is just an ok place, No good No bad. I came in late night and want some pho. The bowl look really big as the large size compare to other places.  But the broth is just blank without any original flavors. The meats were so little.   Good thing is they open 24hrs. That it. Expecting more improvement!

H1gjrCO1tABE8kE5zApiDA.text: So you want some Pho??    Pho Kim Long is open 24 hours a day and will cure your craving for pho without paying the astronomical prices on the Las Vegas Strip.  Even if you get a large bowl with extra meat, you're still looking at less than 10 bucks.  While the service is quite fast, it's not the most personable but does that really matter after a night of clubbing and being slightly less than sober?  If you're not in the mood for soup, the tender beef with black pepper sauce and broccoli is really good.  While they may not have the best pho in Vegas, they're open and it's decent.  Open matters.

T9vMmci99CDAujbRco7WQw.text: Pho Kim Long is busy during the day, but if you go in the evenings (especially after 10PM), you'll have no problem getting a seat and your food on time. One of the high points about this place is that it's open 24 hours. I have not yet discovered any other Vietnamese restaurant that is open for 24 hours, so this is a great place for those who are looking to have a filling, healthy dinner after your long night shift.   I can understand why the quality of the pho might not be comparable to some other places (the broth is a little different here than others), but the reason why I gave this place 4 stars is because I would [highly] recommend anyone to be adventurous with the menu. It's typical to order spring rolls, eggrolls, and your pho, but really... there's so much more to the menu than you think, don't be afraid, trust me!  We ordered rice, the deep fried flounder, walnut shrimp, and coconut milk to go with the meal, and it was quite possibly one of the most flavorful seafood meals I've ever had in a Vietnamese restaurant. I'm usually hesitant with seafood when it comes to restaurants that are reasonably priced and are local establishments, but I have to say the seafood here was fresh, flavorful, and filling.   The dining area is spacious, not tightly packed together, and the ambience of the restaurant is nice and cultural. Might I add they also have a little selection of liquors from their drink menu too?

jb2Zw6SpBuuGuPUPFmBb_A.text: I've been here several times and never been disappointed. The food is good and lots of variety.   Try the spring rolls and the pho for sure and asked the waiter which number is the most popular.

yf_fM5aG2UCuzxO_XcrTbA.text: 1st time was decent. We ordered com gia dinh ca kho to. Canh chua. Ga hap muoi. Not bad. But 2nd time I found menu item are limited. Not enough authentic vietnamese item for eating with white rice.

nGHaIzjcer6b9wrDgefqeA.text: The service here has got to be the worst ever! Majority of the staff cannot speak English at all. Once in the door your going to be on a wait for the longest time! At times you will get skipped and they will seat larger parties because of course the more heads the more money. As your seated you will have a server rush up to you within a few short minutes trying to rush you for an order and if your not ready they won't came back for it for the longest time. Once ordered if you did order any soups such as pho than they will have it out within a few minutes because it's the easiest to serve. So half the table will have their food and the other half won't for a good wait. After the food is dropped off you will not get any attention at all from the servers for refills or anything at all. Expect to constantly ask for whatever you need. The pho is a hit or miss, there's days that it's okay other days it's just flat out too oily. Very busy place , but way over hyped! Everyone talks about how good this place is but my personal opinion of the food here is obviously alright.

6NA55rX14GbxRrznQB7zqA.text: four stars only because the calamari is too good it's soo expensive.  i like the bbq meat and egg roll on vermicelli noodles.  my mouth is watering just thinking about it :) OH and definitely DO NOT GO ON sunday between 9am-3pm.  it's like rush hour.  we went last sunday and i couldn't even make it to the front door.  unfortunately, we left.  but it's not enough to keep me away for good

LmohAJxCj57rK5PC9_UNmQ.text: Worst service ever.....this place is open 24 hrs but if their staff is unwilling to get off their a$$es to take orders or serve food why bother staying open the whole time.  My wife and I came here in the early morning and spent most of our 2 hour meal waiting...  Next time we won't bother with ths place and try one of the other hundred or so pho places up the street.  Extra star for decent food.

q6eC0m4TuMlU-FEMEEMkMg.text: Long over due review but felt like it was time especially after my latest experience here. 2 stars for location and the fact that their open 24 hours but the service here is horrible! The pho is mediocre but they do have a wide selection of food on the menu. I have ate here probably a dozen times but the last time was the icing on the cake. My friend and I went to the cashier to pay for our bill via card and the man had the audacity to ask where the tip was...first off cash tip was left on the table but the fact that he was so rude about it I walked right over to the table and picked the tip back up. This place is clutch for late night or early pho but don't expect to be treated very nice.

D6p9LByy1vxQeJd0Juzfxw.text: My hubby came here for lunch this past weekend. He liked the food so much that he brought me back for dinner that same night. We usually go to Ping Pang Pong for Asian food. But one of his co-workers from Southwest Airlines highly recommended. The food is delicious and the service is fast. We're always looking to add good places to eat since we've been living in this "foodie" town going on 24 years. Tourist is always asking him about good places to eat and he will definitely tell many about this place. The biggest downer is the parking. It's the main reason I don't come in that right area.

y0_mgYOrR-E7GCP74ay07Q.text: Food is so terrible, keep an eye on bill, waitress is not nice. Beef is not good too. The tip that they add to the bill is so high

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food is so terrible

vffAB-LUaBGvXpMkh1bLsg.text: (Update) visited last night in family of 4. Got seated by the wall and it was super cold with direct A/C, asked for other seats with blended temperature but server said there's no other while I saw many empty tables. Anyhow our dishes of 4 got cold quickly and had to have cold stir fried rice! Wish next time this issue get fixed.   Oh my goodness! So glad we dropped by here for our lunch for the first time. Couldn't see how it looks inside from outside but once we entered, we could smell nice Phi soup smell and many people seated on their tables and busy staffs.  We ordered Vietnamese rolls came with peanut sauce and beef pho and spicy pho afterwards.  Speedy enough to get our food and as soon as we finished yummy shrimp and beef rolls, they served phos with plenty of mint, icebergs and fresh bean sprouts.  We'll love to come again when we are that a

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MEJhtHUq0rPT5bRFEbJ79g.text: Wonderful service, food arrived surprisingly fast. The #17 pho was delicious and i hope to come back soon!

mw3MPtz86jBX-95qKfUR8w.text: New favorite Vietnamese place in Vegas. Came in by chance because the Japanese place next door was closed. Bun Rieu was amazing! Best I ever had. Service was ok. Would come back again and again just for this bawl of divine crab paste

oaTB-inSNyIMXV5WLE6rxg.text: Food is good but they try to force customers to leave at least a 15% tip, regardless of their service.

ZNelYrrfaxbQNFp7hZHkTA.text: One of the best stops for good viet food in Las Vegas. My family comes here at least once during our trips. The wait is long and the parking lot is crowded mind you for a reason. The pho Dac biet is the way to go. The soup isn't that amazing but still good none the less. The noodles are awesome, I don't know how but I really can not get tired of the pho noodles they have here. The meat variety is good. The service is pretty fast once you get seated. Also I love that they ask if you want onions or not lol cause even at this age I'm a picky eater about some things hehe.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lCIrmMN7yVNyHQWfR43NGg.text: Oh man oh man! This is my go to pho spot in Las Vegas Chinatown! It's next to Lees Sandwich for my coffee for the road! Not only is it big and can accommodate large groups, the pho here is great as well! The longest I've ever waited was probably 20 mins for a table for 8 on a busy weekend!  The servers are busy but they always come by to help you and are super efficient. I usually order their Pho Tai Chin or Pho Tai, depending on whether I want the cooked beef, and boy is it good! Regardless of the large or small bowl, they give you great portions of noodles, meat, and soup so you never really run out of anything. I'm typically a glutton when it comes to soup, so I like to order the large bowl (the menu doesn't always list the large bowl, so ask if you want it!)  I haven't tried their Com Tam dishes but seeing other people's food, it looks just as tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #15 pho tai chin
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Chay (Pho Vegan)

SIwdv9EnRJ6McHaP1xSoyw.text: Everything was okay, our server came and took our orders and then the runner came and brought out our food, we where okay, however she not ones came to check on us, our water or how we were doing, but when it came time to pay she demanded 15 % tip !!! Claiming that she doesn't get pay there and she lives off her tips, and the minimum she can take is 15 %. For us it wasn't about the money but she did even provide the service. I refuse to believe her claim of not having a salary, and her actitudes was bad. I even took a picture of the recipe and how she circle the tip part.   To insure proper service = TIPS

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YKnAZEjqntOZgs-q9u_T-g.text: We came here based on the reviews and majority of the reviews were good. There were quite a few negative reviews, but I still wanted to give this place a chance.  The food was decent and the service felt uncomfortably rushed. I ordered the rice platter. To my dismay, the Vietnamese rice platter was smaller and more expensive than most other Vietnamese restaurants that I've been to.   At the end of our quick dining experience, our server handed us the check and quickly told us that "tip wasn't included" in our bill. Honestly, it made me feel very uneasy, because it was as if she assumed we weren't going to tip. Also, the check even had a guideline on what to tip... so, I didn't think it was necessary for her to tell us that the tip wasn't included.   Just saying.

HcXjQdTRi_JVKCBhxPG0Kw.text: My go to spot when I lived in vegas and now when im visiting. Vietnamese and chinese menu items so there is a little bit of everything depending on your taste. The rare steak and brisket pho is my number one option and they have multiple sizes small or large. For sides try the crab rangoon or fresh spring rolls. Service is great Jose was amazing and checked on the table multiple times. Sometimes there can be a 5-10 minute wait but thats because its always busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MWY2KGgm3Mdm1TKg_HoFHQ.text: Mediocre as f. Fried rice was bland and tasted like fish. Tofu was burnt. Overall, this is find for locals as a regular place, but I wouldn't go here if you're on vacation.

8UudmJu8XMLY5A5ADKd0tQ.text: For a family of five in town for the weekend this late night dinner ended with a BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!  Long story short, food really was just average and the service was good until the bill came and faces turned inside out.  The waitress that had been nice and helpful all night long basically told my non-english speaking father "the tip is not included, (points to the 20%option) is this okay?"  What??? I have never been asked to tip like this. Whatever she assumed where my family was from she should have never asked for tips like this. I don't care if it was late night, because we would have tipped her and the staff nicely until she obliterated the nice experience we were having.  What made this worse is when we barely stepped our foot out of the door and they didn't greet us with the same manner as when we arrived (maybe because we didn't agree to the 20%) and immediately went up to our table to see how much we tipped. We still tipped around 18%.  FFS I know you guys work hard but I would never recommend anyone to come visit your restaurant because of this type of behavior.  Hopefully you guys can understand how unpleasant this can be for a customer and improve yourselves. I really hate being treated this way and I'm sure others will too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just shrimp, noodles, and cabbage in the fillings. not worth
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NOT WORTH THE 20% TIP THR WAITRESS TRIED TO FORCE ON US

d-KDPf3Jv6ZQCvS_U-_V-g.text: Walking into this place, this place looks legit.  The menu is extensive, Vietnamese, Chinese, Thai, etc.  Service seems decent.  I ordered the pho ga soup and got a nice big bowl of it, also ordered the spring rolls.  The spring rolls were ok, nothing to write home about.  The pho was good, but again, I've had better.  On first impression, I thought this place was going to be fantastic, seemed authentic, but the food is just so so.

3tHoJ6rK6zCVAszVpQBKTg.text: Everytime I visit Vegas I have to come to this Restaurant... number 26 on the new menu.. it was 23 on the old menu..

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lNdjtx_icmhMIkhUBly0_Q.text: 1. Poor customer service 2. Food is ok at best 3. The cashier is a rude asshole 4. Took forever to get our to-go order 5. The place was really dirty  Do yourself a favor and skip this joint

FVRrmZ5PnFVUeXos84ir0g.text: Update Review NOV2017  I used to love coming to this Vietnamese restaurant whenever I visit LV.  I always look forward to eating here whenever i visit LV.  However, during my last visit, it is sad to say that the quality of food here has gone down tremendously. Not only the quality of food but the service as well.  I was fine waiting for an hour in exchange of a quality food and service, but this time everything was not how I remembered this place.   I ordered spring rolls, my usual beef stew, and beef ball pho. None of the items wowed me. The beef stew had so much tendons and meet was not cooked well (see pictures). The egg noodles were too soggy, not fresh! The spring rolls were a joke! The shrimps are so tiny and only placed on one side (see picture).  My fav Viet restos serve big rolls with big shrimps and placed on both sides of the roll.  On top of that veggie was not that fresh.  I like the peanut sauce tho! Both soups had meat that looks old (shiny surface, orange and green color), yuck!  The service, boo! Did not even check on us one bit. And they forgot my hot water request.  Ill still come back next time and try the rice dishes, since I did not  get one this time. Ill stay away from the soups!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old meat and too much tendons! Better decrease the price people!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old meat
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuck, see the meat, not cooked. This was from beef stew.

C1sqv09hVLz-2S1kQVTZkg.text: The food here is kind of good but the service is very suck.I and my family came over for lunch and there has a long line waiting outside.I dont know for what reason but the waitor is very mean when throwing the change to our face at the table after we paid.We could understand if he is busy or not intentional doing that but at least he just needs to say a simple word "sorry" then we would not be upset for that attitude.I wont come back here next time bc I know there still has another places with the good foods and better sevice than here.

wCssgpsNHf3C99e8AYrHVQ.text: Always my go to place for pho in Sunday to heal me. Service is inconsistent - some servers are suuuper nice and others, not so much. The pho dac biet here doesnt have everything like usual places do - they charge extra for meatballs and tendon.  I usually stick with the pho tai - it's not specified on the menu but you get a choice of S or L size for your bowl of pho, except for pho dac biet.  Overall, broth is pretty good for what you're paying. The fact that it's a 24 hr place also makes this place a favorite.  They will not seat you until your entire party is there! Try to get there before 12p to avoid huge parties and a long wait.

puMJd8a4COk5c1CjBN4KsA.text: Ah, Fuck Him Long. My posse's current late-night dining obsession. I am no pho expert, and as a matter of fact, I order bun and not pho, but I find this place to be only OK. On our most recent visit, our table ordered together, and my #32 didn't come until everyone was done eating and we inquired about it. It's on the pricey side for pho...most dishes around $9-12. The shrimp spring rolls are popular with my krew, as are the rolls with the shredded pork skin, but I'm not particularly fond of either, especially considering the price. Service is OK at best. Decor is nice, almost classy, even. They're open late, and they're pretty close to the freeway, which are very good things. I'm not in love with the place, but some of my more pho-knowledgeable friends are very fond of it. I'll continue to go, but I'm definitely keeping my eye out for something better, or at least cheaper.  PRO-TIP: They won't split checks, so if dining with a group, bring cash.

sZ9hC-UxTk3QVXzm_D4-OA.text: will come here every time I am in vegas. Found this place through yelp and the name made me laugh. It had a pretty good rating. So I decided to give it a try.  The place was well put together, the pho is more expensive than what i'm used to paying to back in my area, but I was not disappointed! The service was SO fast and I really liked the broth.. I ordered pho GA as usssual and I enjoyed the strips of chicken and onion and cilantro. The place was clean.. Even the bathrooms. The place closes at 3am which is pretty good time considerin it's in vegas.

uKaMiAwTSyVpI-cPoYgX6g.text: Good pho. I like the 11. Very clean. Friendly staff. The vegitables are always so fresh. I haven't really strayed far from the #11 to be honest. I love it. The prices are cheap and the quality is better than expected for how little it cost. Then again how much can broth and spouts be?  I mean really how can you go wrong with a place pronounced fu kim long?

ossjsCp0BhJxTJCCbYfbqQ.text: 2.5 stars.  Great service, semi-clean interior, minimal decorations, and decent food. Compared to LA pho, this place can't compete. It's about as good as it gets, in the desert though.   The pho broth seemed to lack a little luster, and the vegetables weren't so fresh. I didn't expect fresh sprouts, and limes in the desert though. Can you even grow fruit in Vegas?  Like everyone else mentioned, the name alone makes it worth a visit.

Avcd3vjBGKDkAt4s2OBAOw.text: if I could give a 0 star I would ! service was bad food was bad. we ordered just a basic pho with brisket we asked for extra hot broth and they said they can't do it, and then when we finally got our food the broth was lukewarm.  it took forever for them to bring out water, they threw down the bowls, it was waste of money and tip. we will never go there again.

vYr89u0bXdUHSmMD4HAWqw.text: Our go to place for Pho! Food is always fresh and hot. If we lived closer we go more often. Wish I could try the other menu items, but I alwasy give in and get the Pho. We've placed pick up orders and food is always ready within the time given. Staff is friendly and keep your glasses full.

SrDRdDpPe_ZJtVpf0bBBMw.text: Your service sucks. Even by vietnamese standards. Your host is absent minded. I had to remind me him 3 times about my party and he STILL did not write my name on the list. THEN he seated parties that came after my party. Not just a few, A BUNCH. You suck pho long. Your service blows.  You need a new host, or a better one or at least train them to not ignore your customera.  I am generally very lienient on servce at PHO joints because you get what you pay for but you service was sensationally abysmal.   Not to mention, your Pho is subpar, and the spring rolls are itty bitty.  ugh. never again.

35Y_BvWzTqidkWaNjDkGMw.text: Meh. Like some other Yelpers said, I can get better pho in SoCal. I didn't come after a night of drinking or partying, so I was of sound mind when I sat down. We visited around 9pm on a Sunday night and the place was adequately busy for a 24-hour joint. We got waters quickly and our pho came out in a matter of minutes. The broth was ok; saltier and less flavorful than the pho I've ever had before. I'm partial to deep, hearty, anise-infused broths that don't need hoisin or sriracha for enhancement. Needless to say, I was let down. On the bright side, I was happy to find something 5 minutes away from the strip, even if it's located in a strip mall decorated by a fake Chinatown facade.   Two stars for the pho, but I thought the service was fine and the bathroom was surprisingly not filthy.

zAkXUURET1iwNdsNZgT17A.text: Pho Tai #14 was great!  Spring roll #1 was average.  Thai tea was good.  Service was fast and efficient.

-PitzT97kb8OOe2L20sHqg.text: Come for the name, stay for the pho.  I was pleasently surprised by FHL...I mean PKL.  At first I refused to come here based solely on the name, but after my girlfriend's cousin (who's a local) swore up and down that this was the best Pho in town, I relented.    Surely this is better than any of the Pho I've had in DC, though curiously, the best pho I've ever had was in my home town of Syracuse, NY, not the most cosmopolitan place, I know.  Maybe I am only rating it so high because it totally beat all my expectations, maybe there are better places in Vegas, but I will say I throughly recommend Pho Kim Long.

2SNJ_FjOTu_mC0y22L3Z6g.text: I walked in with a friend and the first thing I smell is windex. No, not from the glass door. More like they replace the air-refreshener refills with blue windex liquid. I haven't tried their Chinese cuisine. Their pho is okay. Not enough noodles.  Oh yeah, the tables can be quite sticky. Service is really lacking here. I haven't gone back since and I don't think I will.

IBMUoTHeBjHBgem7h-oOeA.text: super packed but worth the weight. best PHO i have EVER had.

XwXYljQt-t2eZ3vVQnZ-bg.text: Craving pho after a club in vegas.. This is the place to be.. A bit pricey for Pho but it's late and your hungry then its amazing. Especially having a 24 hours viet place.

t-9nPUkJzSut-ILKcUojwA.text: Great late night Chinese and Vietnamese place in Vegas.  Got into town at close to midnight and my friend suggested this place.  Its in the Chinatown area off the strip not to far from the Rio hotel.  Knew it would be good, being one of the few white people in the place and it did not disappoint.  Had their BBQ pork appetizer which was great, good quality.  Then had a couple of beef dishes, Mongolian beef and the cubed beef.  Both great.  Place got the food out pretty fast too.  This place makes great Chinese food, definitely worth leaving the strip for.  The pho is supposed to be awesome and I plan on having that next time.

avzUFuZQrMWEs3c3NHYArg.text: Place is not that big but the service is super speedy and we ordered and our stuff was out within 10 minutes.  Plus side its open 24 hours!!

F8OVYVB-kigMPVJ9nqdRWg.text: the food is very good. we always order the fried calimari, a must have.... service can be spotty but still a great place to eat.

_fQASb9RZqR3dfL2zXg2cw.text: This was my first Pho experience and I certainly did like it.  I am glad that I went with the small bowl as it was quite large, in my opinion. I found the broth to be very flavorful and it was awesome to sample a new kind of food. There are a lot of other options on the menu which the whole table can share to supplement the pho selections.  Though I have nothing to compare the food to, this being my first experience and all, I can't imagine that other places could be much better.  I certainly recommend this place and the service was excellent.

iNhlUOwZO9vV4gm4mrsTNg.text: love love love it! my husband i and i eat here often and although we frequent other Pho places here in Vegas, Pho Kim Long is the best. The atmosphere is great, the food is fresh, and delicious. There is definitely an authentic feel to the restaurant, and we often get some looks from the usual guests (we are usually one of the handful of non-vietnamese speaking patrons). Highly recommended. Try the pho: noodle soup, and the vermicelli: cold noodles, and the egg rolls are delish!

XxjwMGRfYSQHFqDnPaJzwg.text: Ate there last night and they treated us sooo poorly. I have never experienced such poor service. The waiters did NOT acknowledge us and kept ignoring us if we needed something... Even after eye contact. Multiple waiters were doing the same to us. At check out, we got DISRESPECTED by the so called restaurant owner... He refused to help us figure out our bill as it was being split into two orders. We asked if we could barrow their calculator and he says we have to use our own and figure it ourselves and then he answers the phone and completely ignores us. We got upset at him, and he CAUSED us out! Of course we were causing back to depend ourselves but then he called security like we were some animals. This was the worse place I have ever been too.

kZswT7Rl8IsXsXnVXk2uew.text: Good spot for Pho and Asian food near the strip.  I have eaten here a half a dozen times; sober, faded and hungover and it always delivers.  Today our Server Jose had our order out in 5 minutes flat and had our cab called and waiting 5 minutes after we were done eating.  The service can be uneven at times but never as bad as some reviews for us.  The experience today was exceptional and exceeded my expectations.

sVknKjCmdAqCIp5u2Ks_wA.text: Just ate here less than 30 minutes ago. VERY disappointed. Terrible service and even worse employees.  The ONLY reason I'm giving them a one-star rating is because I can't give them any lower.  Went with my family, I ordered a plate of chicken wings, they ordered some other stuff. Fast forward, everyone else has their food, I assume that my wings are taking long because they have to fry them up, sounds reasonable right?  We ask them where my wings are and they say they're coming, and I don't wanna be THAT guy who keeps asking where his order is, so I continue waiting.  Fast forward again, everyone is done eating, my wings are nowhere to be found, so we ask them about it again. Turns out they didn't even start working on the wings until that moment, the SECOND time we had to ask them about it.  So because we're fed up of waiting and I'm tired from a whole day of driving, we tell them to just cancel the wings.  Seconds later, guy comes out to my table with a plate of wings, so we figure since they're out, we'll just pay for them and take them to-go. Nope, cashier gets defensive and very RUDELY tells us we can't buy the wings anymore, tells his waiter to go grab the plate right as I'm about to grab a wing.  Never coming here again, and definitely WOULD NOT recommend this place to anyone else.  If you're in the Las Vegas area and looking for some great Vietnamese cuisine (I would know, I'm Vietnamese), I'd recommend you SKIP this place, and take the time to drive a little further down the road (same street actually), and eat at Pho So 1 (literally translated as #1 Pho) instead.  (Editing for formatting to make it easier to read)

fMd47ZLQLb9hC1Edsr9b0w.text: Craving for pho and saw this on Yelp so we came here.  We were seated right away upon arrival.  Service is friendly.  Ordered special pho and rare meat pho.  We also ordered fried chinese donut $3.25.  Hot coffee with condense milk $3.75.  Bought to go stirred fried rice noodle and beef.  Food was average good.  Restaurant looks relatively clean and spacious.  Plenty of parking in this plaza.  Price is average as well.

Y88k_yYA_PIYEtLjoWiXjQ.text: I come to this place and order food to go about 4-5 times a month. Around 3ish and whenever i wait for my food it takes about 40minutes to 1hour to get my food when not much traffic going on. The cashier are not welcoming. This time he didn't give me a heads up about the wait time until i said about my food and said to me " i told you about 30 more minutes.

ZtDo_aw85CDU-mYJXi0cug.text: Wow! Great overall experience. Place was packed but service was very fast. I was seated within 5 minutes and got my combination Pho 6 minutes after ordering. Combination pho had thin sliced beef beef, brisket, tendon and meat balls. I wish there was tripe in it too but that's just me. Broth was flavorful and just hot enough for a chilly day. Would definitely go again. Next table over had spring rolls and shrimp summer rolls which looked good. Def try that next time I go which is hopefully soon. Must try.

VxXdsk1G8Qu8byNKSWmEbw.text: If I can rate this a half of star o would.  and very poor service I felt harassed going there and being a first time customer. We ordered our food didn't get our drinks Till way later. And when I ask when our drinks were coming I received a rude face.  After about15 mins our food came our but the the timing was reasonable but the food was the wrong order once again me and my wife received rude faces for telling them it isn't what we ordered. Food was alright. I guess it taste better when your drunk that's when there most busy I heard late nights after hours. Ordered spicy food everything was planned. The food was not good. Horrible service and way over priced.  But that's not all. Once we're finished. I asked a worker if we could get to go boxes. Once again another rude face and this is no lie.  We were every uncomfortable.  After we cleaned up we went to pay and the cashier then harassed us about leaving a tip. I said no thank you and he look angry and he asked " What you mean no tip??" And I told him are you question why he's said "yes was it bad service did you not enjoy the food because if that's the case I don't think you should come back". Very shocking I said really you would go to a restaurant get bad service and bad food and leave a tip and he stayed quit. Then he begins yelling in the restaurant " thanks for not leaving a tip" I yelled back thanks for the horrible food and service.  How rude was that very bad. Horrible I high recommend you take you and your family somewhere else. Horrible place and he's right I won't be going back!!! Stay away

nmq03aNOEIqUZQnT5JL7HA.text: I've been coming here for a few years now but my last experience here was horrible! I will NEVER go back. I was confused on an item on the menu which I frequently order there which usually everyone understands what I want but this time I was being helped by the "OWNER" who completely lashed out on me giving me the biggest attitude because his menu wasn't up to date and I was confused about the item I was looking to get. Long story short he raised his voice at me and made me feel like a complete idiot. I don't know if he was having a bad day but that was so rude of him. You'd think the owner would be more polite and professional absolutely terrible customer service skills.

Y6LS0tjae0TVYi-sN_6nag.text: The place seemed really busy, but luckily we were seated fast. The water didn't taste right, you could tell it was tap water. The food wasn't all that great... me and my friends ordered the beef ball pho with rare steak on the side, and my boyfriend ordered the pork chop. The pho was warm but not hot enough to cook my bean sprouts or the rare steak. The beef balls didn't taste cooked all the way, sorry to say but that was the worst pho I've ever tasted. My boyfriends pork chop wasn't as flavorful either. We came here because it was closer to where we were at the time, I've tasted better pho.

jPpkHNLhjrQdCfFLxI6vfw.text: We came here for a late lunch/early dinner on Sunday evening around 5:30 PM.  Our flight came in around 4:45 PM and we were all super hungry.  We went out searching for a Vietnamese restaurant that my cousin's wife said she really enjoyed on their last trip here, but neither of them remembered the name nor the exact location so we ended up here.  I ordered the bun bo hue and I assume mine must have been the best because everyone else had a complaint about their order.  I thought the bun bo hue was ok, not great.  I asked for shredded cabbage and they didn't have any.  How can they not have cabbage?  The three people who had pho said that it had too much MSG so their stomach felt funny afterwards.  Auntie Bev had pan fried noodles with seafood and she said her dish didn't have much flavor.  The last few times I came here was because they were the only place opened after 2 AM, so I didn't set any expectation.  How did they get named best restaurant in Las Vegas?  I would never know...

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vParwe6bB1oGKwCUCQXFaw.text: These scumbags expect a tip for TAKEOUT and will put in your number as "BAD" and won't answer your calls if you didn't tip for takeout! As far as I know this is the only joint in America that expects a tip for pickup orders. I actually tipped them for over two years for pickup. One time I didn't tip and they put me in as "BAD" and stopped taking my calls.  I always got #24, the chicken Vermicelli and I can tell you they don't make it fresh. It's always cold. They make the ingredients at some point during the day and then just throw them together as orders come in. Don't get me wrong, it was still good enough for 4AM when most places are closed which is why I kept coming back. But they can go screw themselves now.

ZaBYNmpq2hvYkc9kxqXSlQ.text: The place was pretty busy for a Wednesday night especially since we arrived after midnight. We walked in and waited at the front for like 10 minutes before someone even noticed us, still no biggie I'm sure they were very busy. We were seated and a girlfriend of mine and I decide to split a dish. We order the number 66 which is a noodle dish with chicken. Well our meal comes out and it looks NOTHING like the photo. So when our waiter came and asked how everything was, I was honest and said I was hoping to get this (pointing to picture) not this (pointing to my plate). He then goes and gets the manager. And this asshole comes over and tries to convert me to eat the meal. He asked what was wrong, And I explained and said if it's a big deal just forget it but I was wondering if I can trade this for a chicken pad thai instead. He then asks me to eat a piece of chicken and noodle, and I said well, it just doesn't look appetizing to me and I would rather not. But he insisted, getting more and more impatient. I hesitated for a good couple seconds before succumbing to this awkward situation and ate a piece of chicken and noodle for his pleasure while everyone at my table stared at me. I then told him I still didn't like it and would like a pad Thai instead. And he finally removed the dish. And they brought my pad Thai which was much better and the only reason why I'm giving them 3 stars. The Food is good, and if you don't mind impatient, patronizing staff, you will get what you pay for, maybe... IF i come back, it will only be to get the pad Thai. Since I now know that it lives up to its photo and description on their menu.

mUlPnSQMLa8JfYyQIFFK9w.text: Great Pho Tai. Fast, pleasant service. Authentic!  Second time to Vegas, second time here. One of my favorite Pho places from San Diego to Vancouver.

hqOvr_aUcOp7Ayom1-lzfA.text: This place is family friendly, quick, and delicious! Staff is very nice. Portions are big and prices are good! Definitely a go to for Pho!!

oEBA2tqqktDt6kFO6DWf_g.text: Pho was great and rolls were on point!  Wait kinda sucked tho... can't beat pho on a cold day.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho was great! But the wait sucked. Eggrollls were on point!

dTwS5c55LyQQwbA81_-egg.text: This is my GO-TO place when it comes to pho. fast and friendly service and the food is delicious. The place can get packed during Primetime, but busy is good! That just means there's others that really enjoy this place.

K-16kVRwGYHzEdk_AVRG_g.text: I wanted something clean and broth. It's one of the only few places open early on Sunday. It was full too. I had the pho ga and the broth was a little light. The chicken was also tasteless. I didn't think it was too good. The only good thing about it was, it was a lot of noodles and the bowls are big.  But then again, it's a little pricier. They also have a wide variety of different Asian foods, Chinese, Thai, etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GPwYg8fuO35-aPvSzoKO9g.text: I used to come here all the time. I would always get the pho and calamari.   The only downfall of this place is that the customer service sucks. Right when you get your food they never come back to check up on you to see if you need anything else. - 1 star  Also, one of the main servers there is disgusting. It's the guy with the mean face and glasses. I went to the bathroom and I noticed he was there. When he was done he didn't wash his hands! As I came out right after him I noticed he was serving people right away. Disgusting.... - 2 stars

oG2-DgAxyF47WsVgfHxT-Q.text: never eat in this restaurant, if you do not want to poison. After I ate the PHO soup in this disgusting restaurant, after half an hour, I was already writhing with pain in my stomach and went to the doctor. NEVER go back to this nasty restaurant.

SMsZEBtdMOhgmchnhtupMg.text: Good service: fast, got water refills, Food: good portion: Crispy Calamari appetizer good for 3. Food is good not great

Bwf5ACRZKQmNBuK6J5bZ1Q.text: We came after the clubs and this place was still busy! And i know why!! This place is soooo good! I was do down to come back the nxt day haha The EGGROLLS were soo crispy and delicious, esp when you wrap it in the lettuce and carrots and dip it in the vinegar sauce. I mean DUNK IT!!  hahah   I ordered the CHICKEN VERMECELLI and I thought it was sooo GOOOD!!  The chicken was alright, I would get the beef next time, but omggggg! Their vermecelli was probably the most tastiest vermecelli I have ever had! The dish tasted fresh like it was just made and it prob was! The pho was questionable. I'm not a big fan of pho but one of my friends said it was okay and one of my other friends thought it was sooo good she was down to go back too! haha  I LOVE VIETNAMESE FOOD :))

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u8NMVY9gtgb2QqUsnWZ6-Q.text: TLTR:(Guy at register tried to pressure me into paying more tip than I wanted, I refused , Jerk berates and harassed me and my family as we walk out, yelling things across the room).  Me and my wife had been going to this place to eat with our family about once every two months for years, But never again. On our second to last visit the cashier/manager     ( whom some other reviewers have posted pictures of)     insisted that I give 10% tip I usually give a bit below that     (I know it's not a great tip, but if you have ever been served here then you know their service is bad they do the bare minimum and most of the time with a bad attitude but we had overlooked that because the food was decent)    That time I caved and gave the tip the guy insisted on.  I left the place very unhappy. But desided to give the place the benefit of the doubt .. fast forward a couple of months to this morning, and I'm there again with my family. But this time I'm determined to only give the tip I want not what the cashier/manager demands. So I go to pay and again the guy insists I give a larger tip than what I want. I insist I only want to give what I want. We go back and forth a bit until the guy finally caves. That's when the jerk follows me to my table where my family is waiting for me, he proceeds to yell out to the servers near us what my bill was and how much I tipped! Very rude.. I tell my wife lets get out of here. Then to top it of as we are leaving he yelled something at me from a across the room.. my wife noticed and she went over to the register and told the guy that what he was doing was very unprofessional and that if that is how he treated his customers. He could not care less and was very cocky about the whole thing. Safe to say we are never going back there again. I have no problem with a mandatory gratuity fee for parties over a certain size as long as you are notified beforehand .. but this place try's to muscle/con you out of your money. This guy thinks he can act like this with no consequences but I got news for you buddy keep acting like this and it won't be long before customers start abandoning this place in droves like we have.. there are to many good restaurants in Vegas to be putting up with that kind of shit.

BY3tozTTQEtN8TdSBCGuDA.text: This place never disappointed me. Fast service and the waiter reply to your need fast and very friendly. The good is great and everything clean. Every time I'm here and craving for Pho this place is my first to go.

UBEAdkMmTyteNacu9SeEPw.text: This is my go to Pho place in Vegas.  I've tried some other items besides the Pho such as the roast duck and BBQ pork, and I suggest that if you want that just go to a place that specializes in it. But if at 4am you're craving some pad thai, roast duck, and calamari rings then this place has you covered.  They do have some pretty tasty items such as the salt and pepper calamari, spring rolls and egg rolls. But the main star here is the Pho, I like to get it with brisket and flank.  I've read other's reviews about this place and one of them gave a 1 star for terrible food and poor service. Which I'll admit, a few times I've come in and they weren't on their game with the broth, or I've experienced somewhat terrible servic. But that's because usually it's packed and people are just waiting to get a table and with a full house, it can get crazy for the staff.  I've been coming here for a long time now, and overall for the price and taste, it's great in your stomach and easy on the wallet.  Side note! Pho will cure your hangover. My buddy and I had ours cured, results may vary though from person to person.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What lurks beneath these hot treacherous waters?!  Noodles, just plain old rice noodles.

jh4hJgTMGibzdcqVOYhkSg.text: Location: strip mall west of the strip on Spring Mountain Road  Parking: ample outdoor parking but spaces are tight  Description: Vietnamese by name, but majority of menu items are Chinese sprinkled with some Thai dishes  Service: expedient service, polite, most of the staff speak excellent English, staff is knowledgeable of the menu  Quality: slightly above average: egg rolls below average due to lack of flavor and small size; pork chop was overcooked but the staff replaced the dish and it tasted great and the egg cake was perfect; vegetable dish was overpriced but tasted good; pho was perhaps too spicy and the beef was a bit overcooked  Environment: 24 hour restaurant, extremely busy and moderately noisy restaurant, expect a short wait, clean   Value: good--the same dishes are 25 percent less expensive in Los Angeles  Diagnosis: probable return visit

wi3s29q4i17qnLk1Xe91mw.text: Ordered delivery via Postmates. Items ordered: chicken lettuce wraps, drunken noodles, & shrimp fried rice. Order was all correct and arrived promptly. The lettuce wraps were the stand out... Excellent! They will be on my future must have list! The rice was pretty bland by Itself... Needed a lot of help from sauces. The noodles were good  but not something I would order again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie drunken noodles &amp; shrimp fried rice

9fa7tBAqp5y0jEGa7_u4cA.text: We went on a Thursday night from the strip around 745pm and were surprised to find a wait. Turns out this spot is a huge local favorite. We waited about 25 minutes for a table but once we were seated it only took a few minutes to order and probably about five more minutes to receive our food. We both got beef Pho. I had the Pho Dac Biet (beef combo) which was plentiful and very flavorful. One of the better broths I have ever had. The restaurant is large with plenty of seating plus they're open 24 hours. I certainly will be returning.

olW5Jo8Lil9uOan3yw278A.text: Came here at around 1-2am because husband was hungry and they were one of the restaurants that was still open in Vegas at the time.  Line was long when we got there; the hostess seemed very annoyed with all the customers and she didn't smile or even bother to greet us. When it was our turn, she just led us to the table and threw the menu on the table and left. Waited some time before a server came to take order and haha... another one who's annoyed by overwhelmed traffic.  We ordered fried tofu, spring rolls, whole coconut and two Bun Bo Hue; food came out fairly quickly but the quality wasn't as good as I expected it, well, when I compare to what we usually have here in the South Bay. I did like the fried tofu and coconut and that's why I'm keeping two stars here; however, the spring rolls was not fresh and the soup base for their Bun Bo Hue was so bland, it didn't have pork blood or beef/brisket in them either.   Will not recommended until you're dying of hunger.

l11tfjCy57FqkdAYfmyMdQ.text: I heart this place for Bfast.  Pho Kim long is perfect for late night munchies BC they never close.     There was only few other customers dinning early am. My order rare beef with a order of added meat balls arrived asap. The the fresh mints, sprouts and jalapeno made my pho yummy on a cold morning.  Another plus is they take credit cards with no minimum so I'll  certainly return here for bfast for the convenience.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare beef &amp; meatballs pho

Ab6o6etFAv516zrrCa_MjA.text: This is one of my favorite places to get Chicken Pad Thai in town. It is delicious! I get low heat and they never botch it up. Parking can be a drag especially during the evening or weekends and it is located in China Town. This is one of the places I recommend to people when were out and wanting to have good food. Hat's off the the chef! Thanks :)

cE2qeBHLPzwk6wEUH2xYUw.text: Waited for a long time to be seated. When finally seated and trying to enjoy our dinner, the bus boy and waiter keep bugging us to leave tips either on credit card or in the table. Left a good $22 dollars tip cash on the table. Finally when ready to pay our bills, the waiter took my card and bill and then returned by the Hispanic bus boy. I asked him if everything is done he replied to me yes. Come to find out when my friend is walking out, they hold him and claimed that we didn't pay the bill. It was poor service and this restaurant is run by hogging tips bus boy and waiters. They gave my card back with running it for the charge. Stop begging for tips and produce quality service and you don't have to remind your customer to leave tips..

gPIGweXCddcv_zNDDEGBvA.text: This is probably one of the most packed Vietnamese restaurants. Almost always a line. Located right next to lees sandwiches. It serves a great bowl of pho!

hUbS8rNixSAgkuiISv-RXg.text: We gave this place another chance by taking our friends there this time. N the same stupid Server served us. "HUE" THIS TIME SHE DID IT AGAIN! she told our friend the same thing N point it at the suggested % tips. He went pay it with his card N will leave a CASH TIPS  FOR HER. I WAS pissed because she did it again with us so I took the receipt  N go talk to the cashier guy.  I asked if I can talk to the owner or the manager there. But in that meanwhile that girl HUE was there too N she was going through some of the receiptS there .I didn't think anything of it. During that moment the server HUE went back to our table  N LOOK AT THE TIPS N WENT  WENT BACK TO THE CAHSIER N GET THE CREDIT CARD RECEIPT N show my husband N our other 8 people that were THERE N circle the tips part N said   The bill is not going to close out until the percentage of tips should be pay.."
