XTx43piXVAYJ5ZQEO-hRag.text: Not sure why this place has bad reviews! The food was amazing and it was sooo busy at 2 am! We had a wait outside, although we only waited 20 minutes, it was totally worth it. Get the Mongolian beef, it's excellent and obviously the Pho!!

tWGwXi6PzjOdatqlDEEhTA.text: Just like its name, you'll have to wait for a phoking long time. So apparently they cannot sit a party of 6 on a table for 10 people. They're only available for party of 7-10. There were only 2 tables with 6 seats so you're telling me that only 2 parties of 6 can ever eat there at a given time???   And also the ones that were eating on the table with 6 people were parties of 2...  You guys can do better

LMPLkQbw6Lw1PgnK4WY5Hg.text: I love the food here. It's good and affordable. I also love the to-go service--it's so impersonal that you never have to feel guilty about not tipping.

vygrisakSNlZo7eH6C-wJw.text: Pho is one of the best In Las Vegas in my opinion but the service could be a little slow but I understand that they're are really busy at certain times. Best part about this place is that it's open 24/7.

cQXij4ql9J52w-vfs2_llA.text: One of the worst tasting pho I've had. Not only is the food bad but the service is poor as well particularly from the male server who doesn't speak Viet too well.

I4sF7n3T3Oe3rYavpdNtVw.text: Holy crap is this THE worst freaking restaurant to go to. Everyone is incredibly rude. If I were drunk, this place would probably be good. Unfortunately our server Hai, could give 2 craps about us. Thank you for showing us and our friends a tour of Chinatown in Vegas. I've lived here for several years and the service has only gotten worse.   The food is subpar. Add customer service to it and your have a D- restaurant ! I'm normally not here to give bad judgements on ANY businesses but as I'm sitting here writing this review at 2:27am I can't help but to be influenced by the inspiring servers here. Thank you for letting me realize why I don't come here.

48HGwD-woMD3CLQXzZQETg.text: Service is slow and they are pretty busy. Maybe understaffed? But I'm sadden by this visit. My bf and I visited once before 2 years ago (We live in Hawaii) and had a good experience that's why we decided to come back. But this visit made us leave in disappointment.   First, we came inside and it was busy. No one at the front to greet or no sign that says "please sign in" (last time we came someone was at the front) of get our waters till about 10'mins later. After I had to ask them to take our order.

tVJWijJQS8Q0_xYLhFoAtA.text: Food was great- Visiting Vegas with a group of 9 - The majority of our group was Vegan and everyone was very happy with the food and selections.  Can't beat the prices!

-upgW1PkvbDv3yBARSGqeg.text: SERVICE SUCKS SO MUCH, I'M NOT EVEN SURE WHY THIS PLACE GETS SO BUSY.  This place is supppper popular. I've been here a few times and I'm not sure why I do. I can't put into words how the service sucks.  The first time I was here, my family and I were seated in the back corner. Workers and waiters went back and forth our table but never paid attention. I mean we were obviously in the corner, but seriously.. what the hell? We got our food and all and then my sister felt sick. Instantly, she blacked out and my mom hurried and ordered a lemon soda to help her. It took forever to come and none of the waiters cared. I mean, even customers walking by the go to the restroom saw her unconscious and asked if she was okay. Such workers..   Food wasn't even great. The pho was watery and the bun bo hue was bland. I did enjoy my Rotisserie Chicken though but it's so not worth my time waiting and not worth my time dealing with the workers.   Second time I came here, and OH MY GOSH... bad bad bad. My family was separated into two tables. I mean that's fine with us. The other table had 4 adults and were seated and served immediately. Like I mean they got the food before my table ordered fast.. In my table had 3 adults and 4 kids. I guess we looked like teenagers and so this was where the service began sucking. We flagged down at least 4 workers to take our orders. While taking our orders, the man was being so fucking rude. Excuse my language but I'm pretty sure it's because we looked young. Our food took awhile to get to us too.. the other table were done eating and my cousin didn't even get her food yet. It was reallllly bad. They also gave the other table their check too. I'm sure everyone knows what it means when the restaurant gives you your check right? It's the universal language to LEAVE. Uhhh why would they pay and leave if more than half their party was still eating? Like what? Then they got mad because my aunt questioned it. I can't express how rude and uncomfortable we felt. I knew they were annoyed so honestly one more gesture or request would result in them spitting into our food.   IT TOOK FOREVER TO GET OUR CHANGE BACK. I am one to never leave less tip but I can't help but tip them bad. Honestly, this place needs a reality check. I'm really curious why they're so packed all the time.  Parking can be a bitch as the parking is shared amongst several other restaurants and stores.  SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.

z6hd-vSQLqFOMkgrmTBGrQ.text: I'm here at least once a week. Its usually where I go after a long night of clubbing or when the weather is crap and you need some good soup.   It's open 24/7 so its convenient. The service is always speedy but my orders are always correct so I have no complaints!

jqHYWItZGz222mfzcESh1w.text: There's always a line here unless you come visit during the non-peak months. If you come passed dinner time, there's a shorter wait. I always get the pho ga (chicken pho) and is one of the best I have ever had. The soup is delicious and noodles seem very fresh. I can tell when the noodles have been old and makes it break easy. I also tried the chicken pad thai but it wasn't as good. The sauce was too heavy and real greasy. I think I'll only love the phos here!

eSAOUTV50x-Ct9KZqf-uRg.text: This being Vegas, and if you've had too much to drink, you might think this place is equivalent to one of those post cards they hand out on the strip with a sexy girl on it wearing a skimpy outfit, with her phone number (696-9696) ready for you to call her for a "date".   After all, with a name like Pho Kim Long, you might think this is the Las Vegas Chinatown equivalent to the Chicken Ranch.   You might also forget that you have already slurped on the savory dishes here.   Pho Kim Long is a popular Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of Chinatown. It is very large, and at lunch there are at least 10 people working here, doing a brisk business. The food is solid but not spectacular. The menu is very extensive, the ambiance clean, upscale and modern, and the service is very good. Prices are a little more than you are used to in California's Viet hot spots.   They do have a lounge adjacent to it now, which I haven't tried yet. Maybe it is a Viet Cafe or classic Viet men's lounge? It might be closer to the sound of the name sake, Pho Kim Long, at least in some parton's minds.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YSMgbDlopsV9qN4owbuV4Q.text: My experience at this restaurant and there customer service is the worst ever. My family an I decided to have dinner here on a busy night we had our baby stroller and since the restaurant was busy they asked if they could put our stroller away. When I left I completely forgot about the stroller and immediately called and they said they would put it aside so I could pick it up tomorrow.  The next day I come to pick up my stroller they said that someone has already came in to pick it up and that it's not there fault the stroller was left there and it was out of there hands. The manager Ken was very rude and said sorry but there's nothing he can or will do about it. Be advise make sure do not leave your personal belongings because even if they do find or have it there big chance you may not get it back.

sIOSqhXRrlik3BFq2jT9Uw.text: Been to vegas twice and always came here for lunch :) i know its always busy but theres something that made you keep coming back

WE-ISsSZ-OFNlDwaxtRtoQ.text: So convenient to have this place open 24/7. I freaking love this place. My bf brings me to all the good places here in vegas, and this is my place for pho! It sucks it's all the way across Vegas to get to though, but it's totally worth it!  I usually get the combination pho, and you get a plate of sprouts, lime and mint leaves on the side so you can add as much as you like. I wish they had more options like a seafood combination pho like the pho place I used to go to when I lived California, but this place will do. Coming from the Bay Area, you have an array of Vietnamese restaurants that are bomb. This place came close, but no cigar. That's why this place didn't get 5 stars because I have tried better, and once you get a taste of the good stuff, none can compare. Also, the staff aren't welcoming, and I always feel rushed to order something when the waiter takes our orders, but eh. Whatevers.

U0GTkIHWKaIYeb0P9AeMpA.text: Been here a few times and as of last weekend, I won't be coming back. The Pho doesn't taste THAT great anymore (or maybe I just have to be drunk to enjoy it) and the service was rude and rushed. .. Would rather pay $20 for a bowl of Pho on the strip.

J-bIJgPQ2lC_5AIADehBFQ.text: I used to go to this place before it was popular. I went there before all the fish tanks and nice floors and what not. Seriously when they first started out they had missing squares in the ceiling. No problem the food was very good and I loved that they were 24hrs. The first Vietnam soup house in town to go 24hrs before others and now I see others staying open till 3am.  My problem with them that sent me over the top was for only 2 dollars. I was kinda upset with them anyway since they got so popular that they did not care about the locals anymore like in years past. So my problem was about the charge for meat on the side. I asked my server and the cashier before I asked for meat on the side like I always do and they promised me that I would not be charged. I get the bill and ofcourse they charge me for it. Now the manager is a bit rude to me and says that it is listed right on the menu in small print. I agree with that after seeing it and only complain that 2 of your employees said I would not be charged. He refused to take the 2 dollars off of my bill and I was furious. I paid with my CC which was the smartest thing I did.   I disputed the charge on my CC account and Pho Kim Long did not dispute. So they ended up paying for my last meal which was nice but I really do not understand why a business would risk my loyalty for 2 dollars. I remember when meat on the side and a side bowl of broth was free but they got a little too big and greedy for my patronage.  I used to bring all my family and friends over there on a regular basis but not anymore. My 2 top choices for Pho now in the city is Pho Saigon on the top of the hill on spring mtn first, but they close at 10pm. My second choice is the first one I ever went to which is beside the big lots on the corner or Spring Mtn and Decatur, another Pho Saigon 1.  The best is when I make this soup on my own. It has taken a few years to get it right but now it only costs me $1.75 for a bowl of Pho with Beef and Noodles. Ofcourse the Vietnam Coffee that I make costs only pennies compared to the usual 3 dollars any other place charges.

6t_yySafJ_pY5_2_C33Cqw.text: fast and reliable, always open and definitely the place to be for a late night bite, good prices and usually fast service, this place is a win

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kiczmC-F_b4zuM28mVHPxA.text: I'm a frequent visitor of Pho Kim Long but they're not normally my go-to spot. The convenience of being open 24 hours is typically what wins me over.   I am deeply addicted to the eggs rolls. Those lettuce wrapped egg rolls do it in for me all the time! My girlfriend usually gets the pho. I'm not a fan of pho so this review is not for the pho alone. I've had the duck a few times here and it's a hit or miss. I'll either get all bone or all skin.   The service is less than mediocre. You wait to be seated and the second you're seated you're rushed to put in your drink order. The second your drinks arrive they pressure you to put in your food order. It can get a tad uncomfortable.

qtWupm_3wvr3aKguUTqJwQ.text: After 24 hours of no sleep, extreme heat exhaustion, excessive drinking, and nonstop partyin', my poor soul was in dire need of some TLC.   Pho seemed like perfect cure of my Vegas inflicted bodily abuse. My bf and I stumped in red eye and delusional around 11:30 pm on a Sunday night. The house was almost 80 percent full but we were promptly seated. Here is what we ordered:  1. Spring rolls with no pork: I love these. Slightly smaller, but flavorful with sweet tender shrimp and the obligatory peanut dipping sauce. My bf wasn't too please but then again, he might have been eating in his sleep.  2. Pho with flank and rare steak: The broth is the winner hear, flavorful and oily. The meat and noodle was standard. Nick said he prefers more and better meat, but I was more than pleased with the noodle and broth.   3. Lots, lots, lots, of water.  Everything totaled around $21.00. A cheap and good quality meal considering it's Vegas.

fKfGJt8BWMMmuryo9hjHbA.text: A nice place to have late night dinner. The funny thing we encounter is karaoke. We were laughing so loud we thought they will kick us out. The lady wasn't a good singer but she really tried.  The food was OK, nothing special we could remember.

xIM2_nMVjhJIMwTwcbVmNg.text: Open Late lots of seating. Fast service. Good Pho. Cant complain. Hits the spot!

MGNR11IbyNPpIOdRsaVl4g.text: Aside from an interesting name, there isn't much else reason to come here. The food is pretty average. It comes out quick and the service is nice. Cheap food option outside of the strip.

6vb6cImSpe6siD6aauftog.text: Awesome place.  Every time I'm here the service is to notch. The food is always delicious. Always recommend this place.  It's open 24/7 too.

QhrkZ8EjcfLTjw8_4QzFKg.text: My friend and I came here at 4am or so and we got the table real fast, then we got our order taken but then my coke/Pepsi came but then my friend ordered water, so we have to ask for that, then egg roll came in but the sauce came a minute after then my food came and hers too but no utensils then we have to wait and catch the server and ask again like it wasn't that busy I mean if they're short staff like what everyone is going to use as an excuse but come on the water is there and of course common sense utensils I mean how we going to eat without it smh .. Then I thought about it I'm not leaving tips usually I leave like 20% of service but it sucks so it's whatever then when I went to pay it I gave 52 bucks coz the total was 42bucks and the cashier didn't give back my change so I have to ask for it .. I mean it's rude not to give back your change without asking and it's by choice if you wanna leave tips but since it's bad service enough and esp this happened I really don't go to this place but I gave it a chance and they blew it so I'm not coming back anytime soon or forever lol smh ..

Xbz4pS7IR9fUSIZdGFjAkw.text: When the weather is getting colder, I come here to have dinner with family. They have one of the best pho in town. I had my first pho back in Sacramento, introduced by my hmong friends. Eating here reminds me of my 2nd home. I miss cali.

hLygMF28c26IMMiXsLp7kg.text: Terrible food squalid atmosphere bad service, one of the unhappiest eating moments that I can remember dirty, bad and too expensive for what it is, I hope not to get food poisoned or a worm of some sort

Kay9rIsDbRG0CAislq0nIg.text: Probably my favorite place to go for Pho. I especially love that this place is open 24/7!   It can get busy at different times during the day, but the service is always very good, considering.  I always order the Pho Ga, for the pure simplicity & deliciousness of it ;) I have tried other things on the menu as well, but this is the dish that gives me the warm & fuzzies. Imagine consuming a bowl of hugs & that is what this dish is for me.  Anytime is the right time for Pho!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole smoothie w/boba :P
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zkfQK9OCqEjcsxRybZQIew.text: Before a concert my boyfriend brought me here as a first pho time eater. It's located in the heart of Chinatown on spring mountain. Parking was a pain but we managed to get one (not like there's a lot of space in Chinatown). Walked in and the place was pretty busy, about a 10 minute wait, not so bad.  Once we were seated the waiter took our order. We got the flank and brisket pho with an order of combination fried rice. Since I had never eaten pho before my boyfriend made my bowl for me. It came with a plate covered with greens to brighten up the dark brothed soup. I did add everything to it and also added a few dashes of chili sauce to have a kick. My goodness, this soup was uh mazing. The broth was hot but not lava and they are not stingy with meat. The bowl is big enough for my boyfriend and I to share and so was the rice. The rice was nice also, had plenty of chicken and shrimp the order is huge.   The check with both the rice and soup (drinks also) was under $25 how can you go wrong. Left stuffed but satisfied. Been here a few times more because no other pho joint has been this good. The only reason I took off one star is because the service is very slow and sometimes you have to call for someone to seat you or take your order. I understand you're busy but they need to become more organized.

oE7ppnLsa8E_mhOewHp-FA.text: Awesome food. Service is ok but ultra fast. My rice noodle soup arrived in 2 minutes. Overall it's worth the short drive from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Ga- Rice noodle soup with chicken- delicious

tcGCPMj6zR5kpWHQ3Pg5tw.text: #13 Pho - large is my go-to favorite when a bit dehydrated and hungry from the LV sun!  Staff is efficient and quick.  Lines move fast, and the food is always dependable.  Great to grab breakfast!

HyPfTXAl8-ujFFTz2Qec_Q.text: I got sick the last 2 times i came here. The Food is really unimpressive and the service is just the worst.  Just skip this place, there are a lot of places for Pho in Vegas

RpB__chpgteUbF_wM3DazQ.text: BEST PHO AROUND.  Best broth, best ingredients, standard price, and did I mention best broth??  Anyway this places other food is decent, spring rolls are the only thing that Id say are subpar, but really, its all about the PHO PHO PHO.   Im from SF, lived in LA and now Vegas, and this place is it. Everyone has heard of it. Its like an Asian mecca, every girl I meet goes here and late night its a stripper haven. One time I was waiting on Pho to go and a girl dropped a dub in front of me. My girl was sitting on my lap and she saw it first. Shes from Vegas so instead of doing something kind, she tapped me and let me be the moral judge (sorry XTI but we all know u aint readin this...) anyway, I grabbed it  and tapped the girl. She turned around and it was a stripper from my work in SF. (I actually got fired because of her and her amazing butt) We laughed embarassingly and said hi. After exchanging pleasantries I mentioned my life and nodded at the guamanian in my lap and the convo halted (still kicking myself for thatttt) Point is, this place holds it down and word spreads. Good, late, cheap., clean granite tables, huge fishtanks...great place to have a mellow meal. Just wash your hands after that Jalepeno.

I8fNvXq7nfuZdnVliX_6ag.text: This place never disappoints. Good food, good service. Although the pho is awesome, we like to try other things they have to offer. Since we weren't very hungry and were there basically to entertain some friends and recommend something "new" to them, we shared the grilled porkchops and baked egg. We've tried this dish at other Vietnamese restaurants before and we definitely recommend ordering the sunny side up eggs instead. The porkchops we're cooked perfectly and seasoned well. The baked egg resembled a mini quiche. No real complaints just a matter of preference. Our friends loved the pho.

-6yswT89dyNe-wimZnX4gQ.text: Cheap, yummy, filling food. This place is incredible for groups and is always buzzing night and day. If you have never had pho before your are in for a treat.

XtG7-147JxWnsZ00UIlxfA.text: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant..Rare steak and Brisket pho is the best food to have in a cold day..charbroiled pork chop is the best pork chop I have ever tried..my favorite is shrimp and pork vermicelli bowl with beef..extra $1 for the beef and it's totally worth it..fills you up.. Taste is remarkable and price is reasonable as it gets...one of my best latenight dinning spots in Vegas.

FJmLKZ7RYjX8LPuyao1tUg.text: Awesome restaurant.  We were in LV for New Year's weekend and stopped by here.  I'm not sure what the menu items were called because I didn't order.  but, we had the fish with pork in the clay pot.  Amazing!  we also had the shrimp with honeyed walnuts.  The sweet and sour soup.  Clams in Basil.  We didn't order the Pho but it looked good.  Will definitely eat here again when we're in LV.

1PdbpxwYRQw56M7hL3-WLg.text: Food here is good. It's a 24 hour restaurant. We had the #16 and #20. Will definitely be back. The place is really busy. We were in there around 11 and it was packed. As we were leaving there were folks lining up to get in. They have so many items on the menu.

oRZdXCb7TxYqRNEthv1emA.text: i never wrote review in my life but today one server is making me to. i always come here and still might come but i am so UPSET. one server who brought us the dishes was extremely rude!!! dishes of my friend n i were switched n i didn't know so i asked. he said "i said thats number 13 " in a very rude annoyed way. then he just went away. also he threw other dishes at our table.  I dont even want to give one star. My bf n I always give more than 18% tip however not today.  I always order number 13 which is combination pho. there were no meats today. I wanted to say something but I was so upset already I did not want to say another word.  I know this place is always crowded so the service isnt so good but i ate around 3pm. Also it never wasn't that bad. Today was the WROST EVER!! i'll go to other places

U_GMPp0Rj0mCrE-pV-oWfg.text: If youre craving for a pho fix out herr in vegas i highly reccomend this place! Not only is it cheap but the place is nicely decorated (unlike some other pho places ive been to), has grreatttt customer service,wait time to be seated is less than 5 mins, wide variety of food ( from pho to pan fried noodles to creamy walnut shrimp to even pad thai-- all cooked to perfection), fully staffed,annnnd cheaper prices compared to other pho places around the area. I wish there was a place like this out in the bay area where im from.but im definitely going to frequent this spot everytime im out here in vegas now:) good job pho kim long! Best pho place ive everrrrr been to!!

fPUY4FvVBc0Z_z_q033zpQ.text: We always somehow make our way here when we come to Vegas. This place is always packed, for good reason. The food is great and the service is fast. Big bonus points for being open 24 hours. Need one of these in Seattle!

URrgoTN6bBx-dqv-wpS82g.text: What a horrible place to eat.....food was ok. no service what so ever.... and they even charged us gratuities for a  family of four. (thats a first for us) not coming back again......

KaJpHXtOeR_nn-ze585yJw.text: I liked the food and the decent price.  But they really need to do something about the smell in the whole restaurant. Upon arrival, you will smell some dirty cloth or dirty table cloth.  It really turned me off.  The whole time I smelt the dirty cloth.  It was not just me but my parents, my hubbie and my brother and sister in law were complaining.  The dessert menu looked great but I didn't have a chance to eat them - sooooo full.

KkhiLZD0EdGlNnOc0FbOFw.text: I seriously don't understand how my friends come here in the summer to eat pho! It's freaking over 100o outside. So now that it's November, I decided to give it a shot.  I would give it 3.5. It's a good place to get your quick fix of Vietnamese food if you're craving it. Price is a little higher than average. $50 for 4 people. 1 dish and beverage each person.  If I had to compare it to the Pho in the Bay Area then no, it doesn't compare. But just being able to have a bowl of decent pho after a long night adds some stars.   Rice dishes aren't bad. Portion was a little smaller than what I could get back home for the same price.

qP3zwLBPJEQQ3KDyZUHwEg.text: The setting of the place looks nice. At least much better looking than the other ph restaurants around this area.

Zxy_sqvQ5py16i_PQtfpyg.text: Almost an addiction after a late night of partying! their assortment of Pho will have something for everyone. I usually get the combinatio Pho but when I feel like eating something else the teriyaki chicke. And brown rice will hit the spot.

jKElMAPzkhBNOvhILdty1w.text: i came from san jose and i hear this place so good and i stop to fine out but supprire for me. very terrible for service take the long time for waiting list. the employees very discourteous. And the food is so bad.Price so expensive. nothing to remember this restaurant in my life.

pbu5siL3X7x5Pl4Fa3FA7A.text: First time trying this place out of the 3 times I've been to vegas and I am impressed by the pho that they have here. It was really tasty. My friend suggested that we have pho here since everyone wanted pho to cure their hangovers. I ordered the chicken pho and it was really good. The place was kind of packed when we got there on sunday. This place is open 24 hours so i will definitely be back here when I come back to Vegas.

lKcLujqg6Wpc7ByJX88X9g.text: I come to Las Vegas for 4 days and got tired of eating American food. I wanna try hu tiu and pho.Walked inside and the place was packed. I went there Sat and Sun. Avoid going there on weekends! I order 3 hu tieu and 2 ice coffee. Cost about $38. It's right behind Treasure Island. I took a  taxi. I would definitely come back again. The restaurant is open 24 hours!

AnQm3vKQj73F1CfHQ7QogQ.text: This is a ritual spot that my friends and I go to, every time we go to Vegas. We start here, and most of the time, we finish here. Best pho in Vegas for sure, and there is banh mi at Lee's sandwiches in the same plaza for snacking/meals while on the strip.

QwwtKlrTpB982S3G2LK6eQ.text: 3 stars for food gets to you fast Make sure if youre going with a group and you want to split the bill bring cash because they dont split bills.   Pho broth is great. Everything else is super greasy but its a place a lot of people go for hangovers.   Service of course depends on your waiter but it should be run like a business with quality service. Its mediocre. I always look at how long the server gets to your table.  How quick your drinks get to you. If the apps arrive and if everyones meals arrive to the table all at once.  And also how quick they refill my drink.    Price is average for the food unless youre ordering meals from the back of the menu.    Go there if youre wasted but take the family reunion somewhere else

7TOU_4T7paWwsHz-TtIgVA.text: The best pho place to end up after a long night of drinking and partying.  Quiick service + good pho = A happy drunk beezy.   The calamari here is delish too. But only when youre drunk! I was craving the calamari sober so I went back SOBER, mind you and yea it wasnt to die for any more. Actually it was quite greasy which is aparently great when youre wasted. Kinda like jack in the box tacos great when drunk not so great sober. Dont get me wrong tho the pho is still good sober. Hah.

2bk4eMIfdWK9o5vhtWeUNQ.text: Average at best. Service is spotty but friendly. The pho that I ordered was just OK. The broth was just average. I had ordered egg rolls and the came out after I had been given my pho. In my opinion there are better options out there.

6HaPPbPQzy76YVJoHuUoEg.text: Update from my last review... The place have gotten so much better it's customer service!!! Now it's perfect and food is too good.

1zVLMlKfeNAAPP_ixjauVQ.text: I can't believe the bad management . I waited 45 minutes for an order of soup to go.  Finally asked him for my money back and he didn't even try to accommodate me.  I have been a cab driver for 15 years and haven't seen many places with this bad of service.

LAnx8qpAg5UmAyo4E6bpOg.text: It's a "high end" Pho restaurant.  The decor is nice inside, compared to all the countless  hole in the wall Pho places, but the food is lacking.  It is also open 24hrs, so if you are craving Pho at 300am, this place is open.    I started with the fresh spring rolls.  It was bland and tasteless.  The rice wrap was soft, so that is a plus, but even with the peanut sauce, it did not stand up to a good tasting fresh shrimp spring roll.  I ordered the Bun Bo Hue.  It was actually pretty tasty.  You get to add the spice to it yourself, so the broth is to your liking.  Each bite had meat, tendon and they also included the pig knuckle (which I like in my Bun Bo Hue.)  I would order it again.  The noodles were thick and cooked right.  It was a good bowl of Spicy noodles, but for $9, it better be good.  The total bill was $15, a bit overpriced for an underwhelming experience.  Would I repeat?  Yes.  I would just order the Bun Bo Hue or try the Pho next trip.

q6EhCL5aBHtKhExGDzHZYg.text: Pho Kim Long has actually grown on me. At first I wasn't very impressed, but after trying a few different things I have kind of come around.  First of let me say that I work overnights, so when I get off at 5am my options are extremely limited. Pho Kim Long is probably the healthiest option if i want to eat out. The place is always clean but the service is lacking. Usually one person takes your order, another brings you the drink (a lot of the time after receiving food), another brings you the food.  The food always comes out in random order. Sometimes the Pho comes out first, sometimes the entrees. Sometimes it takes forever and sometimes its quick.  Because I've been there at least 20 times I've tried a lot on the menu, but not everything (the menu is extensive).   The combination pho is good, it's not the best I've had but its consistently good. no complaints.  The spring rolls are fresh, but they are small. A lot smaller than any other place I've been.  Some of the entrees I've had we're just mediocre including Kung pao chicken, mongolian beef, curry chicken, and walnut shrimp. They weren't bad, just nothing stood out.  One dish that did stand out was the Honey garlic pork chops. I don't know if these are Vietnamese or Chinese or what, but they are some of the best food I've had at an asian restaurant. So tasty!  All in all, with the exception of slow service I don't have any major complaints for Pho Kim Long. I'll continue to go there, just usually late night because during the day I feel like there are better options.

yI8Y6t_KHDKVsSnwvrP7FQ.text: This was my first time here as many times I have come to vegas. We always make at least one stop in chinatown to get a break from american food and buffets on the strip and the menu here was expansive and food was decent. Its pretty packed though so you may have a brief wait to be seated. It's open 24 hours so that's convenient, will probably return

UGAMRlz609oQGSTEsqPYYA.text: Probably one of the best pho places i've ever been to. The broth was amazing and they put a perfect amount of meat in it for you. The service was a little slow but that didn't really matter because it was so good. I will be back here for sure next time i'm in Vegas.

qCQG3vD-e2HXn1OZADHAGw.text: best meal i had in 5 days.   after traveling from utah to arizona and back for 5 days, this restaurant really hit the spot. it was the best meal i had in 5 days and also the cheapest meal i had. The hours of operation make it convenient and a no brainer.  I would go back again.

EKL9Yv-BLty1oE4iVsvkXQ.text: 24 hour Vietnamese in Las Vegas.  It does not get much better.  Do not expect great service, just expect fast service and good food.  Tucked away in a strip mall in China Town, this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuuuuuuummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!!!!!!!!!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 24 HR Vietnamese! Yes please!

VPcBUEZHy1HDB0Wc-Qkl0g.text: Management at this place needs to be more strict and having the employees stick to their roles. This would make for a smoother transition of daily activities at the restaurant. The employees are all stressed and you can see it in their faces that they are overworked and tired of getting yelled at by the host who plays multiple roles not sure what her title or name was as she never took the time to introduce herself. The reason I gave this place two stars is because the food is great, no doubt and if it wasn't for the food quality I would never come back to this establishment.

bDNpEQtanH9exTyRKiG_Lw.text: Food poor quality and salty. Place is dirty. My second time here. Thought will be better this time. Not coming back anymore.

hdULjkJu9NVtKlUZK_s1tQ.text: Worst customer service ever! The owners are ruder than shit! They have a procedure that they don't follow they ask u to sign in as a first come first serve basis but do whatever the heck they want and sit people first that walked in the door after you. I wouldn't recommend it.

Y302PfVBOGGbU_0yVncK9w.text: Pros:  -open 24hrs -organized waiting list -clean for a pho place -quick, but crap service(typical of viet places) -the pho helped my hangover  Cons: -crap service -meh pho -8 bucks for pho -smaller portions than other pho joints I've been to  Overall, it's a pretty mediocre place. If you're in Vegas and have a pho craving, it will do. But just don't expect it to do that much.

yNX7yzC5O3R3D2z04Is0kw.text: This place is great for late-night eating.  After a few rounds at the nearby PTs, after a few hours of karaoke at Zizzy's or Q.  Even after hitting up the clubs at the strip. Just make sure you have a desi...     Anyways aside from their pho which is pretty darn good I tend to also get their #24.  So why a 3 of 5?  It's their service, now I'm a good tipper but seriously it's hard to tip when you have to remind your waiter then other waiters for a refill of pop/water or for extra fish sauce.  It's like dude you see me choking down the vermicelli least you can do is get that pop I ordered 5 times already...     The food is good and I love the flavor of their charbroiled chicken and it's really not overpriced but the lack of service is something else. Aside from the host (Thierry Henry) which my homies have nicknamed their wait staff just brings down the whole joint... 3 of 5...

MzupYhAWEiM_bn6pL9naUQ.text: This place does the trick for me when I feel like pho (whether I've been drinking or not been drinking).  I got:  ~Appetizer #1: Spring Rolls with Shrimp, Pork, Lettuce ~Rare Steak and Brisket Noodle Soup  It's weird -- the 1st time I came here, I ordered a pho with tendon, but this last time on the menu, there were no noodle soups with the options to get tripe or tendon. That made me sad.  Can't go wrong with the springs rolls, taste fresh, and they come out quick! The broth of the pho is decent -- I've had better, but this restaurant does the trick for me. The quality of the meat is decent too. The veggies to put in the pho were clean and fresh.  Clean restaurant, friendly and attentive staff, they accept card (don't know if there is a minimum), restrooms are clean. It's located in a strip mall type of place off of Spring Mountain Rd. All in all, this place isn't the best, but it's not bad.

oRCDniMtDxdEL4URsUBJGA.text: We came here for lunch to give it a try. REGRET!  Absolute TERRIBLE service.  We were greeted by a hasty waiter who gave an angry disposition.  They gave us the menu and came back a minute later to take our orders. It would take me at least 5 to decipher their menu.   In addition, one of my friends and I ordered similar pho but with slight differences in meat. One was large and the other was small.  After they brought out our food we started eating. 5 minutes later they came back to say that our bowls were mixed up.  For one thing, there is no noticeable differences between a large bowl and a small bowl. Well no use complaining about that anymore.  The pho quality was somewhat substandard, salty, and lacked effort.  I know its Vegas, but there are many pho restaurants in the area and I've tried one a few blocks down Spring Mountain that actually has tasty well made broth.  This place did not give a lot of meat either.    I can only tell you that I am not coming back here.  It does look clean and all, but you will not be satisfied, just like the many visitors of Vegas who gave this place a try.

9LoS-Hnjn9MK9WKTpflojw.text: For being a Pho place their pho wasn't all that great :( I could tell right away from the clear broth and strong smell of anise that I wasn't going to like it. I had to add tons of sriracha and hoisin sauce just to get some flavor in my broth.   The taste of anise was still overpowering and I didn't care for it at all. We had fried egg rolls as well and those were good. The peanut dipping sauce however was ice cold :(   One other thing I didn't like was the lack of meat combinations. There were only about 5 choices to choose from. I give this place a "meh"

0w9Ghbhd8FvzHBoapV15-w.text: The rare steak soup is the best in town! Add an order of egg rolls and you'll go home happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #14. Rare steak.

96CgJW1x5oGH_V0BTliXhw.text: Came in sat down promptly and order right away.  10,15,20,25,30min ..where's my food??? Saw about 3 different tables fill up..saw that they too ordered right away so 35, 40min..what do I see?? I see those 3 tables getting their food before me..WT.F!!!45,50min I think..I was too mad at this point or maybe an hour went by until I finally received my food..if the food I ate was any good (beef cube with brown rice) I would've given them 2 stars but it was bland and the portion was really small for $14..overall I don't think I'm ever coming back..what a wack ass experience.

JJaGSRYuH7CwGhRDtZMuIQ.text: Great food, though I think the servers should be taught on serving with cleanliness....!

vx0W-FpdO1BBj0rYl7xfqw.text: There are other choices in Vegas for Pho.  Come here if you want INCREDIBLY RUDE SERVICE.  food is mediocre at best.

f5yNk2WmrQmjMXhtuLnySg.text: First Time eating pho it was great. Service was good they get your meat meal out extremely fast. I went there with a large group from work got to try a lot of different things everything was very good will be going back soon

qq2nKB34-OQAvLzzgL5WNw.text: I agree with the review below that this place has gone downhill. It was decent before, though not that memorable or special by any means. I ordered a basic pho tai nam and the broth was fatty but bland, no sign of anise which is a critical ingredient and a smell that is quintessential to the flavor of a good bowl of pho. They also gave us wilted basil so I asked for another and they charged me a dollar. The wait staff was obviously overworked and even though they asked the courteous 'are you finished', they grabbed my boyfriend's bowl before he was through. He still was chewing...big clue guys! Definitely will be going elsewhere. For the first time, I felt unsatisfied after eating a bowl of pho.

39DG0laYXSuuUcIQA587mQ.text: Besides always being busy Pho Kim Long is great! Good food, Great service, and most of all priced nicely!

7Ups3mCBKbyDuU6OsDt9JA.text: The food is phenomenal. Come winter time you can find me in here every other day of the week. Being that it is 24 hours a day makes it that much better. Its always crazy busy late at night. Service is iffy sometimes but nothing to make me stop going. TIP: Try the Kidney Bean Dessert with Shaved Ice and Coconut cream.

u1UPRJPP1IYc8kCZsswJNQ.text: Nice clean restaurant, great atmosphere, hip crowd, friendly staff, prompt service, and food was very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Chicken Noodle Soup

qjz5OE7gRxbX-5kGD8r7yw.text: Hated it. Service is crap and servers are extremely rude. They fill the bows completely with broth so you can't help but spill it and all the meat was covered in fat. Once we finished our meal we went to the cashier to pay, we asked to have separate checks he had the audacity to give us the whole check and demand we split it ourselves.  There where 5 of us and they add in gratuity which added up to 8bucks at the bottom of our check. I will never go back to this place it was horrible and left my  party angry all night.

Qqj24zDc5PEzuYAnUkZLPQ.text: This is the place 2 go after u've been drinking & dancing all nite long... I'm so glad they're open til the wee hours! It's not a very clean place but the food here is great! I get either the pho tai or grilled porkchops on rice. The food always comes out fast, so u're in n out quickly, just in time.

tGd5R0MPEFNYzxuVCqeOfg.text: Food is decent...service is terrible...only thing I like about this place is the fact that it's open 24 hours...this is the only reason if any that I would recommend anyone of this place...also make sure u read the fine print cuz they added tip and didn't say anything about it and we ended up paying double the tip amount...for terrible I mean terrible service

nuSI60hyfd5M7W7lgC62mQ.text: Everyone loves Pho Kim Long. Or is it that everyone loves to say the name? In any case, this place gets a lot of traffic.  As for me, I haven't been here since December of 2008. Back then, I really wasn't into pho. Since then, I've been to quite a few places. While I'm still no expert, I obviously know what I like. I've been meaning to return so that I can properly evaluate this restaurant.  Simply put, PKL is A-OK. Their pho satiates the appetite. Their broth is pretty good and the rest of the ingredients complement the soup nicely. Unfortunately, they do not serve tripe, which for me is a bummer. However, they do have that "home made" style chili sauce that I strangely prefer over plain old Sriracha. There's nothing wrong with Sriracha of course; I'm just weird like that.  One thing that PKL has going for it is the decor. Places like Pho So 1 make better pho but are completely devoid of any personality. You would never confuse PKL with a diner. That's really not that important to me though.  In the end, it's all about the pho. In that case, PKL is good enough, especially when no other place is open.

qkiq5JsLPIYqVqAElWxHHA.text: Came here on a Sunday night around 10 PM and was not disappointed. I was impressed to see a steady flow of people coming and going at this time for such a large restaurant. The staff was very friendly and I was amazed when we were offered a large table even though there were only two of us. The pho was great. The broth was top notch as was the sliced beef and noodles. This was exactly what we were looking for: a fast delicious meal in a nice setting. Thank you. Wish I could get this back home.

6si0xnKpCTjs0Mk0OgKlew.text: Best of Vegas. Best Pho and Chinese fusion. Don't be fooled, this is an institution. Virtually everything is to be tried. Always packed and is 24/7 . genius.

9pJ_OajH-yWb5r69WCP8pg.text: The only Pho place I will go anymore, delicious, fast and great service. Their Spring rolls are like no other!

N4lrH98A_gk2tpxaMkzJ-Q.text: This is my go to Pho place in Las Vegas.  Service is fast, prices are OK, and the pho is more than acceptable.  I'd recommend going here, for the time being that is. I'm still on the hunt for a better Pho restaurant.

sdZWcoM6ZzR4rQY_MLqmSg.text: You have to enter from next door Chinese restaurant, and served by Chinese, which made me wonder if it is an authentic Vietnamese Pho restaurant. However, the taste was good. Recommend.

BRBtzd4xAyuT0xuVJSGSXg.text: Went here for the first time.  Was delicious. The service was attentive and the experience was great !

8i-HVzZcHEtC3X5eMGIXGA.text: the food was really good the service was great too.  downfall is the wait but well worth it

lcVMG9VdG_N9QTE4zU5GBQ.text: I found the after party guys! It's at Pho Kim Long!   Ok, I will probably have to re-visit this review because when I was here, I was intoxicated and I seriously thought that my food was heavent sent. So, for now, we'll go off my only experience...  Love this place for the fact that it's open late, service is fast, and the food was perfect (for being in my condition, atleast). My girlfriend ordered a beef and broccoli dish which I was eating off her plate - GOOD, I had combination pho of some sort - GOOD. For these reasons, I am def'ly going back. Yes, my food was additionally delicious b/c I had a few drinks in, but friends and family have gone here several times and raved about the food, so, I am sure it would be just as good sober.  FINAL ANSWER: I found my pho place in Las Vegas! Def'ly must come here especially after a night out drinking.

0sJ-iWZM3__oeuWUCm4-8Q.text: I've been going here for so many years, we always go here the day after partying while in Vegas. It's the best thing for your stomach after all that drinking! The pho is decent  and the spring rolls, egg rolls, and spicy chicken wings are up to par. Can't complain I'm just glad they opened one up in Vegas. Wish they had one there 15 years ago... This place is a bit off the strip so you have to take a taxi there. Prices are normal prices, for Vegas. If you don't want to spend that much $ then you can always go next door and get some banh mi at Lee's Sandwiches.

RecV9YPQLu4tLgE7hbajhQ.text: Good food, but I was very disappointed by the way we were treated. The initial sitting was very fast and the first server was friendly and got us our food quick. However, we went for a large portion of the meal without water, because no one took the time to come back to our table and get us water, even after we had two people show up later and get their food ordered. The icing on the cake was when we finally tried to pay our bill. We ate as a large group, so we asked to get our bill separated. The waiter told us, very rudely, that we couldn't split the check. We paid and we got the hell out of there.   The TL;DR version: food is good, service is terrible, probably never going again. For me, the lack of service took away two stars, because this food was damn delicious.

tXQ6DflfZBEt2dswTESmEg.text: I come to san diego and try to eat pho KIm Long . But i take order and i wait 30 minutes but my order no come . I hate this service this restaurant ..... F******

TgBXaI4dMBgQkiBD1sQblw.text: To preface: My review is based only on the pho. Pho Kim Long is a Las Vegas culinary mystery to me. The restaurant is always busy, which is generally a good sign, and following the masses, I went to sample the pho. I was simply not impressed, and I am not alone, just visit this Yelp discussion: yelp.com/topic/las-vegas... No mention of Pho Kim Long as the best pho, and even the 24-hour convenience does not merit more stars, as Pho So 1 is open until 3am, and after that you should really just be eating Korean BBQ. No need to go to bed on a stomach of noodles; you need protein to repair your party body! Why didn't the pho impress me? Good question. The pho did not impress me because the broth lacked complexity. My favorite thing about pho is the deep sweet but savory flavor of a good broth-- the magic of anise, cloves and beefy bits-- but at Kim Long, the broth had the taste of a glorified, salty chicken broth. Without the broth, you might as well get the chicken noodle soup at Marie Callender's. I think that Pho Kim Long gets overrated by hungry, sometimes drunkish visitors because it is close to the strip. I love visitors, I do, but we should try to get you some different late night dining options.

7UvE7Ktyo81iDGOOh_vk8w.text: I frequent this place. Honestly, I haven't had pho at too many places but this is really good. The service is prompt and good. The spring rolls and egg roles are awesome. I have had other things than just pho there and they are always good (Usually noodle dishes). There are a lot of Asians there which I would assume means they are good. They are always packed but don't get worried about a lot of people because they get you in pretty quick.

sKfju-49rNN1iDPOIoeZqg.text: I eat here about once a week. The pho comes out in minutes and they pile on the extras. Great service, nice marble tables and decor. While Vietnamese is the main menu, their Thai and Chinese dishes are also top notch and reasonably priced.

3PR5wweceppb3TW5bQV4mw.text: I've been going to this place for a quite sometime now and every time, it's always packed... It doesn't matter if it's 2am, there is still decent amount of people.  They have great food. I've tried their appetizers like egg rolls or spring rolls, fried rice, chicken dishes, pad thai, and my personal favorite, their pho. None of them disappointed me ever. I could close my eyes and pick something random on the menu and I guarantee, I'll either love it or at least like it.   I do have problem with their service once in awhile. Sometimes, the server didn't have a very good attitude and was very slow running the food or bringing the check. But besides that, the food is great, the place is great, and the name of the place is great. So go on and try, I guarantee that you won't be disappointed.

XBgtmAQJM94rlf4nV_nXyg.text: I take everyone that visits form out of town to Pho Kim Long for the delicious pho.  It does get busy and crowded but I think it is worth it.  Everything I have tried is delicious.

tT_XMp5sZRmkABXOSon7Cg.text: Watch out ! They charge you on things you didn't order and won't take it off. Go somewhere else. There are alot more restaurants down on the road.

mlOUb1qGkCPswzXq4PwEEg.text: Long night.. A lot of drinking.. Only way to end the night is some Pho from pho Kim long

Qvxx4w57XXUjVGQBReBH2g.text: I've been coming to Kim Long's for around 3 years now since my brother moved to Las Vegas. The Pho is one of the best I've had and definitely the best in Las Vegas. The broth is just right and the meat is cooked just right.  I like the fact that the restaurant is open 24 hours. When I had my Pho it was 2:00 AM and the place was packed!!

OzO-qbaA5haPgz31W304uw.text: Open late. Decent place. My review is probably gonna get lost in the thousands of reviews here, but hey, everyone should feel like they matter right?

_cVPZsh8T_wx1MHAr39INA.text: Since I had access to a car the past trip, my buddies and I wanted some good ol asian food to nurse our wounded livers on a saturday morning. What else to do that than some Pho or some rice plates!  Just a short drive down Spring Mtn Road, Pho Kim Long is in the heart of Chinatown.  I opted for a rice plate since I wasn't in the mood for Pho while is 100 outside. The grilled pork, pork skin, and egg dish hit the spot. Nothing fancy, just down to earth good viet eats. It wasn't the best ive had since i'm spoiled with good viet food at home but it sure hit the spot.  The service was attentive and the place was clean. This is quite strange for a Pho restaurant, a clean one? Total dmg was around $50 for 5 people with tax/tip included, not too shabby at all

J9-NWNYiyqpuU7GlqvrFhw.text: I made this account just to complain about the middle aged guy that call people name out to be waited. never in my life have I ever felt so pissed off waiting to be seated. hella rude though. calling people handicap and slamming clipboards when people are asking question.

yIg1HrPjlbhAb1wXaLbGoQ.text: Pho Kim Long deserves a four star rating!!!  It really hits the spot and never fails to fill your cravings because it's open 24hrs.  The convenience and price of the food is truly what makes up for my rating!!  I'd give it a 5, only sometimes the food isn't always consistent and service is just alright (although I don't expect much from a place with such inexpensive food).    Anyway, the food I usually eat is pho tai with the steak on the side.  Squeeze in some lime and you're good to go.  I also really like the stir fried beef cubes with seasoned rice.  That dish is always on point.  The grilled pork chops is something I used to always get, but i've noticed that this dish is sometimes poorly prepared (undercooked) so i rarely ever get this anymore.  Spring rolls you can't really go wrong with and the egg rolls are pretty yum too.  That is the extent of my menu knowledge, but i have also tried the  mongolian beef, walnut prawns and some of their vermicelli dishes through my friends.    One thing I always get here is the pineapple shake!! YUM!  I've tried their other shakes and noticed them to be a tad bit powdery or artificial tasting.  The pineapple and avocado shakes are the only ones made with milk and fresh fruit, i think, and that's how i like it!!! I'd def recommend you try it.

Xa1g0kvN92AQ-QCGRlAijg.text: When I desire Vietnamese food, is the where I go. The food is good, as well as the atmosphere. However, I recently had a server who was trying to be dang 'hip'.

W6zgUEHqRFmednkBvjyfDw.text: ALways fast and efficient service and great Pho!

9cBxXq4G_TVNv4odscYqGw.text: One of my favorite spots in LV!! Ya gotta try it at least once!

TpxU-NZAnS6kWJYVxR1kMQ.text: Pho Kim Long is the blandest tasting pho I've ever had.  Broth tastes like water, salt, and star anise.  No depth of flavor.  I added extra hoisin twice to make it edible, but it was still bland.     For the amount they charge, you get very little meat.  I ordered pho ga and got razor thin pieces of meat.    They had a sign that said they were best restaurant in Vegas.  Laughable.

mjFlCO3ufPDV7c_Jk4GMTw.text: Pho places always have the most amusing names... like phobulous, or pho king.... This place is open late so it's a perfect place to come after a long night drinking and partying. It'll definitely help prevent and cure hangovers. The prices were pretty decent and weren't as overpriced as the restaurants on the strip. Food: 1) Salt and Pepper Shrimp - this is amazing! I've become a huge fan of this ever since I came here. The amount of garlic + jalapenos give the dish an amazing flavor with a considerable amount of kick. Although I haven't been able to find very many places that make it as good as this establishment. yelp.com/biz_photos/yfxD... 2) Egg rolls were pretty good, but smaller than the ones I'm used to ordering. Pho Kim Long is definitely a much better deal than many of the restaurants on the strip. You get delicious food and reasonable prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt n pepper shrimp!

O1HmkRTgU35uedN9fpik2Q.text: A local recommended this place and I absolutely loved the beef noodle soup!! The pho broth was so good, similar to ones I've had in Vietnam. Regular size was the perfect portion for me, as I have a smaller appetite. We also ordered the Singapore noodles with shrimp, which is a curry flavored stir fry vermicelli dish - also really yummy. The restaurant was busy but we didn't have to wait for long. Service was quick and not particularly good, but I value efficiency more than conversation when it comes to restaurant service. Great place, would definitely come again!

Bn4iB5C076zougvUKPjPIQ.text: Now open 24 hours. If you're hungry after partying on the strip or in downtown, try this place. The place is always jam packed and very noisy. It gets rowdier in the wee hours of the morning. There's always a wait period of about 15 minutes because it's one of the places locals frequently go to. However, the place needs a makeover...dirty floors and outdated decorations. We usually order the spring roll, crispy fried noodles and the bun bo hui. The food is good, the price is reasonable, and the service is fast. I gave it a 3 stars because there's no 3 1/2 stars choice. If you're not after ambiance and you don't mind the rowdiness, go for it for the food and the fast service! Besides, how can you go wrong with the name!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DfuUdx08LKu_9c0cef3xJw.text: I know it gets super busy here, but they NEED to work on their customer service. Waiters are rude. Food is good though.

ODizcykw09STn2ctL8P7uA.text: This place is always packed with people but I enjoy coming to this place when I have those random pho cravings. The good thing is that this place is open for 24 hours. I wouldn't say that  this pho is the best I have ever had but there are places like Pho MaiLan. Considering the location being in Chinatown, it's close to the Strip.

UV9TWJ6laTDYRHYczd5kqg.text: I love the food here. They need to make a bigger waiting room though. Costumer service could be better. No one ever checks on you which is annoying.

oCGBAONrc-x9Apxba53hAg.text: Came here for brunch with my sister before going to the airport, we were tired, hungry and just wanted to sit down. We were seated very quickly, got our drinks, ordered and got our food very fast and with a smile. We shared  #13, special combo pho, and #1 shrimp pork spring rolls. The pho was very good. The broth was very flavorful, the spring rolls came out very fast. The wraps were not the freshest but it explains how fast they came out. The servings were big so make sure you have an appetite! Very good!

lt2MP9wy4EQbmsmW8xlkvg.text: Save your time coming in because you won't get good customer service. This place easily makes 7-10,000 daily average and I came in to get a thai tea to go with no ice and the supposed owner at the register fills it 3/4 of the way and said if you want more it's extra. Doesn't care about his customers to top it off 10oz. To be cheap. On top charged my card twice and gave me incorrect cash back. If customers read this at least they will just make the effort to go next door and get better service. These days it's more about customer service and reviews online than turning into a fast food place.

4JyNpuYn5MHJxGStQfITWA.text: I think that every time I come to vegas I hit up this Pho joint. I love this place because after a night of getting crazy in the clubs I wake up to find photos of us eating here. Lol The times that I have come here and been sober I've loved the pho. Also we never have to wait longer than 7 min for a table, even when it's 3 am and the place is crawling with drunkards.   The serving size is good for the price you are paying. I usually get the Pho with beef balls and rare steak (in the soup). Most of the time the servers are quick to get our orders in and we usually get our drinks refilled in a timely manner.   Love this place!

S8a0L18eJfVTmj4wCygZBA.text: My first impression was that it was okay. I understood it was busy but the hostess was busy fooling around with the bus boy to be attentive to guests walking in.  We started off with the spicy fried calamari.. It was a huge portion but it was not spicy like it said. Then we all ordered the pho, I believe number 13(?) and it was pretty tasty. Also a huge portion as well. We ended it with their dessert which was a cup with three different beans and coconut milk(?) I don't remember the name (it had a Vietnamese name), it was delicious!  The waiters were very attentive and wicked friendly!  Other than the first impression and the calamari, I'd go back again.

yY0GL9AkYrQVWs78JHZhDg.text: My wife and I are on a keto diet and had to pay $5 to sub vegetables for the noodles. The service was slow, the wait for the table on a Sunday night was nearly an hour, and once we were seated they were very unapologetic. Some in my party had to wait longer for water because they were out of cups. This is the last time I eat here, sadly. I love the food, but I cannot put up with the substandard service and lousy charges.

5-7NI1SyZUIGlMlLWql_JA.text: Good pho place to stop by in vegas. I enjoy their vermicilli bowl the most!!! I always eat here at least once when im in vegas. Quick customer service and the food comes out quite fast too. The restaurant also looks clean and is quite big.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RRYb-h1ye3t4vf0bUaW0Yw.text: One of my favorite spots in Vegas. Full of locals and visiting friends. Great good and great atmosphere! 24 hour yumminess!

tucD6Mhsn3Y79DrzPGwPKg.text: We ate here on a Saturday about 10am. Atmosphere/decor has a nice clean asian flare, reasonable prices,  reasonable fast service. Calamari  topped with jalepenos was tasty and served 3 of us as an appetizer. "Pho" soup had lots of meat. We will be coming back to try it for consistency. It's in a plaza with big sign so easy to find.

TK06c2K1N29N2YjbzVZoow.text: Place is ok. I've had better Vietnamese food. In wouldn't go out of my way to come back now that I'm more familiar with other places to eat. Staff is friendly and place is clean. Food is affordable. Parking can be a hassle since there are a lot of other restaurants next door.

dg4C7yYG_CI6R6lXNLYc4A.text: I've been looking for a Pho spot since moving here. Tried a few places and it didn't meet my standards. This place however, is dee-lish. I order the Pho chicken. It came out in less than 5 minutes. The broth was sooooo flavorful. The served was amazing. He was so quick with everything. And it's open 24 hours. Needless to say we will be back!!!

U7j9qgovKGA4HX2_1pZRTA.text: Terrible service, terrible food, had to send my dish back.. tried another dish that was equally as bad... I normally dont like to complain since not too many options available late-night but hopefully just making the owners aware so they can make some improvements.

FyiLgef-onIT5CBn3jINpw.text: i'm sure this place is good for people that don't have a lot of Vietnamese food or pho options where they are from. But coming from OC - this place is not good.  Service was pretty quick though.

ya3tbvjGSYMyjUp4mJCPWQ.text: I went here a while back to have a REALLY late night dinner with friends. I was surprised at how busy a Pho place can get at 3am! The line was wrapped around the door, but thank God we arrived before the traffic rolled in. The wait was reasonable. They definitely hustle to get you in and out.   Food: It was my first time here, but from what most of my friends had mentioned, it lived up to the recommendation. They were fast with the service, and have tons of options. I'd go here again if I'm in the area.

QT2YxES_WeQFIxQEcwNngA.text: Took my boyfriend here since he likes Pho and as a Lyft driver I'm ALWAYS picking people up from here. It's a 24-hour place, food and beer is somewhat cheap- awesome. Food was mostly good.. except for the meatballs which tasted.. off. But other than that, all the other meets were fine.

mN8C4xufgWfi7ZomP5_51g.text: If you are looking for quality pho.... the kind that you can buy for $4.95 in NYC or only a tad more in LA.... this is NOT the place. I have been here several times... many in fact... and it merely became a late-night 'hangout' where men ogle women after they get out of a nightclub. It can be amusing to spectate once in a while but if you want to find a place for great food and avoid potential creepers, I would try elsewhere ;).   Some of their rice dishes are pretty good once in a while and their calamari is hit or miss. I have friends who always order the calamari... The prices aren't over-the-top, but once again, I am a spoiled New Yorker who's used to the best Vietnamese food being extremely cheap and convenient.   The number one pro of this restaurant is the hours of operation. It's always nice to have an Asian restaurant to chill and eat at during all hours of the night ;)

QArbFyebwefoBIFPO8RdwQ.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my bowl of Pho with everything in it. Plenty of meat, tasty soup, and fresh vegetables. I wouldn't rank it up there in the top ten, but I really enjoyed the Pho and would definitely go back. Haven't had a better bowl of Pho in Vegas, so this would be my first choice for a hearty bowl of Pho, its delicious, big bowl, as well as a lot of meat, and not much MSG.  One bad thing is that this place can get really crowded, hard to get a table sometimes.

6O3CZ5LD_qxGtDDKHYQHXg.text: This place never gets old! Ahhhh so drunk, where can we go sober up and eat Pho at the same time!  I'll tell you where, Pho Kim Long!  Its like the hangout for people that just went clubbing.  Girls stumble in drunk in short skirts and guys chatting about girls drunk in short skirts.  Service is very good. The Pho in my opinion are pretty good as well.  Sorry I can't really put much info on the menu bcause I've always ordered by numbers in a Pho Restaurant. But all the Pho are pretty Pho'king good. Best remedy to prevent a hangover.

2EtsMJ2xvUPvrFiMUbr3fA.text: Service is a bit slow but the food is amazing. Despite the many times I've been there I haven't had a bad dish.  I always make it a point to eat here when I'm in Vegas. I've had the pho, fried eggplant in garlic, fried chicken wings in garlic, wonton soup with egg noodles, ong choy, steamed chicken, Singapore noodles, fish in black bean sauce, pan fried noodles, honeydew smoothie, thai tea and thai coffee.  All fabulous. There's been a wait most times I've been here but it's definitely worth it.

eatZ3pKE47g83lF3loKtJw.text: If it wasn't for the food, I'd give it a 1 star.  The service shouldn't be expected here.  I asked for some lime 4 times and they still did not bring it.  .  This place is okay for late night cravings, but holy crap... You'd get lucky to get service at all.  I ordered some pho and the soup had a lot of flavor, so food is okay. If you do come here, expect okay to zero service.

QM4nlRDjLO7u9Bs8HJQtgA.text: Came here my 2nd time this past early Sunday morning at around 3AM after clubbing. TRY TO AVOID COMING HERE AT THAT TIME!! Horrible service!!  When we got there, we had a group of about 10-15 people. We were seated quickly. However, right after, the place was PACKED & way under staffed. You would think they'd have more people working..  We waved our hands around to get the server's attention for a good 30 minutes. They'd avoid making eye contact when we tried to flag them down -_- when they finally took our order, it took about 20 minutes for our food to be brought out. So if you're looking for a quick bite after partying, don't come here.  The other time I came here was for lunch and it wasn't as bad.  Overall the pho is good. Price is decent, I think its about $6-7 for a pho tai.

bQ7ujl3Embtz5CYVv09Yag.text: Pho review. Be prepared to put your name on the waiting list. The hostess was rude. This place is packed so it better be amazing right? Also voted #1 pho in Las Vegas. So, we took our chance and waited for almost an hour. I'm only reviewing their pho. It was nothing spectacular. On a Sunday afternoon after a night of partying on the strip, their pho did it's job. One of my biggest pet peeves is when lemon wedged are served on the side with pho. Who does that?! No doubt, it should always always always be lime wedges!! Service was good. The other menu items looked good at the table next to us. However, we only had their pho. Make sure to stop by Lee's Sandwiches for the best Bahn Mi. It's only a few doors down in the same mall area.

POZ-0weLqpIdjfBTieSwmg.text: I love this place... and I'm slightly bias because I come here so much everyone in this joint knows me by name. Don't get fancy and try to order thai or chinese food here. Stick to the Vietnamese food. I like their pho, pork chops and cubed steak. This place does get a little rowdy the later it gets into the AM (partiers) Can't beat that it's 24hrs!

fnV8m0hgVkjo9QQybwkc5Q.text: Phokim long line? Nope. We got here post clubbing at marquee around 3 am.. We got seated right away for a party of 7!  The food was phokim good and didn't have to wait that long!   The service was phokim great and they're open 24 hrs!  This place is phokim awesome! It's where the locals go and I will keep coming back to this place every time I'm in vegas!

HpcxEk6zz5di7x5XFlAB9w.text: My family and friends went there on last weekend. Pho has too much MSG, the services were bad and they demanded tips. I don't mind tipping but the service much be good enough to earn the tips.  The food were bad and the services were even worse.  We won't come back here again.

zrWaIDqhRLW4f0JnulijZA.text: I'd give this place a 3.5 if yelp would let me. Food was good. I had the pork chop and rice. The ac was broken that night, so it was really warm and a little uncomfortable. The boba was decent. I had the honey dew boba. It was alright. I've had better though. The service was very good though.

RBxakTI1jr24QeYjfdxC1w.text: This place has some seriously good Pho and I just get vegetables in mine. But the broth is deep and flavorful, the veggies are steamed to perfection with some crunch left in them and the additions (bean sprout, thai basil, lime, hot sauce etc) make the place my happy place. I've brought lots of friends and everyone has become addicted- in fact, I refer to it as crack soup because eating it only leave me wanting more. Thank god there's enough in a large bowl for 3 meals!

CaiCHVP9dY5hFk2BOsEpdg.text: Boo! I'm very disappointed. I LOVED Pho-Kim-Long back then. I came back recently, and I don't know what happened. Changed cooks or something!  My to-die-for pork chop with rice has completely changed flavors. I'm..just...sad. And this time, we didn't have a car, so we had to take a taxi there. It pretty much ended up being a $20 meal for a rice plate. Not worth it.

c3cWWbUm6d_v24R0Nn17jQ.text: Honestly my faverate pho restaurant is pho so 1, but they closed yesterday .. so I went this restaurant instead. No surprisingly, the servers were not kind for customers as always.  and..I found a fly in my pho and they didn't appolozie for that. this place was horrible... I will never go back!!

HjdDwsJr4-ZcjfUz_4SfFA.text: Great place for good food, quick. The best for late night eats after cruising the late night haunts. Always packed, great looking people. I would like to rate this place a 4, but my last trip ended with a local kid, driving a far too big Escalade tagging my side door. Security at the door, but they should have better security in the parking lot. Great late night place, but if you value your car, park with caution.

lXPjoUVLm6LER0ypTgwFZw.text: This is by far one the best PHO houses in Las Vegas.  I love late night spots and this one has my heart.  I suggest getting the large Pho Tai every time.  It's what I go for!

JfO2KrriyyJTeimxj9USpA.text: This place is terrible. We walked in and the hostess didn't bother to greet us, she just looked up and said 3 and walked us to a table. I was never asked if  I wanted a  drink. 2 of us went to grab something from the car and while we were gone the waiter took the other member of our parties order. When we came back we waited and finally had to flag  down the waiter. The menu had no descriptions of the entrees and the waiter was not helpful in explaining anything. The dishes are WAY over prices and the don't come with veggies or rice. My food left much to be desired. The customer service was awful the staff as unhelpful, un-attentive, and rude. I won't be back.

bLDawRPE7BYv7o2_cpYfig.text: Open 24/7!  Honestly, I don't remember what I had but it was good!   All I know is, if I were hungover, I will hands down convince all my other hungover friends to go here and have some good, homemade Vietnamese food!

UXxZK04naVVdLHe_PsRvpQ.text: The pho is good here. The perks of this place being open 24 hours outweigh the sometimes lackluster service and the fact it doesn't have the best pho in town.  Besides, I've never been here except between the hours of 2am - 7am. Everyone is hammered so the food automatically tastes better!

7LwhsaCZ8kkaTSP5EK5rrg.text: I first heard about this infamous "Pho " house from my hubby, we laughed about the name, and said only in Vegas... My son said, "this place has a controversial name...", LOL. (we didn't think he'd notice)  Normally, I don't leave the Casinos, not even to eat.     = O  But, we were on our way out, so we stopped here. (we obviously lost and were eating cheap...)   = (  I have to say I didn't know what to expect, vietnamese hooters girls, "would you like spring roll mister?!?", while playing sleazy porno music...bada bow bow... (my lame try at cheesy porn music), dimly lit with sticky tables. But I figured, yes, I've gotta see this place for myself. (I'm crajee like that) (Korean for crazy)  It is located in an Asian strip mall, packed parking lot, so watch out, if you know what I mean...  ; p  The place is actually pretty decent inside, it has obviously been expanded from it's original layout. Looks like your typical Chinese family style restaurant. Thank goodness there were other kids in the restaurant... there could of been a screeching of disco records as we walked in with our 12 yr old...   As soon as we walked in we were greeted and taken to a table and given menus. I love Thai Iced Tea and Thai Iced Coffee.... (ask for extra half and half on the side and you can elongate your drink, I always do) The servers are pretty courteous as well as efficient, and the food was decent, the orders did not come out as fast as I would of expected from the given service. This was the only problem. They had  brought my order out wrong and we didn't want to have to wait again for the right dish. So needless to say wasn't too thrilled about that Pho Kim Long wait for the wrong food.    That is why they only get 3 stars from me, besides the place better be "Pho King" Amazing to deserve more stars.  That's a good name "Pho King", or "Pho King Good", hmmmn... (probably been done....Phok)  We are all so Phonny....not. (slapping my own face)  They are OPEN 24 hrs... duh...Vegas.

yo_MsX51-zloWgpX0kd69g.text: Great menu selection, fast service, and open 24 hrs. At midnight on a Wed the place was pretty crowded. That should say enough about the quality of their food.

So the owner obviously hates Mexican people!!! Pinche Chong lee !!!

9LCOHcRWA-zWa1IE5hciSA.text: Alright I think it's time I move into finding another place for pho. There is usually about  ten people working at night. It gets pretty busy. I can usually put up with the horrible customer service, but one thing I won't put up with is gross socks laying around the floor.   I came here with my boyfriend around 9 pm on a Saturday night and we came across a batman sock laying in the floor next to the aquarium where they have the puffer fish by the entrance.   I  told my boyfriend about it he didn't think it was serious so we went ahead to eat. What proceed next was me keeping an eye  to see how long it will take for them to pick it up.  I tried telling the three different people who tried to take our order, but by the time I was going to tell them they had disappear. In Tokyo it took about twenty minute for a waiter to grab a napkin and grab the batman sock laying in the floor to dispose of it in the trash can.

jNmr6s9J8CeFnIFSnVucKA.text: Mmm I love coming to spring mountain for Vegas hangovers. After a night of heavy drinking and partying you just want a nice bowl of pho Dac biet.  Nice restaurant it's clean and spacious. Staff is super friendly.   Their food is delicious the green oily veggies are great. I've had a lot of stuff here and it's all pretty damn good

VLyxoLGgYm1gK49TxP8BSQ.text: Pho Kin Long is the best casual dining restaurant in Las Vegas. It is open 24 hours, 7 days a week! My favorite thing about Pho Kim Long is their consistency, every time I come (whether afternoon or 5am) they are always consistent!

XDPLMwg8qKQQuyD7Yni6Eg.text: During this visit we didn't have time to dine in. We placed an order with Julline? ,think that how she spelled it)  at the hostess counter. She was friebb takeout pho for me, and for a sick BFF hacking away in our hotel room,than  a courtesy phone call to asked if any one else would like to order? Big mistake! walk out with $100 worth of pho, one order of fried egg rolls, 2 drinks and the owner threw in a complimentary bean dessert in a cup.   Our beef pho, we all mentioned it tastes  bland.

dA0M0iWoy-TvS4pNK_uD4g.text: The only vietnamese restaurant i trust! Compare before the service here now is way much better!
