b63ivuPhi4EqP_RxHCpS3Q.text: Came here at around 2 am on Saturday morning and there was about a 10 minute wait. Ordered the pho tai and it came out literally within a few minutes. The restaurant is clean, service is good, and the pho was tasty! The broth wasn't too salty and the rare steak was sliced thinly. Definitely glad that there's a good pho place just couple miles from the strip, I'd go back for sure!

7tzbVMK3b97HZ1pTJll0wA.text: What happens in Vegas shouldn't stay in Vegas, because I wish an awesome restaurant like this existed in my home town and not just Vegas.  This restaurant is located in the Vietnamese area. It is one of the best Vietnamese restaurants we have eaten at.  Our party of 14 was sat down right away.  Service was quick.  Best of all, everyone enjoyed their dishes, ranging from Pho Dac Biet, Bun Bo Hue, Bun Rieu, Pad Thai, fried calamari, Crab Rangoons, Ca Kho To, Com Chien, and Com Tam.  Isn't it amazing how one restaurant can manage to please 14 people, ordering such a variety of dishes?  I had ordered Bun Rieu for myself and was extremely impressed how colorful, flavorful, and rich the broth was.  The rieu and tofu in my bowl of Bun Rieu soup were tender and spot on.  Half way through the bowl, I decided to share my Bun Rieu with my husband and switched to eating his remaining bowl of Pho.  I thought I would be disappointed to eat Pho after having eaten the yummy Bun Rieu, but boy was I wrong.  His Pho was so good too.  I highly recommend this place.  It will be our go to Vietnamese restaurant when we return to Vegas!

E_fURdLZDbpBnOVfQ55kbA.text: What do you do after a wild night in Vegas? Come here!  It's nice that this place is open 24/7 and it has variety of things to choose from on their menu. The service and food was fast and good. You can't beat it!

WrIapivZmxx7uOwtcmM9mQ.text: The best pho I've had in a while. Another 6 out of 5 stars, unofficially on this one. I'm having a lot of 6 star meals these days...  I feel like you have to go off the strip in order to get good authentic Asian food, particularly pho. And you will definitely need your pho fix after a night of drinking! It's definitely one of my favorite hang over meals...I loved the flavor of the soup, and the meat quality wasn't sucky like a lot of other places.  Since we had a group of girls, there were a variety of other dishes that were delicious. Since it's been a while, tho, I can't really remember each dish...but here goes:  There was a stir fried udon plate that was really realy good. Actually, it's one of the dishes that we took back to the hotel, to-go...and later had as a midnight snack. I know, gross right? But hey, it was perfectly fine!!! No tummy aches...  We ordered the pea shoots for our veggie dish, and it complemented all the other dishes so well. It really helps to have a veggie dish to go with the meat-y, rich dishes.  The calamari (or maybe it was fried squid?) was nice and crispy, with lots of extra crunchy flakes on top. We probably over ordered here, but at least we got to try a variety of dishes!

RW4cDD5XNRPIcXcYttPIvQ.text: Very bad experience with this RESTAURANT! I am a big fan of this restaurant but my friends Had a bad experienced with them couple months ago. They said they ate a long hair on a Calamari, and ants on the soup when they told to the guy the hair the take the plate and manager gave them attitude too bad they never took pictures. Manager kick them out and told them health department wont close them down and they will make a lot of money anyways even they did took picture of the hair and ants.  I could not believed it because I haven't seen it. Long story short I was placing an order today on the phone as of 7/12/17 12:05am and spoke with an old guy. Told the guy my order there was a language barrier and for some reason this guy yelled at me on the phone saying ONE BY ONE . I did not get what he meant so I responded slowly so he can understand my order i only order 2 but he is giving attitude and hang the phone. Tried calling back 6 times but does not want to answer. I stop calling back because im afraid they might do something to my food like my friend said.  Just a piece of advice to anyone trying to place an order U never know what they put and what they can do on ur food.  Very bad customer service.  I wont take risk if u do be my guest.

fpqBhLGFceNuSnNdTj3NAQ.text: its a 24 hour pho spot close to the strip. Located in a strip mall. Enough parking. Fast friendly service. Pho was ok, I've had better. A large is about $8. Decently priced. Would i be back? Yes, I will. I love the convenience of the place and its a nice break from the strip.

Emva5DZqVnlgQyxKtrQ9Bw.text: I love this place BUT, if it's busy... good luck! Food is great point blank! But, the busier it got, you could see the staff loosing their cool. And it was VERY apparent. A lot of them would just stand around and not know what to do and you could see the frustration of not knowing what to do... :-/ And they are rushing themselves so much that when they went to put the bowl of pho down at my table, they spilled some of it onto me... I let it go and said nothing because I could see how stressed everyone was... go when it's not so busy. You will get WAY better service with delicious food.

VBZz89bHbLIY0G8VPq6tQw.text: I used to come here a lot after a night of drinking to get something in my belly since they were always opened .   Came again recently completely SOBER, and I must say their pho is delicious and didn't give me the super tired/thirsty feeling I get when I've had too much msg .   So I'd say I favor this place over pho so 1 and definitely over district one (has the most msg) .

IuN_epyAmq-OCY3-j-rGqg.text: first things first, their seating situation needs to be fixed.. they kept losing the list and would seat people that arrived after us! second, the waiter didn't greet us and just asked what we wanted to order. we gave him our order and he walked away. TWENTY MINUTES later our food has finally arrived to our table and as he's setting my Pho down it tilted a bit and spilled my soup on the table, he apologized and i asked for napkins to clean up but he never came back.. this use to be my favorite spot to come and eat but now i'm considering to go elsewhere.

GRcte549nBwbKIVAomeNAA.text: This location has mixed reviews but when you're in need of recovery food after a long weekend in Vegas, any pho place nearby would do.  The restaurant is very large and the workers are attentive and have better customer service than typical Vietnamese restaurants.  I was not used to them checking up on my table - they asked us how our food was, how everything tasted, and if we needed anything else during our meal.   My cousin ordered the shrimp pho but her order came out to be pho tai.  When she informed one of the workers what the problem was, they took it back and then brought out her shrimp pho with a lot of noodles and shrimp lol. There was no problem with the order change, which was unexpected.  I also ordered their Vietnamese iced coffee.  ITS IS STRONG!!! And so so good.  I ordered a small bowl of pho tai, which was the perfect size for me.  There were a lot of noodles and meat but what threw me off was their broth.  I guess they have good days and bad days but it was too oily for me.. You could see all the oil swimming around.  Besides the excessive oil in my broth, it was decent and did the job as recovery food.

H2yQWk8osYrdZinVJulrRQ.text: Terrible service. They forgot two of six orders and when they finally brought it out it was clear that it was one order split in half. Server just gave us dishes without telling what dish it was nor serving the dish to the right person. Food was mediocre.

-zXACNl5nUbFJX2G-YwYsA.text: I hate that I'm having to put a review on my favorite place I can't even explain how much I love their food here even though there's times where it hasn't been the greatest. Two years ago I used to come here faithfully every day after work and spend over $20 every day by myself that's how much I used to love this place..... But as time went on I stop coming as much due to their service, The employees treat you so disrespectful and sometimes you sit there for 15 or 20 minutes before anybody comes to your table and you gotta make sure you ask for everything the first time because then you won't see them at all. But when you are done and ready to pay they demand a tip when sometimes they don't even deserve a tip......  I now come here occasionally do to the fact that the guy that collects your payment at the register is such an asshole. I now do deliveries and I hate coming here because since I'm not the customer and I'm the person delivering the food I feel like they treat you worse then when you are the actual customer. One time I had the guy at the register snatch the receipt out of my hand so disrespectfully that I had to snatch the receipt back and I told him not to ever snatch anything out of my hand I had never felt so disrespected and his response was definitely uncalled for. So today I happen to have a delivery there again and once I walked in the door and I realized it was him I honestly just wanted to cancel the order to avoid dealing with him but I said fuck it maybe today he will be in a good mood but nope, So I finally asked him today, What was his name he states his name is Jason I also asked him are you the owner and he states he is. Ooooh and before he process my transaction there with a guy before me and I realize that I wasn't the only one that got that kind of treatment he literally threw the credit card back at the guy and then when the guy just grabbed his card and just walked away he started laughing....... So at this point I tell him that he is the most disrespectful person I have ever met and that he is super rude and he roles his eyes and says not one word. It's crazy that an owner or he states he's the owner((Jason)) would even treat his customers like that. You would want customers to come back, And this guy has been there for years as long as I've been going there I have seen him there and it seems like he just hates his job so fucking much and if that was the case why would he hire somebody else to do the job for him because obviously he hates being there or at the register. Honestly like I had mentioned in the beginning I hate having to put a review on them but I'm tired of every time I go in there I literally get treated like shit and it's hard because I love their food but then I hate their service it's like damn I work as hard as they do and I don't ever treat my customers the way they treat me they need a lot of cleanup to do with their customer service skills because it is beyond the word horrible. If you are out wanting to enjoy yourself on your day off ect..... I definitely wouldn't recommend coming here because the way they treat you here will definitely get under your skin.

uXblChD9X4TpfxOUPuEQ2Q.text: Their pho isn't good at all. The broth was watered down with some hard ass noodles. This place gives pho a bad name. I don't see how it stays so busy. The inside of the place looks nice, maybe that's why people come.

TgoOFdzY24wTYmn4tA5J_A.text: We really enjoy coming to this restaurant I'm surprised i haven't reviewed it. Our party of 19 was surprised to have a very short wait time. We were seated within 10 minutes of our arrival. Our food came out fairly quickly after we ordered. The salt and pepper calamari and pork chop was a little on the greasy side but still very good. My parents ordered the plain porridge and it was exactly what they were craving. I recommend to add a little bit of soy sauce for some extra salt (it was a little bland without it). What stood out the most in this meal was how perfectly cooked and well seasoned all of the veggie dishes were. I highly recommend this restaurant when in the area. The wait staff is kind and diligent and give very good recommendations.

3ZzaylrN8qe9sp7fxdbGoA.text: Can't beat a nice hot bowl of PHO after a long night of painting the town red in Sin City! I order the DAC BIET pho w/tendon (an additional $1) & definitely hit the spot! The size of the pho was definitely worth every penny! This is my go-to pho joint every time in Vegas!

BECuIbRmCItnbvPrfEIUBA.text: Came in here lunch around 12 pm and the food here was great! The pho here does have flavour in their broth but I taste more star anise and herbal flavours in their soup. I prefer my soup to be more salty and has a more beefy flavour. Our waitress was really nice and helpful and very quick on service as well (I think she was the manager)! The pho though definitely needs more meat in their large as I did not seem to get as much as I thought. Would come back again!

V90V9PzpIj6me3uFACO9sA.text: The line was relatively long (~hr wait on the weekend) and I can agree it's the best Vietnamese restaurant in VEGAS ... but only Vegas. I took off one star because I didn't really enjoy my broth, they don't serve tripe with their pho, and their service was bad. We had to constantly remind the waiters to bring us things (sauces, straws, beansprouts,etc), not surprising though since it is a busy restaurant.

vBas1VRSyZ3OZXgDjJkYZA.text: I never tried pho before and when my sister and her husband took me and my girlfriend here, I don't think we had the best experience here  And I'm not sure what it was but me and my girlfriend hated it. It was just so bland. I had to put so much sauce and add ins to make it any better and it just wasn't enjoyable at all. Really bummed. My sis and brother in law loved their pho. And the service was kinda rude. Once I got a egg drop soup to go I tried it later shortly after and omg that was even gross. Worst egg drop soup I've ever had. I'm at least Never going back again

2t5bJsBTZd_qRujRPRWd3g.text: I have been frequently visiting this place since 1996 and have continued bringing friends, family, and coworkers . I wanna say to the staff, workers and management thank you from the bottom of my heart for your dedication, hard work and love. You folks are truly what makes the place what it is and continues to be. I visit at least five times a month and everybody I bring has loved it! Thank you soooo much! With all my heart my favorite place to eat and will stay a valued customer!

rudG5hBnTWSUEa083VXAEg.text: Yeah, who woulda thought a place called Pho Kim Long would actually deliver. Every time someone would tell me they liked this place, I just laughed inside thinking there's just no way I can take a place with such a name seriously. I came back here for a second try, since for my first try I wasn't in the right mind set at 3a.m. to be making any type of accurate judgement call. I just HAD to come back and double check.   I went back here for lunch, and the broth is by far my favorite for pho in Vegas. My faith was in viet noodle bar when they first opened, but they've gone downhill for me over the past year. Annie pho is also popular, but I never enjoyed their pho broth much either.  DON'T STOP, PHO KIM LONG, cuz you da bomb.

JxOGOj0izchtx7VrOFp4Rw.text: Wonderful!!  We got there and there was a lot of people on this list as a packed house... asked how long they thought and the guy told us 10 minutes so we waited and it was 10 minutes!!   This place runs like a well oiled machine. Everyone has their job and they all were working so hard and doing an awesome job.   We were in a bit of a hurry. We were able to order immediately... we looked at a menu while waiting. Our food was out in minutes and delicious!!  Happy we found this place. Thanks for being awesome :-)

iWshSA8-VqJFmoWK8FkdhQ.text: Nice and clean spot for a good bowl of Pho.  Fried egg rolls were great too.  The only reason I didn't enjoy the experience 100%, and this was really not a fault of the restaurant, was because of the customers next to us.  As soon as their food arrived, they both started playing some video/TV shows on their phones.  Yes, two phones!  Each person had his/her phone out and was watching something on the phone.  It was the weirdest thing to see and annoying to hear.  We had Vietnamese coffee to go after we finished our meal.  It was quite strong and delicious.

0LTUVHr-BSFIgwkzGEitZQ.text: This was my first time coming here and it was delicious. Visiting from California so we wanted something warm. The pho was delicious, just wished it was a little hotter. We came back the next day and it was just as good. Staff is friendly and speedy. The lady helping us was very pleasant and friendly. We love Pho and this place did not let us down. We will certainly come again when visiting Vegas. Although it was busy, we were seated quickly and our food came out fast. So good!

58jCIh5ngTbf5BbwNAt8kw.text: Great food. The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. We had many dietary restrictions and not only did they know what has gluten but also very accommodating. Vegans are welcome here big time too.

IRg5upLW-rJPJuRDCQrCTA.text: Zero stars. We got take-out only to find that the shrimp inside their spring rolls were clearly uncooked. Completely unacceptable and inedible. Really shocked and disappointed since it is clearly not cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got to-go spring rolls and the shrimp is NOT cooked. Major problem.

mMrxLUJ627Qp7k-fJ57VDg.text: Sat down for 3-4 minutes at our table and was reafy to order. The maitre was nearby so we called for her to get someone to take our order. She harshly says, "You need to wait five minutes to order", and then walks off.  I found it extremely disrespectful, especially with her tone. I've never heard of this order wait period unless someone can confirm it for me.  The food overall is great and comes in on time.

FySEwjoKRJWgQDICR7ZpsQ.text: Open 24 hours! Yes!!! Came here after the club at like.. 3AM.. starving.  The place was packed!  Our food came out fast and was tasty.  The only downfall is trying to catch a cab in this area.  Took a while but that's ok.. worth it for the food haha

nSOq5pl-RNCHbRlmo9HdzQ.text: Date/Time:  Saturday - 12pm Occasion:   Lunch to kick off the weekend Party of:  Four Ordered:  pho tai bo vien; steak on the side Total incl gratuity: ~$10pp  What Vegas trip is complete without stopping by for pho?  This place is really nice for a pho restaurant.  Decor is clean and modern.  The food is good too.  Broth comes out nice and hot too.  Must give props to their extra attentive and friendly service.  I ordered pho tai bo vien with steak on the side.  They inadvertently forgot to give me steak on the side.  I actually didn't even say anything and the manager brought out a plate of steak as well as a hot bowl of broth for me.  Very considerate.  A must visit for those visiting Vegas looking for a remedy for their hangovers.  Avoid primetime lunch on weekends -- wait tends to be a little longer.

HBtS5k_VG2ZD2vsItC5fbQ.text: Their egg rolls and crab langoons are so good and the food comes out super fast. In fact, our to go order came out faster than our friend's order, who was getting some bahn mi a few doors down.  I came here three days in a row. Each day it was busy. Hmn....

SEkp4tmAobWYTpDBWHmRBw.text: Food was good once again, came because it was 24 hours! Service was bad again. Higher rating because it was packed and there was so little staff. He was busting his butt, just sucked that I had to get his attention by walking up to him, we wanted to order more food. And were so thirsty. sigh

j-GVzxw-swbaIMdtpAXwgA.text: I am not sure why people hate on this place. It's still my favorite pho place even after I've moved to SoCal. Maybe it's because I'm not a pho connoisseur but I think this place is awesome. AND it's open all the time. C'mon now.

v0Yglh0k955R3aeiGTPqcA.text: Boyfriend and I wasn't impressed  Pho was decent  But the bun bo hue was very bland. I also had ask for a hot tea Togo and the guy said they don't do Togo hot teas? How interesting

CIIhvPcfQ8QvbM04NkGL-Q.text: I am always weary when it comes to going to Vietnamese restaurants. I am also kind of hesitant when it comes to Vietnamese restaurants that serve Chinese food. With that being my family's background, it is hard to eat at some places and not say that one of my parents could make it better.  It has been forever since I went to a restaurant with the intention of getting pho. I came here with a group of friends to celebrate one of them getting a promotion. None of us ordered from the Vietnamese menu. It is probably for the best, because I am unforgiving most of the time.   Instead we got items off of the Chinese menu and did it family style. The eggrolls and crab rangoons are nothing special. I would rather skip the appetizers and just order more entree dishes. The Pepper Beef is generous and comes with a beautiful array of broccoli. Mongolian Beef was tender and had a decent flavor to it, but it lacked the kick. Kung Pao Chicken had me searching out for the hot peppers to make up for the previous dish. The Singapore Noodles came in a mountain sized portion and had a subtle curry flavor to it. The stand out dish was the Honey Garlic Porkchops. They are phenomenal. Large pieces of boneless and bone in meat fried crisp, tossed in a lightly sweet sauce, and topped with fried chopped garlic. I was grabbing piece after piece.  Not only is Pho Kim Long a place to sooth your hangover. It is a place to get it started. With a decent selection of mainly imported Asian beers and a few common domestics, you can begin the party. Add in some cold sake to do sake bombs and you have a party. With 2 apps, five entrees, and three rounds of drinks we paid $120. It is a deal.

OrGqLMBCZIbE8PCeaEZFkA.text: We always eat here when we visit Vegas... This place is 24 hours and the food here is AWESOME! Especially their House Fried Rice!!!

n0YYATFI8YpEc3NKOk6kyA.text: I love the food here but it seems like the service is getting worse and worse ..  they need an employee remodel

n1ihOVgd3r4onyKLGyxWCA.text: Place is very busy but well worth the wait. People in town say it's the best pho place to eat. My food has been amazing both times I have been there this week. Our server didn't listen to my order and when I told her it was wrong but I ate it she didn't care lol. I will still go back because it's that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #23 added shrimp and extra noodles. Simply amazing!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot stickers were very good!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got the #26 buhn with extra shrimp and added chicken. Amazing!

xOnNzyqXXP7wbQIRcLNtTg.text: Lunch service is horrible,  I had to write about it.  I've been 1 time at dinner,  3 times for lunch.   They are super slow once you get to your table, our server acted annoyed to answer questions and gave the impression he had better things to do.  Food is still great, dinner crew bussers works hard.  Sad face for trying to beat the crowd.

xkh6vfkeiATVsERNaBF5uA.text: Pho is the ultimate hangover food! But in Pho Kim Long's case, it's the best place to get pho at 8 in the morning after having a group of guys crash your suite and force you to take shots at 7a.m. and refuse to let you go back to sleep.  I bad the Bun Bo Hue which I never had before. It came with beef and pork feet, but since I don't eat pork feet I gave it away. I heard it came with blood and intestine as well, but  I am very thankful that they did not include it in my dish! I've had better eggrolls and better spring rolls, but when you are hungry at 8am, food is food!  The prices are very decent here. The food came out fast, the service was fast and the servers were friendly. I would come to this place again if I ever wanted pho/vietnamese food  in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Bo Hue

PAJNFPfZV1UQ3XD09j78Ag.text: My friends and I go eat at pho Kim long often. The food are delicious. The place is pack with people most of the time. One of my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas

4Y-fyEGlLHusMpjr7rtwQg.text: Pho Kim Long is in Vegas Chinatown.  It's open 24hrs!  It's in the strip mall called "The Center at Spring Mtn".  Lines can be long here.  I went when it wasn't busy on Wed 12/28/10.  Got: iced coffee - it's made for u then brought in a Styrofoam cup - taste ok. Seafood rice noodle soup - small bowl, some fish cakes, a few fish balls, taste ok Pho - B. thought it was alright. On Choy - Chinese greens we liked it.  Credit cards allowed.  Separate bathrooms in the back.

717jk6YiJbV1sQOgK9JRLw.text: This place is nothing comparing to the restaurants in OC but I guess it's average for those that came from other states. Their bun thit nuong only has a couple pieces of meat. The dishes here are quite expensive. And if you order any com Gia dinh dishes, plan to wait 30 min for them to be ready.  Ain't nobody have 30 min to wait..crazy!

GeyItbove8meObonxcWyhQ.text: The restaurant was packed so we decided to give it a try. The pho we ordered did not taste anything like we've had in North American and Vietnam. They messed up our order. It had beef tendons which were gross and not mentioned in the description. They forgot to add the extra vegetables for asked for.  We didn't eat any of our food and instead of offering to let us get something else or correcting our order, we just paid our bill and left.  We are very disappointed and would never return again.

KfOBrp_v9tqhfC7hu49eYA.text: Reeeeally good broth on the beef pho! The servings are pretty huge and the meats are super tender and flavorful. No wonder this spot is considered the best Vietnamese spot in town! I just wish we didn't always fee rushed outta there.. I get that there's always a line, but as soon as I was done with my bowl they were cleaning up the table and kept trying to take our check back before we were even ready.. Haha..we get it, we are heading out ;) Definitely try this place if you're craving pho!

6O66l8b9gicAIpYSzQgNEQ.text: This use to be one of our favorite stops for pho in Vegas.  I don't know what happened but it was not as good as we remembered.  Portions have decreased, hardly any noodles in the large bowls, soup was lukewarm, and the Vegan pho was extremely salty. Service was subpar, appetizer came after our main course. Worse of all I saw one of the staff leave the restroom without washing her hands. Sadly we'll have to look for a new place for pho.

DWlK1SppTyPQNtZSx3wJrg.text: So their service is terrible. I'm sorry to say. Our party consist of 11 people and it was only my family that came first (4 of us). One of the waiters seated us and said, "ok these two tables are yours." Like alright that's fine thank you. But then 5 minutes later, the other waitress seated a family of 4 on our other table. I said to them in a polite way, " I'm sorry, but this is our table because we have a party of 11. I really am sorry." They understood and walked to talk to the waitress that pointed them there. The waitress came back to me and said, " is there a problem?" In the most bitchiest way possible. I said, "this is our table and you decided to place that family here." She said," is your party here?" I said, "no, but your waiter sat us down and told us we can save it." She said, "no you can't do that. Go back to the waiting area." I just followed because it is Christmas and because we should just cut the crap. After 5 minutes, they sat us down and said, "next time, make sure all your people are here." Pretty much there isn't gonna be a next time. We basically switched tables 3 times. Because they also said, "the big table is open. You guys should switch." So we did.  But this waiter, that told us to switch the 3rd time, apologized for the inconvenience of the switches and her coworker.  On to the food, they forgot to put in my order. I'm used to it because for some reason, at most restaurants, they forget my order. It's alright. The food in general, was alright. Everything was alright. Theres not wrong with it nor was there anything good about it.

WNf67ePiKCqUoTdrEWSKbg.text: Seeing "best Vietnamese sign" outside sparked my interest so went in expecting great if not good authentic Vietnamese! The bun Bo que was the worse that I have ever had. Very salty, fatty cuts of brisket, and the broth tasted like bad pho broth mixed with sate sauce. Saving grace was they had 2 pigs toes which is authentic part since some parts of Vietnam use pigs feet or oxtail to make the broth. Veggies were disappointing along with their house fried rice. Their egg rolls were good with the lettuce for wrapping. Plenty of other great choices in china town though! Service was good...

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Bo que

XfxCPRoyUa1kTd7DjDee3g.text: LOVE PHO! especially after drinking lol   i came here completely sober though and the food didn't wow me.. the one thing that was impressive was their speed!  i swear food came out within 5 mins after we ordered! sometimes i wonder what they do in the back... best not to know, right? lol   we ordered fried rice, some orange chicken and pho-- funny thing, the pho came out last.  you think they would bring that out first since it requires barely any work to prepare.  anyway, the pho was decent-- it hit the spot alright.  but portion wise is a little small... i mean for $7 bucks, you can't expect too much-- it was enough food for little o me, i don't know about anybody else though.  i have my doubts about how authentic this place is.. seems like it's more of a chinese restaurant than a pho joint-- anywho, as long as i got my pho sometime after drinking, i'm happy :)

NZtHqJjkRa8afNcY2lgluA.text: Go there for the food and not the customer service. It always busy after midnight, and not much space for parking. So you might have to wait a while to get seated. Their Pho is so good though and that's what keeps them busy.

QI4yLMw8wyN2ZKnNMNRjgw.text: I had this pho a couple years ago and it is not the same anymore. I was a little scared when this place is a 24 hour restaurant. It is a great idea for vegas, but not for a consistent flavor of pho soup.   The service is ok like any other pho place. The server would come to our table when we just sat down and wait until we decide.   The pho does not have a clear sweet broth with a full load of complex spiced flavor. There was a cloudiness to the soup. The bo vien (meatball) has a consistency of an Italian meatball but it has no flavor at  all. Usually the bo vien has a bounciness when I bite into it. The brisket and rare flank tasted fine.   The vermicelli w/ grilled pork and egg roll was not the best I've tasted. However if I was craving for this after all the buffet I went to, this will do.        --The grilled pork is lean and nicely charred, but not too mind-blowing of a flavor.         It's missing the sweet crusted part of the pork. The egg       --The egg roll were nice and crispy. The stuffing inside was smushy. I couldn't         the meat, veggies, or vermicelli.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vermicelli with grill pork and egg rolls
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grill pork and egg rolls with vermicelli

OseCUSnbM1WOFBrPnX-_eQ.text: 1 star for everything  Foods suck  The customer service terrible , they look like they mad or piss off some thing  I would recomand go other place like PHO SO 1 or PHO BOLSA , the foods & the price better .. Dont waste your time here

oTHNxgT-lCsQSUaZasS7JQ.text: This place has gone downhill. The waiters didn't seem happy when we asked for additional sauce and peppers and didn't even respond a single word.   The spring roll was terrible!! Tasted like it's been sitting there a few hours. The rice paper was stale and the shrimp tasted ... Disgusting is the only word come to mind.  Two bites and I was done.  The Thai Tea with boba...tea was good  ... Boba ... Disappointed. Tasted so bland...I guess I'm just used to Tea Station.  The food is either too bland, sweet or sour. One of the fish dish seemed undercooked.  I've been here years ago and it was never this bad.   Yes, They are busy , but I guess they are happy with the customer traffic that they start to neglect in quality of the food and service.   Great, we are just finished and the waiter walked by and asked, "Finished?" With the most grunt tone...we said, "yes" and he started clearing out table as if we're in the way of the incoming customers.   I hate going to places when they treat their own kind like crap.

zA1uhNFuDquD-cVIa8-QZA.text: We were in Vegas for the long Thanksgiving weekend, and after being outside in the cold all day long, we needed some Pho to warm us up. This place was recommended by a fellow parent that was there for the same tournament as us, so a bunch of us went.  That was actually my first time ordering a bowl of Pho for myself. I usually just order rice and some other meat. My husband is the Pho lover and eats it on a weekly basis.  My bowl of Pho was really good and for that bowl alone, I'd give 5 stars. My husband of course enjoyed his and so did everyone else in our group.  The low stars are because the service was just terrible. To be fair, we were a large group, however, we did split up into 3 separate groups to make it easier on the staff. Or so we thought.  Food came out sporadically and we were ignored by the staff. One guy dropped off two bowls and walked away, and when we were trying to tell him it wasn't ours, he ignored us and continued to walk away. We had to stop another waiter and let him know it was someone else's food.  As our food was coming out (sporadically) the same rude guy would stand so close to me that he almost hit the side of my head with a plate. And later, as we were eating, he reaches right between my husband and me to fill up the spoons that are in the middle of the table! Could he not wait? Or could he not ask us to hand the thing over? And as he was passing through behind our table, I heard him say "behind you, move out of the way" to a customer! He was horrible and seemed miserable to be there.  Would I go back? Probably not, there are many good Pho places out there. But I did enjoy my Pho.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YWElTEHAA1NGARLFM1xApQ.text: Pho Kim long is a favorite local Spot for pho. I've been going for about 6 years and the pho is always really hot and flavorful. The line doesn't go out the door so prepare and come early. It's open late so it's a great spot to eat after a night out. Service is fast and friendly and I would try this pho place first.

x7BzgtnpkrfeTXJwh_UNzA.text: 3.5   I've come here 3 times this year and it is the only place open late. Lines can be long, but take out is immediate. It hit the spot when we needed it to. The pho is decent. The spring rolls are meh.

dU1m00qQh5jSTye573WrUg.text: ah, finally... Vegan Pho!!!! Gotta love it.  You would think that when you order the vegan pho, there would be tofu in it a long with all the vegetables.  Well, there's no tofu in the vegan pho dish.  But it's ok.  It's still very good and tasty.  You can just order the tofu as an appetizer.   I think the service here  is like any other pho place.  If you want something, then you have to call for the waiter to come over. But it's great that this place is open 24 hours!  I would come back here just for the vegan pho and tofu appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Pho

cHnMDlwgJ29yRQMaDo3-Yw.text: If there is a zero star that what i would give them they talk to their customer like trash especially the waitress and also the manager. the we waited in front with 4 kids for 1 hour a party of 14. We complained about the food because their was a dead fly in the noodle and they quickly removed the bowl to hid the evidence. And then started cussing at their customer. I will report you to heart services.

2ayuisO4hG4nlVXk62qN-Q.text: This place is phenomenal. It is open 24/7--thank you Vegas! I come here every time I visit. It's located in Chinatown, and can be very busy. The wait time has been about 20 minutes each time I've gone. You can get pho to go which is awesome, and they definitely don't skimp on the amount they give you--I almost never finish it all. I go back and forth between the 14 (rare beef pho) and 15 (rare beef and brisket). Both are amazing. Great flavor and is consistently good. I read some reviews saying the calamari wasn't good, but I have to disagree. I think it's great. A little greasy, but great flavor. I love the seasoning they use on top. I will continue to come here when I visit, and would recommend it to friends. It is Pho Kim awesome.

raYAWXcJWcjkH3GZS-fa5g.text: Must AVOID if you know good food.  Poor Cheapest meat, Yes, my pho also had glittering shinny pinkish color beef like other people's reviews ...  Nothing tasted  good. Very Salty & Full of MSG !  Served lemon & vegi with MOLD growing, so you can imagine how they care,  Just cheap food that you'll taste cheap quality,  Definitely TO AVOID

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8qe-69ad14SyxbOCYuz1kQ.text: I ate here with a family friend and her mother to celebrate her mom's birthday.   Ugh, unfortunately, I have to say that the folks that run this place ought to be ashamed of themselves.   I already had a bad taste in my mouth even before walking in after seeing the large banner advertising that this establishment is the best Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas.   We waited approximately ten to fifteen minutes for a table, which wasn't too bad after hearing of the epic wait times for a table here.   It wasn't worth it. The pho was extremely unimpressive, with a cheap tasting, salty broth that rendered my friend and me overly thirsty for the next twelve hours. The rare meat tasted as if it were "improperly aged," as I like to term it, and was not fresh at all. Honestly, if it weren't for the dish's soft tripe, I would have given this place a one-star review.   The pork chop that my "aunt" ordered was greasy and dry at the same time. I didn't think that was possible. It seemed like it had been recooked twice over.   To add insult to injury, the basic tea was priced western-style at $1 per person. I'm sorry, but this place does not qualify as Asian due to that pricing structure. Tea is part of the dining experience at any formal Asian restaurant.   The service was cordial but average.   All of the above being said, if I were to give this restaurant some advice, it would be to remove that silly banner. If you need to advertise that you are the best, it means that you clearly aren't or you already had plans to reduce quality and/or cut costs.

cxIIQ9De6rXjtQIzPkveWA.text: Worst service ever! Waiter kept banging plates and bowl like if you don't like what you're doing get the hell out of there!!! Food is okay, I just don't like negative vibes! Does't even deserve 1 star!

bWWRghTwI1O_Scc_p5qXqg.text: Bad service and ok Pho. The server Beng is so rude. I wouldn't recommend this place. There are other good Pho around the same area.

auocSbS7MVUTjFdA8cXjww.text: This was the only Pho location open 24/7, located conveniantly in Chinatown.  Maybe it was the odd hour I stopped by, (Around 5-6am?), but the food wasn't spectacular or something to scream about.  I've passed by this location a few times, and always wondered why the interior/workers were very formal - then I found out it was to perhaps make up for the lack of good food.  Ordered the meatball pho, portion was pretty small. The weather here is FREEZING, and a nice hot bowl of pho is usually the cure!  But this bowl was lukewarm. The meatballs tasted rubbery and artificial. I left

RXtMJ0rxBe7FIHP6hP7dZA.text: Only ok, Vietnamese soup, pho and bun bo hue, is good hangover juice. I thought it would be good to stop by Pho Kim Long because a decade ago it was really good. Another good sign, there were mostly Vietnamese patrons in the place. But the pho ga (chicken soup) and the bun bo hue (spicy Hue style soup) were barely par. Check that. The bun bo hue was not good, sour, tart, not fresh, and the noodles were over-cooked. The young man serving seemed mute, at first, because all he did was nod or point at the menu items. Service was slow too. Unless it's a hangover emergency, pass on this place until they get back to making good food.

Z45tWcYfNEVWS3sE45qkkg.text: Wanted to check this place out on my recent visit to Vegas. Service was fast. Staff was friendly.  However, I'm not use to seeing that kind of price tag for an average bowl of pho. The noodle was alright. The soup was not memorable. Honestly just a whatever meal.  Would I come back here again? No. There are cheaper and better tasting pho joints in Chinatown.   PS. Women's restroom, dirty...

lmfQSt3RRO71OWe1IYDoUg.text: This is by far one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had. The hostess had an attitude, while all of the staff had the same horrid attitude like we are bothering them by eating at the restaurant. You have to pretty much beg for another glass of water or tea, but when you get their attention to all for another glass of water, it still takes a long time to get it. The only time they were fast was when you gave them them check and money to pay.  The food was okay, but I'm pretty sure I can find better food and service some where else.

xv3dABIeHYVT8IFg_1lzSw.text: I will start out by saying that I have never been here before midnight, but hey, there's nothing like a bowl of pho after a night out with friends.  I like the pho with thin sliced beef and brisket, it's really tasty and the veggies they put on the table for you to add are always super fresh.  The bean sprouts actually are fresh enough that you can hear a snap if you break them in half.  Good, fast service, decent prices, and a clean and busy restaurant make this a good choice if you're in the Chinatown area.  Big plus for being open 24/7.

tM6iucvV6YJfBJawzOpecA.text: open late night, nice prices and an Impressive dining room. yes sir! food is good too And fast!!

u3B9NYeacbTmORsJkpOLFw.text: Ha I love this place. Lotus is better I think, but this place also rocks. I pretty much go here everytime I'm in the area for vacation... which to be honest is at least once a year. Food is good and plentiful. And cheap. Cant really complain about anything really... just a good cheap place to eat while in sin city.

7wv20NP2puHuxAPvrybSvg.text: This is another one of our staples when we come to Vegas. After many Western meals in the hotel, we always need to venture off the strip and pick up some Ca Kho To and Canh Chua Ca. Put simply, it's just good food. They're open 24 hours and the Pho is pretty tasty too. We've been eating here with our family for years.

-Gu4ABKRj82lrR69ao0wnQ.text: let me first start off by saying that the pho kim long in san jose is WAYYY better..the only thing that remains the same at both places is, sad to say but the lack in service.   why this place sucks more in service is because they are really rude and they get angry when you say you're going to "share a bowl". excuse me for buying a jumbo size pho and wanting to share with my bf. jeez. another annoying thing is they grab your bowls off the table when you're still in the middle of eating. it's really rude that they just "assume" that you're done with your food just because you're sitting and talking with your other guests at the table.   3 stars only because i realized pho hung sucks more. minus 2 stars for service and PRICES. they are REALLY overpriced for pho compared to san jose.

kGunSHyo5zctDcNhcq0XfQ.text: I'm giving it 5 stars because this is one the first places I've eaten for Lao/Thai/Viet type food.  I love Basil chicken since being introduced to it but I kick the spicy level down to like  5 just so I can enjoy it. They also have boba drinks which is a plus. But the best part about this, IT'S 24 HOURS and for Casino Industry employees and after clubbing food. This is the perfect place to go. Maybe as I eat more places like this, I'll learn more about the food but for now, this place is awesome.

xMVbL4xSpZmOKjOp-9bpeA.text: Pho Kim Long is my favorite pho place in Chinatown. Great place for both dine-in and pick up. I like that it is open 24 hours and always filled with a good looking crowd. The #14 rare steak pho is always my go to choice.

5njG6xPZTnesKBdMuxbe1Q.text: My friend told me about this place cause he and his friends goes to Vegas all the time and they always come to this place. We stayed at the Rio this time so this place was literally down the street. Decided we wanted to try this place out cause we didn't want to pay $20 for buffet at the casino. This place is pretty good. I ordered a bowl of pho dac biet which was like almost $8 and my hubby ordered the vermicelli with egg rolls and charbroiled beef for around $8. Our meal combined was less than $20.  Later that night my friend wanted pho so I came back with her and this time I ordered the vermicelli with egg roll and charbroiled beef and she ordered the pho. It was equally yummy. I like how they have so much choices of pho, rice plates, vermicelli, etc.    A lot of people come here so this place does get packed. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll most likely come back here cause their food is so yummy. I like how it's open really late so you can go anytime like after clubbing. Pho is a good hangover remedy :)

kXkyrPcLTEnelQjoaXlk2A.text: If the food does not make you sick, the customer service will!  This place is really a 1.5 stars for me, but I'm going to round up for these guys.  The hostess in the front desk was pretty cool, but not the rest of the staff.  Sadly that is about the only good thing I can say about this place.  Now on to the rest of the review.  I visited this place because I was in the mood for some pho and happen noticed this place while driving by.  Dropped in and the first thing was the massive waiting line to be seated.  There were lots of people waiting outside too.  Waiting outside on a HOT summer day is not fun.  After 30 minutes of waiting, we were finally called and seated.  This is where everything started to go down hill from here.  We were seated and we knew what we wanted because we were looking over the menu while we were waiting, so we ordered a coconut drink, the regular pho bowl and spring rolls.  The server wrote that down on his notepad and just disappeared.  We waited for at least 30 minutes and not one single item we ordered arrive on our table.  We then started to notice people that were seated after us got their order and they were chomping away.  After about 40 minutes of wait time I was wondering how long it takes to make just a simple coconut drink.  Are they sending a monkey to climb up a coconut tree to retrieve the coconut or something?  We finally saw our waiter and asked him to check on our order and he returned back to us to let us know they were out of spring rolls, therefore they did not make the pho or the coconut drink.  The thing was, the server said it in a way where it was OUR fault that we ordered something they ran out of and that's why they couldn't complete our order.  I just don't understand how when they ran out of one item that is no way related to the other items on the order could prevent the entire order to be made.  It's not like it was a combo or something.  I understand if I ordered a #1 at Mc Donalds and they tell me they ran out of fries, then I would order something else, not make me wait 30 minutes and tell me they are out of fries therefore they can't make the burger.  I really wanted to tell the server to GTFO here cause there is no way you run out of spring rolls in a Vietnamese pho restaurant.  It's the second most popular dish right after pho.  Its like a chinese restaurant running out of rice.  This is a MEGA CATASTROPHIC EPIC FAIL.    The food finally arrived after putting in our order the second time, but the coconut drink did not.  I was about to take off my shoes and go out back to get the coconut down from the tree myself.  The pho dish was OK to average at best!  After waiting 45 minutes of waiting I have the right to have high expectations.  The size of the bowl was really small.  I wonder if they gave us the kids size bowl by mistake.  I can't believe they charge $8 for this kid size bowl of pho.  I can get a bowl of pho that is twice the size for $5-$6 at home!  The coconut drink finally arrived about halfway into finishing our food.  The drink was meh.    In the end, the food was average, but the customer service just left a really bitter taste in my mind.  People think it is a good thing that they are open 24 hours.  No guys, that is not a good thing, they are there to FAIL 24 hrs a day.  Would you like to go to a place that fails 8-10 hrs a day or 24 hrs?  I personally would rather go to a place that FAILS less.

jIKY6QhQhTOjXrQ8eiAdsw.text: Don't know what's all the hype bout this place. Obviously had way better cuz I'm from Frisco... But had better Pho down the street from this place. Hmmm maybe cuz I'm not drunk like all the other viewers here. Am I coming back when I'm drunk? Maybe but to the other place down the block with fresher herbs to start off...

iyA999Du0aeonm4PD7KV_Q.text: What's so great about this place? This seems to be the only pho place Vegas people go to. Always busy, but the food isn't even that great. Shame!

Z_-1-2c17hCxQjU_HFYQdg.text: The service is disappointing. This is my second time here. Eventhough I've had better Pho, I'm a creature of habit when I'm needing comfort food. Pho Kim Long is open 24/7, and both times I've dined after 1am. They were very busy both times. The Salt and Pepper Calamari was a suggestion from my waiter. It was the bomb! I decided to try the Pan Fried Cake with pork and shrimp. It comes with a heaping bowl of lettuce and fish sauce. I didn't know what to do with the lettuce. The bus boy was helpful and very friendly. We were never asked what we wanted to drink. At least we were given water. I had to call the waiter over to order a drink half way through the calamari. I ordered coconut juice which came in the coconut. I didn't have time to enjoy the generous portions of calamari and pan cake. The waiter rushed the two bowls of Pho (noodle soup) and condiments to our table. I wanted to order a dessert but the waiter dropped the check and ran off. We were seated for barely 20 minutes and were being rushed. When he came back to the table I was going to ask for dessert but he didn't give me a chance. He said abruptly, "Sorry, please pay." RUDE He stood there as I dug my credit card from my purse. I felt uncomfortable. My friend asked for boxes for the food uneaten. on our way out the door I heard our waiter rushing another table of 6 people. He mentioned something about a shift change. Then it clicked. Was he more concerned with the tip? WTH? Unlike my soft spoken self, someone at that table didn't take kindly to being rushed. With other Pho restaurants open late to choose from, I think I'll try the other late night Pho restaurants from now on. This place is just not special enough to deal with an unpleasant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. coconut juice
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt and Pepper Calamari

lmoa4f-i80DyjlTBCNXIkg.text: Best Pho spot to get late, late munch after a long night at the Casinos.  Expect a wait, but it will be worth it.  Clean and fast service.

3dkJqgxAWzo8hueJmDkoOg.text: I have been to so many Asian restaurants and their host or hostess is never friendly. But today I went to Pho Kim Long before heading back to Cal., their hostess name Nena/Lena was the amazing.  She was very friendly and she have beautiful smile all throughout the day. We got our drinks and food quickly after they took our ordered.

ymTJkkIrUAhv8GQaT5XIwQ.text: We came here at 3am and I ordered the same thing I did the other day... Pho Tai Sach with the beef on the side. The broth tasted much better this time. I wonder if the time of day makes a difference of how the broth will be. Maybe it depends on what day you come. I dunno... It was however steaming hot this time.

UbIbiBR4YvROFOXkZpzWfA.text: The food is amazing!!!!! I love going there at odd hours of the night as well!! Service is not the best, but I'll keep going back just for the food!

BP9E6xEOrapGU4Li5u_rKw.text: this place always tends to "hit the spot" and helps me with my hangovers I LOVE IT!

p6FE_TFvAjOb92dTCZaHVw.text: Some of the best PHo Ive had....always fast friendly service. comfort food at its best!!!

jfLmXGzyH9h_AZ5z7XAuOA.text: If I'm feening for Vietnamese food, this is my spot. It's quick and service is good. And there's a really cute girl that works the register! The Pho is always on point. The chicken wings are amazing. They have extra crispy skin and the fried garlic they throw on top of it isn't overpowering. (Puts Hooters wings to shame) The rice dishes are bombay! (chicken, pork chops, steak)! They are all very juicy and never disappointing. The spring rolls are fresh tasting. If your a veggie lover, get the chinese broccoli sauteed with garlic. I have never left this place unsatisfied.

OcvGiXhS1U3v_2dAwTMGzg.text: Hands down THE BEST PHO in town!! The Calamari is to die for!!! Just a little fyi your clothes will smell like pho afterwards.

nji6ikfqwkkyZk5PwtFUIw.text: Pho Kim Long was a very classy yet family oriented restaurant with is why it is my favorite place to eat a veriety of foods besides Pho! If you like a place where you can sit and have a couple drinks and talk to your friends or family the atmosphere here sets the mood. The food was cooked nicely! nothing raw nothing under or over cooked. The place is clean and seems up to standard with their health codes, the waitresses are nice, quick and friendly towards you which makes the restaurant feel more comforting! Thank you Pho Kim Long! I will be coming here for a Long time!

k2x82AauCQfx8qHvAwFETw.text: Service is horrible !  Simple as that  I felt like regulars and member of the same race was being favored I waited 15 mins for the table which doesn't bother me at all ! If your busy that's fine  I sat down and waited for 10 mins no water or anything was brought to me ... 20 mins passed I flagged down a busser and informed him I was ready to order can he notify my sever 30 mins passed  And nothing I told my wife to just wait a lil longer and nothin  After 35 mins they can we ordered and I waited for my 23 mins for my food it arrived I ate and had to wait another 24 mins for my check ...

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Number 13

KnNncmpOQQRNqwVTYYEH7w.text: Oooh yay who doesnt know about this place? Welp this is what yelp is for right! Mmmm okay appetizers are always good for sharing (crab rangoon, eggrolls and calamari) is what we ordered. Verry verry good! Also got the chicken and shrimp pho but it was so good i didnt get to take a pic. Lol! Love coming here after work, theres normally not a wait which is great!

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried eggrolls

0G-Q37fqO2EncoRUe7WLlA.text: Quan an ngon, nhiu mon va nhiu la chn. Nha minh ghe Las Vegas chi va a chm quan nay nen an c sang va ti  ay :)

IrHHd_ZQyD4AqvLsKAjpzg.text: The wife and I were looking for some good food to eat between sessions at a nearby basketball tournament.  We shared an order of spring rolls that were quite tasty and @n order of pho with pork and fried egg rolls.  The restaurant was clean, the service was excellent and the food was exceptionally tasty.  Everything was delivered quickly and the entire wait staff was attentive, my wife skipped the rice with her meal and I think every waiter noticed that she didn't have rice stopping by our table offering to get some for her.  I have had similar dishes at other Vietnamese restaurants and while the food was good, the food here at Pho Kim Long was exceptional in comparison.

1pO9y_u4ztk_vtNFhoEjbA.text: Terrible!  I've been to this restaurant before and it wasn't ever this bad in service.  We're not from Las Vegas and when we feel like Vietnamese food, we go here so we thought we would do the same thing this time.  Big mistake and a waste of money! First off, the wait was an hour long which is not a problem but the young lady in charge of this process was overwhelmed and doesn't seem to have this organized.  While she seats people, new customers walking in the door were just grabbing the sign-in sheet on their own and writing their name on it, absolutely no organized fashion.  People were on top of each other. Next, food took some time to get out.  Second, we didn't get refill on our water.  Third, when we got the bill, they charged us for steamed rice ($6!) on dishes that should come with rice. Why would you charge extra on rice if the dishes come with rice??  They were nickel and dime-ing on everything.  Fourth, when we gave our credit card to pay the bill, the waiter asked us, "how much tip should I add on here?"  What??  Who does that??  Shouldn't tips be optional and up to the customer on how much they want to add..AT THEIR DISCRETION???  So feeling cornered, we said 15% is fine.  When we got the credit card receipt back to sign, the waiter rounded up the 15% into whole dollar...HE TOOK UPON HIMSELF TO WRITE IN THE TIP, rounding up!  The worse service ever and I feel like they want to charge you for every little thing possible to make money.  Needless to say, we're not coming back.  If there was zero star, I would put that.

UmRtEJMPe86HKVs-WYuzmg.text: There weren't many vegetarian options, and I wasn't too terribly impressed with what I had, but I was out with friends, and this place has a nice atmosphere to it.  The waiters were all courteous, and took good care of us, as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

10JIVJ_EIZpTBHMLvDn-Ag.text: This place has its perks of being open 24 Hours. Which is a good thing Becuase many night club goers go to this place to grab some drunk food. I suggest ordering the calamari something about it is very crispy. I also like their special pho which is good.

E33jDS0_3ROga0NvH4gt3Q.text: So me and my friend decided to stop into this place and have lunch together..  Me and my friend both decided to start off with appetizers.. Me ordering the calamari and my friend ordering the chicken wings..  However when the calamari came it looked as if it had been sitting in Grease all day, and was not yummy at all.. And then when I told the server that I didn't like it, he did take it back but the other waitresses really rude about it.. Busting out loudly saying what is wrong with the calamari that me and my guest heard it from across the room..  Not very good customer service if you ask me.. She then proceeded to our table and asked me personally what was wrong with the calamari and I may have been a little rude but I told her it was disgusting and she got mad and walked off..   However my friends chicken wings are pretty alright.. Then our food came my file is really good I ate the whole thing..  So besides the yucky calamari and the rude lady my experience was alright but I would never come back again!!!  PS. I even left a $20 tip

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friends food don&#39;t know what it is but looked pretty good

r-ZGZvNKlL7Crq16sePdPw.text: Food was good our server lady was friendly and nice. But the guy who greeted us was rude and very uncomfortable to talk to. I would give 4 or 5 stars if the guy was nice to customers. Replace this guy!

mCg_vexcJc9Ahi2n49vITQ.text: I got the #13 and the broth was very bland. Though they were generous on meat, it was a bit too raw for my liking. The dining room is clean and modern, but i was disappointed by my bowl of pho

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 color drink

6AQr5XlAc2TqQgPsJJKsZA.text: Pho was absolutely excellent! The wait was the only bad part, but everything else was great! The staff were friendly and service was quick. Although the pho was the star of the show, we got the honeydew boba afterward and that was awesome as well!

CpfG1Xn5n78Fru3bZ0VCfw.text: Awesome food but the staff has changed. This used to be a 5 star but I'm now updating it. They mandate a 15% tip and it goes to the owner to pay for the staff. They add it in and write it on your check for you. Terrible and very illegal!

DnIrYYIWF5GiwK1wpwjqqg.text: The food here is so so but I guess with limited compition is why they are so packed.  When we ate here 3 days ago we went to pay for the food.  The person behind the counter demanded a 15 percent tip up front.  My uncle told him that he will be leaving the tip at the table.  The guy told him no and demanded it before he payed the bill.  No where did I see a sign of mandatory tip yet they felt like it was a given.  The people in front of us was also given the same treatment.  I don't shy away from tip,. Would give 20+ percent if I felt like the server deserved it.  This shady under handing tactics made it seem like someone is trying to pocket it without sharing with the server.

-ISY9gQHn4XOTXC-eGUY3g.text: This place has really gone to shit. The last three times I've gone there has been terrible. Only reason I went again and again was to see if they can redeem themselves but NOPE, same terrible ass customer service. They talk down on their customers and make them feel really dumb. Also food has gone to shit as well. Maybe a notch down from mediocre. WE WILL NEVER STEP FOOT INSIDE THIS ESTABLISHMENT AGAIN. Shame on you foe Kim long. I also work in food industry and I will NEVER RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT and forever talk bad about this place.

JQyQmDA7on1AQl2_1q3Y1g.text: I was really excited to try this place out due to the wait time and the good reviews  on Yelp.  The service here is really outstanding. There was a server I wasn't able to catch the name of who took my table's order and when I asked her to repeat it back, she gave me this "Giiiirl, I got it" look and recited it back, "Easy." She was sassy and I liked her.  I ordered the rice with pork chop and cha trung (steamed egg meatloaf) along with a small bowl of soup. It was delicious! The pork chop was one of the better ones I've tried from a Vietnamese restaurant. I also ordered a thai tea with boba. I'm really picky when it comes to boba, and unfortunately the boba here wasn't that great, hence 4 stars instead of 5. The thai tea itself was decent.   I would eat here again the next time I was in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xe-cOqO669Jdl47zYWVocQ.text: Great experience over all.  Food came out fast and was great. The service was very attentive.   Our waiter was very helpful picking out an entree.   The Beijing beef was  flavorful and they offered to make it medium spicy so it had the perfect  kick for me.  Combination pho was one of the best we've tasted.  The appetizer  of salt and pepper eggplant had enough on the plate to be an entree  and was delightful.   This place was perfect.  Casual atmosphere with 5 star food at 2 star prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pho and what&#39;s left of a spring roll
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2hNf8Zpw3QEtpdyciRjPEQ.text: I really need to get out and explore Chinatown a bit more! This 24 hour restaurant is a pretty good place to get a meal after a night out on the town. At 2am, it was busy!  My plan was to get some pho, but I ended up getting something else. I can't even remember the name of it, but it had noodles, salad greens, small egg rolls, and shrimp in it. It was okay, not fantastic- but a lot of sauce helped add some flavor. The service was pretty speedy, and the prices reasonable. The portion was pretty large as well.  Decent food for soaking up the alcohol, and available whenever the mood strikes you!

874PoGm7msD6z8GZrimiBg.text: Pretty decent pho, it is open long time too! Nab up some noodles and enjoy a cozy setting with some authentic noodles!

puJ3uruWcZfVhTgRau8toA.text: The service here has been consistently terrible. We used to come here all the time and bring friends and family when they would come to town, not anymore! Rude staff and you can't even get their attention if you need something. We won't come back again.

UNlhDi--KiOx8__aWq7LKg.text: Best food! I love the spring rolls. The Cornish hen was really good. Honestly everything I tried was good I suggest eating here!
