DsmKYsjGHBJEdpajCEvUag.text: I dead ass only came for the honeydew boba since I had way too much grind earlier at least I took off with the chicken. Nice waitress too by the way.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5fWscZSFvdNgjvVKsyMv8A.text: Prettyyy good for what it is. 24 hr pho just outside of the strip?   Sounds good to me.  I really liked how they had veggie options on the menu.. which was pretty awesome. Vegan pho, count me in!  Arrived around 2AM.. had to wait about an hourish as the line was really long so probably got seated around 3AM. Kinda sucked with our seating as we unfortunately were in swimsuits and we got the table RIIIIGHT smack in the middle, perfect for viewing for the people waiting in the waiting area, and right in front of the kitchen/register area. Fantastic.  So, while me and my girls tried our best to avoid eye contact with anyone other than ourselves, we ordered some warm, scrumptious pho for all of us plus some dishes to go for later.   All in all, I'm totally a fan of the place, considering if one comes to vegas and is staying in a hotel on the strip, goodluck on finding that recovery soup the next morning. Ubering was def no problem at all, lookin at maybe $7 bucks to and from depending on the time you go.   ANYWAY, food was good, service was good, expect a line, will be back again.

KnWlNeq9gt8q7zyiqXg-Kw.text: This place is mediocre at best.   Pros: -seated pretty quickly (there were 7 parties ahead of us) -spacious  -fairly large portion sizes   Cons: -food is bland.  Usually when a restaurant has such a large menu it is hard to have great tasting food. -food comes out at random times.  My husband ordered the Beijing beef and I ordered the tofu dish.  My food came out about 10 minutes after his food. -no refills with water.  I asked our server several times for a refill but he seemed to forgot each time.  I will never come back to this place. They lack service and food is bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beijing beef. Poor quality beef and used a ton of msg.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu dish. Very bland.

unPe2q_OaJfiwjeoSFIOEw.text: This place has good food.the meat is not hard .if you are looking for good pho, you should go here.also the wait time is not that long

YIF3TZXoiOcPQCqtkkMGYA.text: Alright. I will give it a 4 star for my drunken judgements at Vegas, but 24 hour pho. This store owner is a genius. This place is always packed with drunken guests or tourists looking for a quick lunch after their Vegas trip (which defines the exact two moments I came here, after the club and on the way home) it's off the strip in Vegas' little china town and the pho is pretty on point.   The broth is good, I don't like super sweet pho broth, and it had a nice savory taste. They didn't give a lot of noodles, but it didn't really matter to me, I go for the soup. Warm soup after cold nights  and drunken clubbing? It hits the spot. I always get my beef on the side so that I can cook it myself in the soup, if you love pho tai, you should definitely try it this way! The meat stays nice and tender instead of getting overcooked. I tried it one day on the side and one day the normal way and surprisingly it wasn't super dry like most places, the meat was still pretty soft!   If you have a large party, chances are you will get split up, the most they usually seat is a party of 7-8. And prepare for a wait because this place is crackin'.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho tai with beef on the side!

4Vk6DlSKqNh3Ca-9EpOw5Q.text: I pop in here time to time for some quick and hearty pho. Service is fast and food is decent. They're open 24/7 so quality isn't expected to be amazing.

XGkb5kUc8j0tq1I4TdSeEw.text: I used to go to the famous Pho restaurant in California, and always looking for Pho like there. I have been waiting for this time. I found it.  I ordered spring roll, Shrimp Pho with extra broccoli as always and a beer. Spring roll was good. Above all, Shrimp Pho was amazing! Soup was so delicious. I added flavor of soup gradually to enjoy various tastes. First was plane, Second was with Pepper and Third was with red chili. It cost $23, and it is not bad.  It takes about 10 min from strip to this restaurant. I will come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring roll
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pho with extra broccoli

9V3RjDXSipQRK26YXcoXCg.text: Waited a good half hour to be seated. This place was packed! The pho was nothing spectacular.  Def not worth the wait! We were just so hungry from our massage next door.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O0thVTLL_1pRsM-FZWVO4g.text: Look idc what anyone says. This place is the cure for when you're drunk and lit AF coming back from the dayclub/nightclubs and want food in your mouth asap. Their service could be a little better BUT with them being a a 24hr restaurant they're  pretty good. They take your order quickly and if you order pho it's out within 5-10 minutes max within you ordering so that's GREAAAAT! I order a mix of things when I go. Their calamari is bomb esp since I love garlic and they top it off with a generous amount of fried garlic. I'll literally put the leftover seasoning on my rice. Egg rolls are decent but when you're drunk they're really bomb haha. Sometimes I get the combo pho which is pretty good, I feel like some places their broth is too greasy but theirs isn't and it's pretty clear broth which is perfect and how it should be. I will say my favorite dish is their charbroiled porkchops with steamed rice. I always ask for "no bones" cause I hate cutting up the meat when the bone is in. SOOO flavorful, I liiiiive for the shallots/green onions that they put on top cause it seriously compliments the meat. You will not need soy sauce for your rice (talking to the people who put soy sauce on EVERYTHING) since the pork chops are really well seasoned. Great place for lunch, dinner, breakfast whatever! It's 24hrs so get your Vietnamese food fix on anytime - Welcome to Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charbroiled Pork Chop w/no bone, I got it to-go for lunch. Great portion size.

yiOKYsQonpdQGPSPpazNoA.text: It is hard to give this restaurant more stars when the food is lacking. It's great that they are open 24/7 in a city that seemingly never sleeps, so if you're craving some basic Vietnamese food, stop by!   I ordered eggrolls that we're immediately served. I would have given them more props, if the fast service came with hot food. The eggrolls were still crispy but only slightly warm. I ordered the bo luc lac (shaking beef) rice dish and the beef was over cooked and in a heavily sweet sauce.   It took me 45 minutes to get a table. The wait would have been worthwhile if the food was more than subpar.

WWzZDc661wdz8_eFO8YMvQ.text: This place is ALWAYS busy, but for a good reason. Their pho is really good, they bring the food out fast, and the restaurant is big.  I didn't really like the boba tea, but I come to get their pho every time!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination bowl and beef ball bowl. So yummy!! I love this broth.

eEP78s7A6IFqSZObsdOOMw.text: It's difficult to find a breakfast restaurant in Vegas that serves Asian food, but we finally found this one! It serves congee -- only 3 versions though.  Located along the strip mall in Chinatown, with plenty of parking & open 24 hours a day.  We ordered:  4 orders of Congee with preserved egg & pork $9.95: watery congee, kinda salty with shredded pieces of pork meat & small pieces of egg, not the best I've had because the congee was too liquidy!  5 orders of Chinese fried donut $2.95 - they cut up the donut into bite size pieces, perfect to dip into the congee  2 orders of Combination Pho - husband & father in law ordered this, they said it was good  1 order of Yangzhou fried rice - we all shared this dish, it was ok. Nice to see shrimp in there, good if you add some chili garlic paste sauce..  Overall glad we could dine here at 7:30 am in the morning & walk away full

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho, congee with preserved egg &amp; pork, Chinese fried donut

lZn5iaAqFkfTpsbvgdYuDQ.text: Fast, friendly, prompt service. When you ask for it you get it, quickly. And the pho is very tasty!

QWm6hMCqpAjeP5njaTUdzw.text: Pho is a phenomenal hangover cure and to have a restaurant within minutes from the Strip AND have it be 24 hours is probably the smartest business move someone could make.  I've been here twice now; once being at 6am with absolutely no one in the restaurant and another time being during the lunch rush, on a Friday, on a holiday. Both times were at two extremes, but I know for certain that this place does get really packed during peak times. The restaurant is so big, so the wait time isn't nearly as bad as it feels with so many people around. The most recent time I was here, we counted a total of 25 parties ahead of our name, but our party of 7 got seated within 45 minutes, so all in all, pretty reasonable. We unfortunately got stuck sitting in the back room which seems like an extension of the restaurant with what looks to be like an old kitchen counter in the back. Not an ideal seating arrangement, but it was spacious so it worked.  Our table got an order of eggrolls, which tasted pretty much like your average Vietnamese eggrolls. I ordered the #15 Pho Tai Chin, which was rare steak and brisket and was amazing. Perfect size portion and the broth was so soothing for the cold day. There is plenty of meat and noodles in the bowl and the whole thing was the perfect temperature and full of flavor. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Tai Chin
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggrolls

7-DhCxrTDr8XnbLnR9j3aA.text: Great place, great food!!!!, great prices!!! Try number 24!!! You won't regret it!! Eggs rolls and also tofu nuggets it's all super delicious!!

QUkxVvzvhe7--GdKMY9lcQ.text: Second time coming here while visiting town and everything was still good.   Con: lots of people come to this place so there is always a waiting list.

xueWAfsHWe5Axc1HmAPOsg.text: Best pho in town - open 24 hrs Conveniently located on right off the strip on spring Mtn dr/ In China town (more like China block lol) Also the vermicelli with roasted pork & eggrolls is super bomb.com! Authentic & always busy here but worth the wait.

AxuMW3PAX7SKUucJcfKoRg.text: I love the fact that they are open 24 hours! But be prepared for a long line, long wait, bad service and mediocre food!   Pho at Kinh Doh across the street has way better Pho Broth and Service!   However, the Spicy Garlic Chicken Wings are delicious and are a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eff ResQWater!  best hangover remedy!

HBqLafUm3C4XS2k9V9Q4pA.text: You don't come here for good service or excellent food. You come here when you're drunk at 2am because they're opened 24 hours.   The service here sucks. In my particular visit today, we had a party of 5 and waited for over 35 minutes. We decided to add our name to the list again as they skipped us by over 10 parties (each with 2-3). We were waiting patiently because we knew we had to wait for a round table. Anyways, the girl ended up calling our second name we put down instead of the first, after which I told her what had happened. Her demeanor totally changed because she knew she messed up.   Anyways, food is pretty consistent to me. It's good, but nothing life-changing. I usually get #15 which is pho with rare steak and brisket. I do also like the fried tofu.

yXJ77D1zrX-eulc7IDlTTA.text: Worst customer service in existence!   It's kinda funny to see this in this day and age.   But,  if of don't mind the attitude the food is good.

8_mWkcJH5C6PlB-oH-johQ.text: So so delicious!!!!we always make a stop here when in Vegas.  The food was fast and tasted terrific.

5aP6K1ZNFklQxI2oefX9WA.text: This place rocks! If you're in Vegas, and looking for authentic, fantastic Pho then this is the place! The service is as great as the food!

M--rBNX7PxS8KRMBVWntXw.text: LOVE this place! They have fantastic noodles (combination beef [#13] is my favorite), spring rolls/peanut sauce are addictive and you MUST have the Ong Choy sauteed with garlic cloves (#75). Sometimes they can go a little heavy on the sauces with their Chinese dishes, but just asked for easy sauce. Service is friendly, open 24/7 (BONUS!!) and their honeydew boba is SO good. Do yourself a favor and give this place a try. I promise you'll make it a regular stop.

kW1emP4hppJxe49lbkgE9w.text: Having just had the pho at Pho Saigon 8 yesterday I can definitely say that I like the broth better here at Pho Kim Long.  It is sweeter, not as salty, and more aromatic.    I ordered dac biet Pho that only has rare beef in it but you pay an extra $1 and they add tripe and tendon.  I then asked for double tendon.  It was good.  The broth like I said was solid.  The vermicelli, meat, and condiments were all good.   It is a little more pricey here but the service is great and the place is large, nicely decorated, and very clean.    I will be going back for more pho and to try the bun.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho - Dac Biet

WX8yJ0K5NG-je9aPG_qbmA.text: They messed my order up never going back to this place ! Horrible service always have to wait in line to pay my check.

2wIHi1Kk_B1MyaDM8I2GAQ.text: Do not go there.  It seems they have security problems here. There is security guards by the door and  inside walking around "BS"ing with the waiters.   This is only second time we have eaten here. We won't be returning here again.  It was like the "hood" in the restaurant. All sorts of people here late at night. After the meal, I have come to realization. They don't want you to get robbed in parking lot, because they want to rob you inside.  We saw some body ordered Hainan chicken last time we were here, so we asked the waiter about this off the menu item. "Yeah, we have it, do you want steamed rice or Haina rice?" Of course, we want Hainan style rice, they should not even have asked. That was stupid! Hainan chicken with rice. Very basic!!  It turn out they want you to say "yes" so they can charge $1.50 for this little bowl of microwaved-and-overly-nuked-dry-lump-tasteless rice.   They sell half roasted chicken or steamed chicken for $11 on the menu. But if you ordered Hainan chicken, you get a small plate(almost a quarter of chicken) of tough and tasteless chicken for $11 also. Not including rice!!  Service was nonexistent. We asked for hot tea, and never got them. I mentioned it when I was paying and got two words, "She forgot." and no apology.   If you go, expect getting robbed in or out, and go home with half empty stomach.

YlihoYkuLEww7Kx6639Nyg.text: Wow, things change really quickly over in Chinatown.   1st time I came here, I had such a good time that I gave this place a 5-star review. After my last 2 visits..Now, I gotta give it only 2 stars.   The staff was rude this time around. Very anti-social and easily irritated.  The staff was constantly making fun of customers behind their backs. Calling them all types of degrading names and making fun of their hair, clothes, etc. I found their behavior to be very out-of-line.   Food was still really good. So they get 1 more star.   I don't understand why this place attracts such a shady crowd?  People all around me were loudly talking about sexual topics, drugs, and screaming profanity in the air.   I really don't mind that atmosphere because I use a lot of profanity myself, but this place is designed like one of those fancy 5-star restaurants, so I would expect a more upscale crowd.  Infact, I enjoy that kind of atmosphere when I am at a  dive-place like "Ellis Island" or downtown, but "Pho Kim Long" is a fine-dining establishment with it's giant neon fish tanks, marble tables, and chandeliers. I know I am in my 20s, but I have a lot of friends who are 60+, and one of my friends is actually a former civil rights activist from the 1960s. I felt really  bad having a man of his integrity have to sit there and listen to drunks and typical vegas-trash talk so much sh!t around him.    This sucks because now I gotta find another 24 hour Pho place. If anyone has any suggestions please let me know.

J2GFgGHcRgmzhzZYH7Z2Gw.text: Okay so my boyfriend swears by this place, and I really don't like pho, but anything is good if you're hungry enough. Service was so so. One waitress was nice enough while serving us and I decided to order along with my boyfriend. He got the combo and I got the raw steak small noodle soup. I should have noticed the red flag when my food came out a mere 2 minutes after ordering but I just ate as normal. It wasn't until after I had eaten that I noticed half of a straw wrapper in my soup. It wasn't mine as I thought at first. When the mgmt was notified they told me it was my own until I showed my wrapper was in one piece unlike the half of one in the soup. The manager was told and he did nothing about it and hurriedly gave us our check. Shan't be coming here again.

nm89CS8ZiSSmPZbiNgHtPw.text: Came here around 10 with a party of 4, my other co workers were too pooped from last night. Service was ok, broth was ok, but at least my night was ok as well

oQFGiTWO_x4LuUhm8hHDaA.text: Extensive menu.  Food ok but a little greasy but otherwise not bad.  Typical service at a Vietnamese restaurant.

RojJqukHsBxuZzDhlgPRaA.text: I was serious dissapointed when I asked the waitress what kind of Pho they serve in here? Is it the North version or South version, and he hesitated reply me: Chinese Pho version :/ I was completely speechless. Pho is not even from China. I ordered Bun Bo Hue, it taste kinda ok, but very greasy. The noodle is not the right kind for bun bo hue, it was too thin. Services is alright, but I would recommend Pho in here

5oau8RJinJaLErwMkgv0BA.text: mmm my favorite pho place in town! I've been going to Pho Kim Long for years and they definitely offer tastiest and most fulfilling pho.  The special combination runs a very reasonable $8.

knXDTrwKR93B1bialP9g5A.text: The best thing about this place is that it's 24 hours. Cost about $9 for a small bowl, a dollar and some change more than what's around. Which wouldn't be a problem if it tasted better. Mediocre pho to say the least. Not the worst I've had though. It's just eh.

apPvfRCZcRCcysnObbGJkg.text: I really think people come here just so they can "say" they are coming here...if you know what I mean.  (hence the name)  Gotta love a good name "pho" a restaurant!  Brought some out of town friends here on Monday (Labor Day) around 1pm.  People were everywhere inside and outside waiting.  I almost gave up immediately but my inner gut & the "best of RJ's" on the windows made me stay.  When we finally made our way to the front to put our name in we asked the guy how long the wait was.  His reply, "really fast".  I couldn't help but chuckle but who are we to argue. LOL  Surprisingly, our wait wasn't too long before our name was called.  With all the people everywhere I was halfway expecting to be waiting a while.  We were seated by a window.  Literally every table full.  A guy came to take our drink order.  While we checked out the menu every meal was numbered making it easy to order.  Each item had a detailed description underneath for white girls like me or at least I'd like to think. haha  BTW the menu is gigantic.  I'm often overwhelmed by such menus but I knew what I was looking for.  My BF and I decided we would share each of our orders so we could try a couple different dishes.  We had settled on two things to share until I heard my friend say...UDON Noodle!  I just discovered Udon Noodles when I was in Cali. I honestly cannot have enough of it.  To describe it to someone I would say its like a really thick soft spaghetti noodle.  Here is what we ordered:  *Beef Udon Noodle - I thought it was fantastic.  The BF thought it was a little peppery (you could actually see the black pepper in it) but it was still our favorite. *Chicken Pho - A little bland broth flavor (I remember it being better), chunks of chicken, thin rice noodles.  We added a bunch of hot sauce to spice it up and give it a little more flavor. Pretty good even though it felt like it was the hottest/humid day of the summer.  We did only eat half the soup.  The bowl was as big as my head. *Our friends also got the Beef Udon and love it.  They also got the Teriyaki Chicken with Rice and it was a huge portion.  She only had half of it.  We waited a bit for the check.  The servers were running around like crazy but she eventually came.  Our bill came to around $70 I believe-our friends had bought.  Overall it was good.  Just super crazy busy.  This is definitely a popular spot.  The reviews say that its opened 24 hours.  I cant imagine really wanting a drunken night soup bowl at 3am but it sounds like a lot of people do.  (I secretly opt for a drunken night Fat Burger at that time-but that's just me) but if its your thang have at it!  Its there for your enjoyment!  24 hours.

laAEGNEN6QBRjKdTacYOEw.text: This place hands down is the worst. The food is Mediocre it's not even worth the wait. We came in at 12:30 and didn't get seated until 1:15. And we waited another 20 mins for our order to be taken. We came in with a large group and even after waiting an hour we didn't get to sit together cause I guess It's too difficult to push tables together. And they were so pushy about separating us from each other. Everyone who works here looks so miserable while they're working like they hate their life. The service here is so rude that it just ruins the meal for you. Also the tables who were sat after us received their food and water way after us. Pho Kim Long is so dysfunctional, unorganized, and has one of the work customer service I have ever received. I'm sure there are other pho places in Vegas that are way better than this.

IIOQ9_98X42pJHNbpQC_Ng.text: EH....... I'd prob only come here for a drunk after hours bowl of pho. We came here sober, in hopes to cure some of our hangovers with a tasty bowl of pho, but to our disappointment the soup was really off and a tad bit over priced, but of course non comparable to T.I's pricing.. but that's a whole different story. So, long story short... this place is not that great.

6GdKSq_GdvsDPa6FvwA54A.text: LOL, LMFAO, ROFL!  "Fuh, kim, long...." - "fuhkimlong".....  Ok, so it was funny for me for the first few times I said it.....   The Pho here is pretty darn close to what I had in Vietnam, I mean it is just broth, noodles, and beef... but here you can tell their broth sits in kettles like they do at Pho 999s in HCMC. They don't give you as much beef as they do in viet nam, but it's still really really good. Can't say much for service, but food A+.   Here at Pho Kim Long (^,^ he he he) it's almost a mixture of Vietnamese, Chinese and Thai with their dishes which makes it better than just a Pho house.   Another plus is they're open 24 hours, which is probably why they're broth is so good.  So if you got a hankerin for some soup that's not heavy, but will fill your belly, come here to Pho Kim Long II and enjoy a bowl of Pho, hot and sour or wonton soup.

MHbXfXOJRDsrq3DeHfAG9Q.text: The food and the service here is the best in town. The fried calamari is great and the Pho very good. I've brought many of my friends who were visiting town and I got to say that not one of them has ever been disappointed with the food. I highly recommend this place

bCxMS5MXz6xaRFZ5GgzVVQ.text: Pho Kim Long, your pho is pho king good!    After a night of partying, we were tired, hungry and hungover.  When we got dropped off by our cab, we were dreading the wait as there were tons of people already in line.  Thank goodness we didn't wait longer than 20 minutes and as soon as we ordered our food appeared magically fast.  Perfect hangover cure with your delicious broth and flawlessly cooked noodles.  The broth is full of flavor- hot, salty, yet sweet from all the onions & cilantro in the soup. Even best is that the rare beef isn't chewy but tender and I'm able to actually eat it without feeling like it's going to choke me on the way down.  Trust me, a lot of Vietnamese Pho places rare beef is so chewy you can't eat it.    I just got back from LV and I am already in need of pho from here.  Pho Kim Long has one of the most flavorful pho's I have ever had.    BTW...what's with these names at these Vietnamese restaurants?  Pho King Funny!  Pun intented.

Oeqp0lOE1e4CakRKVSbLoA.text: This place caters to whatever requests without griping about it which is nice. I have strict dietary requirements so not getting flack about it is a plus. They also package their pho orders to go so nicely there is No risk of leakage. Def my favorite pho place

JhnFOplQCZdCpwqpXrDT5A.text: Great portions and quick service! The food was great...but my usual condiments were missing. The pho was perfect...I could have ate it without putting anything else in it. The wontons with cream cheese and shrimp was so crunchy and the filling portion was perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Also ordered the delicious garlic vegetable stir fry. Super yummy!

IFrs5AJfgqV9ZcwlP0ttJw.text: Yummy! One of the first pho spots I've tried in Vegas and will definitely be back. We tried the pot stickers and they were great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pUlMt7cc56aOhrFFGRMc9w.text: This is the go to spot if youre in Vegas and you need some pho. Portion sizes are on point and they do not skimp on the protein. Love it.

HAQ-uSD4lzHNNxfrS6C1_g.text: Wanted to write an updated review because they did something that was weird during my last visit.   Food order this time around:  Calamari - Fried really well, but needed more salt/seasoning.  Vermicelli - Meat was really flavorful and they gave a amount of meat. Pho - Pho with meatballs.. meatballs still the same as my last review, just falls apart.    So when the time came to pay, the waiter came with the bill and my boyfriend gave his credit card, but instead of taking the card and ringing him up as usual, the waiter kept asking which tip option my boyfriend would like to put (15%, 20%, 25%, etc) and did not leave until he circled something. HE WAS LITERALLY HOVERING OVER US and pressuring us to give him a dollar amount or choose one of the pre-calculated amounts. When we received the receipt to sign, the tip was already charged but there was still a tip line to fill out? What's the point of asking us how much tip we want to give if we can still write down what we would like to give. Also, I've heard about a lot of restaurants doing this, but basically they calculate their suggested tips against the total bill with tax (should be on subtotal), and usually I don't really care/pay attention but since they were so adamant to get our tip amount before even ringing us up I decided to calculate AND YUP the tip was calculated after taxes. We ended up paying like 25% tip (which really I don't mind if the service was exceptional, but it wasn't). I can't say I won't be back (cause it's pho kim long in vegas!!), but I'll definitely pay more attention.

R12pflts0YS9Hi2zVE1QJQ.text: Came here due to the reviews and was very disappointed. After reading through the reviews to figure out what to get I ordered the large "rare beef" pho based on comments in Google. I will say that my bowl of pho was tiny and the beef was not rare - my beef was so cooked it was gray -I have attached photos, and broth below par. I'm from Houston,home to a lot of Vietnamese people. The soup base was not inspiring at all- I never seen a large pho also be so small. It was smaller than the small I get in Houston. If you end up here and order this you will wonder if you ordered a large pho- because I seriously wondered that.   Also I ordered "salt and pepper calamari". Now one would think ordering "salt and pepper" calamari would include the titles ingredients. I must have been crazy, but there was no "salt or pepper" on my calamari and they delivered it to my table with some marinara. Yes, marinara - I kid you not. I told the first person there was no salt and pepper on my salt and pepper calamari. Nothing, then my waiter came after another 10-15 minutes and I told him that I advised the person that delivered my pho there was no salt and pepper on it. How does the kitchen send out "salt and pepper" dishes without salt and pepper? My waiter looked at me and then at the dish and said -"there's no salt and pepper". Yes- I know because I've been staring at it for 20-25minutes. They took it off and offered to redo it-surely terrified the may return with salt less or pepper less next, I asked for spring rolls- but sadly these were the worst spring rolls and peanut sauce I've ever had. This was a disappointing visit considering they hype in the previous reviews. Want some real Vietnamese? Come down to Houston honey. Don't waste a trip here as this place easily fell into my top ten worst dining experiences for me. Thank God I had a rent a car, if you paid for a taxi here you'd slap yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_0DVrcd1Yz-4Tllt17QpdQ.text: I've been going to this Pho restaurant every time I visit. It's the only one that I know of that's 24 hours which is always a plus in my book.   Service was prompt and while dining in the other day, I happened to overhear that the female server remembers the exact order of their usuals. They praised her for it. I always think that is nice to see that the employees here puts in efforts for little things like that .   The pho here is not bad. I really like their broth bc it's flavorful. The noodles were cooked to perfection and just the right texture. The only thing that I wasn't used to was the meat as it's much different from the textures of meat in the pho that I'm used to in the Bay Area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1bfEsERc-gEmpj47bQCzSg.text: This is my second time eating here. I again am enjoying the food and wait staff is always great and attentive. But I am ddisappointedin the CDC spring rolls there was no shrimp when I love that part the best. The restrooms could use some TLC it's pretty run down and paper everywhere.

K_huNbHAZLPPXPKZAhzFDA.text: I love coming here, Vietnamese, Chinese, and Thai. This place is always busy and open 24hours. Service is fast, the food is great, I highly recommend this place!

fchedPJxOdxwJ4DOrpg0LA.text: Pho Kim long has multiple locations In Cali and it was great! Thought to try it out but food and service here was horrible. Was here once and they were busy so they had limited menu. We waited half an hour to be seated and there were not many people waiting after us. All of our noodle soup was warm but towards the cold side. We requested them to heat them us and server said that's how they served!  Excuse me? I eat pho all the time, the temperature was like u left a hot soup and sat there for at least twenty min. They brought back and bring it back again, still not hot. And they were rushing us as we adults finished but I got two kids who are still finishing up.

31G7N1lT4RebzBAqxhTDqQ.text: True to its name, the wait is "pho-kim-long" and the service is just terrible.  I came in and put my name down on their waitlist for a party of 1, then stepped to the side and wait.  There were plenty of free tables around 6pm so I should be seated right away, right?  NOPE.  The servers there completely ignored my existence, didn't even bother looking at the waitlist, and then when a larger party came in, some server just walked by and asked them how many people, grabbed some menus and seated them right away.  At that point I started to get annoyed, so I asked another server, who was rushing by, for a table for one.  He was like yeah ok someone will help me soon.  Ok, so I continued to wait; another 5 mins went by with no one paying attention to me.  Then, another huge party of 8-10 people walked in and the same server who previously seated the other party instead of me came back and was about to give them a table as well.  So I had to step in between them and loudly said, "Uh excuse me, I was here first?? My name is on the waitlist??"  The server finally pointed me to a table and told me that I could sit down.  What's the point of having a waitlist and yet not bother checking people in in the order that they came in??  So I finally sat down feeling annoyed.  Took another while for someone to finally stop by and take my order.  Thankfully the wait for the food wasn't that long, but the food was mediocre at best.  I ordered the Pho Combo and it only came with less than 5 pieces of meat, like really?  On top of that, no one came by to refill my water either.  When I was done, I asked for a check and had to wait yet another 10 mins and still no one brought me the check.  I got up and went straight to the cashier, and not surprisingly, the cashier was chatting with someone for another good 5 mins, knowing that I was standing there waiting to pay.    I don't understand how this place got high reviews.  Maybe larger parties get more attention than singles?  Regardless, even if I came in alone or with other people, I was still a paying customer who deserved to be treated as such.  Never coming back here again and will not recommend this place to anyone.

WcM3wySR38nd6ancbvm4Dw.text: Rude service , mediocre food. Waiter took so long and got lost 25 mins into us sitting down. I said "excuse me" multiple times to waiters, bus boys yet I was ignored and I felt like a bother. I literally left no tip and I always tip even if the waiter is rude but this time I was completely ignored. I was so shocked with the service here. The food came cold and in a small portion. The pho was decent at least. Won't ever in my life come back here , I felt embarrassed walking out the door.

wEY3asWho1SocE50pmN8Pg.text: Not too impressed.  The food was decent but the cleanliness was a problem for me.  The floor through the entire restaurant was greasy.  My fork had dried food on the bottom.  The worst was the men's restroom it stunk and had nasty funk on the walls and floor.

yab8S7uNGXBG1X3Fo8Ujyw.text: Came to these place every time to eat after hours and place is packed. It's expected but every time they take their time and always forget an order.   The last time I can was the last straw. We signed in waiting patiently and seemed like we were getting skipped by 3 groups who never signed in. Finally I asked why and host said he knew the owner, sorry. Really!?!?  That's the last time I've been here, thank god I found some new decent pho spots thanks to fellow reviewers

lxO4ZyL9zhgpSFzNpMtVPQ.text: I'll be completely honest I always come here after a night of drinking because I love their pho. They also have some good entrees like salt and pepper pork, which is another favorite of mine. Only downside to this place is the wait time, you'll most likely have to sign in and wait 30+ minutes just to get seated. The tight parking in the shopping center is also a negative for me, especially at night.

O0rbzjXBH8tiW0Iq4LiVvQ.text: I am a Pho Kim Long regular. If there was a stamp card I'd probably have free pho every two weeks.  Multiple times per week I will either make a visit or order postmates. This is my story.  My order today is the reason for this not-so-good review. Not only did I not receive the fish sauce I requested for my spring rolls, but my calamari was so carelessly and poorly prepared I didn't even eat it. There were chunks of nearly-whole squid in the mix.  If a chef is moving too quickly to notice there are whole chunks of calamari being fried, what else is he not noticing?  The quality of the meat in my pho tai also left much to be desired, as the finely sliced, succulent meat I once knew has been replaced with thick slabs of tough, fatty, budget cut ass meat similar to what you would expect to find chopped up in a Philly cheese steak.  I couldn't even chew this meat! It was like chewing on leather shoelaces.  The spring rolls were also terrible, but they always are, so I'm not complaining about that.  It's clear that there has been a serious decline in both the quality control and professionalism of this establishment. Bad show, Pho Kim Long, bad show.

_MEnGkocbLdVDVe4_QMLxg.text: Been coming here every now and then over the years whenever I'm in Vegas, but this might be my last visit here.  I usually get the pho dac biet whenever I dine here and it's always okay. However, today was different as the beef meatballs that they placed in there were not fresh(possibly spoiled) as it had a very foul taste. Not sure if staff knew that their meatballs were bad as another member in my party had the same experience.  Not sure if I'll be back again as this was a decent place for pho 24/7.

x0AHMxADjrrkakDGwJAuCA.text: Not the greatest pho but it's open 24/7 and after not eating for days.. we needed a real meal and this hot the spot after two long nights of partying non-stop. The soup was what we needed at 6am! Lol  There was a wait, even at that time but they go through the list fairly quickly. Super cold A/C - so bring a cardigan! But it might feel good compared to the dessert heat!   The pho broth was a bit on the salty side and the bowl lacked meat and noodles. The Meatballs were soft and tasted like chicken Meatballs? Definitely not the normal Beef tendon Meatballs they use in pho.   Wasn't fantastic but it hit the spot and was what we needed. Ok for late night eats if you need some food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Coconut
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Dac Biet (Pho Special)

HY0tlM1TeotBHI-E0JPQ7A.text: This place is alright. Their wonton soup is really good but everything else was mediocre. The spring rolls were cold, probably been in the fridge for a while, but their peanut dipping sauce is really good. Their ice coffee I got was perfect. Price wise is a little expensive. For the combination bowl pho it was already expensive and if you want meatballs it's an extra charge. It should already be a part of the combination already in my opinion. The place is clean and big. Overall, it was an okay place to go for pho.

q03Bx09USBnqZj356RF4aQ.text: 24/7 pho?! I don't know what could get better than that!  It was so good that we went two nights in a row!  haha Both nights we went super late, but there were full tables of people both times we went. I don't know how many 24/7 spots are available, but this is definitely the one to be at.  It is probably a mile or so off of the strip, but with Uber, that's nothing.  Drunkies or just craving some bomb food at night? The broth is super flavorful! We ordered pho, fried calamari, and the spring rolls and you really cannot go wrong with any of it.  I usually say that nothing good ever happens after 3 am, but I am wrong--Pho Kim Long is the best decision you will make after 3 am!

aSr6Sf5cya2KTWno5kHTew.text: Late night Vegas Pho is no problem at this 24 hour restaurant.     The food here is pretty good even though there are mixed reviews.   Apparently there has been several management changes.   That said, the pho is pretty good and full flavor.     I recommend you visit during the normal meal hours and avoid the late night hours for better service.

U1ys-XoDE0tHPYHHsXpB5A.text: Came in on a Friday looking to feed a group of 12. Heard from a friend the food was really good. Asked up front what was the average wait time and was told they will check and get back to us. 10 minutes passed and dude never can back with a response.  I'm sure the food is ok but not worth the poor service.  Should have read the Yelp reviews first. Went down the street a block and found a better location with solid food.

6cVf5yRbmYkUcy8TmNiKLg.text: We were starving at 3 am and decided to get some late night eats.  It was pretty busy...but hey it was a Friday night in Vegas.  Our service was absolute horrible.  We  were seated for 30 minutes and no one acknowledged us, we had to wave the waiter down to get water than waved him down again to order.  The pho was mediocre and none of us were really satisfied with what we got.  I ordered a drink and it did not come till the end of the meal. L  We left pretty disappointed.

Wm_lCVPtd4NG5NzOPyFhMQ.text: Not what it used to be.  Pho Kim Long used to be Pho Kim Good!  Now it's Pho Kim Nasty and Pho Kim Slow.  The service is awful, 1 drink had to be re ordered, steamed rice (as simple as it is and as readily available as it should be) didn't make it to the table until we were almost done eating.  All that garbage for almost $50 for 3 plates? Nope.  Never again.  And when I addressed the issues when paying (which I had to go up to the cashier because the waiters were nowhere to be found) the guy didn't care at all.

4SOT_UmK9aq6QMHgRNpwRg.text: Don't go eat!  I had Vietnamese noodles with my friends at yesterday afternoon, and we didn't feel any hunger at night.  We stomach aches, vomiting, and diarrhea.  And our body is weak this morning, maybe go to the hospital to check it out later.  I suspect that there is a big problem with the hygiene and quality of food.  Do not recommend everyone to eat!

-Z_C_RCUJY5eSuvvqHTjTQ.text: I used to come here in the past but the serve wasn't good since they are always busy. This time I came back here because of my friend. It was late so not many restaurants was opened & this place was a meal saver for us. Again. We didn't get good customer service. We just have some request for out foods but they answer was a YES but nothing was coming out. They have good food, big menu but for customer service then it doesn't worth it to walk out with an anger.

aDT1yObaKTj6CqJa7Bz7Yw.text: Awful  !!!!!!!! We came before and then no one even acknowledged us ! The two tables already finished they foods and no one even asking anything we re 6 of us after we ordered then the waiter only give us 4 sets up ... ???????? Terrible services !!!!!!!!!!!!! Unbelievably  !

_Tv5Mf2aphMF1iS5Q6ScgA.text: I used to really like this place, mostly for its 24 hour availability. The food is pretty good too. Unfortunately the last 3 times I had gone there was always some sort of mysterious object in my pho. Between a piece of plastic, a piece of metal bristle from a steel wool sponge, and hair (the mystery is to whom did it belong to?) they serve lemons with their pho which I think is weird and every time I'm there the wait staff refuses to give me limes. For what reason, not sure. I had to beg for a lime one time and the waiter gave it to me thankfully. Maybe in a couple years I'll try them out again, or when I see their stars go up. Until then, I really did like you guys but......it's just not worth it.

7BNhxcD63PqJf0d2F9RQzg.text: My pho place when I come to Vegas. This place is always busy but the wait is fast. People came in to eat and left the place as soon as they finished. *Make sure you check the bill because they added tips already and still ask you to tip.

U0p4yz8fohZzdvgkNoBMOg.text: not the best pho around but for a drunk night out or a hangover cure its here for you 24/7, so you can't go wrong.  they have other options also which I definitely will try next time.

-2vojigWALl8lppyxvjr9w.text: Great service. My son and I got seated as soon as we walked in. There was a waiter to take my order right away. Food came out 5 minutes later. The fast service has been consistent at this place. However, it's sad to say that their food just doesn't taste right. Last time I came here, I ordered bun bo hue and pho. Tasted very mediocre. This time I ordered hu tiu kho thap cam. It tasted nothing like what it should be. Food came out not as warm/ hot. Noodles were a bit undercooked. The seasoning/ sauce that they used was just simply sweet, like a sweet, diluted soy sauce. Some of the squid were still see through, aka raw. I'm not sure if that's how it should be, so I didn't touch it. Chicken in there was just simply pieces of boiled chicken breasts, without any seasoning. It feels like everything was boiled separately, then put together, with sweet soy sauce over it. I was so disappointed. I fed my son just the noodles and the broth that it came with.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hu tiu kho

uafvm_m5Tfm2AYHsoTJJbw.text: Wonderfully pleasant dining experience!!! HIGHLY recommended!  Details:  Wednesday at 1:15pm  We were in and out in 30 minutes ... and we took our time, too   The restaurant was packed and the wait was still less than 10 minutes  Waiter took our order within a couple of minutes of being seated   Egg rolls / Spring rolls were delivered to our table in less than five minutes from ordering -- flavors were light and clean  Iced Coffee with Boba was satisfyingly delicious.   Pho Ga (Chicken) came out within 15 minutes -- Light, no overpowering flavor, chicken was perfectly sized (not just large cuts)  Our waiter stopped by our table to ask if our rolls arrived -- we'd already enjoyed it and the plates were cleared when our meal arrived. That's how fast and efficient the Staff is here!  Our drinks never ran low  It was busy, everything came out super quick and we didn't feel rushed. A very well oiled machine with a mission-oriented Staff  Would ABSOLUTELY come back again!!!!  *Parking: Lots of parking -- packed, but found something right away

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QTqpzVnAh78LOLSQ59BScw.text: When you visit Vegas and craving other food besides expensive buffets, you gotta eat off the strip.  Honestly there are amazing and affordable restaurants off the strip that will satisfy picky eaters.   Pho Kim Long isn't new to me, I have eaten here many times while visiting Vegas so felt it was time for a review.  My family and I decided to have some pho so we met up here.  The pho is decent and this place is open 24/7!! That's one of the best things about this place.   We were quickly seated and our food came out not too long afterward we ordered.  My family was happy with their choices of food and so was I.  I'd rather have pho at 8.99 a bowl than pa 15 bucks for a salad or some fast food on the strip.    Place does get busy at times with all the visitors from out of state.  Clean, and staff is attentive.  Yes we will eat here again on future Vegas trips.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ECwBFtKkzYiDvZoJWMfN4Q.text: Visit: Saturday, April 21, 2018  After a long day and night of doing Vegas, I really wanted something beefy, but nothing that was open near seemed very good. Then I had the genius idea of getting pho, and my friends agreed, so we trekked out here for to satisfy our cravings.  We were surprised it wasn't more crowded, but we were seated right away. The host guy was really hustling. He was running between the host stand trying to seat everybody and also serve waters. Their menu is impressive and also has a selection of Chinese dishes in addition to the Vietnamese offerings.  I ordered the special combination pho. There was a generous helping of meat, but that's where the good things end. The broth was quite bland. The beef tasted low quality and stringy. At least it somewhat hit the spot for us.  Service was pretty good. The host was super nice, and the waitstaff was pleasant. The pho is mediocre, but if I were more of a Vegas regular, I'd be back often to try some of the other options on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Accompaniments
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special combination pho

Tp04B-8tHKs68B6AozIZzA.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: Can't go wrong Viet & Thai. And 24/7 to boot.  Well, the drama told under Sushi Kaya continues as I was, yet again just two nights later, called into DD service by pals after yet another Rhino visit. (This time, they had some purpose, I suppose: Free local entry (always), free fried chicken and sides, plus super-cheap well drinks at 5pm due to Monday night football.)  This time, per my conclusion about Sushi Kaya, I put my foot down and insisted we try someplace off my Chinatown bucket list, that being Pho Kim Long. I heard no objections. In fact one of my riders repeatedly referred to it as "a legend."  Digs were attractive, crowded but not swamped at 10pm. Parking wasn't too much of a squeeze play.  This is a serious venue boasting a robust menu containing a lot of the usual Viet, Thai and Chinese suspects. I am sure if my long-gone Viet lady friend had been here, this place could have busted out anything she conjured in her mind.  They even have bubble tea and bubble thai coffee, it appears. Lord knows I love Thai/Viet coffee so much, but it'll keep me awake for two days. Every place I've ever asked for it in decaf, they've looked insulted, so I've stopped asking.  I enjoy Viet & Thai cuisine, though I don't really understand it very well. So I just went tourist and had the pork drunken noodles. The rest of the table did Seafood Pho (which was, for some reason, off-menu). The server described it as having calamari and other scrumptious ingredients, but that the crab would be 'imitation.' We whetted with Spring Rolls. The peanut sauce was thick and bold.  Service was attentive, we wanted not. My plate had a generous portion. Of course the Pho bowls were huge. Spring rolls were fresh, large and tasty. My table-mates were clearly pleased. Food-wise, I strongly suspect this is a 'can't go wrong' venue.  Prices were more than fair, especially given they apparently have a near-monopoly on 24-hour upscale Viet/Thai quality grub.  There's no catch here. A bona fide dining experience, all-night long.   Well maybe one small caveat. A few of the tables -- including ours -- are just too close together. The people next to us were practically dining along side us ... and they probably didn't enjoy the slurred conversation where my pals were self-evaluating their Rhino expertise. (Why is it that most guys don't realize which sex is running the floor in a strip club?)  CONCLUSION: I could very easily get spoiled to this venue ... it's certainly staying on my 24/7 short list ... but I'll have to learn to select my entrees with somewhat more abandon to enhance the experience.  On Spring Mountain (of course), almost directly across the street from Play It Again Sam's, near one end of a long strip mall.  UPDATE: I returned within a week. I told someone I was heading Chinatown-way for some grub. He said "try Kim Long." So I guess this place IS a legend.  I saw a gaggle of lovely Viet ladies all downing delicious-looking pho. But I feared I would slop some soup on my dapper duds. So I went tourist again with spring rolls and pad Thai pork.   It was perfect.  UPDATE: The pretty young Viet ladies at the nail salon say they don't like this place, citing MSG as their cause for conviction. I suppose if you make your own pho at home, nothing else is going to seem better. To be fair, they did recommend a pho shop over here in Henderson they like. I'll hit it and review it soon enough.

0_ptm4urjX9AWHoyhl3OXA.text: My review is just based on the pho ONLY.  Came here on a sunday night around midnight. Always heard good things about this place and that it's open 24 hours off the strip in vegas.  My friend and I were definitely tired of eating burgers and vegas strip food - we needed soup!  We both got pho and was very disappointed. My friend took the first sip and said "it's not even hot". I took a sip right after and noticed the same thing. I have never ate "warm" pho before so that was a first. I also didn't want to be "that person" to complain and have them fix my order.  I tried to chow down as much as I could but it wasn't great. To seal the deal, my bo vien (meatball) was soggy as opposed to the usual "chewy texture" we expect from a meatball. After that I couldn't finish it. This was the first time I have never finished a bowl of pho.  Busy atmosphere and a large # of seating. I'm willing to come back and try other menu items one day though and possibly update my review on yelp.

t_rpAdVqGrK6ofU8-ytcvg.text: Disappointed with my to go order. Orange chicken very over cooked and hard to chew. Dried out from being over cooked. And they weren't even busy

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1WoZ0PAGiIpciABkRSgpbg.text: Go to spot in Vegas if u want asian food. The pho was very flavorful, so flavorful that my shoulder got heavy after and felt sick. I had to go back to the hotel and go to bed sick. I don't like that feeling where I have to make myself continuously burp because I felt bloated. If I ever went back I wouldn't get the pho. I would get a rice plate.

paCFoHu1sbGx-Cmu2_onpg.text: I've eaten here twice. The first time, I wasn't very hungry so I got the fried tofu (which was actually really good). Last night I tried the chicken porridge. It's been pretty cold out, so I wanted something to warm me up. I wish I would've chosen something else. This soup was extremely bland, and I didn't enjoy it at all.   As a side note, the condiment bottles at the table were not clean. They had some sort of film on them, which was a total turn off. The restroom was also extremely dirty.   Probably won't be going back. There are plenty of late night joints in China Town to choose from.

91DWBxXeDLLCaynICh9oTA.text: My go to pho place! I have been going here for years. Great food and so many choices. The salt and pepper calamari is a must have for every table. Their pho is really good as well, and serving sizes are huge. They also have vegan pho which tastes amazing. One caveat I have is that the place is always, always busy. When it's nighttime, regardless of day or time, the place is pack. Be prepared to wait for a table. But it's worth the wait, in my opinion.

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak and brisket with beef balls and Vegan Pho with fried tofu.

svyqn5oXB36PYqr29HwR8A.text: Late night pho, or anytime for that matter is great. Food is okay  (Chinese and Vienamese) that I tried, but to get it any time is awesome. Avoid high traffic times.

QVcyTmjuT7mln1uQ7oEr-A.text: I get anxious ordering my own food sometimes but when I'm faded, I can order everything on a menu with confidence (:  Been here a few times after getting wasted and I can't believe I haven't reviewed the place yet. It's always busy, the prices are good, and I don't understand why people don't like the soup. When you're fucked up, EVERYTHING should taste BOMB.COM!

fi7Bxiw1VyH0sC-ns2Dhog.text: This place is always busy and they are open 24 hours which is always a plus especially in Vegas. I ordered the spring rolls, egg rolls and the pho special. Delicious.!

pXEVikMa-7_RJbAwLcMHCQ.text: I wouldn't go here unless I was drunk, pretty much the only time I go here.   Pho Kim Long, HAHA sorry had to do it.  What I usually order...  Pho w/egg noodle: 4/5 Don't ask me why but I don't like pho with rice noodle lol So I switch it up. At pho kim long the soup is a bit oily you can definitely see the bubbles floating around. The soup comes hot so be careful, it comes hot for a reason because the thin slices of meat have to cook in the soup. The regular size is more then enough for me so portions are good.  Egg rolls: 2/5  I used to like their egg rolls until they decided to down size. Their egg rolls used to be fat and thick but ever since they changed their recipe they're friend super small and thin. The size of a lumpia basically, and they give you like 1 slice of lettuce. Everyone knows you wrap the egg roll inside the lettuce and dip it in that fish sauce they give you.   Service: 1/5 Even if your belligerently drunk service should still matter. This place is very fast paced and when your drunk you just want things to slow down at that point. The waiters are very pushy and they rush the heck out of you. Once you order and they bring your food out forget trying to get their attention later. Flagging down a waiter there just to get your check is a mission there.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak pho with egg noodle

Pmiu6--fc-J0bji2GN7kRw.text: Pho improved - in which now the meat is cooked, egg rolls are still good, wontons were tasty and the pork chop rice was tasty, don't order the brown rice (over cooked) but overall great meal and service.  Gets crowded so be prepared to wait.

DbFbnmOjHdEJWqmM7o3yCw.text: Don't get me wrong, the food here is AMAZING which keeps me coming back but the thing that I don't like about the place is the customer service, the wait time, and the ambiance. It's always super loud, the environment just isn't for me.

8TzINCVFmrBELD9FdJfgVg.text: This is my Go-To place when in Vegas and craving good ol Vietnamese Food. I've had several dishes here and only 2 are memorable. The Pho is lacking flavor and the beef doesn't seem to be fresh. The Bun Bo Hue is actually tasty and it comes with the chili lemongrass on the side for you to add in the spice level and flavor that you want. The other dish that I like a lot here is the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio! The pork is always well marinated and tender and the noodles and salad are always fresh. Service is always great here. Prices are good and it's conveniently located near the strip.

SBbp_--het0CPcyOhUw9YQ.text: My daughter took me here tonight.  It is a good spot, but I want to give it another shot before giving it a higher rating.  We had number 13 on the menu, but I really don't remember what the name of the Pho was.  It was a lot of food which is good, the taste was good, but I just felt like the meat was a little too fatty for the most part.  Service was good.  Place was busy but we waited on fine and the food came quick.  My daughter loves the place and for that reason alone I will give it another try.  I probably will try something else next time.

UHZN4k_pX4mz_LTF6iEnPA.text: YAAAAASSS!!!! 24 pho spot to soak up all the alcohol Vegas has to offer? I'm down! Not to mention, the name still has me cracking up. ZWvUdvdoRC0tfI0EV4IbJA.text: Came here for Pho since none of my group was down to eat a buffet. The wait was rather long for a party of 10 since everyone and their mom is hoping for some pho after a late Saturday night and when you've had too much to drink. The prices are obviously high for what is known especially if you're from the LA area. A regular small bowl of Pho is $7.95 but if you get the Pho Dac Biet it's $8.95. There was a good amount of meat but the broth just seemed like water and oil. Also for some reason each of the Pho broth soups had a different color. Some were more murky than others even though the only difference was the type of beef they had. The service however, is quite good. They refilled our waters appropriately probably because they know most people are hungover and need their best friend aka H20. The interior decor is not too bad but it does look Asian but at least not that old ghetto Asian style. The parking lot can be quite hectic so park carefully so your cars don't get scratched by Asian drivers. Also it's nice that it is near a Lee's Sandwiches because I needed that Ice Coffee for the ride back to LA!

jOtTvAAgILF4IDtB2qiBqA.text: This is a very good place with promptt service. I got the black peppered steak and comparing to jasmine restaurant at Belagio this food is worth $200 a plate.

stqBZDrRNakphQxIMfONRg.text: Always consistent in hot, good pho! And it's open late night so it's perfect, for filling your belly post alcohol consumption.

_HNOOFcU7w1xQkRQ6nmziA.text: Not the best pho, but it hits the spot when you are in Vegas. I don't recommend getting a rice plate bc your food will come out way after everyone has received and eaten their pho.

g7uBVr63jUxgikl-Kbacdw.text: The star is not for the food is for the service is a shame good food but bad bad service

Lb899nrYQaysZvhbZsZ1cQ.text: I have been to this place since I was a sophomore in high school (9 years now). I remember the food being so much better than it is now as well as the service. I don't like posting negative things about restaurants but I just want you guys to know what went down before you waste your money for less than mediocre pho. My boyfriend and I went to eat here a couple of weeks ago. It was pretty late, 3 or 4 am. There weren't a lot of people but we still had to wait for like 10-15 min. The service was so bad I was tempted to just walk out. The food was ok at best. Then, the best part happened. This young waiter/cashier started yelling at a customer, getting all up in his face and his girl's face. It was crazy! I don't know what the customer did but I'm pretty sure you're not suppose to threaten them if you work there. After all that, we waited for 20 min for our check without ever getting refills. Then, these 2 Asian girls walked in. They clearly know the waiter guy. They got seated right away with 5 plates of food on their table PLUS the fucking check within 10min. So in conclusion, fuck that place, there's always white castle.

6HYSGl-vRB5miyCK09WtyQ.text: The rumors are True: VEGAN PHO! yes, they have it; and it is GOOD! It's a very flavorful broth loaded with tons of veggies.  The only drawback is no protein! Now, some places go all crazy town with a million kinds of fake meat, which is really not necessary; but throw a sister a couple of tofu cubes at least! Still, I can't complain too much about a tasty huge bowl of goodness for only a few ducats.  I rounded out my food pyramid with some very tasty tofu nuggets.  Great late night spot (open 24 hrs) and perfect food to soak up the booze.

cKEeO4HXA6GdGNzN_2MMsw.text: I would gladly five stars for the food because i keep coming back for it, but the service is two star. Every time i have been there, about 5 or 6 times, the servers have been terrible. Last time i was there, one in my party ordered veggie egg rolls and they said "no, too busy now". Really? It wasn't packed. They wait for you to tell them you need your check after everyone has long since finished. I think the kitschy name is what gets most people through the door. Maybe they just bank on the name and good food. Whatever. Maybe I'll get it as takeout next time.

Y53q9vbHv1rZPKVTBnKIvQ.text: Wow.... I understand when you are in Vegas and your drunk food usually tastes better. but cmon MAN... food is terrible and well over priced!!!!  I will definitely not return to this place.

edY5-OIo8-7J06ersj79aA.text: food is good... menu looks good! had chicken pho, salt and pepper squid, sauteed ong choy and congee... squid was heavily battered thou!

t40sm_zNiLHQyUeT-dCpqQ.text: One of the best pho places around! Service can be a bit of an attitude but the food makes up for it. Clean place and amazing broth which is the key to good pho!

eZH0_Rmfu2A3OUOKyixOhQ.text: The joys of Pho (pronounced "ph-uh") are fairly straightforward.  Take a tasty broth, add some expertly-sliced thin meat, scallions and rice noodles are offer the ingredients in a bowl.  Add some basil, bean sprouts and spicy peppers on the side (with an optional side of rooster sauce and other spicy, sweet and/or sour sauces).  Simple enough, but get the right bowl of pho and your view of the world drastically improves.  Call it stomach psychiatry--a really tasty bowl of pho can directly stimulate serotonin levels in the brain (more serotonin = more happy).    But all of that just speaks to the genius that is pho.  Here's why you should head to Pho Kim Long for your pho fix.  When I was there, I ordered the rare steak and brisket pho.  The beef broth was well-prepared and pretty rich.  Other reviewers seem to have complained about the quality of the broth, but during my lunch there it was spot on.  It was a very solid offering.  The side veggies were crisp and fresh and delicious.    And Pho Kim Long offers a well-stocked selection of sauces if you like to tinker with your food--making it spicier, sweeter, a dash of sour, etc.  It all made for the perfect pho lunch.  The other folks at my table had the beef vermicelli ("bun" in Vietnamese) and were very pleased, reporting that the bun was better than most.  All of which earns it about 3.5 stars (rounded up because of how popular the place seemed--gotta give some credence to the will of the people).  Good enough that Pho Kim Long has become a standard in my list of Vietnamese places in town.  And the crowd there at lunch suggests that this place has become a go to lunch destination in Chinatown.  It has a big dining space and every table was packed when we were there.  That might explain why service was a little slow when we were there.  But, to the wait staff's credit, they didn't seem to mind when we stepped over to the cashier without a bill in order to settle up.    I haven't tried it late night, but the place is open 24 hrs so it might be worth a visit after a night out on the strip (put down the Jack in the Box, pick up the chopsticks).

YlaCg61AsIBijEVyAN2p0Q.text: I've always heard from numerous people say that this place was the best place for pho.   On a Friday night me and a group of girls decided to come after clubbin at TAO, after dropping the drunkies back off at the hotel we headed to Pho Kim Long! We didn't get here till around 4:30am and to my surprise this place was pretty packed, but they still had a couple of tables open. Parking around this place looked pretty decent.  The pho was pretty good and is always good when you're still drunk or if you have a hangover! The rice plates here are also pretty good! Prices are comparable to that of the prices we have in SF for pho. The service was good, all the waiters were super nice! Overall the pho was good, but I've had better before.  Note: Ask one of the waiters to call a cab for you if you didn't drive here, because you cannot flag down taxis on the street. They will not stop because they can't pick people up off the streets, or you can wait for a taxi to enter the parking lot.

SQ9xhpoQhsexOsfN1NmJfQ.text: Chicken wings are a crime scene. Bahn mi almost makes you forget how good bahn mi can be.

bucFF_5crLbyAvVRvB7iLQ.text: Good late night eat. Love pho, especially in these colder months. Always a good spot to eat at

y0kXbncfIcYbXdXlGzpmtQ.text: If I have a choice, I don't even want to give 1 star.  service sucks! there's a girl at the entrance, she is so rude to me, we brought a stroller for our little one, she yelled at me not to block someone's passage, is that the right attitude toward the customer? she didn't even show me any other place to park my stroller. Should I just place it outside of the restaurant, so people can take it?  Manager doesn't know how to train their employee...so pathetic!  food is not any better than typical pho restaurant.  too much MSG. Eek. Don't go this place period! so disappointed.

OqkS_cLG11-ObpL2YtTyWA.text: Broth was really, really good..... the veggies in my vegan pho however was obviously old which was disappointing but my friends beef pho was perfect (so she says)

lWILXUzENE7elsfw3rHvzw.text: open 24 hrs!!  pho the best for hangover!!  service = super fast!!!!

mmpCaiThhVubHImHh1RgRA.text: I believe this is related to the restaurant of the same name in San Jose, CA. Anyways, I had the spacial beef Pho and it was average at best. The portions are small for the price, but the service and the atmosphere is significantly better then the one in SJ. Probably will come back if I'm craving Pho in the area.

_-8QRfaMNMEl8eovEnNytQ.text: The best pho in town. #10 Large, Egg Noodle. Yum.

pW09IgLseAcNm7JjIOzysQ.text: Despite the what is hopefully an unintentional innuendo in the restaurant name, the food is absolutely delicious. My husband and I were craving Asian food and decided to explore the areas off the strip. Intrigued by the name and prompted by good yelp reviews, we decided to try it out. We both ordered the standard Pho Tai (rice noodles in beef broth) and loved it. The noodles did not clump together like at other restaurants and appeared to be cooked to order. The soup broth was flavorful and very refreshing. I would definitely recommend it. And in Vegas style, the restaurant is open 24 hours!

COUEt694uVJIGQl-US8BzQ.text: I love how pho kim long is open 24/7! Pot stickers are the great munchies when you're drunk after a good night of partying! I'm here all the time! :)

__TlLlUhV-mbQQ6LFic_1w.text: I prefer the pho at Pho Kim Long over any other pho restaurant in Las Vegas. Very inexpensive and delish! I don't feel overly full and stuffed. I feel healthy leaving. I've never ordered anything but pho #10. Soooo good!!

NOIbtLt3TEB2RLXwAPFTFw.text: You gotta love the name "pho kim long" time lol... The decor here is better than any Vietnamese restaurant I've ever been too and to match the food is top notch! Great place to cure your hangover in Vegas. It's also open 24hrs!!!

mUhyAoubdDOO0gn7140jcg.text: Pho Kim Long is the place to go after clubin, love the noodles & their spring rolls which comes with a delicious peanut sauce.

IMRMwS8dpSAU5fPFMg_vyg.text: It isn't Pho to Chau in Honolulu but it's good Pho. Can't go wrong with this place. I wouldn't go for lunch hour while at work though this place will make your clothes smell like a kitchen.

esXl6gxuF0Uepr_uTTfnsg.text: only eat here if you want a little extra protein. after waiting forever for our food, I was greeted with aphids floating atop my pho. they obviously do not wash there vegetables throughly. when confronted, the waited made it seem as if I added the little green creatures to my own food and then proclaimed they wash their lettuce and vegetables THREE times before serving to customers. poor service, poor quality, don't risk eating here!!!

0buvpCYttiwSLNNTKXwU9A.text: open 24 hours! i ordered pho and it was good! meat & noodles didnt taste old everything tasted fresh. we got seated quickly n the best part about this place is the price! its off the strip so food is back to normal pricing. love this place!

dSzhilewT9EctIKv6ejdvw.text: This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant and favorite restaurant!!!  I always go there once in a while. I love the environment and atmosphere, I feel very comfortable eating there.

hwfTm9gIWAoM8b5jo3fDhQ.text: The best Pho restaurant in the Las Vegas area.

qES0YWOHNM0Kb6t1EZC3nA.text: The Pho here is delicious. And you have to order the fried egg rolls. Something about Pho deeply satisfies you. Pho is good to eat when you are hungover or sick. It hits the spot. One thing I like about this place is that they are open 24 hours a day!

zvM_banA9a5ntUF7Ht1lHg.text: best vietnamese food i've had in a very long time...very clean and modern interior which you might not guess from how it appears from the exterior...the staff is awesome and very helpful...definitely try the fresh young coconut juice and the pho...can't go wrong...will be trying again!

jRjKUCVLZjvc-ffvlDeGdg.text: Good food with great service!!! And it's open 24hrs!

F9wCgyq_rXZs4POC1Q--yg.text: Ate the pho here...pho dac biet...it was okay.  Not as flavorful as the pho I've had at other places.  Big restaurant though and good for large groups.

FfQqaKviYflgPp1DExAUwA.text: This place is awesome! Every time we come to Vegas, we always try to eat here sometime during our stay! They have great food, fast and friendly service! Of course, we have to have the Pho! We will continue our tradition and visit this place again when we're in town!

kE4c_tF_Mo6d-tzhJ2qEEQ.text: I'm glad I Yelped this place! We were in Vegas on vacation and I wanted to eat Pho but didn't want to eat on the strip. Ratings were okay on Yelp but decided to give it a try anyway. I had my whole family there and we ordered the Pho, Pork Bun, spring rolls and we were very happy. The food was delicious, the place was clean and accomadated our large group. Will definitely come back when we visit Las Vegas again.

ZN7Rs-xkwMRo-v_ksVFF1w.text: decent, but serioualy whose going to tell at 7 in the morning after a long night of work =]

NIoYRxHCyikDDkprjkKkiw.text: "A-OK" is about right.  Pho Kim Long is the first pho place I've tried in town, and it seems to have a pretty big menu and draws a large crowd. Unfortunately, the bowl of pho dac biet that I had today doesn't quite match the flavor of restaurants back home in San Jose. It seemed smaller in size than I would find at a typical San Jose pho restaurant, so the price is high, especially if you have a regular bowl (as opposed to the large or dac biet size, which is inexplicably #13 on the menu instead of #1). Even the Thai basil that they hand out is pretty skimpy compared to every decent or good place in California. The rest of my table wasn't too impressed with the food either.  It's unfortunate... I wanted to like this place after hearing from some locals, but I guess I'll keep looking for a go-to spot to satisfy the occasional pho craving.

5CQ73QWn0dFvUTnB-UQXbA.text: I've been here a couple of times while in Vegas -- pho is always great for the morning after partying til the wee hours of the morning. ;) The prices are slightly higher than in LA and the regular size is on the small side, but the broth is flavorful, the beef is tender, and the herbs/veggies are fresh. And they're open (almost) 24/7! Works for me!

ahwcnWB5evPCowDpvk_2Sw.text: I'm not sure how their Pad Thai Noodles normally comes, but I asked for no meat and instead of just having noodles, peanuts, green onions, and bean sprouts like most Thai restaurants make Pad Thai, I got a few undesired surprises. I spent the next 10 minutes picking broccoli, bamboo shoots, and bok choy out of my noodles. There was so much in there that it took up more than half of the plate. Again, I've never had Pad Thai at a Vietnamese restaurant, so I don't know if this is normal, but it was quite annoying. The flavor overall was meh. I probably won't go back.

n_PtHhFeN6sBhUerMY2iSg.text: every time im in vegas i end up here after a massive night of drinking   pho = the best hangover cure!  i love this place mainly bc it's called "pho kim long" i mean common that's funny  the service is fast and the food comes out fast  this is my go to place and i recommend this for anyone who has a hangover in vegas   i always get the pho tai, less noodles, no cilantro and i ask for steamed sprouts and i side of white onions. what?! i'm a pho snob :P

xbdKXtItjCudSMZyPczeYw.text: I always stop by this place when I'm in Vegas. This place can get really packed.   Open 24 Hours! They have so much to choose from on their menu! quick and friendly service plus their food is always good quality.  My favorite appetizer here are their FRIED OYSTERS. Not TOO crispy but cooked just right!!

CEQxU2J0XmhRtPBc35mSjQ.text: Love the Name but the food is not up the level of OC Vietnamese. Kind of surprised they do the business they do. Boba was a little hard like it was frozen. Fried calamari was real greasy and the egg rolls had a funny taste. The Pho was a 2 on a 5 scale so I would take a pass as this was one and done for me and my group.

v1WPdbjAwVigDjA8jnHNmw.text: We were visiting Vegas from NYC. I Never used to think ny had good Vietnamese food until I tried this place. My sister recommended it as we needed to feed our kids something comforting like noodles and rice.   The pho broth lacked that deep beefy flavor, it was even really light in color. Beef balls were like weird textured mini meatballs. Nothing was outstanding, just mediocre.   But it must be a popular spot. It was pretty busy.

Ds9o344e5-6zClKJenAggg.text: Bad taste, salty.. expensive.. special appetizer: Chicken Lettuce Wrap $10.25 Horrible...ridiculous Do yourself a favor go to Pho So 1 you will be happier...

EGkLwrTzf69RxXevStZKjw.text: No wonder this place was voted best Vietnemese restaurant again for 2013 it's that good!!  I am from LA and this place came recommended by family friend and I was happy w/ the place; there was a line outside the place but it moved quickly; Food was sooo tasty I ordered the tofu pad Thai very flavorful and big portions too; I would return when in Vegas again; Service was also good

5nidJURUotH3WAfUQbTstA.text: Can you say Pho Kim Long three times fast? ;)   Anyways, this place is so derrishous! Perfect for late night munchies after clubbing. They have great service (got to-go & dined in in the same weekend). Great prices ESPECIALLY for Vegas.   *Eggrolls are bomb *Pho is tasty (add-ons for +$1 e.g. large, extra noodles, better quality beef)  *Bun Bo Hue is great! I'm by no means a bun bo hue expert but I really enjoyed the subtle lemongrass notes. They give you a different type of rice noodle (not pho noodles). No odd ingredients in this Bun Bo Hue - just lots of beef parts.

VZeI7q4YLZ4RPp5yN9Wj5A.text: By far this is the tastiest beef stew egg noodle I have among all the pho places I have eaten at.  The summer roll is average, but not bad. Quick service and clean.  It looks a kind of hidden from the outside at night because the curtains were drawn.  Overall every good eats.

lWEKv_UibxpMB5PRCJBJQQ.text: If you are in town and are looking for a quick authentic Vietnamese meal, this is the place to go before you catch your flight.  The 24-hour operation is a big plus.  Caution: Expect typical Chinatown-style service.  Don't expect to be served as if you are dining at Four Seasons.

XG8Ew6w9eXIftRmQH2OKSw.text: I have been here several dozens of times. Food is always been consistent. But when I come in and ask for a take out menu time and time again and the cashier with his back to me throws the menu at me, makes me never want to come back. I'm Asian and in the industry. No need to ever shit on someone who is going to hand you money. The lady hostess is very gracious. I don't know if this guy is the owner or not but it's not even that busy right now. I came here out of convenience. This will be my last visit here. Plenty of other better options.

EA8YbMtcWDuwaerZ1KvArQ.text: Kim Long has been in Vegas China town a long time but nothing has changed for the better. Here is the good: open late, fast service, fast bill. The ugly: you may get the wrong bill, dated , old, cleanliness may be adequate.  The bad: pho noodle soup and the spicy beef soup taste like msg. They make look like pho and the traditional soup, but they don't taste like it. What worse? A bad case of stomach upset right before heading to the airport!

L_9CbMD6bVNmukGTVbDSQw.text: Don't order vermicelli unless you want to wait 45 mins for it, which is by the time everyone at your table is finished with their pho.   The service is also horrible. They are not attentive in the slightest bit and the cashier got in an argument with my friend about the receipt. Also, we were told we could use multiple credit cards for our check and we wrote out how much goes on each card trying to make it easier for the cashier but as he started punching in all the numbers he just gave up and rudely gave me back everything and demanded it all be on 1 card. Oh and we also had to wait 15 minutes just to even get the check.  The food was average. I felt like you can get this stuff anywhere.   Come here if you want your day ruined.
