JugBgoree5Yuu64uzq7gwQ.text: NOT COMING BACK!  Went to Las Vegas.  We came here for lunch.  I know this place through a friend referral.  My family ordered 2 bowls of Pho, shaken beef with rice, grilled pork with rice and crystal noodles.  They taste okay, still edible but not terrible.  The beef is very very small portion.  The quality need to improve.  The quality is tasteless.  Fail big on customer service.  The guy bring out ours Pho slam the 2 bowls down the table which make a really loud noise.  In addition, the lady bring us the bill point out the tip amounts there are on the receipt.  This is not very polite.  She keep asking me if she can charge the tips on my credit cards.

lnNC0C-yM6ZKmhMUHrUeDA.text: Food was just alright. I ordered the meatball noodles soup, rare steak pho and the teriyaki chicken. The  meatballs had a weird texture and taste. The rare steak was alright, and some of the teriyaki chicken was a little under cooked. Not too impressed. Drive a lil further down the street  to kinh do. Worth the money and drive.

dcQ5uAnlec1pGpHoyBF1Sw.text: Once again, I came back and gave this place another try and once again, Pho Kim Long failed me. I ordered the spring rolls appetizer and Chinese broccoli with tofu. While the spring rolls were okay but very pricey, at $5 for two, the Chinese broccoli was bland and tasteless and they cost $15! Together I paid 20 dollars for these two inedible expensive items. I don't think I will come here ever again.

E2D1j3FvaQubl5rWaWlBrg.text: I must of been Vegas-style drunk and staying out late starving, the last two times I was driven out here. Cause this most recent trip (though not completely sober yet not completely famished, either) I did not find much enjoyment in their food.  This go around, I had the chicken pho. The chicken was cut up into thin slices of white meat which was a bit chewy. The broth was pretty much a fail with very little flavor. At 8 or 9 bucks for this bowl of noodle soup, I definitely expected better. And since my food was unsatisfying, I took a few bites off of a friend's fried rice. That  was too oily for my taste. I was not feeling that either.  So aside from the very quick service (got our food in about 5 minutes after they took our order), the complimentary hot tea, open 24hrs., and the fact that the name does have a tendency to make people laugh and tell off colored jokes at 3 in the morning, it's just not the local spot for good Asian eats.  If you had the "best" of anything here.... you were drunkers, pho sure.

xidssZzW6iTrnGrtUx7kbA.text: Solid food and consistent local favorite. We go there to get pho and drunken noodles. Service is very efficient.

RRMyslW8vD2TXwEUsyHAuA.text: Still excellent food with bad service.   But, it's ultimately the food that everyone goes for.  The egg noodle wonton is yummy. The number 1 was not no 1. Pho is flavorful.   So much on the menu and they make them all so well.  The service staff see you as an inconvenience not as a customer,  hmm.  That's the kind of abuse I have to endure to get the privilege of eating their truly delicious food,  so they had me at the hello followed by the curt, how many.  Love the food.  Addicted to it.

K6fdlgfstj52tIt2pi3dPA.text: I've gone here soooo much that I've already made myself known as a regular. staff is AWESOME(well the ones I usually deal with are, on occasion I will get that random rude server/busser) and the food is EXCELLENT !!! This is a def must go when coming to Vegas!!

mzRzjOY6Md-iYOsLg4ckZQ.text: Ate here twice. Always packed!!! Amazing and fast service. Food are great and not pricey either. Will recommend to everyone, especially friends...

-wW4vnSqNLfU9FqveaO2cQ.text: This place deserve 5 stars. Service was good, clean and most important the pho was good. Tasty soup base; not salty. And generous portion.

_ilDT996_S0nRbzcQAHH6w.text: This is the go to spot me and my friends head to after a night long out in Vegas. It's open super late, and the pho is pretty decent with lots of noodles and meat. Costs lil' more than Tuscany Suites steak and eggs, but sometimes pho is the only cure for a night of heavy drinking!  Oh and they serve WHOLE fresh coconuts here. Very refreshing, and a great source of electrolytes :)

nArr7YUpSjGxQ4ouRvSSLA.text: Pretty good pho. Fast service. Tofu nuggets are good too, they put pieces of edamame in them which I think is a nice touch.

iabicK3uYRxNpTdNCy_60Q.text: A 24 hour Pho place?! WHAT?! I guess anything is possible especially when you're in Vegas. My BF and I love going here after hitting up the club because who else would be open at 5AM serving Pho?! This place hits the spot especially when you're throat hurts after screaming your heads off after watching a DJ spin at a club on the strip, or if your sinuses need to be cleared because of all that cigarette smoke you had to inhale and are now congested.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W98w07DQpCqyNnilyLJ6Xw.text: For some reason I always crave for Pho when I'm away from home. I decided to come here after looking through yelp reviews for the most reviewed pho restaurants in China town.   Definitely 5 stars for cleanliness and promptness in their service for an Asian restaurant. This was probably the most clean Vietnamese restaurants I've been to. Decor was modern and restaurant was big - great for big group gatherings or late night munching. They seemed fully staffed so whatever you asked for was done quickly.   Pho Kim Long serves many other dishes, both Vietnamese and Chinese food, so there's a lot to choose from. I ordered Beef Pho and was very satisfied with my selection. The beef slices were very tender! The portion of beef was generous in the size "small" bowl. I have to compliment them on their soup - I know every pho restaurant uses MSG but this place seemed to use it sparingly. I wasn't super thirsty after eating and did not have a problem slurping up the soup either =)   This will definitely be my go-to spot if I'm ever back to visit! Come hungry, leave satisfied...especially after a long night of partying =D   Happy Eating yelpers!

FYX3SlIy9cNneupE6Cessg.text: So just stopped by this place. Been here several times but this time had the WORST experience.  Walked in waited 10 min for anyone to greet the line....no biggie their busy. But get this...I'm 2nd in line. Couple in front of me gets asked how many...then the hostess skips me asked the two couples behind me how many....btw they are all of Asian decent. Then she ask me finally how many....I said 2. She puts my name down under theirs and I asked why did you u skip me? She decides to draw an arrow up putting me above their names. ...lmao...really? ! I will NEVER eat at this place ever again due to the lack of respect for a different race. I'm saying this nicely. Ps. I'm hispanic.

mtrcX1JyU2gDIiA5EZFYUg.text: PROS -plenty of large tables for big groups -the calamari here is one of the best i've had! they must add some magic seasoning to it (msg perhaps? haha) -i picked a plate at random (crunchy pan fried noodles) and it was delicious! -for me, with tip & tax, it came out to be $15 -we arrive at 11:30-11:45 right before the lunch rush so there was no wait  CONS -there was confusion when they delivered the food. they would call it by # when we ordered it by plate name. it's not a super big deal though -skip the eggrolls! puny and no flavor!  recommendation? YES! great hang over food!!

zjY7YeBvj_uJ6Dn-LucN8A.text: It is a good Vietnamese restaurant.  Can get very busy but almost all the time it is reliable for those seeking a taste of pho.  It is open 24 Hours so I am amazed at how consistent it is.  The name is quite funny.

ZBNPEn0USLZctH0qBRqiVg.text: Everytime I'm in vegas it seems I HAVE to stop here at any time of day. Their food is amazing and portions are good to share! I took my would be husband here for the first time and he loved everytime we had. Definitely try the black bean small clams, calamari serving was huge, house pan fried noodles were perfectly crispy! And if you have  leftovers, i swear they are better later! (Especially after a few drinks) Pho Kim Long is a tradition for me to stop by everytime here. I"ll be back here next time and next time again (until i move here)

Ezf8J7vsb_NSkAe_X1XYiA.text: Their vermicelli and charred pork is freaking delicious.  However if you eat here the wait staff is pushy so be sure to have your entire order ready when they come to the table because they do tend to rush you out the door.  It is almost comedic,  if you can over look the service,  you'll enjoy this place.

ZNEasF33fTOLINKYDRvvhg.text: Rare beef pho(x2), combination pan fried noodles, salt & pepper calamari. Add some egg rolls and ur set

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt &amp; pepper calamari with side rice

2g_aPI5QC2qu7z5aeYis9w.text: Unlike the other posts, I haven't experienced the extremely bad service at this establishment.  I mean it's not superb either but they take your order when you flag them down, they bring out your food, and they drop off your bill before you ask for it.  This is one of my go to spots in Vegas!  Pho is the best comfort food to heal a hangover.  I usually get the Pho Tai and the small size portion definitely fills me up!  I also really like the deep fried egg rolls.  Soup and fried goods = best hangover cure!  Two thumbs up!

cSUC2aQi0-OXp9gYiz-AZA.text: No wait. Big restaurant with lots of seating. The food was decent. While other members of the party had piping hot noodle soups, mines came out warm. The seafood noodle soup had 3 shrimp, some imitation crab and squid.

lOmIXcPL6gcLT0UNm_HouA.text: During my Vegas weekend, the GF actually got some crazy sickness and had to be bedridden (which totally sucked). Especially on the strip, trying to get some good, hot soup on the go is nearly impossible (especially since it was President's weekend) so we went off strip to this Pho restaurant.   When you come in, you know it's a good Pho restaurant when 100% of their clients are Vietnamese and they're all here to eat pho. As we were immediately seated, they took our order of pho and egg rolls. Like any pho restaurant, their food came out almost as soon as we ordered. The pho broth was light and flavorful. Even the GF that was dying said that there was so much different types of flavor going on in the broth. They also gave generous portions of meat in the pho as well. I would say that their meat to noodle ratio was almost 1:1 unlike the other Pho restaurants that I go to in L.A.   The price here isn't that inflated as well. A bowl of Pho ran 7-8$ depending on which one you got and the egg rolls were 6$. The egg rolls weren't anything special but they were skinnier than the ones I usually get.   If you're looking for some good pho (especially after those crazy nights), get off the strip (don't go to the one in TI) and come here. It's cheaper and better quality and bigger portions.

d6nTWJIrn1mUAp44gnxDrQ.text: After long nights in Vegas, finishing off your trip with a last meal at Pho Kim Long is a must. Hits the spot every single time. I also highly recommend their calamari, it is so good!!

f0GTZn-sP002t0-KLIC70Q.text: The pho here was quite good, and the thai tea with boba was good as well. When a place like this is open 24 hours, you know you'll be back at some point. It was pretty busy here at 3 or 4 am, so be prepared for a line, especially if you come during normal hours.

vwQH-dn1BixZ8jcd7LEvVg.text: Don't think I can ever eat here again, I ordered to go more than 6 times in the passed 8 months and all of my orders had something wrong with them,  Especially my last order I decided to try pho for the first time and found a dead spider in my noodles...how disgusting! Never will I order anything again!

fm30mb0VfBmz6EH8_nF8Jg.text: This place is solid and unforgettable.   My fave dishes here are the (very unique) vermicili(esp. the one with spring rolls and fried tofu or sprimp)... It's ingredients are multifaceted, and the sweet and sour sauce on top is the only sweet and sour sauce I've ever enjoyed. The pho with brisket is yummy, but I'd like to try the pho at Pho So(which somehow looks better) to compare.  Drunken noodles here are great(any or all meats); so are the potstickers.  I dislike: the spring rolls(they always taste old and bland); the Thai tea here sucks, so get a... Vietnamese coffee instead. Or an avocado smoothie!  Call to make a reservation for a group dinner, or your legs will regret it. Prices are reasonable--some dishes are maybe $2ish overpriced in comparison to nyc/sf spots... But who cares when you're a block from the Strip.

uodluMnvWCwZD6qN2aW51A.text: Overall: Been here twice and of the 1001 pho places in Vegas, this one inches higher than the rest, but still isn't perfect.  Food: I typically order pho with brisket, flank and tendon. Tendon is hit or miss in most Vietnamese places. Both times i've been here i've had issue with it, the first time i got one small piece and this last time i got several inedible hard chunks. The broth is quite good though. I also get a Vietnamese iced coffee. I am used to it coming in the drip brewer at the table and pouring it myself, its kinda fun, but here they brew it in the servers station and deliver it in a styrofoam cup. not a deal breaker, but i like doing it myself.  Service: Good. There is usually a wait to get in because of the popularity but there is ample serving staff and i never feel like i'm invisible or ignored. English is a second language for most of the staff so communication barriers exist but can be overcome with patience.  Atmosphere: nice place, nothing major to note.

zQF_6qDe6uJ3Bx_isRpe0Q.text: Delicious food! Great decor Too bad I can't say the same thing about their service. We were in a party of 3, they brought one dish out and took forever to bring out the pho.

MFvfu3PZUx8GVWiOq-YDWw.text: So far, the broth for their Pho is my favorite. & the chicken porridge!  This place is one of the late night places to go since they are 24 hours. They are always busy even thought the restaurant is huge. I would rate the service 2-3 stars. It's always been like & I expect it from a place like that. It's not a big deal, I come here all the time anyway!

KG0c31oZw4NdltU64cZRcA.text: Gotta have pho after a night drinking in Vegas. I thought the pho here was alright. I ordered the combo pho (pho dac biet $~9) and thought the portions were smaller than some other places and the broth was somewhat salty. The saltiness didn't hit me until a couple bites into the meal, but I simply added an extra squeeze of lime to counter the salty flavor.  The price was somewhat reasonable, if you're comparing it to L.A prices. If you're comparing the price to other pho restaurants around the vicinity, it's somewhat expensive.  The interior was well decorated, probably one of the more modern decorated pho places I've been to.  Overall, good experience, but just A-OK on the pho pallet.

D_W877C4ymwU56syJYx3mQ.text: This place always seems to hit all the right spots when I want some good Vietnamese food. We ordered some pho and Mongolian beef and both were good. I was expecting some bamboo shoots in my Mongolian beef, but it was missing. Other than that, the food was good and I had leftovers from the beef dish- it was good enough to feed 2... Or maybe even 3.  I'll probably come here the next time I am in town and want some pho.

92KXunxzKooFsoBYYiyFLg.text: Pho Kim Long has earned the distinction with me of being the "Gold Standard" for Pho in Las Vegas. It has earned this distinction with me because they are open 24 hours, they always have a good consistent quality with their food, service is usually fast, and their restaurant is nicely decorated and has a nice ambience. Whenever I try a new Pho place I always end up comparing it back to Pho Kim Long. Most Pho restaurants in Vegas tend to fall short of Pho Kim Long.  I can tell you that after a night of partying or drinking, a big bowl of Pho here really hits the spot. This restaurant is located in Chinatown just a short drive from the strip. Pho is certainly a healthy choice and a great way to keep hydrated out in the desert here. It  will also help warm you up on a cold day. If you have never eaten Pho get the traditional Rare Steak Pho (it starts out rare but is cooked via the hot broth) or get my personal favorite Rare Steak & Brisket Pho. This place seems to be busy all of the time these days with a wait to be seated. Usually the wait is not long and is worth it.

pDLHIWZDKiSUWSVylVpJ9g.text: Best place to eat at in China town ! Fast service and their all you can eat sushi is amazing also staff is very friendly

P8BGm9P5zB1-fDTvytcMkw.text: LMAO! Ok, ok. Got that outta the way. But yes, the name of this place is hilarious, but the food didn't disappoint.  A friend recommended this place for lunch and I was thinking, "You serious? there are more places to go to in Vegas then a Pho place" When we arrived and I saw the sign... Pho was the perfect choice. How can you not crave Pho after the name puts a smile on your face? :)   So now on to the food. I got the spring rolls, which tasted fresh and better than average. Then got my combination pho with rice noodles. The broth tasted really good. Just added a little bit of the hoisin and sriracha sauce to give more kick. Service was also fast.   Another plus. Open 24hrs!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spring rolls
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination Pho

-ZlQgUaHii11lwBxOsw5sw.text: This is definitely the go-to pho spot post a crazy Vegas night.  The soup is A-OK - but due to the limited selection, I will definitely recommend this place + Lee's coffee is right next door.  Please note that they do not have tripe!

bAC9eKe7-DwE0d5BjttJvg.text: Awesome local Pho joint with delicious options and best of all, open 24 HOURS!  Pricing is not bad. I've been here with the husband before, as well as friends at Bachelorette parties or just in regular settings. Great place to get food in the middle of the night as well as during the day-time.

XwInaCzH_9xQ6CO5rXsNBA.text: All time favorite.  The Pho is exceptional.  Bun is great too.  Staff is simply the best as well.  All in all - I never go anywhere else for Vietnamese Pho or Bun.  This is the place.

dTwyD-ZaED4Bt5bRhLIvUA.text: PHO for breakfast is the BOMB....my first time here...it's always a plus to me when a place serves some kind of soup during breakfast...it is a hearty meal...and totally a soul food for me.  This will be one of my go to places when I go to Vegas.

37d4B18DF9MrjTGySumrmw.text: Even though I am Vietnamese, I don't like or crave for pho like some of my fellow Vietnamese peeps. And when I do crave for pho I am extremely picky since most places put way too much MSG. I am not a fan of pho kim long in the bay and I am still not a fan of it in Vegas. The broth to me is very medicore with too much MSG. Meh. We didn't have a chance to look around to see if there are other pho restaurants in the area since we wanted something to eat and then head back to the hotel to catch some ZZZzz.

hPU44fSD4SHw2eeQIqjSWA.text: My son told us about this place so we tried it last Sunday. We ordered fried oysters, but they were tasteless. The honey garlic pork was good though.

bu43sxthOsM1MWASVrlj5Q.text: I have dined her 2 times. I always give most restaurants a few chances. The first time My experience was good. I enjoyed the Pho very much as well as the spring rolls.  BUT today I was highly disappointed. I ordered the Wor Won ton soup and it was lacking a whole lot. No flavor to my broth what so ever. The pork egg rolls were warm, not hot. seemed like they were sitting for a bit before being served to our table.   On a good note we were seated immediately upon arrival during the Lunch Rush Hour. Our waitress was fast, and friendly, She even fixed our bill for us as there was an error and we were charged for something we did not order.  The Pho my brother Ordered was full of flavor.   My suggestion is DO NOT ORDER the wor won ton soup. Stick with the PHO!

0ABfzPhBLZTjouHJ9C_hsg.text: Recommended to me by 2 different Vietnamese friends. I love the Pho and egg drop wonton soup here. Egg rolls were great too. The place is always busy which is a good sign and its open 24hrs which is awesome. For 2 people the bill was only like $35 and we were full with 2 large Pho, 2 coconuts/water, and egg rolls. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special combination Pho

ylocf1nLI1u4dG5lYoZ_xQ.text: This place doesn't believe in answering phone calls. And as of recently they hired an older lady and gives terrible service. She quickly rushed us to order without giving us time to look through the menu.. 10 minutes into our meal, she dropped the bill of on our table without checking on us to see if we needed anything, or to see if we wanted to order more.

EU3aQgYnmdsURhoBIAOZow.text: Absolutely amazing!! I would eat here everyday if I could haha. They're quick and customer service is excellent. Order Pho Dac Biet and it came out in less then 2 minutes and it tasted amazing. Good things is they're open 24 hours, means party hard and come there buzzed for the best food you can have after a great night. Went here the next day and tried the Broken rice with grilled pork . Every time I go to Las Vegas I have to go here at least once. There are you many other things in the menu I have yet to try, but I will haha. Prices are decent too, unlike these ridiculous casino prices and to top it off casino food isn't that amusing to me unless it's like a buffet or something.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oR88npKBt5iWRZgVFctUUg.text: Vegan options are limited, but they exist and the food is great. Service is a little cold, but at 9:45am, who cares? Vegan pho is amazing and the veggie fried rice is very good.   Added bonus? Ronald's donuts is right up the street and they have a bunch of vegan options.

9WjvuAmIbOeLOPTAGGCc0A.text: I'm never going to eat at this place again.  We usually come here every vegas trip but this last trip we found a cockroach in our calamari.  Totally disgusting.    ****BEWARE****

zbrcUo3_U-DnCO8YJ_l-gw.text: This place is always packed with good reason. It's pretty amazing. I'd never tried Pho before but fell in love with it. I started ordering the vegan Pho and love that choice better. I don't prefer to eat meat so I like that option. I'm allergic to shrimp but still choose to eat their shrimp spring rolls because they're THAT delicious. The pricing is not bad at all and the service is good. Although it's always busy, the wait is never really outrageous. We go every Sunday as our family brunch and it never fails. Try it. ;)

8EXFLf8y6MBfHnTk_HAg_w.text: Always open with good broth. Definitely a good late grub after the club gets out.

-PfDM8Yps8m-y4Amh7PUdQ.text: 24hr pho place?! Done deal! Haha  Came here with some of my sorority sisters after the club. We were so excited for some pho! Took a cab here from the strip (about $12). It was pretty crowded, but we got seated right away.   Ordered a rare steak pho. Delicious as usual. They give A LOT of bean sprouts..I was in heaven! Haha. So generous.   Maybe a bad idea to eat pho the night-of because that's a lot of liquid. Probably will rethink to go the next day instead, haha.  The name of this place still throws me off, haha.

kFB7psrV6WkZ73fF4dFwYg.text: Our last lunch spot before my friends and I flew home to the bay.   It was a $12-$15 cab ride from the strip, $30 round trip?!   Food was decent and price was cheap compared to Treasure Island Pho.  Not sure if I would actually go out of my way to come over to Chinatown just to have some pho here.  Service was slow, but the portions were huge.  They gave me so much meat in my pho that I couldn't even finish it .  My friends ordered BBH and it didn't come with pork blood. That was the main ingredient!   I also had the coconut drink , cause I was hungover. $5 for the coconut?! i could have gotten another bowl of noodles.    I will not recommend taking a cab , just to eat this pho. I rather walk over to Treasure Island and pay $15 for the same quality of pho, minus the cab ride.

w42kM1TUXa1G9bay7Pxrdg.text: Visited Saturday night at 11pm. Very busy but waiter was attentive. Lettuce wraps were tasty. Good experience overall.

BseGstFIJHb2jNbWkTqJhA.text: K maybe I didn't try the pho which they are known for, but I felt that their goi cuon (AKA spring rolls) were meh. The rolls didn't taste particularly fresh, as evidenced by their semi-crunchy rice wrap. The peanut dip was peanutty, but nothing special. I think they get plus points for their late night hours and drunkies craving a bowl of hot noodles. Only in Vegas...

ny-GKpZoDPLstL27LvM-Ow.text: Fast service, good food. Although they serve other Asian cuisine that isn't much to write home about.

-pvjKV5j8FMMHUDEJYolsQ.text: Soup came out cold. When we told waiter he said he was going to microwave it and not make a fresh one. Customer service is TERRIBLE!!!!!!

qz6KpjR8j-j8kFVgWESOsQ.text: Go to spot for Pho when visiting LV. You know this place is good when you see the line of Asians standing outside and overflowing into the parking lot. This place starts to get pretty busy around noon, so try to beat the crowd if you can because they don't take reservations. It's a dollar or two more expensive then the pho you're used to paying for at home, but it's good. I love all of their rice plates and side dishes too. When I go with groups we always get the greenbeans with minced pork and garlic. Soooo yummy! They're not too far from the strip either, so if you need to cab it, it won't be too expensive.

aM2DXN4p8iZrNUGf9IFCiQ.text: Best Pho ever.  Not just in Vegas.  But in the world.  They are packed all the time.  Yet, service is great every time.

NGAlw0CDj35zRQ45QgUBOw.text: Items ordered:  Pho tai: tasty  The regret: 3 buns for $10 - braised pork was so tiny and all fat - they will push that item on you. STAY AWAY!

WNRVbh6xpJJctYADkrRw0Q.text: Excellent. I eat at a lot of Asian restaurants and this one is on point. Friendly staff that obviously likes their jobs, fast service and solid food. It's great to see a restaurant that I can recommend. If you love Pho, go. And it's open 24 hours! Respect.

lVuRFvyGRrNonB74A2gwGQ.text: On 1/22/15 I went and had the worst service I've ever  experienced   My wife and I ordered 2 separate meals plus a side of rice, after taking our order my wife gets her meal within 10 minutes. Patiently waiting for about 20 mins till my food came out and another 5 after that for the  rice. Without ever asking us if everything was okay! My Drink was only refilled once by another tables waiter, our waiter only took our order and brought us the check. Before giving the check to the waiter, their  was a host next to us cleaning a table; my wife asked her if her meal was what she asked for she responded no. It was our first and last time there!

B_cyddxajQU6QkuSCHbFcw.text: The staff is always friendly, the food is always fresh and you hardly ever have to wait for a table.  If you like pho, this is definitely the best restaurant in Vegas for it.  Great prices on quality foods.

Rb8oyY3h7rhtRFQnq3FPnw.text: Good food, and good service even though the place was extremely crowded. You can expect to wait for a table for about 15 minutes on a busy day.

hkCIVlbKB4gwpXNH39rrlA.text: I remember eating at this place before leaving Lost Wages. The server had these sunglasses that was hanging off of his face , kinda like the guy that was playing Dracula in Bram Stokers Dracula with Wynona Ryder in it  It looked like if his face wouldve caught the fan the glasses wouldve fell right off haha.  He looked ridiculous.  The pho was ok, the goi coun was ok, the service is typical Asian.

fD6LLTnWv1Em43qI8dejsA.text: Still the best place in town to get great food with great company. Ive been going here since i was 10(im 25 now) and its still my most favorite place to come for lunch dinner or that late night shift. The service is awesome and the people i still remember as a kid are.still here. Keep it up :D

nywt-9c6ZFCLyemm7OuhGg.text: We came here at around 3 AM...  2 stars for being open late... but everything else was a disappointment.  We got the Mongolian Beef (beef was chewy and often times not even able to be swallowed).  Won Ton Egg Noodle Soup (broth was okay, but the wontons seemed undercooked and had an odd flavor, and the noodles were kind of hard and undercooked...) the chicken fried rice was slightly better... but the egg was an alarming shade of orange and the rice tasted bland and pretty flavorless.. with very small pieces of chicken.   We were hoping for better, but unfortunately we left disappointed with out eating much of the food we had ordered.

Mfj0k4Pg7esN_xvtH3DMcg.text: Good pho, less than average customer service. I like that it's open 24/7 ...go for lunch. Obviously get some pho ---try the grilled pork spring rolls!

7o_eSQM79lbX5pTL5mWavQ.text: I don't know if pho shop owners gather weekly to come up with clever or hilarious names, but I like it. (maybe they do a weekly "Pho"ne Con"pho"rence.) The only thing more memorable than the restaurant name is the pho at this place. Pho Kim Long is delicious pho goodness in Las Vegas and it's open 24 hours. I never even considered eating pho in Vegas because I'm always trying to go to the buffets, but now I think I have to go here every time I visit thank to my drunk Japanese boss who suddenly craved pho. Because it's Vegas, it's one of the nicest looking pho restaurants I've ever been to. I just wish it was closer to the strip.

QIP1RmL23STX-4-CslpjKg.text: I would have never found this palce if it wasn't for my friend, who's a vegas native. I hadn't been to Vegas's Spring Mountain Road in 2 years so of course a lot of the restaurants have changed. I had the regular pho with some eggrolls. I love the eggrolls with the sauce-so crispy and delicious. The place is super crowded but everyone eats fast so the wait isn't long. After some pho, we went to go have yogurt. Great ending to a fantastic meal.

oh2JwOAtAF4TDMp8H3uvqQ.text: Good pho option if you're seeking rehab from Vegas. This is my oasis in the dessert. An excellent find, considering most places on the strip are pricey are regular american fare. If you're craving noodle soup, this is worth venturing off the strip a bit.

eALwlMEP3AzNyKOxtH_TBQ.text: This is not your ordinary pho place--the decor is "wanna be" high-end Asian seafood restaurant, complete with sparkling clean fish tank full of colorful fish.  So not surprisingly, the pho is better than average.  My benchmark is the vermicelli with pork and egg rolls, and this one was good lean pork, and nicely crisp but not overly greasy egg rolls.  The young coconut drink is another benchmark for me, and they serve theirs in  the coconut, so you can scoop out the coconut meat and eat it afterwards.  Haven't had THAT since I was living in the Philippines.  Sure beats the version they serve at my local pho place in the sundae glass with the canned juice/meat.  Expect a short wait, but worth it!

wobXvqOwz1RRvvbegbCZRw.text: I love the Pho here, and now that I'm pregnant, I love it even more! it's hot, clean, and makes me happy.  ^_^  What I like about this pho is the noodle.  It is so soft and tender, unlike any other Pho Ive ever tasted.  Service is good and fast (I'm the kind of person that dislikes chatty waiters).

Kf9y0FS63ohd7U9bi9lC1g.text: The portions could be bigger. But the food was good at an ok price. I was somewhat irked when I ordered the wor won ton soup because the pictures showed large shrimp in the soup. Instead I get really small shrimp. The waitress we had was rather short and seemed upset that I wasn't ready to order after literally getting a menu in my hand. The decor was not and the fish tanks were a nice touch. Prices were mid range. We ordered a small pho tai won ton soup spring rolls and a fresh squeezed Orange juice. Total came out to approximately $40

wDQdxt1Ida2RXTzevWYXxg.text: Boy this is the nicest decorated pho restaurant I ever been too!  The tables and flooring were all different from the usual pho places in the Bay Area, it was clean!  The pho itself was decent, nothing really that special, but it was good.  Its located in this Asian Plaza on this Asian Street, felt like I was back in Cupertino or something.  Anyways cheap ok food quick is always good!

9S0A_-j1yCCu_lwfLlTJKw.text: Best Pho in Las Vegas, since I crave PHO especially when you come from the Bay Area. I got to have my pho fix. This place fills the bill. I like the fact it is open 24/7 since people like myself fly in late to Vegas.

wtXcM4aKn7aDPHrlWOJxBw.text: My friends and I first tried Pho Kim Long when they advertised themselves on local billboards as a Cantonese Chinese restaurant. Well, they really aren't that as they are more of a Vietnamese restaurant with several Cantonese style Chinese dishes. But the food we ordered was pretty good nonetheless. I have been back many times, mostly for lunch and love their barbeque pork with Vietnamese eggrolls and vermicelli (number 23 on the lunch menu). I always ask for extra fish sauce which I really enjoy with this dish. The lettuce and shaved carrots are fresh and crisp, the pork is always done perfectly and the egg rolls are delicious. They add crushed peanuts on the top so beware if you have allergies. I have always found the service to be prompt, attentive and personable even though they are usually very busy at lunch time (particularly on Fridays). I enjoy Pho Kim Long and hope you will as well if you give them a try.

My55uiui2F16dNXLVHuHbA.text: After a long day of walking around the Las Vegas Convention Center - and unwilling to pay $15 for a slice of pizza and a drink - we headed over to this place for some Asian goodness. Frankly, it looked more like a Chinese restaurant rather than a Vietnamese joint inside. And the menu reflected this to a certain extent, where the offering was well beyond what you'd find at a pho place, with dishes that readily reminds you of a Chinese joint in the 626. The waiter / server was helpful, pointing us in the right direction. The pho broth was hot and tasty. Saw a lot of other people eating what looked like stir fried dishes. Definitely going to have to delve into that side of the menu the next time I'm in Vegas. Highly recommended.

B-5Kl5MLIKm1G9hD2wa5SQ.text: Dirty name, great pho!  A wonderful choice on chilly Vegas nights or to detox from a weekend of buffets and alcohol.

0wiNqp-z6hEm0jeAgpcXJw.text: I've never eaten Pho before eating it here, so I have nothing to compare it to, but it was delicious to say the least. Just like Clam Chowder or Ramen, Pho is a filling soup that's full of flavor. We also ordered Salt and Pepper Calamari and it was amazing. It's a bit pricey at around $10, but the portion size is well worth it. It may be the best fried calamari I've ever eaten.

A_RcCG7hzPHQsaF8d4hclg.text: cream cheese wontons and calamari is a must order here! the portion sizes are good and price is right. the service is good. its not an american restaurant don't expect the same service theynare busy.... if you need something just wave down a server and ask. highly recommended!,,

161Su8616bT-9dny8svuEA.text: not the greatest pho ive had but the best ive had in vegas.  used to be a pho so 1 regular but now a pho kim long fan.  the service at pho kim long is actually better.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cr0Ud3iJqajwjWStRUHQuw.text: I really wanted to give this place stars but when you live in the Bay Area and have access to so many pho spots this place just does not meet the mark.  Especially when they want to charge 8.50 a medium bowl..... The decor has been updated since last yet the service and food is the same.. just pricier.  I have heard that their crab/crayfish night is the fun/tasty however I have yet to experience it.  This review is based on 8 different returns to the restaurant... different times of year, different years.  Yeahhhhhh-- not again.

UG611LpDqNDz-Wjo80s2bA.text: I've had better. I used to come to this pho place all the time with my parents but haven't come here in a while. This was my go to pho place when i first moves to Vegas over 10 years ago. Since its been a long I thought I would come back and try it again. But things have changed all lot and not for the better. The soup was a decent size cause when I eat pho I love a lot of soup and a large dish. But there was not much meat or noodles in the bowl. Also the soup was not pipping hot at all. This was the first time ever that I didn't drip one drop of sweat eating my pho. It didn't even cook my raw meat all the way...it was still pink! Also ordered the shrimp spring rolls and too my disappointment they were TINY compared to a lot of other places and a little more pricey. Completely disappointing and definitely not going back there again! Save yourself your money and time and go to another pho place instead. Too many places put there. I am so disappointed in my most recent experience here.

uakr5VDfVHNlPhusJno-eg.text: Pretty clean restaurant for being a Vietnamese/ Chinese spot, the prices are great, diverse selection, the best two things on the menu is the fried ginger chicken wings, and the filet minion with rice..

g85jGb_slY3GKxDxaoeGWw.text: I was hoping for this place to be like Pho Kim Long in San Jose but it was a far cry from that.  The pho was "ok" from the other folks with me and my bun rieu was not good at all.  It was very salty and they had snails instead of ground pork mixture.  That would've been bun rieu oc but their menu just said bun rieu.  Very misleading.

NuubAYmLB0asTyAZRaFKCQ.text: I am a Vietnamese from southern california so when it comes to eating PHO, I am not an outsider.  Just about every trip to Vegas, We have made countless  stops here at Pho Kim Long, Not because their food is good( not when a diner compares the quanlity and quantity with a more populous Vietnamese community like Westminster CA, San Jose CA, or Houston TX...Their pho's taste seems ok but the size is like a small bowl in CA and is far away from being on the top notch.  Once in Vegas, when it comes to Vietnamese food, a diner does not have many choices. Even though there are better choices now( in compare with a few years back, thanks to the competition.) But what really gets me to Stand Up:) and create a Yelp account to "award" the first so call negative review for Pho Kim Lonng is that I had a bad diarrhea in Vegas and really need a hot bowl of beef congee with green onions and ginger in it to wash down two caplets of loperamide HCL 2mg. So my wife called and ordered two bowls of the beef congee for me and for her too, since we were staying in a hotel room.  Being so exhausted at 3am, I had to drive up there to pick up the food. Ohh my God!!! When I opened it there was literally Almost noooooo meat! ( something My body really need to digest for recovery). When I said Almost it means that there was just a few very tiny pieces floating up and down to the point that I would rather don't see them so my mind can do a better job of persuading the so disappointed stomach that they have forgotten to put the meat in! I have done with my duty as a Yelp reviewer. There are not only Vietnamse diners but also many Americans and others. I wish the best for the consumers' community and hope that as a diner, you will make the best choice for yourself.

wZx21AebjwMzBob5lauhAQ.text: Good PHO!!  Nothing crazy in the soup and very consistent.  My favorite place in Vegas to eat pho!!  The restaurant is clean and is open late!  Great for late night eats or take out!  Gui Cuon are very yummy!!  All in all, I have never had a bad meal here.  Although there nuoc mum could use a little love.  Perhaps some lime juice etc...

PTD3EwGYmdeItUZ1y-cObQ.text: Decent pho place always crowded but line moving fast.  Good salt/pepper chicken wings.  Service wasn't great but then they are extremely busy so can't fault them for that.  Best part they are open 24/7

1Ls8Vx2f3t-_vR4IBIEnNw.text: The go to Pho place wile you are in Vegas. Definitely not the same as the one in San Jose. The Pho is so so but what's to complain about when it's 4am and you just want some Pho..  The Pho broth is standard issue and the rice dishes are nothing to rave about. Just eat the Pho to satisfy your craving for Pho and go back to your hotel for a couple hours of shut eye before you hit the pool

oawlWieBCggelvMpNXbEjg.text: Open 24 hours, so great for getting some food after drinking and partying it up on the strip.  The food is pretty tasty, and they serve a couple different noodle soup dishes that are good for a hangover.  They also have some tasty rice dishes.    The downsides to this place are getting a taxi back to the strip (although, they used to call taxi service for the customers).  Also, the prices have gone up since the last time I've been there.

CAv2GPaMtQE-Ocx398VHxg.text: Honestly, I wasn't expecting much from a Las Vegas pho joint. I mean.....usually I don't get beyond the Strip, but I was feeling adventurous and I had major comfort food cravings that Earl's couldn't satisfy. This place proved me wrong!  The wait for 5 the Monday afternoon following EDC weekend was about 20-25 minutes. Not bad considering what a packed weekend it was and the families buzzing around.  Got the Pho Tai Nam with tai on the side. They confused my order. I ordered a small, I got a large. I ordered tai on the side, they gave me tai with an extra order of tai on the side. It's okay, though! It was really THE hangover cure. The broth wasn't too shabby, a bit too much sodium for my taste, but I don't inhale the broth so it was okay.  The smoothies are packed with powders, but still delicious. I'd get the avocado one over the mango one, though. The avocado powder is at least masked by the creaminess of the milk and had a better aftertaste.   The decor is extremely modern! I was pleasantly surprised. I'm not sure why I was expecting something more rundown with 70s decor, haha. Maybe I'm just used to frequenting those types of joints. Just don't come in here with high hopes of having a deep conversations -- all the sounds are literally bouncing off the walls. I think it's the "yay I'm cured from my hangover" happiness that reverberates through the walls, but the yummy soup could also the case :).

rJ8PqxaN2U_boJzXFreTRg.text: Absolutely adore this place. As mentioned by others pho is the perfect cure all and you can't go wrong with being open 24 hours. My husband and I go here all the time and it's definitely our go to place when people visit from out of town.

75Ui1ybgSY3XSiH1l2zD2A.text: You can expect better quality service at Mcdonalds, this place was awful. we were ignored the entire time, server was rude, manager was EXTREMELY rude & unprofessional. He rolled his eyes and laughed at me while I was talking to him about our service & food. I used to enjoy coming to this place but I will NEVER be back & make sure to let everyone know they're very unprofessional & treat their customers like shit.

k5NZVET2qwupF5ky4FriQw.text: In October, visited this place on a week day! We were seated pretty quick and the food came out quickly. Three waiters came to our table to check on us.  I will be visiting this place again next month in December.

xBBmNY-rc6k7HHRfoTJV6w.text: Shopping center isn't all that attractive but inside this place is very nice. Excellent service. Kept my water full all the time. Lettuce wraps were mediocre. Beef Pho was excellent. Broth was amazing. Add a few jalapenos for spice. A lot of food. You don't need an appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Pho.

awMaBs8L3cl3DrY8YgM3NA.text: I love love love their vegan pho! Me and my husband go to this place all the time, EXCEPT they all have horrible service. But it's okay, because I never feel bad if we don't tip! Maybe if they were nice they would earn a nice tip.   Their crab Rangoon are amazing by the way!   Also, Jonathan has the best costumer service there. I recommend you getting him because he will actually treat you like a person than money like the others do.   Please work on better customer service then this place will be golden!

LXHbNStzQBbRYtFAvHAHdw.text: I guess because it's open late they're getting decent reviews, but on the quality of food it's no better than any other Pho restaurant down in Chinatown.  The broth was overly salty and for the price you're paying you're not getting a big bowl of pho.  Quantity is not just what I'm looking for, but you have to make up somewhere when quality is lacking.  Even in a Pho Dac Biet there was no tripe to be found.  How can that be?!  It's a staple.  A good place to go if you want to order a plethora of other non-Vietnamese type dishes, but if you're looking for a good bowl of pho, look elsewhere.

sx1SC2PCsCdvhtZx_h3BCw.text: There's always a wait but its definitely worth it!!  Food comes out almost immediately after you order. Service is okay, the servers really don't stop by but the food is "WOW" !!

oOY8cyODXf7XnnFeD9W6AA.text: I'm not from vegas but this is a good place for pho and they open 24 hours (That's awesome). The service was great and our food came out really fast. They have so many choices on the menu ,there's something for everyone. I ordered pho and good pho starts from the broth,definitely was on point . Their smoothies are made fresh even at 2 am . Definitely recommend this place after a night of partying good comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizers
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pho!!!!! Bomb.com at 2 am
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House special fried rice and sweet &amp; sour fish fillet

F6b9wRc3V8tZTCcw8IJRPw.text: This place is LEGIT especially after a long night of partying. Best hangover cure spot in Vegas! I use to crawl in here to get their medicine.  This place got the right broth for me. I usually order Pho Dat Biet, the "combination meat " and depending on my mood I have a few go to appetizers I like. The SPRING ROLLS are always good, CRAB RANGOONS are also tasty and also I love to get the SHRIMP MAYO w/ WALNUTS. Try those!  I recently went and it looks like they renovated the decor to a lil bit more modern look and you really can't blame service. It's usually really packed and the food comes out pretty quick.  And on top of that it is open 24 hours!!!!

iMA33Oh0zLO2F9DAwnBvhQ.text: First pho joint I been to that's 24/7 in Vegas.  Decent food with decent prices. I had the pho dac bit large

TeTa9aZK-0klDfPn6XF-yQ.text: Bad service - we asked for silverware & napkins several times, no straws for our drinks, and we got accused of ordering the wrong dish.  Bad taste - no taste, very bland, pricey for what you get.  This stretch of Spring Mountain Road has plenty of other viet restaurants, but 'pho kim long' probably has the most intersting name.  I guess that's how they get the most votes to be #1.

VarF2PWAfHR_lmBPE1L5XQ.text: Definitely not the top choice for pho during a Vegas getaway trip. I decided to try it out after hearing that it was pretty decent. WRONG. Right when we were seated, we were asked what we wanted to order FOUR TIMES within a 10 minute time period. Barely having any time to think, the manager asks after his second time, "Ready to order? There are people waiting to eat so you guys should hurry and make a selection". (He said something rude along the lines of that). They are basically just trying to get people in, take the money, and kick them out. This is definitely the worst customer service I've ever had in a restaurant.   I ordered a #13 combination pho (the combo wasn't really a combo considering there was barely much variety in there) My friend ordered the steak rice plate, which looked slapped on without nice plating presentation. It was not worth the amount paid for the quality.   I don't think I've ever had such a poor experience at a Vietnamese Restaurant. I see some previous complaints about the manager below and it is certain that he hasn't changed at all. What a dick. Please take this evaluation into consideration before going here to eat.

ZgbUz3aayLyeKoMJaeWfBA.text: I come here often because of the food/ service I have never been disappointed . The service is a bit a slow but I could never stop coming here . They only serve beer and wine  I would suggest to get the beer the wine is not the best of quality .

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

keUXCHoaoTRUvrbnobf0gg.text: LOVE. I come to vegas basically just to get their chicken wings and bun. My favorite Vietnamese restaurant ever.

Xgn2aopK0-6pZOCDf3DGsQ.text: I mainly go here for the Vietnamese spring rolls. They are so yummy and healthy. I've tried to make the peanut sauce at home but it just isn't the same. I also love the charcoaled chicken and rice dish.   They get very busy so leave extra time to wait. Also the parking lot is terrible so avoid extra busy times.

bVVENBWiTKhDl-0MuIUPXw.text: I freakin love this place, I go every weekend after work. Service is fast and the servers are always on it, never a problem and of course food is bomb.com!

YR2V1X5sbwQ0NQL2Io43Fg.text: This is literally the best pho place in Vegas. I love coming here right I drink and the morning after. Their pho just makes me feel so much better after I eat it. I love everything about this place!  I always get pho tai and egg rolls. I just love it! There is nothing bad I can say about the food here. The service is usually great but there are times that it is a little slow, but it is never their fault it's usually the customers' fault. Most of the time they are drunk or annoying and it affects the service because the servers are forced to deal with them first so that they can just get them out. It does suck that the workers have to deal with drunk people all the time. Last time I was there there customers were super impatient that they started drumming their chopsticks and yelling. As the server came to refill their water they also ended up accidentally hitting the server in the face and the customer just laughed. You have to give these servers credit because this was just one night, they probably have to deal with that stuff every night.   Overall the food was bomb! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

LoRTcDjP_mBfy1JqgAD5nw.text: Came here while driving through Vegas. Worst mistake ever. We ordered two small pho's, one large, and seafood chow fun with gravy. Everything was absolutely bland. The pho was so plain, no aromatics what so ever.   They share parking with a bunch of other places on the strip mall. So parking is horrible. My car door got hit TWICE by someone.   The good part about this place is that your food comes out fast and there's a lot of meat and/or seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h0GRbO4CLPqP3s9ZNZmm4Q.text: This place is open 24/7 and they serve everything on the menu at all times I believe which is a major plus. We went in around 10AM and it as pretty happening, maybe 10-15 tables. The service was nice and quick but the food, however, was just ok for me. The best thing I got was the pho, can't really go wrong. We also ordered spring rolls and crispy calamari as appetizers; wasn't impressed with either of these.   I was just visiting Las Vegas and was expecting much better food since it's a much larger city than where I'm coming from.

9hInShfl23n8NLvCP0Zivg.text: I've been coming here for quite a few years now. There are 3 main reasons why, it's open 24 hours, they have great prices and most of all the food is amazing. Every time I end up eating until I'm in pain because the flavor is addicting and the portions are so generous! I usually get the Pho Thai soup, it has thin slices of beef and rice noodles. My other favorite dish is the charbroiled pork with spring rolls. The marinade combined with the smokey bbq flavor is killer! Tastes like you got it straight off of your backyard grill.  This place does get crazy busy sometimes so there might be a wait but it usually goes by pretty fast. Put your name down on the list, I promise it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Thai soup
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charbroiled Pork &amp; Egg Roll

fOHLhhDyi1jUARPek5pbDA.text: I'm a regular at Pho Kim Long and I get my pho cravings fixed here. Location is easy to locate, it's in the Chinatown area. I usually come around lunch time and order a rare steak & brisket noodle soup, sometimes I order an add-on of meatballs for my pho. Appetizers is a must, I always come back for the calamari and the spring rolls with shrimp, pork, and lettuce. The peanut sauce complements the rolls, I recommend it! Service is great, I never had a problem with my waiters. Expect a wait-time if you arrive on a busy day, this place is popular for their dishes, you'll have to sign in on a sheet of paper up front until they call your name. If you're in the Vegas area, this place is a must if you're looking for affordable food that will leave you full and satisfied!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket noodle soup.
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls with peanut sauce.

s8iJU3cXOTJpSuk70w9R9g.text: I've been remiss in my Yelping as it relates to Pho Kim Long. We've been eating here regularly for 4 years.  Besides the name being a great play on word pronunciation (not for small children), we really like their food.  Admittedly we've done almost exclusively Pho dishes, everything is always good.   My wife usually gets the "Vegan" Pho and adds fried tofu. The veggies are fresh, the noodles are great and the broth is tasty, even without any chicken stock or beef broth. The food is always served promptly, and piping hot.   I usually get the special Pho with beef. I always add either broccoli or bok choy so I can feel like I've had my veggies and because it's good. They put plenty of meat in the dish and like my wife's example always fresh and hot with a broth that makes me want to drink from the bowl.   The egg roles are really good  The crispy whole chicken is amazing   The bun BBQ pork on cold noodles with fish sauce is also terrific.   Normally you can't give a 5 rating to a Pho place because the service usually sucks. The positive here is that the staff is friendly and prompt. Keep in mind traditional eating times are busy and there are no reservations.   I highly recommend a visit because this place is Pho-bulous

UoABNgKSQ0VGHhRotFJuZg.text: Given how often I'd see them pop up in my Yelp feed late at night, I'd long wondered if Pho Kim Long was actually good or just a post-clubbing sort of spot. They have a ton of reviews, most of which don't mention being here in the wee hours of the morning, but it'd also be fair to say a good chunk of their business comes well after midnight. Then again, who cares? Cheap pho is always good, especially to save a few bucks in Vegas! In all seriousness though, I was actually pretty excited to finally try Pho Kim Long, even despite running into a line at 9pm (a sign they might actually be good!). Now, maybe it's just because I'm used to divy pho spots in the Bay Area, but I was impressed with how big and clean this place is! Similarly, the menu and all of its options looked great as well. Though there were a bunch of things I wanted to try, I already knew what I had to get... -- CHA GIO - Kim Long Fried Egg Rolls (Chicken)...$6.75 (yelp.com/biz_photos/pho-...) Decent, but not among the better ones I've had. While the rolls were both meaty and sizable for the money, the flavors fell short for me. Mainly, I just wish they had used pork instead of chicken (it was kind of dry). That said, I did like how golden and crispy they were! -- PHO DAT BIET - Special Combination Tender Beef Noodle Soup...$8.95 (yelp.com/biz_photos/pho-...) I wasn't expecting this to disappoint, but I was still pleasantly surprised! The broth wasn't too shabby (beefy and not too oily) and the bowl was pretty large and chock full of stuff. That said, the noodle to meat ratio was heavily skewed to the latter, as this was rather light on the carbs. As far as service goes, I have to agree with others that it's definitely not their strong suit. While there wasn't any singular issue for us, most of the staff was a bit dismissive of us. I know - not exactly atypical of pho joints, but the staff wasn't typical of most pho joints either (read: younger, no grumpy, impatient old guys). All in all, the THREE AND A HALF STARS is dead on, but I rounded down despite how their pho is pretty decent. They're definitely better than just a late night spot (open 24 hours!), but not good enough to endure the inevitable wait. I'm more inclined to try one of the other pho joints I've seen than to come back, but I'm still glad I finally made it here!

DzhiFzhTnrHFeq4fOiMlxQ.text: I WAS CRAVING PHO SO BAD AFTER A NIGHT OUT IN VEGAS. OMG.  I was searching Yelp for a good Pho place and came across here which was pretty close to us. I tried Pho Aimie before and I was pretty impressed by their Pho. I am from the 626, San Gabriel, so I am used to getting the best Asian foods around. I ordered a Pho Ga and when it came, I realize the chicken was not the usual shredded chicken you would get after you boil it fresh. The broth was not as good as the soups I am used to but overall, it helped cure me after a night of drinking. This place is 24/7 which is a huge plus since you can get noodles any time you want. Just 10 minutes away from the Las Vegas Strip so you can't complain.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Ga (Chicken)

rVeJrtewqlJNFLRxK-G5mw.text: Solid pho place. Always good food and fast service. Tried a few other places but this place is by far the best. And you can't beat that name

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls

eBO0-Jyb86rdtDVi0z8HRg.text: Always Prompt, Always priced well even though they are super popular, has a simple wait list to sign into so no one gets confused.  The establishment is surprisingly large and even with that space and the amount of people eating there simultaneously, they always get my food order right and always quick with a smile.  They really know their product. The wait staff asks if you want cilantro to make sure and if you order something out of the ordinary, they will helpfully explain it without sounding condescending. very thoughtful and really, does save everyone time and heartache.   They could easily raise the prices for the value they provide but they are what they are and it helps since the taxi ride costs more than the food. :p  24 hours! That really gets me going since I often find myself drunk on the strip at all hours of the day, LOL  Thank you for providing such great and thoughtful service with yummy foods with variety and courtesy.

Cz0bsxT4GoHcoNdPSJTa6Q.text: It's so hard to find parking in the plaza of this restaurant... so, just be patient, since a lot of people tend to come and go.   This is probably the biggest Pho place I've ever been to, and it's even opened 24/7. It was SUPER packed when I came here around 11am. You need to first sign in at the front counter.  Sign in sheet can get a little confusing. Please make sure you sign in on the FIRST page. Unless all 3 columns are filled up, then you would sign in on the second page.   Honestly, there should be a staff member at the front counter, facilitating the sign-in sheet.  Service was quite fast. However, I expected the food to be much better. In terms of portion size for the pho, well... they give you a lot of soup, but not much noodle or meat. Also, the soup had a cinnamon smell and taste to it, which I found really weird...   The food here is a little more pricey than other pho places. If you like broken rice, there's not many options for you to choose from the menu.   Before you use the chopsticks and spoons, please clean them. The boxes that contain these utensils are dusty.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu (5)
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu (6)
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu (7)

Xzf7-Pt_piH28U-tgXVZZA.text: Actual rating is 4.5 stars. (Knocked off .5 for taste of the pho - see below)  Honestly I think service might be variable depending on what time you come to this establishment. I can't speak on behalf of all others that have came recently but my experience here was great on 8/4/2019. My group of friends and I (total of 6 people) came here at 11am for brunch before heading back home to California. We were provided water as soon as we sat down and our order was taken in a promptly manner despite the restaurant being at full capacity. We ordered 2 plates of eggrolls, 3 pho tai, 2 pho dac biet, 1 bun bo hue, and an appetizer of xa xiu(barbecue pork). The bill came out to be about ~110 with gratuity included. I wouldn't say we waited more than 15 min for the appetizers to come out and our main entries came out quickly after that as well. The hospitality level was great and we were checked on multiple times if the food tasted good or if we needed any water refills. One thing I did notice that I've never seen before at any Viet restaurant was that the servers handed us each separate plates and complementing fish sauce dipping containers per person for the egg rolls. That definitely was nice although not the usual you'd expect. The eggrolls paired with the fresh lettuce, mint leaves and pickled veggies was an excellent start to our meal. You honestly can't go wrong with that appetizer. The pho had generous portions of meat but the broth as others have noted is pretty basic. You can tell they boiled the beef bones to at least create the base for the broth but it was lacking a bit of seasoning. It can salvaged with the hoisin sauce, sriracha, and/or fish sauce but if you're traditional type and don't like to mix it into your broth then you'd feel broth was on the blander side. My boyfriend loved the xa xiu appetizer. It is one of their more expensive appetizers at 12-13.50 dollars (can't remember the exact price) but it was definitely tasty and a generous portion of sliced barbecue pork. I didn't personally try the bun bo hue but my friend that did said she enjoyed the dish as well. Unfortunately I didn't get any pics of our food before we demolished everything! Pho Kim Long definitely met our expectations and hit the spot at least for good last ending note of our Vegas trip!

8J1-GfVRV6GZLTz9q9KwHA.text: Knowing that this restaurant is 24/7, my friend asks to go here as a last resort.  For the most part, we order to go but after our last few dine ins, I thought that it was time to write a review.   Let me just say, the host seems to get scolded by the manager whenever we pop in. It's so awkward to watch.   Now for the food, I've had their Pho Dac Biet but it wasn't good enough to remember. Now, my go to is the Bun Thit Nuong (vermicelli noodles with charbroiled pork and shrimp) and sometimes with egg rolls on the side. It comes out super fast no matter how crazy busy the restaurant is. The egg rolls are pretty good but you cannot screw that up anyways. Recently, I had the Bun Bo Hue and the soup was just warm. I did not get much noodles either :-(   Okay now for the service, it's in the middle of crappy and having to flag someone down for drink refills. It's frustrating but understandable to a certain extent. I also know that you have a choice to tip or not, but my friend gets called out every single time he does not tip. I end up having to cover on his part. They do it in a rude manner as well. Oh yeah and some Uber did a hit and run on my car last time I stopped by soo....fuck this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Com Cha Suon Hoac Thit Nuong

RKTD83o0Pkcjsy-cX3AAYQ.text: I had the fried egg rolls, pho tai and charbroiled pork vermicelli.   The pho broth had a good deep flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pho tai
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. charbroiled pork vermicelli
