CE-cjO2_8aclV7-xjQIN3Q.text: Rudiest place I've ever been.  Waiting so long for a table possible 20 minutes wait. Finally got seated. During our order was being placed we were  moved to another table while the new guess surround us as we had no choice but to get up from our seats. The hostess took or menus during our order. We had to ask to see the menus again.  As we waited for the hostess to come back my two brother in laws brought their own food with take out bags into the restaurant. They were told that outside food wasn't acceptable in their restaurant. I asked to see the manager if it was possible if they ate their meals with us as we eat ours. We were told that it's their policy and refused even though it was a total wait of 30 minutes. I explained that we waited so long and was treated poorly while we were in their restaurant but she insisted that it's in their policy that they can go eat outside because they can't bring outside food into their restaurant. I suggested that at least they can make an exception this one time. The hostess was really rude and we felt we had to rush out for their next guest to be seated.  No one came by to check if we needed refills or if our meals were to or expectations/ liking. We couldn't find our waitress. The only time we saw her was because of our check needed to be paid.  Awful place to go dine. We will never return nor we ever make any suggestions for our family or friends to dine here again.

LhRyEmGhqtpTfqGo0U4gPg.text: Pho beef raw was very good and served fast! The meat cooked in the broth (like it is supposed to) and came with sprouts and greens. The onion was too strong or I would have rated 5/5.  Would eat there again for sure!

gnT8j9hT-b5EUYhz_-c8Dw.text: Great food, fast service, reasonable pricing, great location, close enough to Uber or Lyft from the strip. There was a wide assortment options offered on the menu. I had some fresh spring rolls with shrimp inside. The dipping sauce was really good with it too. My GF had some bun which was also made to perfection. My other friends got pho and they enjoyed their meals equally. I would recommend to anyone who enjoys great traditional Vietnamese food after the club in the middle of the night or any given time of the day. Will be returning to enjoy more when I am not so buzzed LOL

1F3OVs_sxCqq4srj9PmZrw.text: Special Combination Tender Beef Noodle Soup was sooo good!! We also got the chicken lettuce wraps and pan fried pot stickers which were also delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special Combination Tender Beef Noodle Soup

N-k_m1LsuPHLT8vhBbxKHQ.text: If you notice throughout even good reviews, there's a consistent complaint about service. I had been going to his restaurant for nearly a decade and I can attest that this is True.  The service in this establishment was never stellar.  However, I've worked in the service industry myself. I'm not an entitled person. I dislike the social norm we have in retail or the service industry that the customer is always right or that employees have to over-the-top friendly and fake nice.   So, with this establishment, I didn't mind ignoring the fact the service was consistently average or below average. I assumed if we got in and got out, we'd have no problems with staff. My last visit will be my last since they dipped even below my "below average" expectation. My most recent visit my party was yelled at for being in the way. No, "excuse me" or even a flat "go over there."   We were barked at, "you can't stand here!" When we were being shown our seats, one of the other waitresses pushed me out of the way because she didn't want to wait the few seconds for me to take my seat. I had witnesses to this. We were stunned into silence.   When our waitress came, she gave us ONE water. We never got a refill because she never came back except to chuck down our check and promptly leave. I see other reviewers giving the staff excuses like, "they deal with drunk customers." This was mid-day.  Additionally, as someone who's worked in the industry for quite some time, even graveyard, you're friendly to everyone until someone isn't and you return the same energy. You don't default to being disrespectful and rude.   If it was one rude employee, I don't mind. But when it's every member of staff you come across, no. Don't disregard other reviewers about staff. They'll be disrespectful to you too regardless of how nice or friendly you are to them. You're not going to find yourself being the exception. My party wasn't behaving unusual or different. We were quiet and tried to be as easy as possible. It just wasn't enough for them.   Their food quality has also dropped to where it isn't worth it to deal with rude staff. Honestly, I'm not difficult to please and I'm extremely flexible. Way beyond what I should allow, but this was too much. I deserve better. Their customers deserve better.

eU50lsJ_qgGI15dnaPJOXw.text: Took the family here for breakfast;  Ambience: airy and great open space with a lot of plants.  We ordered 4 special pho: I don't normally order pho at Vietnamese restaurant since the family can do it. I was completely surprised with this pho. Most of restaurants will combine their broth with a beef paste to keep it economical and you will taste an unnatural sweetness. When the pho arrived, it has a unique aroma and I new that this is will good.   The broth was on point, with certainty, this restaurant uses a lot of beef bone, ox tail and a hint of chicken bone in their stock.   They didn't filled the bowl with lot of noodle, which is a plus. There were plenty of beef, beef ball and tripe, and they didn't skimmed on the herbs.   Solid

HWr90Sa4BQNE0FQYiTN5jw.text: TIME SPENT many meals - Lunch/Dinner/Late Night  LAYOUT very spacious with an overflow private room.   lots of asian themed decorations (thai, buddha, fish tanks, etc).  SERVICE/FOOD great service...  maybe because i'm a regular.??     PRO 1. great PHO 2. good appetizers (pot stickers & calamari) 3. huge menu 4. boba tea selection is always good 5. rarely closed - 25.hours/day  CON 1. chinese menu is OK.   my american friends enjoy it.^^; 2. seafood menu is MEH.   i've ordered Clams in Black Bean Sauce and their Giant Scallops and can recall how awful they tasted.  PRICING average cost...  nothing that will blow out your wallet.  CLOSING i love eating here because it's always busy, even at 2am...  and that lends to a very exciting upbeat atmosphere.   my only gripe is it tries to do too much with it's menu and the result is not all that great.  NOTE* i hate being served only 2 meatballs for my Pho Dac Biet.!!

5pHBf8DiXyzJWDF8aj5M4A.text: This is my favorite late night place after a night of drinking, and for takeout when I'm sick. The pho is great and the ingredients and everything are really fresh, i love the veggie pho and it is full of fresh veggies. I like their bob a teas as well, its always open and always really fast. The service is not the friendliest, but they are probably dealing with a ton of drunks like my friends and I so I'm not too picky.

KSjIx1Qy30Sw_pGuZrf68A.text: Taste: 3.5 Creativity/Authenticity: 4 Atmosphere: 3 Service: 2.5 Bang for your buck: 4  So there are many 24hr pho spots in LV but this is the place to be, great selection of Vietnamese and your occasional chinese here and there. Now to the pho, yeah its just soup what makes it good? why is this place so good compared to the rest the broth! hands down greatest broth in LV, so much flavor. Now asian restaurant are notoriously known for bad service if your not asian haha but yeah it was good, what i care about in every restaurant no matter expensive or hole in the wall is my water; if you as a restaurant cant do a simple task like this as to keep any of your customers water filled up or even acknowledge if they would like some water than you have failed and well thank you pho kim long for my water! The atmosphere is well cant explain it much cause every time i eat here its 6am in the morning im wasted and this place is packed with as many people who are wasted as me. Overall this is the best pho place in LV, and if your around chinatown at 5am in the morning swing by and check it out for yourself.

VGn3Tdz8xtFq1W_ypgO9Zw.text: Okay I can't help being a bit immature here.  But try saying the name 5x really fast and see if you can suppress a giggle.  The good: - Huge menu variety, they've pretty much got everything. - Pho tai.  Delicious tender meat and rich savory soup broth. - Spring rolls.  Baby you da you da best, best I ever had... - Cool decor.  Aquarium at a pho joint what??  The bad: - A bit off the strip. - Waiter confused our orders. - A bit pricier than I'm used to.

retocp4TNrxj4za0F3F-FA.text: I have to admit, I was tripped out by the name. I mean, say it five times fast and you're gonna have the chuckles! My mom, sister, and I once had a field day about the name (which may be a blessing in disguise since it kept us in great spirits during our midnight food runs). It doesn't make it any better that I reside by a Pho Kim Long in the San Jose area. But I digress. Now onto the review! This place is where my family and I go to when we need our pho fix. It's seems perpetually open and a convenient drive from the strip. The staff is surprisingly nice and upbeat on all my visits (something you don't really experience from any other pho restaurant no matter what time you go there.). Reasonably priced and good food. This restaurant sets the bar on Vietnamese restaurants. I will definitely go again if I'm ever in Vegas and want pho. I have even recommended people here.

J8kgt-T0VAZPGjRPMkV5wg.text: BEST place to go whether you woke up hungover, still drunk, or just craving pho after partying all night at the club. Sure, it may not compare to pho in San Jose (if you're ever up in norcal you've gotta try Pho Kim Long in SJ!) or Westminster, but this is the best pho you're gonna get in vegas. And it sure beats the americanized version they serve at TI.  And I've never made it after a night at XS, but it's open 24 hrs so you can get a headstart on that hangover cure.

3jpxqzRchrSBU_ctCrCCDw.text: This is one of my favorite go to places for pho and vietnamese food.  Its super popular with the locals and its menu is wide and there are lots of choices.  The menu is visual and multiple pages so you can actually get lost trying to make a decision.  It can be pretty packed in the evening,  and nearly impossible to get a seat in under 30 minutes in the early am after the clubs let out.  The staff is pretty attentive and gets food out in about 15-20 minutes after its ordered.  The dishes are served family style,  meant to be shared,  but i often eat an entire dish to myself.  I usually order the delicious spring rolls (cold),  the deep fried tofu pillows,  and either the seafood phad thai,  or the honey walnut shrimp,  which melts in your mouth.  I highly recommend pho kim long.  The fact that it is 24 hours, makes this a super useful spot to get your Vietnamese good fix anytime of the day or night!  Cheers!   -MikeB

sVsPiFXTq05Pkgf2zxg2Ow.text: I am currently sitting in the middle of the dining room feeling as if no care is given by management.Horrible and disrespectful service.  food came out very fast but was extremely cold as if it was cooked an hour ago. Actually it was a fried egg roll and it was cold inside and out so of course it has been sitting for a long time. When we asked for the food to be hot, the waiter said, "it is hot". such bad service and I am even taking in consideration that it is an Asian restaurant where service is not the number 1 concern or priority. I am sitting in my seat right now waiting for a manager, getting looks from my waitress as if I am lying about cold food. Unbelievable.

UCYyrhI4KHN5ugjcdwH4rQ.text: This place is a definite MUST when you're in Vegas. It's like a hip Vietnamese restaurant where all the young kids go after a night of clubbing. They're opened 24/7 so it's perfect to stop by anytime.  It IS called PHO Kim Long so you gotta try their pho and nothing else because my aunt did NOT enjoy her Com Suon Nuong (rice with grilled pork?). I'm not sure if it's always packed on weekends but when my family and I arrived at 11AM on a Sunday, it was a full house.  Service was mediocre.  Our server could have been more attentive.  It took a really long time for our pho to come out due to the party of 15 before us.  Other than that, Pho Kim Long was a good experience.  I'll be bringing my friends here after a long night of drinking and dancing :)

7S8dbVBiTf7OzAKvzSVh0A.text: if you had a crazy night in vegas, and it's 3:30pm the next day and you're hung over, hit up pho kim long for your life-restoring pho fix. they give high portions of meat in proportion to the noodles, and these guys got the broth down.   the various different pho combos/options and spring rolls are on point.

7nySETkQ2eZ5ra300mHtXA.text: SoCal Pho is better than Vegas Pho. Pho sho.  BUT for being in Vegas this place was probably 1 of the better places to get your Pho fix after a long night of head bangin' partyin'. I got the Pho Tai Nam (rare steak and flank). The seasoning of the broth was ALMOST (keyword) comparable to that of places in Garden Grove and Westminster (S.California). It's a good fix, but I definitely would not come here unless I needed a hangover bowl of pho. Service is ok, but if they know you're Viet then they're a lot nicer, so lucky me for that.

OL7EJigZRi2D8VMdh2KiGw.text: Big crowds, long waits, good food!  Ate here twice during my inaugural trip to Vegas - would definitely come back here next time I'm in town!

E_p4d3VKQQF3sUdODBMkQw.text: I love this 24 hour restaurant! There is always a wait, but it's very quick. They have a great selection of food and beverages. Everything is fast and fresh. I love the Vegan Pho and the fresh coconuts! The tofu nuggets are unique and delicious too! I always have a great experience here!

mxS8JqrYOSUtyWDkuUOQXQ.text: Best tasting pho broth in all of vegas,  fast service,  no nonsense,  #3 fried rolls are a must have.  Open 24 hours!  U never know when you're gonna be in the mood for pho.

Yi8yPeb5eIS1T_lXjubENw.text: yumm! if your in vegas and looking for a cheap good pho place this is it!!  we ordered some honey pork chops.. soo good!!! they can get busy fast but they are great to cure your vegas hangover. Its a little ways from the strip but definitely worth the cab ride!

22rtlwuOADF4zsv9m07tRw.text: It is definitely one of the better Vietnamese restaurants in LV Chinatown. Very clean and simple decor. Definitely looks a bit fancier than your average pho restaurants, probably because it is in Vegas. Open 24 hours so that is a great plus! I guess it does have to be since it is again..in Vegas.  The food was ok, i had their Beef Luc Lac (sauteed beef filet pieces in traditional Vietnamese marinade served with salad and rice). Now the meat was tender, but what i wish they did differently was served me some flavor rice. Most Vietnamese restaurants serve Tomato Flavored rice with their beef, this place just had plain ol steamed rice which was a bit bland and dry for me.   Also i had one of their lemonade drinks, it was warm and only had a few pieces of ice in it. My parents had the pho, which looked and smelled good but they definitely looked small. My grandparents had the traditional Vietnamese dinner with stewed fish and sweet and sour soup. They loved it, so hey it must mean something.  Anyways, go here for a nice change from fancy restaurants and buffet in Vegas! Never close!

5fr7ETDuLXCgDC3S24ltSQ.text: "what?!", "where did you want to eat?!", "HAHA! huh?!" Those are just some of the weird reactions I get when I say I want to eat here. I guess you can say it doesn't sound very nice to say, but the food here is my favorite Vietnamese cuisine. I'm not a huge fan of the pho but I'm a very big fan of their vermicelli noodle bowls! It's the perfect amount of food for someone with a middle sized appetite. They're open late night so if you're out on the strip with your friends or are looking for a late night snack (hardly the size for a snack), Mr. Pho Kim Long is your best bet to satisfy your Vietnamese craving.  The service isn't super because of the lack of personality their staff has but they bring your food out fairly quick. Does one base service on how quick you get to eat or how pleasant they make your visit? I say it depends on both but lucky for Pho Kim Long, their service is very fast and consistent.  It wouldn't hurt the staff to crack a smile or two, crack a joke, or laugh even. They don't have a problem splitting your checks as long as they get their money.  The atmosphere is very traditionally Asian and being of Asian descent, it doesn't do much for me.  In other words, you wont catch me with my iPhone in hand snapping shots like some tourist or something. Maybe, the food for Yelp but that's all ;)  Never had a problem customer service-wise, always accommodated the big groups of friends I go everywhere with, and doesn't take log to bring what you ask for. That's a big thing for me when the server takes the detour to bring you something you've asked for. And having to ask for it twice really peeves me but as busy and as impersonable as their staff is, they go and get what you ask for right away. Maybe to get you to go faster? If I wanted to be In -n- Out of a joint, I'd go get a burger! Hahaha! Go for the pork vermicelli, add the sauce they give you with some of the oyster (brown) sauce and a bit of the hot sauce and you'll be good! Have some fun saying the restaurant when suggesting to eat here! Happy eating! :)

HLxevDAxP--Rz-MzMyBtag.text: Today 2/27/2016 I went out to eat with a friend and we found a hair in our food . The manager was very rude and demanded to leave. We also over heard their employees saying that they didn't have hot water to operate. They're not clean and I will never return to this place.

lMRA1ubeXiWQfgrlL92OvA.text: The group I was with insisted we had to come eat here at least once before we leaving Vegas. One of the nicer and cleaner pho places I've been to, which I appreciated.   A plus for having a variety of options for pho as well as family style entrees, as half the group wanted pho and the other half ordered a bunch of plates to share.   I split a bowl of the combo pho, which was the perfect amount for the two of us. Plenty of noodles and meat, and I kept slurping the broth even after I ate everything.

1HQvvxpIAxlgM54TsyRwjw.text: The pho was good, but definitely had wayyy too much MSG.  we also ordered their calamari which was really good!  very nicely seasoned.  it tasted like "tom rang muoi" but instead of the tom (crab), it was calamari.  the food came out very quickly, which was a plus because we were hungry, and tired!

iNmkKGmPFUxBs25NtI8MIA.text: My wife is born and raised Saigon and I resided there 5 years, we can accurately review this Vietnamese restaurant... Our local friends are 20 year patrons and swear by the food... Although they have not visited Asia, let alone Vietnam, their taste relies on the Americanized versions of Asian food... After reading many reviews, we arrived with open minds and empty stomachs yearning for hometown goodness...  We were seated immediately and water was provided... The menu is huge, to say the least, and contains a mix of Vietnamese, Chinese, and Thai dishes and flavors... Our order was taken within 5 minutes of seating...   Fresh spring rolls were lacking shrimp and pork... Just a smidge and over powered by lettuce and noodle... The peanut dipping sauce was par for out of a jar, but the nuoc cham sauce was weak...   The pho arrived with lemon wedges... What...???... A first for us... The server stated they were out of limes so they use lemons... Our friends had the pho so I did not sample it, and therefor, cannot review the flavors... The bean sprouts were raw and only mint was provided... Where is the basil...???...   The bbq pork vermicelli dish contained very little pork... Was mostly lettuce and noodle... Thought I was eating deconstructed fresh spring rolls... The deep fried egg rolls were over cooked, but ok...  The clams in black pepper sauce was a mistake, as was the seafood bowl... As an exporter of seafood in Vietnam, wife definitely know her business... Shrimp is chemically treated so was slimy and tough texture... The baby squid was tough and over cooked...   The staff was normal... Never went out of their way or asked how we got along... Our friends paid the bill and were not harassed regarding a tip...  Overall, our experience was just under par... There are many other Vietnamese cafes with tastier dishes... Since this place is located in the touristy section on the edge of Chinatown, it is ok for Americanized desires... We will not return...

2dPQnoP7_2c5jTuEZpH8Tw.text: Ambiance Pho Kim Long is open 24/7.  Vegas baby!  That is what makes this place so popular in the after hours.  The place usually has a decent wait during the after hours time.  The place does not scream authentic with the plates and the layout.      Food Overall, I liked the pho.  It's good after hours club food.  There are other dishes like the pan fried noodles that are tasty as well.  The prices are cheap as it is Vietnamese food.  The portion sizes are big and that helps with rating the place higher.         Service The customer service was decent.  For Asian places, they usually come and take the order and give the food.  Nothing else that is super special.  That is what I felt when I was in the place.

NXAe_Mqam85ufUAQRlwGqA.text: **MAD RANT from a Viet Chick** This is NOT the same Pho Kim Long in Milpitas, NorCal, that we NorCalers all know and love. SHAM, I say!  As Queen Nicki reiterates, "I don't need NO FRAUDS"  Why is there is a waitlist of 15+ people with over an hour wait? I don't freaking know. But I am as bewildered and perplexed as you.  The pho here is literally a turn-off. If you eat enough pho, you can snuff out MSG in your dreams. Unfortunately with such a busy business, Pho Kim Long decided to take shortcuts and add a bunch of MSG into their flavorless, bland pho broth. But even that didn't save the noodle soup. Noodles were hard in texture, and meat was mediocre cuts. I got the Pho Ga (chicken), and I think they went to Safeway and bought slices of deli white chicken meat and just threw it in my bowl. The chicken slices were anorexic. WTF Pho Kim Long. You can't even get fresh real chicken with a Ranch 99 across from you?! #outrageous  At a pho place, if your pho isn't even good, I don't even want to try the other foods. Please focus on making good pho. NorCal, SoCal, and all of Cali has way way way way better pho. 100% disappointed by the foods.  The only positives were the super fast and friendly service and "affordable" prices. But I wouldn't pay above $3 for that monstrosity. Returning? I think not.

NEOrCRkPn8alIanZnv4Vdw.text: I like this place! I come here pretty often I would say it's the most popular in town. The Pho is really good. The workers here literally whisper to you every time and the place is so loud it's super annoying.

iFL8xHvz-CLqcNRyrRtFiQ.text: Late nite hunger after a long nite in Vegas this is the spot for a serious bowl of pho , pork fried egg rolls , bbq pork dish & house fried rice , always open ! Service is great prices are amazing if you need a little pick me up do the Iced Thai tea big bowls and dishes you will leave satisfied

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork filled fried egg roll there  were more but started before I took the pic :/
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq pork fried rice
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq pork plate a couple of nice size marinated chops

EZf4RJM6cnMyCU-mDrBtzA.text: Pho Kim Long... I know I'll probably end up coming at 2:00 in the morning still, but this last time was whack as hell. Story time:  Vegas clubbing leads to late night pho at the top spot for it in Chinatown. Twenty-four hours a day, crowds of people come and wait to enjoy a nice steamy bowl of noodles. This place is only good at night when you get the drunchies but that's not the point.  On a weekend in April when we were here, PKL's handling of a pretty scary situation left me annoyed and upset at the management. My friends and I were seated near the main doors where the bouncer and customers were waiting to be seated. We were eating our food and was simply letting time pass for us to sober up from going out.  Well, sober up we did. Before we knew it, something had happened where the glass door shattered and people started screaming and running into the restaurant. Someone shouted "gunshots" and immediately chaos ensued. A few of us in my party ducked and ran towards the back, while others used toppled tables for protection. You can't even imagine the level of uncertainty and fear that everyone was facing.  We ended up finding out that someone had smashed the front door with a crowbar out of frustration at the bouncer. We knew the restaurant had to close and we knew leaving was the best place for us to feel safe. I come to find out out later that the management demanded everyone to still pay for their food despite being completely frazzled- my friend included.   It's one thing to demand everyone pay versus suggesting it when the entire restaurant had just erupted in pure chaos. To me, this came off as not caring about your safety and more-so making sure nobody leaves without first paying despite cops on scene and folks frantically trying to figure out what had happened.  The management will likely remain the same so this was simply story time for those out here late at night. Be safe because you never know what could happen!

pf4HA64-LB1TYjfiFV7l6A.text: Every time we are in Vegas we always end up here. Love love this restaurant, it's our go to spot for sure. Always busy no matter what time of day it is and for good reason, their food is oh so very good and the service is fast and friendly for most of my experiences there.  I usually order pho' but this time around I chose the wonton egg noodle soup instead and thought the broth was tasty and everything in it was delicious. Spring rolls are also one of our favorite appetizers. Overall one of best Asian food restaurants to eat at while in LV.

Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LdqzKA-OGKibyDnafTXYrg.text: The food is great, but the customer service is terrible. They only come to take your order and that's it... You'll be lucky to wave a waiter down for a refill or for some napkins. THE WORST PART IS... THE CASHIER He definitely needs some training, he had the audacity to toss me the receipt to sign, and than tell me how much I needed to tip.

J42Hk7Stx2KyRiY5l3WWuA.text: This is my normal go to spot when I'm around spring mountain. The place is always clean and the staff are normally nice.  I always order the pork chops when I'm here and it never disappoints.  Make sure you dip it in the fish sauce, after you put the chili paste into the sauce.   The calamari is pretty good also, but sometimes a little too oily.    I'm spoiled when it comes to pho, so I'd rather not give their pho a rating.   Overall, I would say that the place has good value.

GtRtONSeJZYhubk-MwP6Lg.text: Jason aka the owner of Pho Kim long is the worst business owner ever.  They hire people that don't understand English.  I asked my server which is better the house special noodles or the Udon noodles.  The server asked me if I wanted do the combo for udon noodles.   I said sure and he brings me two plates. I thought it was the combo plates and apparently it was house special noodles and the udon noodles. I asked the server to make its not two different entree cause I only wanted the better one. He brings the menu and points to the two things and I said. I told him I asked you what's better from those two?  And then he starts arguing with me saying well you ate one the shrimp on this dish. I told him I order a combo so I thought you brought what I ordered and you placed these dishes on the table.   I asked him I want to talk  to his manager which was the owner of the restaurant- Jason. He comes out and takes the dish away I told him in a restaurant if you place a dish down on the table you can't take it back. The owner just replied you didn't order it. Obviously I didn't order the dish! The owner does not know restaurant etiquette. I got so pissed I didn't even bother to eat the rest (I only had sampled the dishes, almost full dishes) and was done with the owner, the workers, and the restaurant; the bonus is I was still charged. Last time I step foot in here

dMasqPP-kN0CgUHEhInxDg.text: Service is bad. I order to go tell me 45 m what is this?  If I order to go so be fast  I want coming again and I will tell my friend don't coming any more this place please don't coming any more  , everyone wait but inside have more table  but the don't let people go in and from people ask him he don't speak anything maybe he can't speak. What kind restaurant use people don't speak ? This just in Las Vegas if the is LA I don't think the can open right now

OZWuAuLk4-22zUXAnIs1yg.text: First time I came here ever was as a tourist from LA.  Now that I live here in vegas it's still a place I take guests, friends, and even my future in-laws.  Love their fried pigeons, their chinese dishes are pretty good too and of course the PhoKim jokes.  I never actually ordered the pho here.  There's good phos and bad phos, but if theres other things on the menu to try, I prefer dishes and rice.

JAKXkdhTLg-rt6K2tZP3-Q.text: Not the same anymore. Came here almost 5 years ago and visited today, and I must say it sucked big time. Save your money and go somewhere else.

TUIsEdq9LuH97oRvX-IEzQ.text: This place is like a 3 at best. For me, this is definitely not the best place for Viet cuisine but they do a good job considering it's Vegas and it's open 24 hrs. I definitely needed an asian fix down in vegas and this place is really well known.  The service at 11 am was friendly and attentive. I must say, if you need a pick-me-up, their viet iced coffee hits. Like 2x more than a regular coffee. Loved the chicory flavor and the brew was strong as fuhhh but I needed it. Would definitely recommend.  I must say I am very very particular about Viet food since we have abundant options in Seattle. I am also highly picky about my cha gio and bo kho. I really needed something nostalgic so I opted to try to the bo kho. Man. I probably should have gotten the rice plate instead. The bo kho with rice noodles were subpar. The noodles were decent but the beef stew itself was a 2 star. The pros were the tender meat that just melted in your mouth. It was different types of meat and helllla beef (more than any Seattle portion). That was filling and tasty. However, the broth was bland and tasted more like a pho broth than stew. Very loose and had no uumph to it at all. The dish had no body to it and no distinct spices.   Now the cha gio  (chicken egg rolls) were okay. I'm picky because I can make good egg rolls too but this one was decent. Nothing memorable for ~$5-$6. Good sauce though and loved the pickled carrots!  The spring rolls with shrimp were really good though. I must say the roll was so tender and everything was just so refreshing and clean. The soft wrapper really impressed me and the noodles were really soft too. I loved their thick peanut sauce and would definitely eat this again!  Overall, great service for Asians. Decent priced. For all of this we spent less than 40 bucks. And portions were pretty big for noodles. Next time I'd probably try the rice plates. Lots of menu items (includes chinese and thai dishes) to choose from. There's a parking lot but I heard on the weekends it is crazy packed.

wDjuOpnA3D4E_8EKUDBXyQ.text: The bad reviews for this place are mostly from drunk douche bags who show up at 3am and treat the place like it's a club. The food is good quality and the portions are substantial.

pMsB2vIdojgU6cfaZytREg.text: Worst service I've ever seen. The waiters are extremely rude to you with limited English and constantly ignoring our requests. They brought out the wrong food and accused us of ordering wrong. There are multiple Vietnamese food around and would never return again.

bmnMok1dgH1H3wDGy_cvyg.text: Pho Kim Long and Nina are DA BEST !!! Great food and great people !!!! One of my favorite places !!! :-)

mdAbsFmIj-NvuLM7rwRgbA.text: I come here pretty often after late nights out on the weekends. It's usually not that busy, but enough for me to wait every time for our server to come around, they will bring your food, check up on you ONCE, then never attend you again lol. If you want to pay your bill you'll have to get up and go to register.  One time I came in tried to order to go and their was people waiting to be seated and I could not wait so I left. You'd think that on weekend nights they'd be a little more staffed but nope they're not. ONE time though I do have to mention, I was pretty drunk I went up to pay with the young cashier towards the back, I gave him $20 in cash then my debit card. Which is pretty obvious how I wanted to pay right? $20 in cash and 20 on the card. Simple right? NOPE. The guy either pocketed the cash or used it as tip for them. CRAZY I did not notice until AFTER. I was pretty drunk so the fact that he took advantage of the opportunity pissed me off. A second time I come here, I paid with my debit card, again either they charged me + never gave it back or they kept it. Called the next day they said NOPE its not here,bye. Lmfao long story short you will get taken advantage of here if you're drunk after 1am, and the service is shitty. The food is too good though so I come back for the convenience.

8Z97nsCCe53X-Ol4x-6Hsw.text: This wasn't the best experience. I come in with a buddy and we order two bowls of pho and some spring rolls.   First of all, be warned that the vegan pho does not have tofu in it which I found.. unusual. Just veggies. I asked for some on the side, they gave me four small pieces in broth, and the pieces were cold. They even charged us for these even though we sent them back.   The broth the soup was in was flavorful. It also took a lot to get our server's attention. I wouldn't come here again.

Y866ofKK7F0DgmUOrPkfKQ.text: My favorite Pho in Vegas. Expect a wait since it's close to the strip, but it's worth it. The pho is NOT expensive at all yet it's SO good! I've been here over a dozen times and each time was amazing service :) I will love you guys forever.

XLHA2Es9A7pr4SF5iaUjxA.text: I've been here a few times and it's always crazy busy. The service is fast and moderately friendly. I've only ordered the charbroiled chicken with Noddles and it's delicious. Will definitely be a regular customer.

wMR7Nx0WTUnYM598qrfoow.text: The food, beer, and service are good. The place is 24/7 with take out option. They need to update web menu prices add about a dollar more on most listed item.

GNw1PxcpGgX5xD6Wq5vhHg.text: This place serves the best home made food.  My family and I come here every time when we're in town.  Portions are huge and reasonable priced.  The menu is very big.  And they are very accommodating if you like your food made a certain way.  The only thing I hate is the wait. On most days the line is out the door!  But like they say,  Good things are always worth the wait.

v1rNlFFDcf4EJNwfOAnFqw.text: Pho Kim Long? More like pho came short! Sorry excuse for being a restaurant.. mediocre and subpar food.. and even worse staff. Staff is very rude, and they demand tip. Be aware if using ur card, they will write down tips for themselves

Wrsm5D3gzSumZnbSqX87pQ.text: Why do I keep coming back to the place? Probably because it's open late and it's in close proximity to the strip. My friend asked our Uber driver to drop us off at the address we listed, he guessed it was Pho Kim Long because that's where everyone goes after a night of clubbing. We were there at 3am with a group of six and it took us a while to get seated. The broth is A-Okay, noodles and meat were standard. I feel like the pho here is just average, but it's the perfect way to end a long night of clubbing on the strip.

JwNR8oD-EhJ_susfcyAuhA.text: I'll take the time of my day to write a review on this restaurant and rate it a 2 star only because I'm not happy w the fact that I was ASKED for a tip. I like the food and all but only because of that it does not deserve a higher rate.

HJ8i-GOzQj_mde2c6Gb-Qg.text: I have been coming here for 11 years & they are ALWAYS wonderful across the board no matter what time I come! Tonight we kept it simple with shrimp spring rolls to start, #14 for me (beef steak pho), & a #64 (Singapore noodles) for my hubby. We picked at eachothers dinner & enjoyed all the yummy, spicy, & herb filled flavors. Love some good Vietnamese food. Until my next pho craving!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #14 Yummm!

1U49Qy7izILs-ojSrVxASw.text: It's been a while since I had been to Las Vegas, so I didn't realize how much the Chinatown area has grown.  Even thought it's called Chinatown, it's really Asia Town.  I had gotten to Vegas right around lunch time, so I figured I'd get some quick and light Vietnamese food.    There was a much longer wait than I expected.  The staff was fast to turn tables as soon as folks were done, so I knew they were doing their best.  Once seated, the pork chop and rice dish ordered by my neighboring table caught my eye.  It was fairly good.  The pork was moist and not dried out.  The Vietnamese baked egg (kind of like a quiche) was round like it was made in a ramekin.  It had a good texture and fresh (some restaurants serve ones that are dried out and you can tell they've been reheated, but not here).  My family members order the pho, which was good as well.  All in all, it's definitely worth another visit the next time I'm there.

DkxjVl5jgRLS6DCA1A6uNA.text: Pros:  Spacious interior that accommodates tons of people.  24hrs!  Attentive service, even during the busiest hours.   Vegan pho & fresh spring rolls with tofu are mighty delicious.  Fresh Thai coconuts! Ask for yours to be opened, the "meat" is so yummy!  Cons:  Always would appreciate more vegan friendly options...  There are often long lines.  Small tables for a large group - you are often almost knocking your dishes off, lol (and I'm quite small).

uwvbDB7g8vXStSum9GkEag.text: BEWARE OF YOUR TOTAL  I'm so disappointed in this place, because the pho is actually pretty good!! And the prices on the menu are fair, BUT the owner (some Vietnamese dude) overcharges you like crazy. We were charged $130 for a bill of $88 ($108 including tax and tip), and it took a great deal of effort to get only some of the extra charge back. The owner is seeeriously shady and very rude, so make sure you have your detective glasses on if you choose to eat here.

8gIN-fDW1XRepdUbGS9JAQ.text: This restaurant don't even deserve one star. Worst restaurant in Vegas. No customer service at all they treat customer like shit don't waste your time going here  Fuck there cheap ass nasty food, they don't have no manners at all

DguYRMFX9LO_-oCatPP6bw.text: Pho-stock was warm. Not hot.  Disappointed. I didnt like it.  Restroom -need renovation.  No music.  :(

5lzLX5dk5l1Qa8n4rmWKCA.text: TLDR: 24 hours; overpriced dishes; many servers, hit-or-miss service; wait times common  If it's the weekend or we're in the area, we are going to end up here since cheaper dining options are not really available. I really don't get the hype about this location. The broth is not really that great, but people crave this location. I wouldn't make a special trip here just for the soup. They have an expanded Chinese and Thai menu, but I wouldn't recommend ordering these overpriced dishes as you will be disappointed. I do enjoy the calamari with fried garlic and jalapenos as this fresh preparation style is not seen elsewhere. Their vermicelli noodle bowl is pretty standard with other locations and won't disappoint. Spring rolls aren't too bad either.   They give you a filled water cup right away upon seated. They don't have pots of tea available; just a cup of hot water and a tea bag was presented upon ordering. Apparently they don't do that here, which is weird for this type of cuisine. Service can be good, but it can get busy as everyone really helps the other tables out. Don't be surprised if there's a wait list for 10-15 minutes; however, I would find other options if the wait is longer than 20 minutes.

LnAnDY0SsMwpPUTXDoHudg.text: Another amazing finished bowl of comfort. No matter what time we come here it is always popping. The quality of the food never fails no matter how many people are eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Never let&#39;s me down the comfort and freshness of their pho

1Z-smQ0lC32Nkji4jy6Q5g.text: The best Pho in town.  This place is constantly busy even at the latest hours!  It's a 24 hour restaurant!!! Clean and friendly service!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho from Pho Kim Long!!  Also calamari!!  Yummy!

5Ua17T50qvVXB7-4SZ-tWw.text: I always hit up Pho Kim Long when I'm in Vegas. The food is great and is a good price compared to the strip.

bYSpaBeY8uvO-I_xHfAS5g.text: This place is great. The pho is the best I have ever tried. It's always busy so be prepare for a short wait.

gdMq_Z-0ecSQu5weYeDOgA.text: Came here around 11pm on a Friday and the wait was out the door.  I finally got to order the pho dac biet (pho special), after 20 minutes of staring down the waiter.  He took a while to bring our water out too.  The pho was average, nothing dac biet about it. The thing I like about Pho Kim Long is that it's open 24/7 so if I ever crave another bowl of pho deep in the night when everything is closed, I'll come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Dac Biet

G9U3zfIq9nzRZ2wkX2osyw.text: I love this place and I've eaten here about 100 times. Usually a little wait, but worth it! Every dish is fantastic, but if you like fried calamari you won't find better than here. My favorite dish on the menu is #96 (fish w/black bean sauce). Location is great and open 24hrs. Service isn't always perfect, but almost always fast. If something is ever not quite right (hardly ever), just say so and they fix it right away. Bathrooms could use a facelift and probably even some more frequent stocking and maintenance, but neither of those points warrant a star reduction from 5-star AWESOMENESS.

A99Fo5SzAX29vqRknbg1ZQ.text: horrible service basically told us to get lost.  Their name in Chinese is misleading.

gNCYBYrpbi24BIQS6ca05w.text: Food is just okay and we think we can get better pho at other place .the one good thing is they open 24 hrs.

n3ViaWYi77ybfUwkeg6KLg.text: Foods good, but I went with some friends from outta town. She asked: "do you guys use MSG in your food?" The waiter instantly responded: "yea, lots of it." Needless to say the meal was cut short. It's a shame too, because the food has always been tasty in the past... But maybe that's just the MSG talking. Much better quality Asian food in town than here.

KtFUqpL75kNLPcevtyEr3g.text: I used to go here often when in the area but lately it seems the quality of its food has gone down.  They have an excellent selection of Vietnamese food with pretty good soups of rice noodles and egg noodles.  I like to order their rice dishes with the shaken beef cubes (Bo luc lac) and the dry noodle special (mi kho dac biet).  Those two items, to me, seems to stay consistent.  Good place to go when you need to eat anytime as it is open ALL THE TIME as this is Vegas!

dsI6XIuvA6o9jzBo-ccg7Q.text: Its 24/7 so thats convenient but nothing special about the food unless you're really drunk and starving. Service is horrible. My order was wrong twice and half way thru my meal i went to the bathroom only to return to my table cleared and cleaned. My waiter asked "oh you still hungry?" And i still paid and just walked out. Go to another pho spot. I highly doubt other pho restaurants would be worse than this one.

RzWNEXS-wbk549pLMxZ9MA.text: The broth is delicious. The sides are delicious. The late hours are awesome. I can have Pho any time of the day! The service is fast and friendly. I keep going back and will continue to as long as I'm in Vegas. I recommend anyone visiting to definitely check it out :)

gPzIiRAakIlBLdMU387R0g.text: Came here a couple of times and never really needed to wait longer than everyone else says. Sat down, ordered myself a combination Pho bowl, got our food quickly, then noticed how we still weren't offered any drinks or water. The food is good, customer service was decent, but still taking off a star for me almost choking on my noodles.

GQRbKorAR2x1Dn0fqkJe6g.text: No take out!   Drove all the way and they tell me we are not doing take out today.  How can you choose what days you do and don't do take out.

a1j7XOMh81sSe80xmKK1-A.text: This place was fun from start to finish.  It's 3am and the place is packed that's a good sign.  I have to wait for a table only 10 mins or so but the hostess was playful and funny so the time flew by.  Once seated the waitress was at the table and taking drink orders within a min of being seated.  There are a lot of choices on the menu.  The food was yummy and I will be back for sure.  All in all this was a nice change of pace for me and the total experience was fun and friendly.

CDgj82RmNkWv9J45pxY3Hw.text: This restaurant is amazing! My favorite. Service is fast and great.Food is incredibly delicious! All I have to say is I LOVE pho Kim long!!!

tCltk-tx_fhKSwlEbJ2k7Q.text: I didn't eat much so I didn't really get to taste. It seem alright, but nothing special to me. Maybe I was wasn't really craving though and I wouldn't even mind trying it out again.

cKDmlyOynnuL36IBnyI6jw.text: Being pho snobs, this place is mediocre, and the service is pretty lacking The only thing that taste really good is their Boba smoothies.

NSRiVejgsdwdakLfME9q8Q.text: You cannot come to this place without getting Pho!  My boyfriend always gets #14 with the rare steak and I get #20, the plain pho and add fried tofu.  As for meat, I highly recommend #37 or #38 (depending on whether you like beef or steak).  This meat has an amazing flamed grilled flavor.

ZAvE7Z9MlZAYsKrvjE1uFg.text: Love this place! My favorite pho restaurant in town, hands down! The service is always so quick and attentive. The food is always up to par, I've tried almost every dish on the menu and I can honestly say there is not one bad thing. Definetly a must-try if you are visiting from out of town! :)

DMzHStch4xJXYbx-L5oN-g.text: service is always excellent!! Best dishes are Bo luc lac, lettuce wrap, and the canh chua. Can't go wrong with this order

VpnWO8AQgySKIczZvMFK5w.text: Need a hangover cure for your crazy drunken night in Vegas? Don't go to that fake pho place in TI, come here. The pho is quality and although the service isn't the quickest ever, it isn't bad. I love and am very critical about the taste of pho that I eat, but I can honestly say that this place has some pretty good pho, even compared to the many places I've been to in the past. Not only that, but they also give you a decent sized portion for a large.   I was with two Viet friends who often get homemade pho from their parents, and they both said that the pho was good. That should DEFINITELY count for something.  The moral of this review? I'm going to continue going to this restaurant every Vegas trip, and you should too.

uEUAnryhQ_MFRNN8Pw7pEQ.text: I had the chicken pho, it was okay. The service here was terrible though and it just felt like they were rushing us. I tried the pho again by takeout and I still wasn't impressed.

HrFA7iY7WTriOXRMjcoPFQ.text: I love their spring rolls! Their Fried noodles with shrimp is my favorite! Awesome place!

wAcR0RQW-dXo0mWmGHkyrg.text: Okay, this is a 3.75 rating... but I have no option but to round it up to 4  I love their chair broiled pork with bun.. very yummy.. We ordered that, Beijing beef, Mongolian beef, fried rice, and calamari. I personally don't think the Mongolian n Beijing beef are super delicious but my friend did. I only enjoyed the bun + pork n the calamari (although I think the calamari has thick batter n I can really feel it's greasy after u eat so much). So I guess it's back to your preference. In term of food, it's not bad. I will give it a try again n try other dishes, if ever I'm back in this town. Price wise is decent. Our bill was about $70 for everything we ordered including 2 bottles of beer.

FlbpE6r9Chy47X1vkLRJjA.text: FOOD:  their Vietnamese food is not that good, but the Thai and Chinese dishes are sometimes alright.  The Pho here is to be avoided, but the Pad Thai is good, with a unique flavor.  SERVICE:  is typical Asian restaurant service, meaning you sometimes struggle to get their attention and they don't check in with you regularly.  AMBIANCE:  is big, busy, and moderate in terms of cleanliness.  The big selling point is that it's open 24 hours.  VALUE:  below average based on overall food quality and service.

4QEtyFEEzEGo46OiynOc1g.text: We got the #15 rare steak &brisket and an order of spring rolls and egg rolls and #14 rare steak  The pho is so tasty and they give you a pretty big portion Make sure to ask for the hot chili oil from the waiter, it's so tasty  The egg rolls were so good we had to do a 2nd order  If you're in Vegas then you should def stop by

MqdpV9-bTdvVe945WPV92g.text: Food is like most viet...places...but like the name says the wait was Fak..Kim Long!!!lol...

JhHEw-04FRYcOtBt6V27Nw.text: 2016 - New Review from November 2016  Awarded the Best in Las Vegas by all the Las Vegas publications - Pho Kim Long Restaurant - Listen to the delicious smells of the sizzling seafood, shrimp, scallops, and steak with ginger at the Las Vegas favorite Pho Kim Long on Spring Mountain and Valley View in Chinatown near the Chinatown Plaza by Highway 15 across from Fashion Mall. Clay pots, sizzling plates, steak, noodles, pho, udon, shrimp, fresh seafood, black bean sauces, beer, wine, fruit drinks for children, and sauces, enjoy a variety of flavors with their outstanding sauces. Try the Chow Fun Noodles dry or with a beef gravy sauce.  4029 W Spring Mountain Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89102  2015 - Old Review from 2015  CES 2016, your restaurant was packed. For months, we have seen a line out the door on Spring Mountain, but I guess, because you were right down the street from the entrance to CES, many of the people came, but they came because your dishes were so good. No one else went to the restaurants around you. We went to Lee's for sweet drinks of boba pearl fruit smoothies for the children, but never stood in line. Finally, we decided to stand in line. The wait was worth it. Now we have returned twice. The seafood dishes, noodle soups with shrimp - Lots of shrimp - the thick chow fun noodles in black bean sauce with grilled beef steak. Pho Kim Long has an extraordinary menu with curry flavors, beef noodles, excellent broth, shell fish, and the place is always packed. See for yourself. Leave the Las Vegas Strip to drive west on Spring Mountain. Pass Valley View. Pho Kim Long is right there in the Chinatown center on the left as you drive west. You will be glad you did. Plus the place is open 24 hours, but we usually try to get there before 6 pm after my son gets out of school. Sincerely, Thomas Chee

GpxSQaFGQHu6I6yb4ilpsw.text: Been to a couple of Pho places and this has to be the best one in town. The only flaw is how busy it gets; other than that they serve the best pho and other vietnamese food!

Kc07j-Rw3e8oLwnmK8F24Q.text: This place is SOO GOOD and the staff members are really motivated and dedicated to their job.

pWlKNDhkZHsVChL7s-Wwig.text: 1 star for being open 24 hours.  Worst customer service ever. The guy that seated us gave us attitude and was plain rude. The pho was bland and wasn't worth the wait or the rude service.  No one ever came to check on us to refill our water glasses. Definitely will never go back.

K4ozL02DoxfhXZ5B4agrhw.text: A Las Vegas Standard for Vientaminse cuisine!  A Must!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

htvUlMJsGltRdEC93xi44w.text: All I have to say is you will not be disappointed! Two apps and two small bowls of pho for $36! Open all night , fast and friendly service. And of course the food is yummy.

2K-X0vgFWNHminykhE6GsQ.text: If you're looking for awesome customer service, I wouldn't recommend eating at this place. I've been here a bunch of times already and I'll admit it's my favorite place to go FOR THE FOOD only. Rarely ever do I get greeted upon arrival or when I leave. This place is always packed considering the fact that it is open 24/7, and the wait time for a table always varies between 20-30 min during peak hours. Trust me, if you visit this place during peak hours, good luck finding a seat to wait or a place to stand cause there's not much space to do so. The servers don't really seem like they care about their customers, they're just there to pretty much "serve" you your food. They all look like they hate their jobs and don't wanna be there, and at times it's so busy that they're all just running around and rushing to get a table vacant asap for the next party.   Unfortunately, I come here so often that I started not caring about the customer service I receive either bc the food makes up for it. My boyfriend and I always get their pho, spring rolls, and calamari, which we loooooove! Their chicken pad Thai is also bomb. The price is pretty reasonable for the portions they give. I really wish they improve on their customer service soon, business seems to be booming here so it's no excuse to lack good customer service.

3p4j2Ze3mrhOP2COxIu_Xw.text: We were really excited to eat here. The server was attentive and friendly. Fast service!   Unfortunately, the pho did not live up to the reviews. We ordered fresh tofu spring rolls, vegan pho, and the pho combination special. All of the vegetables were over cooked to the point of inedible. Mushy!  The noodles were also over cooked in both our pho dishes. The vegan broth lacked flavor. The meat in the combo pho consisted of mostly cartilage although the broth was good. The sprouts were slimey and discolered! Should not be served!   Two stars for friendly service and atmosphere. Vegan options always a plus!The spring rolls were pretty solid as well as the tofu.   This is not the place you want to go to for pho. :( Recommend going elsewhere.

H9WDBvgCyzD80LXerW-idA.text: This place is amazing I'm am shoook!!! It's unbelievable how delicious and quick the food was!! I'm honestly so happy ! I came here w/ low expectations since it's open 24/7 but honestly I was blown away! Their proportions were huge && the price is great! I am coming here again! There's so much variety on the menu

mk9Vc6KKADOZ3eh6toImaQ.text: I used to hate this place. I can't get myself to eat pho at a Restaurant when we make it at home.  The first time I went the service was so horrible that I do to even remember the food.  Today I went for lunch with my friends and reluctantly got #13.. It was really good today. The serving was generous and it came out quickly. I know that can be a bad thing but it was a good thing today since we were hungry. The amount of meat for the price was good also. The broth was good and they have us a generous amount of herbs and sprouts.  We got two appetizers the crab rangoons and the egg rolls. They were both good but nothing special.  I took the time out to write this quick review because the service was so good today.  Usually the staff is pretty short and rude.  Today they were attentive, polite, and efficient. We had like 4 people help us.  It seems with the increased business they're getting they took the time to improve the service.  I was just really pleasantly surprised in the best way possible.  I've had their drunken noodles which is a Thai dish that they actually do a really good version of.  They have good food for sure so if you were reluctant to eat here because of bad service I'd say to give them another chance.

3s3VsX10Vl0j73_y20fj8A.text: It was ok. Surprisingly a very small bowl of Pho I got. And it was still $8. The ambience was nice. The waiting was probably 15 mins on a Sunday noon. The food was decent, everything seemed a little rushed but still friendly service.  Toilets are horribly filthy. I can't believe what I saw.

baXUxL9WV2dr_aEq_eG3JA.text: this is our "go to" pho spot because this place is open 24 hours!!! we arrived to vegas pretty late on Friday due to the 15 fwy was closed for 2 hours!   anyways we ordered the egg rolls. comes with 4 pieces of egg rolls with some side lettuce and fish sauce.   we also ordered the special pho noodles. but really $9 for a bowl of pho?! thats really pricey compare to LA prices of only $6. but i guess its vegas and we were hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls

HM9Gxghb_fW7bOBk9UFQGQ.text: Apparently there's good Viet food out in Las Vegas area. Off the strip but great place to grab a bunch of to-go food for pho hangover cure haha  Neat, just learned from Jenny D.'s review "It costs $12 to take the cab here :) when you can't drive :)". Very good to know for next time!  Prices: Pricey compare to the $5 pho I usually get. Its around $8 per bowl. Quality: Soup, everything is pretty good. Their seafood egg noodle soup actually has a buttload of seafood.  24hours!!
