RBqJyQHiRI_dBkWke7VwsQ.text: I have been coming here for five years and it just keeps getting better!! Service is fast and friendly. My server Quan was my friendly server today!

KBUfOeqa2vswhJRrk0gikw.text: I'll be honest in saying that this is a totally biased love-fest post.  I have been coming to this place for what feels like forever. Yes, it can get really packed (because people love this place). Sometimes the service is not the best (all restaurants have their off days). On occasion the food isn't perfect (I've never experienced this). But you know what, this place has always had my back in the middle the night shenanigans. And for that I will always have theirs.

x9lmqIBDJnO2i_cTngzVQA.text: Open late and they have a vegan pho option.   We got here around 3 or 4am and the place was pretty full but the wait was not long at all.   We had a pretty big group and everyone was satisfied. My non vegan friend tried my broth and she liked it too. We were in Vegas for 4 days and my friends had to make their second round to Pho Kim Long before we left. I was sad I missed out on that second trip lol

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan pho

BTNAxlBLhRWZCkOqyrZPFw.text: There's something good if we are coming here 2 days in a row every time we are in Vegas. Not the best pho I've had, but in a land of $65 buffets a $8 bowl of quick and warm stomach soothing goodness sure does a hangover'd body good. Save your money on food by eating pho, save it for the slots!

py330s2PM3ULcekG_nRx8Q.text: I'm so disappointed of this restaurant.  It looks nice inside out but other than that everything else is so bad. The food is not that good. The service is so bad. They bring the pho without bean sprout and spice and then we asked for it. They gave us an attitude and said bc the foods are not coming out yet. Wtf the pho is on the table already and they still said some bullshit. And when I ask for fork for kids they gave me attitude again. I hate the service! I would not recommend for this place!

xFWXUNOezmRCF3oo1qjnOA.text: Food was good. I went there on sept 29th after we went to surrender. When I went to to the counter to pay, I had realized I grabbed the wrong bag and my other bag was in the car. I asked the guy at the counter if I can go to the car and get the other bag... The guy at the counter said leave your purse... I was like can you repeat that thinking that I heard wrong. He said it again and said leave your purse. I told him I wasn't going to do that and if he could just walk me to my car to get my other purse. He was like no we do not do that here.  I was like I wasn't going to leave without paying and how dare you treat me like this... I wouldn't have gone to the counter if I wasn't going to pay... He started taking receipts and slapped one at a time on top of each other on the counter. he was like these are the people who didn't pay. i cursed him out and told him it was an insult if he thought i was going to do that. You idiot! I went back to the table and asked my cousin to take my keys and go to the car to get my purse. She just gave me the money and I paid without giving a tip. It was such an insult. I will never go back. I hate the cashier there. Be prepared to feel like a thief.

6qIbLWgaE5mBU3DSqtAzeQ.text: This place has the worst customer service.  They would give you a hard time if you ask why your food takes so long to come.  They yelled at me when i asked for a tea cup and sort of throw it to my face.  And be aware, tips are included in your bill.  Would you pay 15% tips for that kind of service?  I would never come back to this place.

AlxMTUX1Jiu3ZWjsfVhopA.text: If it wasn't so far from where we live, we'd probably be here alot! We love this place. Service is always fast!

mmjJ0o3fMDU3r-dvarwA4Q.text: Only time I eat Pho at another restaurant is when there is a line out of the door @ this place. Then I'm thinking to myself that I should have just waited that hour because this is the BEST Vietnamese restaurant in town, no bullshit.

ylro44itrcEgeUzIGf4zcw.text: Not sure if this place is related to the Pho Kim Long in San Jose but I came here kinda expecting the same.. However, the service here is waaaaaay better & the pho is just as good! Perfect soupiness & proportions for after a night out.  I got the pho tai with the meat raw on the side so I can cook it myself in the soup (I HATE when it gets overcooked).  My bowl was about $6.. what a deal! My only complaint with this place is the smell.  I'd give it a 5 star if it weren't for the wet towel smell that fills the air. Oh, & it's open 24 hours!

aocrShLnq_oty-yXJJqJFQ.text: It is so Pho-King good, and the name is better than Pho-King.

Dz7iRorwwXvqYYjnukGzng.text: Atmosphere: The waiters and waitresses are clean, they actually have a uniform, unlike many other places where they just wear jeans and whatever they want.  One really hot waitress.  But that's besides the point. Lots of people of all ethnic background.  Service: Seated immediately. Got menu and water immediately. But the waitress didn't English very well.  Food: Pho broth is a bit too plain for me. Portion is the smallest I've seen, except for Jenny's Pho in SW LV, that's even smaller.  The price listed is for SMALL, but they don't tell you that. It's $7.25 for SMALL. You can't get steak with beef balls.  You have to get one or the other. But if you want both, it's an extra $1.00.  So for a large, it's $8.25 + 1 = $9.25 for a "Large" which is actually very small.    Drink: No comment since only got water.   Bottom Line:  Food is so so but very expensive. One waitress is hot. But that's it.

1PqgeVLC9G23Kcw0ef-Khg.text: good pho, good friend rice and good duck. open late and the food comes quickly and hot. definitely a good night cap!

VogY0zEZjFGd8Bba8xzfdg.text: We came here after a night of clubbing with a pretty big group of people.  (Yes, I believe it's 24-hours). Love that we didn't have to wait for a table.  The staff was very patient with our group, considering we were so loud and annoying.  Food didn't take too long.  I ordered egg rolls and a chicken and rice plate that was shown on the menu. It tasted alright, but I felt like it was such a rip because the pieces of chicken were so small! I was still hungry after, even with my egg rolls. Besides that, the establishment was clean and like I said, we were pretty annoying so luckily they didn't kick us out.

-eCi1ZvmGFaco1s5yuKlaA.text: I love their pho! The only place i would get pho and the fact that they are open 24 hrs is a plus....but i seriously dislike their staff!!! Ive been going to this place for a very long time and their staff has always been very rude! It would be nice if they could at least crack a smile when servicing you. Other than that, service is pretty quick, atmosphere is inviting, pho never seems to dissapoint!

UJHBKz8UXDRyGmrVEb5DRA.text: THE WORST SERVICE EVER!!!  We came in a family of twelve in the morning at 10am.  So the restaurant is pretty empty.  The waiter sat us by the door with a cold weather.  I was asked to be seated inside and spot a long table that enough for my family.  The waiter was refuse and said if we want to sit inside then we have to split into 3 corners.  What the F?  I understand if the restaurant is full.  But it is quite emply on that day.  I screwed at them and walk out and NEVER come back to this restaurant again.   WORST WORST AND WORST EXPERIENCE EVER HAD!

9RthYV22mWs2VYAtTdZ7Qg.text: The pho is alright. Seems like if you ask for a large they just give you more soup. Bad service. I had asked for a refill & the waiter cleaned two tables right in front of me & still didn't get me a refill. Asked again & cleaned three more tables & yet still didn't get me a refill. Ended up asking another waiter for a refill.

BOd9gLEjTQAQMuduKy-Z5Q.text: For a place in china town with a name that has the word "pho", it's menu had a lot of non-authentic items on it... yeah, yeah I ordered them :) The food came out very fast, a little too fast for us because the calamari I had to start was very undercooked. The spring rolls were okay and my pho was a little salty and little flavor. Service was okay, but all around we've experienced much better in china town.

d2K6dSKXcKTGlyGRIA4qMw.text: I did not like the food here.  I ordered a simple wonton soup, and the soup was too salty and oily.  My boyfriend ordered pho and got soup spilled on him by the waiter, but luckily (or unluckily), the soup was not hot enough to burn him.  I tried some of the pho broth and it wasn't all that great either.  I don't think anyone in our group liked their food.  But when I came to Vegas another time, I stayed in the hotel room feeling sick while everyone else went to eat.  When they came back, my friend brought me the most delicious wonton noodle soup with duck meat.  When we ate here this time, my friend told me the duck wonton soup came from this restaurant.  So maybe we just ordered the wrong thing?  Because I remember that dish being really good... but then again I was super drunk.

E3NhbgS0R5YOJ5Rhz-YMZw.text: Very clean and good service. BEST PHO IN VEGAS HANDS DOWN! Their egg rolls are awesome too, just on the smaller side. Wish they were bigger. Other than that, my whole families fav place to get Pho!

oo9pJMQQVDjsdD9bQFIdyg.text: Went here with my friends after a DRUNK at Tao nightclub. I have to say for Pho made at 330am it was fantastic! The fresh rolls were also quite delicious. Now all this might have been because I was plastered but the hot broth sobered me up and tasted great....basically 3am + Pho = can't complain :)

LbjY2rzb6cXxzuIrZjcNng.text: Not the best pho place, I went here with a pho connoisseur and we both walked away dissapointed. The thing I remember most was the darker brown broth with strong clove flavors that I didn't enjoy. Still looking for great pho in vegas.

IAKwUBv3nvutzoZUMcZHzA.text: 24 hr Pho!! Price is on the high side. Their Pho is just okay...but hey it's open 24hr. Good spot to grab a bite after a long night of drinking @ sin city.

clMoyyOK5AcSO-s4p0gxvg.text: Great Vietnamese food!! The group I was with had Pho, Bun, and Spring Rolls. Restaurant was packed and everyone's plates looked great.

WP_wTtChbjzU0ViV9b6fyw.text: The pho here is the best in Las Vegas! Service is very fast as well and the menu has several items to choose from. One of our favorites is the bun. Is Highly recommend!

4H9Y90kehlHWiyzxA1LxbQ.text: Came in late last night for dinner and saw a short line of people. Fortunately, service was swift enough and both me and my bf got seated almost immediately.   This place is busy! Noticed that patrons tend to be either party-goers or families. Food is ok, not fantastic. I got the rice noodle with barbecued pork and egg rolls while my bf got his usual chicken pho. Didn't think too highly of the food, but when you are starving, it actually left me pretty satisfied. I can see myself coming here before going out for a party or after a clubbing night.   One of those places to go to if you are looking for comfort food.

wq4sN2TkGWxhPiqb3Ef1nQ.text: Came here very late one night after long hours at work. Four stars for the Pho which was very good, though the flavor was not as strong or authentic as places like LA or New York. One star for the service. Server was a little rude and took until almost the end of our meal to bring our drinks. I had the mango smoothie, thinking it would have actual mango in it, but no. It was sickly sweet and very artificial tasting, I couldn't even drink it but also couldn't find my server to send it back, so ended up paying for it even though I didn't like or drink it. Our server disappeared after hurriedly dropping off our drinks, and 45 minutes after we were done eating and obviously waiting were we finally able to flag down another server to bring our check. We might be back because the Pho was tasty and they are open late, but hopefully the service will be better at normal dinner hours. Not a great first experience.

aEwqfCP0o5OvCNq7V3IfDQ.text: The food is always good here. But the service always seems rushed and the host staff is very unpleasant.  We come here often for the food, but again the service is almost a turn off.  The last time I came in we left without being served. The servers never came to our table 20 minutes is a long time to wait for someone to acknowledge your presence.

lajzk12QarJl06al1r70EA.text: You wouldn't expect it but there's a very good Vietnamese restaurant in the middle of this desert. Pho was sir Pringle very good and food came out very fast. The decor is yet to say interesting. However, I'm one of those who judges a Vietnamese restaurant based on their phos AND spring rolls. Spring rolls were mediocre

yGgEXx2J2jjmAUmANsea8w.text: Still not a big fan of their pho or service, but I have to admit there are quite a few dishes that I enjoy here and how can you not give them an extra star for the name alone.   I go here on occasion and I actually quite enjoy it.

2uI-10htb_oC1oJ0z_KHcg.text: My co-workers had been trying to get me to go to this place for months but I had always opted to go to the Korean BBQ place that was in the same little strip mall parking lot that they introduced me to.  I WISH I HAD GONE TO THIS PLACE MUCH SOONER before we moved away from Las Vegas!!  The service was pretty good, just the right amount of checking to make sure we had everything we needed, but not so much that we felt rushed.    I was a little apprehensive at first but since my co-workers swore by it i decided to get whatever they recommended.  The Pho i got was amazing.  I loved adding the bean sprouts and other things they brought to the table for us to it, I especially loved adding the different sauces they  had at the table (mostly hot sauce was what i added since I'm sucker for spiciness). It was very filling and very delicious, i couldn't even finish it all and had to take it home!  The only food i didn't like was the spring rolls I think is what they were.  My friends had ordered them before I got to the restaurant so I didn't have a say in it, but seafood is not my thing and these had shrimp in them I believe so that pretty much killed it for me on them. Plus the dipping sauce was some kind of peanut based sauce......I've had other peanut based sauces at other places which I've liked, but this one was just too thick for my liking.    Otherwise I love this place and will definitely have to make it a priority to go here when I visit friends in Las Vegas.

4msPSsJkX6M8GDtU7HSADQ.text: Usually when we come we have okay service, but the food is always good. This time we thought to bring our friend who has never been here before and who'd just arrived from Hawaii. Once we received our food our friend went to the bathroom, a server came to us letting us know our friend had fallen. So we got up to check on him, while our friend was walking back to the table he collapsed into my husbands arms. I went to pay the bill and the cashier, told me "oh I thought he was high" with a smile on his face. And I asked him "why do you say that for?" And he giggled "oh cause I thought he was high." Mind you my husband was right in back of me and I didn't want him to hear because I know he get really upset. But to late cus he heard and so my husband asked the boy "why would you say that for?" The boy replied " oh I just thought he was drunk " and which went on for a couple more times. I was so upset because that is not what happened and for the boy to judge my friend because he has dread locks?!? That's wrong in so many ways. Little did you know he was dehydrated.! Never coming here again, and to that boy. Grow up.

pFF2t57lJM-RYK4-kIRNtw.text: The food is good here but the service isn't. It's conveniently opened 24 hours but the servers don't even come around to fill your drink or ask if your doing ok. I understand they have high volume of customers but that's not an excuse for poor customer service.

dvGAq_ZWh2B7o0Asm9RdTw.text: OMG, the girl named Hana(/Hanna?)was so rude. I never met any waitress that ruder than her. this was my first time to this restaurant but I was extremely upset due to this discourteous behavior. the food was ok, not the best Vietnamese dishes in town. Never come back unless they fire the girl.

ZTymzzR1t3yVGtnpRKoTrA.text: BEWARE OF THE RUDENESS. I came here with my boyfriend before heading to the airport. We were surprised at the line that already started around 9 a.m. but we decided to wait in line. There were 15 other people ahead of us and there was no standing room inside so we had to wait outside with our luggage. Thankfully, the weather wasn't dreadful at that time of morning yet. My boyfriend stepped inside to use the restroom and I continued to wait outside. I heard his name being called and it took me LESS than 30 seconds to get inside with the two luggage. I approached the host table and the host was no where to be found. I waited there for about 7-8 minutes and when he came back, I told him my boyfriend's name and he said, yea I called his name already. And just like that he dismissed me and didn't give me anymore information. When I tried to ask him what can we do about it, since he already scratched out his name, he ignored me and carried on sitting other groups down the list. When my boyfriend came out, he had to talk to a manager for us to get seated. I was already furious at that point but hoped the food outweighed the service. Unfortunately, the shrimp fried rice I ordered was dreadful! I wish I would of read the reviews before ordering it. Had the host attempted to resolve the matter in a professional and respectful way, I would of considered trying out this place again but I would not come back here after that experience.

D5oaSXtC_wzt0VgZ3rlgGA.text: Pho Saigon 8 is usually my go to spot for pho but this place was the only one open late at night so we came here. Service was absolutely TERRIBLE! The waiters have always been rude and slow to serve. The pho is way too overpriced and the portions are small. Even with the siracha and hoisin sauce it lacked flavor. It wasn't the worst but it wasn't great. The beef is gross so I started just ordering the noodles only. I hate that they use a lot of white onions. They give lemon, no lime. The only reason I went multiple times was because I was pregnant and NEEDED pho lol. Now that I'm no longer pregnant I will never return.   Egg rolls were good. Taro was not sweet and definitely a waste. Thai tea sucked too! Save your money.

lbXZkNWIm4ZWP0hzD2-MLw.text: I am kind of obsessed with this place. I'm not sure if it's because it's open 24/7 or because they have a large menu with relatively all things Chinese and Vietnamese that I want to eat at odd hours of the night.. Probably both. Their pho is always a must-try for obvious reasons, but definitely try their wonton noodles, xo string beans, xo udon noodles, duck, and fried tofu appetizer.

0_KlHU8xm5ZozjYqHqbbEw.text: Usually come here to order pho for the husband and kids to go.  And they love it each time.  However tonight, ordered 4 phos (3 specials and 1 beef), as soon as we got home, the special phos were perfect, but the beef pho had no meat whatsoever, and being  that we live in North Las Vegas (bordering Aliante) at 2am, I didn't want to bother driving back and complaining.  So from now on, I'm just gonna have to take the extra effort to check the order prior to leaving the restaurant.

6udHe-WKFaCn4FqgJncIOg.text: I've never felt racism until I came here, I'm disappointed with the staff for targeting me and my friends and for being racially profiled by us Mexicans and African Americans, if you don't fit a certain profile you wont get served, I will never come here again and I hope you wont too, long story short we sat down waited 30 minutes no one came, asked a server to take our order never came, so we left and as soon as we leave we look through the window outside and they take our menus to clear up space for customers who fit a certain profile, I'm really sad that in 2017 we still experience this racial injustice!

nRj1g94Jj4rRuTKgUFbQSA.text: First person you meet in the restaurant is the host and she needs to be more informative and pleasant to deal with. If you come in and theres a wait, you will not get a wait-time. Her response is pretty much we will seat you when we seat you - first come first serve. If a restaurant is busy thats great, however it would be nice to let your customers know if its going to be 5mins or an hour. I witnessed another guest waiting prior to me walked outside for a smoke or whatever and when he came back he asked how much longer the host told him she called his name and he got skip...Well if you wouldve told him how long he would've known to stay inside..thats where the lack of communication needs to be fixed. The whole first come first serve is bs. They will seat a bigger group before you if they need to. When it was time for my friends and I to get seated, the host "pointed" to the table for us to sit at, not walk us to the table- pointed. Okay, Sure.. Walking to the table another employee(who an earlier guest asked him how long the wait is said he didn't work at the restaurant- mind you this guy was wearing a "Pho Kim Long" shirt! LOL hmm.. WTF?!) anyways this guy stops us and told us not to sit at the table then the host saw us standing around and told us to sit.. its fine just sit.. its was back and forth for a minute. I finally just sat myself at an open table bc this was just beyond bad. So we sat waitress takes our order ( doesn't write anything down) order comes out and of course one of the dish was wrong, we told the a lady (the owner?) she came back with the right order she was very nice (thats the one star) the food was good (second star)UNTIL my sisters Pho had a bug in it (extra protein?) and my pho had a good size piece of plastic vinyl thing in it. So that completely ended our meals :)

Kz_oHPN3X-Clk5KKVrdmMA.text: Due to my house being close and having some ridiculous pho craving and also hearing decent reviews for this place, I decided to try out pho Kim long.  Came along and got seated right away, seemed pretty busy so by this point I'm wondering how good this place is goings to be.  Decided to get my usual, pho vegan.  Food came out with in 5 minutes, huge portion, plenty of vegetables and over all with the taste, not bland, not to salty, noodles were to perfection and I was very much satisfied.  However the satisfaction for their service went down when I asked one of the servers that came to pour in water if they had sake bombs or just bottles of sake. She said he doesn't know and told me she would go ask our waiter. Fair enough, though you should know the menu at the restaurant you're working at.  My waiter doesn't come an 15 minutes later I was forced to grab another waiter. He helped me out and got my drink.   Got my drink, happy with my food. I was ready to go and leave. Yet our waiter once again has us waiting for another 15 minutes. I must say, good food but bad service. I'll be back to give it another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho vegan.

Qp6wWI1jcWjMAhAr54HbsA.text: Very bad service and this isn't the first time. I came in for a table for two. They were about to seat us, but said the tables had to be cleaned and asked for us to wait. The table looked clean. While waiting I saw a few two seater tables open that also looked clean. A party of four came in after us and got seated. I figured maybe because it's a party of four. A couple comes in after for a table of two. Keep in mind we were sitting on the bench right in front of the door. The couple gets seated. The guy looks at us so we left. It was a slap to the face. My buddy also mentioned another party of two got seated before the party of four.

kVdocRzH9YAEL8JfRpqPog.text: The service was really rude. We came here twice and both times got an old grumpy waiter who's had an obvious attitude problem.   For the food, they was salty and nothing special. I got rice serviced with steak the first time. The steaks tasted so old- they were all chewy and not even hot. They were barely warm meaning that they were overcooked and  kept there for a really long time. I had their special combination pho the second time and the broth was real salty for my taste. The meatballs tasted so nasty.

76YQTp0px4KMfDfU2vBCkQ.text: Terrible Vietnamese noodle soup.  Beef ball tastes like staled.  The worst Vietnamese soup that I've ever taste.

5BaFZTLWofeFdj49eglf2Q.text: Pretty wonderful Vietnamese food.  Place was packed and busy but the service is quick and the food is very good.  We had pho, spring egg rolls, pork chop rice, vermicelli, etc.  Everything tasted great!  Coming back again if we have a long trip in Vegas and crave something over than hotel food.

2tdGf0iJaLhRGy1ce3VFpg.text: F**King long lineup,   That's what this place should be named. But don't let that discourage you. It's well worth it even for vegetarians like me

7bLHa4d8-m8fkQl3TG1VJA.text: I like this place. Because of pho I'm coming but I like calamari too. A lot of people in here so, sometimes have to wait long but it is interesting too.

4jRaGVF5ZCbCPW9NAOj59Q.text: 24Hr Pho restaurant, what more do you want? The best Pho in Vegas and it is served all day everyday. Perfect for a late night craving or a hangover cure. I come here quite often when I'm living in Vegas for the summer. I always order the soft spring rolls and a large bowl of Pho Bien (meatballs). The broth is very flavorful and they are generous with the meat portion. Service could be a little disappointing at times because they are pretty busy.

npt83kb6rFipNy22fKyI-Q.text: It's amazing spot to come late night to satisfy that late night craving (hang over cure). It gets a lil loud but that's just part of the atmosphere. It gives it character. Btw the broth of the soup is unbeatable.

glEMHxWlOChlT509H6dq4Q.text: 3 stars, it's decent but nothing spectacular.  Pros + Clean and spacious with many tables. Our party of 8 only waited 10 mins to get seated. + Many food options to choose from the menu from salt and pepper chicken wings to pho. + Located across the freeway from the Las Vegas strip. + Great location near by other Oriental shops.  Cons + The waitress did not want to separate the check for us. The male server who originally took our orders said we could pay separately at the cashier, but the female sever who handed us a single bill practically told us to divide it ourselves by informing us that they accept multiple credit cards. She quickly left the table after that statement.  + Waters were not refilled. + More expensive than other Vietnamese shops. + Fresh coconut cost $5.95!  + Food does not come out at the same time.  FOOD:  + Spring rolls: I was a little disappointed because for around $5 I received only two small spring rolls that mainly consistent of noodles. Only two layers of thin beef slices if I remember correctly. I do not recommend this as an appetizer.   + Pho Tai (regular): The broth is bland but still has taste. I find it refreshing. I like it because it's not oily but I don't love it. The regular size could use more beef slices.   + Pork and shrimp vermicelli: The pork had great char and flavor. It was perfectly grilled. The shrimp was medium size and average in taste. Noodles were soft and chewy and veggies were fresh. This entree came in a large sized bowl with a generous portion of meat and noodles.  + Garlic and pepper calamari: I would pass on this dish next time. I did not like the batter on the calamari. It reminded me of the batter from cheap beer batter onion rings. The squid itself tasted like rubbish and was not crispy. It was even more disappointing because the dish lacked flavor.

IRSEPFcDMUg29O3cTpry2Q.text: First time eating Viet Namese cuisine. I was very surprised at how tasty the food was. The area was very busy, hard to find parking. Once inside, the restaurant was very busy and noisy.  Service was quick, food was hot and fresh. The peanut dipping sauce was fantastic! Great for families, but not for a romantic rendevous.

zv3MkG9_7kr8Tr34jZoxOg.text: The pho was okay but I had better. This place was busy so I thought they would have amazing food but it was just okay. The noodles were soggy and the broth wasn't hot. Our pho took awhile to come out and the service here is just not that good. It was busy enough that the kitchen staff forgot one of our order and our waiter didn't seem really interested at all other than to bring us food. Honestly I wouldn't come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #13

eUk7GHBclGsSv5YVV2R6dQ.text: Manager Jason cursing on the floor poor guy is obviously way over his head. Not to mention my pho was cold when it got served to me and my spring rolls still hard this place used to be good what happened

gK3z0AIvTHCsg6XueWcuQQ.text: Don't know what all the hype about this place is but I've been here three times already and their pho is not up to par nor is any of their food on the menu. Their large bowl is like a small kid's bowl with lots of soup but very little noodles. So it's like paying extra for soup by ordering a large. I've also noticed, each and every time, we get serviced by this pint-sized chick whom isn't even pleasant to look at giving us her very unpleasant remarks whenever we would ask for something additional. I wouldn't give this place any stars but I did give it a one star due to it's location being very conveniently located near the strip & fwy. Third time-you're out....I'm looking elsewhere to eat next time around.

uPLM_MAX8AYbxmmR6Ezr5g.text: This place definitely belongs amongst the best pho restaurants in the valley. This is pretty obvious by the fact that it was FULL and had a 30 minute wait for lunch time on a Saturday. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was what you'd expect out of a busy restaurant in Chinatown. The pho was delicious. We also got egg rolls and spring rolls to share at the table and they were all very good and fresh. Looking forward to returning here in the near future.

OshvnPkXXl8hV__GksxIFA.text: It's 2am, and I just got off shift. I'm sick as a dog and need some sustenance before passing out. Where to go?..... to get some hot delicous PHO!!!  I'm happy to say the pho here is very very good, and at 2am on a random Wed night, there were still enough people at the restaurant that is wasn't creepy, but not so crowded that I had to wait. Not the best pho I've ever had, but solid.   I ordered a Beef brisket pho, and it was perfectly piping hot, with all the fresh toppings and the broth helped to sooth my throat and clear up my sinuses. Just what the Dr. ordered :P   Service was efficient, maybe not the friendliest, but definitely not rude. Food came out fast and I was literally in and out in 20 mins. I can def see myself coming here many more times in the upcoming year!

duCzD51Qf2O6IZh0dcpQHg.text: I come here regularly because it is conveniently 24hours. the pho quality here is probably the best I've had in Vegas because the meat is never over cooked in the broth when I get it, noodles are never done poorly, and overall the pho is a good balance of herbal essences with choice meat or veggies. service is god awful for the most part, unless on rare occasions you get a server like Benz who is one of the few employees that seem to care about their guests' satisfaction. don't come expecting good service or you will be irritated. food is alright and what you'd expect for the price points.

QMnD2-16WVG1p7ArKN5RjQ.text: Great food had the Mongolian beef and udon noodles with shrimp. Very fresh & delicious. Best Vietnamese food My sweetie & I have ever tasted. We will be back

X-sYZv_OXeiiEC_GpoyQAQ.text: It just amazes me some restaurants get it and some don't. This establishment isn't perfect but at least they do not present an absolute trash (dish) to its customers. Seating could be extremely slow (don't know why with so many open seats) but the food (fresh) and service are both decent.

z-M64Gg5BvVlRGpzygqh6A.text: So, my question is, what is Pho?  We see the signs hanging all over town, so how come I don't know what it is?  I think I have had it before, my husband tells me I have, but funny thing is, I wouldn't know if I did.  I googled it and it seems I have had it, and more than once.  I didn't know the official name of what I was eating, just knew it was good. So now that I know what it is, I am on a quest to find the best and thought I could start here.  According to a few reviews, this place is supposed to have some really good Pho.  I picked out a charboiled pork with egg and thought it would be a little bit spicy, but it wasn't.  It was hot and hit the spot on this late night.  Is it one of the best, I cannot say that, but it's just the beginning of a tasty journey.

j02h75224hnh1ShEiflDJA.text: What more do you have to say than 24 pho in Vegas, for those late night drunken cravings! We chose this spot because it had a ton of reviews and because it was 1am and open 24 hours a day lol. I love pho so I'm a bit picky about the broth and the meat. This place surely didn't disappoint, it's a short drive from the strip in the china town district, wait wasn't very long on a Sunday, only about 10 minutes. I recommend this place to anyone craving some awesome pho at any hour of the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare beef pho and spring rolls at 1am! #GottaLoveVegas

-XHN473Rgb2zU739kk_cMA.text: I love this place for there pho, but other then that I think this place is a little bit overrated and a little over priced. The service sucks every single time. Things never taste like it's fresh. I feel like everything is made in bulk and sent out. The waiters are never friendly and inattentive. I mean it's not horrible, just not the best.

fmxKByLZ7xpFCXnoMN--0Q.text: I came here after what seemed like such a long time in the airport. I felt my throat was getting scratchy so I really needed to fix it. I had to work the next day so I definitely needed my voice to stay with me. My husband knows that at times like this I need Pho so he said he would find something to eat on Pho Kim Long's menu. He said he would settle for a salad because he wasn't really hungry.   Well just as a heads up to others that may be seeking salad ...there is none. He did find Beef and Broccoli which is kind of like salad. He ate almost all of it except the little bit I took to taste it. The amount that was given is easily a good amount for two to three people but he finished it even though he wasn't that hungry! The meat was well seasoned and the broccoli was nice and crispy. I hate soft broccoli!   I ordered the chicken fried rice for lunch this week at work since I came in on late Sunday I had no time to cook. It was pretty basic the chicken pieces didn't have any fat on them which is a good thing. I spiced it up with some Sriracha.   The Pho was good it wasn't too salty the veggies that came with it were fresh but I was surprised that they served it with lemon. When I usually get Pho I 've always been given limes to go with it. I wasn't going to be picky about it though. My Pho had the beef strips in it but it also came with these round meatballs . I didn't try it though ...I was wondering what it was . I concentrated on the broth just so my throat would feel better by morning. The Pho did help my throat on Monday but had to call in sick on Tuesday.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Rice
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef and broccoli
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho

glq9PojZoG2aXlAp-dm_FA.text: Came here after a long night dancing at EDC. Wasn't expecting much since this is one of the few 24hour Asian restaurant open. We went in at 4am, and it was full house.  We got seated fast. Food was brought out quick, they are fresh and tasty. We are very happy with everything we ordered, from pho, to seafood clay pot, to desert.   This place deserves a solid 5 star for being a quality and friendly 24 hour food spot !

ATF8ZsuUC88Igybuj5VvXQ.text: Got myself a large bowl of pho with rare steak.   Pleasantly surprised with how good it was.   Super tasty broth, noodles were good and meat was standard rare steak but nice.   Service was on point.   Water always being filled and very accommodating.  Server was friendly.   Overall very good experience.    Heard that there's usually there is a wait for a table but at lunch time on Saturday, we were seated immediately.   Inside was clean and modern.   Prices were fair and maybe a dollar less than some other places.   Will almost definitely be back.     The only reason it's a 4 and not a 5 is because the amount of meat and noodles was a little less than I'm used to.  If there was a 4.5 option, I would go with that.     I can recommend that pho without thinking twice.   This white guy says give it a try.

mN5HVBlS9TGGZooc7CiaGA.text: I would advise you not to go to this place! From the start the waiter had a really hard time taking our order high was a boiled egg on top of vegetable pho. He seemed as if he didn't want to be bothered at all and had the worst facial expressions as if every question aggravated him.  He came back with raw eggs in broth with vegetable broth in a separate bowl. When I explained what I wanted he responded with the worst attitude that this is not a American restaurant. I'm sorry, I thought I was in America but cannot figure out what bearing that had on the conversation. I remained nice and cordial, but When people treat you rude from the time you enter the business until the time you leave, you can't help but wonder if race plays a factor.. either way ignorance played one tonight.

z9L1mRFToYyH07PPp8pQew.text: The restaurant name itself should be enticing enough for everyone to stop by to figure out what it means. It turned out "Kim Long" means "Golden Dragon" in Chinese and Pho is obviously Vietnamese. The end result of this place is some freaking good Vietnamese and Chinese dishes.   We came here as a big group and got to order a great selection of dishes to try. Some of the highlights are their Stir- Fry Diced Beef cubes, Salt and Pepper fried Pork Chop, BBQ pork, Drunk Man Noodles, and deep fried spring rolls. Unfortunately, I did not get to try their Pho as I was holding my sleeping son so I only got 1 hand available to eat.   If I ever get to return to Vegas with a car, I would love to try this place again! It is open 24/7 so that means I can be here post-show :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Freaking awesome restaurant name!
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stir fry water spinach
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diced beef cube with broccoli

YbPLwN6BLv1mLQEJbO_a_Q.text: If your drunk asf with your friends after drinking and want Vietnamese food. This is the spot lol

I-loy3BdXqbSBe4GsSX0XA.text: This is our go to place after a night of drinking. Service is usually pretty fast and food is decent. While in Vegas, we visited the restaurant 3 of the 5 days.. so far, no problems.

YTp8ISRL-db8jIt3rpagGA.text: Have you ever thought you were going to go try a new restaurant only to walk inside and remember that you'd already been there?  I did that yesterday 9-17-16 around 10AM.  I got alllllll excited thinking I was going to try "the best Pho in Vegas" at this popular spot and when I walked in I immediately realized I had been here like 4 years ago and forgot.  I bamboozled myself!   $45.96 got us a bowl of pho, chicken fried rice, two soft drinks, a coffee, and an order of chicken teriyaki.  Our servers were efficient and friendly and they called my son cute so they got extra brownie points for that.    $8.95 Pho Dac Biet- Piping hot (but not burn-your-mouth-off-lava-hot) and savory broth chock full of noodles, onions, cilantro, tendon, raw beef, and I was dreading finding a piece of tripe but never did so......whew! Dodged that bullet.  It came with plenty of bean sprouts, basil, and lime on the side.  Many condiments were provided on the table such as sriracha, chili oil, etc.  This would be great "sick food" if you weren't feeling well.    $10.95 chicken fried rice- It was average.  The rice was a bit small and mushy like it had been handled too much but it was full of peas, carrots, eggs, and chicken.  It was missing that charred umami flavor that I like in fried rice. I don't think they actually fried it which made it kinda mushy.  I wouldn't order this again.  But that's what I get for ordering fried rice at a pho place.    So, folks, stick to the pho if you go here and you'll have a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki chicken.  9-17-16
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $10.95 chicken fried rice. 9-17-16

mkmgIBmzmY2qvpni3IypiQ.text: Took forever to receive our food, and the Owner bugged me about the amount of tip I gave them and then threw a fit about us splitting the bill. Terrible customer service will not recommend dinning in.

mfPA24KnQreXuomkJ4KIag.text: I arrived and there was a line and they were crossing names off the list. I put my name on the list and the hostess ask me how many in my party I said just me and she said follow me. I was in dying need of some pho so this was a great start. I got the combination beef pho and it came out quick and the broth was the perfect temperature, not too hot where u can eat right away without burning your mouth. Good flavor and good portion noodle to meat ratio only down side was the meatballs it was cut in half so I technically only got one total and it was small and the texture n flavor was off. This place is open 24hours so that's a plus if you need to eat late or should I say early mornings lol

1d3MdWrqVnRh4Ooz011_Rw.text: What's not to appreciate when it comes to a 24 hour Pho spot :)  For the price and portion this has always been my go-to for pho. Yeah yeah, I'm sure there are better options out there in vegas but I appreciate the consistency. Been eating here for over 6 years now and honestly nothing has changed. The broth isn't ever bland and the meat portions are always generous.   Ordered the #14 togo and they provide everything you'd need.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #14 togo

YOUTPbYnnyS-o-I-R7IoMg.text: I come visit vegas quite a bit. Been to Pho Kim Long for years. And it was always has been a decent bowl of pho. This visit seems a different weather the cooks change or they're just plain using pho mixs packets instead of making there own broth scratch. It was disappointing. My meat in the pho had the shinny rainbow to it and look old and definitely taste old. Will never return to this place again

XZggXvt1vayOpGz8v5clVA.text: Every time I go to Pho Kim Long I go around late at night and it's always packed. Since the place is open 24 hrs they get a lot of people who have been out drinking and need a fixing. Upon entering I can see the hostess running around everywhere so I put my name down on the list. We waited around 20 minutes to get seated.   When we sat down the waiter was quick to serve us our waters. Their water isn't the best so I was quick to get a tea instead. The waiter gave us our menus and he gave us time to look through the menu.   After we placed our order, we waited about 10 minutes to get all of our food (appetizer served first).   The place was packed and quite noisy. The food was pretty good for the cold night. Overall customer service was great despite the long wait times and I'll prob go back if within the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh spring roll
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination Pho

Ula_8PgLkWR5Q5aNuOYerw.text: Good decent bowl of Pho, better than I have had in New Jersey. We had the beef combo pho and the chicken pho, both with rice noodles, and pork chop with baked egg and white rice. The chicken pho had the best broth. The beef pho broth was good, but it was even better after I added juice from 2 lime wedges, cilantro, jalapeno peppers, and bean sprouts. I prefer my pho to have a little kick in it. Service was good. It was also packed with a multicultural customers, both Asian and Non-Asian, and primarily locals, and seems to be a popular spot. Our son has shellfish allergies, and I'm always worried about cross-contamination, but he was fine here. I told the waitress, and it was all good.

FxIEtwyABBL-U_8ZOq3mNw.text: There food is good!!but there customer service suck!! That lil Asian motherfucker with his hat backward at the cashier someone need to smack that motherfucker!!!!

xVcUdN1h3G8bvgRdNhAlDw.text: I love this place. Best pho in town guaranteed, open 24/7. Service is fast and prompt, as to be expected in a busy Asian restaurant. Some of my favorites are:  Deep fried chicken with dried garlic. Crispy skin and juicy flavorful meat. It's the closest I've ever gotten to a Filipino chicken BBQ.   Pho. Duh.   Grilled Pork Chop with rice.   Fresh Coconut Juice served with the coconut.   Be warned, your clothing and your hair will smell like pho after. So make sure this is your last stop. (Not unless you want everyone else to be jealous of where you've been, then please, don't let me stop you.)  Don't chat with your waiter. They're not into small talk. They want to feed you good food, as fast as they can, so you can be on your way to full-bellied happiness.   Pro-tip: If you're anywhere in Chinatown and the service is above mediocre, the food is going to be crap.

dremaJLeOZzpDMixlIYJDg.text: Place is notorious for adding gratuity and then asking still for a tip when closing out at the register.  Beware.

wpg0ZMIOl4OpCigIIjX2uA.text: I was very impressed with this 24 hour Chinese-Vietnamese fusion restaurant. Our party of 8 ordered various dishes that all came out in less than 10 minutes at midnight, when we dined there after a long day out on the town.   The orange chicken did not skimp on the chicken and the sweet and sour shrimp was done well.  I ordered my usual bun Tom Cha gio which is the vermicelli with shrimp and egg roll, that I use to gauge how authentic and good a Vietnamese restaurant is - everyone leaves the shrimp tail on but this place is the only one that de-shells it. Simple measure but pleasant surprise. Our pickiest eater who generally dislikes Asian cuisine said he wanted to come back, which says a lot.

VGiN_frJpGMMJQ5NDutf7w.text: They were busy but we were able to sit fairly quickly and the service was as quick.  My friends and I shared their #56 fried rice. We were all in love. They serve a lot of food, so come prepare to eat. Also their egg rolls are soo good. They had a lot of options but I other their pho soup with beef and was pleasantly surprised with the taste. Best pho soup I've had.   For those with kids, it seems to be a family friendly environment as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lsgkJuT2njQKypbw4gfMAg.text: Never been disappointed! Service is always fast and friendly! And the food is great! Best Pho joint in China Town! Tried the chicken Chow Mein for the first time today and it was great!! Super casual and again super fast service!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eSxWuV7y27qYjuBo9NT1CA.text: For a 24/7 pho restaurant I was very impressed. I was there close to midnight and it was a full house. I got the pho dac biet. Pho came out quickly, service wasn't the greatest but was expected. Pho itself was pretty good, broth was beefy which I liked. The best part was their slightly fatty brisket, very tender and flavorful.

SVHUEfrxM5qgZjwiJfud6Q.text: The only thing good about this place is that it's open 24 HOURS! The food and service didn't reach my satisfaction. I knew coming from a strong vietnamese culture that this place wouldn't be as good as the ones I've had. BUT it was 4 am and me & my friends were so hungry from a long night out. It was surprisingly very crowded... at 4 AM LOL but we were somehow seated (5 people) right away. I ordered pho with beef ball and it was GROSS! There was way too much msg in the broth, the noodles were half cooked, and the beef ball was not beef ball! I was not satisfied at all!! We also asked for hot sauce and dipping plates at least 3 times before they finally brought it to us...

3ZHOYNVoF35XbRG4IdGAjQ.text: Comfort food comes in many forms. For us, over the years since I and my guests have been coming here, comfort food is their cha gio (crispy hot, thin Vietnamese-style egg rolls that you wrap in a green-leafed lettuce with mint, basil and shredded daikon/carrot mixtures, then dip each in a flavorful fish sauce). Next, it's the vermicelli dish that has the grilled pork and shrimp which is sprinkled with chopped peanuts, topped with the tender grilled proteins, along with fresh veggies. We douse it with the house nuoc cham sauce! During past visits, we've had the pho and other noodle soups, their Chinese selections, including the roast duck (which at the time, my dad said it was the best he'd tasted in his long life).  PKL is located in the middle of a busy commercial center on Spring Mountain Road and the parking area sucks sometimes, so we grab a spot when one opens up and just use the stroll to work up our appetite and burn off calories after.   Finally figured out the best time to come to avoid the lines--3:30pm on a Sunday afternoon!  Actually, the wait times in the past haven't been too bad because we know it's worth the wait.

MW1h25stcVfCJxvvcRqKGw.text: Best vegan pho in Las Vegas :) So many good veggies and spices. Love it! Would recommend this place to everyone.

8ftqq_uzWIbppUw8FjCGWA.text: Not friendly at All , an literally treated there type of people better then me .. maybe because I'm a Hispanic but if can give it a 0 I would

yy2P-Zj7wlD46-TbEQJqDQ.text: Pho soup 24/7! Thoroughly enjoyed the food. I am a calamari snob & these guys nailed it. We've eaten here several times. Food & Service consistently good. Beware if you come in at dinner rush time as the wait line can be out the door... it's worth it!

Ys9yT8lnpdOM-0iqHfBABw.text: First of all the food is really good here . Came in with my family and they loved the food . Restaurant looks nice inside . The out side looks all simple . The restrooms are small . The service on the food after you place your order is fast . You get to enjoy your food while is still hot . The waiter is slow when is comes down to you getting refills or ordering anything extra . But overall good quantity in food wise

2yxyIWdy1DVHxl-TQeA1Vg.text: Seriously, what a disgrace to pho!! If you want less than mediocre pho with awful service, this is definitely the place for you!    First of all, it's in a plaza with like 90 other stores. And they mostly cater to the Asian community. So imagine a tight parking lot filled with Asian drivers. Yeah, you get the picture.   Next, it's always so busy in there. There's no room to wait while you get called for a table, so people are forced outside. Fine if it's spring time, crap if it's in the middle of summer or winter.   There's no warmth in the service. Idk, maybe it's just me, but if I'm going to sit down at a restaurant, I like the server to chat a little. Even just a smile, a "how are you?" would be nice. Nope not here. They hurdle you to the table, take your order, bring your food, then your check. Good luck trying to get someone's attention if you need something extra. On my last visit, it took about 10 minutes to waive someone down so I could put in another order to go. I see this place as a fancy fast food pho joint.  Now the food. The egg rolls are pretty typical. They are fried so you can't really mess those up. Pho broth is on the oily side, like you can see the oil floating at the top of your bowl. Noodles are stuck together like they've been waiting in the bowl for broth to loosen them up. My last visit I ordered seafood pho and it was so gross. The seafood was not fresh at all and had a fishy taste. And the squid tasted like it was on the verge of expiring. Their smoothies are pretty tasty, but stay away from the boba. It's mushy at first and they get hard as it sits in your cold drink.  The only thing they have going for them is that they are open way late and can cater to the night crowd of Vegas. I don't eat here by choice, only by the choice of others. I'd much rather drive the few blocks down and eat at Kihn Do.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty taro smoothy with the worse mushy boba
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gross seafood pho

QZICD0ven3CUnQIl5Q8SCA.text: Best Pho anywhere. We come here to eat every time we visit Vegas. They never fail our tastebuds. I like the chicken pho or the rare beef pho, I haven't tried any other phos but my friends and family have and they haven't complained. We tried the chicken lettuce wrap today and it will be a must have. We also order the fried rice too, also good.

J_S3A75FOm2f3i6UQVab0g.text: Pho here is very plain, not flavourful like many places i have been. The spring roll here is one of the worst i have ever came across, the outer skin is too thick and dry. Bun Bo Hue here is so so. I thought the server was rude when i tried to charge to my card and she asked "you wanna tip 15 or 20 percent", and the only thing she did was brought us the food and went off the entire time we were there. Also, when the server brought me the CC slip to sign, its already hand written 15 percent tip on my CC receipt and i marked off for 10, but they deserved ZERO TIP. fI8NpfIZ23oMUHKtBENZpw.text: This is my fav place to go to for pho besides Pho Saigon 8! It's perfect here! Along with the summer rolls, they have the PERFECT peanut sauce! I also love their wonton noodle soup because it's probably the closest I will ever get to how it tasted when I travelled to china. Their Thai tea is delicious too!!! I get some rice dishes sometimes when I come here and it's really good. So overall, everything I've tried so far have been 10/10 and it's not easy to find restaurants like that! They're open all day all night so I can come here on my 3am cravings which is super nice! The service is fast and everyone is pretty nice! I love this place!!!

aj8TQkehXZojbujdpFy9lA.text: Greed, greed and greed. I have been to this places several times in the past.  The last trip was my last time coming here ever again.  I ordered a noodle dish that has the noodle in one bowl and the soup given separately in another bowl.  It is a combo and customers get charged for one price.  This place wants to get as much money as possible from their customers so they add another fee on top of it by giving a tiny cup of soup that force you to order extra soup at a cost. Very tricky and dishonest....There are many Vietnamese restaurants around this place that you can more for your money.

sAIL0UC5KEM-yFu8Yg0fZg.text: I tried this restaurant following my gut instinct and ignoring the yelp rating of 3.5 stars; as it turns out, I should have followed the yelp advice instead.  Service was solid. No complaints there.  But the food was pedestrian. I eat a lot of pho, and Vietnamese food in general, and I left this restaurant feeling full, but not overwhelmed by the food quality.   My appetizer was spring rolls--here, the spring rolls are the soft rice paper. The shrimp in my spring roll were over cooked and mealy, and the rice in them was also overcooked and had a pasty consistency.  For my main course, I had pho Tom, which is Shrimp Pho. I ordered a large bowl...and was somewhat surprised at the size of the bowl that was delivered. It was smaller than what I usually get when I get a large bowl at my go-to spot in MD. The broth was flavorful, but the shrimp and noodle quantity was so-so. I will say that the shrimp was cooked well and had a nice, firm texture, unlike those in my spring roll.  As an accompaniment, I ordered a Vietnamese iced coffee. It was overpoweringly sweet with a strange aftertaste. I drank it all; like looking at a car wreck, I couldn't help but do it. But I didn't quite enjoy it.  With all the choices that exist in Chinatown here in Vegas, I probably won't go back to Pho Kim Long.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Kim Long - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QzAH6m4lor2RVAJYrPvYjA.text: Late night hunger at The Palms Casino and I turned to YELP. Punched in 24 hour restaurants and Pho KIm Long popped up. Pho sounded good and my gf agreed.  It was around 3am and this place was busy! Got seated right away and took some time to read the menu. I decided on #13 special with beef. My gf had the chicken pho.  The #13 was very tasty and filling, probably the best pho I've had so far. The spring rolls were good, nothing spectacular.   We will be back.

osA_7zoWd6yzkDjLpFR60w.text: One night after a gig... Some friends took me to Pho Kim Long (no pun intended), although I've heard many good things about the place I was ready to see for myself.. We arrived a little after 2am on a Wednesday night, there was a line and I didn't mind. I'd have to say that's the only negative thing I encountered.  So for starters I ordered the Fried Potstickers and the Crispy Calamari. The potstickers were just perfect and full of flavor. The calamari I absolutely fell in love with! Fried to a perfect golden brown crisp, on a bed of cabbage and peppers with a cocktail sauce on the side. All the flavors were right and it made me want another order soon as I was done!  For entree I had the Roasted Duck with Peanuts and a sweet and sour sauce. The duck was seasoned and roasted to a tee and the sauce along with the peanuts and cilantro really connected all of the flavors as one. One of the best plates of duck I've had in a while! I wasn't full although I was indeed satisfied. This is a nice place to go after a night of clubbing or even for a date. I will definitely be back again!
